long_text: yorker just outside off, jabs it into the covers, runs to the other end with his arms aloft. Krunal Pandya seals the run that gives Mumbai Indians their fifth title

taken at midwicket. Short ball, rolls the fingers on it outside off. At his throat, and he's taken his eyes off it as he looks for the hook. Slices gently for Rahane who takes a few steps to his right to hold on
low full toss just outside off, shuffles and punches to long-on to level the scores
short of a length at middle stump, punched aerially off the back foot to long-on's left
short and into the body. Shuffles and dabs to midwicket's right
past the outside edge. Short of a length and rising steeply outside off. Shuffles to line up the pull but that cross-seam ball goes straight on and forces him to withdraw is shot
slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
slower ball, short of a length and across the corridor. Waits on it, opens the face and steers it past short third man
good length outside off, on the back foot to push this to sweeper's right
inside edge onto middle stump. Looks like a slower length ball from Rabada, wide outside off. Static feet as Pollard reaches out and looks to lift that over the overs. He's through it early
good length on leg stump, thick inside edge to deep square as he swishes at this 150.5kph ball
flicked to the midwicket boundary. Full and at the stumps at 147kph. Stands tall and times the flick to percection, to midwicket's left and giving deep square no chance
lofts his first ball over mid-off. Oh he wants his 15th T20 title in a hurry. Overpitched outside off, gets a stride out and extends his arms to nail the connection on this
short of a length just outside off, sliced to third man

oh a sensational catch in the outfield. Delhi's Lalit Yadav has plucked one at deep midwicket. It's a slower short ball outside off, he plays the pull to a ball that's continuously getting big on him. Drags it over midwicket. Lalit is at a straight deep square leg position and runs to his left as this is about to dip and plop into the floor. Puts in a full length dive low to his left, slides gracefully along his two elbows and holds on to that. A standing ovation for Mumbai's captain as he goes back into the dugout. He's put them on the brink

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: yorker at middle stump, jammed out into the leg side
full on off stump, driven along the floor to long-off

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, cut to cover point
good length at middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
slapped off the front foot this time. Short and sitting up a little wider this time. Uses his stride to get at it and swats it to long-off's right. Quickly wide of Hetmyer down there
hammered past extra cover! Short of a length, sitting nicely up outside off. Gets deep in the crease, waits and waits and gets a rapid bat speed on the back foot punch
full outside off, reaches out and drives to long-off
low full toss on off stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
bouncer at middle stump, hurried hoick to deep square's left

pumps it over the long-off boundary! Wow. Incredible how sweetly he hits these despite what appears a short reach. This is lobbed up like an offbreak, wide outside off. He gets low on the front foot, reaches out and absolutely crunches this from that base
offbreak from a good length outside off. Allows it into the corridor and chops to short third

short_text: Stoinis to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full slower ball, wide outside off. Mistimed drive to extra cover
ood length and angled across him. Punched to sweeper's from the crease

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's right off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Ishan, no run
long_text: short of a length and sliding on outside off. Beaten on the late cut

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length and turning away from middle. Gets deep and clips through vacant midwicket
short of a length and into off stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length outside off, on the back foot to punch to sweeper cover

squares him up. The first delivery of the type. Unfortunately for Ashwin, it's his last of the season. Cross seam offbreak, turns from leg stump. Kishan follows with his hands and gets an edge to slip's left
good length, a carrom ball at off stump. Waits on that and clips to deep midwicket's left

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: oh too easy. Short and wide outside off, hangs back in the crease and cuts that to cover point's left. Boundaries from his last three deliveries
good length at middle stump, tossed up slow. Gets down for the sweep and it's off the top edge and into the short fine leg region
good length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
good length at off stump, leans in and drives along the ground to long-off

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed past point. Short and wide outside off, gets his weight onto his back leg and transfers it through this square drive

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball slammed in short outside off. Waits on that and drags it over midwicket, who is in the circle. That is fifty.  His first since October 1

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
slower short ball just outside off, runs it to third man with the angle
good length and into leg stump. Flicked to fine leg's left
length ball wide outside off, gets big on him as he leans in for the drive on the rise. Thick outside edge to third man
good length on off stump, leans in and punches uppishly to long-off

Suryakumar has sacrificed his wicket. Length ball outside off, punched to extra cover's right off the back foot. Rohit's taken off for the run. SKY is ball-watching. Rohit's made it to the other end as the throw comes in on the bounce to the keeper. Suryakumar leaves the crease and Rohit is on his haunches and distraught. It was Rohit's call, SKY doesn't respond to it. But he's made the decision to let the better set batsman take Mumbai through

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: carrom again, at a length on middle stump. Defended on the front foot
length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
carrom ball at a length on leg stump, looks for the flick, gets a leading edge to extra cover
good length and sticking in the pitch outside off. Stays back and clips it to long-on as that stops on him

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: good length and into leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
length outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length and into the stumps. Looks to drive and gets an inside edge onto pad

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: paddled to the fine leg boundary. Good length and sliding into the stumps. Gets the front leg into the off side, back knee on the floor, and helps this along

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: beaten. Length and sliding in from outside off. Rohit opens the face and looks to chop behind square on the off side
short of a length at the stumps, onto the back foot to clip this to deep square

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: sent over long-on with the angle. With the turn, in fact. He's picked the googly. It's full and turning into middle stump. Has the reach to get to that and then a satisfying swing to hit that high and far enough

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and sliding on at middle stump. Defended on the front foot

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: pumped over long-off. Strays a little too full. Rohit gets the front leg out and down the pitch. Keeps some swinging room and drills it straight
tossed up at off stump, gets to the pitch and whips firmly to long-on
short of a length and a slider outside off. Beaten on the cut

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto middle stump. Looks the open the face on that and is hurried. Defends into the covers
short of a length and into the stumps, punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length at off stump, backs into the leg side and can't get the cut past point

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, pushed to extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, driven along the ground to long-off

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, driven along the ground to long-on
good length at off stump, gets forward and drives past the bowler to long-off

short_text: Dubey to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly, sliding onto leg stump stump. Defended watchfully off the back foot
full at off stump, looks to drive through cover. It slides along to long-on off the inside half
short of a length outside off, punched uppishly to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket's right off the back foot
good length at off stump, punched to long-off on the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length and holding in the pitch as he looks to punch this to long-off. Axar cuts it off

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length and into the corridor, punched straight to extra cover off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover's right
short and just outside off, hangs leg side of that and chops to third man's right. Rabada with a big lunge and slide to his right
short of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off on the up
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
casually lofted over the fine leg boundary. Short and at middle stump. Shuffles a touch and gets inside the line. Waits on it and guides that with the pace. First tier too
back to business for Mumbai. Short and wide outside off, weight quickly onto the front foot and slapped to cover's right

taken behind! Stoinis, golden duck earlier today, gets a wicket off his first ball. Short of a length, cross seam, in the corridor. Wants to cut behind square and is cramped on it a touch. Gets a thick edge to Pant's left and it is held. Stoinis is punching just about anything he can find - the air, his own palm. Get out of the way. He is pumped

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: the trademark pull. Top drawer and into the first tier. Similar sort of delivery that he had been defending earlier in the over. It's a matter of inches. This is a touch wider of the corridor and that's enough. Onto the front foot, a clean pick up with an angled bat coming from under it. Regal, regal stuff

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, feet rooted as he looks to squeeze this through the infield on the off side. Comes off the inside part of the bat and ends up at mid-on

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: swiped with the pace and angle to long leg. They'll check if that's hit the padding on the full. This is short of a length and onto his thigh. Stands tall and rotates the upper body to help this along. Fine leg is inside. It's hit the padding on the bounce

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length and in at off stump, 149kph. Defended back to the bowler

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length and into the corridor. Defended down the pitch
good length and onto the pads at 147kph. Nice movement of the feet to get deep in the crease and clips languidly to deep square's left

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: pulled over midwicket. Short of a length and into middle stump, just enough room for him to go with the angle and lift this pull from deep in the crease

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto off stump. Chopped to first slip's left
short of a length outside off, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length, a knuckle ball outside off. Defended into the covers on the front foot
good length and into middle stump, gets deep in the crease and punches to mid-on
good length and into leg stump, gets deep in the crease and clips to deep square off the back foot

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed over point this time. Good length and wide outside off, reaches out at that and manages to get the low part of the bat on it. A lofted square drive that no one can cut off

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: connects on one at last! A lot of leg-side swinging later, QDK has nailed one over midwicket. It's picked up from outside off. A length ball and a sweet, sweet swing across the line

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and shaped into the pads. Looks for the slog and is struck on the thigh again

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, 4 leg byes
long_text: floats past the keeper. Short of a length and into the pads. Beaten on the attempted swipe behind square, but that's off the thigh guard and between keeper and short fine

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length and just outside off. Arches on that a touch after getting on the front foot, then slaps that over extra cover

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off. Looks for big slog, mistimed out to a wide mid-on
short of a length and into leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto middle stump. Defended down the pitch
good length on middle stump, flicked down to long-on with the turn

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: just clears long-on. Good length and dipping on him quickly outside off. Shuffles and not to the pitch of this. Ends up dragging it with the turn and long-on's dived backwards and to his left but that was beyond him

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: tossed up outside off, leans in and clips to midwicket with the turn

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
run out at the non-striker's end. Full and into off stump. Shuffles and looks for the flick .Leading edge trickles out to long-off's right and Rabada calls for the sacrifical second. Doesn't make it
gets this one away. Slower short ball outside off, waits on it deep in the crease this timeand slaps it on the rise, flat and to deep midwicket's left
slower short ball outside off, looks to power that off the back foot over deep midwicket but is beaten by the variation
yorker at off stump, clears the front leg and slices it straight to backward point

dragged straight to deep midwicket. Slower short ball outside off. Nothing on that for the pull. Axar invited to make all the power on his shot and he can only hit it to Anukul who is a few yards inside
slower short ball outisde off. Shuffles and drags a laboured pull down to long-on

short_text: Bumrah to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: another full toss at the stumps, backs away for the drive and can only get it as far as extra cover
low full toss on middle stump, punched to long-on's left

big appeal for lbw. Mumbai review it. He's looking to whip a length ball over square leg from outside off. It's a slower one and he's shuffles a long way for this. No bat on it. On-field umpire reckons that's hit him outside off and it stays umpire's call on that.
low full toss at off stump, can only pat that down to long-on
yorekr at middle stump, shuffles and flicks out to deep square
low full toss on middle stump, driven to long-on's right
short of a length at middle stump, steps out and has no room for the pull. Drags it down to long-on

short_text: Boult to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length and cramped at the body. Hurriedly pushed down the pitch

short_text: Boult to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed wide of third man. Short and wide outside off. Stays tall on this and gives it a big whip. NCN is back at third man this time and his slide to the left isn't enough

short_text: Boult to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump, defended down the pitch

steered straight to short third. It was a slower short one outside off. He shapes to give that a spank. Is forced to rethink that and try to stab over short third man. There's just no pace on it for him to manage that. Simple catch for the fielder
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket on the bounce
low full toss on off stump, punched straight to mid-off
slashed over point. Slower ball, short of a length and rising in at the body. Shuffles into the leg side for the room and deliberately chops this over that fielder

short of a length outside off, shuffles and jabs that to third man's right to bring up his fifty. Important knock from Delhi's captain. He's seen them through some turbulence and set them up for a big flourish
slower ball, short of a length and into off stump. Looks to slide that down to third man but gets it to the keeper
good length and into middle stump, clipped to midwicket's right
hurriedly slashed wide of mid-off. Short of a length outside off. Almost looked like he was shaping for the cut but had to adjust because it came on slowly. Slaps it to mid-off's left
oh sweet! Marginally full from Yadav, at off stump. Gets to the pitch of that and goes inside-out with the turn, a chip to long-off's right
full and just outside off, drilled firmly to long-off's left
short of a length and into leg stump, nudged through midwicket off the back foot
big turn and beaten again. Short of a length and gripping and turning and rising as Hetmyer goes on the back foot this time and swishes hurriedly
turns past the outside edge. Yadav around the wicket, lands it on a length outside off and turns it big as Hetmyer looks to defend
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover

guided straight to fine leg. The only explanation I can think of is that Pant has probably not seen the field change, but that sounds implausible for a batsman in the IPL. It's a slower short ball up at his ribs. He swivels and hooks uppishly, and deliberately. That's four if short fine is in. It's a simple catch when he's back. Mumbai have the breakthrough they desperately wanted
flat-batted straight to mid-off. Short of a length outside off, steps out and is cramped on the room by this short of a length delivery
top edge over the keeper. Goes regular pace for this one. Short and into Pant's left shoulder. He's woefully late on the attempted hook, but he has four

gets it over short fine this time and brings up fifty. His first of the season. Rishabh Pant bursts into life in the final. A slower length ball from NCN, around the wicket and slanted in at middle and leg. Waits on that, gets on his back knee and ramps it
looks to nudge that cheekily past short fine. But he finds the fielder. Length ball at middle stump, uses the angle of NCN from around the wicket and has a short-arm whip at this from middle stump
short and down leg side, lets that one go
good length and into middle stump. Stays tall and punches to long-on

shoveled past short fine! Incredible shot. It's a yorker at leg stump, and he's got some stunning bat speed on this to stay upright but still get this behind the wicket. He's got it right under his eyes, and it's pretty full. That takes some doing. Brilliant skill
good length on leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and turning away outside off, through his cut too soon as this grips in the pitch
full and wide outside off, reaches out and drives along the floor to deep extra cover
short of a length and sliding at the stumps, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
low full toss at off stump, punched down to long-on
yorker is very wide outside off, left alone
short and into the body, mistimed pull to deep backward square's right
yorker length outside off, driven off the toe-end to mid-off
slower short ball, really sticks in the pitch and comes in at Iyer's body as he backs away. Only gets an under-edge on his pull, down to long-on
good length and sliding on to middle stump. Driven to long-on with the angle
length and looks like a slower one again. Just outside off, punched to long-on
cutter at a length outside off, steps out and punches to sweeper cover
slogs it over wide long-on! Pollard seemed to be getting away with a quiet over. The extra ball costs him in the end. It's at a length, spun into Iyer. He lines it up and gives it a right whack
slower ball at a length on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket's right
short and climbing outside off again, past his attempted cut
beaten. Short of a length and cutting away in the corridor. Looks to slash through cover but that climbs over the bat
slashed past point. Short of a length cutter outside off. Gets on the front foot and gets this between point and short third man. Pollard is around the wicket, but there is a lot of room
short of a length and just outside off. Punched to long-off on the back foot
full and spinning down leg. Beaten on the flick
short of fine third man. Short and angled into Iyer, who is arching into the leg side for the ramp. A third man is put in there exactly for that. But it doesn't get close
short and into the stomach. Waits on it and swipes with the angle to deep square's right. He was waiting on the back foot for this
short and into the corridor. Nicely on top of that to defend to point
low full toss at off stump, punched to long-on with the angle
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
short of a length into the pads. Nudges to fine leg with the angle
quicker yorker at off stump. Closes the face to jab that into midwicket, gets a thick edge towards short third

slogged wayyyy over deep midwicket. Another sweet sounding hit from Pant. This is tossed up at a length and outside off. He gets down for the sweep and it slides on nicely. Beautiful swing through that ball with one knee down
good length on off stump, whips to deep midwicket off the back foot
oh well bowled. Keeps it slow, dipping at a leg stump line this time. Steps out and is beaten in flight. Swipes it out to deep square

steps out and crunches that into the sightscreen. Might be the last time we see Krunal toss it up tonight, because that has been given a serious beating. On an off stump line and Pant is quickly down to the pitch of it. Drills it flat and over the bowler's head
full on leg stump, driven firmly to long-on
good length and into leg stump, steps out and dabs it expertly to deep midwicket's right to return for the second
good length and into leg stump. Steps out and whips to deep backward square's right
good length and turning into off stump. Shuffles and clips to deep square
short of a length outside off, steps out and chops to sweeper cover
good length outside off, driven on the up to long-off
good length and sliding in at middle. Steps out and looks to force it down to long-off. Off the inside half and trickles towards long-on
good length on leg stump, swept to deep midwicket's left
good length on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
good length and tight at middle stump. Defended back down the pitch
good length and gripping to turn away outside off. Gets back and turns it through vacant square leg with a closed face
short of a length outside off, chopped on the up to backward point
good length and slow at leg stump. Gets forward and flicks to deep square
beaten on the improv ramp. Reverse ramp. He wanted to go fine leg, but this length ball slid on wide outside off and he had to go the other way
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length on off stump, defended to cover
short of a length and into leg stump. Deep in the crease to glance that to long leg, where NCN misfields and allows a second
full outside off, driven to extra cover's right with the turn. Long-off cleans up
good length and into off stump, can't get his watchful punch past extra cover for the single at long-off
length and into leg stump. Runs into the leg side to create some room but is forced to jab that into the covers as it cramps into him
good length and into the thigh. Stands tall and tickles that fine
short of a length and just outside off, chopped to third man

nearly plucks a stunner at cover! Iyer is fighting fire with fire, and at the moment he's just about surviving. Ishan Kishan drops a difficult catch to his right. Short of a length and just outside off, backs into the leg side and gives that a might slap on the rise. It's flown to Kishan's right at cover. High to his right. He's done well to time that leap to his right and get two hands to it. Perhaps one he would have taken with his gloves on. Too difficult to hope to hold onto that this time
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to cover
short of a length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

awkward fend and safe because square leg is back. Can't accuse Iyer of being in control so far, but he's still there. This short ball is up at his crest. He's caught on the front foot, which is eventually raised after his weight falls backwards and he hooks half-heartedly from under the ball

aerial again but dipping away from the diving extra cover. It's lovely timing on this. Short of a length and climbing in the corridor again. Gets on this toes and punches from under his eyes. It's quickly into the boundary
short of a length at middle stump, rises on top of that and defends into the leg side
beaten. Shuffling, dancing, skipping, slashing. Short of a length ball outside off and Iyer has to play the cut backing away after all that. It's past him quickly
aerial but between extra and mid-off. Good length and climbing in the corridor. Drives on the up with a half-stride. Not fully in control of that either
good length and into off stump, front leg across and patted to mid-on
good length and into middle stump, leans in and jabs it to mid-on with the angle
short of a length and into middle stump. Gets deep in the crease and whips this to deep square's right
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch

knocks off stump! They brought him in for the left-handers, and three balls in, he's got their best one this season. It's at a good length, around a middle stump line. He's given it some air and got a bit of grip from the surface. Dhawan is down and playing the slog sweep pretty early. And he's through the shot before the ball arrives. Some turn away and tonks the stumps
good length and turning in from just outside off. Defended to cover off the front foot
good length at off stump, looks to drive. Big gap between bat and pad as he looks to drive through cover. Slides on and gets the inside half of the bat

leading edge short of the bowler. Bouncy, bouncy. Short of a length ball is up at Iyer's ribs. He's tried to get on top of that and close the face on it for the single to fine leg. He's done it too soon but he survives

edged over keeper and slip. Whew, adventurous shot to say the least. Not in control of that. It's a short ball angled wide outside off. Rises sharply and he chases that to try and steer it to third man. No chance he's getting on top of that with this bounce

there's a sound and it's given! Rahane is caught down leg side. Good length, not a lot of movement on this. Some movement in Rahane's feet though, a little shuffle towards middle stump. He's tried to flick from there as the ball slides wide of him down leg side. It's thin edge, a faint sound, followed by thunderous roars from the fielders
good length and just outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and into the pads. Hangs back for the glance but cops it on the pad. QDK saves to his right

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed over cover. Runs down at this length ball that's shaped away from him. Has judged it perfectly. Has enough room to swing from under that
edge onto body and dead before the keeper. Length ball outside off and he had a stab at that on the front foot

big inswinger that Dhawan has survived this time! Nailed him with a yorker last match. This one is marginally shorter, more driving length. Into leg stump and he's scrambing, both feet sliding around the crease as he flicks onto pad and Rahane steals a run from the keeper

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length and across the corridor, past him quickly as he shapes to defend

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: just clears QDK! Short of a length and getting steep in the corridor. Dhawan is looking to get on top of that and guide that towards third an with the bat face pointed down. It takes the high part of the outside edge and is past the keeper

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and into of stump. Deep in the crease to defend that into the covers
short of a length and wide outside off. Watchfully steers that to third man's right

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and swung away just outside off. Checks himself after shaping for a drive, but he gets some sweet timing on this punch to mid-off

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: handsomely clipped through midwicket. Full and swung marginally towards slip, but it's started on a leg stump line. Gentle, float half-volley and he holds a lovely shape as he closes the face on it

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and swing away outside off, left alone
full and swing into middle stump leans in and jabs that to midwicket

got him first ball! Felled the Hulk first up! Short of a good length, rising in the corridor. Stoinis defends for the one coming in but has ended up playing inside the line and is all sorts of contorted. It takes the thick outside edge and floats gently to QDK's right. After a brief move from the patterns, Capitals are back to their recent problem of failed first-wicket stands
backs away, Nortje stays full and straight, and he slips trying to protect his wicket
follows him with a bouncer, and he ducks it
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
he backs away, and Nortje follows him with a low full toss. Just the single to midwicket
yorker, nails it, just the single
makes room, hits hard, but can't get under a full ball. Just the single
shuffles across to look to ramp but is beaten by a full ball
and he has three wickets in three legal balls. Slower short ball again, Goswami looks to pull over midwicket but doesn't get any power into the shot. Caught at deep midwicket
slower short ball, too high, called a wide
that oughta do it for DC. Rabada hasn;t quite nailed the yorker, but he is full enough to not let him get under it. Rashid tries, but goes only as far as long-on

Keemo Paul takes the catch at long-off. After missing two yorkers, Rabada gets one nearly right. And because it is straight, it has given Samad no room to swing his arms. He toe-ends it to long-off, and Paul takes the catch to his left

short_text: Rabada to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: that is a high full toss. And just a nonchalant flick of the wrists sends this sailing over deep square leg for six. Still alive. Not called a no-ball
quick thigh-high full toss, and he gets no power into this. Just the single to deep midwicket

short_text: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, 1 leg bye
long_text: and he protects the over by following him as he leaves the crease. Off the pad for a leg-bye

short_text: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: yorker this time. Ashwin gets it right. Dug out. No run

short_text: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: wide length ball, and he goes over extra cover this time. He has nailed it. SRH refusing to roll over and die

short_text: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: another slog sweep, and he has given this his all. Gets this off the toe end, but has got just enough behind it to clear long-on

short_text: Ashwin to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: tries the big slog sweep, but is beaten by the carrom ball
fires in a yorker, inside edge to short fine leg, and Rashid calls him through for one
high full toss, but not high enough to be called a no-ball. Samad is a little surprised, and pushes this to wide long-on for one

is this the game? Stoinis has produced another wicket. Williamson finally makes a mistake. He has not looked to hit this one into a gap. Stoinis has gone full and wide, and off-cutter. Williamson commits to hitting it in the air and over cover, which means he has to go all the way, but this is too far from him to get power behind the shot. Caught at deep cover

this is just lovely batting. He has picked his spot beautifully. Third man and point are up, but the cover is pretty straight. Stoinis goes short of a length, and he makes room to hit this square on the off side. Beats deep cover
full, not exactly a yorker, drilled to long-off. Iyer has hurt his left shoulder while throwing this back
slower ball, short of a length, punched hard, forward of deep cover, Rabada puts in a dive, saves two runs. Are SRH thinking of their own fielding effort?
full, low, wide, hit to extra cover for one
mis-hit to a length ball, but it doesn't carry to long-on. Ten off the over. A difficult time to bowl for him, and he seems to have done okay
wide legbreak, and Samad needn't have cut at it. Would have been called a wide. Cue-ends this for one
on a length, straight, holds its line, pushed to deep midwicket for one
short, wide, Williamson has to reach it, but he throws all his might at it. He has cut this in the air, but has managed to place it between point and cover-point
short of a length, whipped to deep midwicket for one
and some more fortune. Carrom ball outside off, and Samad cue-ends it past short third man
another pinpoint yorker. I said 20, they got 16
yorker, middle and leg, dug out for one

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: full and wide with third man up. Not the smartest ball. Samad throws his bat at it, gets a thick edge, which clears short third easily

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: wide length ball, he stays back, and cuts this over point. Some timing that. Suddenly there is an added dimension to this match

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: have some of it. This is a hook out of the screws. Phew. Has he nailed this or what? Disdainful hook to a high bouncer. Off the middle of the bat with time to spare. Clears midwicket with ease
more luck for Williamson. Completely done in by a slower ball, and gets a thick inside edge on the slog. His body is in the way, though, and saves him from getting bowled
smart bowling. Sees him come down, and slows it down and pulls the length ball. Pushed to extra cover for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: this is perhaps the first time the luck has run SRH's way tonight. Looks to hit this length ball hard, and gets an edge thick enough to go past Pant

short_text: Axar Patel to Abdul Samad, 1 run
long_text: on a length, into the pads, pushed to deep midwicket for one
on a length, dipping on him, pushed to deep extra cover for one. Another fifty for him. Job half done

short_text: Axar Patel to Abdul Samad, 1 run
long_text: slower ball, on a length, pushed to long-on for one
Williamson is looking for the big shot, but Patel follows him, and he still hits it wide of long-on. Incredibly, Samad turns down the second
slower offcutter, just the single. Smart comeback from Stoinis after being hit for a six off the first ball

shuffles across for the ramp, Stoinis does him in twice. Not only does he go wide to make him look to go past short third, he has also bowled a slower ball, which means he gets an edge on this back to him
misses out. Stoinis has bowled a length ball sliding down leg, and he looks to get inside the line and go behind square in the leg side. Is beaten and hit on the pad
short of a length, just outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
on a length, quick, soft hands, pushed towards long-on. Can't get back for the second
filthy little full toss down the leg side, and would have been wide had Williamson not gone low and shovelled this over square leg for a six
quicker, flatter, punched to that deep extra cover for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: slow, wide, looking to draw a mis-hit, but Williamson waits for it, and then cuts it square of deep cover who is very straight to plug his extra cover hits

smart bowling from Axar. The thing with Holder's charge as against Williamson's is, he comes down early, and Axar fires it in and follows him too. Takes his arms out of the shot. And is caught at deep midwicket
flatter, quicker, punched to deep cover for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, no run
long_text: slows this down, gets it to dip, pushes to extra cover, and they don't get the single despite a Rahane fumble

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: lovely shot. Down the wicket, gives himself slight room, reaches the pitch of the ball but hits this back over his head
slower ball, short of a length, runs this down to third man for one
Williamson slogs, and slogs this out of the screws. Gets close to a wide length ball, and goes over midwicket. Incredible shot but he needs to do this more often
short of a length, holds its line, and Williamson draws out of a dab
bouncer, down the leg side, and Williamson looks to go over fine leg. Beaten. Wide
on a length, outside off, and he dead-bats it. Three dots
again done in by inswing. Rabada hits his thigh pad this time
swinging in, on a length, beats the inside edge, hits his pad, but again high
down the wicket, too close to its pitch, drives this down to long-on for one
and that is why. Holder is hitting them straight, and the straight long-off doesn't have to move sideways at all
full, on off, driven with an open face to deep cover for one
Williamson skips down too, and he is not close to the pitch of the ball so he has room to swing his arms through it and clears long-on with ease
down the wicket, almost gets too close to the pitch of the ball so he doesn't get the elevation. He has got a lot of power, though, and Nortje has to put in a dive at long-off to keep this in
seems there has been a word in the timeout. Tries the slog first up, is yorked a little, and gets just the single
slightly short of a length, and Holder is quick to pick the length and hit this wide of long-on. Dubey fields it one-handed and is very close to the boundary triangles but stays inside

short_text: Axar Patel to Holder, no run
long_text: Holder looking to lap him fine this time, but the ball sits in the surface and takes the front edge back to Axar
on a length, quick, no room, so he can only punch this straight to deep cover
on a length, angling in, helped around the corner for one
slows this down, Williamson is looking to go over extra but sees he is not to the pitch of this so he aborts and pushes this along the ground to deep cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: finally intent from Williamson. He knows Axar bowls fast, and he gets inside the line to lap-sweep this fine of fine leg
on a length, and Williamson goes back to punch this to deep cover
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, another defensive push back to him
slow legbreak, defended to cover
full and straight, can't get under it, driven to long-on for one
some dip and drift on this, but no turn. Hits Hiolder's pad
full, straight, pushed straight of the diving short straight midwicket for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Holder, no run
long_text: quick again, slightly fuller, but also straighter. Holder can't do much with this. Another good start from Axar

short_text: Axar Patel to Holder, no run
long_text: quicker, on a length, arm ball, beats Holder who is looking for the turn
stays low, on a length, angling in, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Williamson, no run
long_text: fuller, slower, just outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, slow, pushed wide of midwicket for one
quick length ball, turn for him, punched to deep cover for one
only slightly short of a length, and he is looking to pull this. Lucky to get an inside edge onto the pad
Holder has been looking to go past point for the last two balls but gets it right this time. Punches this away frmm the body but gets the timing and placement this time
slightly wider, Holder stays back to look to punch it, but is beaten
on a length, not too wide, pushed to point with an open face
on a length, straight, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, outside off, doesn't quite come on, ends up punching this in front of square

oh golden arm if ever there was one. Huge wicket of Pandey with the extra ball because of the wide. This is in the slot to swing hard at, but he has bowled a little offcutter to take the inside half of his bat. Caught at mid-on
wide length ball, dabbed to third man for one

he has missed a full straight half-volley. Garg will be bitterly disappointed he has got out bowled to a nothing ball. Half-volley, just outside off, and he has pushed outside the line of this. There is a bit of movement but he is playing down the wrong line all the way. this ball should not be getting you a wicket in a knockout match of the best T20 league
on a length, extra bounce on this slower ball, punched down to mid-on for one
slower ball, wide down the leg side
short, hip-high, and while he has a deep square leg in place, Pandey is smart enough to go inside the line and go behind square with his short-arm pull
down the wicket right away. Stoinis pulls the length back, pulled to deep square leg for one
quick length ball, into the pads, goes off the front edge for a single to mid-on
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on for one
full, just outside off, and Pandey gets a thick outside edge over point. Ashwin just jogs across to the ball
on a length, hits him high on the bat, goes for a single to square leg. The bat comes out of his hand on impact
short of a length, outside off, runs this one straight to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, runs this down fine of square third man, and they also take on Ashwin to make the second comfortably
an iffy little push to a wide length ball with no foot movement. Beaten on the outside edge
the bouncer gets big on him, but Garg has hooked this a long way. Uses his pace to go behind square. Clears long leg with ease
big lbw shout but the height has saved him. This swings back in from a length, and Garg swings without his feet moving. Hit in front but high on the pad
short of a length, hits him high on the bat. Defended
that is better from Nortje. On a length, into the 140s, swinging it in, inside edge onto the pad for one
lovely shot from Pandey. A gentle loosener, mid-130s, right in the slot, and he stays leg-side of it, and lofts him back over his head
on a length, angling in, pushed uppishly and wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, leaving him, left alone again
short of a length, extra bounce, and leaves him too. He doesn't follow it
lovely off drive. The mid-off is wide, and he plays the push-drive to the full ball, and beats him to his right
lovely outswinger, left alone outside off

bowled him. Lovely ball but Warner also sightly unlucky to get out to this. Full inswinger, going well down leg, Warner looks to get out of the way and work this to leg, but the swing beats him and hits his pad and it deflects back a long way to hit the wicket
big offbreak, starts from well outside off and ends up cramping him up. Draws a dot
on a length, quick, angling in, pushed to leg for one
wide down the leg side again as Ashwin looks to tuck Warner up
wide on the crease, offbreak, pushed wide of mid-on for one
wrong'un. Shows him the wristspin, and bowls the googly, but ends up sliding this wide down the leg side
and Garg attacks Ashwin early. They needed this right-left split to unsettle Ashwin, and Garg is showing the right intent. Down on a knee, and slog-sweeps this length ball over deep midwicket
quick, drifting in, pushed to mid-on, who is hanging back at the edge of the circle

nearly a wicket first ball. Plays for the turn, closes the face, gets a leading edge, but it doesn't carry to point. And Hetmyer goes for the catch, which allows a single as the ball skids past his dive
excellent yorker, this one reverses in a lttile to beat him altogether. Pant does the smart thing to sneak in a bye
another yorker, but Hetmyer goes deep into the crease and opens the face to get a couple square of deep cover
yet another wide yorker, Pant looks to go down the ground but only cues it back down the wicket for a single
another attempt at the ramp, and Natarajan nails the wide yorker again, and it goes off the toe end towards straight midwicket for one
looks to go across and tries the ramp but Natarajan nails the wide yorker to concede just the leg-bye
Hetmyer down the wicket to convert this yorker into a low full toss, but gets no power into the shot. Just the single to long-on
knuckle ball, nearly a yorker, drilled to deep cover
down the wicket, Sandeep nails another yorker, and concedes just the couple as this mis-hit goes wide of long-on
gets the yorker right, just the single to long-on

Dhawan looks for the revere sweep, but Sandeep beats him with a quick full toss and he has been given out lbw. It seems he has been hit outside the line but he doesn't bother reviewing. Hit well outside the line but Dhawan doesn't even look at his non-striker to check if he should review
goes wide yorker, Hetmyer stays deep in the crease to drive this to deep cover

oh Rashid has dropped a sitter at deep midwicket. Absolute shocker of a night for SRH. Knuckle ball from Sandeep, right in the slot, but Dhawan doesn't get all on this slog. Rashid, though, lets it slip through
bouncer from Holder, Hetmyer is not in control of the pull, but he has sent this straight enough of the deep midwicket fielder. Yorks the boundary triangle
nails the yorker, Dhawan digs it out. The ball goes nowhere, but Hetmyer steals the one

short_text: Holder to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Dhawan has been trying this since the start of the last over but gets it right this time. Shuffles across to go to the leg side, Holder serves up a straight full toss, and he flicks this to the vacant square leg fence, Six hundred runs for Dhawan this IPL
goes for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a low full toss, and Hetmyer gets an inside edge for one

Nadeem's nightmare continues. Holder bowls wide and length, draws a slice from Hetmyer, Nadeem gets under it at third man, but as he goes down he loses the ball and doesn't even get a touch on it. And as he tumbles extravagantly, the ball rolls away for a four
slot ball, outside off, and Hetmyer stays deep in the crease to stay under it and smacks this straight of long-off for four

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: well bowled. Dhawan shuffles across early to try to go over short fine, but Natarajan bowls a wide yorker, really wide, and beats him. Good comeback after that early six off him
wide yorker, misses the mark, but Hetmyer drives this low full toss straight to deep cover for one
misses the yorker again, but the low full toss is hit just for a couple, straight of long-on
goes for the wide yorker, but bowls too wide. Called
goes for the yorker, misses his mark, but draws a slice from him. Hetmyer takes a couple wide of long-off
oh the Hetmyer power. And timing. Natarajan bowls short of a length, just outside off, and he plays the inside0out drive to it, and clears the man at deep cover. Incredible hitting
fine leg is up so Dhawan shuffles across, but Natarajan stays wide with this short-of-a-lenght ball. Just the single to deep square leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: slog-sweeps, doesn't get all off it, and takes just the single to deep midwicket
wrong'un, on a length, outside leg, pushed down the ground for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: full and straight, Dhawan makes room to drive this to deep cover for one
full again, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: wrong'un, Dhawan shapes up to pull but is done in by the pace off the pitch. Rolls his wrists to take one
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
ends up with that low fast full toss, and concedes just the single to deep cover
another yorker, soft hands, bunted to midwicket, only to the 30-yard circle with no one inside the circle. They sneak in a second. And what's more? This is a no-ball
quick yorker this time, dug out back to him
immediate impact. Nadeem slows it down, but gets no action it. Ends up bowling a plum half-volley, and he chips it over extra cover for four
out comes the big sweep to a full toss but there is a deep midwicket in place, and Rashid does well to keep them down to one
Nadeem is hoping this hits the wicket at the non-striker's end as Dhawan has drilled this hard and straight. It misses the wicket, and they get two
down the wicket, driven to wide long-on where Garg has twisted his ankle trying to slide and pick up
finally one goes to hand. Iyer backs away again, Holder digs it in, doesn't give him room, and Iyer goes ahead with an aggressive shot. Ends up flat-batting this straight to mid-off

another catch dropped. Anorher half chance. Iyer backs away early, goes deep in the crease, turns this into a driveable length but doesn't get all of it. Williamson runs to his right from extra cover and then leaps in the air, but only gets finger tips to it
slower ball, big slog, off the inside half of the bat for two wide of long-on
extra bounce. That will interest the DC quicks. Iyer is surprised by this tennis-ball bounce outside off. Beaten when looking to turn this to leg
misses the yorker, but the low full toss has been hit straight to long-on
on a length, straight, flicked to deep midwicket for one
full, into the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket

more luck for SRH. Iyer drives this wide of long-on. Two fielders converge, both are looking to dive, and then pull out of the dive because of a fear of collision. This would have been two but Iyer gets four
full, just outside off, driven down to long-on for one
really nothing going their way tonight. Iyer skips down to try the big hit, Nadeem follows him, but the mis-hit is not good enough to carry to long-on
gets away with full toss, swept along the ground and straight to deep straight midwicket

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: finally he doesn't start an over with a six first-ball to Dhawan. Bowls a yorker as Dhawan backs away. Right at the cue of the bat
nothing going SRH's way. Draws a leading edge on this flick with a slower one, but it doesn't carry to midwicket
shuffles across, Natarajan bowls really full, nearly a yorker. Driven to long-off for one
Iyer shuffles across early and then backs away, which he often does. Natarajan stays short with no room. Cut to deep cover for one
down the wicket, Natarajan shortens his length, draws a bottom edge on the cut
slower offcutter, on a length, driven down to long-off for one
stays on a length, but slips down the leg side for a wide
on a length, straight, pushed back to him
low full toss, driven down to long-on for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, legbreak, no room, and he drops it with soft hands towards point for a single

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: legbreak to Dhawan, gets the inside edge onto the pad, and the ball rolls back to him
quick legbreak, pretty straight, on a length, worked to leg for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: wrong'un, starts well outside leg, helped around the corner for one
quick legbreak, full, gets a leading edge into the covers for one
flat length ball, takes the leading edge for a single to long-off
slow in the air, this is the one that he turns the other way, the carrom ball  Dhawan bunts this to leg for one

another full toss. Nadeem is having a shicker. Dhawan has flicked this between deep midwicket and deep square. Samad dives to save the boundary but Holder is close to him and his spike lands on Samad's hand
low full toss, worked behind square for two

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: Dhawan brings up a fifty off just 26 balls with another slog-sweep. Clears deep midwicket with ease. The dugout on its feet
flat, on a length, angling in, punched to deep midwicket. Hands over the strike to the left-hand bat

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: beaten on the legbreak. Plays the angle, looking to drive this length ball into the covers. Beaten on the inside edge
another wrong'un, goes back now to push him down the ground for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: doesn't pick the wrong'un. Looks to cut, but is beaten on the inside edge
oh that is a rare loose ball. A full toss, on off, and driven past extra cover two
that is a ripper. Rashid gives SRH the relief they need. Full quick legbreak, pitches on off, Stoinis plays for the angle, and the ball turns just enough past the bat toknock back the off stump

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: wrong'un, starts outside leg, worked to deep square leg for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: misses the yorker, not by much, but enough to allow Dhawan to slog this past midwicket for four

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, at his body, cramps him up as he has skipped down the wicket again
bouncer, Dhawan pulls out of the hook and makes a belated attempt at ramping this. Misses. But called wide on height
yorker, outside leg, dug out to midwicket for one
down the wicket, slogs at it, hits off the inside half of the bat to long-on
short of a length, slower ball, opens the face, gets a single behind square
full, outside off, driven hard to long-on for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: full, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 6 runs
long_text: short this time, Dhawan goes back to pull this wide of long-on. Rashid has now conceded four overthrows. Clearly shows his frustration. He collects the throw from the deep, Dhawan is already through for his second, and his overthrow has gone well wide of Goswami
on a length, around off, punched down to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: legbreak, middle and leg, worked leg
wrong'un first up, he goes back to punch this length ball down to long-on for one
fires in a quick length ball, pushed down towards mid-on for one
low full toss, clipped to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, not much width, punched wide of extra cover for one
short of a length, straight, punched back to him

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: fires in a yorker at the toes. Does well with the free hit

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: this is not SRH's night at all. Nadeem slips in a high full toss, and he sweeps it over short fine. No-ball for height too

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: and Dhawan loves left-arm spin. Slog-sweeps the first ball, and goes well over deep midwicket for a six
yorker to end the over. Draws a dot
on a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for one

short_text: Sandeep to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: wheels are coming off for SRH. Natarajan lets it slip through his legs at short fine leg. Sandeep swings it in, Dhawan glances it to short fine, but Natarajan gives away four runs

short_text: Sandeep to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: and now Dhawan joins the party. Shows him the shuffle across and then backs away to cash in on the room available. Cuts him in the air, but to the left of point
waits for this to swing, delays his swing, pushes it wide of midwicket for one
short of a length, straight, punched to deep forward square leg. Gets the single. Over to Stoinis
Holder looking clueless right now. Bowls short of a length but gives him the required width. Stoinis late-cuts this, between point and short third man, even though it is aerial for a while
slower ball it seems like, 114ks, and it is right in his slot. He delays his swing and slogs this over wide long-on for a six. Clear plan, clear execution
full and straight, clipped to midwicket

no half measures from Stoinis. Doing the job he is asked to do. Skipped down the track, Holder shortens the length, and then he slaps this down the wicket, straight of mid-on. Gets timing and power in it
lovely outswinger. Wide on the crease, on a length, makes him play the angle, and then leaves him. Too good to take the edge
catching height but this is a blistering pull and wide of the diving midwicket. This is a powerful pull from well outside off as Holder pitches short
slower ball to end the over, bunted to square leg for one
walks at him, gets inside the line and flicks this to the right of deep forward square leg. This is along the ground
gets a little too full and a little too straight with this inswinger, and Stoinis whips this to leg despite the presence of a deep forward square leg. Beats him to his left

dropped. The plan nearly works. Stoinis punches this inswinger in the air, to the right of silly mid-on. It is the tall Holder, who dives to his right, gets a hand to it, but can't hold on. Tough chance but a chance nonetheless
big inswinger, but it ends up on off and middle as always. Stoinis can't do much with it
on a length, swinging away, uses soft hands to get a single to point
again he denies him any room and Dhawan tucks this off the hip for a single square of short fine leg

short_text: Holder to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full, swinging in, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him

short_text: Holder to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: tighter line, and this swings back in too, tucking him up. Dot

short_text: Holder to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: down the wicket, and he goes in front of square with the cut shot. Doesn't bother with keeping it down and clears point with ease
nice little late-cut to one pitched just short of a length, but their third man is square because they know of Dhawan's strengths
no swing first ball, tucked away off the hip for a single to square leg
big inswinger, Stoinis does well to play this late, pushes this straight of that silly mid-on. Gets a single to long-on
swinging away, from just short of a length and just outside leg. Uses soft hands to drop this wide of cover for one

short_text: Sandeep to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: sharp inswinger, which moves away from Dhawan. Left alone outside off
this is swinging in again, and draws an inside edge onto the pad, and they get a single straight of that short midwicket
straighter this time, pushed to short midwicket
inswinger, on a length, shaping in towards off, punched to mid-off

that's past point for the win! Oh that is questionably tactics, honestly. Yorkers outside off with third man and point inside. Holder shuffles again, waits on the yorker length delivery. It's a low full toss and he gets it to point's right

drilled to long-off's left! This is driving length outside off. Holder has taken a big step into the off side for the full ball that he expects there. Gets a little more than he expects  - a pretty friendly driving ball. Gets the front leg out of the way and opens the face to beat that fielder
beaten outside off. Yorker outside off at 144.6kph. Holder is a little late on the swish as it marginally tails inwards
overpitched outside off, driven along the ground to sweeper cover to bring up his fifty. He needed to bring it this deep after his start, and he has done exactly that
ramped wide of short fine and then he slips at the other end. Full ball outside off, gets low and gets a bit too much bat on this. It floats harmlessly and lands to Saini's left
full slower ball, a dipping full toss on off stump. KW making room by getting into the leg side but is deceived by the pace. It bounce back to the bowler

steps across and ramps over short fine. Another overpitched ball outside off. Gets the front leg into the off side and gets a bit too much elevation on that for it to run away. Plops into the turf and short fine runs back and drags it in
yorker length at middle stump, jammed down to long-on where Kohli does superbly with a one-handed pick up to keep them to one

outside half and it's past short third. That's a length ball, outside off. Holder gets the front leg away and looks to blaze that through the off side. The bat face is open and it slides off it. Point was back, third man was in
inside edge to short fine as he looks to latch onto a full ball outside off
low full toss at off stump, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket
full and just outside off, chopped to sweeper's left and an early call for the second
steered between keeper and short third. Good length and angled into the corridor. Waits on it, stays sufficiently inside the line and opens the face to dab that fine of the fielder
good length and just outside off, slapped firmly on the rise and bursts through Chahal's grasp at extra cover. But he recovers and keeps it to one

dropped at deep square. Saves five runs though. Williamson has chipped a thigh-high full toss to Padikkal, who might have just stretched upwards too early for this catch. Can't keep his balance as he lands on his back foot and loses footing. Lobs it back in but too far away to return to take it
full outside off, driven long the ground to sweeper
short of a length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it straight to short third

crunched to sweeper's right. The intention is clear now from Dube - he'll bowl full and at the stumps. KW is backing just about a foot into the leg side to account for that. For his smarts, he's rewarded with an overpitched ball just outside off and he leans into that drive
yorker floated up at off stump, squeezed down to long-on off the toe-end
beaten on the slog as Dube slows it down. Good length, offcutter, following him down leg side. It's past his inside edge
full and just outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
yorker length at middle stump, jammed down to long-on

slog sweep to see Chahal off! Once again, Williamson has picked his release shot with perfect judgement. This is tossed up full and at middle stump. He's quickly on his knee, front leg out in the leg side, and sends that over deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
beaten. Cannot resist, but possibly misses out on a wide here because of how big his reach appears. This is tossed right up, wide outside off, spins past his attempted drill over extra cover
full on middle stump, jammed down to long-on
a fumble at point from Sundar as he loses his footing. Good length outside off, pushed with soft hands and he gets a hand reaching backward as he slips
good length and sliding onto middle. Punched to long-on off the back foot
full and just outside off. Leans in and pushes into the vacant leg side again
good length and sliding on at middle stump, deep in the crease and pushed into vacant midwicket
tossed up full outside off. Reaches out and sweeps to long-on's right. Quick work from the man there to keep it to a single
good length and a quicker one it appears. Gets forward and pats aerially down to long-off
full and at the stumps. Stretches out at that and clips to long-on
googly at a length outside off. Looks like Holder's picked that. Well forward as he flicks to deep midwicket's right
short of a length and flat outside off. Waits leg side of that as it slides straight on and dabs it to short third man's right
slogs it cleanly over deep midwicket! Full from Sundar, and faster. He clears the front leg and goes with the turn. Wonderful sound off the bat
short of a length and turning into middle stump. Backs away and gets the punch only as far as extra cover
falls short of  deep midwicket. Short of a length at middle stump, aerial pull comes off the toe-end
short of a length and just outside off, punched to extra cover's right
short of a length and holding in the surface. Check-pushes to midwicket off the back foot
full outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
good length outside off, shuffles and watchfully pushes this to long-on
full at off stump, gets forward and pats it back to the bowler
beaten on the cut. Short of a length and sliding through rapidly as KW jumps into he leg side to make room for the cut
good length and turning in at off stump. Gets forward and defends
short and turning into leg stump. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket's right
full and just outside off, driven to long-off with the turn

chipped straight to sweeper cover! Implosion. Looked like he was prepared to play out this period, but Garg has looked to launch Chahal over extra cover off the front foot.That is one of the most difficult shots to attempt against Chahal, who has mastered the dipping legbreak outside off in limited-overs cricket. Garg is nowhere near the pitch of it and the other leggie completes the job after running to his right
short of a length and sliding on in the corridor. Whipped to short midwicket off the back foot
full and slow at middle stump. Leans in and drives with the turn to long-off
full at off stump, steps out and drives to sweeper's right
good length and turning away outside off. Gets deep in the crease and punches to long-on
good length and slid on at off stump. Solidly defended down the pitch
another sweet drive as he gets to the pitch. Past extra cover and to sweeper's right from outside off
short of a length and sliding on outside off. Hurried punch, only as far as the bowler
full and into leg stump, gets to the pitch and drives to long-on
slider at a length, down leg side and past the attempted glance
full and into leg stump, flicked to midwicket
past the outside edge. Woof. Zampa has landed them perfectly tonight. Dipping at a good length and turning past the forward block outside off
short and just outside off, cut to point's right and a fumble there
good length and back to the dipping ball outside off. Driven back at the bowler
full and pushed through quicker this time. And he's nicely to the pitch of this as he drives to sweeper's right
googly at a length outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and drawing him forward with some lovely loop at off stump. He's not to the pitch as he looks to drive and it's off the thick outside edge to extra cover
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper's right off the back foot
good length and turning away from off stump, defended off the back foot to extra cover
inside edge onto pad as he looks to force this through cover off the front foot. It spun back in from a length outside off stump
full and just outside off, driven back to the bowler

no doubt about this one! Short of a length and sliding on outside off. Pandey is still moving into the leg side as he reaches out to stab for a single through cover. That's a clear edge, and catch number three for AB de Villiers
full at off stump, looks to drive through cover, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
full and dipping at leg stump, leans in and drives off the toe-end to long-on
good length and sliding on outside off. Punched to point's right off the back foot
good length at middle stump, punched off the front foot to long-off
good length on off stump, driven back at the bowler off the front foot
short of a length and turning away outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
low full toss at off stump, driven down to long-on
yorker length outside off, beaten on the attempted drive through cover
full and just outside off, pushed to extra cover's left off the front foot
googly at a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket off the front foot
short of a length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
good length and into the pads, uses the angle and nudges that towards fine leg
short of a length and rising up at the hip. Pulls out late from his attempted glance and that's pinged fine off the thigh guard

appeal for catch behind as Warner is cramped. Kohli reviews. Short of a length and into his body as he's skipping down leg side again. There is a sound as it goes through. AB lunges low to his right to cover the angle of Siraj being around the wicket. He didn't seem convinced. It's definitely got a part of Warner's body. But did it hit glove before that? Early pictures on Ultra Edge suggest that it might have. Disturbance as the ball goes past his glove. challenge for the umpire is to determine whether that's trouser or glove and he'll have to check purely on visuals for that. For gaps and light. The ball is right in between the glove's edge and where the abdomen guard would be. "I can see the ball is touching the gloves here," he says. So that will be out. The debate will be - if it took that long, was there enough conclusive evidence to overturn it? He sounded confident by the end of it. It seemed based purely on the spikes on Ultra Edge.
short of a length and just outside off. Under-edge on the attempted cut
short and pushed across the corridor, waits on it and cuts late to beat sweeper to his right

slashed over the covers. That's taken some contortion. Short ball with not a lot of room outside off. He skips into the leg side and is briefly aerial as he also arches back to make room for a cut. Then he slashes from under it
short of a length and into leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, backs away and punches to extra cover
good length outside off, leans in and pushes to mid-off
punched past mid-off again. Short of a length outside off, gets deep in the crease and times the punch to perfection, no fuss

good length outside off. Drags that from well outside off. Thick inside edge to midwicket's left. Midwicket slips and does well to stop the ball as it threatens to trickle past him. Wonder if that is the dew

short and just outside off, cut to cover off the back foot. As he makes connection, the stumps are broken. It's just AB's gloves. Which could mean a no-ball. They're sending it up. Yes, it is a no-ball. Stumps broken before shot offered.
short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Gets the front leg into the leg side and chops this between cover and extra

sweet timing on the drive. Full ball just outside off, keeps the stride away, stays leg side and this is all hands - full face of the bat comes down before a slight opening as he's about to make connection. Gets it to mid-off's left
short of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
short of a length just outside off. Short-arm pull as that hurries onto the corridor. Midwicket parries it to his right after a dive
short of a length at leg stump, swiped to fine leg off the thick inside edge
good length on off stump, patted back towards the bowler
through from under Dube. Length ball outside off, half a stride out and a swing across the line. Floats towards Dube, landing in front of him and then nutmegging him as he goes down inelegantly
short of a length and at off stump. Backs away and chops to point
short of a length outside off, backs away and chops to third man
pulled neatly over midwicket. One of his favourites. Short ball outside off, stays tall and swishes through the line for a sweet connection. On the front foot for it
inside edge onto pad. Length ball jags in as he gets on the back foot and looks to turn that into midwicket
good length and just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
good length and wobbling in the corridor. Pandey unsure about that as he stays leg side and jabs into the off side
short of a length and down leg side, past the attempted glance
good length and down leg side, left alone
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length and tight at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
just short of third man. Short and in the corridor. Stays leg side of it and looks to steer that past slip. Nearly lifts that to the fielder
good length and in the corridor. Waits on that and jabs to third man's left
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, gets on top of that and tucks it into midwicket off the back foot
length and curving away in the corridor, defended with a closed face

a wobble but AB takes that. Good length and pushed across the corridor. Clears the front leg and has a slash at it. Thin edge that dips on AB like a football struck from distance. Keeps his eyes on it and hangs on. Siraj lets out a screech that echoes in the ground
short of a length just outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
short of a length and coming in at the corridor. Watchfully left alone
short of a length and into off stump. Dropped to cover's right off the back foot with soft hands
good length and wide outside off. Searching for some swing. This goes straight on and is left alone
yorker at middle stump, jammed along the floor to deep midwicket
gets it away this time! Full and just outside off, drops the right shoulder and gets into the off side and then jabs at it to get it to the keeper's left
just over short third. Slower ball at a length following him as he walks into the off side. He was looking to ramp that towards fine leg
low full toss outside off, driven to extra cover off the toe-end
slashed over point. Length and across him again. Manages to get bat on it this time after throwing his hands at it
cutter at a good length, away from the corridor, and beaten on the swish
full at middle stump, clears the front foot and gets the slog along the ground to long-on
yorker at middle stump, squeezed into midwicket off the thick inside edge
bouncer at a leg stump line, backs into the leg side and swipes, well beaten
full and in at middle stump. Swings for midwicket, gets an inside edge to fine leg
short and in at off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man
slower short one at leg stump. Half-ducks and then fends this towards short fine
full and outside off, swings into the leg side, beaten on the outside edge

knocks out his middle stump! Oh boy, talk about a memorable ball. What a story, this man. Uncomplicated as ever, full and at the stumps. AB has the front leg out of the way trying to drill that through midwicket. It's snuck under him and sent the stumps rolling. It's cross-seam, it's angled across from an initial leg-stump line. And it's done one of the best
short at off stump, arches into the leg side and chops to third man's right
yorker at middle stump, squeezed straight out to midwicket
just short of long-on as Warner charges in to make sure there's no chance of a second. Slower ball, it appears. At a length at middle stump and getting big on his attempted slog

steered straight to sweeper cover. Decent connection on that, to be fair. But the placement not quite there. It's a full ball outside off, he hangs leg side of that and opens the face late to try and get that over point possibly. Samad runs in and takes this as it dips into his mid-riff
yorker at middle stump, clears the front leg and jams it to long-on's right
full and just outside off, clears the front leg and gets a good hit at this cover drive. Can only find sweeper cover
good length and sliding on at middle stump. Punched down to long-on
good length and at middle stump. Punched back to the bowler whose momentum in the follow through means his fumble ends up at long-off
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
good length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
brings up fifty with a calm whip to long-on's right. It's a low full toss on leg stump and he leans in and makes full use of that. No chance for the fielder
short of a length outside off, stays leg side of that and steers to third man

leading edge is taken by mid-off. It's wicket number three for Holder. Full and at leg stump. Looks like a slight roll of the fingers from Holder too. Dube looking to stab that through midwicket and closes the face too early. Warner runs in and holds that
full and wide outside off, left alone
short and up at chest height on a middle stump line. Pulls this to long-on's left and Garg is quick to get across and put in a slide
yorker at middle stump, looks to whip into the leg side and gets it onto his boot
yorker outside off, shuffles and chops to third deep backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dubey, no run
long_text: googly at a length on leg stump, turning away and headed towards off. He follows with his hands and pokes it into the covers
googly, short of a length and into off stump. Inside edge through midwicket as he looks for the cut

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: oh lovely.  Googly outside off, and he's quickly down for the sweep once again. Watches it closely, gets inside the line and uses his wrists to shovel this to the vacant long leg boundary
short of a length and just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: beaten on the sweep. Full legbreak outside off, gets down on a knee to whip that through square
good length and sliding on outside off. Looks for the slog sweep, thick inside edge to short fine
yorker at middle stump, squeezed into midwicket
bouncer down at a leg stump line, sways out of the way to let that go
good length at middle stump, nudge to long-on
length and just outside off, mistimed pt down to long-off
creamed to sweeper's right. Full and floaty, wide outside off. Gets the front leg into the leg side to open up some swinging room and then drives handsomely
short of a length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length on off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
full and just outside off, driven down to long-off
short of a length at off stump, deep in the crease and punches to long-off's right
full on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length and at the stumps, punched to long-on

misfield at long-on. Short of a length and sliding into him. Short-arm pull to long-on's right. Holder has completely mistimed his effort to the right. Gets his feet in a tangle, manages only to get his right hand out at it and tumbles over

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dubey, no run
