long_text: short of a length and turning into leg stump, whipped to midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dubey, no run
long_text: nearly chops on again. Short of a length and coming back into him. An angled bat and past off stump again. Once again Rashid asks about the lbw and is turned down. Replays suggest that was pad first

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dubey, no run
long_text: chopped into the pitch. Playing for the googly as he's rooted on the back foot, but this spins back in and he nearly chops it on. Rashid with the lbw appeal, bat was close to pad
length at off stump, leans in and clips through vacant midwicket
full and just outside off, driven into the covers with the turn on that googly
full and just outside off, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
full at off stump, backs away and drives to long-off
short of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper's left

no Rashid, it's a free hit for Moeen, not you! A smooth pick up and throw from his left at extra cover to knock out the stumps at the non-striker's end. Moeen is at three yards out, not even in close enough to attempt a dive or a slide of the bat. It was a full ball fired outside off, cleared the front leg, hit it straight to extra and took off. It was hit too well to pinch a run. A golden duck off a free hit ball, write that one down, all you quizmasters
into the stumps and whipped out to deep midwicket. The siren goes off, he's overstepped.

outside edge sprints past short third. Short of a length and sliding on in the corridor. Backed away and chucked his hands at that with the punch. Caught inside the line a little and that's his first boundary. Also RCB's first non-Finch boundary of the night

taken at sweeper cover. Full outside off. Having followed him down leg side all this while, he hangs this one up full and away from Finch. He reaches out and looks to clear extra. But he's arching back and really swishing hard to try and make connection. Off the low part and floats out for Samad, who runs and takes it about halfway in
tossed up at middle stump, backs into the leg side and drives to long-off
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short and sliding on outside off. Mistimed cut to extra cover's left
short of a length and into middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: beaten on the sweep. Googly at a length outside off, slides through from under his bat

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: full outside off, driven to extra cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX runs
long_text: nails the slog sweep. First boundary stroke since the powerplay.  It's a quicker one outside off, sliding into him, and he gets down early and uses the angle to his advantage with a clean swing
good length outside off, lashed off the front foot to sweeper cover
short of a length and sliding in, low, at the stumps. Hurriedly chopped to point's right off the back foot
yorker length at middle stump as he backs into the leg side. Jammed to sweeper cover
short of a length and following him down leg side. Mistimed pull to deep midwicket's left
good length at middle stump, steps out and drives to long-off's right
short of a length and flatter this time. Into leg stump, punched to long-on's right
slow and short of a length, into leg stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
oh close. Short of a length googly headed menacingly for off stump as Finch takes a walk down leg side. Just manages to get the under-edge on the cut

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, cut straight to short third man

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: slider, quick and short of a length and down leg side. He was shaping for the pull and copped that on the front pad. Outside leg stump. Lbw appeal turned down by umpire and then Warner

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, gets low for the ramp and it's off the pad to midwicket after an inside edge
full outside off, reaches out and drills it along the ground to sweeper

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: googly, short of a length and cramping him at leg stump. Pushed back down the pitch
short of a length and into leg stump. Forced to deep midwicket off the back foot
arm ball at middle stump from a good length. Nudged hurriedly to extra cover's left
good length and following him down leg. Back foot punch goes straight to extra cover
short of a length and following him down leg side. Whipped down to long-on with the angle
good length outside off, jumps out to get in line and turns that through square leg
good length and into leg stump. Gets forward and turns that into the vacant midwicket region

squeezed past backward point. Length and just outside off. Hangs deep in the crease and opens the face late as he sets up for a back foot punch. Opens it enough to get four, as third man is in the circle
good length and tight at middle stump. Full face offered as he punches this to mid-off's right
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length and at middle stump, patted to mid-off off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, onto the back foot to punch to sweeper cover
short of a length and just outside off. Waits on that deep in the crease and punches it well in front of square, to extra cover's left
full on leg stump, driven along the ground to long-on
full and marginal movement away from off stump. Feet rooted as he drives to mid-off's left
short of a length and in at middle stump. Cramped and forced to defend down the pitch
good length and just outside off. Waits on that and punches to long-on's left
good length and sliding into the corridor. Looks to force it through cover off the back foot, gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on
short of a length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler off the toe-end
beaten on the slash. Good length, curving away and climbing as he gets a stride out for the big square drive
good length and swung away wide outside off, left alone

hauled to midwicket. No signs so far that the ball is coming onto the bat smoothly. Holder gets another one to climb, this one is just short of a length. And it's at Padikkal's stomach. He's backed into the leg side and tried to pull that, but it's off the high part of that bat and floating above Garg. It's not come at pace and these can get tricky if you don't time the jump right. Garg does it perfectly and lands with some grace
short of a length and rising in the corridor. Gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to point's right
short of a length and climbing into the hips. Stays deep in the crease and uses the angle to swipe that to deep square's right with his front leg raised
good length and just outside off, leans in and drives on the rise to extra cover
short and just outside off, cut hard off the back foot but straight to backward point
good length and shaped away from off stump, thick outside edge to backward point as he looks to drive on the rise
good length and shaped away from middle stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length and curving in at off stump to cramp him. Manages to squeeze this to mid-off's left off the back foot
short of a length and swung into the corridor. Chopped into the covers
short of a length and up at the ribs outside off. Walks into line and tickles that to short fine's left
beaten on the drive. Full outswinger outside off. steps out and looks to drill that through/over the mid-off region as it floats past his edge
good length and in at middle stump. Defended uppishly into the covers with hard hands and static feet
pushed down leg side
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers

appeal for catch behind and it's given! Kohli is taken down leg side by Goswami. Good length ball rises inwards as Kohli walks down at it outside off. he likes doing that to open up the leg side, but this gets big on him. It gets his glove, his thigh, and then Goswami lunges to take that to his left. Kohli was walking
good length and some shape away outside off, jumps into the line of that and clips it to mid-on's right
short of a length and curved into the corridor. Stays inside the line and opens the face to steer that to third man
good length and curved into the corridor. Stays in the crease this time and defends to point
good length at off stump, walks down at that and flicks with the angle to deep square's right
full awayswinger at middle stump, leans in and clips to mid-on with a closed face
full inswinger outside off, shuffles and uses the swing to clip this to mid-on's riht
good length and curving into the corridor. Defended on the front foot
offbreak, too full, patted back
wide outside leg this time
slower ball, wide outside off

Chahar takes it on the fourth take. Big laugh on Rohit's face. Slower ball, Patel toe-ends a skier, and Chahar nearly drops this running to his right from deep midwicket. Massive juggling act but he finishes a catch that should cheer him up a little
massive slower ball, and he toe-ends it to long-off for one
Rabada having some fun here, driving this length ball back over his head for four
quick bouncer, he gets inside the line and pulls this to the left of deep square for four
bouncer, outside leg, called a wide
slower short ball, and the big fast bowler Coulter-Nile dives full length at short fine leg to try to catch this. I wouldn't be doing this if I was the big fast bowler and risking an injury
full toss, on the higher side, driven to long-on for one. Just under the waist, the umpires rule
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
on a length, outside off, punched to long-on for one
goes full and wide, bowls too wide

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: Axar keeps showing his batting wares. Coulter-Nile digs this in, and gets it high too, but Patel has pulled this way above forward square leg

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, into the body, nudged for one into the leg side

short_text: Bumrah to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, seams away a long way. Beaten
and he has let Rabada off. The bouncer gets big on him, the top edge falls short of point, and the fielder allows him to get off with an overthrow
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one

short_text: Bumrah to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: defended to short straight midwicket. Bumrah wants a wicket or, failing that, a single  so he can go after Rabada

short_text: Bumrah to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: length ball, angling in, defended to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
bouncer into the body, beaten on the pull
that falls bang in the middle and short third man and cover running towards it. This short ball gets a bit big, and he escapes
slower short ball, Rabada early into the pull, will take a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, beaten on the punch. No feet
short of a length, angling in, pulled to deep midwicket
two double-wicket maidens in the same T20 innings. This is just too good. Rabada not good enough to edge it. Short of a length, leaving him against the angle, and just misses the edge
on a length, outside off, defended back to him
bouncer again, and he ducks it
and Bumrah has another. Another bouncer. This one is sharoer and at Sams. He tries to get inside the line and help it along, but all he manages is a glove through to de Kock
bouncer, outside off, and he doesn't get close to its line and sways away

and Bumrah has killed this game too soon. Oh what a killjoy. But also what joy to watch him bowl. Quick length ball, nips back off the seam, but he has also done Stoinis for the pace. Middle stump gone for a walk. This is just too good
slower ball, short of a length, short-arm pull. Just the single to deep square
slower ball, just short of that slot, punched to deep cover for one

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: lovely clean strike. Capitals realise there is no Boult, and they are going after Pollard. This is on-pace and in the slot, and he shuffles across to get close to it and lofts him back over his had

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: Pollard goes even slower but shorter, and beats him on the pull

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: he has picked the bones out of a Pollard slower ball. He is sitting back and waiting for it, and slogs this length ball over midwicket. Half the target achieved
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: quick length ball, angling in, hits him high on the bat. Pushed to midwicket

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length, effort ball, extra carry, beats his attempt to late-cut it
short of a length, outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
wide length ball, beats him on the cut
slightly shorter of that length, he punches at it, gets a thick edge for a single to third man

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: wide length ball, Axar stands tall and drives this on the up, between mid-off and extra cover. Along the ground
shapes up for the big hit again, but Chahar gets his length right on the fast legbreak. He has to defend this to cover
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one

short_text: Chahar to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: full, on the toes, clipped between long-on and deep midwicket, and Pollard misfields there. Is this the dew at work? Has he failed to guague the speed of the ball
quick lerbreak, on a length, well outside leg, then turning towards the wicket. Pushed towards deep midwicket for one
legbreak, short of a length, Stoinis lets this turn and cuts this between point and cover-point for four more
Chahar bowls short of a length, and flat, and Stoinis rocks back to pull this over wide long-on
bouncer, and de Kock is expecting it. This is the second such Krunal has bowled in the last two matches. Anyway, Stoinis pulls this down for a single
really slow, angling across him, punched to deep cover for one
gets to his fifty with a quick single as he hasn't bunted this too far off Pandya. He misses with the direct hit
another yorker, but this time Stoinis cues it fine of third man for four. Can't have been intended. Not entirely
and now he bowls a 110ks yorker outside off. de Kock does well to stop this
on a length, no room, punched to cover

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: wide length ball, but just inside that wide line. Axar leaves it alone thinking this will be called but Pollard is pinpoint with his accuracy

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length, on-pace, punched to extra cover

short_text: Pollard to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: wide on the crease, down the leg side, and it is slow so the edge doesn't carry to the keeper. de Kock immediately says it hasn't carried even as Pollard is excited about it
slower ball again, on a length, no room, bunted into the leg side for one
slower ball, on a length, on off, punched down to long-off for one
wide on the crease, on a length, pushed down to long-on for one
on a length, into the body, worked to leg for one
on a length, outside off, no turn, dabbed to cover-point
drills in a low full toss, driven down to long-on for one
slow through the air, on a length, middle and leg, punched down to long-on for one
driven to long-on this time for one

short_text: Krunal to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: quick, straight, on a length, pushed back to him

lovely shot. This has been the trick of Chahar and Chahal. When under the pump, they bowl loopy slow wide legbreaks, and batsmen fall for it. Stoinis, though, much like Surya did to Chahal the other day, goes over extra cover instead of down the ground, and gets six for it
quick and full, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, turning away, punched to deep cover for one
that is Samson-like. Chahar overpitches outside off, and he just extends his arms through it to loft him over long-off for a huge six
short, quick, hurried into the pull, but there is no deep midwicket in place
legbreak, Axar goes back to work this behind square on the leg side for one
straight length ball, worked to leg for one

and Bumrah won't be required to get Pant out today. Krunal angles this wide, Pant sets himself up for the slog sweep, but instead of turning in, this actually angles furhter away, and all he manages is a toe-end to long-on
full, just outside leg, inside-edged to deep midwicket for one
slower in the air, straight, on a length, defended back to him
wide length ball, punched to right of deep cover, but Chahar puts in a diving save
on a length, slow, no room, worked towards deep midwicket
on-pace, length ball, just outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
on a length, tucked away off the hip for one
wide on the crease, bowls a wide length ball, driven on the up, gets a single to deep cover
slower ball, on off, pushed back to him
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
slower ball, on a length, defended back to him
picks the slower ball, Aussie to Aussie, and clears mid-off with a languid drive
short of a length, into the body, short-arm pull forward of deep square, and Anukul Roy - how does he spend so much time on the field? - makes a diving save
slower ball, offcutter, tucked away off the hip for one
on a length, on off, defended to cover
on a length, closer to off, hits him high on the bat as he drives
a wide length ball, he toe-ends the drive
another quick length ball, punched to cover-point
quick, on a length, punched to cover

dropped by brother Hardik. Krunal had earned this wicket with his tight bowling and then the length ball to cramp Stoinis up. He hits this just over mid-on, Hardik has to time his jump, but he fails to do that. It slips through for four
looks for the wide yorker, goes too wide
full and quick, Stoinis backs away to punch this, but can't beat cover
slower in the air, full, pushed back to Pandya
flat length ball, punched to cover
oh nearly a repeat of the last dismissal with this angling in from round the wicket and hitting his pad. Except this time it is going down

and they have got what they wanted. That extra wicket. Hit straight to cover. You could call this unfortunate and all but Iyer has played away from the body and neither not looked to keep this down nor tries to clear the infielder. Just throws his hands at a wide length ball, and Rohit takes the catch at short cover
lovely shot. Driven on the up as Bumrah bowls this length ball wide. Crashes this past extra cover for four
on a length, angling in, worked to square leg for one
slightly short of a length, straight at him, pushed to mid-on
quick length ball, defended off the back foot
on a length, angling across, driven to cover
shuffles across, then backs away, as he usually does, and cuts Boult's attempted bouncer over cover-point
Iyer has to keep going. Boult goes a touch too full looking for swing, and he lofts him over mid-on for four
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
on a length, slight seam/cut away from leg stump. Squares him up a little. Pushes this back to him
uppish as he pushes at this length ball, and it goes wide of point for one
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
looks for the yoekr, misses his mark, and Stoinis flicks this half-volley off this toes for a four to square leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
bouncer, and they get off the mark with a wide
short of a length, punched sweetly, but straight to cover

ladies and gentleman. If you ever want to see domination, this is what it looks like. Lose the toss, ask to bat, score 200, and reduce the opposition to nought for three. Swinging quick yorker. Searing and moving. Traps him lbw first on the toe, and then breaks his off stump. Bowled takes precedence here

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, punched to cover

double-wicket maiden to start off with when defending 200. Hardly gets better. Short of a length, pushed to pint, and Kishan has hurt himself trying to deny them the single they are not even serious about

bashes the front pad this time. When they were looking for swing, he bowled across them. Now he has drawn Rahane across twice, and has bowled the late inswinger to trap him in front. In an otherwise powerful attack, when you can't afford to see Boult off, this guy is a menace. And he is shrewd to go with his skills
on a length, around off, pushed to cover
on a length, slight swing, defended solidly off the front foot

this is such clever bowling. Shaw is looking for that inswinger, his feet are not going across, and Boult has not given him the inswinger. He has bowled on an angle. And with feet unsure, his hands push at it, and it takes the edge. What's more? It is a cutter, meant to go across. Clever clever bowling
no swing. Short of a length, just outside off, defended

and 200 it will be. Nortje bowls a wide full toss, he goes deep in the crease, his front leg is in the air in an effort to generate power, and he clears extra cover. The six race between Kishan and Pandya is well and truly hot and on
slower ball, hard length, beats his pull, and they take the bye as Pant fumbles. No ego from Pandya sending Kishan back
goes wide yorker again, bowls a full toss, and Pandya goes across to loft him over long-off for another six. This is such efficient risk-free six-hitting. He is playing within himself, guys
that is a nothing ball. Slower ball, in the slot, and you are not beating this power hitter with such full slower ones. He drills this over long-on for six
goes wide yorker, bowls a low wide full toss, but Pandya gets only the toe end
Nortje bowls the slower yorker wide outside off, and he gets just the single to deep midwicket
Rabada follows him again, and this time he helicopters this low full toss flat to deep midwicket for one

oh he has picked his spot perfectly here. He knows mid-off is up so he is making room early and wants only enough power to clear mid-off. Rabada follows him, cramps him up, and he doesn't clear mid-off, but has put this wide of the man
the yorker nailed again, and he can only dig it out for a single to long-off
gets the yorker right, and he digs it out back to Rabada
slower ball, short of a length, but Pandya generates great power on the slog and goes flat over midwicket. Scary batting
misses the yorrker by a foot, and Pandya flicks this from the slot. Not a massive follow-through, but big muscle and timing. Clears long-on

slower balls worked for him so far but Sams doesn't want to be too predictable and bowls one-pace. Except that he gets the length wrong and bowls in the slot. Kishan slogs this over wide long-on for a flat low six
full and wide, and would have been called had Pandya not reached out and toe-ended it to long-off for one
slower length ball, he picks it late, and gets just the single to long-on
yorker, down the leg side, pushed to deep midwicket for one
sees him walk down, bowls the slower one, and it runs off the inside edge for a couple to long leg
yorker gone wrong. Full toss into the pads, flicked away nonchalantly over square leg
full and wide, squeezes it under his bat. What an over. Forced to bowl the 17th because the match-up is not ideal for the specialist spinner, and he takes a wicket and concedes no boundary
short, not too wide, cut in the air and in front of square. Gets a two. Pandya not at his sprightliest when running
full toss down the leg side, but Pandya just pushes this to deep square for one
short and not too wide, gets big on Kishan, and he mis-hits it over mid-off for one
wide length ball, he shuffles across to push this straight of extra cover and wide of mid-off for one

wide length ball, and he does well to drag this out of his reach. Pandya looks to drive it over extra cover, but this goes off the toe end as he has a long way to reach. Caught at deep point. Golden arm eh
short of a length, angling in, he plays this late and absolutely deliberately, placing this fine of third man
on a length, looks to slog, gets an inside edge and they steal a single to midwicket
into the second tier again. Krunal Pandya into the act now. Bouncer from Nortje, Pandya doesn't hold back even though this is too high to control. It sails over long leg
on a length, no room, slogged to deep midwicket for one
low full toss, 148ks, on the toes, and not only does he get his toes out of the way, he jabs at it and scoops it straight of deep square leg for four
short of a length, tucked off the hip, fine of fine leg for a couple
another big pull but doesn't get all of it. Will take the single
it doesn't matter where the fielder is this time. Rabada bowls short, Not even chest-high, and he has pulled this into the second tier behind square leg
again the short ball gets big on him, but the mis-hit carries past midwicket in the circle. And the boundary rider is square for Kishan. So this rolls into the fence. Ends a drought for Mumbai
mis-hits this as he goes across to try to hit over midwicket. He has mis-hit it enough for it not to carry to the boundary rider
looks to play the pick-up pull, mis-hits this short-of-a-length ball for a single to deep square leg
on a length, angling in, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
slower offcutter, he looks to run this down, but is cramped up and hit on the glove. They get a single, though
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-on for one
slower ball, cuts back in, cramps him up, hit back to Sams
short, pulled down, gets a single to deep square leg
short of a length, on-pace, punched down to long-on for one
on a length, outside off, pushed with an open face. A fumble at point gives them a single
really slow in the air, middle and leg, driven with soft hands down to long-on for one
flat length ball, no room, defended with an open face
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
on a length, dipping, on off, defended with an open face

a loud shout of come on from Ashwin as he has Pollard caught at long-on. This is a carrom ball, but he has overpitched it. No turn on it, but Pollard's bottom hand comes off the bat as he looks to go over long-on. Rabada dives to his right at long-on to catch this
short of a length, into the body, pulled to long-on for one

big yorker first up but Pollard's stride seems to have got him outside the line. At any rate, they don't have a review left. And replays show that Pollard has got his foot outside the line as he is hit on the toe. Fast yorker first up. Not a bad shout from the bowler

this lull in the last three overs has brought about the wicket. Good bowling too. Short bowling like they mean it. This one cramps him up, and also gets big on him, and all Surya manages is a top edge to long leg
short ball, no room, and he is beaten on the ramp again. Twice in two overs now

disdainfully ends the boundary drought, and brings up his fifty. Dominant except the last two overs. Takes this length ball from outside off, plays with a straight back and then flicks it at the last moment to beat midwicket
slower ball, on off, pushed to cover: 15 balls without a boundary now
short of a length, wide, punched nicely but straight to point
looks to attack him but Rabada gets this bouncer high enough to not let him pull to midwicket. Surya ends up mis-hitting this to long-on for one
looks for the ramp to this short ball but is beaten by the loopy bounce. Twelve balls without a boundary
slower ball, on a length, down leg. clipped for one to square leg
short of a length, no room, opens the face, can't beat point
short of a length, quick, on top of off, steered down to third man for one
misses out on a leg-stump half-volley. Ends up hitting this straight to midwicket in the circle
swept away from outside off, wide of long-off, gets a couple

short_text: Axar Patel to Ishan, no run
long_text: on a length, can't drive this, can't pull this. Pushes it back to Axar
short ball, stays low, but Kishan still pulls this straight enough of deep midwicket to be able to come back for two
quick length ball, into the body, driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, into the body, pulled wide of long-on for a couple

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, pushed down the ground, but cover is straight to deny them the single
full, just outside off, driven straight of mid-off for one
slower short ball, and Surya has dragged this from wide outside off and rolls his wrists on the pull to clear square leg. What awareness of the field. Has picked his spot spotlessly
slower ball, on a length, pushed to cover. Plays in front of the body so he doesn't try an attacking shot
short ball, pulled to long leg for one
on a length, around off, punched to third man for one
short of a length, just outside off, punched to mid-off
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover. He wants the single to get off the mark but is sent back
full, middle and off, driven to long-on for one

Ashwin has another Mumbai wicket. He is single-handedly keeping them in the contest. de Kock looks to keep attacking to look to deny DC their plan for bowling high pace in the back 10. He charges out, Ashwin slows it down, he looks to go inside-out, but all he gets is a toe-end. Caught at long-off
quick length ball, driven down to long-on for one
slog sweep, the big slog sweep. Uses his height to reach it even though the ball is not full enough. Keeps his head down, and lofts this over midwicket
quick, on a length, on off, punched back to Ashwin
driven uppishly, straight of short cover, gets a single to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: incredible shot. This is disrespectful batting. Axar Patel has bowled a decent length ball outside off, but he has gone back, bent his back leg, created his length and late-cut this for four

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: goes wide on the crease bowls wide, de Kock catches up with it, cuts this to deep cover
on a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: on a length, into the pads, clipped away for a single to deep midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: repeated appeals from Pant for catch at the wicket. Not given. DC review it. de Kock looks to reverse-sweep this, the ball doesn't turn as much as expected, and it goes close to the glove and settles in Pant's gloves. Flat line on Ultra Edge, though. DC have lost the review

what a sign-off to the field restrictions. This is some shot. Glory days of West Indies batsmen like. He has gone to a length-ball offbreak, leant back further, raises his front leg and managed to send this punch scurrying between cover and cover-point
flatter, short of that driving length. Defended back to him
another pause in the stride, and it doesn't matter if he has bowled an offbreak or carrom ball because he has pitched too close to Surya, who has lofted him over mid-off casually for a six
offbreak, doesn't turn, takes the soft leading edge towards extra cover
carrom ball, bowled with a pause in the sride, driven to extra cover
on a length, outside off, goes back to punch this down to long-off for one
wide length ball, pushed to cover

big appeal for the catch at the wicket as Surya is beaten on the pull. There is a noise for sure as it passes the bat, but the umpire doesn't give it. And they don't review it either. Replays show why. Not even close to the bat or the glove

this time with a vertical bat. Quick length ball, good bounce, but Surya flicks this in the air and over midwicket. There is a man at deep square so he has to make sure he doesn't drag this too far. And he manages that
phew  that is disrespectful. Short of a length, quick, but Surya just walks across and short-arm pulls this through midwicket. This is high-quality execution
doesn't carry to third man. de Kock swings across the line of a quick ball just short of a length, and the edge nearly carries all the way but falls well short

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, around off, looks to open the face for one, but he is cramped up by the line. Dot

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: de Kock clears the front leg, draws the big back lift, but Patel manages to fire this in full enough to not let him get underneath it. Just the single to long-on
on a length, slight turn, punched down to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: fired in, nearly a yorker, drilled to wide long-on for one

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: long-on and midwicket back, but de Kock takes them both on. He is not going to let the left-arm spinner settle. Drives this on the up without reaching its pitch, and goes over wide long-on for a six

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: short of a length, outside off, de Kock looks to clear cover/mid-off, doesn't get all of this, but still does clear the infield
flat, on a length, outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, 2 leg byes
long_text: signs of dew as Nortje slips when fielding this at third man? de Kock looks for the big pull over midwicket this time, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and the deflection goes fine of third man. Nortje slips just as he reaches the ball. If it is dew this early, that could neutralise DC's advantage to an extent

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: slower short ball, 121ks, de Kock does well to delay his pull shot, rolls his wrists on it, and also ends up dragging this to the left of deep square leg
short ball, hip high, de Kock looks for the pick-up pull. Beaten down the leg side. Called wide
loose shot. A drive away from the body. Feet can get stuck against extra pace. The inside pace hits the pad, and they take a single
on a length, 142ks, just outside off, hits him high on the bat as he defends
short of a length, no room, soft hands for a single to backward point

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: quick length ball, driven on the up, the mid-off is wide to field this
flatter, on a length, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: wide half-volley. Looking to toss this up, but doesn't get the drop he is after. de Kock drives this trhough extra cover for four
on a length, offbreak, flat, pushed to long-on for one

big offbreak first ball, and he has been given. Think he needn't review if he hasn't hit this. Big offbreak not for the big sideways movement, but how much this has done in the air. Drifting and dipping, making him play down the wrong line, and then turning it in to hit him bang in front. No hesitation in raising the finger
quicker length ball, bottom edge onto the toe. They steal a single

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: half-volley on the toes, clipped to midwicket. Crisp shot, with the deep man square. Six feet either side, and this was runs
and he will keep the strike. Drops this length ball to leg for an easy single

short_text: Sams to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: looking for swing, he bowls yet another half-volley. He is looking to attack, and his mid-on is wide. So al de Kock needs to punish this error in length is to push-drive this fairly straight and the mid-on is beaten again

short_text: Sams to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: loses his line again. de Kock is loving these gifts. The length is fine, but he angles it down leg, and de Kock places it well forward of deep square leg

short_text: Sams to de Kock, no run
long_text: finds the length and line. Short of driving length, just outside off, slight swing away. Pushed to cover
on a length, angling in, tucked away wide of the man deep square on leg side for a couple

short_text: Sams to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: starts with a half-volley, de Kock pushes at it on the walk, using his wrists to place it on-side of the bowler. Mid-on stands no chance
slow length ball outside off, and he punches this between cover and extra cover to end it all
slower ball, inside edge onto the pad as he looks to work this to leg
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
bouncer, outside off, beats his attempt at an upper-cut
short of a length, into the body, tucked away for a single
short of a length, no room, pushed to point
slower ball, on a length, Warner makes room to punch this to deep point for one
ramps this short ball towards third man. Coulter-Nile has to go to his left and also run in. Can't make it. Half-volleyed
backs away to try to hit over cover, but the ball doesn't come on and he ends up playing this back to the bowler
short ball, waist-high, swivel-pulls this to long leg
slower ball, short, wide, cut to square third man for one
on-pace short ball, midwicket is up in a catching position, and he has short-arm-pulled this over the man
wide low full toss, and Warner is beaten as he has backed away early
quick length ball, angling in, pushed to cover for one
slower ball, short of a length, and Warner has pulled it at a catchable height for midwicket, but straight enough of that man
skiddy short ball, beats his pull and hits the thigh pad. No leg-bye as this goes straight to short third and Warner is off balance
sharp bouncer, at him, and Warner sways out of the way
on a length, angling in, flicked away into the leg side for a single
short of a length, no room, he looks to open the face, but can't place it. Cramped by the offcutter
slower ball, on a length, driven in front of deep cover. Another brace
really full, can't get under it, dug out for one
slower ball, on a length, wide, punched in front of deep cover for two
slower bouncer, wide on height
slower short ball, pulled to deep midwicket for one
yorker, dug out for a single to leg
wide slower ball, bunted into the off side for one
full, on the toes, clipped away for a single to deep midwicket
slow in the air, on a length, pushed wide of long-on for two. If Krunal collects this throw clean, Saha is gone. He doesn't
seam-up bouncer. Not sure the keeper knows this is coming. This is also down leg. Five wides
slow and wide again, punched to wide long-off for one
slow, wide, loopy, Saha tries the sweep, but is beaten
quick length ball, wide, he has late-cut this, but can't beat the diving short third man
on a length, slow, dipping, and Warner has out this between long-on and deep midwicket with soft hands for a couple
accurate length ball, and he steals the single after dropping this at his toes
short of a length, straight, and they have a deep midwicket and long-on to protect the leg-side hits, but Warner has bisected them with this pull
down the wicket to take this on the full and take a single to bring up his own fifty
wide slow legbreak, Saha knows he is not in control of this so just defends. Beaten by the turn
wrong'un, wide outside off, gets the single off the bottom edge
goes to his fifty with a superb slog-sweep. Skimmer. Flat six. Wide long-on. Hits the triangles on the full. Taken off a length from outside off

high full toss, and I think Chahar might have done them a favour by dropping this at deep square leg. Had he caught it, we would have checked it for a no-ball, and I suspect it is too high. Anyway, Saha has flicked it square, Chahar has to run to his left from deep square, and his dive is not good enough to catch it
slow in the air, wide length ball, Saha gets a bottom edge on the attempted inside-out hit
low full toss, hit hard to long-off for one
full, clipped off the toes for a single to long-on
quick, seam-up, wide outside off, driven to long-off for one
slow in the air, on a length, wicket to wicket, punched to deep cover for one
quick length ball to Warner, punched hard and wide of long-on for two
wide legbreak, Saha is looking for the inside-out shot, but gets just the toe-end for a single to long-off
reverse-sweep, ut ends up playing it in front of square. Gets just the single as deep cover comes around
quick legbreak, on a length, outside off, pushed to extra cover
slow off the surface, Saha works this length ball behind square on the leg side
beats the big sweep with the slowness in the air with the legbreak. Beaten outside off
fires in a low full toss, pushed wide of deep midwicket for two. Coulter-Nile fumbles, then wipes his hand on his pants
slower in the air, on a length, middle and leg. Turned around the corner for one
whipped away into the leg side. Pandya bowls flat, and short of a length, and he rocks back to place this between deep square and deep midwicket
short of a length, looking for the inside-out drive, but ends up slicing it over short third man for four
on a length, turning in, pushed down to long-on for one
slow through the air, no turn, beats him on the inside edge but they take a leg-bye. Called a run. Must have got an inside edge
short of a length, on-pace, short-arm pull, but straight to midwicket
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for one
slower bouncer, he sits back and runs it down to third man for one
wide length ball, driven on the up, forward of deep cover, comes back for two
on-pace, short of a length, cramps him up, but he gets beside the line and drops this to off for one
slower ball, short of a length, tucked to leg for one
slow wide legbreak, which he and Chahal often use. Saha sees it is out of his reach and aborts aggressive intent. Just defends it
short of a length, around off, punched down to long-off for one
the paddle sweep now, takes it from middle and sends it over the keeper's head
reverse-sweep, and it is a good'un. Takes it from just outside off, and this is hit so hard it gives short third man no chance. It is not too far from the man, mind
tries the sweep, the legbreak sits the surface, and he cue-ends it to long-on for one
lebgreak, just outside off, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
slower ball, on a length, worked to deep square leg for one
short of a length, on-pace, into the body, beats his pull and hits him on the thigh pad
slower ball, short of a length, wide, cut away, but straight to point
cramps him up with a length ball, Warner makes room to slog, mis-hits this, but he has sent this wide of mid-on for four
slower ball again, short of a length, grips the surface, and beats his pull
slower ball, angled too far down the leg side
short of a length, straight, worked to leg for one
on a length, straight at him, he makes room to punch this straight to extra cover
and he tries to beat the field by truing to reverse this. Hits this straight to short third, but it doesn't carry
another sweep, this time he connects, and hits it in the air past the diving square leg. He has dragged this from outside off
Warner tries the sweep to a length ball, but is early into it. Pitched outside leg, though
slower in the air, full, legbreak, pushed to long-off for one
doesn't need to sweep if you give him a long hop first up. Cracked over midwicket for four
slower ball, on a length, he picks it early, delays the shot, places this wide of the deep fielder on the leg side, and comes back for two
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover-point with soft hands
and this one deserves to go for a fourth four. Short, wide, cut away, but this time Kishan dives to his left at cover-point to keep them down to one
that is poor. Short, no height on it, just outside off, and he makes room to cut this through point. Five hundred IPL fours for Warner
slower ball, short of a length, no room, but someoiw Warner manages to make room to cut this in front of square, and place it between extra cover and cover
and Warner gets into the act now. Just short of a length, and he rocks back to pull this through midwicket for four
that is a top shot. Kulkarni bowls a length ball, pretty straight, and he has glanced this from middle stump, maybe middle and leg, to send it for a four fine of fine leg
on a length, Saha looks to go over cover, gets the thick edge over short third man for four
short of a length, no room, pushed to mid-off for a quick single

slower ball, wide outside off, he sweeps and gets a cue end to short third man. Warner calls him through for a quick single, he is struggling, but the throw hits Saha in the back. No change in direction, though
short of a length, no room, pushed with an open face
length ball, outside off, and he slogs at it, and is beaten by the slowness off the surface
dug in short, chest-high, straught, but he is off his toes to ride the bounce and run this behind square on the off side for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
another chip shot, and it is nearly a six over mid-on. Just a check-drive to a length ball. No follow-through in that drive. Just the bat speed and the timing
lovely check-drive for a six. This is short of a length, wide, and he just nonchalantly chips this over mid-off. Just the bat speed and the timing carry it all the way for a six
short of a length, sliding down leg ever so slightly. He looks to help it over square leg, but is beaten, and hit on the pad
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
on a length, just outside off, punched straight to cover
short of a length, gives him the width, punched wide of point for one
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
short of a length, just a flick but it nearly carries to the fielder at deep square leg. Heavy bat
looks to whip this square on the leg side, but the ball is not short enough for that shot. Hit high on the pad. Headed down leg
short of a length, at him, defended to cover
wide down the leg side as he gets some swing on this

oh good to see. Sight for sore eyes. Batsmen not worrying about their not-outs and running the extra run off the last ball. And it doesn't matter than Warner's throw from long-on has hit Kularni in the helmet as he looks to complete the second. He hasn't changed direction so there is no appeal for obstruction
low wide full toss, driven hard to square third man for one
slower ball, on a length, slugged to deep square leg for one

Holder with the three-fingered salute again. He has Pollard. This wicket is worth 10-15 runs. And he seems to have got really lucky. This is a plum full toss, and not even a slower one. Pollard is early into the shot, looks to drag this to leg, and is still early into it. Bowled
yorker gone horribly wrong. Straight full toss, and Pollard flicks it over square leg for six. This is nonchalant six hitting
wide on the crease, low full toss, Pollard gets only the cue of the stick. Refuses the single
yorker, and this is straighter than the last lbw appeal, but seems he has toe-ended this into his boot. He also gets the single to retain strike
thrice as nice. Blows to give KKR some oxygen. Wide low full toss, and this time Pollard goes straight down the ground and clears both the long-offs with ease. Breaks his bat in the process
oh Pollard. That is why he is among the greatest T20 players ever. He has put the fear in the bowler's mind. Gets a low full toss this time, and gets inside the line to loft him over deep midwicket

there are two long-offs in place and Pollard has hit this to the wider of the long-offs. Pandey gets under it, and Warner is next to him for the rebound. Pandey has to leap and take this overhead, but it slips through. Just a touch too high perhaps

Pollard walks practically halfway down the pitch, is hit in front of the wicket, but these are so hard to give. They review. I am sure the 3m thing will come into play here. And the Ultra-Edge shows a scratch anyway as the ball passes the bat. So the review is lost
down the wicket to take this on the full, takes a single to deep cover
dipping low full toss, driven down to long-off for one
wide low full toss, and Pollard inside-edges this for a single to leg
short ball, chest high, sits up, pulled forward of deep square leg for two
yorker from that great height. Garner-like. But at slower pace. Dug out back to him

slower ball, in the slot, outside off. Seems like Coulter-Nile is expecting a quick yorker, and picks it late, and it is too late by the time he goes for the aerial cover-drive. Caught at extra cover. Hundred T20 wickets for Holder
nearly a yorker, just outside off, Coulter-Nile tries the big shot, gets the to end through to the keeper
jumps out of the crease this time, and I mean literally, but Sandeep shortens his length and draws a defensive push from him

Pollard walks practically halfway down the pitch, is hit in front of the wicket, but these are so hard to give. They review. I am sure the 3m thing will come into play here. And the Ultra-Edge shows a scratch anyway as the ball passes the bat. So the review is lost
short of a length, outside off, worked to leg for one
a second played-on for Sandep. Slightly round-arm, own pace, wide full ball. Kishan reaches it, looks to go to cover, but gets a toe end onto the wicket
shuffles wide on the crease, and unlike Pollard meeting yorkers early, he stays back in the crease to create a half-volley out of a full ball. And he has lofted him back over his head
slower ball wide yorker, Kishan early into it, and gets the toe-end

the Pollard power. A lot of batsmen struggle to get power into low full tosses. And I am not convinced this is a low full toss either. He has reached out in front of his body to convert a yorker into one. And the long-on and long-off are pretty straight, but he has still beaten them. The gold standard of death-overs batting

that is how difficult it is to bowl to Pollard. Misses the yorker by a little. Bowls a low full toss, or perhaps it is the Pollard reach that converts this into a low full toss. And he drives this hard and straight of long-off for four
full and wide, driven down to long-off for one
change-up ball. Goes from bowling the straight yorkers as he has been doing to Kishan to the wide length ball. Draws a dot as Kishan is already making room
low full toss outside off, driven down to long-off for one
full and straight, whipped into the leg side for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: huge appeal for lbw, not given, and they have reviewed immediately. What good captaincy and bowling here. They have brought up the fielder to block that push, and they have successfully drawn a block from Pollard. And he has not picked the wrong'un, and this ball is hitting middle and leg. The umpire feels he has got outside the line with his height and big stride. The replay returns an umpire's call on that point of impact. He has survived by a bare margin. How crucial will it be in the coming five overs
wrong'un, on the pads, worked to leg for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, FOUR runs
long_text: another wrong'un, but bowls this too full, and he is not worried about playing the big shot again. Not the cleanest connection, but he has gone straight down the ground and beats long-on to his right
driven down the ground for one

Rashid has dropped a skier off his own bowling. He is filthy with himself. Kishan is winding up for the sweep, he bowls the wrong'un, does him in completely, draws the top edge, and Rashid runs towards midwicket to get under it. It slips out
on a length, middle and off, punched down to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, nudged into the leg side for one
looks like the wrist-spun delivery, but it is a full toss and has been driven to deep midwicket for one
Pollard with the big wind-up, Nadeem goes round-arm, and slows it down. He has to abort the shot, and settles for the single to cover-point
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to short midwicket
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
on a length, pushed back at him, and he has Kishan in his way as he dives to his right, but he does enough to deflect it to midwicket
wrong'un, back of a length, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: legbreak, just short of a length, middle and leg. Defended back
legbreak, takes the thick inside edge for a single to leg
wrong'un, too short, pulled between the two deep fielders on the leg side
full, just outside off, driven hard to long-on for one

and Rashid Khan is right back into it. Wrong'un to take the edge, and for Saha to take it clean. It is an excellent catch because it has stayed low too. And Saha stays low for long enough. And Tiwary is defending for a legbreak here, and then when he sees it turn the other way, he sort of follows it with his hands
has he bowled a legbreak here? This is loopy, slow, and turns the other way. Tiwary has enough time to adjust, and takes a single to cover
turn from him, off a length, outside off. Defended to cover

one more for Nadeem. This pitch is extremely slow. A length ball, Pandya looking to work it to leg, but the ball stops on him and takes the leading edge for a lob to settle with Williamson at short midwicket
fired in, on a length, into the pads, worked to midwicket
slow through the air, really full, driven straight to mid-off

short of a length, wide, stays low, Surya punches, is beaten, and Saha breaks the wicket. Oh this ball is so slow that Surya has dragged his back foot trying to reach it. He has slipped out of the crease and hasn't gone back in by the time Saha stumps him
yorker, dug out into his own toe and then back to Natarajan
slower ball, on a length, punched down to long-on for one
full and straight, Kishan can't get under it, drives it along the ground to long-on for one
slower ball, on a length, he delays the shot and flicks it to deep square leg for one
on-pace, fuller, nearly a yorker, and slightly down leg. Surya early into the flick. Beaten and hit on the toe
slower ball, on a length, cutting away from around leg, pushed to cover
short of a length, wrong'un, slow turn. He has time to adjust and punch this into the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: wrong'un, on a length, outside off, and he defends this back to Rashid

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, 1 leg bye
long_text: dug in short, and Kishan is early into the pull because it sits in the surface

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, SIX runs
long_text: these Mumbai Indians youngsters have no respect for the legends of the game. A flighted wrong'un, and he clears the front leg to loft him right back over his head
full, on the pads, he looks to flick, but gets a leading edge towards point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: Surya keeps sweeping Rashid. Takes this off a length, from outside off, and this time he beats deep square leg to his left
slightly round-arm with this ball, full, just outside off, driven down to long-off for one

drilled hard at him, Nadeem gets a hand at it, and I, for one, won't call it a drop but three runs saved. The ricochet nearly hits the wicket at the non-striker's end, and would have caught Surya short if it had
delays the delivery with a pause in his run-up. Not that that is the reason, but for a change the Surya inside-out chip goes to long-off instead of extra cover
full and straight, dug out to long-on for one
on a length, on off, punched down to long-off for one
shaping up for the big sweep, but Nadeem keeps the length away from him. He adjusts to drive it to long-off
slower in the air, overpitched, driven down to long-on for one
another sweep from outside off, just the single, but he is not letting Rashid bowl the way he wants to
wrong'un, pulled in the air, but the midwicket is back, so they get a single
sweep now. Gets a single to long leg
lovely shot. Inside-out chip to a Rashid Khan legbreak, well over extra cover. Gets a couple
short of a length, outside off, pulled down to long-on for one
worked to leg for a single

dropped. Think he took one return catch last match. Sundar, I think. But here he has dropped one. Surya toe-ends this back at him, not too hard, but his hands don't go at same trajectory as the ball. Doesn't even get a touch on it
short of a length, straight, pulled to wide long-on for one
short of a length, quick, no room, punched with an open face to point
on a length, wicket to wicket, Kishan looks to work with the angle, but gets a soft leading edge back to the bowler
on a length, angling across, hit off the inside half of the bat to long-on for one
slower through the air, punched to mid-off for one
on a length, outside off, small turn, defended back to him
length ball, outside off, punched to long-off for one
angling in, on a length, defended to leg
nobody can stop this one. Short of a length, straight, quick, and he makes room to punch this between cover-point and extra cover
through the leg of cover-point. Samad is the fielder. Actually not through the legs, but to his left. Surya has punched this square, and Samad has not made allowance for the spin away to his left
full, outside off, punched square on the off side, but straight to the fielder at point
on a length, angling in, defended back to him

one shot too many, and Sandeep has nine Powerplay wickets now. Of all the balls he has chosen a wide full toss to get out to. To Sandeep's credit, this is a slower ball, which means de Kock is early into his drive, and he gets the inside edge onto the wicket

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: de Kock toying around with Sandeep now. Now he walks down at a slower ball, delays his swing a touch and lofts him over wide long-on

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: that is a de Kock special. Oh how quickly he picks the length. This is just a length ball. Maybe inches short of good length, but de Kocks picks it so early, goes back, and pulls it into the road

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. He leaves the crease, Sandeep bowls the slower ball, but he delays the shot to reach it on the half-volley and place the drive wide of mid-off for four
full and straight, driven hard, straight of mid-off, but Warner is quick and onto it in a flash
slower offcutter, on a length, Yadav picks it halfway trhough his drive but goes ahead with the shot and chips it over extra cover
short, wide, and the lack of pace off the wicket means he is beaten on the cut

that fielder at deep square leg went more towards midwicket after the last shot, and this time he wants to go to the right of that man by shuffling across and playing a bit of a ramp. Beaten outside off and hit on the pad
on a length, straight, and Yadav gets inside the line and plays the pick-up over midwicket. Just the flick of the wrists
short, hip high, but he has a deep square leg in place to keep this pull down to just one run
short of a length, outside off, punched to mid-off
plays with softer hands this time, and keeps this down and to mid-off
risky shot. The slowness of the pitch. Surya just pushes at a wide length ball, and the ball stops on him, and he ends up hitting this in the air. Lucky that it has gone wide of short cover

the slow pitch does its job, and I also think he has bowled the knuckle ball here. Rohit gives him the charge, Sandeep slows it down, and he ends up chipping it to mid-off. Just doesn't get enough timing to clear that man
slightly short of a length, punched to deep square leg for one
on a length, wicket to wicket, driven down to long-on for one

the slow pitch is showing its wares. Rohit looks to drive him over extra cover, but he ends up lofting this towards Samad at deep cover. It falls just short. Holder feels he could have gone for the catch
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep point for one
full, swinging in, clipped off the toes, forward of deep square leg. Samad runs to his right and puts in a dive to save two runs

short_text: Holder to de Kock, no run
long_text: looks to shuffle across and flick him behind square on the leg side, and he edges a length ball into his pad
wide on the crease, angling in, tucked away off the hip

short_text: Holder to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, punched to extra cover

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, no run
long_text: length ball, stops on him, driven uppishly to mid-off

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length, pitched outside leg, punched past midwicket for a four all along the ground

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, swinging away, pushed to cover

short_text: Sandeep to de Kock, no run
long_text: swinging away from de Kock, ending up on top of off. He gets a bottom edge that bounces over the wicket
driven back on the up, Sandeep gets a hand to it, and Rohit takes a quick single. A quick single. An early test of his hamstring

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: starts with an inswinger, Sharma has to reach out to push at it. Hits the inside half of the bat and goes to mid-on
top edge clears the keeper and Delhi Capitals will get two shots at the final. Short ball across the corridor, looks for the pull again but that is too high for him
short and across the corridor. Inside edge onto his body saves him from being bowled. Trickles out to the keeper
full and just outside off, mistimed slog down to long-on along the floor
short of a length and wide outside off. Hammered on the up to sweeper's right
short and down leg side, beaten on the whip

just over Chahal at deep square! Kohli brings out the teapot. He reckons that should have been taken. Short and up at the chest. Top edge on the pull and it hangs despairingly in the air as Chahal takes a few steps back. Flicks his index finger and is over the line
short and at leg stump, has a massive heave and miscues the pull to deep backward square
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off
short of a length and gets stuck between Pant's legs as he misses on the pull. LBW appeal is turned down. He's around the wicket and that's probably going down
good length on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot

steered straight to short third. Short of a length and across middle stump. Tries to use the angle to play the reverse lap. It comes off the top edge and is an easy take. Rahane's put them on the brink, can't take them over
good length on leg stump, steps out and drags that to deep midwicket's left
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on with the angle
good length and pushed across off stump. Steps out and slices to sweeper
good length on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
full and into leg stump, jabbed to midwicket's left
drags it straight to long-on. Good length and holding in the pitch outside off. Reaches out and looks to clear the straight boundary. It comes off the inside half
good length and pushed wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, under-edge on the drive to extra cover's left
googly, full and at off stump. Leans in and drives to deep extra cover
good length on off stump, punched on the up to long-off
full and sliding onto off stump, driven to long-on off the inside half
short of a length at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and punches to long-on's right off the back foot
good length on leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
good length on off stump, reverse sweep straight to backward point

good length on leg stump, clipped towards long-on and that is fifty for Rahane. A welcome one for him in what has been a wretched season so far. But this is the kind of chase Rahane is made for, and he's done the job so far
full on leg stump, flicked through vacant square leg

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Rahane, no run
long_text: good length and slowed down outside off. Under-edge on the attempted drive
short and wide outside off. Goes hard with the cut, gets an under-edge to extra cover's left
good length and into leg stump, steps out and flicks to long-on's right
full and into leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and sliding onto middle stump, tucked into midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle stump, leans in and flicks into vacant midwicket
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and making him reach out for the cover drive. On the bounce to a leaping Kohli's right at extra cover
good length and sliding on at leg stump. Nudged to short fine off the inside edge
short of a length and turning away outside off. Gets deep in the crease and whips to long-on's right

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Rahane, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length and sliding into the pads as he looks to flick. Single stolen from short fine
short of a length and into leg stump. Back foot punch comes off the thick inside edge to deep square's right

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, OUT
long_text: lapped straight to short fine! Dhawan knows what he wants to do but he's down for it too early. Shahbaz slows it down. A full one on leg stump. He lifts it straight to the fielder. Standing ovation from the dugout as he goes out
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Rahane, SIX runs
long_text: lofts it over long-off! Short of a length outside off. Steps out and isn't anywhere near the pitch of this. But he goes all in, extends the arms, lifts his back leg as he does it, and lobs it gently over the fielder

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: good length on middle stump, swept to deep square's right
slapped over extra cover. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. Waits on it as he presses onto the front foot and times sweetly to clear the fielder. One bounce, close the boundary, and over
slower ball, short and outside off. Cut to sweeper's right
short and outside off. Waits on it and cuts to point's right. Point reaches out and gets a right hand on it

short_text: Udana to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full and into the pads, leans in and flicks it past short fine to bring up fifty. Back to form after two ducks
short of a length and skidding on. Looks to punch through cover, thick inside edge to long-on
full slower ball outside off, looks to drive through cover and gets a thick inside edge into midwicket

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: short and across off stump, cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: low full toss on leg stump, gets down for the lap sweep and hits it straight to short fine

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, 2 runs
long_text: short at middle stump, pulled to deep square's right
full and into off stump, lofts to sweeper off the front foot

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Rahane, no run
long_text: good length and pushed through outside off. Steps out and taps it back to the bowler

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: good length and onto leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket's left
short of a length and into leg stump. Nudged to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and just outside off, allows that on and chops to point's left. And he fumbles to allow a second
good length at middle stump, steps out and whips it to long-on's right
full and into leg stump. Reaches out and flicks to deep square
good length and into middle stump. Gets down for the sweep and gets this off the thick inside edge to deep square's right
good length and just outside off, looks to drive through cover on the rise. Thick outside edge to short third's left

short_text: Chahal to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, driven to extra cover

short_text: Chahal to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: some turn there. Goes very slow and dips this at a good length. Dhawan is beaten in flight after stepping out, but that spins into the body
full outside off, reaches out and clips to deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven to long-off

short_text: Chahal to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: nails the sweep to deep square's right. Full on middle stump, gets down and makes contact so sweetly on this. Head right on top of the ball
good length and sliding onto leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and wide outside off, waits on it and cuts to sweeper's right on the longer side

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and sliding into the pads outside leg stump as he leans in for the flick
good length and sliding on outside off. Steps out and is caught inside the line and far away from the pitch of that. Stabbed to short third's right off the outside edge
short of a length and into middle stump. Hurriedly chopped in front of point

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: lbw appeal turned down. Sundar shakes his head as they discuss the review. Going down, perhaps. Short of a length and skidding onto his back leg as he looks for the whip through the leg side. Sundar is around the wicket, remember

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and into leg stump. Jammed to the bowler's left
good length and sliding on outside off. Punched to long-on's right off the back foot
swept between deep square and deep midwicket. Full outside off. Gets forward and slow and sweeps uppishly, right in the middle of those two fielders
short of a length and sliding across off stump, cut to cover's right off the back foot
full outside off, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
good length and sliding onto middle stump. Pushed down the pitch off the back foot
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep square's right
yorker length at leg stump, squeezed to mid-off's left
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

slower ball at a length. A check punch and it's past mid-off. He was deceived there. Back of a length slower ball at outside off. He was leaning in for the drive but adjusted well on the fly to check that. It was aerial for a bit, then bounced over mid-off's outstretched right hand
good length and at the stumps, pushed back down the pitch
crunched past extra cover. Short of a length and just outside off. Punches from the crease and it's in the air. But sufficiently to the fielder's left
good length and into leg stump. Flicked to midwicket's left

big lbw appeal as he's beaten on the inside edge. They don't review it. Ah, in fact there is an inside edge on this. Length ball sliding in from outside off, was playing for the one that straightens, bat in front of off stump
good length at middle stump, punched to mid-on off the front foot
good length and into middle stump, punched to midwicket's left off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover's left off the front foot
good length at middle stump, gets the front foot out and across and sweeps with the turn. To square leg's right
good length and into middle stump, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and thuds into the thigh guard as he gets deep for the leg glance
good length and into off stump. Defended to point off the front foot
good length and at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
good length and across middle stump. Dropped into the covers with soft hands

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: drilled past mid-off. Overpitched and just outside off. Slides nicely onto the bat as Dhawan drives from an upright position, full face offered. Slightly aerial to his partner's right but very safe
good length and into leg stump. Leans in and swishes at that. Pings off the inside half to midwicket's right
short and into off stump from around the wicket. Chopped down to deep backward square
good length and into leg stump. Deflected to fine leg's right as he looks to flick
short and wide outside off, a controlled cut out to deep backward point

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full slower ball just outside off, eyes light up for the big drive, but it's off the toe-end and into the covers

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short and across off stump. He gets the back leg into the off side and gets the cut off the thick outside edge and fine of short third man
good length and wide outside off, left alone

oh that is a stunner from Siraj! Unplayable. Simply stunning. He said pre-match about how he's been chewing Dale Steyn's ear off in training. Well this is one way to pay tribute to Steyn. It's a very similar initial line - at middle stump - as the last few balls. But the seam is upright and this shapes towards off stump, very late in it's path. Lands on the seam and keeps going away and climbs past Shaw's angled bat to hit the top of off. Actually scratch that, the bat is straight enough, he was looking to defend it. Dream delivery
short of a length and into middle and leg. Pushed to midwicket's left off the back foot
oh easy. Full and into the pads. Gets forward and leans into that to whip this wide of mid-on
short and wide outside off, chopped to cover point
good length and onto the hips. Stays tall and allows this on before whipping it to the square leg boundary

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short and up at the left shoulder. Looks for the hook but is through it early and cops that on the left forearm. It lands pitch side

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, left alone

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: oh handsome. This is overpitched outside off and he leans into the drive after a half stride out. Holds the shape as he gets it to mid-off's right
full and wide outside off. Reaches out to try and drill that through the covers. Thick inside edge past the keeper and slip gives chase

short_text: Morris to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: low full toss swung into the corridor outside off. Half a stride out and punched firmly to deep point's left
good length and shaped away outside off. Hangs inside the line of that and steers to third man
short and wide outside off. Backs deep into the crease for the upper cut, but that comes off the toe-end and ends up at extra cover
short and rising quickly in the corridor outside off. He's well beaten on the cut but they sneak a bye

taken at long-off. 150.4kph. Short and rising outside off. Backs into the leg side and looks for the horizontal bat shot. Slices it up for Iyer, who had gone back after the last ball. Runs in and takes it easily

just clears mid-off with a miscued swipe. Short of a length and just outisde off. Slices from under that. Looks like ball hitting bat rather than the other way round. But it's looped over Iyer and run into the boundary

full toss at middle stump, goes too hard at the slog and miscues it. Ends up at long-on where Rahane has done brilliantly. Not the fielding itself, because it was straight at him. But the presence of mind to throw to the end AB is running at - the striker's end to keep strike. Took his time, lobbed it in really. Pant grabs it on the half-volley and catches AB well short. That is potentially a few runs saved for DC
beats him with a slower ball. A full toss outside off, but dipping rapidly as AB looks for the slog
finds deep midwicket. Short and just outside off. There in his pulling arc, but he's got no elevation on it.Dips into Rahane's lap
short of a length and into the body. Pings off the thigh guard and to the keeper
lifted over extra cover. Short of a length and across him. Stays leg side of that and gets his hands through that with an angled bat
beaten on the pull. Short of a length and across the corridor, it's past his inside edge
short and just outside off, dragged to deep midwicket with a toe-ended pull
sent a million miles over the leg side! Whew. A knee high full toss on leg stump. Need one say more when AB is the batsman? Firm in his half-crouch and sends it over square leg
swiped to deep midwicket's left. Sams finishes poorly. A slower short ball spinning into Dube at hip height. Another easy swing across the line for him
full and slow outside off. Backs away and drills to long-off's right
slogged to deep midwicket's left. Sams misses on the yorker. It's a friendly full toss at middle stump and it feeds Dube's swing across the line
slower ball, short of a length and at 108kph. Turning into the corridor and past the inside edge as Dube looks to slog this
low yorker outside off, big heave ends up at deep midwicket off the thick inside edge
crunched to long-off's left. Full slower ball outside off. Half a stride out and then he leans back to drive aerially and open up the region for him. Over the line on the bounce
yorker at middle stump, 143.6kph. Driven off the toe-end to midwicket's left
short of a length at off stump, turned to deep square's right off the back foot
slower short ball at off stump, waits on that and jabs it to point's right
low full toss on leg stump, dragged into the leg side off the toe-end
good length and pushed across off stump, looks to push through the covers with minimal feet. That's flown past him. 136kph
good length and into leg stump. Pushed aerially towards long-on

outside edge is taken and the Morris gamble doesn't pay off. It looks like a cutter from Nortje on first viewing. On slow-mo that doesn't seem to be the case though. But that short ball has really gripped and lifted slowly off the surface as Morris runs down at it. Gets bigger and bigger on him and it's a thick edge that Pant takes above his head
good length at middle stump, driven on the rise to extra cover

knocks middle stump with a 152kph length ball. It's scrambled seam, it's angled across from an initial leg-stump line. Padikkal backs into the leg side to try and lift him over the covers like he had in the powerplay. It's rapidly past him to hit the top of the stumps
length and outside off. Miscued slog ends up at long-on
into the boundary padding at long-off. they're checking it it's on the pull. Short of a length ball outside off. Sliced over mid-off again and it's deemed to have hit the padding on the full

just evades Iyer running back from mid-off. Good length and just outside off, looks to loft it over him. He can't get a hand on it after running back, looking over his shoulder. It bounces into his body as he tumbles

safely clears point. Full and wide outside off. Throws his hands at that and it comes off the cue-end. Sweeper cleans up to the right as Padikkal brings up his fifth fifty of the season and his third on this ground
swatted to the backward square boundary. Fine leg and square leg were in the circle, and this short cutter turns nicely into middle and leg. Padikkal reaches out and puts that away
beaten on the wide yorker outside off. just past the tramline again
yorker just past the tramline outside off, left alone
short of a length and into middle stump. Steps out and is cramped on the cut. Chopped to extra cover's left
cutter slides on, short of a good length and into off stump. Miscued pull to deep square's right
106kph. Cutter at a length outside off. It's like Axar's back. Padikkal into that early and awkwardly jabs that through square leg
good length and into middle stump. Looks to force through the off side, thick inside edge into the leg side
good length and wide outside off, reaches out and laces that along the ground to sweeper
short of a length outside off, laboured cut to short third man's left
full and pushed through at a middle stump line. Looks for the slog and gets an inside edge into vacant square leg. Short fine is slow in getting across to that and Axar has given him an earful
good length at off stump, gets low and sweeps to deep square
good length and just outside off, tapped off the front foot to sweeper's left

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
