long_text: appeal for lbw is turned down. Was looking for the sweep and this length ball hit him well outside off
grip and turn. Lobbed up at 78.3kph on a middle stump line. Leans in and pushes with hard hands to extra cover
good length and turning into off stump. Waits and waits before patting that down to long-on
tossed up at off stump, driven back to the bowler

taken at deep midwicket! Nice and slow again from Ashwin, 77kph. Up at length on middle stump. Kohli steps out to make the pitch of that but there's just no pace on this. Slugs it into the long boundary. Stoinis is in from the line, but he hangs on above his head and then does well to balance himself on the steps back
round-arm again, good length and angled into off stump. Driven to long-off. He really slowed that down
short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Under-edge on the cut, into his leg
good length at leg stump, flicked to deep square's right with the angle

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, SIX runs
long_text: lifted over long-on! This is what he was looking to do on that dropped catch delivery - use Axar's angle against him. It's good length and it's in at middle stump. This time he's created swinging room after stepping out and lofted it from under
good length and wide outside off, drags it with a sweep in the non-striker's direction. Axar stretches and gets a hand to it
good length at off stump, punched to long-off on the back foot

leading edge as he looks for the ramp. Length ball at leg and it ends up fine of short third man. A very tentative chase from Ashwin that the bowler isn't too thrilled about. Kohli is back for the third

short_text: Axar Patel to Padikkal, no run
long_text: short of a length in the corridor, chopped to short third man
short of a length at leg stump, front leg off the ground as he whips this on the bounce to deep square
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square's left
short of a length outside off, pulled on the bounce to deep square
short of a length and just outside off, steered to third man off the back foot
crunched over extra cover. A full slower ball outside off, waits on that and gets a stride out before lifting this over the fielder
beaten. Short of a length and climbing in the corridor. Steps out and looks to slash through cover. It climbs past the bat

short_text: Axar Patel to Padikkal, no run
long_text: length and tossed up slow outside off. Steps out and is forced to check himself and push this to extra cover

dropped at long-on! Nortje loses his footing, his shape, and then the ball. Kohli steps out for the release shot. It's a length ball at leg stump. No room for the loft and it comes off the inside half. Dips as Nortje runs in. He's taken the catch but slips and ends up on his back. The ball pops out as that happens
short of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length outside off, driven to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: full outside off. Steps out and is beaten in flight. Looks to whip through the line and gets an inside edge to midwicket
full and just outside off, driven to sweeper cover
round-arm length ball, in at middle stump. Punched to long-on's right off the back foot
short of a length and into leg stump, clipped to deep backward square's right
short of a length at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length and slow at middle stump. Gets deep in the crease and clips off the back foot to deep square's right
short of a length and sliding in at off stump. Chopped hurriedly to short third man
good length at middle stump, gets a big stride out and flicks to deep square
short of a length and just outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length and sliding on in the corridor. Punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and into leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length and into the stumps, steps out and punches to long-off
good length and into leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, looks to drive through the off side but that's gripped and come off the inside edge. To midwicket's right
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
short of Ashwin. Length ball drifts in at a middle stump. Drives with hard hands and it comes off the inside half and lands in front of the bowler
short of a length and delivered with a lower arm. Slides into off stump and he punches to extra cover
short and just outside off, gets deep in the crease and chops it between backward point and short third
good length and just outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
a 144kph bouncer follows. At his head. Padikkal stands tall and sways his head away at the last moment
short of a length across him, waits on that and opens the face late to steer this to short third man's left. The shortest part of the ground tonight and sweeper point has no chance
short of a length outside off, allows that on and runs it to third man
punched past extra cover off the back foot. Short of a length and just outside off. Stands tall and threads the gap in the infield
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
good length and just outside off at 143kph. Punched on the up to mid-off
full and at the stumps at 144.5kph. Flicked off the thick inside edge through square leg
slower ball, short of a length at leg stump. Whipped on the bounce to deep square
beaten. Short of a good length and slanted across the corridor, fends inside the line of that

chipped over point. This is reminiscent of Mayank Agarwal yesterday, who gauged early that hitting boundaries along the ground was difficult on a slow surface. Padikkal with no intent to keep this drive down against a length ball across him
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch. Was early into it and took his bottom hand off as he did that

Shaw tracks back at cover and takes a simple catch. Philippe's driven and pulled without finding his timing tonight. This time he looks to go inside-out and chip over the off side. It's a length ball angled in at middle stump and he backs away before opening the face. Done it too early and it comes off the toe-end and is a friendly skier
short of a length outside off, miscued punch to extra cover's left as he clears his leg to make room. Padikkal sneaks in at the other end as Stoinis' throw misses
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Looks for the pull but that ends up feebly to mid-on's left

lofted over mid-off but not quite with the same timing this time. More signs that it's sticky. Good length outside off, this time it comes off the high-ish part of the bat as he gets on the front foot and lofts deliberately. Rabada gives chase and swins towards the boundary to pull this back in. they're checking if his right elbow has made contact with the padding before the ball's out of his palm. It's very close, a matter of frames. It goes in Rabada's favour
beats the outside edge. Short of a length and jagged across the corridor as he's pinned on the back foot

lovely lofted drive over cover. Nortje's extra pace is nice for this drive through the line from Padikkal that was Kohli mouthing "wow" and standing up in the dugout. It's a length ball pushed across him and he gets half a stride out and keeps his head very still to maintain balance under this. Nice wrists at the end help him get that over. Languid and elegant
short of a length and just outside off, looks to loft that over midwicket. Can only get it as far as mid-on
good length and just outside off, defended to short third man
full and at off stump. Clears the front leg for the drive. Gets it off the inside edge to mid-on's left
good length and just outside off, goes hard on the drive on the up, can't beat cover
slower ball, short of a length and just outside off. Punched to mid-off
slapped wide of mid-on. Short and sitting up nicely outside off. Looks like it stuck in the pitch. Philippe with a lovely swing on the front-foot pull
good length and just outside off, stays leg side of that and pokes to extra cover
full and wide outside off. Beaten on the drive
good length and into leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's right off the back foot
good length and sliding on outside off, backs away and punches firmly at extra cover who misfields
good length and lobbed outside off. Dropped into the covers with soft hands
short of a length and just outside off. Punched to cover's left off the back foot and a lunging stop from Iyer
full and just outside off, looks like a carrom ball too. Driven off the toe-end to extra cover
short of a length and sliding into the hips. Glanced to short fine's right
good length and just outside off, pushed into the off side
pull ends up hitting the stumps at the other end. Short of a length ball across him. He wants to pull but can't close the face on that as it goes away
sliding stop to the right from Nortje at long leg. Short ball was hooked firmly into the turf
short of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
good length and shaped into the corridor again. Punched to mid-off's right off the inside part of the bat
short of a length and swung into the corridor. Shuffles and pushes this into the covers
eight-ball zero not out for Aaron as Nagarkoti bowls the short ball at him again and beats him
bouncer, accurate, and it beats Aaron's attempt to pull
makes room to punch this on the up but can't beat short cover
quick short ball, at his helmet, Aaron has to throw his bat up in self defence. Another dot
follows him with a length ball, gives him no room. Another dot for Aaron
short of a length, no room, punched to deep point for one
wide down the leg side as he slips it down with the yorker

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Aaron, no run
long_text: yorker, dug out to end the over

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Aaron, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, pushed to point. Another dot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Aaron, no run
long_text: hits the pad with a quick length ball, but it is a tough too high

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kartik Tyagi, OUT
long_text: takes this on the rebound. This is a big wicket for KKR's overall chances. Tyagi has chipped a full ball back at him, he sticks out his right hand, onto the shoulder, and then into the chest and then his hands
yorker, dug out to long-on for another single

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kartik Tyagi, 1 run
long_text: yorker, middle and leg, dug out for one
bouncer, at his head, and Gopal swings and misses
on a length, on off, runs off the outer half of the bat for one
full toss, driven down to long-on for one
Archer looks for another golf-swing six, and ends up toe-ending it. In the slot all right, but Archer is slightly early into it. Caught at long-on
driven hard on the up but straight to deep cover
full and straight, hit back at him. He gets a hand on it in follow-through. Just the single
another reverse sweep, and he has nailed it this time. DC and RCB will love this. KKR will absolutely hate it
another reverse sweep, and this time he gets a top edge back over Karthik's head
reverse sweep, too late for RR, but it will hurt KKR. He has cleared the man at point
hit hard, in the air, towards long-off, but it falls short of the man

is he bowled or has this come off Karthik's body? He slogs across a straight ball, and the extra bounce beats him, and also the top of the wicket. It comes off Karthik's body to break the wicket, but Archer has never left the crease
on a length, outside off, punched to cover
quick yorker, dug out into his own toe, and they take a quick single
slower length ball, driven to deep cover for one
length ball, punched down the ground for a single to long-off
yorker, just outside off, dug out for a single

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gopal, no run
long_text: short, quick, beats Gopal's attempt to cut
another leading edge falls safe. Looks to work this to leg but ends up chipping it out of Mavi's reach
short of a length, outside off, pushed into the covers for one
nearly another for Varun. Leading edge as he closes the face on this legcutter, and it lobs to the left of him. Varun is reluctant to put in the dive. A dive would have got him the catch
Varun keeps on delivering. Tewatia has to go for it as the asking rate keeps climbing. He looks for the big sweep, but has been done in by the wrong'un. The top edge settles with Karthik
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
quick length ball, driven to long-on for one
gets inside the line to sweep, gets a toe-end of the bat to end up hitting this towards deep midwicket. The damp ball means Nagarkoti fumbles, and they take the second
another, higher, bouncer. Gopal looks to ramp it, and is beaten
he has drawn the top edge on the pull but Gopal has managed to go in front of square while the catching man is at square leg. They get a couple
low full toss, dug out for a single to long-on
looks to ramp, Cummins shortens the length, and he is beaten
backs away, Cummins follows him, he places this wide of long-on and comes back for two
full, on off, driven hard but straight to mid-off
he might have made it back. Yorker, dug out to point, runs off when there is no single. Tewatia sends him back. He has to put a dive in to beat the throw
legcutter, on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, good bounce, runs this down to short third man
short of a length, down the leg side, and he has pulled this straight to long leg, He is disappointed with himself
legcutter, on a length, just outside off, pushed down to long-off for one
quick length ball, pushed down to long-off for one
on a length, punched down to long-on for one
big sweep. Outta here. Tewatia down on a knee to dismiss this full offbreak out of his sight. Oh this has gone way back
fuller, higher, on off. Defended back to him
top shot. Narine pitches short of a length, and he goes back to cut it in front of deep point for four. Tewatia's last dance this year
uppishly pushed down to long-on for one
down the wicket, Narine stays short of a length and straight. Defended
another wrong'un, worked into the leg side for one
appeal for lbw as he bowls a slow wrong'un. Beats his inside edge but it is slipping down leg

huge wicket. Buttler is gone. And now KKR can look for the big margin. Legcutter, bowled fast, Buttler gets the length to pull but this one skids on hurries him into the shot. He has found deep midwicket to perfection
tossed up outside off, driven forward of deep cover for two more
slower in the air, outside off, pushed to cover
unlucky. Quick legcutter, Buttler looks for the drive, and the skiddy ball takes the edge through for four
fuller, into the pads, clipped away for one
short of a length, gets inside the line to pull this to the right of deep square leg for two. It is difficult to field in the dew because it is hard to predict how fast the ball is coming at you
picks his spot. Mid-off is up, and Buttler makes room to take this from outside leg and loft it over mid-off
full and straight, driven hard to cover. The wet ball skids fast. Morgan fumbles. They don't run off the misfield
short of a length, outside off, punched wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, wicket to wicket, pushed back to him
carrom ball, punched down to long-on for a single
carrom ball, he goes back to push this past point for a single
offbreak, short of a length, pushed between deep midwicket and deep square leg for two more
fuller, quicker, pushed to extra cover again
carrom ball, he sees it turn, punches it to cover
majestic. Buttler goes deep into the crease, and loft him like a seamer off a length. No turn there so he afford to do that. Clears long-on with ease
full and wide, trying to stay out of his reach, but Tewatia reaches it and goes over extra cover for a four. And so it begins to turn again
cut in front of square this time, but straight to extra cover
lands equidistant from three fielders converging on this. Tewatia looks for the upper-cut to this short ball, but he clears point, and it falls between third man and deep cover running towards it
short of a length again, Buttler looks to pull again, but this is not short enough and hits the pad for a leg-bye
short of a length, into the body, and even though Buttler is down the wicket, he plays the short-arm pull and beats deep square leg. Quick outfield does the rest
beats him on the inside edge with a length ball, hits his pad, but is headed slightly down leg
nails the big reverse-sweep, but can't beat cover-point
slower in the air, Tewatia looks for the turn, but this goes straight on to hit the inside half of the bat
carrom ball, takes the leading edge as he looks to work this to leg. It goes into the covers for one
on a length, on off, pushed to long-on for one
slow offbreak, pushed into the leg side for one
full, driven to deep cover
offbreak, punched to the left of Nagarkoti at cover-point, and they take a single as he has to put a dive in
legcutter, on a length, Buttler goes back to work this to leg for one
really quick, 106ks, nearly slides through. Gets the inside edge for one
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover this time
quick, on a length, no room. Pushed back to him
on a length, straight, worked to leg for one

and the third over does the trick. He might not have got Buttler but he has got another wicket. Short ball, at his body, no room. Parag tries to get inside the line to help it to leg, but he is late on it, and Karthik takes the catch
short of a length, on off, Parag is on his toes to defend with an open face
on a length, headed for top of off. Defended
on a length, into the pads, defended to midwicket
on a length, straight, he gets inside the line to work this to leg for one
and Buttler doesn't have a negative bone in his body. Dreamy as ever. This is short of a length, not too wide, and he has punched this through extra cover. All hands

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: wicket-maiden as he leaves one alone outside off. Looking to win it inside 14 overs one moment, leaving alone balls the next. The drunken pendulum keeps swinging

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: full, looking for swing, pushed wide of point, and it takes a full-length dive from the man. They don't even look for the single

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, top of off. Defended

Mavi into it. Get in, KKR. This is a huge wicket. McCullum said earlier the ball will move around. Tripathi said it seamed around early. And this one moves off the surface just enough to take the edge. This is on a length, Samson looks to drive on the up, and edges it through

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: full, outside off, but Samson has taken a backward step now. RR need to regroup. Pushes this to cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: on a length, straight, defended to mid-on

oh the adrenalin is flowing. Cummins gets his former captain. Again he nearly beats the inside edge of the shuffling Smith. The last time the inside edge saved him from a dead lbw. This time it drags the ball from outside off to top the of the leg stump
inside edge. Cummins look to get his former Test captain with a blueprint that most sides need. Beat his inside edge as he shuffles across. He just gets the inside edge
short of a length, into the body, Smith gets inside the line, tucks it square of short fine leg. There is a deep square leg in place, but this outfield is quick. And quickened further by the dew
on a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-on
full, middle and leg, clipped away to deep square leg for one

oh a flying Karthik spotted. Stokes gets a slot ball, goes for the bog drive, gets a think edge, Karthik is wrong-footed and has to dive to his left. He goes full-length, and the ball sticks in the left webbing. And he does well to bring the right hand around as his elbow hits the ground
short of a length, on the pads, worked to leg for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, FOUR runs
long_text: crunched away. Down the wicket, turns this length ball into a half-volley, and drives him through cover for four
full and straight, Stokes gets an inside edge into the leg side, and he has come back for a two that doesn't exist and has been made it with a dive. He is really high on adrenalin

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run
long_text: nearly a return catch. Stokes looks to go to leg, and this length ball sits in the surface and hits him high on the bat. Doesn't carry to the bowler
good bouncer. Stokes bails out after shaping up for the hook. Oh he has got this just too high. Called wide

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run
long_text: down the wicket, Mavi shortens the length, and he drives this into the wicket at the non-striker's end

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run
long_text: short of a length, wicket to wicket, Stokes has to abort his back lift and push this to mid-off

and what cricket. Every match should be played with an eye on NRR. Just big hits and wickets. Uthappa plays the pick-up shot again to a full ball, but this time he is dragging it from outside off, which means he needs more power. He hasn't imparted it, and he has found the man at deep backward square leg
short of a length, at him, punched wide of mid-off for one

this is ridiculous. Ramp to a length ball wide outside off, and he has had to use a flick of the wrist because it is wide and slightly short of the perfect length for the ramp. He manages to send it over fine leg for six
Stokes is not going to die wondering either. He makes room to go through covers, and gets a bottom edge on a skiddy length ball, and past short fine leg it goes
short of a length, at him, punched back to Cummins as there is no room available
big wide down the leg side, and a flying Karthik saves three byes by getting a hand to it
a cute little pick-up shot for a six first ball. Cummins bowls length, just slides down a little, and he uses all the pace of Cummins to flick him over long leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, SIX runs
long_text: and Morgan hits the third one for a six. Tyagi misses the yorker, puts this in the slot, and Morgan clears the front leg to loft him back over his head for a six

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, no run
long_text: another single turned down. If you turn down one on the fourth ball, you might as well do it off the fifth too. if you back yourself, back yourself all the way

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, no run
long_text: full, outside off, drilled hard to long-off. Turns down the single
low full toss. driven down to long-on for one
full and wide, out of his reach, Cummins drives, gets the edge, and Samson takes it. Not only is this a dot, Morgan is still off strike
misses the yorker by a foot, driven hard down the ground, between the two boundary riders. Gets a couple
on-pace, short of a length, not much room, but Morgan leans back to cut him between point and short third man for four more
too predictable with slower ones. What's more? It is in the slot. Morgan sits back, and lofts him over long-off for a high six
down the wicket, creates all the momentum into a slower ball and lofts him over long-on. His first fifty of this IPL
on-pace yorker, dug out for a single
I think Cummins has been watching Stokes has been bowling a lot of slower balls so he sits back and waits for this to arrive, and picks it from the slot to crash him over long-off
short of a length, no room, dabbed away for one
sharp bouncer to end his spell. Cummins ducks it
beats him for pace with a quick length ball, hits the pad, but this is headed down leg. This has hit him between the pad and thigh pad
nearly a yorker again, punched to mid-off, takes the single on, he is gone if Smith hits. He misses
quick length ball, Cummins gets more height than length on the slog, but there is no deep midwicket in place to take the catch

nearly a yorker, but Summins has punched this powerfully down the ground. And so quick is this wet outfield that it has gone almost all the way to the long-off fence. Stokes runs to his left from long-on, puts the dive in, and saves two runs
Cummins backs away, and Archer slips in a yorker just outside off
can't protect the over. Short of a length, slower ball, on off, and he waits for it to finally make connection with cut. Beats the man inside the circle, and also deep cover
quick length ball, following him, hits the thigh pad. Just the leg-bye

shuffles across, Stokes bowls a slower ball to do him in, Morgan pushes this to his left, but Superman Stokes not only catches up with it, he throws off-balance to catch Morgan short. Just not able to hit it direct
on-pace short ball, out of his reach, beats the cut again. Three dots
slower bouncer, just outside off, beats his upper-cut
slower ball, nearly a yorker, surprises him. Dot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, 1 leg bye
long_text: again hits the heel of Morgan. Superb comeback after those two sixes. Just the leg-bye

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, no run
long_text: yorker, outside leg, draws a dot by hitting his heel
now gets closer to the yorker mark, dug out to deep cover for one

big grunt from Russell as he has found deep cover to perfection. Tyagi misses the wide yorker by a foot or so, which means Russell sees a six over cover, but ends up hitting this straight to the man. He is really upset with himself

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: No. 2. Full, in the slot, just a touch wide, and Russell clears the front leg again and hits over long-off. Doesn't get all of it, but enough of it

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: that is No. 1 for this over. On a length, on-pace, in the slot, and he cleared the front leg and hit it flat over long-on
short, quick, 147ks, chest-high, and beats Morgan on the upper-cut
slower ball, cramps him up with this length ball. Dot ball
short of a length, outside off, fended down past point for one
Russell has arrived. Short ball, doesn't get too big, and he clears the front leg to pull this for a flat six over forward square leg
nearly a wicket. Short of a length, gets big at him, takes the outside edge and goes wide of the keeper
starts off with a slower ball, on a length, on off. Defended

and just like that KKR are right back into the game. Twice in this match, Smith has let them back in by bowling Gopal. Short again, skidding nicely onto the bat, and he has pulled this over wide long-on
in the slot, and Morgan won't need second invitations. Over long-off he goes. RR have six bowlers. Did they need to continue bowling Gopal?
short, wide again, and he cuts him over extra cover, and deliberately so. Gopal is not having a great night out
that is dew for you. Slider, outside off, and he has mistimed this straight back, and it keeps sliding on. No signs of slowing down at all, and beats long-off
skips down the wicket and makes room too, Gopal follows him, draws an inside edge for one
big wind-up, Gopal stays short of his swinging arc. And is straight too. Defended back to him
slider, quick, just outside off, opens the face to short third man
big wind-up, Tewatia stays away from the swinging arc, so he dabs on it for a single past slip
quick slider, hits him high on the bat as he defends

the big wicket. Karthik plays for the turn, Tewatia has bowled a straighter one, and the inside edge goes to short midwicket. This is when you pay for those monstrous edges. This is an inside edge, and he is just pushing at it, but it has carried all the way to short midwicket
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
nearly back-to-back wickets. Breaks a 14-ball boundary drought with the sweep, but he hasn't nailed this sweep. Parag charges to his left from deep midwicket, but can't reach it
nice catch by Uthappa, running to his left from long-on and taking this high by his head and while still running. Tripathi looks to pull this skiddy delivery, and gets a sort of top edge
falls just short of short third man. Morgan looks to punch this over extra cover, but gets a healthy edge. Aaron thinks it is carrying to him, but it dies in front and beats his dive
sides one out of the front of the hand. Too wide outside off
wrong'un, outside off, pulled wide of long-on for two
short of a length, skidding through, hurries him into the pull. Just the single to long-on
slider, quick, skids through, takes the inside edge, just misses the leg stump
reverse-sweep again, but straight to short third man. Just the single
slow, full, straight, just a single to long-on
down the wicket, Tewatia slows it down again, and Morgan is hit on the cue end. Dot
flatter slider, punched to deep midwicket for one
sees him come down, slows it down, slips it wide, draws a defensive shot
you could predict the reverse-sweep coming from a mile. He gets past short third, but can't beat the chase of deep point, who must be there just for this shot
slider, on a length, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, pushes with an open face, but straight to point
Morgan is not going to die wondering. Skips down the wicket, and punches this shortish ball past extra cover for two

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, SIX runs
long_text: bouncer, looking to follow him as he backs away, but Morgan manages to get inside the line and pull this fine for a six over fine leg. All that pace can be your enemy if you slide down leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Morgan, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, he opens the face, but can't beat Tewatia at point
length ball, outside off, driven to the right of deep cover, but they won't take Miller on for the second
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, single to deep cover

Narine tries to hit a six second ball. He clears the front leg to try to go over long-on, and skies this slider for Stokes to take at wide long-on. Not a bad move, not bad intent, but the result is a two-ball duck
full, middle and off, no turn. Pushed to cover
would have been a wide had Tripathi not cut this straight to deep cover

top edge on the slog sweep, and Buttler is under it. You can start walking. This is a length ball, pretty straight, and hasn't turned. Still Gill doesn't get all of the slog sweep, and deep midwicket does the rest
short again, pulled this time, just the single to wide long-on
short, wide, cut in the air, just past point, and deep cover can't get to it
full and straight, just the single to long-on. The first non-Archer over to not concede a boundary

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Tripathi, no run
long_text: bouncer, just 129ks, might have been the slower one, and beats Tripathi's attempt to upper-cut him
short of a length, outside off, punched to the sweeper. Buttler is doing an excellent job there. Last ball to his left, this time to his right. Only singles
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point for one
short of a length, outside off, dabbed in front of backward point for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gill, no run
long_text: lovely quick outswinger from wide on the crease. Beaten neck and crop
short of a length, on off, punched nicely to extra cover
down the wicket, gets under a length ball, extends his arms through it, and clears long-on with ease. Terrific intent from KKR
slider, wide down the leg side
slow wide legbreak, Tripathi beaten on the sweep, Samson breaks the wicket. The replays show the back foot is grounded
on a length, into the pads, worked to leg for one
superb shot, even better fielding. Tripathi down the wicket to drill this wide of long-off, but Stokes rushes to his left, puts the dive in, and keeps them down to just one
full, on off, driven back to him
slower ball, but it swings down leg too far, and the fine leg is up. Clipped away for an easy boundary. The inswinging knuckle ball
down the wicket and backing away, Aaron follows him big time, and still hits his heel
on a length, driven on the up, single to mid-off
slower ball, down the leg side, concedes a leg-bye
top shot. Makes room early, Aaron follows him with a short-of-a-length ball, and he punches this from outside leg to place this between cover and cover-point
slower ball, 117ks, cuts back in, hits the inside half of the bat on the bi drive. They will sneak in the single
just clears deep backward square leg. Not in control of this hook at all, Tewatia settles himself under the top edge, but he is not tall enough for this
into the body, worked away to deep square leg for one
slower ball, Tripathi way early into the cover-drive, gets an inside edge to mid-on for one
slower ball, on a length, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, into the body, punched forward of deep backward square leg for two
wide length ball, pushed to short cover
that sweep earlier sent the deep midwicket to deep square leg, and Gopal proceeds to bowl short, and Tripathi pulls this to deep midwicket for four
wrong'un, he goes back to punch it, but can't beat cover-point
swept away first ball. On a length, outside off, and Tripathi gets stuck into him and goes over square leg. This is proving to be a costly decision to bowl Gopal in the Powerplay
flighted outside off, pushed to mid-off for one

too short, and Gill goes back to pull this, and he has out this in the gape between long-on and deep midwicket. Stokes puts in a full-length dive to his right, gets a hand to it, but the ball keeps rolling on. The outfield is quick
just clears mid-off. A languid like off-drive in the air, and he has just cleared Archer there

they have done well to get out of this over unscathed. There might be a bruise or two under the pads, but no wicket lost. Archer is quick and short of a length again, and this time Tripathi defends it
in the batsman's half this time, pushed wide of mid-on for a single
short of a length, rising, 148ks, fended to point, who is in tight

again he hits his body even before he can react. This is at 145ks, and is following him after pitching short of a length. He gets the leg-bye this time. Non-striker's is a better place to watch Archer from
quick, short of a length, 147ks, hits his thigh pad even before he can react
short ball, at his body, and Tripathi ducks it. Not even one for the over
this is exciting cricket. No one holding back punches. Aaron goes for a bouncer, Gill goes for the hook. In front of square he goes. Four more
lovely shot. On-pace, on a length, at his wicket, and he plays the pick-up over midwicket. Joy to watch
slower ball, 120ks, on a length, wide outside off, beats his expansive drive
short of a length, into the ribs, a languid short-arm pull, and this outfield is electric. Beats long leg even though he doesn't have too far to go to his left
sweet timing to a length ball outside off, but hit too sweetly to take a single to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover-point
bouncer, not too high, he ducks it. Slightly down leg, but not called wide
backs away to try to cut, Archer stays short of a length, and beats him with the pace and the bounce
cuts him in half. This is short of a length, and nips back in, and beats the inside edge. Over the stumps its goes
full and quick, defended back to him

golden duck for Rana. Oh hang on. He has reviewed with one second to go. That is strange. This is not an lbw decision, but a catch at the wicket. It shouldn't take you 14 seconds to make up your mind on these. Archer has dug this in short, gets it chest high, and the Snicko shows there is a scratch as this goes past his fend. Rana, and the review, both gone
and nearly a third. Leading edge first ball, but the third man is back and square, which means the point is in front of square. And this flies through backward point
misfield at cover and that is it for both teams this season. Full and just outside off, driven hurredly into the covers and it's past the dive
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
tossed up at leg stump, swept along the ground to deep square
good length on leg stump, glanced to deep square off the back foot
lobbed up at middle stump, leans in and flicks to long-on's right
yorker length at off stump, pushes it out to extra cover
slower short ball outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length outside off. Swishes inside the line of that on the front foot and is beaten
spanked over midwicket. Nothing awkward about this. Short one again, but about stomach height. Presses deep into the crease and then springs out at this with a clean swipe
awkward fend flies over the keeper. Bounce rises sharply at a middle stump line. Looked like a top edge to me as he looked to withdraw from his attempted pull

short of a length and cutting into his body as he drops this into the leg side with soft hands. Took a walk for the most part of that run and was forced to hurry as Neesham threw at the non-striker's end
full and into off stump, makes room and mistimes the drive to mid-off
slapped to the extra cover boundary. Slower ball at a length, wide outisde off. Steps out, makes room and reaches out to flat-bat that
full and into leg stump, punched to long-on's left
full and into middle stump. Flicked to midwicket
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Under-edged cut into the covers
low full toss swung in at off stump, punched to long-off's left
short of a length and into leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad, FOUR runs
long_text: a third consecutive fifty for Gaikwad. Brought up with another flowing lofted drive over extra cover. Nicely to the pitch of this on the front foot
googly at a length on leg stump, pushed through square leg with soft hands
good length on off stump, nudged into the covers off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad, FOUR runs
long_text: crunched over extra cover. Googly at a length outside off, steps out to that and lifts it cleanly after holding his shape
good length and sliding into the corridor. Opens the face and steers it towards short third man
googly at a length onto leg stump, nudged to deep square
sounds like that's a dropped catch. Short and wide outside off, steps out and is forced to cut because he's not to the pitch. And yes, there is an edge that pops out of Rahul's gloves
good length outside off, steps out and drills it to long-on's left
short of a length and sliding on outside off, cut straight to point
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
short and just outside off, cut on the bounce to backward point's left. Does well to get his body behind that

punches it late and beats both backward point running backwards and sweeper running to the left. It's a short of a length ball outside off, he allows it on and opens the face very very late to place this
short outside off, pulled to deep square's left
good length and into leg stump, looks to drive on the up, gets it to long-on off the toe-end
good length and just outisde off, beaten on the jab towards third man
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot

legcutter at a length outside off. Waits on it and taps it into the vacant midwicket region. Pooran runs in and puts in a sharp throw at the non-striker's end that isn't collected. an extra run at extra cover
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to long-off
full on off stump, driven down to long-off
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
dropped short outside off, gets back and pulls it to long-on's right. Rayudu was down for a second run that Gaikwad was rejecting. But Jordan's throw has gone to the striker's end
googly ripping back in from a length outside off and beating the inside edge as he looks to whip this into the leg side off the back foot
full and just outside off, jammed into the covers
googly and turning into leg stump. Deep in the crease to nudge this through square leg
good length at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket
googly, short and into leg stump. Pulled to deep square

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, FOUR runs
long_text: googly and short of a length outside off, gets deep in the crease and slashes it firmly past point
googly, at a length and outside off. Swept to deep square's right
full outside off, mistimed drive down to long-on
googly, short of a length and down leg side. Beaten on the glance
slower ball, short of a length and just outside off. Late cut to short third man's right and Bishnoi dives to stop
full at off stump, looks to flick and gets if off the leading edge to sweeper's left
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to sweeper cover
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket's left
bouncer at a middle stump line. Shuffles for the pull but decides to let that go
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
slower ball, short of a length at leg stump. Patted through midwicket off the back foot

Rahul grabs it running to his left. Slower ball at a good length outside off. Jumps into the off side for the ramp. Ends up miscuing it and it floats to Rahul's left. He's held on and appears to have made a faux appeal with both hands outstretched. Can't tell without a wider shot if that is aimed at the third umpire, but there's a good chance it is
slower ball, short of a length on leg stump. Nudged to deep square off the back foot
slower short ball just outside off, pulled to deep square's right off the thick inside edge

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: full slower ball just outside off, shuffles and lofts it over the wide mid-off region
slower ball at a length outside off, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket's right
good length outside off, gets low and sweeps to deep midwicket's right

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, gets back and jabs it down the pitch

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and straightening outside off. Keeps low as he looks for the back foot punch. Beaten
googly, short and at middle stump. Punched to long-on
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, driven down to long-on with the angle

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length and spinning in outside oGets low and chips it to Mandeep's left at backward point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad, no run
long_text: Mandeep lunges forward to take it at backward point. They've sent it up with a soft signal out. It's a googly, gripping in the pitch at a good length outside off. He leans in for the square drive and ends up slicing it. Mandeep goes low to his left and forward. He seems to to have taken it cleanly but as soon as his hands make contact with the ground, it looks like they've split and the ball has hit the turf. Or so the umpire thinks. KL Rahul is protesting that with the on-field umpires, who simply tell him to get on with it. Shakes of the head from KXIP players

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full googly outside off, shuffles and sweeps to deep midwicket's right
good length and wide outside off, sliced to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length googly outside off, cut to backward point's right

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length googly outside off, beaten on the cut
short of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
length outside off, steps out and flicks to long-on's right
good length, a googly spinning onto leg stump from middle. Inside edge to short fine

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: catch taken down leg side and Faf review the decision right away. It's a googly at a length, spinning into him. He's playing the glance and it's off the thigh, it appears. Yes. It was a big deflection, so you can see why the umpire might have thought that was bat. A good take from Rahul.
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gaikwad, no run
long_text: good length and onto the pads, flicked to midwicket off the front foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 3 leg byes
long_text: good length and spinning down leg side. Tickled fine off the back foot. Shami chases it and flicks the ball back in with his heel. Stepped right onto the ball there and there are at least a few coaches and possibly the Indian captain questioning his decision to do that before a big tour. In the end, it's all safe and he's done no damage

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length googly, into middle stump. Squeezed into the extra cover region off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: big lbw appeal is turned down. A slider at a length, onto leg stump. Can't get the flick away. Probably sliding down leg. Yes it is.

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: and now lofted casually over mid-off! Good length outside off, does grip into the pitch somewhat, but he reaches out and lofts it on the rise to make sweet contact

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: neatly done. Length ball pushed through outside off, gets a nice stride out and opens the face to drive this to mid-off's left
full and in at middle stump, check-drive to mid-on
low full toss outside off, punched to mid-on
full and just outside off, shuffles and flicks to midwicket's right

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: bounces past mid-off's dive. Low full toss outside off. Gets his drive off the toe-end. It lobs past the bowler, and bounces over the fielder's dive to the right
good length and just outside off, dropped into the point region with soft hands
oh pristine. Full ball outside off, gets neatly into this with a half stride and then leans onto the front leg as he opens the face to punch between cover and extra
thick inside edge to midwicket. Sets up outside off again, it's a full toss again, but he miscues the slog

swung away over square leg. A bit predictable here from CSK and Ngidi. He's already camping well outside off for that line. Ngidi misses on his full slower ball. It hits up at knee height for him and he sends it far back

beaten on the slog. Full dipping slower ball outside off, looks to go leg side and that's past him. They run through. Dhoni misses the stumps with his throw. Ngidi picks it up and flicks onto the stumps at the other end, but third umpire confirms Jordan was in
full slower ball outside off, driven to sweeper's right and can't pinch the second
carved to long-off's left. Full and just outside off. Shuffled a long way and waited for it outside off and then opened the face to pick his spot with the drive
length and wide outside off, lofted out towards sweeper cover
full slower ball, wide outside off. Reaches out and drives to sweeper's right
slower short ball just outside off, inside on the pull, onto boot and it rolls back to the bowler
length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket's right off the back foot

slower short ball at middle stump, has to adjust and get this pull to short fine's left. Can't beat him, but that is a very impressive fifty for Hooda in a must-win game. Been proactive and found ways to keep his scoring rate high as the others have struggled on this surface
steps out and carves it over extra cover. Full slower ball outside off, quickly to the pitch of it with his feet down leg side to create room. Funds his spot to perfection
slower ball at a length on leg stump, nudges it into vacant midwicket and shouts immediately for the two that they've managed comfortably
full dipping slower ball outside off. One-handed poke out to long-off
slower ball, short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
length ball outside off, shuffles and opens the face to run this to deep point's right

drilled over extra cover this time! In the slot and wide outside off. He shuffles to get in line of that and once again a beautiful extension of the arms to transfer his weight through this lofted drive. Picturesque from Hooda

a review for catch behind fueled entirely by the bowler's enthusiasm. It's a yorker past the tramline. Hooda looks to chop at that. He's definitely hit the ground as he attempts it. The bat face is open and there is a shadow on the bat as the ball goes past it, says the umpire. Sharp observation, that. And then he uses the angle from behind the keeper to confirm that there is gap between bat and all
sliced over the point boundary. Full and wide outside off. Reaches out and deliberately opens the face to get it well fine of the sweeper fielder

a diving catch to the right by Gaikwad! At deep midwicket. This pitch could be Ngidi's BFF, the way he's understood it today. Around the wicket, dug into the pitch short of a good length outside off. Neesham shapes for his favoured swipe over midwicket, but the slow pace on that makes him get a lot more elevation than he's like. Then, Gaikwad tracks it brilliantly with a sprint to his right and lunges with perfect timing to take that and then hold on
length at middle stump, shuffles and nudges it into midwicket with soft hands
short of a length slider with a low arm action. Outside off. Gets back and clips to deep square
good length and into the pads, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
good length on leg stump, pushed towards long-on from the crease
slides onto off stump. Short of a length and coming on with the arm. He's deep in the crease trying to whip across the line but that keeps low and is under the angled bat
full and into leg stump, clipped through midwicket with soft hands
good length at middle stump, shuffles and stabs it into vacant midwicket

crunched over extra cover! What a shot that is. A function of Hooda's reach, for the most part, and then the extension of the arms. It's a floaty legbreak outside off and he gets on his knee and swings cleanly from under that
good length on leg stump, nudged through midwicket with soft hands
just short of long-on. Low full toss outside off, wants to whip that wide of mid-on but picks him out
good length and sliding onto off stump. Pushed towards deep midwicket with soft hands
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length at middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket's right. Gaikwad fumbles and they come back for the second on the long throw
short and into leg stump. Hurried pull off the inside edge to deep backward square's right
good length at middle stump, reverse sweep to short third's right and a sliding stop from Ngdi
good length and into the pads as he leans in for the flick. Deflects into the off side
full and into leg stump, leans in and flicks through square leg
beats deep square's dive to the right. Another slower ball dug in too short. Gets big on him but he gets on his toes and swipes handsomely to that fielder's right
good length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
slower ball at a length just outside off, dropped pitch side on the off side. Backward point is too quick for them to steal a single
slower length ball outside off. Shapes to drive that but it sticks and he's forced to adjust and tap that down to long-on
good length and just outside off, steered down to third man

nicely placed between fine leg and deep square. First boundary since the powerplay. Slower ball, short of a length outside off. Waited on that as he shifted his weight back and rolled the wrists to get this pull into the ground
length and just outside off, stabbed to short third man's right and a misfield allows them the second
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length at the stumps, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
good length outside off, leans into that and flicks to deep midwicket

that looks plumb on first viewing. Gayle reviews this lbw, hoping it's spinning past leg stump. He's down for a sweep and struck on the knee roll, right in front of middle stump. It's definitely pitched in line. Ultra Edge confirms no bat on it. And before ball tracking is even ready, Gayle has seen enough and is walking towards the dugout because that is dead in front. Pitching in line, hitting middle stump. Three reds. Tahir is pointing happily to someone in the dugout. Snuck past the sweep and now the squeeze is well and truly on
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
good length, gripping and turning away from off stump. Gets forward to defend, thick inside edge through square leg
good length and sliding on outside off. Pushed into the covers off the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
inside edge is taken behind! Short of a length and rising at middle stump. Clears the front leg and looks for the big pull. A thin edge as he gets cramped a touch
short at leg stump, pulled to deep square
full and just outside off, lifted to deep extra cover's left
full and just outside off, looks to drive firmly into the leg side. Gets it off the thick inside edge to long-on
good length and just outside off, pushed to extra cover's left off the front foot
full on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket's right
googly at a length outside off, driven to long-off
good length outside off, leans in and pats it back to the bowler
slider at a length outside off, tapped back to the bowler
googly at a length on off stump, defended into the covers
full and just outside off, punched back down the pitch
slower short ball outside off, beaten on the cut
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover's right. His dive only helps him parry that towards mid-off

dips under his sweep and bowls him! Beautiful bowling from Ngidi. A full slower ball at off stump and once again he's deceived him. He's looking to shovel that past short fine as it loops at him and tonks off stump
beaten on the outside edge. Short of a length slower ball dug into the pitch. Wants to lift that over mid-off but it grips and gets big on him
good length and wide outside off, thick inside edge past the stumps as he looks to drive on the up through cover
short of a length and just outside off, cut straight to backward point
good  length and just outside off, leans into the drive to long-off
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
full on middle stump, miscued slog sweep rolls out to deep midwicket
good length and gripping wide outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
full and onto the pads, flicked to deep square
inswinging yorker at middle stump, gets the front leg out and squeezes it past the non-striker
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
full and at the stumps. Backs away to open up the off side but can only jab this to extra cover
good length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
short and just outside off, chopped down to third man
good length and on the pads, flicked to midwicket
slower ball, short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone. It cuts back in to stay inside the tramline
full and just outside off, leans into that and drives to sweeper's right. Tahir slides and has over-done it. Has to reach out behind himself to try and grab it last-ditch, but he can't manage that
short of a length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
good length and angled across outside off. Left alone

inside edge onto middle stump! Ngidi rolls the fingers on that and gets him. Short of a length and in the corridor. He's leaning back to try and play the pull shot, but is dragging from too wide outside off on a slow pitch

driven to the wide long-off boundary. Good length and just outside off, gets a stride out and lofts it on the rise. Making full use of the fielding restrictions today. It's a slow-ish surface and grounded boundaries might not be as easy to get
slower short ball just outside off, cut straight to backward point
beaten on the pull. Short and outside off. Was looking to lift that over midwicket
slower short ball, into off stump. Patted into the covers off the back foot
good length on middle stump, nudged to mid-on

slashed over short third. Didn't make an effort to keep his shape there. And it's not exactly a risky option given the field. Third man is in. Slower short of a length ball outside off, chucks his hands at that and gets four
pick-up shot to the long leg boundary. Full and into the pads. Deep square is pretty straight and he closes the face to get this well fine of him

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: whipped wide of mid-on. Such good wrists. It's a length ball that's sticking in the pitch at a leg stump line. He gets well in front of that pad and lifts it from under as it climbs up on him
short of a length and into leg stump, flicked out to deep square

short_text: Sam Curran to Rahul, no run
long_text: short ball at an off stump line. Walks down at that and is forced to leave it
short of a length and into the stumps. Stabbed into the covers

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed over point. Good length and wide outside off. Gets the front foot stride out and reaches with an open face to lift that over the infield
good length and into off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
inside edge to short fine as he walks down and looks for the straight loft. Through his shot early. It's a full ball outside off
full knuckle ball at leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
full outside off, driven on the up to deep point
chopped over the third man boundary. Just strays a bit wide this time, and Rahul chops deliberately aerial as third man is in. Marginally short and wide outside off from Chahar
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
good length and just outside off, punched off the back foot to extra cover
slower ball at a length outside off, steered to backward point's right off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, onto the back foot, front leg in the air as he whips to deep square's left

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, no run
long_text: full and wide outside off, reaches out to drive that on the rise. It comes off the toe-end and trickles out to extra cover
full and swung into off stump, opens the face and runs this to backward point's right
full inswinger at middle stump. Check-punches to mid-off's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, no run
long_text: slower length ball just outside off, defended to backward point
good length and swung away outside off, driven on the up to cover
good length and just outside off, punched sweetly on the up to deep point's right
full and down leg side, leans into that and whips this off the shin to deep backward square's right
just short of midwicket. Good length at middle stump, closes the face early on the flick
just over mid-on. Good length outswinger just outside off. Comes on slowly off the pitch and Mayank waits on that, closes the face and lifts it on the rise to Rayudu's left
good length outswinger, just outside off. Leans in and pushes to deep point off the front foot
and Holder finishes it off with an incredible six. Short of a length, straight, and he nonchalantly uses his ling arms to punch this straight down the ground for a flat six
full, straight and quick, driven down to long-on for one
wide length ball, Sharma looks to draw level in one shot, but gets too much under it and holes out to long-off

pace on the ball. It is your biggest enemy today. Saini just keeps giving them pace on the ball. Yes it is a top edge on the pull, but these are small boundaries. There is premium to be had on slower balls. It is gripping in the surface. And you keep giving them pace
full and fast, wide down the leg side. Called a wide. They get a bye too
pace on, pace on. Yorker down leg, and he cue-ends it fine of fine leg

Saini keeps giving them the pace to use. And Holder keeps showing why he loves batting. And if you have followed him in international cricket, you know you don't bounce Holder. He has pulled another six. This one over square leg

appeal for lbw first ball, and this looks good and straight, but it has hit Holder on the top of the pad. For a tall man, this might be sailing over. But RCB have reviewed the not-out decision. And there seems to be a scratch anyway as the ball passes the bat. So no need to even check the height. RCB lose the review because of the faint inside edge
quicker, fuller, punched down to long-off for one
slower ball, he edges it as he looks to run this down, but it is slow that it bounces twice before reaching the keeper
oh that shot is something. Nerves, what nerves? He gets pace on the ball, and this attempted bouncer is only waist high for the tall Holder. He pulls this over wide long-on for a six
too full, driven forward of deep cover for two
short of a length, quick, skiddy, he gets a bottom edge on the dab

and what a bowling change it has proved to be. Williamson has chipped one straight to short extra cover. Slower offcutter, on a length, and he ends up pushing at this well in front of his body. Easy catch to Kohli at extra cover. A soft dismissal. if you are not looking for a boundary, shots with hard hands are a soft dismissal on this pitch
full, just outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, straight, pushed to deep backward square for one
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, down the leg side, turned around the corner for one
hard push at a length ball, ends up hitting this in the air, but above cover
he starts off with a short ball, but it comes slow off the surface, and he pulls this along the ground to deep square leg

beaten in the flight. It takes a lot to do that with a wet ball. Chahal manages to do that. Saha skips down the wicket to try to go over extra cover again, but the ball drops on him to fall short of where he is expecting it to. And then it rips past his bat to give de Villiers a regulation stumping
on a length, no turn, Williamson uses soft hands to dab down on it. Single to point
does him in the air as Saha looks for the extra cover, and he ends up chipping this full ball towards long-off for one
slow through the air, full, on the toes, driven down to long-on for one
looks for the paddle sweep but can't place it fine of short fine
lovely shot. Right down to the pitch of the ball, opening up the front leg, and drilling this over midwicket for four

that bouncer is too high. Oh not called again. Williamson drops his wrists and sways out of its line. Even if not higher than the head, technically this is the second shoulder-high ball of the over after that beamer
slower bouncer, outside off, and squeezes under Williamson's attempted pull
grips this drier ball better. Nearly a yorker outside off. Steered to third man for one

slower ball gone wrong. High full toss down the leg side. Williamson has pulled this straight to fine leg. And they have got away with a blatant no-ball. This is chest-high, and not called a no-ball. Very lucky there, RCB. Williamson is not happy. He just stands and shakes his head quietly. Nearly shoulder high it was. In Kohli's world, Williamson would be reviewing this successfully and availing of a free hit for Saha
on a length, quick, pushed to mid-off for one
slips out as a full toss outside off, and he drives it through cover and forward of deep cover for four
on a length, into the pads, worked to leg for one
slow, high, down leg. Saha gets bat on the paddle sweep, but he has hit this straight to short fine
flat, quick, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
slow in the air, full, on the pads, nudged wide of midwicket for one
driven between Williamson's legs for a single

Chahal is claiming a run-out here. Saha down the wicket to drive this straight, Chahal dives to his right, and claims to have got a finger on it, and the ball hits the stumps at the non-striker's. It has taken us a hundred replays to establish that it hasn't hit his finger. Rather, in the words of the third umpire, there is no conclusive evidence he touched it. Ruled not-out. And I think Williamson was back anyway. Animated discussion between Kohli and the on-field umpire
on a length, on-pace, 131ks, on top of off. Defended to short cover
bouncer, on-pace, 130ks, well outside off, and he ducks it
slower legcutter outside off, Williamson ends up pushing inside the line
length ball, into the pads, 129ks, clipped to deep square leg for one
on-pace, into the pads, and he glances this fine of fine leg for two
starts off with a slower ball, Williamson uses soft hands to drop it at his feet and sneak in a single
short of a length, and turn again as Saha looks to pull to let. Gets an inside edge to short fine leg
turn and bounce outside off, and he runs this to short third man

Chahal shows he is good enough even with the wet ball. Pandey has been impatient all over, looking to take him down early. He looks to clear long-on as this is flighted invitingly again, and it dips and turns to take a massive edge for Morris to run in from long-on and catch
looks for the big drive as he flights this, and still gets some dip to beat him in the air. Hit back to him
on a length, on off, punched down to long-off for one
slow in the air, Pandey has to check his attempted off-drive, and plays this to deep cover for one
slower ball, middle and off, pushed to mid-on
pace on ball, head high, and Saha hooks this sweetly into the roof behind long leg. Oh Saha, what timing. Even Kohli looks at it in awe
short of a length, quick, rising, and beats him as he looks to run this fine to third man
bouncer, too high, but Saha goes for the hook. Would have been a wide had he not pulled this in front of square for a couple
length ball, mid-on up, and Saha picks his spot. Not the cleanest hit, but manages to clear mid-on
on a length, on off, driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
full, on-pace, down the leg side. Pandey gets an inside edge on this for four, but this one deserved to go anyway
short of a length, no room, dabs on this for a single
another big wide down the leg side. He is lucky they have not got any bat on these wides

short of a length, quick, good bounce, and he is unable to get power into a punch. But they will accept two gifted overthrows from cover. They are rattled here. Wild throws and poor backing up from the man in the deep on the leg side
big wide down the leg side. Saha will feel he has missed out
short of a length, into the rib, looks to tickle it fine, but gets a glove to AB on the bounce. And they steal a single even though the fumble has gone only about two feet away from AB
short of a length, straight, punched down to mid-on
wide down the leg side
a slower ball to start off with, but Pandey checks his shot and flicks this over midwicket. He has picked the spot well here. The deep fielder is square
quicker, fuller, driven down to long-on for one
quick, on a length, pushed to short straight midwicket
on a length, straight, turned around the corner for one
I asked this question earlier because I know Saha sweeps very well. It doesn't matter this is bowled at 100ks, but he gets on a knee and helps this over square leg for four
on a length, outside off, punched to cover

nice shot. On a length, outside off, push-driven past cover for three. Kohli receives the throw at the non-striker's and lets it rip to the keeper. Showing his frustration that they are allowed to take three here
short of a length, 140ks, lands on the seam and holds its line outside off. Beats his outside edge
full, quick and skiddy at 142ks. Pandey looks for the big drive again, but gets an inside edge onto the pad
short, on-pace, 144ks, skiddy, and with dew on, this is not a good ball on these short boundaries. Pulled over square leg for six
a swipe across a length ball, bowled at 137s, and it beats him and goes over the leg stump by about a foot
that is like running around a ball and turning it into a forehand and hitting up the line. This is short of a length, into his body, and he punches this straight of mid-on for four
on a length, 140ks, punched on the up, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, straight, punched down to long-on for one
sharp turn, quick, played uppishly to square leg
back to his length, just outside off, staying low. Pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, extra bounce. Left alone

Warner looks to dominate him after the first-ball six, but chooses the wrong length now. Sundar is a little fuller than the last ball, Warner is looking to clear midwicket but ends up going straight to mid-on
a rare poor start from Sundar. A short ball, and the new ball skids on nicely for a pull over midwicket for six
short of a length, wide, punched away square, and Philippe has to dive full length to his left at cover-point to save four runs here
short of a length, wicket to wicket, but Warner makes room to push this past point for one
wide length ball, Warner shapes up for the big drive, but then lets it go
on a length, straight, worked to leg for one
pushes at a quick length ball, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
short of a length, just outside off, short-arm pull to deep square leg for one
short, wide, too wide
looks for the reverse-sweep/ramp. Natarajan stays full and straight. Just the one leg-bye
full and straight, driven to extra cover for one. A bit of a helicopter again
yorker outside off, dug out to deep point. Can't keep turning down singles forever
looks to ramp, Natarajan fires one in full and quick. He gets an inside edge to short fine but turns down the single
another big slower offcutter, and Mann is really early into the shot. Beaten again. Mustafizur-like cutters here
slower offcutter, Siraj is beaten as he swings at it, and they steal the bye. Saha's throw bounces over the wicket
on pace, full, into the pads, a bit of a helicopter to long-on for one
slower short ball, tries to hit it hard, but gets a single to deep midwicket
slower ball again, on a length, Udana looks to go over cover, but toe-ends a skier for extra cover to take running back
in the slot but a slower ball, and he nearly holes out to deep cover. Just falls short of the man
full toss, Morris goes for the six over long-on, the bottom hand comes off, he gets no timing, and Warner takes the easy catch at long-on

nearly a yorker, Morris does well to drive this hard towards deep cover. it is dying on the sweeper, but Abhishek Sharma attacks the ball, and even though he doesn't get to it on the full, he makes sure he gets some part of his body behind it
lovely yorker, well inside the wide line, squeezes under his bat
wide yorker, ruled inside the wide line by the umpire. I thought it was slightly too wide, especially because Mann hadn't moved across

nearly a sensational catch by Sharma. Mann looks to ramp this, Natarajan goes across him, he gets a top edge, and Sandeep chases this back from short third man. Somehow manages to get a hand to it but these are so difficult to take over your shoulder
slower ball, on a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, quick, flicked nicely, but straight to midwicket

and he has taken that threat out. Slower ball, on a length, sundar early into it, hits it in the air back towards Natarajan, and he is lucky that it hits the wrist and deflects into his lap. These two have faced off against each other many a time in TNPL
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to deep point for one
another yorker. Nails it. He cue-ends it for another single
yorker, on off, dug out to backward point for one
slower ball, in the slot, and he flicks this is in the air towards long leg. Rashid, the fielder, has lost this in the lights, but goes back to make sure he prevents the boundary
full toss, outside off, punched down the ground
slower ball, full and wide, too wide
yorker, on off, dug out for one to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sundar, no run
long_text: Pandey nearly takes a stunner. They go upstairs. The soft signal is not out. This is short of a length, and has been punched wide of extra cover, but Pandey dives full length to get a hand on it. He never is in control of the ball and grasses it. And his reaction suggested the same, but they still went upstairs. Not sure why we needed to do that

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sundar, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. All hands and wrists to create the timing and power to clear extra cover. Just a touch too full, and he goes up and over extra

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sundar, no run
long_text: wrong'un, dipping, quick, takes the outside edge straight to pint, who is in tight on the single
quick full legbreak, and Mann goes back to it. He is a sitting duck, but miraculously gets an outside edge to survive this ball

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gurkeerat, no run
long_text: wrong'un, and Mann has not picked this at all. Beaten on the pull, but this is headed down leg
legbreak, sits up, punched uppishly down the ground
wide on the crease, pinpoint yorker on off. Dug out for a single. Good comeback after that first-ball four
full, slower ball, 124ks, pushed to short cover
on a length, in the slow, on-pace, but Mann nearly holes out. Bounces in front of deep square leg
looks for the yorker, gives him a low full toss, which he flicks straight to short midwicket
short of a length, slower, straighter, and is run down to third man for one
gets the width and cashes in. Sundar is an intelligent player, and he deliberately cuts this short ball over point. Gets four for it
yorker, middle and leg, 137ks, dug out to short midwicket
yorker, slides down, Sundar tickles this fine, but the fine leg is fine, which is where it should be when you are looking to bowl yorkers
slower ball, wide length ball, driven on the up to deep point
slower offcutter, grips from short of a length, and beats his push outside off
short of a length, on-pace, no room, pushed back to him
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
drives a full ball down to long-on for another single
flighted, around off, driven to long-off for one
length ball, pretty straight, worked to leg for one
flighted outside off, Sundar pushes at it, gets an outside edge. And it goes fine of short third man
on a length, slow off the surface, worked to leg for one
on a length, slow in the air, pushed wide of long-on but can't come back for the second

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gurkeerat, no run
long_text: wrong'un, slow in the air, Mann picks it off the surface and dabs down on it for a dot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gurkeerat, no run
long_text: slow legbreak, really full, pushed to short cover
now he will be happy. He has his man. Caught at deep midwicket. Short of a length, slow off the surface, and Philippe gets no timing on this pull at all

short_text: Rashid Khan to Philippe, no run
long_text: slower legbreak, just outside off, and he beats Philippe again. Oh he is not happy with those wides. You can see it from his face
oh this one has done in even Saha. A wrong'un that starts on middle and leg, and beats Philippe comprehensively, but Saha has been blindsighted and can't catch up with it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Philippe, no run
long_text: another legbreak, this time on a length, and beats him outside off again

short_text: Rashid Khan to Philippe, no run
long_text: he makes room, Rashid bowls a wide legbreak. Beats him

oh this looks like a bullet as it leaves his bat but de Villiers has found deep point with precision. Relief for Nadeem as de Villiers looked like he was going to reprise his KKR heroics after Nadeem dropped him earlier. This is on a length, just outside off, and de Villiers leans back to time the pants off it. Just can't place this wide of the man
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
punched down to wide long-off
stays short of a length, and de Villiers pulls in the air again. Straight of deep midwicket. Gets a couple
that is a de Villiers special. A back-foot drive to a slow bowler and way way above long-on for six. As the phrase has gone around this year, Nadeem has been ABed this ball
flighted, no turn, cramps him up, hit to short cover
flighted legbreak, driven with an open face for a single

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: too short, and de Villiers gets his own back momentarily. Pulls this straight of deep midwicket for four
looks for the reverse-sweep, gets a bottom edge to short third man for one
flighted, wrong'un again, and he goes back to punch this to deep cover again
short of a length, legbreak, punched to deep midwicket for one
wrong'un first up, and he goes back to punch this square on the off side
slower in the air, and it turns and stops. Punched to wide long-off for one
short of a length, straight, he pulls this to deep square leg for one
nice shot. Makes room again, Nadeem follows him again, but he manages to get under this and lofts it straight of long-on for four
short of a length, de Villiers leans back to hit this hard but straight to deep cover
looks to make room, Nadeem follows him, and he drives it to deep cover for one
short of a length, really slow off the surface, pulled in front of deep square for two
quick length ball outside off, driven in front of deep cover for two
wrong'un, but down the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: Mind holding the bat still AB? Rashid can hit it then. Beats him with a legbreak again. Third time in a row. De Villiers pushes inside the line

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: another legbreak, slower in the air, slower off the surface. Beats him as he looks to open the face

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: looks to cut a length ball by going back in the crease, but is beaten by the legbreak

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: quick legbreak, takes the leading edge of de Villiers's bat to short cover. Bounces in front, though
wrong'un first up, Philippe picks it off the surface but does well to punch this down to wide long-on

he has out de Villiers down. Can you believe it? The match-up nearly works out as de Villiers punches this back at him and in the air. It is about knee high, and he has let it slip through. How much will this hurt SRH?
on a length, on off, turns away and sits up, punched uppishly down to long-off for one
manufactures this shot. This pitch will need some more of this manufacturing in the middle overs. Shuffles across, and deliberately lap-sweeps this in the air to clear short fine leg
slower, fuller, played uppishly to the right of Nadeem for one
Philippe moves across early, Nadeem goes short and wide, and it sits in the surface. Hit down to long-off for one
on a length, slight turn, de Villiers goes back to punch this to deep cover
full, nearly a yorker, dug out towards mid-on, but Natarajan dives to his right and fields it clean
Philippe looks to pull this from outside off, but the ball stays low to squeeze under his bat. Still well above the wicket
on a length, AB uses softer hands to push this towards mid-off for one
short of a length, AB gets some timing into this back-foot drive, but hits this straight to mid-off
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to straight extra cover
on a length, accurate, no room. Defended from the crease
on a length, wide outside off to counter his movement across. And then he leaps high to field this overhead in his follow-through
outside edge first ball, but no slip in place. Another outswinger when a batsman is expecting an inswinger

Sharma gets Kohli for the seventh time in the IPL. Again he follows inswinger after inswinger with an outswinger. On a length, outside off, slow off the surface, and Kohli fails to keep his drive down. Caught at short extra cover. Nobody has got Kohli out more often in the IPL. Sharma has gone past Nehra's six
