short of a length, wide, punched nicely through covers. Williamson's dive at extra cover gets a hand on it to save two runs
tries the outswinger this time, it stays low, and Philippe punches this down to long-on
Kohli gives him the charge, Sharma shortens the length, and he drives this to long-on for one
the second back-foot shot over mid-off from Philippe. Holder digs this in, and is wide of off, and Philippe is on his toes to flat-bat it over mid-off. Forehand down the line
short of a length, good bounce, Kohli runs this down straight to short third man, where a fumble gives them a single
yorker, down the leg side, but gets him on the toe. A leg-bye ensues
short of a length, Kohli looks to punch this through point but it is slow off the surface so he uses soft hands to drip this at his toes for one
length ball, into the pads, meat and drink for Kohli. Takes a couple past square leg
slower ball, Philippe early into the shot, but checks it and takes a single to cover
short of a length, looking to cramp him up, but slides too far down leg
short ball, gets it to rise higher than the chest. Kohli has to stand tall to make sure he fends it down

top of middle. On pace, swinging slightly, back in, but mostly wicket to wicket. Padikkal plays for the one swinging away from him and looks to loft him back over his head. This is cleverly bowled to make it swing back in. Beats him neck and crop
slower ball, full, driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, on-pace, pretty straight, he looks to pull this, but gets a front edge and manages to clear mid-off
knuckle ball, 114ks, and Philippe is well early into the shot. The lob back to him doesn't carry to Sharma
on a length, around off, swinging back in, he looks to hit it through covers, but gets a sort of a bottom edge to short third man
first boundary of the innings. Holder stays short of a length, and angles this across him, but this Padikkal just punches it down the ground and straight of mid-off
wide on the crease again, short of a length, angling away, punched straight to backward point
this one has pace and carry. Short of a length, pitches outside leg, Padikkal makes room to look to off side, and the extra bounce beats him
wide on the crease, short of a length, pulled to short midwicket. Gets no timing on this
short of a length, he moves across to access the leg side and punches this towards midwicket. Rashid puts in a dive there to keep them down to one
big outswinger, and Philippe leaves it along outside off
inswinger, on a length, clipped away to deep forward square leg for one
swings again, from a length, but Padikkal has the time to wait on it and open the face for a single
fuller, swinging away from around off, beats his defensive push
on a length, around off, opens the face on it. Can't get it past point. Early signs that the pitch is slow as they have time to play these length balls off the back foot
on a length, swinging in, worked to leg for one. Has taken this from outside off
he moves across early as he is used to doing, and then leaves alone a wide inswinger
finishes it with a six! A sweet, sweet pick-up over square leg! That's a length ball into the stumps from around the wicket. Times that perfectly and the pace on that has sent it a long way back
short of a length and into off stump. Inside edge on the attempted whip behind square leg
full and just outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
short and wide outside off, punched to long-off
full on off stump, driven to long-off
full on middle stump, whipped to deep square
full on middle stump, gets under this and smokes the slog sweep over the square leg boundary
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's right
length at middle stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
drilled past the non-striker. Length ball at middle stump, steps out to make the pitch of this and pumps it powerfully along the ground
good length and pushed through quick at middle stump. Uses the angle for the lap sweep. Dhawan sprints to retrieve to his left
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to sweeper's right
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
slower short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep square
length at off stump, defended to point
full and just outside off, backs away to make room and forces a drive this time. Miscues to sweeper's left and comes back for the second to bring up his fifty
lofted over sweeper cover. Length ball with a lot of width outside off. Just runs his hands through this, doesn't look to hit it hard. Uses the pace and clears the fielder
jabs it over the keeper. Short ball in the corridor. Rises up with it, allows it to get past him and times it perfectly with the bat facing upwards
short of a length in the corridor, too full for the pull. It trickles into midwicket
short of a length and into the body. Tucked to midwicket's left
full and just outside off, punched to mid-on's right

defended onto the stumps. Thinks of a left-footed volley as the ball bounces, but he would have taken the stumps with it because the ball bobbed onto the bail. No room for the punch, no room for the kick. A length ball that he was looking to drop pitch side with soft hands

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length wide outside off, punched on the rise to backward point
and another. Tossed up outside off, walks into the line of that and sweeps along the floor between long-on and deep midwicket
full and at middle and leg. Gets low and swings across the line to get this sweep to long-on's left
full on middle stump, flicked into the vacant midwicket region
good length and outside off, opens the face and steers into the off side
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full ball just outside off, dragged down to long-on
slow, dipping full toss outside off. Driven to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to point

short_text: Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower length ball at off stump, defended on the front foot

short_text: Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: yorker and wide outside off, jammed back towards the bowler
good length and into off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
whipped wide of short fine. Short of a length at leg stump. Lifts the front leg, gets his weight on the back foot and closes the face to loft this wide of that fielder
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right

short_text: Dubey to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: tossed up outside off, QDK gets low and at the ball before reverse sweeping it fine of short third
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length outside off, watchfully pushed to extra cover's left

lbw is given and reviewed. This looks like a full toss that's struck him outside off on the boot. He was looking for the reverse sweep. On closer inspection, it's not hit him on the full. Bounces before hitting him low on the pad. But also looks a googly .so that is missing the wickets. Overturned
stumping appeal as the googly rips past the outside edge. He was stepping down at this outside off. But has managed to stretch the back leg in

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: full outside off, driven to extra cover

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length, slow and dipping at off stump. Bat-pad on the forward defence
goes slingy action. Good length and keeping low at a leg stump line. Whipped to deep midwicket off the back
good length and sliding into leg stump. Punched down the pitch
tossed up on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, leans in and drives to long-on
short outside off, cut to third man's left
short and just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's right
slower ball at a length on leg stump, poked into the midwicket region off the back foot
short and just outside off, arches back for the cut and gets a thick outside edge fine of third man
slogged to the midwicket boundary. Good length and just outside off. Clears the front leg and nails the connection on it
short of a length at off, steps out and punches to deep backward point
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, poked into the leg side off the back foot
good length and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
short and just outside off, cut firmly to cover
short outside off, mistimed cut to sweeper cover
lands just inside at long-on. Short and rising in the corridor at 150.6kph. Similar to the last ball in some ways, but this time Kishan his through the angle with a lofted pull over mid-on
short and across off stump, looks to hammer that on the rise and is beaten
pulled to the wide long-on boundary. Good length and pushed across him. Quickly onto the back foot and an aerial pull. Nortje might have rolled the fingers on that too. It slides on nicely anyway
short of a length and just outside off, steered to third man off the back foot

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: oh nice. He's played a few elite straight drives this tournament, and this one goes straight into the collection. A good length ball just outside off. Stays upright, offers the full face and check-punches between partner and stumps. High elbow and all

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: full and outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off
good length and sliding onto leg stump. Mistimed pull to midwicket's right
length outside off, onto the back foot as he punches to long-off

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and hurried into his pads as he looks for the back foot punch

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: shapes for the slog sweep and then adjusts to gently chop it into the covers. Was down early to try and slog sweep this dipper outside off
good length and down leg side. Backs away and punches to long-on off the back foot
good length and into leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
short at middle stump, defended off the back foot

slower short ball at off stump, gets deep in the crease and pulls off the toe-end to mid-on's left. Harshal misfields with a slide onto his left thigh, and then has to recover and slide onto his right thigh to stop that rolling into the padding

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: short and across the corridor. Under-edge on the cut to point
good length on leg stump, glanced to square leg's left off the back foot

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, mistimed cut to cover

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: full inswinger in the corridor, jammed out to mid-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
good length and into leg stump. Watchful punch to mid-on
good length and onto leg stump, glanced to short fine off the back foot
good length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's right with the angle
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

slower short of a length ball into middle stump. Looks for the slog and gets an inside edge onto body. Takes a couple of steps down, tries to back into the crease as Bumrah swoops down on the ball. Hasn't stretched out quickly enough as Bumrah hits the stumps with an under-arm flick
slower length ball following him down leg side. He sets up for the slog and is beaten
low full toss outside off, offers the full face and punches to long-off's left
low full toss at off stump, inside edge to fine leg on the slog
short and climbing up at off stump, can't connect on the pull again
bouncer outside off, pulls under that and is beaten
full and into leg stump, miscued slog to long-on's left
yorker at leg stump, backs away and squeezes to deep extra cover
short of a length at middle stump, backs away for the pull and is beaten
gorgeous punch over the bowler! Beautiful from Rabada. It's a length ball just outside off and he holds his shape as he punches this on the rise, off the front foot
yorker at middle stump, jammed into the covers

taken by long-on running to his left! Krunal Pandya. Full ball outside off. Gets deep in the crease and lofts it straight over the bowler. Krunal seems to have over-run it to his left but just manages to get his hands in order. Almost looks like he ran chest-first into a floating ball. Takes a tumble and keeps the balance
short of a length outside off, cut to point
good length on leg stump, looks for the flick, cops it on the pad as he looks to glance
good length and following him down leg side. Steps out and taps it back to the bwoelr
full outside off, steps out and drives to extra cover
good length on middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep square
good length on off stump, defended to point off the front foot
full and wide outside off, swept along the floor to deep midwicket's left
good length outside off, steps out and wants to stab it through cover. Comes off the inside edge
googly at a length on off stump, drags it out to deep midwicket with a sweep
good length and lobbed wide outside off. Inside edge as he attempts the slog sweep
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
good length outside off, gets forward and laps this to long leg's right
good length at middle stump, punched to sweeper's right
hooked over fine leg. Short ball up at the front shoulder, swipes under that and gets it off the thick top edge
short of a length just outside off, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
pulled straight to deep square. Short of a length at middle stump, pulls aerially off the front foot and picks out Krunal Pandya who has only a couple of steps to take to his left
good length outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, cut to backward point
short and a googly outside off, cut to sweeper
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length and at the stumps. Looks to punch through the covers, gets it off the inside edge back to the bowler
length at leg stump, waits on that and tickles it fine of short fine leg
full googly at middle stump, defended down the pitch

pinned in front playing across the line. Harshal is not happy, but there are no reviews left. Shakes his head as he walks off. That's hit the back thigh and looks high. Short of a length on a middle stump line. Looks to play the flick and misses. Might have gone over the stumps, that. Replays confirm that
short outside off, mistimed cut straight to backward point
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
does well to sway away from that. Short ball angled into middle stump. Gets low and arches backwards
clipped to the midwicket boundary. Full and into the pads, shuffles and gets deep in the crease as he flicks aerially and wide of midwicket
good length and into off stump, defended towards square leg off the inside edge

close run-out call at the striker's end. Good length ball at leg stump, tickled to short fine's left. Tiwary dives to his left and only manages to get a hand on that. QDK is standing in front of the stumps as a wide throw comes in. He tries to deflect it backwards and misses. Hetmyer was well out
googly at a length on middle stump, defended off the front foot
short of a length just outside off, backs away and punches to sweeper's left
full outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
length at off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
good length and sliding away from the corridor. Thick outside edge to short third man as he gets forward to defend
past the outside edge again. Good length and into the corridor again. This time he defends inside the line on the front foot
past the outside edge. Good length ball angled into the corridor and straightening after landing on the seam. Harshal looks to defend for the initial angle
bouncer dug in too short, ducks under it

big lbw appeal and it's given out. Sheepish smile as he discusses with Hetmyer before taking the review. Good length ball slides into him from around the wicket. He's beaten on the attempted flick. It's hit him on the outside of the knee flap, right in front of middle stump. It's a short stride. And it's out. Tracker shows that's hitting middle stump
short and up at off stump, gets his weight onto the front foot and swipes this to deep square's right
short of a length and into leg stump, patted out to deep square

thick edge is taken! On the second attempt by QDK. It's coming apart rapidly for DC. Short of a length ball slanted into the corridor. Stoinis looks to force it through the covers off the back foot, but he's ended up playing inside the line. It pops out of QDK's grasp before he takes it
top edge clears short fine. Looks like a googly at middle stump, he gets low and goes full-blooded with the sweep. The batswing helps him out in the end
googly, short and into leg stump. Pulled out to deep midwicket
short of a length and sliding onto middle stump, mistimed pull to deep square's right
falls short of sweeper cover. Dipping legbreak outside off. Stoinis reaches with only his hands and looks to loft that over extra. Ends up slicing it

stumping appeal as Iyer loses his shape and has his back leg in the air briefly. Good length ball rips away from him outside off as he goes across the line at this outside-off delivery. And his toe hasn't landed in time. QDK is quicker than Iyer. Lovely delivery from Chahar, a dipping legbreak outside off, but questionably shot selection from Iyer who was swishing all over that
length at the stumps, whipped to deep square
short and wide outside off, rapidly past his attempted cut shot
good length at middle stump, poked towards long-on
short of a length at middle stump, mistimed pull to deep backward square
slower length ball at middle stump, shapes for the reverse ramp and is beaten by the deception

dropped at midwicket. Pollard to his left. This short of a length middle stump ball was pulled very firmly off the front foot. Pollard got two hands to it though, about thigh height, and will be disappointed with that
short of a length and into middle stump, pulled to deep square's right
good length and into the pads, flicked to fine leg's right
bouncer in the corridor, past him before he can get the hook away
short and climbing up at middle stump. That popped up and surprised Iyer. Took his bottom hand off and fended this pitch side on the off side
short of a length and into the corridor. Chopped towards the keeper off the under-edge
good length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length and into off stump, defended to point
good length at off stump, punched to long-on
good length at off, steps out and punched to long-on
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
shuffles into the off side and ramps this past QDK's left glove. And just over the stumps too. It was a quick length ball outside off. Short third man cleans up to his left
sends this a long way over long-on. The trademark Iyer loft against offspin. Quickly down the pitch to meet this at the pitch and a lovely clean swing with the turn
full outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
yorker length on leg stump, driven to long-on
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length and into the stumps. Backs away and looks to force that. Thick inside edge to long-on
good length and at middle stump, backs away and drives on the up to extra cover's left. Jayant Yadav stops with his outstretched left arm
length and sliding onto leg stump. Deflected towards short fine off the back foot as he looks to glance
short of a length and just outside off, mistimed whip to midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length and sliding on towards off stump from around the wicket. Looks to drive and gets an inside edge to square leg
short of a length and fired in at the stumps. Backs away and hurriedly cuts to cover's left
good length and pushed through quick outside off. Hurriedly jabbed towards short third
short of a length outside off, shuffles and glances to square leg
good length and tucking him up at middle stump. Defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, cut to backward point
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
good length and jumping up from a middle stump line. Gets behind that to defend and it pings off the outside half

QDK the lone appealer for this catch behind. And he's managed to convince Pollard to review the not out decision. Short of a length and angled wide outside off. He checked himself on the cut. Ultra Edge has nothing. That's the review lost
good length and into middle stump, gets forward and jabs to midwicket
short of a length and just outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and sliding onto leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
full and wide outside off, driven uppishly into the covers
full on off stump, gets forward and flicks to long-on
back of a length and turning into off stump, pushed down the pitch off the back foot

sliced high for QDK and he takes it to his left. Short of a length ball rising at a leg stump line. He backs into the leg side and looks to swipe it with a horizontal bat. It's too steep and there's no room and all he manages is to slice this with the bat face pointed skywards
ducks quickly as this bouncer heads for his helmet
sliced over short third. Good length and across the corridor. Stays still and looks to slog this across the angle, loses his shape but has the runs
good length and into leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
pulled to fine leg's left. Short and up at hips on a leg stump line. He's on his front foot and then he swivels to drag this away
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and down leg side, beaten on the flick

chipped over mid-off. Good length at off stump, marginal turn away. He reaches out and doesn't make the pitch of that, but he only wanted to get it over the infield and there's enough connection for that
safely short of deep midwicket. This is dipping at a length outside off as he goes down for the sweep and sticks with that decision. Ends up hacking from under it with the bat face pointed upwards
full and into leg stump, poked to mid-on off the front foot
short of a length and turning away outside off, cut to cover point
good length and dipping outside off, pushed into the covers
good length at middle stump, leans in and tucks this to midwicket
good length and swung into leg stump. Flicked to square leg's right
yorker and just outside off, jammed into the covers

chopped straight to backward point! A sharp, low catch from, it looks like, Suryakumar. They've sent it upstairs with a soft signal out. A third man angle - the side angle in this case - shows he took the catch without the his hand touching the ground. That is, while the ball was still aerial. It's only in the follow through that his hand touches the turf, and from a front on angle, the umpire is satisfied that the back of the palm is under the ball. It's a second consecutive duck for Dhawan. This was a good length ball shaped away outside off, and he reached out for a square drive on the rise

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length and wide outside off, punched into the covers off the toe-end
full inswinger at off and middle stump, keeps his forward stride sufficiently leg side as he flicks to deep square
and Jordan ends it up with a wide outside off. Royals win with 15 balls to spare
full and wide, crunched wide of deep cover to get the couple that levels the scores
Buttler is going to finish this off this over. Takes down fellow Englishman. Gets one in the slot, and clears the front leg to loft this over the sight screen
yorker, down leg, dug out to deep midwicket for one
full, fast and wide. Too wide
end of an absolutely shocking over from Shami, whose comeback as a T20 bowler had so far been one of the stories of the tournament. Another slot ball, on-pace, and another four to deep midwicket

and again, they nearly allow KXIP back in with a quick single. Hit straight to point, Buttler calls him through, and Smith is having to dive at the non-striker's end to stay alive. And he still wouldn't have got in had Suchith hit
ah Smith. Quick half-volley are just what he needs. Gets down on a knee and ramps this over short fine
slower ball, Smith makes room and drives this square of deep cover for two
there is a deep midwicket in place, and Smith has decided to loft this slot ball in that zone. But he has managed to place this straight of that man
half-volleys won't create magic. Smith lofts him over that man in the circle, the mid-off

Jordan goes back to bowling off-pace, and Buttler is prepared this time. The issue with this slower one is that is too full, and Buttler stays deep in his crease to loft this over long-on for six. Breaks the 11-ball boundary drought
change of pace, bowls it quick, at 137ks, short of a length, and Buttler is hurried into the push. Jordan fields in his follow-through
slower ball again, Buttler looks for the pull and it arrives late, taking the cue end through to the keeper
another slower ball, on a length, Smith gets inside the line, and is hit on the pad. They take a leg-bye
another slower ball, fuller, and driven straight to deep cover this thime
a typical dreamy Buttler punch. Slower length ball, and yet he times this back-foot cover-drive well enough for two, wide of deep cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, pushed to point, and this time they won't take Suchith on
quick length ball, middle and leg, worked to leg for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Buttler, no run
long_text: massive but equally ridiculous lbw shout. And they will even review it. I have seen it all. This is a legbreak from round the wicket that has hit him in front. It has to pitch outside leg unless some physics is on leave. It isn't. A review wasted

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Buttler, no run
long_text: legbreak, just outside off, beats his punch

direct hit. Oh why do they go for these silly runs when they can hit such big sixes? This is a quick length ball, Smith opens the face, straight to cover point. Samson hasn't hesitated, but he has still been beaten by the direct hit from Suchith, substituting for Mandeep
full and wide, driven down to long-on for one. Dragged all the way

misses the yorker, bowls a low full toss, and Smith jams down on it. He is opening the face on it, but he doesn't intend for it to go this fine. it hits the outer half of the bat, and does go fine of third man
Jordan lucky to get away with this. Short ball, down the leg side, with fine leg up. Samson pulls this down but straight to the man

unbelievable shot. Jirdan hs dug this in, but Samson is off his feet, high in the air, and rides the bounce to cut this down into the ground. Arshdeep has to put in a big dive after chasing this from third man
on-pace, 143ks, too far down leg, and he gets a tickle on it. And the short fine is inside the circle. Oh the replay shows this has gone off the pad but the umpire has credited the runs to Samson
slower short ball, pulled down to long-on for one
slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
classy. Ashwin is not short here, but still short of a length. Samson delays his punch, and beats point to his right and deep cover to his left
just too short from Ashwin as he looks to bowl flat, and Samson pulls this over deep midwicket, the bigger boundary
goes back to late-cut a flat delivery, but hits this straight to short third man
Arshdeep saves three. Smith backs away to punch, gets an outside edge fine of short third, but Arshdeep puts in the big dive to keep them down to one
wrong'un, short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
down the wicket to push this length ball to long-on for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: slow in the air, just short of Samson's arc, and he doesn't try to hit the six. Just pushes this back to him
flighted, on a length, punched down the ground for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, punched down the ground, but Bishnoi fields this to his right to deny them the single

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, no run
long_text: quicker, on a length, on off, defended back to him

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, FOUR runs
long_text: Smith is not messing around here. Bishnoi tosses this up wide, and he sweeps this hard and down the ground. Wide of long-on it goes, and he didn't have far to go to his right, mind
full, outside off, Smith plays the lap sweep, gets it fine of fine leg for two
full and straight, clipped off the toes for one

this is slower than the last ball, and gives him slightly less room to swing his arms. Uthappa still gets a lot of the slog-sweep, but not enough. Pooran takes the catch at deep midwicket. Just feet inside the fence
Uthappa gets into the act himself. Slog-sweeps him this time. Flat six over deep midwicket, the bigger boundary
Uthappa looks for the big reverse hit to a length ball outside off. Is beaten. Rahul appeals for the catch but it is more hope than conviction
length ball, legbreak, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
flatter, wrong'un, Uthappa picks it and works it into the leg side for one
slow in the air, but not a half-volley. Samson is smart, and bunts this into the leg side for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: flatter, on a length, straighter, pushed back to his right, and Bishnoi is quick enough to deny them a single

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: dreamy six. Bishnoi tossed it up twice in his last over but Samson chose to get his eye in. Not this time. Languidly he drives this over wide long-off for a six
really full, outside off, Uthappa nails the sweep, but gets just the single to deep backward square leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Uthappa, no run
long_text: wrong'un, full, outside off, driven to extra cover
wide down the leg side. Uthappa will feel he has missed out on a boundary

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: nicely bowled but even more nicely played. This is a yorker outside off, but it is not express pace, which gives Samson the time to go back and open the face on it. He beats short third man with ease
he is moving across early, Arshdeep stays on a length and wide outside off. Doesn't let him get inside the line. Just the single to leg
yorker, dug out to long-on for one
length ball, around off, and Uthappa moves across to get inside the line and flick this to deep backward square leg
slower ball, really full, driven down to long-off for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: I mentioned the big boundaries in Abu Dhabi last over, but he says they are not big enough for him. Sees the short ball early, and it is just waist high. Pulls this way abover deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Uthappa, FOUR runs
long_text: breaks the 11-ball boundary drought with a revere-sweep. Takes this from on the stumps and bisects point and short third man
another brave flighted delivery, asking Samson if he wants to take on the big boundaries in Abu Dhabi. Just too full, and Samson knows he can't get under this one. Takes the single to long-on
stays wide outside off with a length ball, and Uthapps sweeps it to deep square for one
flighted outside off, and that is a brave ball to Samson. Gets it wide outside his reach, though. Just the single to long-on

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: length ball, legbreak, gets some turn. Defended back to him
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
slower in the air, swept away from wide outside off for one. First boundaryless over
length ball, legbreak, punched to deep cover for one
full, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
full legbreak, driven along the ground to long-off for one
wrong'un, short of a length, wide, and he has picked this only off the wicket. Dabs it to point
middle and leg, full, clipped off the toes for one
oh lovely shot. Nonchalant. Short of a length, wide, and he punches this late to beat the man at point to his left and third man at the boundary to his right
slower ball as Uthappa moves across, and he nearly traps him leg-before. Uthapps gets the bat down in time
short of a length, wide, steered to third man for one

Stokes makes room to try to go over mid-off again, but Jordan is full so he gets too close to the ball. Doesn't get the elevation he wants. Finds mid-off. What relief for KXIP. What a fiery knock from Stokes to go with his bowling effort
Stokes skips down the track, Jordan bowls the slower one, and he hits this to mid-on for a dot
what a rude and dismissive welcome to Jordan. Makes room and lofts this length ball over mid-off for his third six, brings up his fifty
another teaser to mid-on. Uthappa looks to pull a skiddy short-of-a-length ball, and ends up half-volleying mid-on with the mis-hit
full toss again, hit to long-on for one
short of a length, angling in, cramps him up. Hit to cover-point
full toss outside off, he hits hard, gets a thick edge to short third man
Stokes is batting in another world. Incredible batting. Makes room, Shami goes for top of off, but he drives this on the up, and the ball singes the outfield as he rushes across through extra cover
on a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
quick slider, beats his attempt at the reverse-sweep
and Stokes goes midwicket this time. Deep into the crease to sweep this in the air. Nails it again
flighted delivery, the first time he has given it air, and it is a wrong'un, but Stokes knows the mid-on is up and he goes over that man. And gets six for it
nails the reverse-sweep this time. On a length, around leg, and he has absolutely smashed this over point
short of a length, slow, and Stokes makes room to cut, but straight to extra cover
looks to reverse-sweep first ball, is beaten and Ashwin appeals for leg-before. Pitched outside what would have been leg stump but does the batsman give up that right when he switches?
full and straight, nearly a yorker, flicked to long-on for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Stokes, FOUR runs
long_text: Stokes makes room, Arshdeep follows him, and follows him too far. Stokes gets inside the line and flicks it straight of short fine leg
length ball, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
on a length, straight, pushed to mid-off for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Stokes, FOUR runs
long_text: Stokes shuffles across early, and pulls this short-of-a-length ball from outside off and beats deep midwicket to his left

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Stokes, no run
long_text: swinging low full toss, beats him outside off
short ball with fine leg up, and Uthappa gets inside the line of the ball to use his pace and pull him over fine leg for a big six
short of a length, angling in, no room, pushed wide of cover for one
Maxwell nearly pulls off a stunner. Sharp bouncer, gets big on Stokes, who ends up pulling this towards mid-on. He has to run in and dive, which he does, reaches it on a yorker length
looks for the ramp to a straight length ball, and gets the edge onto his own helmet grille
Stokes looks in golden touch. Short of a length, just outside off, and he luxuriously punches this in front of cover-point for four
short of a length, skiddy, beats his attempt to pull. Flies off the thigh pad for a leg-bye

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Stokes, FOUR runs
long_text: Stokes negates the swing by jumping out of the crease and lofting this straight length ball over mid-on for the first boundary of the innings

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Stokes, no run
long_text: swinging again, and this time Stokes lets it alone outside off
another thick outside edge as Stokes makes room to go big over cover. This swings a touch and goes over point for another couple
more swing as Stokes drives hard at this. The outside edge goes along the ground and wide of point for two
full, slight swing, pushed slightly wide of mid-on for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Uthappa, no run
long_text: short of a length, pretty straight, defended back to him
Maxwell will have to wait another night for his first six this IPL. Short, wide slower ball, beats him for a dot, and they don't even try to run a bye. Why, oh why?
full toss down leg, and he tries the cut shot behind square on the leg side but the fine leg deep. Only the single

emotion from Gayle. He has missed out on a hundred. What a seed from Archer. Yorker on leg. Maybe just six inches short of one. It goes past the inside edge, hits the pad, and ricochets into the wicket. Gayle is looking to kick the ground with his bat but loses control and the bat flies towards midwicket. And then a nice tough. He forgets the bat, and shakes Archer's hand. Gayle walks back with the helmet on the top of his bat handle. The only man with two 99s in the IPL
thigh-high full toss, hits him high on the bat, but Gayle has imparted a lot of power into this. Clears Stokes at wide long-on for six No. 1001
dropped at short fine leg. Difficult chance, though. Maxwell gets inside the line tu try to flick it past short fine. Aaron dives to his left, gets a hand, but can't hold on
perfect yorker, also following him. Can't do much. Just the single
nearly takes out Maxwell at the non-striker's as he drills this low full toss outside off to long-off for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: ONE THOUSAND SIXES. Over the big leg-side boundary. To a quick bouncer that is higher than his shoulder. Enough said
leg-side full toss, and this should be on the grass banks, but Maxwell mis-hits it for a single to deep square leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Maxwell, no run
long_text: Tyagi bowling smartly. Using his open stance to go wide outside off. Maxwell struggles to reach it again

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Maxwell, no run
long_text: and Tyagi comes back well, doing Maxwell in as he backs away early. He slips in a wide yorker outside off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Maxwell, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: that is a brutal delivery for Tyagi. Not only has he conceded four past short fine leg, he has also bowled a high full toss. No-ball
full and wide, nearly a yorker, driven to deep cover

Tewatia with another smart boundary catch. He has been so safe on the fens this year. Slower ball, short, around off, and Pooran takes on the short boundary. Tewatia leaps a little to take this overhead. Right at the edge of the boundary
on-pace length ball, on off, and Gayle goes for it again. Ends up shanking it for a single to long-off
slower ball, on a length, looking to tuck him up, but Gayle can take on the shorter leg-side boundary with a six just over deep midwicket. No. 999 in T20s
slower short ball, outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, outside leg, Gayle early in his swing. Gets just the leg-bye
slower bouncer, called wide on height
length ball, on-pace, asking for trouble. Gayle smashes this between long-on and deep midwicket for a four

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: Tyagi errs a little in lenght, and Pooran is good enough and brutal enough punish him. Just misses his yorker by a foot or so, and he smacks him over long-off for his 25th six this IPL
full toss, higher than the knee, Pooran is hurried into the shot, but still manages to hit it straight of long-on. Smith saves two with a dive there
shorter of being a yorker, and Gayle winds up, but doesn't get all of it. Just the single to long-off
another yorker, or a near-yorker at any rate. Pooran can get just a single into the covers
another yorker, just outside off, dug out for just the single

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, no run
long_text: lovely yorker to start off, dug out back to him

and that one inch over the line has cost Aaron has seven runs. And this is an incredible shot. This is a slower ball, just short of a length, and wide outside off, but he has managed to loft this over extra cover for a six. That shot also makes Pooran the sixiest batsman this IPL, going past Samson's 23
short of a length, Pooran sets himself up for the six over square leg again, but the slower ball beats him. Oh hang on, this is a no-ball. Oh this might ruin what has been an excellent over
slower ball, on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to point for a dot
oh Pooran loves the pick-up shot. The first time Aaron has veered off the straight length ball. Just short of a length, and Pooran gets inside its line to pick it up over square leg for a six
slower ball, 118ks, on a length, no room. Punched down to long-off for one. Good over so far
quicker length ball, no room, and pushed back to Aaron
slower ball, on a length, top of off, Gayle opens the face but sends this straight to point
on a length, pretty straight, pushed back to him
short of a length, on the pads, slower one, worked into the leg side for one. He called for two but it is not on
wide down the leg side

Rahul has struggled to time the ball all night. It shows you the pitch is not easy. He rarely fails on the slog to a length ball. Bowled at 129ks, so seams like an on-pace ball because his slower ones have hovered around 110. Rahul doesn't get any power into the slow, and holes out to deep midwicket. Replays show this is the split-finger slower ball so he has really outfoxed Rahul
slower ball, on a length, 109ks, cramps him up, the mis-hit into the leg side gets them a single
quick bouncer, well outside off. Called wide. Not sure if it is on height or line
slower ball, hit hard into the leg side, but doesn't make a clean connection. Gets just the single to deep midwicket
slower ball, wide and full, but inside the line. Good ball. Left alone
sharp bouncer, just outside off, and Gayle wants to have nothing to do with this
Gayle is haring between the wickets. He has hit the full toss to mid-off, and sets off immediately, and draws a misfield from Smith. And then runs the second off the misfield too. Scenes
full and sliding down leg, which is not what you want to do with fine leg up. Gayle clears the front leg to slog, but gets an inside edge past short fine leg for four
cue-ends another shot to an on-pace delivery. The ball is not coming on. He looks to go wide of long-on, but gets the toe end for a single just past Archer to long-off
slower ball, 118ks, but he slides down leg, and Rahul picks the slower ball early to get inside its line and flick it past short fine leg
and Rahul is showing that intent. Makes room early to go over cover, but gets an inside edge to short fine. This pitch is not exactly a flattie
Rahul skips down the track, Tewatia pulls the length back, punched down to long-off for one
down the wicket to another wide length ball, gets a single to long-on

just clears the leaping long-on. Six No. 20 for Gayle in just six matches this IPL. Wide length ball, Gayle thinks it is close enough to go for it, but toe ends it up for a skier. Teases and teases Stokes before going over his head
he is beginning to show intent. Shuffles across early, sweeps this down, gets a single to deep square leg
full, outside off, Gayle uses his feet and gets too close to the ball. Gets just the single to long-on
oh sees a length-ball legbreak and goes for the slog-sweep. Beaten by the turn
short ball, crunched hard off the pull, but gets just the single to deep midwicket
full and wide, driven hard, but straight to sweeper-cover
slower ball, on a length, cue-ended to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short ball, gets big on him, and the pull goes towards long-on instead of midwicket, which is what he intends
on a length, on off, pushed wide of Stokes to long-off
short of a length, punched down to long-on

Tewatia has nearly done him in all by himself. Gayle tries to go straight down the ground, but toe-ends a skier. This has gone nowhere. Is landing at around the 30-yard circle. Tewatia charges back at it, and Stokes, running in, lets him go for it. He puts in a dive, but can't reach it
short of a length, wide, away from the hitting arc. Hit straight to extra cover
big boundary, what big boundary? This is the first mistake Tewatia has made. Gives him the slogging length, and he goes flat and over wide long-on. Third fifty in six matches
full again, and again too full to go aerial. Driven to deep cover for one
full, outside off, just too full for the slog. Drilled down to long-off for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rahul, no run
long_text: short ball well outside off, but Rahul tries to pull it. He is beaten by the slowness of the surface
yorker, middle and leg, Gayle shows the respect and digs it out for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, no run
long_text: full and straight, 140ks, defended back to Tyagi
wide length ball, runs off the outside half of the bat for a single to third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: lovely shot. Length ball, outside off, and he stands tall and drives this on the up and in the air over extra cover. This is the short boundary too. So with Gayle in the side, Rahul is okay taking risks in the middle overs too

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rahul, no run
long_text: wide on the crease, full, into the pads, driven straight to short midwicket
slow, short of a length, wide, and it squeezes under his bat. Excellent first over for Tewatia
short of a length, wide, cut straight to a fielder in the infield
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
again, stays short of a length and wide outside off. Cut to deep cover for one
another slider, short of that slogging length. Left alone outside off
slider, short of a length, wide outside off, cut straight to point
slower ball again, short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
another knuckle ball, 113ks, really full outside off, takes the bottom edge into the pitch and through to Samson
slower ball, full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
short, quick, pulled to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, offcutter, does him in, takes the outside edge, but it is well wide of the diving Samson. Sorry it is not an offcutter, but a knuckle ball
on a length, into the pads, clipped away for one
half-volley, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
shorter, flatter, pulled down to long-on for one

never mind the slip. Gayle has slogged this over the bigger boundary. He sees one full enough, the back knee goes down, and he slogs powerfully. The knee doesn't even reach the ground as he plays the shot
short ball, slow off the surface, pulled straight to deep midwicket
fuller, straighter, worked to leg for one
wrong'un first up. Seems like he has picked it off the surface, but has enough time to adjust and play a defensive shot

not the cleanest of the shots. Ladies and gentlemen, this is not a 53-for-1-in-PP pitch. Rahul is repeatedly getting done in by the slow nature of the surface. Gets a thick inside edge as he looks to go over the infield, but luckily it goes straight of midwicket in the circle
on a length, on top of off, defended back to him
full and straight, clipped away off the toes, in front of deep square leg
slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out to mid-off
and now Rahul is well and truly in the party, hats and all. Massive pull to a short ball that is only about rib high. Huge strike over square leg

and now Rahul looks to joins the party. It is a length ball, within Rahul's swing, and he looks to go over wide mid-on. But again he hits it off the inside half of the bat. Early into the shot. Signs that this is not the easiest pitch to bat on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, no run
long_text: nearly a yorker again, on middle and leg, this time it is dug out to mid-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, no run
long_text: bouncer, on leg, gets it high, and Gayle ducks under it. And suddenly the follow-through is longer

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, FOUR runs
long_text: Gayle moves early. Tyagi thinks he has bowled a decent yorker. Just short of a yorker, but by no means a half-volley. On off. So Gayle has to dig it out, but he digs it out with such power and with that tree turn in his hands. It rolls all the way to the extra-cover fence

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: short of a length, middle and off, and he clears his front leg to pull him over deep midwicket. Gayle has had his sighter. Now RR need his wicket soon or they will get no sighter come second innings

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, FOUR runs
long_text: again, a length ball just outside off, and he has driven this flat and in the air, and well above mid-off who just throws his head back

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gayle, no run
long_text: wide length ball, beats him on the drive. Gayle has made his intentions clear, though
short of a length, no room, defended
length ball, middle and leg, worked to deep forward square leg for one

this is a Mars-kisser (and it is visible clearly on this full-moon night). Gayle looks to pull again, and gets a massive top edge towards deep backward square leg. Parag runs to his left, and Uthappa runs back from inside the circle. Parag calls for it, and is perhaps put off by another fielder in his sight, and drops him
oh, a risky shot from Gayle. Chest-high short ball, tucks him up with the line, and Gayle still pulls it despite a man at deep forward square leg. Not a big six, and beats Riyan Parag to his left
wide down the leg side again. Aaron is looking to deny him any room and erring down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man for one
full, outside off, Rahul looks to drive, but it hits the inside half of the bat. So this pitch is not a flat batting beauty
bouncer, but Gayle smartly drops his wrists out of the way and lets it sail through to Samson
on a length, outside off, runs off the high part of the bat to third man for one
short of a length, no room, Rahul opens the face, but can't find a gap
on a length, just outside off, defended

it is Archer, yes, but you can't block his quota out. Rahul sees this just short of a length, but crucially he has the width. He throws his bat at it, and cuts it over the leaping point. That is 600 runs for him this IPL
on a length, on top of off, defended back to him
down the wicket, Aaron shortens the length, Gayle pulls, and he gets a bottom edge past the wicketkeeper for four
short of a length, wide down the leg side
bouncer, too high, Samson has to leap full length to prevent byes. Called wide
Gayle gives him the charge, turns this into a length ball, but can't beat short midwicket
seam movement. Stays short of a length and pretty tight on the line. It leaves him after pitching and beats the outside edge as Gayle pushes in defence
short of a length, middle and off, punched with an open face to cover-point
short of a length, angling away just outside off. Left alone
short of a length, down the leg side, kisses the pad on the way through. Samson has to put in a dive to prevent leg-byes
big wide down the leg side. Samson gets a hand to it but they will get a bye too

sensational bowling and an equally sensational catch. We have said it so many times about Stokes. This is Test-match stuff. Bouncer, straight at his badge. And his eyes look away as he throws his bat up in self defence. The ball lobs up towards point but it looks like it will fall short, but Stokes charges in and puts in a full-length dive to catch it
short of a length, on top off, dropped wide of cover for one
on a length, slightly wider, driven on the up, but straight to cover-point
short of a length, at him, rib-high. Defended back to him
nice little push-drive to a full ball outside off. Sent straight to short cover
starts off with a yorker, 139ks, dug out off the inside edge

pulled over wide long-on! Jadeja points to the dugout, then turns around and underlines his name  on the jersey. And then holds a finger up. He's scored 29 off the 30 they needed in the last two overs. It's another length ball across the corridor, and it's another pull. Flat and safely wide of the fielder in the deep
pumps it over deep midwcket! The length ball gets figured out eventually! Jadeja the new finisher for CSK. Lines it up at off stump and swings across the line to make sweet contact on that
beaten on the slash. It's four length balls across the corridor so far and CSK have not found a way. Jadeja backs into the leg side and looks to cut but that is under the bat
good length and pushed wide across him again. Seems a plan and he's stuck to it so far. Curran looks to hammer it through the off side, gets an under-edge to extra cover
good length and pushed across him. Front leg into the leg side and slapped on the up to long-off's right

short_text: Nagarkoti, to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: mistimed slog back to the bowler. Short of a length and just outside off. His pull is back to the bowler on the bounce

outside edge to third man. Oh boy, the wheels have come off for Lockie, who has been so good for them before this match. Good length ball pushed across the corridor. Gets the front leg away and has a big hoick at that. Third man is in but he wouldn't have had a chance if he was back

swiped over deep square! Doesn't dare go to the yorker after the slip-up last ball, and it has costed him big. This is a length ball on leg stump. Jadeja stays tall and swipes under that. It's all there - the pace, the line, the length. His job was to make contact. And he did. Ferguson pulls his shirt up and sinks his face into it
a full toss above waist. Mistimed pull to deep square's right but that is three bonus runs
dragged to the fine leg boundary. A full toss on the pads. Stands tall and gets it fine of the short fine fielder
yorker at a middle stump line, 146kph. Backs away and chops it to sweeper cover

short_text: Ferguson to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: beaten on the attempted ramp. Low full toss in the corridor. He predicted the length alright, but the line doesn't allow him to get bat on that because it's headed straight for him as he shuffles
low full toss at leg stump, 145kph, whipped along the ground to deep midwicket who steams in and keeps them to one. Nagarkoti the fielder, buying himself more room for the 20th over
yorker down leg side to start off, left alone
yorker just outside off, front leg in the leg side and in the air. Balance entirely on his back foot. Can only stab it down to long-off
full and just outside off, clears the front leg and drills it to long-off's left
full and just outside off, forced down to long-on off the front foot
short of a length and across off stump. Beaten on the attempted late cut

splits middle and off stump! It's a length ball angled into the stumps. He drops his right shoulder and gets low to try and ramp this over short fine, but that has slid onto the stumps from under the bat. Shakes his head as he walks off

can't get the run-out at the non-striker's end. It's a yorker outside off. Curran wants to ramp over short fine. Gets it pitch side on the leg side and is nowhere near completing the run. Cummins can't quite find the balance as he picks up and turns to throw
inside edge on a good yorker. At leg stump. Curran backs away and has a hack at that. Out to short fine's right
full and wide outside off, reaches out and drives to long-off
good length and very wide outside off, left alone
manages to get the sweep away this time. This guy sees differently. Gets down on a knee and drags a Lockie Ferguson length ball over square leg from outside off
nice timing on this but straight to sweeper cover. They steal a second from him. Short of a length outside off and a nice flow on the cover drive
yorker at middle stump, flicks it into his pad and gets only a single in the covers
full and wide outside off, and he looks to sweep him. Thick inside edge only as far as square leg

short_text: Narine to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: beats deep midwicket's slide. Short of a length slower ball, steps out and pulls between long-on, Rinku, and deep midwicket, Cummins. They're converging on that and Cummins almost pulls out of the slide at the end
good length on leg stump, leans in and flicks to long-on
short of a length and turning away outside off, dragged out to long-on with a pull

short_text: Narine to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and turning away outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
short and turning into off stump. Punched to sweeper cover
good length and just outside off, steps out and pokes into the covers

short_text: Varun to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: dropped! Oh he's going to think about this all evening if they don't pull it off tonight. A simple catch put down by the bowler in his follow through. Short of a length outside off. Curran runs down the pitch and isn't close to the pitch of that. Looks to punch towards long-off and it comes off the high part of the bat and floats at a comfortably pace and height to Varun's right. He gets both hands on it, but perhaps the hands were too hard

short_text: Varun to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, guided into the covers off the front foot

takes out leg stump! Oh he's burst through MS Dhoni's defences after softening him up the last two balls. Proper dominance, those last three balls. This is quick, and it's sliding into Dhoni who is hurriedly skipping into the leg side to try and make room and stab this through square leg off the back foot. Plays all over it and the stump is well and truly tonked. Bowled by Varun C for the second time this season
short of a length and turning into middle stump. Cramped on the back foot punch, gets it to extra cover
good length at off stump, stabbed to extra cover off the front foot
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut into the covers
short and just outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man

can't beat mid-off this time. Short and wide from Cummins this time. He runs down the pitch and wants to flat-bat it over the infield. But it's gotten too steep for control and it's about throat height for the fielder there

shuffles and swipes it fine. Expert limited-overs batting. He's played pretty much the only two boundary shots you can get off Cummins' length balls outside off. It's angled in, he uses that to get it fine

rolls into the long-off boundary. Mid-off is in. He steps out in anticipation of Cummins' good length ball slammed into the pitch and gets it. Outside off, he's running into the leg side. It comes off the low part of the bat and floats over the infield
good length and in at the stumps. Steps out to try and drive on the rise through cover. Gets a thick inside edge down to long-on
googly at a length on middle stump, steps out and is beaten in flight. Manages to jab it into the vacant leg side off the inside edge
good length and into the corridor. Under-edge into the pitch on the late cut
googly at a length just outside off, punched to deep extra cover
good length and sliding into the corridor. Opens the face and runs it to point
good length and pushed through quickly outside off. Leans in and drives to sweeper's right
cut over extra cover. Drops this legbreak short outside off, he's backing into the leg side as he whips out at it. Lockie slides to his right, studs up like a red-card tackle. Can't stop that
short of a length and just outside off, pushed into the covers
short outside off, shuffles and pulls to deep midwicket
upper cut over the cover boundary. You read that right. Some hit, this. Short and wide outside off and sitting up for him. He reaches out and sends it well in front of square
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover on the rise
short of a length outside off, waits on that and cuts to sweeper's left to bring up his second consecutive fifty
good length outside off, steps out and looks to crash it through the covers. Gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
good length and into leg stump. Forced to midwicket's right off the back foot
good length outside off, leans into the drive to long-off
pumps it over the long leg boundary! Slower short ball down leg side. Waits on that and pulls from under it. Sends it onto the second tier
short of a length outside off, jabbed into the covers
short of a length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands

more elegance from Gaikwad. Not many batsmen have taken a liking to Lockie so far. Gaikwad enjoying him so far. This is full and just outside off. Sliding into the corridor and he's stood tall and opened the wrists to loft that over extra cover
full and fast outside off, drilled down to long-off on the front foot
slower, at a length outside off. Poked into the covers
full and fired down leg side, left alone
full and wide again, and he lifts it over extra cover like the throwdown it is

lofts it straight! This is fairly simple batting for Rayudu, who is very good against spin. There's dew, Rana doesn't give it too may revs. So he knows it's safe to run down at him without the fear of getting beaten. Doesn't get to the pitch of this length ball but manages to launch it anyway
whack. Full and wide and sliding on nicely outside off and Rayudu reaches out and drills that over extra cover
short and skiddy at middle stump. Hurried pull to deep midwicket
good length outside off, leans in and punches to long-off on the front foot
length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, subdued sweep out to deep midwicket
short of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs to short third
inside edge onto pad as this googly heads for middle stump from outside off
good length and sliding onto off stump. Punched to long-off on the up

taken at long-on. A tame slog sweep attempte. A hit out attempt. Wasn't picking him at all. A length ball outside off that grips and goes away from the attempted slog sweep. Sends it high up and it's taken well inside
beaten on the punch. Good length ball delivered with a legcutter grip. Most times that comes in. That's what Watson thinks on this occasion.But this grips and goes away
length at middle stump, punched to midwicket
offbreak tossed up at a length outside off, punched to long-off on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length and just outside off, defended to extra covet off the front foot
good length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, flicked with the turn to deep midwicket
short of a length and turning into middle stump. Punched to extra cover off the back foot
full and fast outside off, beaten on the attempted chop
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to long-on off the back foot
good length at the stumps, looks to force off the front foot and gets an inside edge onto pad

punched over the long-off boundary off the back foot! Or a back foot position, anyway. That is outrageous. Technically, he's running down at that, but he's static as he forces this short of a length ball. Straight bat but down to up, a punch upwards and it's gone a fair distance too. Incredible
short of a length and following him down leg as he backs away to try and drive over the infield. Beaten
short of a length indipper outside off, cut to backward point
slower short ball just outside off, forced to adjust to try and pull that. Beaten on the under-edge
hooked to short fine on the bounce. Short one up at the ribs and it looks like he gets that off the glove. 151.2kph ball
good length on middle stump, pushed out to mid-on
gorgeous lofted drive over the bowler. Full and into off stump, stays very still and offers the full face to get this over the bowler. Minimum effort
full slower ball wide outside off, steps out and into the leg side to make room for himself. Is forced to chuck his hands at that and get it off the under-edge

pulled to deep square's left and just enough to beat Nagarkoti. Short ball up at middle stump, pulls off the front foot and high into the leg side. Bounces despairingly to Nagarkoti's left and his attempted scoop back in isn't successful
good length at leg stump, lofted drive out to long-on
good length curveball away from off stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and floating away towards off stump. Punched to long-on off the front foot
short and turning into off stump. Backs away and finds cover point with the cut
short and turning away outside off. Waits on that a long time before dragging a check-pull out to deep midwicket
good length and curving away outside off. Punched to midwicket's left off the back foot
pulled to deep square's left. A slower ball dug in short and coming into his body. He's quickly in position to get behind that and swivels to get it over the boundary on the bounce
good length and angled into the stumps. Flicked to midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
short ball climbs over DK. Dug in very very short. Gaikwad was running down the pitch and couldn't even think of getting connection on that. That gripped in the surface
short of a length and slower in the corridor. Opens the face and steers to short third
good length ball slanted into him, he backs away and punches it on the up to get it wide of mid-off
good length and into off stump, defended into the covers
short of a length and just outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
good length at leg stump, pushed out to midwicket's left
doesn't stay low this time and he uses the bounce to lift this over the long leg boundary. Short and into middle and off. Swivels and nails the pick up
short and keeps low as it straightens outside off. Left alone
full and swung away outside off, reaches out and slices to third man
short and wide outside off, under-edge on the attempted cut
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, leans in and pats it to mid-off
full and into leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length and just outside off, defended to cover off the back foot
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on from the crease
just short of deep midwicket and they pinch the second. Full slower ball at middle stump, gets down for the slog sweep and gets too far under it. Ends up lofting it high as Jadeja swoops in on it
full slower ball follows him down leg side. He gets on a knee for the sweep but cops that on the front pad
yorker at off stump, steers the jab straight to backward point
yorker on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left

taken at long-off. Full slower ball wide outside off. Walks into the off side this time and is still forced to reach out. Wants to loft over extra cover but gets it only a couple of yards to long-off's right
edged over third man. Backs into the leg side and is forced to stretch out to try and get a connection on this full one outside off. Gets his reward for reaching it in the end, I suppose
full outside off, looks to drive through the off side and gets a thick inside edge to long-on's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Karthik, no run
long_text: beaten on the drive. Goes a long long way into the leg side and misses out on an overpitched ball outside off
slower short ball just outside off, cut aerially to sweeper's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: walks into the off side and swats it over square leg. No one back on the line square on the leg side. This is a cutter, short and wide outside off from over the wicket. So the angle is well against him, but he's moved right across and found his spot
short of a length and rising outside off, cut uppishly to sweeper cover

short_text: Sam Curran to Morgan, FOUR runs
long_text: slapped over extra cover. That is savvy, not an easy shot on a slow surface. Cutter climbing up at an off and middle stump line. His feet are off the floor and he's cramped as he gets into the leg side, but he manages to get the punch away

just short of fine leg who ends up creating a ramp for the ball to slide off of and lob into the boundary behind him. Slower short ball at middle stump and it was a dipping pull shot to Jagadeesan's left. Decided to go in for the catch and couldn't manage it
slower ball at a length on middle stump, flicked to long-on's right

lifted over the keeper. Slower ball at a length on middle stump. Gets on a knee and steps into the off side. Shapes for the paddle sweep and then adjusts to use the extra bounce to go upwards and get it over Dhoni
slower ball at a length on middle stump, leans and in and clips it to short fine's left
yorker wide outside off, chopped to deep point

slammed high up and taken at long-on. Full offcutter at off stump. Rana looks for the slog and is done by the pace. Gets a nice connection on it but it's all elevation. And it looks like that swerves on Curran late in its path because he's taken it a couple of inches out to his right and at waist height. These guys train to take catches as close to the body as possible so that must have changed path. Good take to end a good innings
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Left alone
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
digs the slower ball in short at off stump, shuffles and fends it into the leg side
yorker and just outside off, jabbed to backward point
lifted over extra cover. Full and just outside off, half a stride but out of the way of the ball to make room. Goes inside-out from right under his eyes
slower ball at a length on leg stump, backs away and looks for the chop through cover. Misses as it lobs over the stumps

short slower ball at leg stump. He runs down on it and swipes it to deep square's left off his hips. Rayudu pulls it back in with a slide to his left. But in his recovery, as the ball slides towards the boundary, he gives it a pat with his foot in contact with the padding
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch
good length on off stump, jabs it into the covers with soft hands
beaten. Googly, full and wide outside off. Looks to go over cover and can't connect

drilled straight! Karn is rattled. Looks like this quicker one is pushed through from the front of the hand. It's overpitched and outside off and it's the perfect pace as he drives straight and through the line
steps out and drags it over square leg! Good length and dipping on him as he steps out. He counts on it to spin into his body and it does, and his wholehearted slog makes connection
front leg out of the way for the slog sweep. Good length and at a middle stump line. Down on one knee and that slides on nicely as he swings from underneath
good length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right off the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and pushed past the tramline outside off, left alone
inside edge on the reverse sweep. Full and down leg side, too far away for him to make optimal connection
dragged to deep square's right. Full and just outside off. Gets down on a knee and lofts this to find the gap
good length outside off, leans in and nudges to long-on's left with soft hands

falls safely in front of long-on. Googly at a length. Steps out and can't get to the pitch of that. Ends up slicing his attempted slog and Curran can't get close in the end as this plonks just past the circle
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
googly spins away from leg stump, Morgan shapes to close the face but ends up defending into the off side
good length and just outside off, punched back down the pitch
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket to bring up his fifty
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length and just outside off, cut to backward point's right
top edge out to deep square. Good length ball gets big on him as he checks himself on the attempted sweep. Floats out gently for Rayudu
b>spanked to long-off's right. That's a good looking drive. Good length and sliding on quickly outside off, goes through the line and on the rise
good length on leg stump, pulled to deep backward square
good length at leg stump, miscued slog to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, gets forward and opens the face to get this to point
good length and just outside off, opens the face and pushes to extra cover
short and gripping outside off. Gets big on him as he cuts uppishly to sweeper cover
on the bounce to long-on. Full one at middle stump, a lofted drive with little elevation
good length and just outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
full on leg stump, mistimed slog to deep square
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
swept to deep square's left. Full and down leg side. Sweep is aerial for a bit, but dipping quickly to Rayudu's left. Too quickly away from him as he dives
whipped to long-on's left. Good length ball at middle stump, steps out to the pitch of that and slugs it forcefully with the turn
good length and spinning into off stump, lunges out and gets an inside edge onto pad that deflects so short third's right
short of a length outside off, cut to point's left. Ngidi dives to the left to parry that for sweeper cover
flighted full toss outside off, forced down to long-off with the cut
full and outside off, leans in and flicks to long-on with the turn
slower short ball just outside off, steers it down to third man
short and into the body. Jumps into the leg side to try and cut, but that's past him quickly
caressed past point. Looks like a slower ball. Short and just outside off. Waits on it and rolls the wrists over that late cut to get it to point's right
beaten on the pull. Short ball seams away wide outside off and he can't manage to drag that into the leg side
good length outside off, punched on the rise to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, cut on the bounce to sweeper cover
yorker length at leg stump, jabbed to long-on's left off the front foot
short and just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
good length on leg stump, punched towards deep midwicket off the back foot

taken at deep midwicket. Tosses this up slowly at a middle and leg line. He's hitting into the longer side. And he can't clear the fielder with the slog. Floats nicely out to Jadeja who takes it inisde the line
full on middle stump, drilled firmly back to the bowler off the front foot
short and sliding rapidly away from off stump, beaten on the cut
length ball and dipping at leg stump. Heaved out to deep backward square
clears long-on. Full on leg stump, in his swining arc and he manages to get just enough bat on the lofted drive
full on the pads, looks for the slog and cops that on the front leg
just past his grasp. Good length at off stump, looks for the flick and closes the face too early. Karn flies to his right in the follow through and can't get to that

knocks out leg stump and belts out a victory cry! Gill pretty static in his stance outside leg stump. Looks like he was trying to open up the off side. It's a slider on a good length, and he swishes for the initial line as it beats the inside edge
good length and onto leg stump, steps out and jabs it into the midwicket region
short of a length just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
good length and across the corridor, opens the face and gets this to short third
past the outside edge. Flat and fast and going on with the arm as Rana looks for the cover drive
good length and slow, on an off stump line. Pushed into the covers with soft hands
full at off stump, flicked down to long-on to bring up their first half-century opening stand of the season
good length at off stump, driven down to long-off
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
swung over the midwicket boundary. Good length on middle stump, confident in the forward stride this time and a clean swing on it
past short fine now. Full and at middle stump this time. Gets down for the sweep again and this time he's just managed to get a thick inside edge on it
swept to the backward square boundary. Full and outside leg stump. Gets down on a knee and swats this between square leg and short fine
good length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off on the front foot
driven past point. A full ball wide outside off. Rana leans in and opens the face late
beaten on the late cut. Short ball is quickly past him in the corridor
short of a length and across the corridor. Mistimed punch ends up at mid-off
short of a length and just outside off, chopped to backward point's right
full at middle stump, gets the front leg into the leg side and drives firmly to mid-on
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: cutter at a length on off stump, gets forward and defends to backward point

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: beaten on the pull. Short and rising steeply in the corridor. Hurries him as he shapes for the shot

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: beaten on the cover drive. Feet stuck in the crease as Rana goes all hands at this full outswinger

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, pushed into the midwicket region from the crease
good length and into middle stump, pushed towards mid-on with the angle

short_text: Sam Curran to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: punched past cover. Length ball in at leg stump. He goes a long way down leg side to make room and taps this on the rise to get it between cover and extra
good length and across off stump, left alone
good length at middle stump, pushed out to mid-on with soft hands
good length and just outside off, steered with the angle to deep point's right
good length and pushed across him outside off. Left alone
good length outside off, defended to extra cover's right
swatted wide of mid-on. Nonchalant. Certainly picks the pace on this one. Short and just outside off. Stays tall and puts this short-arm pull away off the middle
good length and angled at off stump. Tucks it into vacant midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off. Defended to mid-on

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: full outswinger at off stump, defended down the pitch

short_text: Sam Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: full outswinger in the corridor, a watchful defence out to short third
leading edge out to sweeper point. Once again, through the shot early. This is full and swung inwards from outside off. He leans in and closes the face this time
good length and into middle stump, defended down the pitch
full inswinger at leg stump, looks to flick and gets an inside edge onto front pad
thick outside edge past short third man. Short of a length outswinger outside off. Feet rooted as he looks to punch away from the body. It bounces to Ngidi's left
good length and swung away outside off, thick outside edge to third man as he pushes on the front foot
inside edge to fine leg. Short of a length and curving away outside off, looks to punch through cover with an angled bat and gets lucky
