swinging away, short and wide outside off. Sits on the front foot and flat-bats this past short extra cover

Yadav provides an exclamation mark on this performance with a delightful drive over extra cover to finish it all off. And then he looks at someone (I don't know whom) and gestures, "Am I all right?". You are more than all right sir. You are more than fine. You are exceptional
ends up giving him a full toss, and Pollard won't be leaving this, no sireebob. Flicks it through forward square leg for four. That is the game

slower ball, on a length, Pandya is looking to go over extra. And it seems to me he has picked the slower ball, but ends up hitting it straight to extra cover. There is a send-off. RCB have been feisty all night, but this one doesn't involve their captain Kohli. Morris has had something to say to Pandya, who points a finger and says something in return
that is why Pandya doesn't need to push for twos. He gets one in his slot, on middle and leg, and dismisses it over wide long-on for six. Disdainful
gets down on a knee to sweep this full toss to deep fine leg. Not sure why has gone for this option with the fine leg back
makes room to try to go over extra cover. The length ball sort of stops at him, and the toe end clears extra cover for a couple
full, on off, with mid-off and extra cover up. Yadav has to get only six feet to the left, but drives this straight to extra cover
Pandya gets the full toss within his range that he is looking for but ends up swinging inside its line
he is looking for the ramp again but Steyn bowls wide and short. He manages to pull this to deep midwicket for one
full toss. Straight. Yadav says thank you very much. Gets on a knee, and uses all of his 143ks pace to guide it over fine leg for six
full and wide, goes off the toe end fine of the deep point. But they don't push for the two
another wide full toss. He will need a ladder to get there
full and wide, too wide. Pandya is standing his ground
perfect wide yorker, squeezes under his bat
that is short and wide. And this time it is called despite Pandya's move across
wide length ball, not called wide because the umpire has decided Pandya moved across. But this is still too wide
Yadav gets the boundary they needed this over. Morris is frustrated but he has bowled length with no deep midwicket. He flicks this over the man in the circle
shuffles across to punch this length ball to leg. Just the single to deep midwicket
full and straight, driven straight of long-on, but they are not pushing for two
but Morris keeps hunting those pads. Punched down to long-on for one. Good over so far
on a length, quick, on off. Pushed back to him
quick offcutter, does him in, but he gets an inside edge for a single to deep square leg
full toss, on off, driven to deep cover for one
yorker, dug out. Pandya not wasting his energy taking quick singles
more touch from Yadav. Siraj bowls a bouncer, Yadav arches back, creates a bit of a room and ramps this over the keeper's head
on a length, just outside off, pushed back to him

full, outside off, with mid-off inside the circle. You must have a death wish. Yadav here chooses to kill with paper cuts. A teasing push-drive to torture both mid-off and cover as it goes to the fence
feeding them now. On a length, into the pads, and he gets inside the line to flick it to the left of the diving long leg. That is an excellent fifty for Yadav
slower short ball, widish. Pandya decides late to abort the shot
moves across early, Morris slips in a yorker, but the bat comes down in time. They take two as this goes wide of midwicket, but doesn't race to the boundary riders
length ball, on the pads, dismissed it over the deep square leg. Just a flick of the wrists. Doesn't even look up to see if he has done enough to clear the big Abu Dhabi boundaries
wide down the leg side. Pandya will feel he has missed out
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point with an open face
slower ball, full, nearly a yorker. Dug out back to him
short of a length, straight, punched to long-on
quick, middle and leg, turning towards off. Defended solidly
Chahal gets another batsman with a wide slow legbreak. Unlike Yadav, Krunal Pandya looks to clear long-off. This doesn't turn back, and takes the toe end for a catch to long-off
length-ball, legbreak, from middle and leg, punched down to long-on for one
full, fast, down the leg side, and he loves this for the sweep. Gets this fine of long leg, using his pace
swept to long leg for one
punched over midwicket for two
slower ball, short of a length, toe-ended to cover
short, wide, this is not good from Steyn. This time he plays the back-foot drive, in front of deep cover. Such good timing. All along the ground
slower ball, on a length, just outside off. Defended to cover
short, wide, ordinary, and Yadav stands tall to cut down on the top of the bounce. Beats point. Third man has no chance either
short of a length, too wide, and Yadav looks to cut. He is late into it, but the width also means the outside edge goes fine for four
short of a length, too quick for him. A leg-bye to square leg

top shot over the bigger boundary. Chahal has done this to many a big hitter. Just bowl a slow loopy wide legbreak, and they go wild and mis-hit it. Yadav plays the classic drive over extra cover, using the turn. And goes all the way too
quicker length ball, Yadav draws the late-cut, but can't beat short third man
down the wicket, Chahal stays slow, so he drives this down the ground and along the ground
reverse-sweep again, and he connects it well. The lack of pace means it goes square as opposed to behind square. Gets two
strong wrists to clear cover. He has picked the spot, which is over extra cover, but he is cramped for room, and unfurls the wrists to get the required power to clear the man in the ring
Pandya looks to reverse-sweep Chahal, who slows it down, and beats him with a legbreak
short of a length, at the hip, goes for one leg-bye
bouncer, quick, at his face, and he sways out of its line

sensational catch at mid-off. Padikkal uses all his height to dive full-length and forward to send him back. Tiwary is looking for something pitched slightly full to go over mid-off, but this is bowled cross-seam and stops on him. It is dying on Padikkal, but he flies forward to take this inches from the ground. One of the best catches of the season for sure
wide length ball, pushed to the left of square third man. Gets two
short of a length, pretty straight, stays low, keeps this out, and doesn't get a single
on a length, on-pace, 134ks, on top of off. Pushed with an open face to point
the teasing wide slow legbreak. Many a batsman has fallen for it, but he delays the shot and drives this square. Can't beat point, though
quick length ball, defended back to him
scud missile of a sweep. This is really full, and he has absolutely bludgeoned this sweep dead square on the leg side
top-edges the big slog sweep, and there is a man stationed at deep midwicket. This is the shorter boundary - not very short, mind - and it clears the man. Only just
full, on off, driven down to long-off for one
accurate legbreak, turns less than expected, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for another single
might have been wide down leg had Tiwary not worked this to long leg
slower in the air, some turn, hits the outer half of the bat as he looks to push this to leg
short of a length, straight, punched down to long-on for one
on a length, on off, driven to long-off for one
offbreak, gets some turn, the ball runs off the inside half of the bat for one
slider, into the pads, looking to protect the over. Just the single to leg

Chahal does it again. Slows it down, tempts the batsman, and he skips down to try to go for a straight six. The ball drift away a little, and is also slow in the air, and he gets only the toe end on this. Ends up skying it
looks for the sweep from outside off, but this is a slow legbreak and does him in. He gets a single off the cue end. To long-on. On the sweep
sweeps this from around leg, gets a single to deep square leg
slow, short of a length, cut straight to deep cover for one
wrong'un first up?. Fullish, around off, hits the inside half of the bat as he pushes at it
on a length, into the pads, punched to deep midwicket for one
slightly fuller, slightly straighter, defended back to him
quick, on a length, punched to short cover
cut in the air, just wide of point and just short too. They get a single off a misfield
on a length, opens the face, Yadav wants one but is sent back. Rightly so. Because the short third man is in tight for the single
wide down the leg side. Kishan looks for the bye off the fumble but is sent back. Rightly so
on a length, middle and leg, punched to long-on for one
all wrists. This is on a length, and on the pads, and he has flicked this between mid-on and midwicket. Slightly fuller than good length in fact
lovely shot. Shot of a man among the runs. Short of a length, outside off, and he still punches this wide of mid-on for three
short of a length, outside off, punched to mid-on
looks to bounce him, slides down the leg side

de Kock looks to repeat the shot he played to Steyn last over. The pull to a length ball, but Siraj doesn't offer him the high pace he got from Steyn. Ends up toe-ending it to the deep midwicket. Siraj can do no wrong these days

short_text: Siraj to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, just outside off, driven hard into the pitch, straight of mid-off. De Kock says no to the single
nearly played on. Short of a length, straight, he looks to open the face, but gets an inside edge onto the toe. They take the single too

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: full and straight, 103ks, pushed back to him
slog again but Sundar is not giving them the ideal length to slog. Keeps this down now, and hits it in front of deep square leg for one
backs away - I think he wants to go over cover - but Sundar follows him and he ends up slogging. Off the inside half of the bat it goes, in the air, but between midwicket and mid-on

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: quicker, flatter, straighter, pushed to cover

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower through the air, and de Kock has to abort this big swing. Pushes this to point
on a length, quick, into the body, pushed towards mid-on for one

short_text: Steyn to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: de Kock is so good at the pull. This is a length ball, I am not kidding. Bu he stays back and swivels with the pull to clear the bigger boundary here. Steyn's pace also helps

short_text: Steyn to de Kock, no run
long_text: short, 139ks, de Kock wants to pull this hard, but it doesn't quite come on, and takes the front edge to mid-on

short_text: Steyn to de Kock, no run
long_text: de Kock looks to back away, Steyn follows him with a quick delivery, hitting his glove
slower ball, on a length, and even though Steyn has drawn a mis-hit from de Kock, he has done enough to clear mid-on with this swipe
short of a length, into the body, pushed towards midwicket for one
really full outside off, driven wide of mid-off for one
finally misses his length. Probably bowls it quicker to protect a good over, and ends up bowling it short. Kishan goes back to cash in, cutting it to the right of point
on a length, into the body, pushed to mid-on for one
looks for the big drive down the ground, the angle takes the thick inside edge for one
slower in the air, but doesn't budge from that in-between length. Defended back to his right
short of a length, stays low, punched to midwicket
on a length, angling in, no room. Pushed back to him
slower ball, full outside off, drives this past short cover. Deep point has to run to his left to field this
skiddy short ball, hurries him into the pull, but he gets bat on it for a single to square leg
what a way to go to 1000 IPL runs. On a length, middle and leg, and he plays the pick-up over midwicket. That's why Sten struggles in T20s. Not enough movement on the ball in this format
uppish towards mid-off. Looks like a front-of-the-hand slower ball, and Kishan is early into the push to a length ball
on a length, middle and leg, shaping away towards off. Runs this square on the off side for one

short_text: Steyn to de Kock, no run
long_text: half-volley, looking for swing, and de Kock drives this powerfully. But straight to mid-off
on a length, straight, slight shape, defended to mid-off
short, wide, and Kishan is quick to cut this hard and in front of point. Short in stature, he loves the cut
misses out on a freebie. Full ball down leg, needs just a tickle, but what it tickles is the protruding thigh pad and nearly trickles back onto the wicket
short of a length, at his hip, pulled down and in front of square for one

short_text: Morris to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, slight seam back, hits him on the thigh pad

short_text: Morris to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, pushed towards point. Sent back rightly by Kishan
shuffles across to go behind square on the leg side, but gets a front edge towards deep midwicket for two
slower full ball, right in the slot, and mid-off is up. Mann goes deep into the crease to loft this over mid-off
he likes it when the pace drops off from the Bumrah levels. Bould bowls full and straight, and he whips this square of deep midwicket
slower offcutter, wide outside off, but can't be a wide as he has moved across. Mann wants the wide but is sent back. de Kock hits the stumps but he is back in. Lucky it hasn't ricocheted
on-pace length ball with mid-off up. Recipe for disaster. Sundar, though, hits this straight to the man placed wide than an usual mid-off
misses the yorker a little, and mid-off is up. But Sundar can't drive this wide enough of that man. They do run the second off the fumble, though
searing yorker. Swinging in late, headed for the base of leg stump, but Sundar's bat somehow comes down in time
quick and straight to Mann. He is late into the slog again. Just mis-hits this to mid-off for one
slower ball, on a length, pushed wide of cover for one
follows him with a length ball, slogged to deep square for one
that seems to be about the only way RCB can score off Bumrah. A bouncer well down the leg side. Called wide
looks to slog at a length ball but again Bumrah is too quick for him. All he manages is a limp hit to short midwicket. Falls just short
short of a length, quick, on top of the stumps. Pushed back to him
that wide has cost them more than just that extra. Boult is looking to tuck these batsmen up, but ends up sliding down leg again. And Sundar glances this fine of long leg for four
bouncer, it is a good ball, but only just down leg. I wouldn't have called it a wide, but the umpire does
short, into the body, hurries him into a pull. Just the single to deep square leg
short of a length, into the body, swivel-pull to long leg for one
short of a length, angling in, runs this down to third man for one
short and quick, chest-high, Morris is off his toes to try to cut this down, but it gets big on him, and the top edge flies to third man. This wicket might be worth 10 runs in the end

Morris continues with his cameo-hitting form. There has hardly been any runs scored in the last two overs, and three wickets have fallen, but he makes room and casually thumps this length ball in front of deep cover for four
double-wicket maiden. Slower ball, on a length outside off, and he ends up pushing inside its line

are we in for a double-wicket maiden? Padikkal has been placing these perfectly all night but has found the man at long leg now. Short of a length, into the body, uses his wrists to punch this in the air, but straight to Boult

just short of the diving man at point. This is short of a length, he looks to which this to leg, but gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad. Ishan Kishan puts in a full-length dive at point, but this still reaches him only on a half-volley
bouncer at 140ks, head high, and Dube is under pressure to go after it. It is so hard to control them from this height. Caught at deep midwicket. Bumrah too good
skiddy quick ball just short of a length. Another dot. The perfect in-between length
short of a length, quick, cramping him up. Defended back to him
another slower offcutter, slightly fuller, driven to deep cover for one
slower offcutter, 116ks, short of a length, and the turn beats him as he looks to open the face
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, uses his height to get it chest high. Fended to leg for one

and he has hit a full toss straight to deep square leg. They are checking it for height, but I feel it is always dipping on de Villiers. He is given so make it four de Villiers wickets for Pollard in eight. Looks like a juicy full toss, but it dips down on him in the last third of its journey, and he ends up mis-hitting straight down the lap of deep square leg
slower ball, he goes inside-out, and places this square of deep cover for two
gets lucky with this sort ball as Padikkal is early into the pull, toe-ending this back to Chahar
quick, straight, worked to deep midwicket for two

misfielded at point. Chahar fires this in short, Padikkal cuts it in air, dying in front of Krunal Pandya at point. Pandya goes for the catch and dives forward, and he reaches it too. But the hands come down late, and it squeezes under them
and Padikkal is back now, expecting a flatter delivery. He gets it, and he leans back to late=cut this between point and short third man
looks like the wrong'un to me but either way it is too full. Padikkal clears the front leg and lofts him hard back over his head. Excellent intent from RCB
goes back to late-cut a slow legbreak, but can't beat point
short of a length, quick, outside off, 144ks, gets a little big on him, and he ends up pushing this back to him
slower ball, short of a length, and just slides down too much, and de Villiers pulls this square of long leg for four

on-pace full ball, de Villiers is quick to go across, bend his back knee onto the ground and ramp this over the keeper's head for a six. Incredible shot. This is death overs already the way AB is batting
slower ball, short of a length, 127ks, whipped to long leg for one
short of a length. he is deep in the crease to pull this. Gets a single to deep square leg
length ball outside off, he looks for the big slog, gets a thick inside edge into the leg side
full and quick, just outside off, punched down to long-off for one
wide as Chahar slides too far down leg in trying to deny him room
quick, full legbreak, draws a dot
short of a length, outside off, uppishly punched down to long-off
looks for a reverse-paddle this time, but ends up dinking it straight to slip. Good job he has swept this into the ground
wider legbreak, de Villiers likes the flight so he goes after it, but is beaten by the turn
slow legbreak, just the slight bit of turn, and beats his tentative push
short again, about rib high, he gets on his toes to steer this to third man for one
bouncer to de Villiers too. He sways out of its line, and he has to hurry up as he does that because it is following him
short of a length, pushed down the ground, and the timing is so good that mid-on has to put in a desperate dive to keep this in
slower ball, outside off, beats him on the outside edge with the offcutter

and Bumrah gets to No. 100 with Kohli's wicket. A smart catch by Tiwary at midwicket. Not for the first time Kohli has fallen to a short ball. He looks to pull this but gets a massive top edge. Tiwary has to back-pedal, which he does, and gets to the right of the ball. So he is catching this over his shoulder and on his natural side. Well done. This is a short ball that has got big on him as his weight is still forward when pulling
short of a length, into the body, placed to the left of long leg for two

Padikkal continues to punish the spinners. Short of a length, quick, looking to protect the over, but he has gone back and punched this wide of extra cover. And deep cover is far too square. That is an excellent fifty, in which he has kept the intent up even after the Powerplay
slower in the air, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
pulled away but to short midwicket on the bounce
into the pads, beats the inside edge, hits the pad. Another dot
on a length, around off, pushed to short cover
nearly a stumping. Uncharacteristic shot, leaving the crease, looking for a big hit. Pandya slides this wide, and he manages to get some bat on it. Otherwise gone
slower in the air, straighter, gets some turn, hits him on the pad, but it is headed down leg
Padikkal keeps beating the man at deep cover. Chahar is looking to sliders short of a length to bowl to his field, but Padikkal has cut to the left of that man twice in this over
full and straight, wristily driven to long-on for one
shorter this time, cut to deep cover for one
slider, on a length, and he goes back to cut it late and cut it powerfully. He has also placed this in front of deep cover
short of a length, straight, worked to leg for one
full outside off, driven down to long-off for one
short of a length, middle and leg, punched down to long-on for one
slow, on a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
nearly a return catch. Looks to work this to leg but is early into the shot. The leading edge falls well short of the bowler
inside edge onto the pad as he plays for the turn but this goes on with the arm
short of a length, straight, worked to leg for one
and nearly a chance for slip. Short of a length, legbreak, Kohli looks to push this to cover, but the ball turns to take the edge. Wide of slip, though

appeal for stumping as he looks to go over extra again but Chahar shortens the length and gives it time to turn past his bat. Philippe has only just left the crease, which means he has the time to get back in, especially since de Kock doesn't deal in Dhoni-like no-give stumpings. But his back foot is in the air when he breaks the wicket
they are taking spin on. Philippe showins off his wares? Where have you been so far young man? Leaves the crease, gets to its pitch and drives this over extra cover. Stylish
guides this quick length ball to fine leg for one

this is an even better sweep. A tall man playing sweeps efficiently. This time is the reverse variety. It has the keeper excited because he has taken this from in front of the wicket and really full. Places this to the left of short third man
again he plays the paddle sweep to the first ball from a new spinner. Both are quickish spinners. So he uses the pace to place this fine of fine leg
on a length, straighter, pushed down to long-on for one
slider, length ball, angling across him, and skids through to beat him on the outside edge
yes he has Smith-like trigger movements, he completes his down-the-ground swings like Haddin. The latter is stylish. Single to deep cover
short of a length, 93ks, but slow off the surface. Worked to deep square leg for one
makes room, Pandya follows him. Punched to deep midwicket for one
lovely reverse sweep first ball. The length is a touch short for the shot, but he sweeps down on it, and drags from around leg. And keeps it down too. And beats short third man to his right
makes room to take this length ball and drive it over cover for four. Excellent Powerplay for RCB
short of a length, at off, no room, fended to cover
bouncer, pulled down to long leg for one
short of a length, straight, worked away to long leg for one
follows him with a short ball as he backs away, and tucked to the right of long leg this time. Comes back for two
gets down leg this time, and Padikkal tucks this fine, fine of long leg for four
lucky runs but intent often good tends to do that. He looks to pull this cross-seam short ball at around off, and gets a bottom edge past de Kock for four
shapes up for a ramp, and Boult slips in a big bouncer. It keeps rising even after crossing Philippe, and de Kock times his jump perfectly to take it one-handed
makes room to crunch this short-of-a-length ball away, but straight to cover point
short of a length, outside off, pushes at it with an open face
slower ball, 114ks, but it doesn't matter to Philippe who extends his arms through this length ball and goes straight back over his head. Looks a little like Brad Haddin in executing this shot
leading edge as he shuffles across and looks to work this to leg. This goes with the angle, and takes the front edge. Safe
short ball has him in trouble but it doesn't carry to short third man. Padikkal is off his feet trying to ride the bounce as this follows him. He fends at it, but can't quite control it
short of a length, straight, he moves across to work this to long leg for one
lovely shot. Pattinson bowls short but he is in position with his back and across trigger movement. Likes the pull shot, and he beats long leg to his left
short of a length, good carry, runs this down to third man for one
makes room to try to go over cover but is beaten by a quick ball just outside off
shout of "catch it" as he whips this length ball of the pads. There is a man back at square leg, but this has gone towards midwicket. A cute little pick-up shot
short of a length, straight, pushed to short midwicket
short of a length, around off, punched down to long-on
misfielded at short cover as this one bounces awkwardly off a practice pitch. Short of a length, and he goes back to punch  this only for Boult to let it through
clever batting. He knows Pandya is usually quick so he can use his pace. This is bowled at 99ks, and he has lapped this over the keeper's head
short of a length, straight, pushed wide of short midwicket for one
sweeps this from wide outside off, places this wide of deep square leg
on a length, holding its line in front of off. Defended
high full toss, about three-fourths of the way up the stumps. Gets a little big on him. He hits this to mid-off for one
finally gets the line he wants after moving across. This is just outside off, which his movement turns into a pretty straight delivery. He punches this wide of mid-on for four
leading edge as he shuffles across again. Bumrah stays outside off, and gets this to hold its line. It falls well short of mid-off
short of a length, 138ks, slight seam back, extra bounce, hits him high on the bat
on a length, outside off, 144ks, he shuffles across and defends
short of a length, off and middle. Defended with an open face
makes room and thrashes this length ball over short cover for four. Actually just short of a length, which allows him to go with a horizontal bat
stays on a length, just outside off, and he opens the face on it. Can't get it past point
on a length, on top of off, defended from the crease
swing again, but he shuffles across and clips this to deep square leg
some swing first ball as Philppe shuffles across. Defended back to him
taken at square leg. Natarajan shows his bouncer off. It's too much for Nortje, who looks to fetch it with a pull from outside off. Sliced up and swerving, but Garg is steady under it
full and just outside off, jammed into the covers

looks for the reverse ramp after shaping for the conventional ramp. Ends up going at it too early and gets it off the leading edge to square leg. Low full wide outside off and he was swishing all around that. And it's probably the only ball that brings some smiles to the Delhi dugout tonight
low full toss wide outside off, left along
lofted over the bowler. Low full toss at off stump, gets low with the front leg away and lifts it
bouncer at middle stump, mistimed pull out towards deep square
taken at deep midwicket. Overpitched on a middle stump line, there for the slog. But he's gotten too far under this, off the toe-end of the bat and taken on the line
yorker at leg stump, squeezed out towards long-on
yorker at middle stump, jammed down to long-on
flat-batted over the long-off boundary! Whew, they sound sweet when he connects. Short of a length and rising outside off. Gets half a stride on the front foot and hammers that
full and wide outside off, chucks the hands at this with a cover drive, thick outside edge to third man's right
oh sweet! Top-drawer straight drive. This is full and on off stump, he gets the front leg out of the way and drills it cleanly past the stump
good length at the stumps, poked through midwicket

run-out missed at the non-striker's end. Ashwin hits a pristine punch on the rise, straight to mid-off and barely gets halfway as the fielder shapes to throw. He went for the direct hit with bowler backing up instead of at the stumps
pulled neatly to deep square's right. Short ball sitting up at middle stump, nicely in position and hits it along the ground
that looks plumb on the lbw but Ashwin has got bat on it. Full and into off stump. Head falls over into the off side as he looks to flick
full and into the corridor. Mistimed slog off the inside half to long-on

big appeal for catch behind. Umpire has signaled wide. Warner takes the review. It's a full ball dipping away wide outside off. He reaches out and looks for the drive through point. On early viewing, the bat has definitely hit the ground. But there is a tiny spike on Ultra Edge as the ball goes past bat before that. The bat hits the ground a few frames after that. The third umpire has gone on the evidence of sound and overturned the decision
yorker into the base of off stump. Sum up a bowler in one line. Seam upright and past Rabada's attempted drive through the off side
short and wide outside off, steps out and is beaten on the cut

tough catch dropped at extra cover. Full and just outside off, gets on one knee and drills the cover drive. It's waist height and swerving away from Abhishek Sharma. He gets parallel to the ground and sticks out a right hand. Parries it towards sweeper cover
beaten by a friendly full toss. Loses his shape and smiles sheepishly. This was outside off, and he was looking to send it some 300 metres into the leg side
low full toss into the front thigh. Mistimed slog to deep square's left
pumped past the bowler. Slower ball at a length wide outside off, slides on nicely as he gets forward. Slapped on the rise ad long-off has no chance to the left
low full toss outside off, sliced to deep point's left
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Cut off the toe-end to sweeper
full and just outside off, driven uppishly to mid-off

low full toss wide outside off. Sliced to deep point's right. Rashid makes the ground and puts in a slide, but has over-done the slide in the end and is reaching out. Gets a hand but the momentum pushes it into the padding
yorker wide outside off, beaten on the chop
short of a length and wide outside off, mistimed cut to sweeper cover
yorker and just outside off, jammed down the pitch off the front foot
full and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's right
full toss at off stump, punched to mid-off
good length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, slapped on the up to long-off
full and just outside off, driven back firmly to the bowler's left. He sticks out a hand to stop

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rabada, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Axar Patel, OUT
long_text: swiped straight to deep midwicket. Full ball outside off, half a stride out for the slog and he's not close enough to generate power on it. It's off the inside half and floats out to Garg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: full and down leg side, looks to flick and it deflects to short fine off the pad
length and angled into the stumps. Clipped through square leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: good length outside off, defended into the covers
short of a length outside off, steps out and slaps it to Warner's right. He stretches out and parries it to long-on
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
short of a length and across the corridor. Punched to sweeper cover
slower ball, short of a length on leg stump. Swiped to deep square's left
taken at extra cover. Slower ball dug in short and wide outside off. He checks himself on the lofted cut. Ends up dabbing it for Williamson running back
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square's left
slower ball, short of a length and just outside off. Mistimed pull to deep square
length at the stumps, punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: squares him as he beats the outside edge. Good length and ripping away from off stump. He was shaping to poke that through midwicket
good length and spinning into off stump. Looks to whip off the back foot, gets it onto his back leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: googly, good length and outside off. Punched back to the bowler off the back foot
short of a length and wide outside off, whipped to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, jabbed to short third man
drilled past the bowler. Full and just outside off, keeps the front leg out of the way and gets the drive along the ground and nutmegs the bowler
short of a length outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
short of a length just outside off, under-edge on the pull to deep square
short of a length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: good length and ripping in sharply from off. Poked out to midwicket off the back foot
googly, on a length and onto leg stump. Whipped to deep backward square
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: googly at a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: good length and turning in towards middle stump. Shuffles and looks to whip off the hips. Cops it on the thigh pad and survives the lbw appeal

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
low full toss at middle stump, punched straight to midwicket who fumbles and gives them a run at long-on
full and just outside off, driven ambitiously, but with little force, to extra cover
swept over square leg! Vintage Pant. Good length ball in at middle and off. He gets on one knee and pulls out one of the cleanest sweeps, right off the middle
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length and wide outside off, cut to third man
good length just outside off, punched firmly to md-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: inside edge onto pad. Googly, good length and wide outside off. Looks to drive away from the body

lbw appeal given. Two sounds on it. Rahane runs the timer out and decides not to review. it's a quick googly outside off, he's on the front foot for the block. He's beaten on the inside edge and is right in front of off and middle. No question on the line there. And seemingly no edge on that

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahane, no run
long_text: short of a length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, going away from him. Cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: lbw appeal as he walks across and looks to punch to midwicket. Slider from a length that might have missed off stump

clips off stump first ball! Good length, a slider starting from just outside off stump. It's a regulation legbreak. Hetmyer backs away and looks to drive through the covers with all stumps exposed. It marginally gets the outside edge of the off stump
past the keeper. Good length and onto the pads. Gets forward for the flick and it defects off the thigh guard
pulls it over the midwicket boundary. Short of a length at middle stump, rising up at the hips and he gets his weight onto the front foot as he pulls
short of a length at off stump, pushed to point's left
slogged to the midwicket boundary. Good length and just outside off, onto the front foot and across the angle he goes
past backward point's jump. Full and wide outside off. Reaches out and chops at that. Nadeem stretches high to his left with both hands and only manages a fingertip on it
low full toss at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
good length across the corridor, looks to drill it on the rise through cover and gets an inside edge to the keeper
pummeled past mid-off. Full slower ball outside off. Waits with a forward and stride and swings powerfully though the line
short of a length and down leg side. Backs away and punches to long-on
good length at middle stump, jabbed to midwicket off the front foot
short of a length and just outside off, walks into the leg side and punches to cover's left
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on
outside edge safely wide of slip. Short of a length and rising up outside off. Looks to pull
short at middle stump, crunches the hook out to deep square

missed run-out chance as the ball slips out of Holder's hand. A yorker at off stump, jammed pitch side on the off side. Hetmyer takes off for a speculative run and is sent back. Holder's lost the ball just as he looks to release the throw
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to cover's left
short of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and into leg stump, whipped out to deep square
good length on leg stump, flicked to miwicket

survives a run-out chance at the non-striker's end. Good length and just outside off, punched to straight extra cover's right and takes off. Rahane's bat stop as he slides it at the other end. A direct hit would have had him. Vijay Shankar the fielder with a one-handed pick up and throw
good length outside off, walks into that punch into the covers
good length ad down leg side. Walks down and misses on the flick
good length and onto leg stump. Looks to flick and cops it on the pad
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, under-edge to the keeper on the attempted cut

slapped straight to mid-off! Good length and sliding into middle stump. He backs away to make room and meets this on the up with an angled bat. Possibly looking to go over mid-off but he gets no elevation. Straight into Warner's lap
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
full and down leg side, beaten on the sweep
full and just outside off, mistimed slog to long-on's left
short o a length and sliding onto middle stump, backs away and cuts into the covers
full and into leg stump, flicked through square leg
dropped short and wide outside off, waits on that and cuts it past backward point
good length and just outside off, punched into the covers
short and wide outside off stump, punched straight to extra cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
chipped wide of mid-on. Full inswinger onto leg stump. Half a stride out and meets it on the pitch before whipping the wrists at it

taken at mid-off! They have Delhi's form batsman for a golden duck. Classic Sandeep - a full ball hooping away from middle and off stump. Dhawan looks to force a flick through midwicket and closes the face too early. It's off the leading edge and Warner tracks it nicely as he takes short steps backwards and to his right
full and swung in at off stump. Walks down at it and punches to long-on
good length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
slower ball at a length outside off, stays leg side of it and chops to sweeper's right
follow him down leg side with the yorker and he can only jam it back towards the bowler
slower short ball outside off, climbs past his attempted upper cut
full and into the toes, flicked to deep square
chopped over backward point. Short ball, possibly a slower one. KW jumps off the pitch and gets adjacent before bringing out the upper cut
narrowly past leg stump. Yorker past leg stump. Walks into the line to try and ramp this past short fine and misses
full slower ball dipping outside off. Reaches out and chops to deep point's right
good length and very wide outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, just past the tramline as he has a chop at this and misses. Not a wide, deems umpire

lifts his foot to save his toes! There are peculiarities on offer every time Pandey is out in the middle, but this one is new. A yorker headed for his foot and he just lifts it. It slides through between the boot and leg stump
thick edge over short third man. Full slower ball outside off, looks to blaze it over extra cover. The ball grips and rises
good length and very wide outside off, left alone
full and dipping slower ball outside off again. Lunges out at that and flicks to deep square
back-of-the-hand slower ball. Full and floating outside off. Slogged to long-on's right
short of a length at middle stump, backs into the leg side and punches straight to extra cover
slower ball, sliding on low at a length and wide outside off. Shuffles and slogs to deep midwicket off the thick inside edge
full slower ball at middle stump. Shuffles and flicks, gets it off the inside edge and towards short fine
full slower ball wide outside off. Gets on a knee and looks to loft that over extra. Comes off the toe-end and floats down to long-on
swatted to long-on's right. Another high full toss. Dew already? This is outside off and he drags it into the leg side with a pull
short and into leg stump. Backs away and pulls to deep square
just over deep midwicket. High full toss swerving in at middle stump. On the front foot again and with swinging room. Comes off the high part of the bat but there's enough pace on that
pulled between deep midwicket and long-on. Slower short ball, sitting up outside off. Deshpande has fed Pandey his two favourite shots this over - this one is the front foot pull
full toss straight onto his thigh as he walks down. Hurriedly whips it straight to square leg
hammered past the bowler. Loves the straight drives. This one is in the slot, just outside off, he half-steps into the leg side and gets it into the straight boundary, all along the ground
full and just outside off, looks to club through the leg side and gets an inside edge onto boot
good length and into the pads, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and into leg stump, gets deep in the crease and punches to deep midwicket's left

short_text: Axar Patel to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length outside off, steps out and swings through the line. Inside edge onto pad

short_text: Axar Patel to Pandey, no run
long_text: nicely bowled. Anticipating that Pandey will step out. Pushes it flat and slides it off a length, into his body. Steps out and taps it back to the bowler
good length and down leg side, left alone
good length and into off stump, backs away and punches to sweeper

short_text: Axar Patel to Pandey, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length and sliding onto the pads as he steps out. Looks to flick and it deflects to short third man's left
good length and sliding onto leg stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
crunched over the non-striker. Full and at off stump. Clears the front leg as he walks down the pitch and swings sweetly on the rise
good length and just outside off, looks to punch on the up towards long-on. Gets an inside edge onto pad
short ball outside off. Too short. Pandey can't get a pull attempt on it
length and just outside off, 147.9kph, punched into the covers

looks to clear mid-off again, but the bowler's adjusted his length. Slams it into a length just outside off. Saha backs away for another loft, but that keeps getting big on him and he can only end up lofting it like they do at catching practice. Mid-off takes it easily. Falls short of a hundred by 13 runs, but he has done a fantastic job tonight in a more familiar role
gently lofted wide of mid-off. Full and into leg stump. Takes stance down leg side with the stumps exposed and then waits on this drive and opens the face late
full and just outside off, front leg clear as he nails this drive along the ground. Long-on cleans up to his left
backs away and ramps to third man. Slower short ball rising at off stump, Walks into the leg side and deliberately stabs between keeper and short third
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short outside off, steps out and gets an under-edge on the pull
short of a length and down leg side. Backs away and pulls, this slides through from under the shot
short and rising in the corridor. Miscued pull to long-on's left
slower short ball wide outside off, pulled to long-on's right

sweet sound on the pull over midwicket. Short of a length and just outside off. Backs away and times it perfectly. Picks his spot well too. There's no one back on the boundary and this dips into the boundary padding on the full

deflected off the body and into the third man boundary. It's a slower short ball at off stump. He's through the attempted pull early. It hits the him on the right shoulder and trickles past the keeper
short of a length on middle stump, gets behind that and nudges into midwicket
just short of third man. Full and just outside off, looks to go inside-out over cover, ends up slicing it a bit too much
short of a length and just outside off. Cuts aerially to third man's right
good length and into leg stump. Looks to flick aerially and cops that in the mid-riff
good length and just outside off, steps out and punches to deep extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, FOUR runs
long_text: oh lovely placement. They brought cover in and put extra cover out. Saha backs away and punches this length ball to that deep fielder's left off the back foot. Rabada gets a hand on it too with a dive to his left. Manages to push it into the padding with the momentum
short of a length and outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length and into leg stump, shuffles into the off side, exposes the stumps and gets a delicate ramp to the keeper's left. Ashwin gives chase and takes an inelegant tumble

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, SIX runs
long_text: length outside off, leans in and sweeps aerially to the midwicket boundary

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, steps out and drives to extra cover
full slower ball just past leg stump. Looks to flick and cops that on the pad as it dips on him
mistimed lofted drive. To mid-off's left. Good length and into middle stump. Makes room and drives on the up, but the bat turns in his hand. Iyer gives chase and pulls it in
low full toss at off stump, leans in and flicks to deep square
caressed to the point boundary. Short of a length just outside off, waits on that with the feet static, and then opens the face late to punch this to point's left

places the pull to deep square's right for his fifty. This is no flash in the pan, Saha has a superb IPL record as an opener. And in his first game as opener, he's cashed in. Short of a length ball into leg stump, he's cramped a touch but manages to pull from under it and bisect the two fielders in the deep
short of a length and just outside off, off the floor as he opens the face and guides to third man

one-handed swipe to the long leg boundary. This looks like a knuckle ball, good length and moving away from middle stump. He got low and well forward in reaching out for this. Bottom hand came off as he swept
good length and turning away just outside off. Punched on the up to sweeper's right

taken at extra cover. Slows it way down this time, Ashwin, and manages to find some grip and turn. Warner looking to hit this full leg-stump ball with the angle, into the leg side. Ends up slicing it as it turns away and it's an easy catch. Top bowling that to end one of the best knocks of the season

long-off does well to get a hand but only manages to swat it into the boundary padding to his left. Length ball pushed through fast and he made room to slap this on the up. Nortje ran to his left and looked to push that in on the half-volley with his left hand
good length on middle stump, gets forward and flicks to deep square
length and just outside off, onto the back foot and punches straight to extra cover
short and into leg stump, aerial pull to deep square's right
full and just outside off, poked out to mid-off
full and just outside off, driven to mid-off's right and his throw at the non-striker's end is misfielded by the fielder backing up at square leg. They get an extra run
full and just outside off. Makes room to try and drive to mid-off's left. Doesn't connect well enough
full and just outside off, hangs leg side of that and lifts this cover drive to sweeper's left
low full toss at leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length on leg stump, pushed to deep square's right with soft hands
short of a length at off stump, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left
good length and sliding into the corridor, backs away and punches to sweeper's left
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
elegant. He's a good player of spin, this guy. Steps out and meets the length ball on its pitch outside off and lifts his drive over the bowler
good length outside off, gets forward and low and sweeps to deep square's left
full and into off stump, leans in and flicks to deep square
full and into middle stump. Looks for the flick, gets an inside edge onto pad that deflects into the covers
good length and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, FOUR runs
long_text: full and just outside off, gets low and sweeps sweetly off the middle, all along the ground to deep square's left

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Saha, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, steps out for the flick, cops it on the body
good length and just outside off, waits on it this time and opens the face late to steer this to short third man's elft

slashed to the backward this man boundary for the fifty! Oh this is some birthday bash for Warner. A 25-ball half-century. This is on a length and pushed wide of him and he reaches out with an open face. There is a sweeper point but he won't get close
launched it over wide long-on! Short of a length and at middle stump again. This time he doesn't defend - makes room instead and takes him on with the pull and nails the connection this time
good length and cramped on off stump, defended into the off side
slapped over extra cover. Good length and pushed wide outside off. Front leg in the leg side, arms reaching way outside off and lifted on the rise
swatted to mid-on's right. Short and just outside off, goes horizontal bat and across the angle with the pull. It's not off the middle but there's enough
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Warner, FOUR runs
long_text: punched wide of mid-off and beats his sprint too. Good length and into middle stump. Had to jump quickly into the leg side to make room, but did it well enough for the power into the punch
good length on leg stump, whipped to long-on's left off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Warner, no run
long_text: dropped short and wide, waits on that and hits the cut straight to extra cover
good length and into leg stump. Pulled aerially to deep square's left
good length at middle stump, backs away and punches to long-on off the back foot
short of a length and into the legs, looks to tickle that fine, cops it on the thigh guard for a run to short fine's right
good length and into leg stump, uses the angle to deep square's left
slower short ball wide outside off, quick feet as he jumps out to reach that and then cut it between backward point and cover
crunches it past the bowler. Warner again with the front leg well out of the way, and this is a full ball just outside off
good length and just outside off, punched into the covers
good length and into the pads. Uses the angle to flick this aerially over midwicket. Safely wide of deep square
steps across and swipes this through the backward square region. Good length at middle and off, decent stride out and a nice swing through that
sliced over point. Length ball wide outside off and he opens the face to try and clear the covers off the front foot
good length at off stump, punched to long-off, off the back foot
stays still this time and uses the angle to swipe this over square leg. Good length and onto leg stump. Got the front leg across and swept from under that
short of a length and sliding into his body again as he looks to open up the covers with a punch
good length and sliding into leg stump. Looks to to back away and punch through cover but finds extra
good length and just outside off, allows it on and jabs it to third man's left. Slips at the other end as he thinks of the second
full at off stump, looks to drive on the rise and gets it off the thick inside edge to mid-on
just clears cover. Length ball outside off, gets a stride out and looks to lift that over the infield on the up, but that comes off the toe end and plonks into the turf past the back-pedaling Stoinis
flicked past square leg. Full and into the pads. Waits on that and flicks aerially, but safely to the diving fielder's right

inside edge past the keeper and into the fine leg boundary. Good length and just outside off, reaches out at that and looks to drive on the up. Possibly through the leg side. Didn't get anywhere near it

swiped over mid-on. Good length and just outside off. Keeps the front leg in the leg side and swings across the line. It comes off the inside half. Deshpande pulls it back in with a slide at the boundary
beaten on the edge. Short of a length and rising up in the corridor as he feels for it
hurried pull but a controlled one in the end. This is short of a length and into his body. Pulled off the high part and well to fine leg's left
short of a length and curving away outside off, mistimed punch on the up

good length and just outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot. A direct hit at the striker's end from Axar Patel. It deflects towards the midwicket boundary but Saha's gone a long way after grounding his bat and the chance of a second is gone
good length and just outside off, angled in. Defended to midwicket off the inside half
full and into off stump, watchfully pushed into the covers

sealed with a leg-bye. That is five straight wins. Short of a length again, quick again, but they run off the thigh pad. There might have been an inside edge because the umpire hasn't ruled this a leg-bye
nearly a run-out. Short of a length, just outside off, he opens the face, but the point is in close. Pooran has to go back, but they will get the overthrow
short of a length, quick, runs this down to third man for one
full, fast, 147ks, some movement away. Beats the outside edge

massive slower ball. At 122ks. He is looking to leave it, but it is still there in front of his face. So he looks to ramp it, but ends up gloving it to short third man. Stand up and applaud another Gayle special. The game was in the balance when he came out to bat. The game is no more now
and Mandeep celebrates this performance with a six. Again Cummins misses his yorker mark by a few inches, and this time he goes to his favourite area: over midwicket
bouncer, looks to ramp it away, but it is too high. Not called a wide
just short of the yorker length, and he goes over extra cover for four more. Hit off the cue, but has enough in it to clear the infield
looks to move around in the crease, and Cummins slips in a wide yorker to earn a dot
another yorker, dug out for one to long-on
starts off with the perfect yorker, in front of off. Dug out back to him
looks to pull this short ball, it skids on to his his thigh pad and go away for a leg-bye
slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out for one

short of a length again, inside edge, just short and wide of the keeper. That is the fifty. He flashes the big smile and "The Boss" sign on the back of his bat. And this time it is written the right way, and not upside-down
even shorter than last ball, and somehow manages to stay full of the pulling length. Defended

oh Gayle at his best. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this ball except that it is bowled to Universe Boss. Short of a length, rib-high, 140-plus ks, and still he punches this over mid-off for a six. That is extraordinary
lovely bouncer at 146ks, gets it shoulder high, but the top edge goes fine of fine leg for four
regal pull shot. Short, outside off, and he pulls the pants off it. In front of square it goes. One-bounce four again
short of a length, around off, no room. Opens the face on this

yorker, runs off the inside half of the bat for one. Singh looks to the skies and blows a kiss. Paying tribute to his father, whom he lost three days ago. Can't believe how he is even managing to play, let alone compete at such high level. A special fifty
short of a length, just outside off, opens the face, but can't place it wide of point
short, and Singh gets inside the line to pull this to deep midwicket. Into the fence, on the first bounce
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point
wrong'un, goes back to push this down to long-on for one
short of a length, and he goes back to bludgeon it down the ground, straight of long-on. Tripathi puts in a big dive to keep them down to one
on a length, quick, angling across him, pushed between point and cover-point, and he comes back for two
this one looks like the other one, and he goes back punch this into the leg side for one
slower in the air, drags the length back, pushed to extra cover
legcutter, too full, and Singh drops his back knee to drive him over extra cover. Lovely shot
slower ball, on a length, into the pads, beats his pull, concedes a leg-bye
another bouncer, 148ks, but he has gone too high with it
quick bouncer, 152ks. Singh looks to use the pace and upper-cut him, but it is too quick for him
full and fast, 152.5ks, but the pace doesn't matter if you pitch it in the slot. He drives this wide of long-on for four. That is the one shot he has enjoyed tonight
short of a length again, pushed to the right of pint, and Rana puts a dive in but the collection is not clean. They pinch the single
short of a length, outside off, he looks to run it down, gets a bottom edge through to the keeper
slower ball, on a length, runs this down to third man for one
carrom ball, beats him, hits him on the pad, but is turning too much after pitching on leg
but now he will amble through for a couple after dunking this length ball into a gap deep on the leg side
on a length, outside off, pushed to point. He is not charging through for ones
too short, too slow, and Gayle goes deep in the crease to pull this over wide long-on. They keep writing him off every year, but Gayle keeps writing himself back in
on a length, outside off, punches this square of deep cover, but Gayle is not sprinting a tight second
offbreak, on a length, and he pushes this just wide of cover for a quick single
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
that is how difficult it is to bowl to Gayle. Ferguson has nearly nailed this yorker, but Gayle takes this on the full and opens the face to beat point to his right
slower legcutter, Singh plays the late-cut, but the man at point gets a hand to it with a dive
shorter, meaner, 140ks, and beats him on the hook. Gets is higher than the shoulder
gets the length right now. Short of a length, 145ks, jags back in, beats the inside edge
not with on-pace length balls, no he won't. Singh is staying deep to loft this. Goes wide of long-on
gets one in his slot, well in his slot, and Gaule depostis this leg-side half-volley over wide long-on. Such smart batting. Nothing to do with length balls, and take toll of the full ones
on a length, outside off, and he has left it alone. Gayle is not taking any risks against Narine
offbreak, starts straight, concedes a leg-bye even though he has beaten him
down the leg side, plays the vertical sweep to long leg for one
on a length, straight, punched to midwicket
Singh chips the first ball to long-off for one

he is going to take the risk with the googly, look to buy the wicket, but again just a touch too full. Gayle knows he can clear this field with a mis-hit if this is in his zone. And this is not sweetly hit, and yet the skier clears long-off with ease
Mr Gayle announces himself. Varun makes the mistake of bowling a touch too full, and Gayle knows he is clearing this short boundary if it is in his zone. Goes over long-on
quick legcutter, beats him on the outside edge as he defends
wide and skiddy, cut away to deep cover
Singh pulls out a timely reverse hit. This is a legcutter, outside off, and bounces on him. Seems like he has been beaten but he catches up with it and sends it over short third man
on a length, outside off, cut away, but straight to point
on a length, on off. Gayle pays him respect. Defends
seam-up knuckle ball, chipped off the outside edge, over the bowler's head
offbreak, slow, and stays low, and takes the inside edge onto the pad
slow length ball, outside off, he opens the face, gets a single as the diving slip deflects this into a gap
into the pads, worked to leg for one
flighted outside off, pushed to cover

given out lbw, and Rahul is not using the review. And I think this is missing leg, but I will wait for the replays to prove me wrong. Looks like the skiddy wrong'un from around off, and the sharp quick turn beats him. Umpire Illingworth raises the finger, but the question is: is it turning too much? We will have to wait for the end of the timeout for the answer. Umpire's call on the leg stump
on a length, outside off, this time the cut goes straight to point
too short, wide, and he goes back to cut it square of deep cover. Delays the cut to get this placement
short of a length, quicker, punched down the ground, but not wide enough of Varun to his right
legcutter, driven in the air, just to the left of Varun, who is not quick enough to thrust a hand out
on a length, around off, goes with the angle. Pushed to leg for one
another away-swinger. Looks like that knuckle-ball seam-up floater. Gets a bottom edge on it. Single to short third man
offbreak, middle and leg, pushed deep into the leg side for two
short of a length, pulled into the leg side
yes this is swing and not turn. Again it dips and swings. Pushed to short cover. It is a carrom ball bowled with the seam up
slight swing away from Rahul, driven to deep cover. Seam-up this time. Perhaps the last one was too
carrom ball, outside off, beats his cut
wrong'un, on a length, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
on a length, outside off, hit off the toe end to cover-point
full and straight, pushed down to long-on for one
quicker, fuller, on off, pushed to short cover again
on a length, just outside off, Singh goes deep to punch this to short cover
legcutter, on a length, punched to cover-point
slower ball, on a length, outside off, punched to backward point
short of a length, short-arm pull to deep square for one
on a length, straight, and he swipes across its line. Not a clean hit but clears midwicket in the circle, and that is all you need in the first six overs

Has Tripathi manufactured a run-out here? Singh has got back in by a frame. Pushes this short-of-a-length ball to deep point, Tripathi charges at it from deep cover, picks up one-handed and throws in the same motion. Singh is struggling, but he just about makes it
low full toss, around leg, dug out to short cover
Mandeep gets going. He is waiting for this length. Short of a length, around off, and he stays in the crease to pull this over midwicket
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, dropped towards point for one
extra bounce. Rahul shuffles across early, and then backs away. Kirshna goes short of a length, and the loopy bounce beats him cut
short of a length, straight, runs off the thick outside edge to point
low full toss, 143ks, on off. Knocking practice. Drives this straight of mid-off for four
Rahul takes charge. Stays back to a length ball, moves to off, and lofts him over wide mid-on. Not the cleanest of strikes but enough in it to go away for four
short of a length, wide, cut straight to cover-point again
short of a length, just outside off, drops this wide of cover for one
tries the big swing down the line, gets too far under it, but the mis-hit clears mid-off. Just about
full, just outside off, he makes room to drive, but can't beat cover-point
looks for the pull to a wide short ball at 146ks. Well just short of a length and not a long hop. Beats the pull on the bottom edge
on a length, aiming top of off. Singh defends this back to him

lovely shot. All hands and strong wrists. This shortish ball gets big on him, but he goes through with the back-foot drive. To the right of cover-point. Nagarkoti's chase and dive saves two runs for KKR. Well he saves one, and casual running saves the other
on a length, outside off, not much power in this drive. A single wide of mid-off
nearly played on. He looks to open the face on this, but it jabs back a little to take the bottom edge. His feet save him from getting bowled
wide length ball, driven on the up, but can't beat cover-point
short of a length, 141ks, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, straight, punched wide of mid-on for one
length ball, outside off, hits him high on the bat as Singh defends
short of a length, at off, runs off the thick edge to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to point
beaten on the outside edge This length ball seams away despite a wobbly seam
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
some excitement first ball, but it fizzles out soon. Rahul has steered this to third man. It nearly carries all the way, but then Krishna lets it slide through his legs
beats him with a yorker, but it does my head in why they don't try to run the bye. Really strange they won't keep running till they are run out
looks to ramp it instead of looking to take the single to hand over the strike to Ferguson. Jordan beats him and uproots the leg stump
full and straight, doesn't let him get under it, driven to long-on just for the one
really full again, dug out wide of long-on, but they take just the one
length ball, angling in, cramping him up for room. Varun gets two leg-byes fine of fine leg
gets the yorker almost right. No way Ferguson is getting under the low full toss. Just the single to long-off
short of a length, into the ribs, they get a leg-bye
Ferguson sends a question mark to Gill. Why did you deny me the strike? Makes room, and takes this full ball and sends it over extra cover for a six
full toss, middle and leg, pushed towards wide mid-off for one
low full toss, right in the hitting slot, but he hits this straight to deep midwicket. Just a chip instead of a full-blooded slog. Perhaps Shami denied him any slogging room by following him
makes room, Shami follows him with a full and straight delivery. He hits this straight to long-on, and turns down the single
oh right in the sweet hitting slot, but Ferguson doesn't get all of it. Just the single to long-on
low full toss again, down the leg side, dug out to deep midwicket for one. They have missed out on three straight full tosses
another low full toss, and he ends up hitting this straight to deep backward square leg for one
full toss, hits his pad, on the full, Jordan appeals big time, but this is headed down leg. Gill has just moved too far across to take toll of this full toss
yorker almost, middle and leg, dug out down to long-on for one
short, wide, on-pace, and he flays at it. Upper-cuts it over point for four more
this ball is relief. Full, outside off, with mid-off up. And on-pace. Driven wide of mid-off and along the ground
classy shot. Ashwin stays wide with his legbreak,s but pitches this up this time, and he is down on his back knee to loft thim over extra cover
full, on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
wrong'un, quick and on a length, so Ferguson opens the face late to guide this past slip for four
another wide legbreak, and there is some turn on it. Mis-hit straight of cover, and he will take the one now
looks for the reverse sweep to this wide legbreak. Beaten
wide legbreak, punched straight to extra cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ferguson, no run
long_text: sweeps this from well outside off, and Gill has now turned down the single. He wants strike at the start of the next over

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ferguson, no run
long_text: down the wicket first ball, Bishnoi bowls a wide legbreak, and he is lucky to get a bit of an inside edge

this is a straighter wrong'un, and he gets his man. Cummins wants to review, but they don't have a review left. This googly starts just outside off, and it is closer than the last one, but it is still headed down leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Cummins, no run
long_text: another wrong'un, beats him comprehensively this time, but this is sliding down leg. Not given. But he has convinced his captain to go for the review. Replays show it is missing leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Cummins, no run
long_text: wrong'un this time, worked to leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Cummins, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, he plays for the turn, gets an inside edge onto the pad
wrong'un, from outside off, he gets an inside edge on it for one
another tentative push back to him
flighted just outside off, defended
quick, flat legbreak, Cummins is tentative as he pushes at it from deep inside the crease. Just gets an outside edge, past slip

that ends a tortured stay for Nagarkoti. And it is torture when you are not picking legspinners. Misses another wrong'un as he looks for a big cover drive, and this turns back enough to hit the wicket
full, slow, just outside off, thick edge back to him

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gill, no run
long_text: full, outside off, driven to extra cover
flat, into the pads, placed wide of deep midwicket. That is a fifty for Gill. Good to seem him back with form and intent
chipped back over his head. Unconvincing shot again
slow, full, down leg, runs off the inside half of the bat fine on the leg side for a couple
on a length, on off, turns away, punched to deep cover for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gill, no run
long_text: legbreak, just outside off, punched straight to extra cover
fails to pick the googly again. It can get really difficult if you are not picking it from the hand. Looking for a big booming drive, and then gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
short, slow, Gill won't get any timing into this. Just the single to long-on
this one has sat in the surface. Nagarkoti aborts his cut and ends up checking his shot. Just clears cover-point
doesn't read the googly again, this one starts from within the stumps and hits him on the pad. Going down leg, though
wide wrong'un, comes back in a long way, he dabs on it, but can't clear slip
some turn for this legbreak, hit back to him
wrong'un, he picks it, works it into the leg side for a single
legbreak, middle and off, turning away, pushed to long-on for one
pushed to deep cover for one as he gets too full

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Nagarkoti,, no run
long_text: another wrong'un, and this time he picks it and defends it off the front foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Nagarkoti,, no run
long_text: wrong'un outside off, and he has not picked it. The inside edge hits the pad
flat, length ball, punched to wide long-off
slower ball, and Narine has dragged this on. Wide off cutter, on a length, Narine is looking to go over cover with his drive, but gets the toe-end of the bat onto his wicket
shorter, higher, wide
cheeky. Jordan goes short and at his body, but he ramps this over the keeper's head. Just arches a little to make the room
short of a length, outside off, punched to point
gets away with this. Short of a length, into the body, handcuffs him with the angle. Narine throws his bat at it, and manages to clear midwicket with this aerial hit
looks to dig it in short, but gets it only rib high. And also down leg
slower ball, short, wide, cut away for one
yorker, outside off, beats him on the inside edge
short, wide, cut away to deep point for one

Bushnoi strikes. Wrong'un outside leg, Morgan goes for the aerial sweep, just that degree of spin means the connection is not the sweetest, and even on these short boundaries, that results in a catch at deep backward square leg
flatter, on a length, punched to long-off for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gill, SIX runs
long_text: Gill just keeps clearing long-on. This is not a half-volley. Bishnoi has bowled a legbreak on length, but his reach means he can access it and go over long-on
slow in the air, outside off, swept along the ground to deep midwicket for one
down the wicket first up, ends up dragging this to long-on for one. No turn on the ball
Morgan is looking to get outside the line of off and access the leg side, but ends up playing a cover drive to this length ball. Straight to extra cover. Just the respite KXIP needed
short of a length, widish, out of his reach, and quick. Beaten
slower ball, short, outside off, pulled down to long-on for one
wide and full, he drives at it, gets a bottom edge through to the keeper. Along the ground
short, wide, he looks to cut, but his back foot is stuck on the leg stump. Beaten on the cut
Morgan is looking to charge him, and Jordan starts off with a slower ball to keep him in check. Punched to deep point

slog sweep. With the spin, against the spin, it doesn't matter. They are not letting the spinners bowl. Reminiscent of the Samson-Smith assault against CSK. Down on a knee to send this over wide long-on
full, middle and off, dragged to short midwicket
slider, short, wide, cut away for one to deep point

Morgan is in some mood. He is taking these short boundaries on and succeeding. This is not off the middle of the bat but has cleared long-on with ease. He skips down and just goes through it with full conviction even though he is not to the pitch of the ball
flighted outside off, pushed back to the right of Ashwin
on a length, on off, some turn, punched down to long-off for one
flat low six. Maxwell bowls only slightly short, but that is enough for these small boundaries. Morgan goes over deep backward square leg. It is a skimmer
slow in the air, on a length, some turn, pushed to extra cover
on a length, middle and off, punched down to long-on for one
on a length, into the pads, punched to deep midwicket
excellent batting. Top shot. Makes room, takes this from way outside leg, and drives him over extra cover for four
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover

this is into the road. This is T20. Who cares if you have lost three early wickets? You still have seven over the next 17 overs. Shami bowls a half-volley on the pads, and he languidly clips this over wide long-on. LOvely to watch
lovely shot. Gill seemed to have turned a corner last game the way he struck the ball, and now he is showing more of it. High-arm on-the-up punch to a length ball, all the way over long-on
down the wicket, gets too close to the pitch of this ball, but sneaks in a single to mid-off
short of a length, no room, Morgan plays a bit of a late-cut, guiding this wide of point, using Shami's pace
looks to hook this bouncer, but is beaten. Looks really high to me but not called a wide
Morgan continues to punch back. Skips down the wicket again, turns this into a length ball and goes over mid-on

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Gill, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, hits the inside half of the bat as he drives

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: that is dismissive. He skips down the wicket, Arshdeep digs this in short, and he pulls this through square leg. Rolls his wrists on this
angling in, Morgan stands his ground and flicks this to deep square for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Morgan, FOUR runs
long_text: Morgan keeps charging at him, Arshdeep bowls a wide length ball, and he gets a thick outside edge well fine of third man who is placed square
again extra bounce from just short of a length, but he gets a single to mid-off this time

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Gill, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, he punches this on top of the bounce. Straight to point
down the wicket, creates a bit of a driving length, but ends up toe-ending this to cover-point
cramps him up with this shortish ball, punched straight to point this time
short of a length, not too wide, but he upper-cuts this over point. This one travels. Just one bounce into the fence
on a length, angling into the pads, clipped away for a single to deep square leg
half-volley on the pads, beats his attempt to flick this away. Missed out on runs here
on a length, just outside off. Defended
down the wicket, slightly early into the shot but clears midwicket with a swipe

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Morgan, no run
long_text: slight shimmy down the wicket, defends this length ball outside off

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Morgan, no run
long_text: length ball outside off, left alone as it holds its line
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
wide length ball, too wide

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Gill, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, left alone

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: full, on the pads, clipped away square on the leg side

this is even better. Too good in fact: he has been given but Karthik has reviewed it immediately. Lovely length ball, just outside off, holds its line, there is a sound as it passes his bat. Karthik contends the sound has come from his bat hitting the pad, but the Snicko shows a spike at the exact moment the ball is next to the bat. And it does also hit the pad at around the same time. So the benefit of the doubt has to go to the on-field call
leaves alone outside off now. It is a little Test-like
Shami strikes. Test-match lines and lengths. Attacking top of off on the angle, and then leaving him after pitching. Top-quality bowling. Tripathi pushes at it with an open face, and edges it through
Maxwell saves three. Push-driven on the up, straight of cover, wide of mid-off. It beats the first man, but Maxwell cuts the angle and puts in a big dive
short of a length, skids through, hits him high on the pad after nipping in and beating his bat
on a length, outside off, holds its line. He leaves it alone
quicker, flatter, shorter. Defended with an open face
Tripathi takes on deep midwicket and wins. The confidence from a fresh wicket and a small ground. He slog-sweeps this just over the fence
stays on a length, on the pads, punched to wide long-on
on a length, outside leg, pushed wide of short midwicket for one

Rana annihilated Ashwin the other day, but he is out first ball to a much lesser offspinner. The shot is on. This is a length ball, outside leg, both square leg and fine leg inside the circle. So the sweep is on, but all he manages is a soft top edge straight to Gayle at short fine leg
full, outside leg, clipped to deep midwicket for one
lifts it over extra cover to seal the win. Low full toss pushed across him, reaches out and opens the face perfectly

swipes it over midwicket to bring up his second IPL hundred! This is what Stokes does when he gets past 50 in the IPL - turns them into hundreds. Length ball picked up with a pristine pull shot.
