He's struggled to get the runs away but has been pretty close to flawless tonight. His previous century also came in chase, this is a record in the IPL
short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut
slower short ball down leg side, pulled out to deep backward square
full on the pads, flicked straight to short fine
short and just outside off. Check-pull down to long-on as that stops on him
full and following him down leg side. Driven on the bounce to the bowler
low full toss outside off, driven to long-off's left
top edge over the keeper. Short and across the corridor, looks to pull along the ground and this is into the third man boundary
short and climbing across middle stump. Sways out of the way to let it go
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
slower short ball at leg stump, pulled into the square leg region
good length outside off, allows that on ad chops to third man's left. Comes back for the second and puts in a slide to get into the nineties. It's sent upstairs for the run out but he was well in
good length on leg stump, glanced to deep square's left
yorker into leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tickled fine. Yorker dipping down leg side and he helps it along off the front foot
slower ball at a length on middle stump, waits on that and nudges with soft hands to long-on's left
thick outside edge fine of short third man. Slower short ball rising outside off. Backs into the leg side and goes hard with the cut that he's ultimately not in control of
length and at the body, shoveled into the vacant midwicket region off the back foot
just clears extra cover. Slower short ball outside off, waits on that for the lofted cut which comes off the toe-end. Sweeper cleans up to the left

short of a length outside off, allows it on and drags this to deep midwicket's left to bring up his fifty. Flexes his left bicep and gives it a pat with the bat as he acknowledges the applause from his dugout
tickled fine. Attempted yorker is a low full toss heading down leg side. Stays tall and closes the face delicately on this

short and angled down leg side. Waits on it and caresses this with a pull, to fine leg's right. Desperate slide to the right from Pattinson after an intense sprint. Gets a hand but can't stop that rolling into the boundary
slower ball, short of a length and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper's right
slower short ball just outside off, pulled to deep square
yorker down leg side, thuds the pads as he looks to flick

steps out and slaps it on the up over the bowler! That is an incredible shot because he's been beaten in flight but still manages to get six. It's slow and dipping at a length outside off. He's almost had to go flat-batted to clear the rope, the way you would after you step out to a fast bowler

chopped past point. Chahar loops this at a length, wide outside off. Usually the kind of delivery a leggie bowls when he expects the batsman to step out. Samson stays deep, gets the front foot out and gets this square drive to the fielder's left
googly, short of a length at leg stump. Pulled to deep midwicket
steps out and drills it over the bowler's head. It's length and pushed through at middle stump. He's met that at the pitch and launched it off the low part of the bat
full and wide outside off, loses shape as he looks to blaze this through the covers. Off the inside edge down to long-on
good length and down leg side, cops the attempted sweep on the pad
deft and effective. Short and climbing in the corridor. He leaps off the ground, watches that right under his eyes and opens the face to dab this past short third man
slower short ball down leg side, left alone

a beauty from Samson! Trademark straight six against the fast bowler. It's a length ball just outside off, he's so well balanced as he swings through the line of this and lofts it over the long-off boundary. Sweet, sweet connection
yorker at middle stump, can't get the drive away. Single at midwicket
beaten on the ramp. Short of a length and climbing above middle stump as he drops into the off side

low full toss outside off, hangs deep and drills this to long-off's left. Pollard does superbly to sprint across and slide to his left, but even better to stop himself from sliding into the boundary padding
short and wide outside off, reaches out and slaps it on the up to extra cover's left
good length at middle stump, gets low for the ramp but is through it early. Looks like that hit the glove, after coming off the cue-end
diagonal run up again. Googly at a length on off stump, defended into the covers
beaten on the cut. Chahar goes to the diagonal run up between umpire and stumps. He's still over the wicket. Short of a length and climbing away from him
short of a length outside off, punched to deep extra cover off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
slides through under the bat. Googly, short of a length and spinning across the corridor as he looks to pull this over deep midwicket
appeal for lbw turned down.
full and just outside off, misitimed drive to extra cover
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length slower ball outside off. Chopped to sweeper cover
good length and into the body, tapped past the non-striker off the back foot
short and well down leg side. QDK leaps a long way to his left to gather
slower short ball just outside off, backs away and finds point with a well-timed cut

short of a length and into leg stump, swiped with the turn and there's a mix-up between deep square and deep midwicket as they converge. Neither is sure which one has to sprint at this. In the end it's into the boundary and that is Stokes' first fifty of the season and it's come off 28 balls
low full toss on leg stump, clears the front leg and pumps it between non-striker and stumps. Too quick for long-on to his right
yorker at leg stump, squeezed out to deep extra cover's right
another yorker, just inside the tramline. Left alone again. QDK can't gather cleanly
fires a yorker ust inside the tramline, left alone
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
good length cutter outside off, clipped to deep midwicket off the front foot
full slower ball, spins down leg side. Left alone
short of a length and just outside off, punched to long-off
full slower ball, down leg side. Rolls out to the keeper
lbw appeal is turned down as Stokes gets in a tangle attempting the reverse sweep. It's a length ball from around the wicket, it's come off the glove
slower ball at a length outside off, gets a little too much bat for a second on this pat to long-on's right
slower ball at a length on middle stump, leans in and tucks it to long-on's right
launched over long-off! Sweet as ever. It's overpitched outside off, he hangs back to open up the exact spot he's hit it in. A clean swing with the straight bat offered
good length at middle stump, a bit late on the slog sweep. It dribbes out to deep midwicket
good length and just outside off. Punched to extra cover's left off the back foot
tossed up outside off, mistimed drive to long-on
dropped short outside off, punched to long-off from the back foot

reverse sweep past backward point. And rapidly too. Picks this full one from outside leg, is almost arching by the end of that to get it in front of his pad. The fielder can barely get a hand out to his left
gets the slog sweep over deep midwicket. His first six of the season. This is a length ball, pushed flat at middle stump. Gets on one knee and swings cleanly across it
full and down leg side, beaten on the sweep
short and wide slower ball outside off. Stabbed to backward point
slower ball, skidding on outside off. Short of a length. Subdued pull to long-on's left
beaten as he runs down at this. Short and wide and past the tramline
good length and just outside off, a languid punch down to long-off
full and wide outside off, driven along the ground to sweeper cover
slower ball, short of a length and past the outside edge as he looks to steer to third man
full slower ball outside off, leans in and flicks through midwicket

just out of Hardik's reach at deep midwicket. A difficult one but a drop nonetheless, because he had made the ground. Good length ball at middle stump, slices the attempted slog sweep. Hardik runs backwards and to his right, but can't get his hands on it as he lunges. It bounces well inside the line and trickles into the boundary. Looks it like it curved away from him at the end
finally threads one. Full and tossed up at off stump. Gets down on the back knee and gets the reverse sweep square of short third man
low full toss wide outside off, slashed straight to cover
full on leg stump, backs into the leg side for room and drives straight to extra cover
beaten on the reverse sweep. That was full and across his off stump
good length at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
good length and at middle stump. Defended to mid-on off the back foot
bouncer down leg side, left alone
short at leg stump. Awkwardly fended into the leg side. Stokes goes halfway down and then back as Samson refuses the run

inside edge and onto leg stump! That's a good delivery from Pattinson. Gets it to jag back in off a good length from outside off. Smith is looking to force it through the covers for the initial line and the movement is enough for the ball to take the inside edge. Leg stump if out of the gorund
beaten as he looks for the ramp. Short of a length and climbing over leg stump as Smith steps into the off side
slower full ball at off stump. Front leg out of the way as he check-punches to mid-off
just clears mid-on. Good length at leg stump, gets big on him as he offers the full face and looks to loft it on the rise
short of a length and just outside off, beaten on the chop

hoicked over the square leg boundary! Hangs deep in the crease, waits for the length ball angled into him. Then swishes from from under that, a complete closing of the bat's face. To the point that the bat face is facing the bowler after a full rotation after he completes this shot
short and going across him. Looks like he wanted to pull that initially, but followed it with his hands. Got decent timing on the push through the off side, but point tumbles to the left and stops
good length and cramped at middle and off. Hurriedly stabs to mid-on
good length and in at off stump, defended off the front foot

oh lovely timing! Good length and slanted into the corridor. Forces this drive off the back foot and gets it to Pollard's left at mid-off. He gives chase, puts in the slide and pulls it in. It keeps rolling towards the line with the momentum though and on his second attempt to keep it in, he touches the boundary padding
sliced past extra cover! Walking into the leg side again. Boult overpitches on a stumps line. Stokes has made plenty of room and drives on the rise. A little uppishly but to the fielder's right
lofted over the bowler. Not off the middle, that sticks in the pitch a little. But it's got enough. Full ball, and the full face offered. Trickles into the padding as mid-off and mid-on give chase
drilled past the bowler's ankles. He walks into the leg side. Boult follows him with an attempted yorker. Stokes meets it on the full though and punches firmly
short of a length outside off, punched into the covers
good length and into the pads. Walks into that, as he does, and clips it through midwicket
good length at leg stump, defended to mid-on
short of a length outside off, nicely behind the line to defend off the back foot
taken at mid-on. Locked on the front foot again. This is a length ball outside off. He wants to shovel that wide of mid-on. But it's off the high part of the bat and floats gently to Pollard's left
full and just outside off, a nice stride forward as he drives elegantly to mid-off's left
good length and cutting into the corridor. Gets forward and pats it to midwicket
good length and angled into the corridor. Punched to mid-on
lofted over midwicket. Short of a length and just outside off. He's locked on the front foot but he watches closely and lifts the pull sweetly
good length on middle stump, gets the front leg across and pats this uppushly to mid-on's right
good length and tight at the stumps. Defended down the pitch
good length and swung into the corridor. Punched on the rise to mid-on's left
beaten. Good length and going across off stump as he feels for the one coming into him
leading edge falls short of backward point and the bad bounce sneaks through him. Full and just outside off, looked for the straight drive but brought an angled bat down on that
good length, and an inswinger outside off. Leans in for the drive. Hard hands get him a thick inside edge to midwicket's right

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: clubs this over the bowler Unreal hitting arcs on this guy. Completely intimidates the young bowler, who has bowled yet another length ball right at that back leg which is deep in the crease outside off stump. That's the slot for Pandya. And he uses his core strength to hammer it on the up from there

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: brings up fifty with his sixth six. Short and wide outside off, split stance and then quick hands from under this. He doesn't time it too well but it's wide of long-off and into the boards

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, FOUR runs
long_text: lofted over extra cover. Good length and wide outside off, the back leg is out to give him the reach and he opens the face late. It's off  the low part of the bat but it's in the gap

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, FOUR runs
long_text: slapped to the extra cover boundary. Once again, he puts the back leg into the off side and sets up with a split stance. Tyagi goes short and wide and he chucks the hands at this and gets it over extra cover

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: clears deep midwicket. Casual. Short of a length ball outside off, he gets the back leg into the off side to get in line of that and pulls it cleanly
full and just outside off. Attempted drive comes off the toe-end and trickles down to long-on
slower short ball outside off, mistimed pull out to deep square
short and just outside off, gets on his toes for the upper cut but is beaten
yorker just outside off, chopped straight to point
full and just outside off, wants to pierce the covers with the drive but he hits this straight to extra cover. There was no sweeper
yorker at middle stump, jammed into the covers
taken at long-on. Low full toss at middle stump, wants to loft it over that fielder but it's come off the low part of the bat and is taken well inside
another full toss and it is sent over square! 27 off Rajpoot's last over. He finishes with 60 off his four. Full toss on leg stump at 133kph. Hardik merely waits and lifts
pulls this over vacant fine leg. Shuffles to open up that side of the ground and Rajpoot gives him a thigh-height full toss on leg stump. He simply lifts it with the angle

whipped over long-off! This is overpitched outside off, his feet are static but he gets his upper body out on top of the ball as he meets it, and then whips his wrists out at it. That is an ode to the helicopter shot
short and at the body, misses on the attempted pull
full and just outside off, drilled along the floor to sweeper cover
high full toss lifted past long-on. Just. It's outside off and his attempted pull is not off the middle of the bat. It is wide of long-on though, and just to his right
yorker just past the tramline outside off
swipes it over the long leg boundary. Lost the radar with this one too, did Jofra. Short and angled into the hips from around the wicket. Tiwary swivels and helps it along
full and just outside off, clears the front leg and lifts this straight over the bowler. Jofra missed on the yorker
low full toss outside off, driven to long-off's left
yorker at middle stump, jammed down towards long-on
inside edge past short fine. He follows Tiwary down leg side and he can't get the attempted slog away
legcutter, good length and in at off stump. Punched to extra cover

dropped at deep midwicket. Tewatia had that in his grasp but couldn't keep it as he went to floor. Good length ball outside off, a slog off the inside half. He caught it in front of his right shin but it popped out as he lost balance and went forward
just short of fine leg. Cramps him with another bouncer. He gets bat on the hook this time but not enough for it to carry

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Tiwary, no run
long_text: bouncer at the front shoulder, swivels to try and hook but that's past him
low full toss at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and across him from middle stump at 135kph. Pushed into the covers off the outside half
full and just outside off, shuffles and drives to long-off
tossed up full outside off, out to the pitch of that before driving to long-off
googly at a length on middle stump, defended to midwicktet's left
googly, short and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
full and just outside off, leans in for the drive to long-off
short of a length and wide outside off, toe-ended cut to extra cover's right
hammered to sweeper's left. Dropped short and very wide outside off. Reaches out and muscles the cut
googly, short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
googly at middle stump, defended into the covers
slugs it wide of deep midwicket. Good length and lobbed up slowly at leg stump. Steps out and gets it a little off the inside half of the bat. Still nearly clears the line to the fielder's right
googly at leg stump, reaches out and defends on the front foot
good length at leg stump, looks to stab through midwicket off the back foot and gets an outside edge to short third's left. Strange outcome, because that ball was actually coming into him
low full toss on leg stump, driven to long-on's left

cuts through him and takes out the stumps! Oh that'll feel good for the bowler. It's a googly, landing on a good length outside off. Pollard is on the back foot and swishing outside the line of this as it spins past the inside edge and tonks off stump. That's the first time Pollard has been dismissed since the season opener
full and just outside off, defended down the pitch

Stokes with the one-handed pluck attempt at long-off, but this one has a lot more venom in it. He goes with his right-hand too, but that's a bit past him when he jumps and he can only help it along. Full and wide outside off and he used his reach to drive firmly through the line
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot

lofted straight to long-off. SKY is playing this loft off the back foot, because he wants to make room to go from in to out and over extra cover. But he's managed to lift this full ball from middle stump straight into Stokes' hands
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
googly, full and just outside leg stump. Looks for the sweep and cops it on the pad
short and wide outside off. Had to make his own pace on the cut. Found point, where Uthappa misfields
googly at a length outside off, pushed to short third man with an open face
full and at leg stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket
full on leg stump, driven to the bowler along the floor
short at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Tiwary, no run
long_text: rapidly past the bat. A quick yorker outside off to wake him up

one-handed pluck from Jofra at third man Tyagi has his head in his hands. It's a tough one, slightly self-inflicted after he took a couple of steps in, but Archer watches it closely, jumps upwards and back to stretch and grab this one-handed. It's a short ball outside off, he looks for the upper cut and seems to have just gotten away at first glance. Not tonight. Jofra's team-mates are dumbstruck after that effort. all but Ben Stokes, who looks to the skies and cackles

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Ishan, no run
long_text: inside edge onto thigh. Looks for the big slog across the line at this short and wide ball outside off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Ishan, no run
long_text: full and wide outside off, looks for the drive through cover but only manages to jam it into the pitch
full and into the pads, flicked to deep square
helps it wide of short fine. Low full toss at leg stump, gets down on a knee and uses the pace from the quicker one to ramp it to the long leg boundary
short of a length and turning away from outside off. Lofted pull towards deep midwicket
googly, short of a length on middle. Gets back and whips through square leg
good length and down leg side, shuffles and paddles to short fine's right
leading edge lands safely in the off side. Was looking to slog this googly from middle stump
short of a length and just outside off, gets deep and whips this to Stokes' left at long-on. Puts in a slide and parries it in for Buttler at deep midwicket to retrieve

lovely loft straight over the bowler. This is full outside off, he puts in a small stride to get to the pitch and is clear about where he wants to hit that. Just a gentle raise of the bat after meeting the ball on the drive
good length on leg, flicked to deep midwicket

dropped by sweeper. Tewatia running in. A tough chance low and in front of him. Full ball lofted, inside-out and straight in line with Tewatia at deep cover, but he had to sprint in a lot and just managed to get his palms under that as he put in a slide. Couldn't hold on

sliced over point. Probably not where he intended to go, but you can't always tell with SKY. It's a length ball outside off, he steps out and goes inside-out. The bat turns in his hands but he clears point comfortably
googly, good length and turning away wide outside off. He shuffles to open up the leg side but is forced to pull towards long-on because of the slow pace
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot
full on off stump, driven along the floor to long-off
full and into off stump, check-driven back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, drives straight to extra cover
good length and sticking in the surface as he drives on the up again. Falls just short of extra cover
tossed up outside off, nicely to the pitch as he drives to long-off's left this time
good length and just outside off, lifts it inside-out with the turn and on the rise to sweeper cover's right
full and just outside off, driven to long-off
fuller and quicker outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
short and pushed wide outside off. Cut on the bounce to extra cover
good length and just outside off, mistimed punch to cover
good length at off stump, no turn on that. Punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and sliding into the pad down leg side as he looks to punch through midwicket
short and cramping him at middle stump, jumps to get on top of that and gets it as far as point
slower short ball, sitting up nicely down leg side. Reaches out and slaps this over short fine. Hard enough to just clear the boundary too
good length and just outside off, under-edge into the pitch as he looks to poke into the covers
good length and punched to mid-on's right
ramps to the long leg boundary. Mr. Reverse V. This is short of a length outside off, even moving away from him. But he reaches out and swishes his bat to lift it over the infield
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: overpitched and with the angle into his toes. Stays tall and gets his flick to short fine's left

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: inside edge past keeper. One for everyone, so far, runs only for two of them. Good length and cutting into the corridor as he looks to force it through cover off the back foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's right

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Ishan, no run
long_text: short of a length and just outside off, punched firmly off the back foot to find short cover point
good length and just outside off, pushed out towards third man
short of a length at middle stump, swipes across that to find deep square with a thick inside edge
short at leg stump, miscued pull out to deep square
past the edge. Short of a length at middle and off. Arches into the leg side for try and steer to third man again
expertly done. Short and angled across him. Third man is in, point is in, he opens the face and helps it between them
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square

slower ball, short of a length and down leg side. Samson gets his body behind this after diving to the left. Stokes from slip picks that up and throws at the no-striker's end where Kishan was diving after being sent back. Was safely in and there was no direct hit
good length and down leg side, 134kph, can't get bat on it
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers

big lbw appeal. Rajpoot has swung it into the pads from over the wicket. Those are difficult to get on the review. Smith doesn't review. It was full and Kishan's head was falling over as he looked to play the flick. Tracking says it pitched outside leg
good length and in at off stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
good length and just outside off. Gets forward and opens the face to steer to third man
past the left shoulder. Try pulling that. Kishan won't. Sways away from it to let it pass
beaten on the pull. Short and across off stump. Stays lower than he expects and is past the under-edge

good length and at leg stump. Looks for the flick and cops that on the pad and is limping before going to ground. Looks like that hit him on the side of the right knee, just where the knee roll of the pad ends
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
good length at the stumps, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
pulled to the midwicket boundary. Short of a length and just outside off, hangs deep in the crease and swipes across the angle. Aerial for a bit but safe
short of a length and wide outside off, looks to drive on the rise but goes too hard. Under-edge into the covers
good length and just outside off, defended on the back foot

inside edge is past the keeper. Short of a length and across him. Angled bat from Kishan too as he looks to go square. It comes on slower than he expects. Misses off stump comfortably, and then Buttler's Samson's right hand
length and curving down leg side, past the flick
full inswinger just outside off, leans in to that and defends into the covers
good length and just outside off, hard-handed push on the front foot. Thick inside edge runs to fine leg's left
short and down leg side, beaten on the attempted pull

chopped on! Jofra delivers, almost every time. Good length and swung away outside off. Stays still and reaches out with an angled bat, trying to stab that towards third man. It's a big inside edge onto stumps

short_text: Archer to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: slapped over square leg. He's in terrific form to be pulling Jofra for six from just short of a good length. No movement on that, he drops his back shoulder to get the weight back and uses the pace to launch this

short_text: Archer to de Kock, no run
Archer to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length on leg stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
edge is past second slip. Short of a length and swung away from middle stump. He follows with his hands and ends up steering to third man's right
sealed with a six. Pace on the ball, short into the body, and he plays the pick-up pull over long leg
low full toss, dug out to short cover
on a length, on-pace, the story of RCB'a defence. Gaikwad picks it up over midwicket for four more
on a length, just outside off, inside edge onto the boot
nearly a yorker, 144ks, Dhoni pushes this back to him
low full toss, hit down the ground and along the ground and straight to mid-off
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
slower ball, short of a length, wide, cut hard to backward point
on a length, outside off, looks to punch this hard but doesn't get any power into this
Dhoni will not take this deep. On-pace length ball with mid-off up, and he picks his spot. Goes over wide mid-off for four
Dhoni wants to hit an early six, leaves the crease, but is done in in the air, and ends up with just the single to long-on
on a length, Dhoni rocks back, punches this hard but straight to extra cover
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
full again, drilled to long-off for one
slow, high, dipping, driven nicely to long-off for one
slow, full, drifting in. Leg-bye as Dhoni misses with his attempted nurdle
short and wide, lucky to get away with it as Dhoni has cut this straight to deep cover
full, straight, 145ks, swinging in, pushed to short midwicket
on a length, angling in, pushed past midwicket for one
full and straight, pushed to long-on for one
full, 145ks, just outside off, punched to mid-off
wide length ball, driven on the up to deep cover. Pace on again
short again, on-pace again, 143s. Dhoni pulls him handsomely again. And there is no deep square leg in place
they all know he likes the bouncer. It is the one in the ribs that causes his trouble. Not a chest-high short ball outside off, and pulls this square of that long leg. Again an on-pace delivery
on a length, middle and leg, some late swing to beat his attempt to work it to leg
quick length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
short again, and a wide down the leg side
short ball, 140ks, he pulls this hard but can't beat long leg
on a length, cramping him up, pushed back to him
too full again, driven down to long-on for another single
full, really full, driven to long-off for one. Brings up his maiden IPL fifty
on a length, sliding down, worked behind square for one
big shriek of a YES from Kohli as Rayudu sweeps all around a full legbreak. He is bowled neck and crop. The off stump gone. Chahal comes back and creates a chance. Who would have thought?
legbreak, on a length, goes back to punch this to deep cover
cuts away a length ball for a single
on a length, middle and leg, bunted into the leg side for two
short of a length, quick, punched to short midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip
full, outside leg, worked to deep midwicket for one
slight shimmy, then wegiht transfer back to a flat delivery. Punches this down to long-on

Rayudu creates all the momentum and timing with his charge down the wicket. And even though Siraj has slowed this down to 127ks, he times it perfectly for a six over long-on. Turns this into a length ball with his charged down the wicket
short of a length, straight, pulled down the ground but not past the short straight midwicket
slower bouncer creates an opportunity. Who would have thought it? The top edge doesn't carry to deep square leg, though
oh sweet god, finally we see a slower ball, worked to leg for one
half-volley at 140ks. RCB bowlers infuriating here. Haven't they watched how CSk bowled? Gaikwad accepts the gift with thanks and pushes this wide of mid-off for four
on a length, on off, 140ks, worked to leg for one
on a length, angling towards off, worked behind square on the leg side for one
down the wicket, not to its pitch, but pushes it past cover for another single
short, and it turns to defeat his pull. Bottom edge to short fine for a single
on a length, straight, driven down to long-on for one
on the pads, on a length, worked around the corner for one
nails a sweep first ball. Down on a knee early, takes a length ball and sweeps it over square leg
full and straight, 146ks, driven down to long-on
pace on the ball again. Rayudu skips down the wicket. Saini goes short of a length and wide at 140ks. Rayudu of course loves the pace, and goes up and over point
on a length, 146ks this time, defended back to him
pace on the ball. Short, wide, 144ks. Rayudu loves it. Upper-cuts it for a six
on a length, 144ks, just outside off, defended off the back foot
on a length, just outside off, Rayudu gets a thick inside edge even as he looks to drive past cover
on a length, outside off, he goes back to open the face for a single to short third man
flighted, on off, driven back to him
excellent bowling but Rayudu gets away with it. No slip in place. He has got lovely dip on this, Rayudu is playing for the offbreak, but it goes straight on and takes the outside edge for four
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
quicker, on a length, turning in, defended
top shot. Gaikwad in the zone here. Skips down the wicket, gets close to this ball, and goes against the turn to clear long-off. Timing. Something RCB batsmen struggled for
p[itched up slightly, driven to deep cover for one
looks for the late cut but this slow legbreak beats him just outside off
lovely sweep. On a length, middle and leg, and he sweeps down on it, and between long leg and deep midwicket
slower in the air, just outside off, swept to deep square leg
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, there is appeal for pad first, but this is turning too much. Not given
quick, length ball, a lebgreak. Defended with an open face
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
nice flight and drift, he covers it and drives this to long-on for one
full, outside off, pushed to short cover
sweep from outside off, gets a single to deep backward square
dip and then turn. Hit uppishy back to Moeen but doesn't carry
some turn on this offbreak, worked to leg for one
on a length, at him, hits him high on the bat
wide half-volley outswinger, driven straight to short extra cover
top delivery. On a length, on-pace, pitches just outside off and then seams away against the angle. Beats him
slower ball, full, outside off, pushed to cover
full, swinging out, push-driven past extra cover for two

and Morris strikes first ball back. Du Plessis looks to use the pace on this seam-up delivery. It is on a length, and he is looking to go over cover. Ends up toe-ending it, and Siraj takes a smart catch running back
slider, middle and leg, runs off the inside half of the bat
perfect length-ball legbreak, runs off the outside half of the bat, and another single at cover-point grants them a single
slow, tossed up high, and wide. Gaikwad stays back to cut this to cover-point where a fumble gets them two
looks like a wrong'un, picked off the surface and defended
pushed to deep cover for one

dropped but this is a thick edge for a keeper. Gaikwad goes back to cut a shortish ball, and gets a thick thick edge. It is a big deflection. Not really a drop. The only way it is getting caught is off a deflection of the glove but it lands safe

short_text: Siraj to du Plessis, no run
long_text: du Plessis winds up for a big hit down the ground, Siraj bowls a good slower ball on a length and just outside off. He has to change his mind, and defend to cover

short_text: Siraj to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: not smart. A quick bouncer on a slow pitch with the fine leg up. You want to bounce them? Get the field first. The top edge sails over short fine leg for six

short_text: Siraj to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: ramp this time. Siraj bowls a length ball, short of a length, and du Plessis goes deep in the crease to send this over short fine leg
run-out missed. On a length, outside off, pushed straight to Kohli at point, and he missed wildly with the direct hit
Gaikwad taking them on now. He skips down the wicket, Siraj bowls short of a length, outside off, and he gets on top of the bounce and goes up and over cover with a high-elbow drive
full, outside off, some swing, defended to cover

short_text: Sundar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slight shimmy, yorks himself up, digs this out back to Sundar
on a length, middle and leg, and he uses soft hands to place this wide of midwicket for two
quick length ball, punched down to long-on for one
on a length, angling in, uses soft hands, places this to the left of deep midwicket for two

another nice shot. He knows long-on is back, so he makes room and chips this over mid-off. Just an extension of the arms, and a chip, but he has timed it well enough to send this all the way for a six
on a length, on off, punched to short straight midwicket

short_text: Morris to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: lovoly shot. On-pace, on a length, middle and leg, and he lofts this over midwicket. Using the new ball and the early pace of the pitch

short_text: Morris to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: tries the yorker, I think, but it is down leg anyway, and he glances this fine of short fine leg for four

short_text: Morris to du Plessis, no run
long_text: length ball, 133ks, offcutter, hits him high on the bat. Doesn't carry to short cover
on a length, angling in, clipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length, straight, tucked away off the hip for one
on a length, straight, pushed to mid-on for one. Padikkal is a little slow there

short_text: Sundar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to short midwicket
on a length, quick offbreak, punched down to long-on for one
down the wicket, Sundar spears this in at his heels. Yorks him
pitched up outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, into the body, pushed to short straight midwicket
pretty straight, some turn immediately. More overspin. Pushed back to him
Man  skips down the wicket, yorks himself up, gets a single to extra cover
slower again, short of a length, hit in the air for a single to long-off
lovely shot first up. Slower ball, on a length, outside off, and he stands his ground to drive this over extra cover for four
yorker. The pitch doesn't matter here. This is just the quick yorker after that big slower one last ball. Disturbs the furniture
big slower ball, 114ks, Morris is well early into the slog. Beaten
short of a length, on-pace, pulled to deep midwicket for one

yet another man perished trying to take on the slowness of this pitch. Excellent catch too. Slower ball, on off, right in the slot, but Kohli can't get enough in it as he looks to clear long-off. Du Plessis sprints to his right to make the catch
looks to slog at a length ball, gets the inside half of the bat for a single to deep midwicket

short_text: Sam Curran to Morris, no run
long_text: sharp bouncer, 136ks, hits his helmet right in the badge. Excellent free-hit delivery

short_text: Sam Curran to Kohli, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: high full toss, steered down to third man. Another fifty for Kohli. In difficult conditions for T20 batting. No-ball too
low full toss, outside off, dug out to long-on for one
down the wicket, low full toss, driven to long-off for one
sees Kohli skip down the wicket, he slips in a lovely wide full delivery past him. And oh, wait a second, this is a shocker. It has been called a wide. It is well inside that wide marker
Ali looks to take on the slow pitch and perishes. Skips down, gets a length ball in the slot, but he ends up hitting this slower offcutter straight to long-off
down the wicket, Chahar follows him, and he pushes this low full toss wide of long-on for two
Moeen looks to smack the first ball big, gets an edge towards long-on for one
short of a length to the advancing Kohli. Just the single to point
the slowness of the surface gets de Villiers. A length ball, in the slot, and he looks to hit a six. The knuckle ball does him in, and the mis-hit goes straight down long-on's throat
full, in the slot, and he hits this hard but straight to long-on. He is not happy, and lets out a grunt
Kohli is skipping down again to make his own pace. Mis-hits this cover-drive but he has placed this in front of deep cover. Comes back for two
quick length ball, middle and leg, pushed into the leg side for one
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for another single
Kohli has had enough. Skips down the track, also makes sure he makes room so that he can swing through this. Flat six back over him. Six No. 200 in IPL for Kohli
full, middle and off, driven to deep cover for one
length ball, into the pads, worked away to leg

short_text: Monu Kumar to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: and he fails to protect a decent over as he slips down leg with this length ball, which de Villiers whips fine of fine leg for four
Kohli stands his ground this time, and drives this full ball down to long-on for one
yorker, down the leg side, right on the money. Dug out for just one

short_text: Monu Kumar to AB, (no ball) 2 runs
long_text: yoekr gone wrong, high full toss, pulled down square on the leg side. Called a no-ball. Chahar's misfield costs them two runs
Kohli is charging at him to create his own pace, but Monu is making it slower. Swiped to deep midwicket for one
down the wicket again, and this time Monu slides down the leg
wide length ball, hit hard to extra cover, and they take the single
slower ball as Kohli gives him the charge. Pulled to deep midwicket for one
flighted, slower in the air, uses soft hands to place this wide of short cover for one
goes back to punch this length ball to deep cover
Kohli nearly holes out. He jumps out of the crease, Jadeja pulls the length back, and he is beaten so comprehensively in the flight that the mis-hit doesn't even carry to long-on
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, on off, he opens the face, but can't place this wide of point
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to short extra cover

brute power and timing. Down the wicket to take this on the half-volley and drills this down the ground. Straight of long-off it goes for four. Only the second fifty second between Kohli and de Villiers when playing CSK
looks like the wrong'un, just outside off, and he pushes this length ball to deep cover
on a length, middle and off, pushed to extra cover
short of a length, ho goes back and punches this square of dee cover for two
all hands and wrists to create some power on a slow pitch. Tahir has bowled a half-volley, and he drives all along the ground and wide of long-off
flighted, full, nearly a yorker, dug out to extra cover
down the wicket, Jadeja pulls the length back, and Kohli can't beat that ring of short mid-off, cover and extra cover
gets too straight, and Kohli places this into a gap on the leg side
full, just outside off, driven straight to extra cover
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover
full, outside off, hit hard to the left of Jadeja, who gets a hand to it but can't field it. Actually he has ended up hitting it in the air while looking to keep it down. So a drop from Jadeja
full, middle and off, driven to deep cover for one
pitched up, on off, driven to long-off for one

can't call this a drop. Hit really hard back at Tahir, who does well to get a hand to it and take the sting off. Faf, the man at long-on, though, completely misses the ball before Santner puts in a desperate dive to save one run
legbreak, on a length, on off, pushed straight to cover
really full again, driven to long-off for one
nearly yorks him, dug out back to him
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
tossed up, on off, driven straight to short cover
slower in the air, turns, takes the outside edge towards short third man. This time de Villiers takes the one
slow length ball, opens the face, and this time AB calls a big NO out
flat length ball, punched to long-off for one
leading edge as this sticks in the surface, but it doesn't carry to the bowler
on a length, middle and leg, pushed square of short straight midwicket for one
short, wide, de Villiers rocks back to cut this in front of square and beats the man at deep cover to his right
Jadeja misses de Villiers. Kohli has hit this straight to Jadeja at short third, and responds to AB's call. But Ab is really struggling except that Jadeja misses with the direct hit
whipped towards long-on, but can't beat that straight midwicket
uses wrists to drag this drive towards long-on, and comes back for two as he has hit this straight of the man
full, straight, worked into the leg side for one
he opens the face now to take a single to short third man
full, on off, driven to long-off for another single
half-volley, on off, driven to deep cover for one
driven powerfully, down to long-on for one
quick turn, runs uppishly off the high part of the bat, but goes wide of cover for one
Tahir is quite a few yards off the deep cover fence, which has resulted in four. Driven past cover in the circle, and Tahir fails to cut the angle or dive to his right. This has cost them two runs
full, middle and off, defended to cover
de Villiers behind the line this time and works this to leg
shorter, and it sits in the surface. Takes extra bounce, and beats his attempt to play to cover
goes back to work this length ball into the leg side
back-foot drive to this legbreak for a single to long-off
on a length, turns away from around off, and he punches it to short cover
pitched up, middle and leg, he drives this down to long-on for one
fuller, Kohli drives this down to long-off for one
on a length, and there is turn again. He goes back to punch this past point
short of a length, some turn, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, outside off, he goes back to work this past cover-point for one
driven to long-on for one

Padikkal does the right thing but the pitch is slow. He wants to take on spin early, when the ball is still coming on. He steps out to try to hit him over long-on, but he sends it only as far as Faf du Plessis at long-on. While tumbling over he relays the catch to Gaikwad to his left, and Padikkal is gone
on a length, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: slower ball, does him in, but the inside edge goes onto the pad

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, into the pads, and Padikkal whips it over square leg for four. All unfurling of the wrists to place it square on the leg side
full and just outside off, pushed to long-off
full and straight, driven down to long-on for one
full, just outside off, pushed past cover
flat, quicker, into the body, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
full, dipping on him, defended to cover
stays back to whip this length ball to deep square
stays back to punch a length ball to cover
and he likes that angle. Gets inside the line of a full ball and sweeps this over square leg for four
pitched up, slow in the air, just outside off, pushed wide of cover for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, pushed towards point, who is in tight on the single

Finch will have to wait another day to come off. Curran sees him come down at him, and slips in the slower bouncer, which also cramps Finch up. Finch goes ahead with the aggressive shot, managing only a skier to cover
full, angling in, clipped to deep midwicket for one
walks down at him, Curran pulls the length back, he works this to deep square for one
slower ball, Padikkal well early into the shot, ends up dragging this towards deep midwicket, but it doesn't carry to the man
wide down the leg side as he looks for a yorker
full, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on
excellent delivery. Trying to swing this away, but it goes pretty straight in the air, pitches on a length on middle and leg, and then leaves him to beat the bat
Finch doesn't quite walk at him this time, but is on the front foot to push this wide of point for one
swings in again, Padikkal looks for a whip into the leg side and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
on a length, swinging in, headed towards middle and leg. Defended
that is a bit of Jayasuriya. A length ball, wide outside off, and he stays back to cut this over point. All the way for six. And this man is way taller than Jayasuriya
makes room to try to go over the off side, but is beaten outside off

short_text: Monu Kumar to Finch, FOUR runs
long_text: down the wicket again, but catches up with this leg-side wide this time and tickles it away for four to fine leg
walks down the wicket, another wide down the leg side

short_text: Monu Kumar to Finch, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, pushed back to Kumar

short_text: Monu Kumar to Finch, no run
long_text: short and wide, at 127ks. Looks like a bit of a cutter. Finch tries to pull, there is a sound as the ball goes past his bat but nobody appeals. Nothing on the snicko
big wide down the leg side, bowled at 133ks
wide length ball, cut away to square third man

short_text: Monu Kumar to Padikkal, no run
long_text: short of a length, 132ks, some extra bounce. Pushed to point with an open face

short_text: Monu Kumar to Padikkal, no run
long_text: wide length ball, 134ks, outside off, left alone
inswinger, he sees it early, and also sees it sliding down leg, which gives him the freedom to swing through its line. Plays the pick-up shot over midwicket with a bit of a whip of the wrists
length-ball outswinger, he stays in the crease and lofts him over mid-off. Doesn't try to hit a six. Just enough to clear the infield
down the wicket again, Chahah bowls a good outswinger around off. Defended back to him
walking at him again. He has been doing this all IPL, it seems like. Chahar bowls the inswinger, and that beats him, but he has managed to get outside the line. Gets two leg-byes off the thigh pad
this one swings away from the left-hand batsman, but the pitch is slow and he picks it off the pitch and dabs this behind square on the off side
pitched up, wide outside off, left alone

run out at the striker's end as Khaleel takes a walk. Good length and just outside off, dabs this to point and literally takes a walk for the most part until he sees point sprinting in at that. It's too late by then and the direct hit has him

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Ahmed, no run
long_text: slower ball, short of a length and just outside off and defended into the off side.

Jordan settles under that at long-on and takes it! Kings XI are all but there. another short of a length ball, dug in as a cutter. Sitting up at off stump. He backs away and pulls off the toe-end. Jordan watches closely as he moves with the ball and lunges at the very end to take it close to the ground. It's coming off spectacularly for KXIP - they want them to hit leg side and leg side is exactly where they've tried to hit

taken at midwicket. Slower ball, short and in at off stump. Sandeep backs into the leg side and makes room. He has swinging room for the pull but it's come off the toe-end and Ashwin plukcs it running to his right
skied pull shot well in front of fine leg. They take the run. Short and into the body, gets under it and pulls aerially off the high part of the bat
he sends it about a yard down the pitch. It's a length ball, just outside off, there for the slog. Slog he does, but it's not his man skill. Off the under-edge and into the pitch
full and just outside off, dipping into the corridor. Leans in for an elegant cover drive to sweeper cover

he's scythed it straight to sweeper cover! Oh, you're kidding me! Good length ball wide outside off, stretches out at that and simply throws his hands at it, with an open face. It's a long, long boundary and the fielder runs in and takes a straightforward catch

sliced straight to extra cover! This is full and just outside off. He clears the front leg and wants to go inside-out over extra. The fielder is right on the circle and Holder's bat turns in the hands. This is a simple catch for Mandeep
full and just outside off, looks to drive through cover and gets an inside edge onto pad
nails the yorker at middle stump. Some dip and hoop inwards at Holder, who can only jab it down to long-on

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Garg, no run
long_text: good length, another cutter outside off. Gets forward and opens the face to find backward point

he's got him! Arshdeep's strangle has resulted in an edge. Rolls the fingers on this. Remember, he's around the wicket. So the short of length ball is into Shankar's body. Shankar is walking down into the leg side to try and open the face and get this through backward point and short third man. He gets a thin outside edge to Rahul

Shankar is down on the ground after running through to the striker's end. The throw has hit him on the left side of the head. He is wearing a helmet against pacers. He usually doesn't, against spinners, and such a blow could have been fatal in that case. He has also survived a run-out chance. It's a short ball just outside off, stabbed to point where Pooran is the man. He sprints in, gather and throws it on the bounce and Shankar is struck on the grille as he grounds his bat. Looks dramatic as he goes down because he was also sprinting full speed. But the medical team is out quickly and he is on his feet pretty soon as well. He's okay. Shakes hands with Pooran and the exchange smiles. He's good to bat on.
short of a length and just outside off, clips to short fine's left off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, turns it to midwicket's right off the back foot

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Holder, no run
long_text: cops that on the box, it appears. Short of a length ball sneaks under his attempted pull and catches him flush in the box

oh gorgeous! Another picturesque lofted drive to the straight boundary from Shankar. Mid-off was in so there's no risk in this. It's a length ball just outside off, his feet are static and he offers the full face to loft this over the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
short of a length and just outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
full and just outside off, inside edge onto pad as he looks to stab this through cover

taken by long-off running to his right! It's J Suchith, perennial IPL super-sub fielder. Pandey's release shot doesn't come off. This is a full ball just outside off, he looks for the long drive over the bowler's head but it comes off the bottom. Suchith sprints to his right and times the jump perfectly as he takes it with a reverse cup. Then he lands delicately enough to hang on and do a lap in front of his dugout
full toss down leg side, has a hack at that and misses

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: googly, short and wide outside off, cut to backward point off the under-edge

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length, wide outside off, looks for the slog sweep and is beaten

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, pushed back at the bowler
good length and wide outside off, slapped on the rise to long-off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
good length outside off, jabbed into the covers on the front foot
full outside off, opens the face and runs it through point

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Shankar, FOUR runs
long_text: guided past backward point. Full and wide outside off, reaches out and opens the face to find the third man boundary. Third man was in the circle
full and into the corridor. Slogs across that and gets it off the thick inside edge to deep midwicket

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length outside off, stabbed to extra cover off the back foot
overpitched outside off, sweetly driven to long-off
good length outside off, punched to long-off on the up
elegant and straight past the bowler. The full face offered again on Shankar's big stride out and he lofts this past where the umpire's head might have been if he hadn't ducked
tossed up wide outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
googly, short of a length and turning into the corridor. Backs away for the cut and in the end he's just scrambling to get some bat on it
short and wide outside off, a crisp cut to sweeper cover
good length outside off, jabbed back to the bowler

too much for long-on. This is full and tossed up on leg stump. Gets a nice stride to meet this at the pitch and drives uppishly with the full face offered. It's to long-on's left and Jordan puts in a big dive to his left but can only parry it into the boundary padding
good length and just outside off, pushed back to the bowler on the bounce
full on the pads, flicked to deep backward square
short and wide outside off, cut on a slow pitch ends up on the bounce at extra cover
full and just outside off, driven to Maxwell's right at mid-off. He gets the direct hit in and they send it upstairs, but Pandey is safely grounded
good length and in at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
short and wide outside off, he's beaten on the cut

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
googly, short and wide outside off. Chopped to backward point's right and they steal a run as Mandeep puts the throw in
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length and wide outside off, mistimed drive out to long-off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, punched to midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length and in at middle, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, driven to long-on with the angle
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length and down leg side, past the flick
good length and just outside off, feet static as he pushes this to short extra
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
checks the punch and it ends up at mid-off. The pitch is gripping. Short and wide outside off and he pulls out of a forceful punch through cover
short and outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length and into middle stump, punched towards deep midwicket off the inside half
good length and onto leg stump. Glanced to deep backward square off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length outside off, defended on the front foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Shankar, no run
long_text: googly, good length and turning in from wide outside off. Big stride out to defend
googly, short of a length on middle stump. Punched aerially towards long-on

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto leg stump. Defended onto pad off the inside edge
yorker length at off stump, pushed out to short extra cover
can't clear mid-off. Overpitched and just outside off, wanted to loft that and was in decent shape and all. But he couldn't find the elevation to beat Chirs Jordan's perfectly-timed leap
good length on middle stump, jabbed towards long-on
yorker just outside off, jammed out towards backward point
good length and just outside off, a handsome punch on the up to sweeper cover

short_text: Shami to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: yorker at leg stump, stays tall and helps that fine off the low part of the bat
good length at middle stump, hurries him on the back foot as he defends
full outside off, nicely to the pitch of that to drive to long-off's left
googly, wide outside off, reaches out and drives to point's right
full and coming in from outside off. Looks to crunch that through the covers, gets it down to long-on off the inside half

bowled round his legs but this is more his doing than the bowler's. This is a full, slider at leg stump and he's walked across into the off side to try and sweep it. He's missed by a long way and that slides into leg stump
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, no run
long_text: huge lbw appeal turned down and KL reviews again. Good length ball slides past the inside edge as he gets forward to defend and catches him on the back thigh in front of middle stump. Ultra Edge confirms no bat on it. Tracker shows that is missing leg stump by climbing over it. So a decent shout from Paul Reiffel and KXIP are out of reviews with that
good length at off stump, pushed to short cover's left

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: short of a length and angled into middle stump, onto the back foot to pat this to midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandey, no run
long_text: googly jumping into the pad as he gets on the back foot. He can't get the glance away

appeal for catch behind is reviewed by Rahul who looks very confident. It's a full googly outside off, Warner is looking for the reverse whip again, possibly aerial this time. It's past him and into KL's gloves. The ball goes by the Warner's glove on the way to the keepere's gloves and right around then, Ultra Edge shows a spike. Warner had a smile after that review was taken, and is shaking his head as he walks off. Seems like he didn't feel that. But it is a good review for KXIP. Warner won't get a 10th consecutive fifty against them

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Warner, FOUR runs
long_text: reverse-whip past short third man. Good length and pushed across him outside off, reaches out and sweeps into the floor and very fine
short of a length outside off, coming back in again. Looks to punch through cover, it comes off the inside half, to the bowler
googly, climbing onto the thigh guard as he stays on the back foot to try and punch this through the leg side
good length and into the corridor, punched to extra cover off the back foot
appeal for lbw as he looks for the reverse sweep against this googly outside off. Rahul says that hit him outside off and turns down the review
oh sweet sound. He has bludgeoned this sweep. Good length and just outside off, down and on the front foot again, and the conventional sweep blazes past square leg
reverse sweep past backward point. Good length legbreak outside off, gets low, makes up his mind, and gets a wonderful bat swing through this. Shami dives over it, to his right
good length and climbing up at leg stump, but Warner swivels on the back leg and gets front-on before dragging this wide of mid-on with a pull shot
good length at middle stump, defended into the covers
flat-batted over the bowler. Short of a length at middle stump, gets the front leg away and hammers this on the up. A slap to clear the bowler
good length outisde off, jabs with hard hands and gets it into the square leg region with a closed face
good length and cutting in from outside off. Cops it on the thigh as he looks to whip into the leg side
good length at off stump, squeezed into the covers from the crease
doesn't pick this googly as it hits his withdrawn bat. It's a length ball wide outside off and his bat is tucked behind the front foot stride as he looks to leave
quicker one, short of a length and outside off. Hurried punch into the pitch
chopped between keeper and slip.Googly coming back in at off stump, just short of a length. He's jumping into the leg side for the cut and this comes off the edge to dribble past Gayle's left shin
good length and wide outside off. Drives inside the line of that to be beaten as it turns away
nearly through him. Googly comes back in sharply as Bairstow is desperate to make room for the punch through the covers. Gets it off the inside half to short fine
dropped short and turning into leg stump. Pulled straight to deep square
low full toss on leg stump, waits on it and clips that to the vacant long leg boundary
full and just outside off, walks down once again and nearly yorks himself. Taps this off the toe-end to mid-off
full on middle stump, walks at that and drives to mid-on
short of a length and just outside off, leaps off the pitch as he nudges this down to third man
just clears mid-off. Short ball climbing across him and he can't smother the angle with his attempted pull
good length and just outside off, keeps the front leg clear and drills this on the up to mid-off
good length and into leg stump, pings off the thick inside edge to short fine as he has a prod at it

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Warner, no run
long_text: good length and cramping him on the mid-riff as he looks to stab that behind square on the leg side

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Warner, SIX runs
long_text: he's swept him. Over square leg. It's an outswinger on a good length and Warner has got down on a knee and turned this high into the leg side. Incredible skill
short of a length and slanted into the corridor. Bairstow looks to force that through the covers and gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg
good length and down leg side, past the attempted flick
good length on leg stump, glanced to deep square off the back foot
good length and just outside off. Chops it into the pitch off the under-edge and looks up to see Warner absolutley haring down for the run
short of a length on leg stump, allows that one and nudges to deep square's right before sprinting back and sliding to make his ground as weak throw comes in
short at middle stump, subdued pull to short fine leg
reaches out and helps that over the extra cover boundary. Overpitched and a lot of width outside off. He got on one knee and ran his hands from under this. Flat and into the ad boards
big lbw appeal as this one swings into Warner. He's beaten on the flick but that pitched and hit him outside the line of leg stump
full and down leg side, can't get bat on it
full and marginal shape away, starting wide outside off. Left alone
good length and in the corridor. Walks into this and opens the face for an easy second to third man's left
low full toss outside off, driven to deep extra cover's left
low full toss outside off, swept along the floor to deep midwicket's left and the throw isn't anywhere near accurate enough
beaten again by the wide yorker outside off. Once againhe goes for the chop, this time he can't get bat on it
yorker just outside off, tries to chop it past short third man but can't beat him

yorker wide outside off, looks for the lap sweep and is beaten. Lovely bowling this, bowling so wide that he can't exploit the square region on the leg side. And with point back on the line, boundary options are difficult

slides though Warner and Rashid backing up behind him can't quite react at the extra cover boundary. Low full toss outside off, driven betweem long-off and deep extra. Looks like it bobbles past Warner's right hand and he misses out as a result

forces him to leave that. A wide yorker outside off, he was shaping for the ramp and withdrew late, probably thought that would have been called wide .oh and it was. Looked okay to me given how much Pooran shuffled
full and just outside off, stabbed out towards long-off
vicious yorker has him scrambling to get his foot out of the way. Manages to squeeze it off the inside edge to short fine

run out chance missed because Khaleel is not at the stumps. Inexplicable, really, there was plenty of time. Warner, the long-on fielder, is furious. It's a length ball nudged towards long-on and the throw is on the bounce and adjacent to the stumps, but the bowler is backing up about a yard and a half behind
at long last, a boundary. After more than 11 overs. A slower short ball at middle stump, sits up nicely for him and he gets half on the front foot and pulls to the square leg boundary

a direct hit at the non-striker's end. And Ashwin is well short. Full slower ball outside off, gets well forward and opens the face to run this to point. Shankar swoops down on that and releases quickly to hit the stumps on the half volley
full and wide outside off, reaches out and slices to third man's right
slower ball cutting in from a length outside off, watchfully dropped pitch side with soft hands
low full toss outside off, driven sweetly along the ground, straight to deep extra cover
full and just outside off, leans in and pushes that to point off the front foot
taken at short fine. Slower short ball just outside off. Looks for the pull shot again but this grips and gets big on him. The top edge floats straight to the fielder
low full toss down leg side, beaten on the flick
slower short ball outside off, waits on that and pulls to deep square's left
full toss wide outside off, toe-ended drive into the covers
good length ball, cutting in at off stump. Inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick this
good length slower ball on leg stump, gets on the back foot and pushes this into the leg side with soft hands
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs to short third
slower short ball just outside off, punched to extra cover's left. Garg slides to his left to keep  that to one
slower ball at a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third
full slower ball outside off, leans in and flicks this down to long-on
full and wide outside off, slashed out to deep backward point
low full toss on leg stump, patted down to long-on
good length cutter, rising past the outside edge as he looks to defend off the back foot
slower ball at a length, pushed wide of the corridor outside off. Looks for the cut, gets it off the under-edge into the pitch
good length on the pads, onto the back foot to push this to short fine leg's left
good length and down leg side, beaten on the flick
full and wide outside off, looks for the big drive off the front foot. Gets it to sweeper's right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jordan, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto off stump, defended off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jordan, no run
long_text: good length and ripping past the outside edge as he hangs the bat out at it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jordan, no run
long_text: good length outside off, pushed into the covers

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jordan, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, gets on the back foot and flicks to short fine

excited stumping appeal from YJB. This legbreak outside off turns past his bat as he looks to flick and his back leg has dragged out and is in the air as that happens. Bairstow quick to break the stumps and that is a straightforward decision for the third umpire
good length and turning into the body. Nudged to deep square's right off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler on the front foot
bouncer in the corridor, sways away from that to let it go. It's above head height
full at middle stump, shuffles and drives to long-on

he finds long-on. Warner tracks it to his right, stretches to take it and drops to the floor to complete it all. It's full and into middle stump. Clears the front leg and looks for the slog, but gets no elevation on it. It's a big boundary and Warner takes it well inside as it dips to his right
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Mistimed pull to long-on's right
knuckle ball at a length outside off, steps out and drives on the rise to long-off's left
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
yorker at off stump, the attempted drive trickles off the toe-end to extra cover
good length outside off, half a stride forward to punch to sweeper's right
good length at off stump, uses the angle and shovels this to deep midwicket
slower ball, short of a length and wide outside off. Slaps that on the rise and to sweeper's left
short of a length and skidding low in the corridor again. Looks to pull again and cops that on the raised front pad
beaten on the pull. That stays lower in the corridor than he expected as he set up on the back foot
full at middle stump, flicked uppishly to deep square's right
short of a length slower ball just outside off, shuffles and clips to fine leg
good length and just outside off, runs it to third man with the angle
full and into middle stump, driven to long-on's left
good length and just outside off, dabs it down to third man with the angle
good length on leg stump, shuffles and glances to fine leg
full and just outside off, driven to long-off's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
full googly outside off, leans in and drives to long-off
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: good length and into the body. Tapped into the covers

through him with a beauty! KL Rahul has missed two consecutive googlies from Rashid. The second one tonks middle stump. KXIP have lost two in two after a watchful start. This is tossed up outside off, dipping deliciously to draw Rahul forward. He drives for the one that turns, tying to poke it through the covers, but that's snuck past the inside edge to hit the stumps. Genius from Rashid to get a batsman of Rahul's form like that

drilled straight to Warner at long-off! Loopy slower ball outside off, brings the bat down on that rather than swing through it to get distance. It's flat, throat height and pouched by an elated Warner
yorker at middle stump, squeezed out to midwicket
yorker at leg stump, jammed down to long-on
full and just outside off, driven to cover
short of a length and into the pads, caressed down to fine leg with a pull
top edge over the keeper and third man cleans up to his right. Short of a length slower ball, rising in the corridor as he looks to pull
low full toss, very very wide outside off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: googly, short of a length and ripping into the body. He doesn't pick it and his attempted punch through the off side ends up at midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: good length and wide outside off, reaches out and guides it to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: good length and turning away from middle stump. Squared up as he defends the legbreak off the outside part of the bat
full on middle stump, mistimed sweep to deep square's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: it's taken some convincing but Warner takes a review against the lbw decision. Gwhip this. Gayle is pinned in front of the stumps on the back foot, struck around the knee roll as he tries to glance. But that has pitched outside leg and they lose the review. Keeper and bowler looked convinced. Tracker also shows the ball was climbing over leg stump

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: full and pushed through quick at leg stump, looks for the slog and cops that on the pad
yorker in the corridor, jams it into the pitch and it bounces over the bowler for a single at long-off
full and just outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length on leg stump, glanced to fine leg off the back foot
good length and into leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: rips past the outside edge. Googly, short of a length on leg and squaring him up as he gets onto the back foot to defend. A big appeal from the keeper. The sound might have been the ball brushing the top of the left pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: clears long-on. By just enough in the end. It's a miscued pull. Or a hurried one, at the very least. Short of a length and skidding on quickly at middle stump. It's almost a speculative pull in the end, comes off the inside part, but it's into the cameramen

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: googly, short of a length and hurrying him outside off. Mistimed cut to extra cover
googly, turning into middle stump. He's onto the back foot to punch to long-on
good length and at middle stump, onto the back foot to push through midwicket
low full toss at off stump, driven along the floor to long-on
yorker and just outside off, looks to chop behind point but is beaten this time
slower short ball just outside off, waits on it and opens the face late to get the late cut past short third man
good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers
good length and just outside off, brings the hammer down on that, hardly any feet, but the off-drive is well to mid-off's right
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
friendly, knee-high full toss outside off and Gayle misses it completely on the drive. And the bounce is a bit awkward for YJB who doesn't gather cleanly and has to give chase

Rashid takes it at deep square leg. Looked like a knuckle ball. Full and at off stump. Gets on one knee again and hits this high into the evening sky with the attempted slog. Rashid has to run in a little and to his left. Samad tracks back from midwicket for a bit but lets it be. Rashid follows it as it dips on him and hangs on safely
good length outside off, poked into the off side

the ball slips from Samad's hands at the boundary and two turns to four. Legcutter, good length and just outside off. Gets down and brings out a miscued slog sweep. Samad sprints to his right at long-on and picks up with his right hand, but it looks like the swing of the hand has met his leg and he's lost his bearings
short of a length and angled into off stump. Backs away to try and punch through the covers but he's through it too soon. It gets the thick inside part of the bat and just evades mid-off to the right
full at middle stump, driven along the ground to long-on

pumped over the midwicket boundary! He's sent that into the top tier. It's dropped short outside off and he's nicely set with swinging room for the lofted pull. And once again, it is an absolutely delicious connection off the middle of the bat

just evades Warner running back from mid-off. Full slower ball and Mandeep is down on one knee early for the drive. He's outfoxed. Ends up lofting this a few yards behind Warner who runs back and puts in a big dive as it bounces past his face
good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
clattered wide of mid-on. Short of a length across him and he hangs on the back foot for the pull, gets it right off the middle and you can hear the echoes in the stadium
good length and pushed across off stump, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length and just outside off, looks for the aerial pull but gets it off the high part of the bat. Clears midwicket
short of a length just outside off, onto the back foot to pat this behind square on the off side
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to extra cover's right. Big dive there but only a touch managed on the way to mid-off
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
short and wide outside off, gets big on him and he uses it to cut that over the cover point fielder who then gives chase to pull it in
good length and just outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
good length and just outside off, chops into the off side off the front foot
good length and just outside off, steps out and drives on the rise to extra cover
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
good length and just outside off, defended into the off side
thick edge to the third man boundary. Looks to drive this length ball through the covers from outside off and ends up playing inside the line

good length and at the stumps, drops it in the infield on the leg side and wants to sneak the run but he's sent back. On the way back there's a direct hit with an under-arm flick, from Shankar it appears, but replays show Rahul has made his ground
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to cover point
good length and just outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
good length and curved into middle stump. Punched to mid-om off the back foot
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
good length and into middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
full inswinger at middle stump, walks at it and clips to mid-on who rushes in and misses the ball with the attempted single-handed pick up. Samad took his eye off too early
full in-dipper at the pads, leans in and clips it to mid-on's right
full inswinger at off stump, defended down the pitch
quick short ball, gets the bottom edge to short third man. Ashwin has the right idea. He wants the single. Nortje sends him back
