and a length ball produces another catch at long-on. This is just a languid hit, which he has timed well enough to carry it all the way to the fence. DC could still be bowled out
yorker now, dug out for a single to long-on
slower bouncer, outside off, beaten on the ramp. He wants the wide call but doesn't get it
slower ball, on a length, he opens the face for a single
low full toss, squeezed out to deep cover for one
yorker, on the spot, dug out back to him

length ball, into the pads, and Cummins has got another wicket. Not the best ball to get a wicket with but he has bowled quite a few good ones in the previous games for no rewards in the last column. This has been hit straight down the throat of long-on
slower wide full ball as Rabada backs away. Another dot
low full toss, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
Cummins responds with a near yorker. dug out towards long-on for one
lovely shot but all too late. Driven on top of the bounce, past extra cover, thuds into the fence
nice little hit straight of long-off but not powerful enough
wrong'un, swept away to deep midwicket. Straight of him
full, dipping, nearly a yorker, dug out back to him
excellent shot. Picks the offbreak, goes down on a knee, and hits him straight of long-off
he sweeps, but straight to deep square leg for one
wrong'un, on a length, Rabada pushes it into the leg side for one
Ashwin moves across his wicket to pull this shortish ball past midwicket and all the way to the midwicket fence. Along the ground
hit in the air but it falls short of mid-off. Early into his push. Takes the tight single
looking for yorker, gives him the low full toss, driven to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
extra bounce from short of a length, and beats Ashwin's attempt at the late-cut
on a length, angling in, hits the bat high
quick length ball, Ashwin opens the face, can't beat short third man

that's the five-for. The wrong'un this time. Hits the top of off. The first five-for for KKR since Narine did it in 2012. Seems like Axar has picked the wrong'un and is looking to make room and hit it over the off side, but he has been done in completely by the flight first and then the turn. the first five-for of this IPL
slower in the air, outside off, punched to long-off for one
quicker, length ball, pushed into the leg side for one

short_text: Varun to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: on a length, legcutter, hit back to him

No. 4 for Varu. The legcutter is turning enough to do the DC hitters in. And none of them is looking to hit with the turn. All four have perished hitting to leg with the ball turning away from them. Another big outer edge as the ball turns away from him. Taken easily at long-off

short_text: Narine to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: tries the big sweep, is beaten and hit on the pad, but this is pitched outside leg
offbreak, straight, worked into the leg side for one
carrom ball, short of a length, pulled into the leg side. Wide of long-on. Bigger boundary means they get two
short of a length, no pace or room, tucked away off the hip

short_text: Narine to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: slog sweep against the turn, but to the shorter boundary, and Patel has connected this well enough to clear deep midwicket
slow offbreak, middle and leg, guided to short fine for one
full legcutter, driven to long-on for one
offbreak, on a length, just outside off, pushed past point
wide down the leg side
slow and loopy all right, but wide and too full. Driven hard to long-off

and he is on a hat-trick. That earlier drop has not cost them anything. Lovely carrom-ball legcutter, on a length, outside off. Iyer likes the length and wants to go over long-on, but there is a puff of dust where the ball pitches, and the ball turns away from it. He toe-ends a skier to long-on

but Varun gets the other big hitter. Seems like wrong'un, Hetmyer sees it in is swinging arc, clears the front leg and tries to go over long-on. The top edge only carries as far as the boundary edge where he is caught smartly

dropped by Varun himself. Iyer tries to hit a big six but gets a massive top edge towards straight cover. Varun calls it for himself even though he is running back. Might have been better off letting the guy running in take this. Doesn't even get a hand on it
Hetmyer breaks the shackles. On a length, outside off, Hetmyer clears the front leg and swings hard to create his own pace on this. It goes very high but long enough to clear the fielder at long-on
tries the big slog, but Narine again stays slow and outside off. The toe end goes to leg
on a length, no room, punched hard to cover
offbreak, slow, on a length, punched straight of long-on for two
wide length ball, outside off, and he mis-hits this wide of long-off
Iyer looks to lap him, but Narine gives him no pace to work with. He doesn't get the boundary but will take three
on a length, outside leg, soft hands, gets a couple of wide long-on
quick, short, 105ks, Iyer late into the pull, manages to get this wide of midwicket
on a length, legcutter, punched to wide long-on
quick, flat, on a length, pushed to deep cover for one

caught on the long leg-side boundary. And not even the boundary. Well inside. Varun bowls the wrong'un, full, outside leg, and Pant plays the kinda vertical sweep that he does. The top edge is taken at deep square leg
legcutter, around off, defended back to him
Iyer keeps backing away after shuffling across, but Ferguson is not falling for it again. Beats him with the short ball this time
quick sharp skiddy short ball, keeps the pull down for one
the double shuffle from Iyer again, Ferguson bowls short this time, cut away to deep cover
Iyer is stepping it up here. Shuffles across early, then backs away, takes a full ball and goes inside-out, wide of mid-off
picks his spot. Just a touch too full. He has mid-off up so he is likely to bowl short of a length, but gets into the length zone, and Iyer drives it over mid-off
short of a length, into the body, tucked away into a hole on the leg side, the bigger boundary
again he keeps denying Iyer the hitting length or the pace to work with. Hit hard but straight down to long-on
slog sweep into the bigger part of the ground, and there is a deep midwicket in place
slow, short of a length, Iyer can't find any timing on the pull
down the wicket, beaten in flight, driven down the ground and straight of long-off
Narine stays on a length, and gives Iyer no pace to work with. Punched to wide long-on for one
down the wicket to push this length ball to long-off for one
on a length, quick, 148ks, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
yorker, on off, dug out to mid-on
short of a length, at him, Iyer opens the face for a single
gets inside the line of this length ball and whips this fine of fine leg. The tall lanky fast bowler, Krishna, does well to keep this down to one
on pace, on length, outside off, and he clears the front leg and slogs him over midwicket for four
big slower ball, half-volley outside off, hit back to Ferguson
offbreak, Pant is down the wicket to punch this down to long-on
down the wicket, Narine slows it down, and he ends up playing it back to Narine
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
carrom ball, it seems like, punched to deep cover
on a length, middle and leg, worked into the leg side
this is a newish action, the leading arm breaks away early and stays away from the rest of the body. Bowls down the leg side, is worked away
starts off with a wide down the leg side
wide length ball, driven on the up, just the single to deep cover
full and fast, hit back softly towards the bowler, and he hits the wicket at the non-striker's end. Takes the single off the defelction
and now he looks to go to leg after shuffling across, but falls over and is beaten outside off
not much wrong with this ball but Pant has punched this away for four. Short of a length, no room, but he slaps this square of backward point and in front of deep third man
bouncer, gets big on him, still manages to clear the infield with the pull and gets a couple to deep midwicket
and suddenly you can tell the extra pace when a length ball hits the bat high. Defended to leg
on a length, just outside off, pushed wide of cover
on a length, 138ks, outside off, opens the face to point
short of a length, not much room outside off, punched to extra cover
moves around in the crease as he often does, but Nagarkoti doesn't budge from his length. Iyer opens the face to takes a single to point
on a length, middle and off, hits him high on the bat
short, rib-high, pulled to deep square leg. Falls short of him
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
big slower ball, loopy full toss outside leg. This is called wide. A never-ending over
length ball, outside off, slogged to deep midwicket. He is caught but this is a free hit, remember. He has bowled the free hit well to have sent the slog to one of the two fielders outside the circle

short_text: Prasidh to Pant, (no ball) 1 leg bye
long_text: this is a good bouncer on the free hit, Pant is beaten on the hook, and hit on the helmet. But another no-ball. A big one
near yorker, outside off, driven to mid-off. This is a no-ball
yorker, just outside off, dug out back to him
wide length ball, driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
oh the Pant we know. This is bouncer outside off, and he gets inside the line of it to help it along over short fine leg. His head is down when he plays the shot and not even looking at the ball
short of a length, at him, Pant looks to work this to let, gets a leading edge, which falls short of the diving Krishna
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
short of a length, outside off, gets a bottom edge
and he picks this same gap bu shuffling across to convert this length ball into a straight ball. He has taken this from outside off, and clipped it behind square on the leg side
tucked away off the hip, and the fine leg is in and deep square leg is forward of square. And this rolls into the gap and into the boundary
short of a length again, but this time there is no room to work with. Defended back to him
short of a length, wide, punched to point
short of a length, just outside off, fended back to him
on the front foot to a shortish ball, hit high on the bat as he defends
short of a length, angling in, punched to point

like the London buses. And it tells you the old thing about bowling: you keep bowling well for long enough, and the wickets will come. And if they come after a long interval, they will come in clutches. Lovely ball to get the form man. On a length, angling in towards middle, then holding its line against the angle and uprooting the off stump. Dhawan likes to stay legside of the ball anyway. At 147.4ks too

short_text: Cummins to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, driven nicely on the up, but straight to extra cover
short of a length, hits the splice of the bat, they rush through for a quick single to cover. Morgan slips a little as he gets ready to throw

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Dhawan shows his form. Jumps out of the crease early, gets under this wide length ball, and sends it crashing over cover-point
short of a length, into the body, tucked away off the hip
short of a length, no room, he looks to punch this to off, and gets an inside edge for a single to leg

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and leg, punched to mid-on
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, outside off, bottom edge on the cut for Dhawan
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, at his body, defended back to him
on a length, into the pads, flicked away to leg, but straight to midwicket
short of a length, no room, defended back to him

full and straight again, looking for the lbw again, but Iyer plays a more forceful shot, and also this one doesn't jag back in. Not too wide of mid-on, but no dive comes in. And he doesn't anticipate the angle well enough either. Narine is the fielder

plumb lbw first ball. Wickets have been few and far between for Cummins, but he has struck immediately here. Full ball, the seam is not perfectly upright, but it pitches outside off and jags back in to beat Rahane's defensive prod. Dead in front
another wide bouncer, another high ball, and another top edge. Rabada runs back from short fine leg to take the catch. A good last over from Stoinis given what had happened earlier

short, outside off, gets it high, and Rana has fallen to a short ball that has got big. Who would have thought? Except that it has happened in the last over of the innings and not the first. Top edge for a catch inside the circle. A very important hand in an emotional time for Rana
full and wide, looking to deny him the leg-side hit, but the off side is also Rana's strength. And this is a half-volley. He opens the face and drives over backward point for four
looks to drag this short ball from wide outside off, and gets a toe-end edge between the keeper and short fine leg
goes full and wide to a shuffling Rana, and he ends up slicing a low full toss square of deep cover for two
oh Rana, why Rana? Tries the reverse ramp to an on-pace length ball. This is fair game for a wild slog over midwicket. What a miss. Beaten

bonus runs but a love;y shot nonetheless. Ten runs so far off the Rabada over, and he makes room, and Rabada follows him with a short ball. He takes this from outside leg, opens the face, and guides it between short third and point
nice knee-high full toss. Yoroker gone wrong. Morgan sends him for a six back over his head. All unfurling of the wrists at the last moment. As Morgan often does with these hits
nearly a yorker, outside leg again as Rana makes room. Squeezed out for one to point
short of a length, no room, punched to deep point for one
slower ball, nearly a yorker, outside leg as he is making room. Pushed into the covers for one
low full toss, takes the inside edge, single to short fine leg

finds the gap. Rana is looking to open up the short boundary by shuffling across, and he ends up slogging a length ball towards square leg. The fielder is there, and the ball has gone in air, but just wide of his dive
well bowled. Rana opens up the front leg, but he goes with a quick yorker outside off. Ends up being a low full toss but is out of Rana's reach
slower ball again, nearly a yorker, dug out to cover for one
shuffles across to try to access the short leg boundary. Nortje beats him with a slower ball that squeezes under his slog
mid-off is up so Morgan picks his spot. Gets under a length ball and lofts him over mid-off. Doesn't need to go for the six here. Just needs to clear 30 yards
short of a length, outside off, he opens the face but is beaten
the first proper bouncer to Rana all day, but without the field you need for a bouncer. The top edge sails over short fine leg for four. Very questionable plans and field sets from DC
slower ball, full outside off, hit straight to extra cover

big boundary and Rabada gets his man. He digs this in short, cramps Narine up by following him, meaning the short off boundary is taken out of play. He pulls, makes a decent connection, but not decent enough to clear the big square-leg boundary. Caught, but has he played a match-turning, a season-turning knock here?
slower short ball, down the leg side. This is a wide. And Pant fails to collect the half-volley. Another bye to go with it
misses out. This is a quick length ball angled down leg, and all he needs is a tickle. Instead it clips the pad on the way. Doesn't even get the wide ball
he makes room again, and Rabada follows him and he is beaten outside the leg stump
and now all bets are off. In the last four, outside edges will also fly. Rabada bowls length from round the wicket, Rana looks to go over mid-off and cover, but gets a thick edge over short third man
top shot. Was looking like it might be the first over without a boundary in a long time, but he shuffles across to reach this full wide one and drives it between mid-off and extra cover for four
stays full and wide, tough to reach it, dug out for just the single
full, outside off, driven past the slow-diving extra cover
full and wide again, this time he gets bat on it, and thick outside edge brings them two
full slot ball outside off, he looks to go over long-off, but swings down the wrong line
another wide, but this time not called because the batsman has shuffled across
staats off with a big wide outside off
quicker, shorter, no room, punched to point for one. Six feet either side, and this would be four too
slower in the air, swept away fine, nearly beats short fine, and gets a second off the fumble
Ashwin goes round-arm, almost like Jadhav, full, on off, drilled to long-off
legbreak, he picks it, and goes over for the big leg-side fence. Clean straight hit over long-on. That is a brave and well-timed hit

that's fifty for Narine. Sams might have given him a life here. Falls just short of the substitute fielder at deep backwards square leg, but this has been in the air for long. Reason for Ashwin to be disappointed
short of a length, quick, and he drives him on the up, between deep cover and long-off. The short boundary means he gets four instead of two

now he is picking his spots. Stoinis bowls full and wide, and he goes deep into the crease, breaks his back knee to get under it, and drives this in the air ans wide of deep cover. A Raina-like shot from a batsman who has a Raina-like weakness against the short ball
slower ball outside off, edged away as he drives, but it falls well short of Pant
full and wide, beats him on the drive
full and outside off, left alone
goes slower again and trying to get out of Narine's reach. Ends up bowling a big wide outside off
short of a length, wide, slower, and he rocks back to punch him over straight extra cover. This is brutal batting
bowling short at Narine with the short leg-side boundary at Stoinis's pace? Not a good idea. Smoked away for a six over midwicket. This is only slightly higher than his waist

and when it is going for you, it goes for you all day long. He looks like he is trying to go over mid-off, but gets an outside edge to this length ball, which beats third man. Brings up fifty for Rana
short ball, into the ribs, he is half-ducking-half-pulling but he has sent it into a safe place for a single to long leg
full and straight, driven wide of mid-off for one
makes room to go big, Nortje cramps him up, he takes the single to long-on
short-arm pull to long leg

yes, no, run-out missed. Extremely casual running. Length ball, pushed to point. Rana wants one, Narine doesn't. Then Narine wants it but Rana doesn't. Narine has given up, but the throw misses, and Nortje not back to the wicket in time to collect it
swept away to deep square lg for one
classy batting. Tossed up outside off, and he stretches out to its pitch and drives him inside-out over extra cover. Confidence, touch, elegance
slow in the air, Narine tries the big slog sweep, but gets an inside edge for one
Ashwin bowls a legbreak, pitches it short, and Narine doesn't need a second invitation to pull him over the short boundary over midwicket. This was the wrong'un, but didn't turn at all
Ashwin stays wide, driven to deep cover for one
Rana is not looking at the size of the boundary. He has premeditated a reverse-sweep, and has nailed it, sending it over short third man
short ball, Rana looks to swivel and pull behind square but ends up front-edging it towards deep midwicket for one. Is a slower ball, and he has toe-ended it
slower short ball, Narine early into the pull, but will take the leg-bye
slower ball, short of a length, opens the face, gets a single to square third man
nearly a third boundary as he opens the face but can't beat short third man
even better. Just short of a length, just outside off, and he makes room to cut this past backward point. The confidence showing now. Picked the slower ball too

Rana says I won't let Stoinis bowl without some tax. This is full, on the pads, and he goes inside-out. In the air, but well between mid-off and extra cover. Not the best timing but going to the short boundary
he has manufactured this one. Deshpande bowls a length ball angling into his pads, but he makes room and goes inside-out. Slices this over backward point
slower ball, outside off, punched away to deep cover

lovely shot over the short boundary. This is not too short at all, but Rana plays the swivel-pull. Just jumps on to the back foot with the front leg in the air, and this is only waist high so he can pull him for a six
quick yorker, leg stump, 142ks, dug out for one to short fine leg
stays short of a length, and this time he goes along the ground with the punch. To the left of deep cover this time. Gets a couple
short of a length, wide, not high pace, and he stays leg side of it to crunch him over backward point. No half measures
flatter, quicker, punched to deep cover
Rana shows familiarity breeds, well, not fear. Down the wicket immediately, right to its pitch, and drives him inside-out for a single to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, quicker, Narine throws his hands at it, gets a thick outside edge, and beats short third man

clean clean strike. It is a brave shot on big boundaries with field back. Ashwin has given him no pace to work with and tossed it up nice and slow, but he drives him over long-off for a six. All power through timing
on a length, no turn, defended back to Ashwin
beats him with extra bounce on a shortish ball outside off. Rana pushes at it with his hands
short of a length, outside off, pushed to third man for one
on a length, just outside off, left alone
stays short of a length, and bowls wide outside off
short of a length, outside off, left alone

and Karthik has been sacrificed again. He has been doing well in the second half of the innings, but KKR continue to send him in early. Not a great shot. Looks to work to leg a length ball pitched outside off, and it holds its line to take the edge through to Pant
wide length ball, hit in the air, but wide of point for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
short of a length, hit just to the left of midwicket for one
full and wide, too wide
short, stays low as Karthik pulls. Gets a single to long leg
short of a length, around off, steered down to third man
on a length, middle and off, defended
short of a length, into the body, worked to leg for one
full and straight, worked to leg for one
superb seam bowling to a new batsman. On a length, just outside off, Karthik pushes for the angle, but it holds its line after pitching. Beaten

too quick for Tripathi. Yorker at 148.3ks with a new ball. This is high-quality bowling. Not very high-quality batting, though, as his feet are away, and his bat comes down late. Middle stump and off stump knocked back
short of a length, tucked away to short fine leg
fuller this time, driven down and along the ground. A single to wide mid-off
Tripathi manufactures a boundary. This is his speciality. He makes room early, gets inside and under a length ball and lofts this over point

short_text: Axar Patel to Rana, no run
long_text: slow through the air, drops on him, beats him in the flight, turns back in, hits him on the pad, but he has got himself outside the line

short_text: Axar Patel to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide, a rare loose ball from Patel, and Rana takes full toll, pulling him through midwicket
angled in, and worked into the leg side

short_text: Axar Patel to Tripathi, no run
long_text: short of a length, he rocks back, punches this, but can't beat cover-point

short_text: Axar Patel to Tripathi, no run
long_text: on a length, slow in the air, defended off the front foot
tossed up, driven in the air but straight of cover and wide of long-off for two
short of a length, no room, runs this down to third man for one
another shot not out of the screws but this he has just cleared mid-off. This length ball cramped him for room, but he went ahead with the aerial off-drive
short ball to Tripathi, well outside off, but he goes ahead with the pull and clears mid-on
short of a length, around off, this time he manages to place the defensive shot wide of cover for one
short of a length again, just outside off, pushed to point
short of a length, around off, pushed with an open face
short of a length, 141ks, at him, defended with an open face
on a length, outside off, he opens the face to get a single to third man
short of a length, at him, defended to leg
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
short, but not with sting in it. Only about waist high, and he pulls this across the line and over square leg
on a length, middle and off, hits Rana's bat high as he defends
superb delivery first up. On a length, just outside off, and then moving off the seam, against the angle. Tripathi pushes inside its line

that is a bit of a nothing dismissal. Short of a length, just outside off, and he punches at it but neither is he looking to go over the infield nor bothers to keep it down. Caught at backward point. And today was a day when Gill looked in good touch
just short of third man. Rana throws his hands at this shortish wide ball, and the top edge flies nearly all the way
length ball, on the pads, clipped into the bigger side of the field, but Deshpande does well at long leg to keep them down to one
nor does the delivery. Short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
for some reason, Nortje starts off with an offcutter. Trying to play with the mind of someone expecting one in the ribs. No feet. Beaten outside off
just outside off this time, pushed to cover
lovely shot. Gill seems to have found some touch today. On a length, middle and leg, no swing, and he drives this wide of mid-on. Not a half-volley, mind you
on a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
shimmy down the wicket, Deshpande keeps the length short. Defended
lovely timing. Short of a length, slight swing, and he punches this on the up and in front of point for four. That should make him feel good
short of a length, wide, sits in the surface, hits the toe end of the bat on the cut

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: swatted to the square leg boundary. Knuckleball, short of a length at middle stump. Swivels and places the pull to deep midwicket's left

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, chopped on the bounce to point
slower ball at a length on middle stump, punches on the front foot and gets a thick outside edge to third man

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, driven down the pitch off the front foot

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower ball, good length and wide outside off. Chopped to backward point
slower ball, short of a length just outside off. Punched to long-on off the back foot
slower ball at a length on middle, tucked through square leg off the back foot
slower ball, short and into leg stump. Pulled to deep backward square

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower ball at a length on off stump, defended into the pitch off the front foot
dropped at midwicket. Gaikwad to his right. Full ball on leg stump, flicked aerially and it seems Gaikwad's jumped up a little too soon and only manages to push it out towards long-on
slower ball at a length on middle stump, check-drive down to lpng-off

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: lofted over the long-off boundary. Full slower ball outside off, gets to the pitch of that and keeps the full face offered as he extends the arms through the line. Mid-off was in, so the risk was cut out
full and just outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off's right
short of a length outside off, opens the face and chops to third man
crunches it straight over the bowler. Full ball outside off, gets forward and low and picks the googly before launching it straight with some savvy wristwork
full outside off, driven to long-off

short_text: Tahir to de Kock, no run
long_text: lbw appeal turned down. Good length, a slider outside off. Looks for the ramp and cops that on the front pad outside off
loses his shape on the slog. Full ball tossed up at middle stump, clears the front leg and has a big swing that ends up rolling out to short fine's right
full and wide outside off, driven to long-off

short_text: Tahir to de Kock, no run
long_text: googly at a length outside off, tapped into the off side on the front foot
length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length at middle, mistimed lofted pull out to deep square
slogged over wide long-on. Full and fast outside off again and this time he gets forward and hits with the turn, and cleanly
fifty with a reverse-swept six. A brute of an innings tonight from Kishan. Gets in position quickly to this full ball outside off and lofts it over point
length and sliding on outside off, chopped into the pitch as he looks for the late cut
full on off stump, flicked to deep square's right
short of a length and turning into leg stump. Glanced out to deep square

short_text: Tahir to de Kock, 2 leg byes
long_text: good length and keeping low at leg stump. Gets back in the crease and deflects fine off the pad as he looks for the glance
full outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
good length and going on with the angle outside off, beaten on the attempted jab off the front foot
slogged over long-on. Full and flat outside off, goes with the turn after getting down on a knee and nails the connection
good length and turning off stump, defended into the off side

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length outside off, another slower ball. Check-punch to mid-off

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, no run
long_text: beaten. Slower ball at a good length outside off. Leans in for the drive but that spins past the bat

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: caressed onto the roof. A short ball at leg stump, swivels to open up that area for himself and gently sends this hook onto the main road via the roof
full outside off, mistimed slog along the ground to long-on
good length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's left off the back foot

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: casually drilled over mid-off. Good length and just outside off, already on the front foot as this arrives and lifts it on the rise
googly at a length on leg stump, looks to whip through midiwcket, it comes off the leading edge and at Tahir
good length at leg stump, pushed through vacant midwicket
short of a length just outside off, punched firmly off the back foot to Curran's right at mid-off and he moves smartly to cover the ground on that before the tumble
full outside off, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
full googly outisde off, drives with the turn to mid-off's right
good length at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot

spanked to the deep square boundary. Whew, those hands are moving rapidly tonight. It's a short ball at about throat height and he's over it quickly before pulling viciously. It's on its way down but it's over the line and makes a loud thump on the advertising board
slapped on the up again, this one through cover. Short of a length and a lot of room outside off. Gets his weight into this and throws everything into the punch on the up
blazed past cover point. Good length ball with some room outside off, half a stride and a big whip through the line to hit this on the rise and rapidly to the fielder's right
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
good length and just outside off, leans in and languidly punches to deep point's left
good length at middle stump, clipped to midwicket's left
good length and just outside off, pushed into the off side
beaten on the drive. Good length outside off, pitches and holds its line as Kishan leans in for the cover drive on the rise

over first slip. Cramped on the cut in the corridor as this gets big on him, but he takes it on with a cut anyway. Faf has his right hand stretched and both feet off the ground, but he's not close to getting a finger on that
good length and just outside off, pushed to short cover's right
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
to the fence from under Gaikwad. Short of a length and tucking him in the corridor, but he times this back foot punch pretty well. Straight to cover point who is late getting down on it

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: length outside off, mistimed pat into the off side

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: trickles into the backward point boundary. Length ball pushed across him. Steps out and has a slap at that. It's off the thick outside edge, high, and clearing short third man. Sweeper hares across to his right but it's got enough

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower short ball, just outside off. Cut straight to short third man

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to deep backward point
short of a length across the corridor, has a poke at that and is beaten
good length and just outside off, leans in and pushes to cover's right
good length outside off, defended in gully's direction off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, steered on the bounce to gully off the back foot
placed between cover point and backward point this time. Short and across him again. Waits on it a touch this time and opens the face on the cut
good length and just outside off, defended to point
crunched to the cover boundary. Short and wide outside off. He springs onto his toes and slaps this in front of square with a horizontal bat

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, tapped on the rise to cover point

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: full awayswinger from middle stump, driven straight to mid-off on the front foot

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, tapped into the covers on the up

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: oh shot! Super, super straight drive. A pretty good ball too. Good length and curving sharply into the corridor. He keeps his stride short and well away from the incoming ball and offers the full face to punch this past the non-striker

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: thick outside edge and sneaks under Hazlewood's dive to the right at third man. Full outswinger this time and QDK chases that with his hands, feet rooted in the crease

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: full inswinger curves viciously at middle stump, punched towards mid-off with the full face offered

rips out off stump. Yorker headed for off stump as Curran walks into the off side again to try and go behind square. Nutmegs him, makes him fall over and sends off stump flying out of the ground for his fourth wicket

short_text: Boult to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: brings up his fifty. One to remember for Sam Curran. Short ball at middle stump, weight onto the back foot and pulls aerially to fine leg's right, giving him no chance on the small boundary

short_text: Boult to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: lofted over backward point. Smart stuff from Curran. Not so from Boult. Overpitched and wide outside off, sycthes under that and opens the face late

short_text: Boult to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: appeal for lbw turned down. Good length outside off, jumps into the line of that and looks to whip it over fine leg. Struck on the pads outside off

short_text: Boult to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: slower short ball at middle stump, hangs deep and puts the pull shot sufficiently to deep square's left
full and wide outside off, hangs back and chucks the hands at that. Thick outside edge trickles to third man's left. Tiwary sprints and puts in the boot. Curran says no to the second
full and wide outside off, backs away and drives along the ground to sweeper cover
yorker at middle stump, jammed down the pitch
oh hello! Short ball, slanted into the corridor. Arches into the leg side and expertly ramps this fine of third man. Superb timing on that
low full toss on middle stump, punched to long-on
squeezed past point but sweeper cover dives to the right to stop this. Yorker following him down leg side but he manages to time this chop with an open face

short_text: Bumrah to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: low full toss at middle stump, tapped to extra cover off the toe-end
yorker outside off, jammed out to mid-off
short of a length and down leg side, a slower ball gone awry. Past the attempted pull
good length and down leg side, QDK can only manage to parry this towards fine leg

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: slower short ball at middle stump this time, and this slips through from under his attempted pull. Another difficult take on the half-volley for QDK

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: slower short ball outside off, floats past him long after he's had a pull at that. Tough bounce for QDK who manages to gather anyway
full and wide outside off, drilled wide of the sweeper

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: finally gets the ramp away. He's been itching to get inside the line and hit NCN to the fine leg boundary. Finally gets a length ball coming into him from the corridor, and he's in position and gets that away

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a good length and into the body. Mistimed swipe across the line, off the thick inside edge to fine leg's right
finds the boundary with placement. Short of a length and just outside off, allows that on and cuts late to bisect backward point and short third man
bouncer and a misitmed pull on the bounce to deep midwicket. Curran steps out at that and gets it off the low part of the bat
good length and just outside off, jabbed to extra cover's left with soft hands. Pollard misfields that and they sneak a run

stumping appeal sent upstairs. Full and wide and slow outside off. Tahir plays the big slog sweep and is beaten. The back toe was out briefly but he's got half the foot back in as he gets back up from the sweeping position
good length just outside off, gets low with a forward stride, keeps his eyes on that and laps it to long leg's right
full and just outside off, mistimed slog along the floor to long-on
full and into off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
yorker at middle stump, squeezed into the vacant leg side

short_text: Bumrah to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: low full toss at middle stump, watchfully tucked towards long-on but he won't take the single

short_text: Bumrah to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: full at the stumps, blocked on the front foot

short_text: Bumrah to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, defended off the front foot

narrowly past off stump. Attempted yorker is a slow full toss in the corridor. QDK gets a bounce that he isn't comfortable with to his left, looks like he's copped it on the leg before having to chase it down

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: bouncer at a middle stump line, gets inside the line and has a hack from under that. Well beaten

taken at backward point. Slower ball, short of a length outside off. Arches into the leg side and wants to slice this over the fielder off the back foot. He's done by the slower pace and hits this high and simple for that fielder
just wide of extra cover. Good length and rising up in the corridor, his attempted back foot punch is aerial as the bat turns in his hands
good length and in at middle stump, backs away and chops to backward point

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a good length and in at middle stump. Gets low to try and ramp it fine and cops that on the arm on his way down before it trickles out to QDK

just short of deep square. Short of a length just outside off, has a slug across the line and ends up getting under that too much as it climbs. Elevation, more than anything, and the fielder running in can't even get close
good length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
low full toss speared wide of off, driven to sweeper off the toe-end
short of a length on leg stump, quickly onto the back foot to whip this to deep midwicket
good length at off, punched back down the pitch off the back foot
good length on off  stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, onto the back foot to slap this to deep extra cover
good length and sliding on towards off stump. Hurried punch down the pitch off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover
good length and ripping away outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length and turning away outside off, past the jab
nearly plays it on. Short of a length and turning away outside off. Looks to flick but gets that onto his back leg off the inside edge
googly, short and wide outside off. Tapped to long-off, off the back foot with an angled bat
good length and just outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
good length and into the corridor. Punched in extra cover's direction and they pinch a run
full slower ball outside off, defended on the front foot
good length and just outside off, pushed to extra cover from the crease
good length on leg stump, dabbed to deep square's left off the back foot
short of a length and wide outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover

short_text: Chahar to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: googly, short and outside off.  Cut firmly but straight to extra cover
floated full and wide outside off, driven to long-on off the toe-end
good length and sliding on at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Chahar to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: full on middle stump, flicked towards the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left

short_text: Chahar to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: googly, spinning away outside off and gets the inside half as he looks to punch through cover
short of a length outside off, jabbed to point from the crease
full and into middle stump, pushed down to long-on

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: bouncer in the corridor, sways away to let it go

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: launched onto the roof over long leg. NCN is around the wicket, and he's short and into the body. Curran swivels and puts that away off the back foot
good length on middle stump, punched towards long-on off the back foot
short of a length at middle stump, looks for the pull and cops this on the body
short of a length on leg stump, deep in the crease to nudge this to fine leg

he's out stumped on the attempted slog sweep! QDK took the bails off and was clapping already. The umpire didn't even need to send in upstairs. Deepak Chahar looks oblivious to the fact that he's at least a few inches outside here. No scramble back to make his ground or anything. It's a full, slow legbreak tossed up outside off. He wants to slog through midwicket and it spins past the bat. QDK can barely believe his luck
short and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover

short_text: Chahar to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: tonked over deep midwicket. Full and in the slot, just outside off. Gets a stride out, gets low and slogs this cleanly in that direction
full and sliding into the pads. Deflected off the outside of the pad as he can't get the flick away and fine leg cleans up to the right
good length and angled across the corridor, onto the back foot and dabs it past slip
good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
good length and just outside off, jabbed into the covers with soft hands

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
bouncer at a middle stump line and he ducks that one too

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, ducks to let it go

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended to point off the back foot

short_text: Coulter-Nile to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, looks for the cut and is beaten on the under-edge
good length and skidded through at off stump, hurriedly pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length and turning away outside off, pushed to midwicket off the back foot

thin edge and he walks. That is a lovely follow-up delivery from the young legspinner. Goes slower, goes wider, and extracts a bit of turn from this. Dhoni is back to pushing with hard hands with a big stride. Swishing, in this case, at the very end, to try and get a single at cover. It spins and rises and gets a bit of the outside edge that QDK takes smartly
steps out and lofts it straight. Good length ball pushed through flat. He's down to the pitch of that and gets a nice clean swing from under it
good length at middle stump, stride out and a poke to extra cover
full on middle stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot

short_text: Boult to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: full and into middle stump, stays back in the crease and defends to mid-off
good length and into the pads, nudged through square leg with the angle
good length on off stump, defended to cover off the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and onto the hips, uses the angle and glances to to deep square's left

straight to midwicket. Short of a length and just outside off, steps out at that and pulls. But this got tight on him and the pull comes of the toe-end of the bat and floats harmlessly for Krunal at midiwicket
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and angled in towards off stump. Stabs for the line, it rolls down the pitch off the inside half
good length at middle stump, big stride out and a hard-handed push to extra cover
full and into middle stump, watchfully stabbed back to the bowler
full and into middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the inside edge
good length and at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length and just outside off, patted to deep midwicket off the back foot
full and down leg side, past the flick and QDK can only deflect it in short fine's direction
bouncer at an off stump line, ducks under that to let it pass
good length and angled into the pads from around the wicket. Gets on his toes and uses the angle to tuck this fine
good length and angled into off stump. Defended into midwicket off the inside edge
shot. Back of a length outside off, weight quickly onto the back foot and this is sliding on nicely off the pitch as he punches it through cover
good length and in at off stump, defended from the crease

edged between keeper and first slip. Short of a length and skidding on low outside off. Looks for the cut and gets an under-edge on that. It wouldn't have carried, but the two slips are staggered and pretty wide
good length and into the pads, nudged to deep square off the inside edge

there's a sound and the finger is up! Oh boy. Overpitched and wide outside off. Faf's feet are rooted as he throws the hands at this to try and pierce the covers. It's a thin edge straight into QDK's hands

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, allows it on and stabs it to point's left. Kishan with a leaping stop there

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full inswinger on off stump, driven to mid-off

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended to point off the front foot

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: narrowly past off stump. Short of a good length in-dipper, just outside off, and he lets that go on the initial angle
bouncer at the helmet, sways out of the way to let it go

taken at slip! Good length delivery landing on the seam and coming back into the corridor. Jagadeesan has a stab at it with static feet and ends up playing inside the line of that. Beaten on pace. It's dipping on the slip fielder but he takes it cleanly

caught down leg side. Three short balls to Rayudu tonight, and the last one gets him. This one is at his left shoulder and this time he doesn't get on top of the bounce for the pull. It pings off the glove and is an easy take for QDK to his left
short and just outside off, gets the front leg in the air and pulls this into the ground to fine leg's left
good length and just outside off, looks to punch through the covers, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and angled into off stump. Solidly defended from the crease
short ball climbing across the corridor, rapidly drops his hands to let that go

huge lbw appeal is turned down. Pollard reviews it. This looks very good on first viewing. A full inswinger pinning him in front of leg stump as his head falls over into the off side and he misses on the flick. Ultra Edge confirms there's no bat on it and tracking shows it's pitched in line and is hitting leg stump. Gaikwad off without scoring, and through the perfect set up from one of the game's best bowlers. Three away, one in, and that is a duck on return
good length and just outside off, drops it into the off side with soft hands and is sent back as he takes off for a run
beaten again. Good length and pushed across him again, making him reach out a little more this time on the front foot
past the outside edge. Good length and angled away in the corridor as he looks to defend for the one that swings in
good length and some curve into middle stump. Blocked on the front foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Shankar, FOUR runs
long_text: and that is the match and the fifty in one clean swing. Tyagi pitches it short, and he pulls him stylishly over midwicket
short of a length, around off, dropped to leg for one
slower ball, he recovers well, drives him down to long-on for one
the exclamation mark on a horror night for Stokes. A length ball, swinging into the pads, and he has nonchalantly whipped it over midwicket for six
full and straight, hits the pad, but angling down leg
slower bouncer, well down the leg side. Samson dives to reach this on the half-volley but can't prevent the bye
length ball, chipped into the leg side for one
slower short ball, wide outside off, and he is beaten by the lack of pace

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, SIX runs
long_text: right in the slot. Half-volley. Pandey clears the front leg and deposits this over long-on for a flat six

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: sharp bouncer, 134ks on the gun, but it is the carry. Pandey is surprised by it, and pulls out of the pull

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: short, quick, Pandey pulls this straight to shirt midwicket
short, not too high, pulled to deep midwicket for one
another full toss, driven with an open face to deep cover
full toss, driven down the ground for a single
short of a length, following him, tucked away off the hip
another short ball, and another ramp attempted. Beaten again
bouncer at 149.1ks, and Shankar is still looking to ramp this. Beaten
the best of the lot. Slower ball, picked early, in his slot, and drilled right back over his head
and now he goes mid-on. Smith is looking to attack and he takes on that field. Gueeses this will be short, so he makes room and short-arm pulls him over mid-on
and Shankar says he is in enough to be taking Archer on. He knows mid-off is up, and he sets himself to go over that man. On top of the bounce, and inside-out over that man. Clean swing
on a length, pushed through, worked away for an easy single to leg
slow in the air, looks like a wrong'un, defended to leg
wide length ball, slow in the air, a legbreak, driven to long-off for one
full, on the toes, driven down to long-on
short of a length, punched to deep midwicket
length ball down the leg side, helped along for a single
nice dipping legbreak, middle and leg, turning towards off. Defended to cover
wrong'un, he seems to have picked it off the pitch, but has done so well for a single to deep square leg
flat, into the pads, punched down the ground for one
every time they give him air, Shankar chips them over cover. This time the deep cover is straighter to keep them down to one
looks to punch this down the ground but can't beat the short straight midwicket
on a length, middle and leg, he works this to leg with soft hands. The ball has just crossed the 30-yard circle, and thy come back for two
lovely batting. Pandey is on a roll. Skips down the track again, and he has to advance a long way to get close to this. He is not right to its pitch but lofts him straight back over his head
slider, into the pads, worked away to deep square leg
down the wicket, Tewatia shortens the length, and he pushes him down to long-on for one
full, flat, driven to long-off for one
flatter, on a length, just outside off. Defended
and Shankar keeps chipping the legspinners over extra cover. Gets two more
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
and another bouncer, this time at 144ks, and he has been wided for height this time
proper bouncer this time, 143ks, and Shankar gets out of its line
shorter, 142ks, rising higher than expected and beats his attempt to cut
quick length ball again, 148ks, just outside off, and Shankar just keeps this out
on a length, just outside off, 150.2ks, defended with an open face
on a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for one
once again he bowls slow, full and wide, and Shanks plays the chip over cover again. This one goes much straighter than the last shot, but still wide enough of long-off
Shankar breaks the shackles with a beautiful hit. Gopal tosses this up but goes too full and also provides him the width. He chips him over extra cover
on a length, around off, and he goes back to cut this to deep cover
down the wicket, takes this on the full, hits it hard down to long-on where Stokes makes a dive to his left, but it slips through still. Unfortunate for Stokes
slow legbreak, around off, and he uses soft hands to push this wide of cover
legbreak, on a length, middle and leg, punched down to long-off
on a length, into the pads, whipped away to deep square leg
too full, and driven to long-on for one
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, no turn, hits the pad, but headed down leg
punched down to long-on for one

nearly bowled'im. Not the kind of ball that should earn a wicket. This is a long hop, and it stays low as Pandey looks to pull. Gets an inside edge onto the pad well down the leg side, and it almost rolls back on
on a length, legbreak, punched down to long-off to bring up his fifty. An innings that has completely turned this game around
too short this time as he looks to go defensive, and Pandey is in great touch tonight. Pulled over midwicket for another big six
slower through the air, around off, defended off the back foot
down the wicket, Gopal pulls the length back, draws out a defensive shot

that is definitely pad first. The umpire, though, calls it not out, probably because it is missing off with the turn. This is a length ball that he goes back to cut, and it kisses the flap of the pad before hitting the bat. But it has hit Pandey's pad outside off so they lose the review
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
full, outside off, drilled hard to long-on
full, middle and off, he stays legside of it and drives this to long-off
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
turn there. This dips on him, turns from around leg, takes the soft front edge towards cover
on a length, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, into the body, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, drifting in, defended back to him
driven hard to long-on for one
slider, down the leg side, and he gets only a little bit of bat on this
short of a length again, cut away to the sweeper again
on a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
flighted legbreak outside off, pushed to cover

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, SIX runs
long_text: wide length ball, Pandey gets the big front foot down, and dismisses this over long-on. Pandey looking in great touch

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: on a length, hit uppishly, but it bounces well short of mid-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, SIX runs
long_text: this is not good enough to Pandey in this form. Short at 133ks, not even chest-high. No no no. Pulled over midwicket. The sound of the shot echoes around in the stadium

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, outside off, it gets big on him, but he finds enough power in the drive to clear mid-off. A seriously good shot
short of a length, outside off, he fends it down for a single

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Shankar, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, down the leg side, wide
full and straight, hit back hard, but Stokes gets a hand on it and the deflection goes to a fielder

attemps a bouncer, but Pandey says your pace doesn't intimidate me. Doesn't even bothering transferring his weight. Pulls him off the front foot and over deep midwicket. Hits the boundary rope on the full
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-off
they are feeding Pandey as if this is his birthday. Leg-side half-volley after those short and wide gifts last over. Whipped over deep square for six
slower ball, full, outside off, pushed past cover for one
full and straight, punched to mid-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: wide length ball, Pandey drives on the up, but it gets big on him. Mis-hit to cover
short and wide again, and thankfully Smith has given him protection deep on the off side. Just the two this time

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, punched to mid-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: gets this fuller. Still short of a length, and punched to mid-off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide again, and you don't want to play Pandey in. Cut in front of point again

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: short, wide, and despite the good carry, he has been cut in front of square for four
wide down the leg side, but there is a flick as this passes the bat. Nobody else is excited about it. Apart from me, that is
short of a length, rising again, and he fends but manages to keep it down
short of a length, in front of his throat, fended down

Can he ever? A 149kmph length ball seaming in to take the top of middle. As good as his ball to Shaw earlier in the season. Top-quality bowling. Some ego from Bairstow too? Three balls to go this over, could he have played them with a low back lift? This one allows him a gate to burst through. And burst through Archer does
on a length, straight, risky risky single to mid-on, but Uthappa's throw is wilde
pace like fire. Carry like trampoline. Just short of a length, 149ks, and Pandey flails his bat at it. Beaten. Samson collects this in front of his face
short of a length, just outside off, fended to point
wide length ball, driven on the up, not timed well. Fielded at cover-point
short of a length, slower ball, 120ks, around off, draws an inside edge onto the pad
slower ball, gone wrong, wide down the leg side

top edge to a length ball for a six. That is how it works if you swing hard enough. Another swipe across the line, and the ball is swinging a little. But the edge flies straight back over Samson's head
short of a length, outside off, crisp hit, but can't beat Parag at cover-point
Bairstow walks at him, and he slogs across the line of another outswinger. Lucky not to get any bat on it
Bairstow looks in good touch. This is a wide outswinger, on a length, and he drives it on the up, and in front of cover-point
on a length, 147ks, defended back. A wicket-maiden but for that edged boundary over slip
Archer ius letting 'em rip. Bouncer at 148ks, on top of middle, and he sways out of its line

and he has got him again. Never mind the format, the team, the colour of the ball, the colour of the jersey. Archer gets Warner all the time. And great captaincy to have that second slip in. This length ball seams away from him, takes a healthy edge, and Stokes dives to his left, full length, to take it. Archer to Warner in all formats this year: 7 innings, 45 balls, 32 runs, 6 dismissals
he has nearly got his man. Just out of the reach of the first slip. Short of a length, seaming away, Warner throws his bat at it, and the edge goes over Tewatia at slip
beats him again as Warner pushes inside the line of a length ball moving across him
short of a length, middle and off, seams away to beat him
that is an Archer special. Drops all nice little dinks and takes a wide full toss and sends it back over his head for a six
goes wide to defeat Archer's attempt at the ramp. Beats his outside edge
yorker, spot on, outside off, dug out for a single to mid-on
shuffles across, Natarajan bowls a wide low full toss, and he hits this straight to extra cover, who is in tight to prevent the single
misses the yorker, but the calf-high full toss ends with extra cover for just a single
changes the plan. Bowls a wide length ball. Goes too wide
Archer does what you do when someone is as good at the yorker as Natarajan. You ramp. Takes this on the full, and even adds a bit of a flick to the ramp
full and wide, hit to extra cover again, and this time Garg holds on to it
low full toss, outside off, driven extra cover. Garg has a shy, and concedes an overthrow
nearly a yorker, on the toes, Archer gets an inside edge past short fine leg for two
yorker outside off, squeezed out to deep point for one

smart bowling, smart catch. Parag leaves the crease, Holder bowls the slower wide short ball, taking it out of Parag's reach, who still flat-bats it and skies it. Warner back-pedals from mid-off to gets under it, but because he is still on the move, the catch is not clean. He juggles it as he falls over, and is lucky the ball has not bounced too far from him and completes the catch
goes for the yorker, but slides down the leg side
Smith gets no power. He is expecting the yorker, so he goes deep into the crease to turn this full ball into a half-volley, but manages no timing in the slog. Caught at long-on
gets the yorker right this time. Dug out back to Natarajan
gets this yorker nearly right. Just about six inches short of the mark. Paraga looks to go over cover with an open face, and gets a thick outside edge over short third man for four

that is a lovely shot, and not a moment too soon. Natarajan goes for the wide yorker, and misses the mark by a foot or so. Paraga reaches it, is down on a knee, and hits this over extra cover for a six
Parag corrects that. He knows Natarajan is bowling yorkrs, so he gets inside the line and down on a knee to take this on the full and ramp it over short fine
pinpoint yorker, middle and leg, and all Smith can do is dig it out for one
low full toss when looking for a yorker. Runs off the thick outside edge to square third man for one
on a length, into the pads, dropped to square leg for one. No attempt at slogging an over full of length balls
slower ball, full, outside off, Smith has to abort his big hit for just a single to deep point
slower ball, pushed towards deep midwicket. Played just a touch too hard to come back for two
appeal for a catch at the wicket down the leg side, but this has come off the pad. Parag misses out on a leg-side gift as he is late into the glance
slower ball, on a length, on off, bunted wide of long-on for two
short of a length, outside off, nicely timed, but straight to extra cover
nearly a yorker, Smith drives down the ground, and has hit it too hard to mid-off to be coming through for one
looks for the wide yorker, just inches off the length, squeezed out for two to deep point
on-pace length ball, 128ks, pushed to deep cover for one

and Shankar adds the huge Buttler wicket to an already impressive night's work. Buttler looks to walk at him and across too to create his own pace. Shanks slips this wide, takes the thick outside edge, and is caught at backward point
slower length ball, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
gentle length ball, Smith picks the gap he wants and slogs it there. Square of deep midwicket he goes
wrong'un, Buttler picks it, places it wide of deep midwicket, and comes back for two
on a length, middle and leg, pushed into the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Smith, no run
long_text: sees another full ball, and tries the big slog-sweep again. Seems to have picked the googly too. It just dips on him, and takes the inside edge onto the pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Smith, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, punched to cover
Smith is not premeditating to just play him out. Sees one too full, and slog-sweeps it wide of long-on for two. Along the ground
legbreak, down the leg again, worked away for one
makes room, opens the face on the cut, hits this uppishly, but gets it wide of the man at backward point. Four runs for his risk as the deep cover is too far in front of square
too full, dragged to wide long-on for one
makes room to punch this length ball to deep cover
wide length ball, played on the up, to long-off
quicker, short of a length, off the bottom edge for a single to cover-point
full, around off, pushed down the ground
legbreak, short of a length, goes back to work this to leg for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Buttler, no run
long_text: legbreak, quick, short of a length, on leg. Defended. Off the leading edge it goes back to him
another wrong'un, a touch too short, and pushed wide of deep midwicket for two

short_text: Rashid Khan to Buttler, no run
long_text: wrong'un, tossed up, just outside off. Buttler has picked it, and defends
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-on for one
double strike. Rashid gets Stokes. A long struggle comes to an end. Legbreak, middle and leg, turns in, beats the inside edge as he drives, and deflects off the pads onto the wicket
sharp bouncer. Registers only 129ks on the gun, but it has got good carry. Buttler is beaten on the hook. They appeal to try their lick on the glove. Not given. Not reviewed
on a length, just outside off, pushed with an open face
Holder has his own back immediately. Slower offcutter, just short of a length, turns back and beats his attempt to dab it square. Top of leg. Look at how much this has turned
lovely shot. Bouncer, at his face, Samson pulls this with his face down. Doesn't even look up to see where it is going as he has deposited this for a huge six over midwicket
full and wide, squeezed out to deep point for one
looks for the big shot over mid-off, but ends up slicing this over cover. Shuffles accross to get close to this length ball, but not close enough for that shot
looks to slog across the line. Offcutter. Beats him. Hits the pad. Headed down leg
wide on the crease, another slower ball, 112ks, on a length, outside off, opens the face for a single
short of a length, 127ks, Stokes makes room but is cramped up by this. Hits this back to Shankar
slower ball again, full, on the toes, clipped into a hole on the leg side for two
short of a length, slower ball, punched straight to extra cover
looks for the ramp, Shankar bowls a wide slower ball so he changes his shot to the reverse ramp. Beaten
Stokes is shaping up for the sweep, but Rashid fires this quick at his toes. Just the single to short fine leg
short of a length, legbreak, punched down to long-on for one
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
on a length, outside off, goes back to punch this against the turn, and past cover. Good timing. Sign of a turnaround?
short of a length, quick, pulled to long-on for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: wrong'un, on a length, into the pads, pushed to short midwicket
slower ball, short of a length, he adjusts well and punches him in front of deep point for one
low full toss, on the pads, clipped straight of deep midwicket for two
short and wide, cut to deep cover-point for one
slower ball, short of a length, runs this down to third man
incredible hit. Short of a length, not much room, and he goes over the top on the off side with a sort of a punch. Gets a lot of power. Deep point has to rush to his right to keep this one
short, angling across, and he has pulled this from outside off and over midwicket. Not the cleanest hit, but he has picked his spot well

Stokes keeps enjoying good fortune. He skips down the wicket, Rashid bowls a wrong'un, he goes towards deep midwicket, but doesn't get the distance. Shankar runs to his right. Does the hard work and gets to it, but can't hold on to the catch. Think it hits his chest and pops out, and he slips, which means he can't take the rebound either
stays back to push this to deep cover for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: wrong'un, just outside off, turning in, defended to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: on a length, quick, legbreak, defended from the crease

reverse sweep, and he is not able to get it behind square, which he wants to do. Now he has hit this in the air and to deep point. And for the second time tonight, a Stokes mis-hit falls just short of a deep fielder

short_text: Rashid Khan to Stokes, no run
long_text: quick legbreak, on a length, defended off the back foot
full, just short of being a yorker, dug out to mid-off for one
yorker, on off, dug out back to Natarajan
short of a length, angling away, runs off the outer half of the bat for one
length ball, on the pads, pushed past midwicket, and they come back for two
nice shot. Makes room to drive a length ball on the up, and in front of deep cover for two
length ball, at the pads, Samson looks to swing hard, but is beaten and hit on the pad. Pitched outside
short of a length, straight, pushed wide of midwicket for one
good bouncer with two deep men on the pull. He keeps it down, and takes the single to deep midwicket
another short and wide, hit-me ball, but again hit straight to a fielder. Extra cover does the job this time
short and wide, Stokes stays in the crease and cuts, but can't beat backward point
on a length, straight, driven back uppishly but wide enough of Shankar. A single to long-on
Stokes skips down immediately, Shankar pulls the length back, and his pull bounces just short of deep backward square leg
slower ball, Samson is not expecting it, he picks it off the pitch and defends
even better. Beats extra cover to his left this time. If the last shot was Saturday night, this is dreamy Sunday afternoon. Leans into a half-volley, and drives it between extra cover and cover-point
dismissive. Back-foot cover-drive on the up. Sharma has done nothing wrong. Inswinger, on a length, just outside off. Just that he is not very quick. Samson drives him hard, and wide of mid-off
makes room to punch this length ball to deep cover for one
on a length, outside off, no room, pushed back to him
still swinging it in, Samson gets a thick outside edge to third man for one
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
length ball, swinging into the pads, clipped past midwicket for one
wide on the crease, wide down the leg side

that is a gifted run-out. And for what? A quick single? Holder cramps Stokes up as he looks to dab it, the ball has hardly gone off the pitch, but Uthappa wants one. Stokes sends him back, but he is slow to turn back, and Holder is alert, quick and accurate. What a waste on a night that he was looking so good
Stokes ramps, Holder follows him, hits him high on the pad, it goes much finer than he intends to, but just wide of Bairstow
the keeper is back for a change, and Stokes walks at Holder, who pulls the length back, but he still goes ahead with a flat-bat smack over wide mid-on. Not many keepers will stand up to Holder

this drive echoes in the empty stadium. It is powerfully hit. Down the wicket, not close to its length so he just flat-bats it down the ground. Long-on is back, has only a few yards to go to his left to field this, but can't make it
Stokes has given up. He makes room to hit this straight to Rashid at mid-off, and goes off for the single. He is gone if Rashid hits, but he misses
driven on the up and on the walk, wide of mid-off, but can't beat him completely

crisp pick-up shot. Sharma too predictable bowling just inswingers, and at his pace he is easy to line up. This one strays into the pads, and Uthappa is all wrists with the aerial flick over square leg
wide length ball, Stokes moves across and drives it to deep cover
on a length, swinging away, punched to mid-off
lovely cover-drive. Shuffles across to cover Holder's wide lines, and takes this outswinger on the half-volley to find the gap between mid-off and extra cover
short of a length, the extra bounce allows him to go with the pull over mid-on. Not the sweetest of connections but it clears mid-on
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off
down the wicket, and Holder shortens the length to beat him with extra bounce
outswinger, on a length, outside off, defended
short of a length, good bounce, defended to cover
swinging down the leg side this time, and he plays the pick-up to deep midwicket
some more swing this, slightly fuller, beats him, but seems to have hit outside the line. Going high anyway
another inswinger, headed towards the middle of the off stump. Defended
on a length, swinging away again, punched uppishly to deep cover for one
on a length, swinging away, punched to cover-point
on a length, nips back in from outside off, Uthappa opens the face and takes a single
short of a length, outside off, he runs this down to third man. They need one but he runs two. Only one will be counted
yorker, dug out. Another dot
length ball, clipped in front of deep midwicket, and they come back for two
driven on the up but straight to mid-off
looks for the upper cut, but is beaten by the pace and the bounce outside off
backs away, Ferguson bowls the slower legcutter, and he can't get this past Ferguson
short of a length, outside off, hit back to Ferguson
low full toss outside off, pushed to deep point for one
and Kohli says he wants to end it this over. Goes over midwicket and connects this well
legcutter, pushed wide of point for one
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
smart shot. Picks his spot in the leg side, and sweeps Varun against the little turn that there is, and goes over square leg
short of a length, too wide, and Mann gets a thick edge on the cut to beat short third man
short, long hop, Mann looks to pull but it sits in the surface. Front edge to midwicket
full, really full, yorks him up, dug out to cover
full and straight, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, angling in, worked to deep square leg
big short ball, fended in front of the throat, and it goes uppishly to third man for one
Mann beaten by the extra bounce on the cut as this keeps rising outside off
short of a length again, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, fended down
tries the sweep this time, but is beaten outside off
legcutter, a touch too full, and Mann goes over extra cover for the second boundary of the over
short of a length, quick, defended back to him
fuller now, pushed to deep cover for one
Kohli quick to pounce as Varun overcompensates and drags this short and wide. He cuts it square for four
full toss, driven straight to short cover
short of a length, rising outside off, he rides the bounce and runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
lovly drive on the up. This is nowhere close to being a half-volley. He drives on the up, and past cover, for four
digs this in short, in front of his face, and Mann fends this down towards midwicket
short of a length, angling, pushed to short midwicket, who is in for the single
on a length, outside off, angling in, hits the inside half of the bat as he pushes at it
tossed-up legcutter outside off, Kohli defends this to cover
stays back to defend a length ball
nearly caught and bowled. Hard hands on this drive. This is the wrong'un, and he gets a thick edge back to Varun, but it doesn't carry
full, turning in, worked to leg for one
short of a length, legcutter, pushed to cover. Sent back
full, outside off, driven to long-off. Don't expect Kohli to take this chase lightly
wide length ball, pushed to cover
full, swinging in, pushed back to him

Padikkal has run himself out. Short of a length, pushed in front of square, this should be Mann's call, but Padikkal takes on a single that is not on. Mann doesn't respond. Padikkal keeps coming, and the midwicket fielder has enough time to carry the ball himself and deliver it to the wicket at the non-striker's end
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease

and Ferguson produces the wicket immediately. These things always happen just to show up your captaincy even further. The extra pace from Ferguson, Finch stays back to a length ball, and it holds its line to take the edge
slower ball, big wide down the leg side, Karthik dives to his left to reach this on the half-volley
short of a length, middle and off, played with an open face for a single
slow through the air, some dip, just outside off, hits the outside half of the bat
legcutter, too full, but driven straight to cover-point
short of a length again, into the body, whipped past mid-on for one
too wide, and Padikkal goes back to cut him past the diving man at point. RCB still on for a 10-over finish
short of a length again, into the body, he gets inside the line to take a single to short fine leg
short of a length, into the wicket, worked to square leg for one
and he gets a boundary finally. Walks at Cummins, who bowls a length ball on the pads, and he whips it over square leg for four
bouncer as Finch walks down. He has to sway out of its way
short of a length, wide, Finch goes back on the cut, but can't beat point
wide length ball, Finch is on the walk and he pushes this past point for two
clipped away over the infield on the leg side, but it bounces well short of deep square leg
short of a length, tucked away past mid-on for two

Finch gets an inside edge and that beats short fine leg. He is shuffling right across the wicket, and for a moment the bowler must have thought the lbw is in play. The edge, though, dashes all his hopes
this time the length is pulled back, which means Padikkal gets under this too much, but he has hit this powerfully enough to clear mid-off
Padikkal with another aerial off-drive. Kishna is just a touch too full, allowing him to play the shot. Over mid-off he goes
short of a length, sliding down, worked away for a single. Again stayed in the crease
on a length, outside off, the rare time that Finch has stayed in his crease. Defends
short of a length, no room, runs this down to third man for one
down the wicket again, Cummins stays short of a length, pushed to cover
down the wicket again, Cummins shortens his length, pushed to midwicket
Cummins responds with a yorker, Padikkal squeezes it out for a single to third man
lovely shot from Padikkal. He has tried this twice before but nails it this time. Makes room, Cummins is too full, and he drives it inside-out and over mid-off
down the wicket again, pushed to mid-off for for a single
