seam movement this time to hit him on the pad but Finch has got himself outside the line
Finch down the wicket again, and this is a wide down the leg side
walking at him again, Krishna goes short of a length, pushed wide of mid-on for one

appeal for a catch at the wicket. Not given. Not reviewed. Karthik likes it but Morgan doesn't. Finch is walking at him, the ball hits something on its way to Karthik, and it seems it is just the pad, and he has got himself out the line to avoid the lbw. Actually not outside the line. It is an umpire's call
another big swing, gets a thick outside edge for a single to third man
big swing and a miss. On a length, around off, moves away to beat him
full, outside off, pushed straight to mid-on, but he can make the single because he has played this on the walk
Finch walks down again, Krishna looks to tuck him up, but bowls a wide down the leg side
Finch walks at him, Krishna bowls short of a length, hits him high on the bat
on a length, straight, defended back to him
uppish but reaches cover-point on a half-volley. Early into the drive on the up. Lucky to survive
full and straight, whipped away to deep square leg
walks at Cummins, who fires this in straight and quick, but they get two leg-byes as this is sliding down leg
on a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
on a length, outside off, left alone, collected on the half-volley by Karthik
full toss, cramps him up, and I like that they have risked the second even though this has been hit to long-on. The throw comes in right on top of the wicket, and Yadav is run out by inches
slower short ball, does Ferguson in as he looks to cut it up and over. Beaten
full, swinging in, driven wide of long-off for two
cramps him on the attempted slog as Ferguson backs away. Skies into the vacant midwicket region inside the circle. Comes back for two
quicker short ball, Yadav makes room and cuts this
length ball, on the pads, Yadav makes room and swings this over midwicket for a four. Slower ball, allows Yadav the time
nearly a yorker, dug out for a single

looks like a hat-trick of successful reviews against S Ravi but he has got this one right. Ferguson looks dead for all money as he walks across his stumps but replays show he has got a bit of an inside edge. They lose the review
slower bouncer it seems, pulled over midwicket for one. Called one for the over
Ferguson down the wicket to swing this to long-on for one
short, cramps him up as he makes room. Bottom edge on the pull for a single
full, on off, dug out to cover
yorker to finish the over. Yadav opens the face, but plays this straight to point
short ball, loopy bounce, bounces over his cut
on a length, angling in, and they go past their own lowest total with a single to long-on
crunched away, on the up, inside-out, but straight to point
slower ball, full toss, dips late on him, clipped to leg for two
Ferguson makes room to try and drive through cover. Beaten outside off
full, outside off, pushed to short straight midwicket
he tries the reverse sweep and is beaten
slow and loopy again, on off, driven to deep cover for one
the teaser, wide outside off, looping and dipping, beats him on the drive
down the wicket to chip this over midwicket for two
wrong'un, outside edge, and Kohli beaten at slip. Many odd things in one ball. Ferguson plays inside the line of this, it doesn't turn enough, and the outside edge flies past Kohli's left
slows this one down, 85ks, on a length, on off, holds its line. Defended
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one

and Morgan perishes. I think the lure is the short boundary, but Sundar doesn't give him the length to pepper it. Morgan goes deep into the crease to try to pull this short-of-a-length ball, and gets no power into it because it is not short enough. Caught at deep midwicket
slog sweep. Morgan keeps swinging. Between deep square and deep midwicket. Along the ground
on a length, just outside off, pushed with an open face for one
full, straight, defended back to him

Morgan keeps fighting the good fight, though. Saini tries to bounce him, pitches it outside leg, and he pulls it through forward square leg for four. KKR have at least gone past the 47 or 49 that they had bowled RCB for in 2017. Not that it should be any consolation
short of a length, no room, Yadav manages to cut it in front of point for one
wide length ball, left alone
quick, on a length, on off, defended with an open face
full, middle and off, defended back to him
on a length, around off, pushed with an open face for one
short of a length, around off, punched down to long-off for one
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
Yadav plays for the turn, is hit on the inside half of the bat. Takes a single
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
full, outside leg, he sweeps it, but can't beat short fine leg
slow legbreak again, defended to leg

Chahal is so good at teasing them out. Cummins has been tied up for so long that he throws his arms at the first ball tossed up. Chahal is a wily bowler. Not only does he toss this up over his eyeline, he bowls it wide of his reach. All Cummins manages to do is hole out to long-off
full, dipping, middle and leg, hit back to him
full, middle and leg, clipped off the toes
make that four maidens. Short of a length, no room, defended back. No team had ever bowled three in one innings. Now we have four
beaten on the outside edge. Cummins doesn't know what line to play. He is playing for the turn, and fails to connect
on a length, on off, pushed back to him. A fourth maiden coming?
slider outside off, and Cummins is beaten on the outside edge this time

big appeal for lbw as Cummins plays the big sweep from in front of the stumps. Not given, but Kohli has reviewed it. That looks like a pretty good shout because Sundar doesn't turn the ball. Pitches middle, goes with the angle but no turn, and it just clips leg. Saved by the umpire's call
short of a length, just outside off, pushed back to Sundar
on a length, middle and off, defended off the back foot
on a length, no turn, worked to leg for one
slow, high, outside leg, swept to short fine for one
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
short, and it sits in the surface and turns away. Cummins punches this down to long-off for one
legbreak, on a length, middle and leg, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched past cover for two
on a length, around off, sliding in, pushed to mid-on
quicker, on a length, outside off, punched to long-off for one
full, outside off, pushed to short straight cover
again he drives for the offbreak, but this slides away to beat his outside edge
plays for turn, and the ball is not turning today. Beaten on the outside edge
full, straight, turned past short leg for one

another wrong'un, and this time he has got the lbw. Again it seems like going down leg to me, and Cummins has reviewed it this time. Pitches off, hits him in front of leg, and by extension it is missing. Two balls, two reviews overturned against S Ravi

big appeal for lbw but this is headed down leg according to the umpire, and me. But Kohli reviews it with one second to go. This is the wrong'un, Karthik defends for the legbreak, but it turns the other way ever so slightly. And RCB and Chahal have got it spot on. This pitches on middle, doesn't turn too much, just enough to beat his inside edge and it is going on to hit the leg stump
swept away from outside leg for one
straighter, fuller, worked to leg for one
this one doesn't turn. Slow in the air, conventional legbreak, Karthik plays an inside-out drive accounting for the turn, but gets an inside edge as it goes straight on

takes on the short boundary. Morgan has walked out with intent today. He gives him a bit of a shimmy, Saini bowls the bouncer, and Morgan goes ahead with the hook, clearing the man on the deep square leg fence
full, down the leg side, clipped off the toes
short of a length, 138ks, good rise, chest-high, fended down by Karthik
fuller, straighter, punched down the ground, but straight to mid-on
stays on that in-between length, around off, pushed with an open face
on a length, outside off, hits him high on the bat and on the inside half of it
slight shimmy down the wicket, Udana shortens the length, Morgan cuts it, but again he finds the man at point
another inside-out drive, on the up this time, and he can't beat extra cover
shortens the length just a little, gets closer to off, and draws a defensive shot
top shot. Half-volley, just outside off, and Morgan has been staying leg-side of deliveries anyway. he drives this between mid-off and extra cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
full, into the pads, clipped away to deep backward square
bouncer, looks high, but not called a wide
nails the cut this time, finally, but can't beat Padikkal at backward point. RCB are on it every ball every time
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed straight to backward point
down the wicket to turn this into a length ball and drive straight of Morris at mid-off but they won't get a single because Karthik is on the ground trying to get out of the way of the shot
short of a length, no room, Morgan gets another bottom edge on the cut
through a misfield, that is how. On a length, driven straight of mid-on, Morris gets a hand on it with the dive but can't gather it clean. They take the single
full, really full, Morgan backing away again, drives this straight to extra cover
beaten. Morgan is backing away almost every ball, and looks to open the face on this despite there being a slip in place. Misses
short of a length, no room, pushed to cover-point
swinging yorker outside off, and it squeezes under his bat

Morris is in a celebrappeal as this seams back to hit Karthik on the pad. Not given on the field. RCB review. On a length, outside off, big movement after pitching, but only umpire's call on top of the leg stump. So it stays not-out but they retain the review
on a length, slight inwards movement. Defended off the front foot
a second straight maiden. Just the on wicket this time, though. How disappointing Mo' Siraj. Short of a length, outside off, punched straight to point
short ball, gets it high, Morgan keeps the pull down but can't beat square leg
Morgan is backing away first ball, Siraj goes wide, and he gets a bottom edge on the cut

Siraj on an absolute roll. Repeat of 2017 anyone? On a length, scrambled seam, and I am not sure this has moved away after pitching. Seems like Banton has just driven inside the line to edge it through to the keeper
wide length ball, pushed to cover
misses a leg-side half-volley, but I think this has swung in late. Leg-bye for KKR
lovely shot. Banton showing some of his wares. Short-arm pull as this short ball angles into his body. Goes flat over square leg for a six. This is only short of a length, and not a long hop
nearly played on. Short of a length, jags back in, inside edge onto the toe
short of a length, outside off, he looks to drive this on the up, but ends up inside the line
long half-volley. That is some relief. He punches this through mid-on for four, all along the ground

and on a night when KKR need Gill to be circumspect, he plays an ambitious shot to make it nothing for 3. Gill is having a horror season: slow when quick runs are needed, reckless when you need to rebuild. This is short, outside off, and he plays the pull, only to top-edge it to midwicket
shuffles across to drive on the up, hit on the inside half of the bat
short of a length, chest high. Defended. A double-wicket maiden
bowls in inwinger, aimed at the stumps. Defended from the crease

Bluffmaster. Siraj has bluffed Rana. He has shown him the field for a bouncer, and slipped in the full swinging ball to knock him over. Rana's feet are stuck behind, he makes no attempt to get in line, and the ball swings back to make its way through the big gate

they have strangled Tripathi. He has been given no width at all all innings. This is short of a length, just outside off, and he can only push at it with an open face. The ball swings to take the edge
gets width for the first time, walks into a drive, but can't beat cover-point
on a length, straight. Defended. No room given to Tripathi so far
outswinger, outside off, and Gill ends up playing a defensive push outside its line. This outswinger has pitched, and changed its direction. Seam movement
short, outside off, pulled to mid-on. No power in the shot
inswinger again, a touch too straight, and clipped away for one
yes, he bowls an inswinger, headed towards the middle of the off stump. Pushed to mid-off
on a length, into the pads, clipped away to deep fine leg for one
wide down the leg side, and he has missed out on easy boundary. He tried, though, but couldn't catch up with it

Sams, as he has done all night, slips one in too full without meaning to bowl a yorker, and Neesham loves the slot ball. Slogs it over midwicket. And KXIP have won this without taking it into the last over

oh man. KXIP trying their best to take this into the Super Over, but DC say no thanks, we will let you have an easy one. Hooda goes for a big shot to a length ball, it seems like a slight offcutter, and he skies it to extra cover where Stoinis drops him
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover-point who is in tight on the single
short of a length, into the body, tucked away to long leg
length ball, outside off, driven to deep cover for one more
more blips on the way, though, as Neesham looks for a big shot down the ground and gets a thick outside edge for a single to third man

short_text: Axar Patel to Hooda, no run
long_text: down the wicket, yorks himself up, pushes this to midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to Hooda, FOUR runs
long_text: that should be the shot that does it for KXIP. Just a little short of length, and he goes deep into the crease to whip it over midwicket and into the gap on the leg side
sweeps this from around off for a single to deep square leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Neesham, no run
long_text: quicker, into the pads, and this time he hits it back to Patel

short_text: Axar Patel to Neesham, no run
long_text: full, outside off, driven down the ground, but can't beat the short straight extra cover
length ball, into the pads, worked to leg for one

nearly a stumping. Ashwin bowls a legbreak, beats him in the flight as he skips down the wicket. Oh this is a wrong'un in fact. He has done him in twice in one ball, but he gets his pad in the way and it deflects out of Pant's reach
slows this one down, offbreak on middle and off, he waits for it to turn and works this to leg for one
full, outside off, 96ks, which is quick for Ashwin. Defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, cut away past point for one
opens the face on this but short third man is tight on the single
carrom ball, front edge to the left of Ashwin, who puts in a dive to save the single
wide length ball, driven on the up to deep point for one

oh that touch was too brief. Maxwell goes back and across looking for a pick-up shot into the leg side, and Rabada stays on a length outside off. This is bowled cross-seam, and it sits in the surface a touch. He toe-ends a skier for Pant to take. Not without a dive, though, as these catches in Dubai have been tough to judge

that is some of the good Maxwell touch coming back. He is forever looking to shuffle across to Rabada, but this time he goes short and wide. Maxwell is quick to adjust and pulls this over mid-on for a flat four
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, extra bounce, beats him as he looks to open the face
Maxwell keeps trying the pick-up shot after getting inside the line to Rabada. Bounces well short of deep square leg
flighted outside off, driven in front of point. Takes just the single even though the fielder in the deep is Shaw
pushed wide of cover for another single

short_text: Axar Patel to Hooda, no run
long_text: down the wicket, fired in, hit on the pad, but it is going down
stays back for a slow delivery, 86ks. It runs off the outside edge to short third man, and he responds to Hooda's call
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Hooda, no run
long_text: quick, length ball, pushed to short cover
Sams has been playing with fire this over. Two half-volleys before this were hit straight to the fielders, but Maxwell doesn't miss this time. Places this drive wide of mid-off for four
slower offcutter, Hooda walks at him a little and runs this down to third man
short of a length, just outside off, pushed with an open face
slower ball, full, driven hard to mid-off, who is at the edge of the circle. And yet he is gone if Deshpande hits. He misses
full, outside off, crisply hit, but straight to extra cover
a length ball on the pads, and Hooda plays a nothing flick in the air. He is lucky the field is up, and it just clears mid-on

Maxwell tried this earlier in the over, but gets the right line now. Gets inside the line of a ball sliding down leg, and flicks it fine of long leg for four. It has gone at a catchable height, but a little too far for a fast bowler to even attempt a catch
unconvincing again. Rabada goes full fast and straight. Hooda pushes this uppishly through midwicket
oh this is fast and furious. Short of a length, into the body, Hooda fends, it hits him high on the bat and falls where a forward short leg would have been

Rabada strikes again. He gets a wicket at least every match. Pooran has gloved it while swaying out of its line. Rabada bowls this short, gives him no room, but when you are leaving one alone your Test technique comes into play. He doesn't drop his wrists fast enough, and the ball kisses the glove on the way through to Pant
edged away to bring up his fifty. Rabada drags him wide with a length ball angled away from him. He looking to drive it down he ground, and the edge is healthy enough to fly wide of Pant
length ball, down the leg side, whipped away, but straight to long leg
legbreaak, outside off. A touch too full and Maxwell goes for the slog. The lack of turn means he ends up dragging this to long-on for one
wide carrom ball, going wider, and called too
short of a length, into the pads, punched to deep square for one
are they getting too cute now? Pushed with soft hands to the 30-yard circle, and they come back for two. Maxwell is gone if Sams hits direct. He misses
soft hands to a length ball into the pads, perfectly placed into the leg side for two
short of a length, punched to right of Patel at cover. They don't run even though it has gone to Patel's wrong hand
carrom ball, full, clipped off the toes for one
stays back to bunt a slow length ball to long-on for one
short and wide, trying to deny him that midwicket hit. He cuts it to deep cover
short of a length, into the body, worked to deep square for one
wide length ball, driven on the up, wide of deep cover, but Maxwell shouts loud and early to say there is no two here

short_text: Axar Patel to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: Pooran is not a man getting off the plane. He is flying this plane. Just slightly short of a length, and he goes deep into the crease to pull this for a massive six over midwicket
short of a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
good delivery. On a length, around off, and nips a little to leave him. Pooran, to his credit, pushes only inside its line
wide down the leg side, and Pant concedes a bye too
length ball outside off, opens the face, gets a single
fuller, wider, outside his eye line, beats him on the drive
Pooran's rules are simple: you have got Rabada, Ashwin, Axar, please bring them back on. I am not going to let Stoinis and Deshpande bowl. Gets under a length ball and goes smack over long-on
man he is living life in the fast lane. Length ball, no pace to work with, mid-off in the circle, and yet he hits this hard and in the air. He has managed to place this one wide of the man, though
a length ball, angling in, worked to leg for one
on a length, on off, defended with an open face. Somebody shouts a loud NO this time
yet another slower short ball. Off memory, every time he has tried that tonight, Deshpande has been dispatched. Over midwicket it goes this time

is that just the luck Pooran needs? Oh this one has seamed at 141ks in the ninth over. Short of a length, middle and leg, Pooran defends for the angle, but it jags back to take a thick inside edge that Pant can't catch up with

slow down? Pooran doesn't know what that means. If the ball is there to hit, he has to hit it. And more power to him. Deshpande bowls short, not even chest high, and at that pace, it has to go. Over deep square it goes. Lovely hit
short of a length, straight, defended off the back foot
short of a length, wide, punched past point for one. Maxwell doesn't respond to Pooran's call for the second. Looking at the fielder, Shaw, the second is pretty much on
carrom ball, short of a length, worked into the leg side for one

nearly another run-out. This time Maxwell sends him back. This is to the right of short cover, so I think the single is on if you set off immediately. Maxwell doesn't. Pooran is gone for all money, but the throw is wide. Pant dives to take it one-handed and flick it in the same motion. He misses the stumps, and they take the overthrow
lovely offspin. Slow in the air, drifting in, dropping on him, not turning, hitting the pad. Just sliding down leg
carrom ball, Maxwell looks to punch it, gets a thick outside edge, and Rabada misfields it at short third man to concede two extra runs
pushed to deep cover for one
lovely little cut. Just inches short of a length, and he is quick to rock back and cut this hard so as to give deep cover no chance to cut this off
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
wide length ball, driven uppishly past cover
lovely delivery. On a length, just outside off, and beats his drive with some movement away. This is not just the angle, but some movement after pitching
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
on a length, outside off, pushed to point
he bowls full again, and down the leg side. Clipped away for two
bowls on a length. Wide down leg side
pushes this to wide long-on for one

slower in the air, and Agarwal is caught ball-watching. He is livid with Pooran as he walks off. Pooran has pushed this wide of Ashwin, and sets off. It is his call as he is running to the danger end. Agarwal doesn't respond to his call at first, but sets off once he sees Pooran doesn't have brakes in his system. Too late. Ashwin's throw is good enough to catch him short? What's more? He seems to have hurt himself. He is limping off the park
on a length, drifting in, middle and leg, defended
oh starts off with a lovely cover-drive first ball. Ashwin overpitches for a change, and he drives it past extra cover. Easy as Sunday afternoon

oh he still takes him out. To say that he has the wood on Gayle will be an understatement. Lovely old-fashioned spin bowling. Slow in the air, dipping on him, pitches on off. Gayle looks for the slog sweep, but he has been done in the air, and also off the pitch as it goes straight on instead of turning. Bowled neck and crop
full, into the pads, eases into a drive, beats mid-on. Patel runs to his left from long-off to save two runs
slower short ball again, pulled to deep square leg for one
goes full and fast, 146ks, but wide down the leg side
slower short ball again, and Gayle unleashes the best of the shots. Pulls this from well outside off and well over mid-on for a flat six into a camera
more power. Short of a length again, outside off, slower ball, which means Gayle doesn't get all of it, but gets enough to clear the infield on the off side
and now he shows the power. It is BOSS TIME. Deshpande goes shorter than the two previous balls, and this bounces only slightly higher than the waist. He pulls it over midwicket
that is four more. Universe Boss showing he has touch to go with power. Short of a length, again, down the leg side, and the short fine leg is up. Gayle tucks this away wide of that man
short of a length, gentle pace, outside off, almost gently pushed for four through cover. All timing
slower bouncer, Agarwal goes for it, and makes sure he pulls in front of square because the boundary rider is square on the leg side. Gets two for it
wide down the leg side
quick, on a length, no room, 136ks. Defended
slower offcutter, 118ks, on top of off, Gayle dabs on it, and Agarwal calls him through for a quick single
another bouncer. This time at 137ks. Gayle sways out of its line
top bouncer. At 144ks, At his head. Agarwal is pulling even as his head falls away. The top edge falls clear of square leg, though
full, outside off, driven crisply, but can't beat the diving extra cover
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
Gayle shuffles across, and Patel slips this down leg. Just the single to leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Gayle, no run
long_text: stays on a length, outside off, and bowls this one at 94ks. Pushed to cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Gayle, no run
long_text: on a length, 92ks, outside off, defended

huge wicket. A rare Rahul failure. Patel showing why he is having such a great season. He sees Rahul skip down the wicket, and slows this down. The ball gets some drop too, which means he is not quite to the pitch of it. And then the lack of the turn does the rest to go off the inside half of the bat for a catch to mid-on

short_text: Axar Patel to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. This is dreamy batting. It is a length ball at 100ks, not too wide, and yet Rahul bends his back knee to create his own length, and late-cuts this for four
misses out. The fine leg had come up and Rabada slipped down leg, but Rahul can't place the glance either side of the man. They get a single off the misfield, though
short of a length, angling in, worked into a gap on the leg side
short ball, gets big on him as he looks to get inside the line, gloves it away for one to fine leg
on a length, outside off, hits him high on the bat as he looks to make some room
short of a length, outside off, dabbed to cover-point
on a length, angling in, worked to leg
nearly a yorker, outside off, Agawar gets a bit of an inside edge back to Sams
full, outside off, driven crisply, but straight to mid-off. He takes the risky single, and makes it
full, swinging, near yorker. Hits him on the pad, but after taking the inside edge

Rahul couldn't have asked for a better way to get into his innings. A free hit early into the innings. Sams goes to his trusted slower ball, but pitches it on a half-volley. Rahul holds his shape, and goes high over long-off
oh no-ball because he has knocked the wicket at the non-striker's end. He has done it with the hand as it goes up for the delivery
short of a length, outside off, Rahul looks to cut, but the extra bounce beats him
slight swing, but this is a full toss. Driven to short cover, and they don't run off the misfield
perfect yorker at the base of the leg stump to knock him over. Shami has bowled excellently here to bring KXIP right back into the contest
another yorker nailed. Hetmyer digs it out, but they take on an overthrow for the second. Why is the throw needed?
looks for the outrageous reverse sweep to 145ks low full tosses. Easy into it, and the front edge gets him just a single
low full toss, but Hetmyer doesn't get enough on it. Just the single to mid-off
making room, but Shami doesn't waiver off the yorker length. Dug out for one to long-off
shuffles around, takes this on the full, and places this into the leg side

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Hetmyer, SIX runs
long_text: Hetmyer finally joins the party. This is how difficult it is to bowl at the death. Arshdeep misses the yorker by half a foot, but Hetmyer goes deep in the crease to take it on the half-volley, and hit him over long-on

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: yorker gone wrong, but it is still a straight low full toss. Hit hard but straight to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, 2 runs
long_text: Dhawan charges at him, Arshdeep bowls this short, and away from his reach. The toe-end cut goes past point for two. Back-to-back hundreds in the IPL. First time ever. He raises his arms in celebration

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, 2 runs
long_text: Dhawan looks to undo the yorker with a ramp but he is early into the shot. The front edge goes softly down the ground, and Hetmyer initiates the second and makes it
another yorker nailed. Hetmyer gets a single to cover

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Hetmyer, no run
long_text: no fancy slower ball first up. The yorker. Dug out back to Arshdeep

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: yorker gone wrong, and this could have been the hundred. Dhawan hits the full toss straight to extra cover. A little bit either side, and this is four

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: oh Shami. He doesn't want to be too predictable with yorkers so bowls one short of a length and into the body. Dhawan still manages to cut it, and cut it hard, wide of square third man for a four

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhawan looks to give him the charge, but Shami still bowls a yorker. What an adjustment in length. Dug out back to Shami, who makes him rush back. In fact if Shami's throw is accurate, he gets Dhawan. He misses

yorker gone wrong, but when you err you err on the full side. That is what has happened, and Stoinis who is looking to go deep into the crease is surprised as this full toss gets big on him. He gets a thick outside edge for a skier for Agarwal to catch after running to his right from cover
Shami nails another yorker. Dug out with an open face for just a single
lovely yorker first up. Just the single to long-on
full legbreak, but it dips on him to deny him the big hit. Runs off the outside half of the bat for one
wrong'un, short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
down for the sweep early, Ashwin shortens the length, he places it wide of the deep fielder on the leg side. Comes back for two
full, outside off, drilled to long-off
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside leg, worked to leg for one

short_text: Ashwin to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: Dhawan is going to take down the legspinner. Can't let him bowl the 17th unless he is of the pedigree of Rashid or Narine. And this is a risky shot, slogging against the turn of a wrong'un on a big ground. But he has got just enough to clear the boundary rider

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: driven down the ground for one
beaten by wrong'un as Stoinis winds up for a big hit. Hits Rahul just on top of the flap of the pad and they take the run

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: Bishnoi has done him in the flight. He is down the wicket, Bishnoi gets it wide of him, and he ends up slicing it up in the air between cover and long-off. Hooda rushes in, but can't make it. Doing an interview on the sidelines. Jonty Rhodes says he heard no calling. That is not great
full, just outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: attempted big sweep, not hit cleanly, which is just as well as this falls short of deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Dhawan's placement is impeccable. Bishnoi bowls full, on his toes, looking to take his arms away from him, but he whips it out of the hope and between deep midwicket and long-on
on a length, straighter, pushed into a gap between deep square and deep midwicket for two
full, just outside off, Stoinis's eyes lught up, and he swings without any feet. Beaten
picks the wrong'un, makes room, and goes over point for a single

short_text: Ashwin to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: powerful slog sweep. Just a touch too full even though the line is good and wide outside off. Dhawan has got the right length to sweep, and goes wide of long-on
wrong'un, picks it off the pitch, and punches it down to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, Dhawan sweeps. Just a touch too full to be sweeping but he gets the bottom half of the bat on it in time
full, outside off, driven to long-off
full, outside off, punched to long-off. And good to see he has learnt his lesson. No converting ones into twos off a slight fumble

gets too close to this one. KXIP have bowled really well to Pant, who has been looking to take one of the spinners down. And they haven't given him the length to do so. Jumps out of the crease again to try to create his length, but gets too close to it, which means not enough elevation, and an easy catch at long-on
into the pads, and worked away for a single again
full, into the pads, clipped off the toes
on a length, into the pads, nudged to midwicket for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: tries the slog to this, but is just short of a length, and it skids on to take the inside edge onto the pad

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: down the wicket again, beaten in the air again, and he ends up defending a wrong'un to cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: wrong'un again, on off, turning away, cut away past point for one. Dhawan wants two. Pant sends him back again

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: Dhawan keeps the hits coming. Opens the front leg, goes down on a knee, and sweeps this length ball over deep square lg. All timing. That is 5000 IPL runs for Dhawan
another wrong'un, on a length, outside leg, turning towards middle, pushed to long-on for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: ridiculous lbw appeal to a ball pitched short and outside leg. They get a leg-bye
and he tries the big hit now, but Maxwell gets enough drop on the ball to beat him in the flight. The inside edge is thick, hits the pad, lobs up, but falls well short of Maxwell
down the wicket again, but Maxwell stays away from his swinging zone. The push is not wide enough of Maxwell to get him a single
short of a length, straight, worked into the leg side for one
down the wicket, Maxwell shortens the ength, and he manages just the single to deep midwicket
on a length, angling in, punched to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, into the body, worked away into the leg side
shimmies down the wicket to nudge this length ball into the leg side. Dhawan wants the second but Pant sends him back. The call is clear and early

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, straight, tucked away to deep midwicket
this time he goes back to cut the slider to deep cover-point for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: wrong'un outside off. Pant seems to be shaping up for the big slog, but has to abort as he reads this off the pitch

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: again, outside off and sliding away. Defended back as this is not short

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: slider, short of a length, and even if it is not too wide, the length gives Pant the time to punch this wide of the diving short cover
full, into the pads, nudged into the leg side for a single
this time the ball turns from around leg to defeat a repeat of the last shot. He does get a single to square leg, though

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely batting. Short, quick, but slightly too far down the leg side. And again, Dhawan is not happy with just the one extra. He wants to tap this fine for four. And he succeeds too
slight shimmy down the wicket to push this length ball down to long-on
down the wicket, hit hard back at him, and Maxwell can't field this clean because it is hit too hard. They take a single off the defelction
full, on the toes, driven to long-on for one
on a length, around off, punched down to long-on for one
on a length, outside off, slight turn back, punched to the right of Ashwin but not wide enough
full, on the pads, clipped to midwicket

lovely catch. He is so confident Iyer has hit this that he is not even bothering with the stumping. This is a legbreak down the leg side, drifting outside Iyer's eyeline. He tries to clip this fine, but the ball turns back just enough to take the edge. Rahul is right behind it to accept it
wrong'un, starts outside leg, turns towards off. Punched down to long-off to bring up yet another fifty. Answering the voices that doubted him and called for him to be left out

short_text: Ashwin to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full toss, on the pads, and Dhawan goes down on a knee to sweep this to the right of deep backward square leg
full and wide, and Dhawan drives it hard to wide long-off. The fielder there is wide so they will get just one

short_text: Neesham to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, down the leg side, and the fine leg is square. Dhawan lets it come to him, and he flicks it fine of that long leg for four. That is 400 runs for him this IPL
on a length, at the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
legcutter, on a length, around off, Iyer plays with soft hands and the edge goes wide of Rahul and falls shor too. He does get a glove to it to make sure this doesn't go for four
down the wicket, Neesham shortens the length, outside leg and angling towards off. Punched to deep cover
length ball, down the leg side, clipped away to long leg
full, into the pads, clipped away for one
full, outside off, chipped to wide long-off. He has gone in air, but he has not hit it hard enough for it to carry to the fielder
short of a length, and Iyer goes back to cut this to deep cover
on a length, on off, not much turn, pushed to short cover
wrong'un, on a length, on off, turning away, cut away to deep cover
full, straight, legbreak. Worked to leg for one
short of a length, around off, again uses soft hands for a single when he can't hit a boundary

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: full toss, into the pads, driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, straight, tucked away to square leg for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: short, wide, cut away, but they have a deep point in place

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: bouncer, chest-high, so not a bad ball at all. It is getting big on Dhawan, but he rides it well, and keeps this down as he pulls it square for four. Just the lack of that 5-6kmph on it makes all the difference to this pull
short of a length, no room, he drops this at his toes, and this time they take the single

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, dropped at his toes, Dhawan looks up at Iyer if he wants to come through for one. Iyer doesn't

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short, wide down the leg side, and Dhawan says he will take the boundary instead of the one extra. And he pulls him fine, helping this along

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: and they keep going after the bowling. Shami has just done him in with seam, but as soon as he overpitches, Dhawan drives him well over mid-off

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: this time Shami is unlucky. Short of a length, closer to off, and it jags back in to take the inside edge. Misses the stumps and goes to short fine

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: off the edge but Shami can't consider himself unlucky. This is short, this is wide, and Dhawan has all the freedom to throw his bat at it. Goes wide of the keeper

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, angling in, no room. Played with an open face
oh a dreamy Buttler-like six. It is like silk. Neesham bowls a wide length ball, Iyer reaches it, opens the face slightly, and drives up and over extra cover. Smooth as
full, middle and off, Iyer defends this back
short of a length, no room, opens the face on it for a single

short_text: Neesham to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: wide length ball, driven on the up, but can't beat the short extra cover

smartly bowled, and he has held his own pretty well. Not the perfect seam-up delivery, not the full-blown legcutter. Just slight rolling of the fingers on its side. Short of a length, outside off, and Shaw is looking to go over mid-off. Early into the shot, and the toe-edged skier is caught at extra cover
gets away with one. A gentle loopy full toss, on pads, and Shaw has surprisingly played this straight to midwicket

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good come back. Short of a length, no room, defended back to him

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: skips down the track, turns this into a length ball, and lofts him over mid-off. DC are a dominant side, and they are not going to let young bowlers settle into a rhythm
short of a length, he stays deep in the crease to pull it, and it bounces short of deep midwicket

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: fortune favours the brave. Bouncer, but just down the leg side, and Shaw knows now half measures. It goes off the glove but there is enough in it to clear the keeper

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Shaw, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Shaw, no run
long_text: full and straight, good to see Shaw go after a ball that deserves it. No point fretting over what has happened last over. Driven crisply but straight to mid-on

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and straight, a touch too full, driven hard but straight to the mid-on placed wide

short_text: Shami to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, cut to cover-point
thick outside edge. Shami goes straight with a length ball, Shaw thinks he can slog this, but the ball holds its line, thus taking the edge. It bounces well short of third man
bouncer, but a wide down the leg side

a nothing shot. Short, wide, but too high to be playing the orthodox cut. But he does play the orthodox cut as opposed to going up and over. The ball stops on him, and it is really hard to keep it down. It falls just short of backward point
wide length ball, room to swing his arms. Swing his arms Shaw does, but the ball seams back to beat the inside edge. Incredible that Shami gets seam movement in this format too
this one seams the other way, holding its line outside off, and hitting the outside half of the bat
starts around middle, seams down leg, and Shaw thinks of the glance for four, but it goes down too far out of reach

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: uppish as Maxwell bowls another offbreak around off, but it bounces in front of Maxwell

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: there is a hole in the Maxwell plan all right, but punctured by Dhawan. This is some shot. He has slog-swept a length ball from well outside off against the turn. And there is some turn. But it has come out of the screws

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: another drive towards wide long-off but intercepted by the short straight extra cover
fuller, outside off, driven to wide long-off for two

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: misfield at point. What a gift to Dhawan. Shoddy work. Dhawan cuts away a length-ball offbreak, but Pooran doesn't get down properly to cover the line of the ball. Beaten clean
length ball, on the pads, tucked away for a single
good length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot to seal the win
full and into the pads. Flicked to short fine's left
good length outside off, pushed to backward point
googly at a length outside off, looks for the late cut, under-edge onto the pitch
full at middle stump, slogged to long-on's right

Jadeja takes it at long-on but it's past the boundary as he does so and he falls over. One-handed grab, his left hand. Superb work, but that wasn't redeemable. Good length at middle, steps out and doesn't make the pitch of that and it's a laboured attempted slog. But there's enough on it
full at off stump, pushed to extra cover's left off the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and just outside off, gets a stride out and swings this away to deep midwicket's left
short and wide outside off, cut to third man
short at the hips, shuffles and whips to deep midwicket
short and just outside off, mistimed pull to long-on
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers
good length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper
Curran over-runs to his right at long-on. Full and into middle stump, uses the pace and angle into him to pick this up. Curran is headed the right way but that holds its line
short and wide outside off, slides on nicely and he cuts it past backward point
drilled to long-off's right to get his fifty. Full googly just outside off, gets to the pitch of that and a flat lofted drive. He was looking for four there, not six
full and wide outside off, mistimed drive to sweeper
full and just outside off, gets down on one knee and scoops this fine. Short third man cleans up to his left
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
ramped wide of leg gully. Good length outside off, skelter into the off side and gets low to get this ramp away and into the vacant fine leg boundary
good length outside off, punched to long-off
good length on leg stump, nudged to deep square's right
good length on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to third man
good length at off stump, deep in the crease to nudge to midwicket's right
tossed up full and wide outside off, misses on the cover drive
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
beaten. Googly, short of a length and into the corridor. Past the attempted cut
good length outside off, slow but no turn. Buttler steps out and is beaten in flight, but manages to nudge this with soft hands into vacant midwicket
good length and sliding into off stump. Punched to extra cover's right
full and just outside off, driven to extra cover's left. He dives and gets a hand on that, but can't stop the run
full at middle stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
lofted over mid-off. Thakur goes full and outside off and he's set up deep in the crease on an off stump line. Then gets a bit of a stride out and a clean loft

lifted over point. Whew. It's a limtied-overs batting clinic tonight from Jos. It's not easy to score if you let them bowl at you on this pitch, and he's just manipulating the field to put pressure on the bowlers. He's picking the gaps so well. Short and wide and this time he hangs back instead of slapping in front of square. Waits on it and chops over point
short and wide outside off, hangs deep in the crease this time and slaps it to sweeper's right

big appeal for catch behind from the bowler. No reviews left. Dhoni didn't look to animated on this appeal. Short and wide outside off, walks across into the off side and has a stab at this. It's past the sticker region of the bat. Nothing on Ultra Edge

short_text: Sam Curran to Buttler, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length cutter, angles into the thigh and catches him on the guard as he looks to flick
outside edge to third man's right. Good length ball angled in from around the wicket, holds its line as he looks to defend
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length outside off, leans in and nudges that to third man's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Buttler, no run
long_text: good length and into off stump, punched to mid-off on the rise
good length and into leg stump, shuffles and flicks to fine leg
full and into middle stump, hurriedly punched to mid-on
short of a length and just outside off, chopped to backward point
good length outside off, nudged out to third man on the rise

oh lovely placement Jos. Pristine timing. It's a full ball at off stump, not much wrong with it. But he shuffles and closes the wrists on this to beat midwicket to his right. Long-on puts in a long sprint and can't get to it after a slide
good length outside off, walks at it and punches to sweeper's right
full and down leg side, can't get bat on it
past the outside edge. Good length and in the corridor, opens the face on that to try and get it to third man
good length and just outside off, shuffles and punches to sweeper cover
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
chipped over mid-on. Serene Jos. Good length and just outside off, half a stride across into the off side and a gentle pick up to clear the infield with the full face offered
short and just outside off, shuffles and pulls firmly to deep square's right. Chawla tumbles and stops
good length outside off, looks to force the punch through covers. Comes off the inside half to mid-off
good length at middle stump, shuffles and flicks to midiwicket
short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, jabbed into the covers
good length outside off, forces a drive on the rise and there's a misfield in the covers
good length outside off, defended into the covers off the back foot
good length and just outside off, shuffles and punches to mid-on
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off, can't get the drive past extra cover's outstretched right hand
good length and into leg stump, glanced to deep backward square
good length on off stump, gets down and paddles it to fine leg's right
reverse sweep into the point boundary. Full and flat at middle stump. He gets down and that slides nicely into his arc and flies off the bat
full at off stump, drives with the turn to long-off
good length and just outside off, punched to short extra off the front foot
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to short extra cover
good length and wide outside off, reaches out and drives to third man's right
good length outside off, chopped to point
good length outside off, shuffles and jabs it into the off side

oh that looks very good on the lbw. Dhoni says no then walks back to his mark and says okay, why not? The review is taken. Smith was shuffling across, looking to flick into the leg side. Was caught right in front of middle stump but Ultra Edge shows a murmur as the ball goes past inside edge. That looked very good on line because leg stump was visible as he was struck. Smith was seemingly walking back after they took the review. He didn't think he'd edged that but he survives. And that's CSK's review used up
length and just outside off, tapped into the covers from the crease
good length and swung into the corridor. Walks down at that and punches to mid-on
good length and some shape away in the corridor, defended off the front foot

taken down leg side and that's three down in the powerplay once more for RR. Must be the fifth time this season. It's a good length ball down leg side, he looks to tickle it fine. Off the inside edge and Dhoni does well to get his left hand under this. As he takes a tumble, the ball wobbles tantalizingly in the glove but he's managed to keep it in
good length and swung away just outside off. Walks into line and defends
beaten by an outswinger. Curves away from him outside off as he has a prod at it
good length and cutting in at off stump. Defended to mid-off
length and in at the stumps, nudged towards mid-on
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and and in at off. Defended into the covers off the back foot

lobs it for Dhoni who takes easily. Uthappa jumps into the line of this short ball outside off and wants to ramp it to fine leg. Probably not expecting this length. It's up at the chest and he gets it off the high part of the bat, only managing to get it a couple of metres behind Dhoni
chipped over mid-on. Full and angled into the pads. Half a stride across to pick this up with the angle. Not enough connection on it to beat Curran's sprint back though
chopped on. More evidence of the slowness in this pitch. Short of a length delivery outside off, angled bat on the cut and it's right off the inside edge. Stokes is audibly annoyed
crunched. Nails this one for sure. Walks closer into the line instead of making room this time. Allows him to line up the full and wide ball outside off and he drives firmly to mid-off's right
cut uppishly to deep backward point. Short and just outside off, goes hard at that but can't find the gap
good length and just outside off, defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
lofted out to sweeper. Another miscue from Stokes. Good length and outside off, walks down the pitch and loses his shape
good length and pushed wide across off, steps out and has a chop at it. On the bounce to deep backward point
manages to get it fine but he wasn't in control. A good bouncer from Hazlewood, hurries him at the front shoulder. He wants to hook that but it's off the gloves
short of a length and swung into off stump, hangs deep and chops it on the bounce to gully
beaten. Short and across the corridor. Down the pitch, into the leg side, cutting from under it
short of a length and just outside off, shuffles and jabs through point
short and into the hips, shuffles across and tickles it fine off the thigh

big appeal for lbw. Chahar manages to convince Dhoni to take the review. Dhoni didn't looks convinced. It's an outswinger and he's looked to lift it over midwicket. Swings past the edge and hits him on the outside of the front knee flap. Was it missing off? Just clipping the top of off says tracker, so that will remain umpire's call and they retain the review. Uthappa was going across the line and was done by the awayswing
length and just outside off, tapped into the covers

overthrows at midwicket. Four extra runs. Good length and just outside off with shape away. Drops it into the covers. Rayudu gets down at it and throws at the non-striker's end. Mid-on and midwicket were converging and he manages to get this to both their lefts
beaten. Good length outswinger wide outside off, steps out and throws the hands at it. Not close to making contact
spanked through the covers. Short and wide outside off, sits up nicely for him and it's blazed through the covers
good length and swung into leg stump, walks down at it and clips to midwicket
low full toss at middle stump, looks to slog that and gets it onto the pads off the inside edge
beaten and then a fumble by the keeper. Slower ball at a length outside off, gets low and stuck halfway into a sweep as this climbs past him and dips on the keeper

doesn't give them even the thought of a second this time, Jofra. Full slower ball outside off, slugged along the floor to long-on's right and ad he's quickly onto it before unleashing a rocket throw on the full to the keeper. Jadhav had slipped and the second was off anyway
yorker length at leg stump, flicked out to deep square

dropped at long-off by Archer. Some indifferent fielding from him there the last few overs, run-out aside. Slower ball at a length outside off, looks to launch this straight on the rise and Archer is under it with a reverse-cup. Almost too soft with the attempt, the balls just bursts through
short and wide outside off, steps out and drives straight to extra cover
short and up at the throat. Feet off the ground again as he rides the bounce and drops this into the square leg region
nudged to fine leg. A short ball headed for his under-arm and he leaps off the floor and fends this fine with the angle
lifted past mid-off. A length ball in at middle stump, clears the front leg, offers the full face and lofts it between bowler and mid-off
good length and into the stumps, backs away and chops into the off side
beaten by legcutter. Lovely ball. Lands it on a length outside off and goes past the outside edge as he has a swish at this
yorker at off stump, jammed into the covers

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Jadhav, no run
long_text: short and rising outside off, looks for the upper cut but is beaten as that is rapidly past him

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Jadhav, no run
long_text: lifts past his face and he can't even get a shot away at this. Short ball outside off, walks down the pitch and lets it go

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Dhoni, 1 run, OUT
long_text: run-out appeal at the striker's end. Another fumble at long-off from Jofra as CSK looks to punch a second. His throw to the striker's end is a good one though. Only slightly to Samson's right who grabs the ball and whips the bails off. Dhoni's grounded the bat but it's on the line as the bails come off, nothing behind it. It was a full delivery outside off, driven firmly in Archer's direction and they looked to run on the misfield. Dhoni hadn't run the first one hard, merely trotted across. He was caught off guard as Jadeja pushed him for the second

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: Archer misfields a straightforward take at long-off. Low full toss outside off, driven firmly to Archer's left and he fumbles and lets this between his legs after making the ground

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Jadeja, 1 leg bye
long_text: appeal for lbw is turned down  and they don't review. Length ball on leg stump, beaten on the attempted whip into the leg side and struck on the back thigh. That pitched outside leg
low full toss on middle stump, mistimed slog down to long-on
short and rising up the body. Shuffles and hurriedly fends this into the square leg region
short and wide outside off, left alone
full and into the toes, whipped out to deep square
past the edge. Good length and in the corridor. Leans in to drive through cover and is caught inside the line
yorker wide outside off, squeezed down to third man off the outside edge

leading edge falls short of extra cover. Low full toss angled into middle stump and he closes the face too soon on the flick. Buttler has a shy at the non-striker's end and a direct hit would have been close
slower length ball outside off, sliced straight to short third man
good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

good length and cramping him at middle stump. Hurriedly stabs it down to long-on with soft hands and Smith does well to make the ground and stop them from thinking of the second and then he misfields and they get it anyway
slower ball, short of a length and just outside off, jabbed to short third
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
big appeal for lbw. Slower good length ball raps him in front of middle as he gets forward to defend. Pitching outside leg? Yes. Smart choice not to review that
short and sliding on low outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length and turning into offs stump. Defended into the covers
good length and skidding on at off stump. Backs into the leg side and punches to long-on
just short of extra cover. Dipping length ball outside off, reaches out and pushes at that with hard hands
googly, short and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper's right
good length and skids on low at middle stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Jadeja, FOUR runs
long_text: expertly steered to third man's left. Short and across the corridor, hangs inside the line of that and places the late cut to perfection

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Jadeja, FOUR runs
long_text: outside edge sprints away to third man's right. Good length and angled across the corridor. Pokes at it, inside the line and the edge is fine enough
short and down leg side, left alone
good length and into middle stump, pushed towards long-on off the back foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Dhoni, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: drilled to sweeper's right. First boundary in 50 balls. Full and just outside off, he stays tall and drives firmly off the front foot to beat extra cover to the left

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Dhoni, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short of a length and outside off, punched to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, gets forward and nudges to point with the turn
good length and loopy on an off stump line. Defended watchfully off the front foot
googly, good length and away from off stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
googly, short of a length and just outside off. Defended to point off the back foot
good length and turning away outside off, gets forward and jabs to backward point's left off the outside half
full and just outside off, gets low and behind that to paddle to fine leg's left
short of a length and pushed across the corridor. mistimed punch to extra cover
good length and pushed across the corridor. Steers the late cut straight to short third man
short of a length and turning away outside off. Allows it on and chops to sweeper's right
full and just outside off. Watchfully defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, jabbed to backward point and a misfield from Tyagi turns one into three. He over-ran it to his right
googly, good length and into leg stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
googly at a good length, watches it closely and rides the bounce to jab this between slip and short third off the back foot
just past Miller's outstretched hands at midwicket. Googly dropped short and fetched from outside off with a pull. Off the toe-end and safely to long-on's left in the end
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and turning away from leg stump. Gets forward and stabs it to midwicket's right
googly, short of a length and into leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket

Samson settles under this top-edge and takes it. Front-of-the-hand quicker one, at a length and in at leg stump. Looks for the sweep and is through it early. It hands in front of short fine and Samson takes it easily with a couple of steps to the left
good length outside off, steps out and doesn't make the pitch of that. Driven back to the bowler
full outside off, driven with the turn to long-off
tossed up at middle stump, defended down the pitch off the front foot
loopy and full at 78.9kph on middle stump, big stride out before jabbing to the bowler's left
tossed up outside off, jabbed straight to extra cover
tossed up full outside off, keeps the front leg away as he reaches out and drives to sweeper cover
short of a length and turning away slowly outside off. A laboured pull down to long-on
good length and turning away outside off. Onto the back foot as he opens the face and defends to point

big appeal for lbw is given. A chat between the batsmen and Rayudu reviews. Probably no bat on that, the only thing that can save him is the googly spinning past leg stump. He was beaten on the inside edge looking to defend on the front foot and was caught on a middle and leg stump line. A flat line on Ultra Edge. And ball tracking has the ball spinning past leg stump. The decision will be overturned

taken at long-off. This is smart bowling from a bowler in full control against the batsman. Knew Curran would be itching to step down the track and pushed his googly wide outside off and just short of a good length. Curran is reaching out for it in the end and it's a simple chip for Buttler to hold at long-off
sounds like a dropped catch. But it was off the top edge and near impossible for the keeper to react to his left. Googly landing at a length outside off and he was looking for the sweep
good length and pushed across the corridor, onto the back foot and punched to deep midwicket
full outside off, pushed into the covers with soft hands
nice dipping legbreak outside off, draws him forward and takes the outside edge to short third man as he gets forward for the drive
good length, turning away from middle. Punched to long-on off the back foot
short and front-of-the-hand outside off. Rayudu steps out and only manages to slice it for short third man to run backwards and grab that
good length ball slips out of his hand and is very very wide outside off. The siren also goes off which means he has overstepped
googly, short of a length and just outside off. Pushed into the covers
short and sliding away outside off, under-edge on the cut

short_text: Gopal to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: leading edge into the covers. Looks to flick this googly from outside off but he's well safe

short_text: Gopal to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short and pushed across off stump. Cut off the back foot but can't beat Smith to the right at extra cover

short_text: Gopal to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length, a googly outside off. Pushed into the covers off the back foot
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to long-off
good length and just outside off, turning away. Punched to point off the back foot
full and just outside off, jammed to mid-on's right

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rayudu, no run
long_text: low full toss wide outside off, sliced straight to backward point

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rayudu, no run
long_text: beaten on the drive. Good length ball wide outside off, looks to go flat-batted through the off side on the front foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length outside off, left alone

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Sam Curran, 1 run
long_text: good length and just outside off, punched to deep backward point with the angle

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended into the covers off the back foot
only a matter of time before Rayudu steps out. His favourite release shot - a jump down the pitch to lift this length ball over mid-off from outside off stump. Stokes slides on nicely for such a shot
good length and into leg stump, defended to midwicket with the angle
nicely timed. Short ball up at the chest, swivels on the back foot and pulls into the ground, firmly and to deep square's right
good length and just outside off, defended to point off the front foot
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third's left off the back foot

short_text: Stokes to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: pumped straight over his head! What a clean straight hit this is. Friendly full delivery just outside off, front leg out of the way and a clean swing through the line. Dead straight

taken at midwicket! Full and into leg stump with the angle. Watson gets the front leg forward, and flicks aerially, straight into that fielder's lap. It was there to picked off for runs and Watson can't believe it

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: bounces over Samson off the inside edge. Good length and wide outside off, Watson wants to slash through the off side but gets an under-edge that clears the keeper

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: swatted through midwicket. Short and just outside off, springs onto the front foot and pulls firmly into the turf and well to midwicket's left

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Sam Curran, 1 run
long_text: short of a length and wide outside off, cut on the bounce to third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: drilled through point. Overpitched and full and just outside off. Gets the front leg in the leg side and carves this behind square on the off side, off the front foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, looks for the carve through point and chops it onto his boot

taken at short extra cover. Buttler lunging high to his left. Short and wide bouncer outside off. Faf wants to lift that over point with the pace, but is through the attempted guide a bit too soon. It comes off the inside part of the bat and floats to Buttler's left and he lands softly after jumping to his left
full slower ball on the pads, waits on it and flicks to midwicket's right

short_text: Archer to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length and rising steeply just outside off, gets on top of the bounce and forces this to mid-off off the back foot
finds the edge but this is down to third man. Good length and climbing away from outside off, a defensive push this time

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: past the outside edge. Good length and moving away in the corridor, swishes inside the line as he looks for the back foot punch

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

short_text: Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and into middle stump, defended down the pitch from the crease
top edge clears the keeper and then Tyagi dives to his left after sprinting from third man. Short ball rising in the corridor and he was cramped on the attempted pull
misfield at mid-onby Uthappa. Short and just outside off, mistimed pull and it's snuck through from under Uthappa
short on the hips, allows it one and dabs into the square leg region

short_text: Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: short and shaped away outside off, but he goes leg side anyway and drags this pull past midwicket off the inside half

short_text: Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and shaped away outside off, pushed to cover point off the back foot

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: beats the edge again. 146kph, short and climbing across the corridor as he defends inside the line

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: bouncer at 144kph, climbing up from a middle stump line and beaten the outside edge before sailing past his left shoulder

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and at off stump. Nicely behind that to defend off the back foot
full and just outside off at 147kph. Pushed to mid-on's right off the inside half of the bat
good length and shape away from middle stump. Defended into the off side with soft hands

short_text: Archer to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: beats the outside edge. Good length and jagging away off the pitch as Curran looks to drive on the up

yorker, swinging in, and there is a third umpire checking the striker's end. And we have a super over by the barest of margins. A second super over. Jordan's running is suspect here. he has turned around in a big circle, and is running two pitches off the main pitch. He has lost at least four yards doing that, and he has been beaten by an inch. Yorker, dug out, reaches the 30-yard circle towards long-on. Pollard comes in with the big throw to the keeper, but Jordan has brought on yet another Super Over
full and wide, and this might have been wide had he not got bat on it. Single to deep point
good umpiring. Hooda moves across the line, Bouls goes behind him with a yorker. Misses the yorker by a stump's width. Hooda wants a wide, but it is not called
slower ball, on a length, outside off, shovelled to long-on for one. Keeps it along the ground
oh finally some luck for KXIP. Pinpoint yorker, Jordan makes room, gets an inside edge past the keeper. Oh sweet relief, they must be thinking
Jordan does look to take that route but this slower short ball squeezes under his attempted pull
full and straight, pushed straight of long-on. Smart again. Soft hands too. Pollard has to run to his left and also in towards the ball. They take an easy two

this is ordinary bowling really. Finally goes on-pace but well down the leg side with short fine leg up. This is poor execution in elite sport. Can't bowl half-volleys down leg with short fine leg in the circle. Tickled away for four

dropped at short fine leg. Oh this is not a good ball. Short of a length, slower, but down the leg side, and all Hooda has to do is clear short fine. But he doesn't get enough bat on this, and offers Chahar a sitter, head-high to his left. He spills it
smart shot. Short of a length, on top of off, but Hooda makes room and plays the late-cut, bisecting short third man and backward point
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, he pulls this wide of long-on for two
slower ball, 123ks, full and wide, driven crisply, but straight to extra cover
low full toss again, he moves across to work this to deep midwicket for one
full and straight, a low full toss, pushed towards long-on for one

bowled'im. Oh Bumrah. That piece of magic upsets all calculations and plans. What a piece of bloody magic. Yorker at 149ks to peg the off stumps back. And that is not all. It seems Rahul has the line covered, but it seems it shapes away late to beat his outside edge and then hit the wicket. Oh man, what a bowler Bumrah is
full toss, quick, ow, hit straight to extra cover. Sharma feels the pinch. Takes the risk of a direct hit. Rahul is alert. He doesn't over-run. Comes back for the overthrow
Hooda swings hard, doesn't get all of it, will take a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, slower ball, outside off, steered for one to short third man
short of a length, outside off, beaten on the cut. Sharp pace here
slower ball, short of a length, shovelled to deep square leg for one
lovely shot. Coulter-Nile misses his yorker by six inches or a foot, and Rahul stays deep in the crease to go inside-out and in front of deep cover for four
short of a length, into the pitch, slower, pulled wide of long-on. Pollard puts a dive in, but can't deny them the second
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of long-on. Easy two

you are looking for eight, you get 15. Bouncer at his badge, but unlike Pooran, Hooda manages to get inside the line of this. That bouncer was over the leg stumps, this is outside off. Hooda gets inside the line and pulls hard. The short boundary does the rest
slower ball, full and wide, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, wide, with no deep point. That is a rare bad ball from Bumrah. Rahul cuts it perfectly into the gap. That is eight off this over
another slower ball, wide again, this time he catches up with it, but can't pierce the gap between point and short third man
slower ball, wide outside off, well wide. Called too
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked square of deep midwicket for two
round-arm, short of a length, into the pads, pushed towards deep midwicket for one
down the wicket, Pandya pulls the length back, he bunts this to leg for one
doesn't miss out on this full toss. This is wide outside off, and he goes square of deep cover. All along the ground. Beats him
oh misses out. Really missed out. A full toss down the leg side, all he needs is a tickle, but he tickes it too well, and sends it straight to short fine leg
makes room, Pandya fires this in, punched straight to cover, who is in on the single
down the wicket, Pandya fires this in quick, Rahul places this wide of deep midwicket for two
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover for one
length-ball quick legbreak, defended off the back foot
slip takes out Maxwell
too full outside off, drilled to deep cover for one
Rahul takes on the loose ball. His fifth fifty comes up with a pull off a rank long hop. This is just a gift
quick length ball, 147ks, outside off, defended to mid-off
Bumrah delivers again
slightly fuller, but not driving length by any means. Bowled at 141ks. Pushed back to him
on a length, 138ks, just outside off, defended from the crease
short ball, sharp, gets big on him, takes the top edge on the pull, but doesn't carry to deep square leg
top-quality shot, short of a length, angling in towards top of off, but he punches it on the up, and in front of deep cover
Just the over MI needed. The last bundary-less over brought a wicket in the next over
goes back to punch this length ball to long-on. Hurried into the shot because this is not short enough
slower loopy legbreak, just inside the wide line. Left alone
wrong'un, outside off, cut away to deep cover
fuller, straighter, pushed down to long-on for one
ice legbreak outside off, turns away to beat him but not wide enough to be called
this is the Pooran show. Submit to it. After a four into the big side of the ground, he shuffles across to play the pick-up shot over the shorter leg boundary
lovely shot. Singeing the turf as it travels to the extra-cover fence. A rare on-pace ball from Pollard, and he drives it on the up and square of deep cover
short of a length, wide, nicely cut away in front of deep point for two
slower ball again, hit straight to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, slower ball, Rahul walks at him and places this square of deep midwicket for two
nearly caught and bowled. Slower ball, Rahul early into the shot, but it reaches Pollard on the half-volley
nicely done. After the six off the tossed-up delivery, he is back and waiting for the quicker one. Just turns out that this is turning down leg, and he guides it fine of fine leg
Pooran announces himself. Has he picked the wrong'un? At any rate, he has gone over long-off. And this is just a touch too full, and he goes over long-off. Powerful hit
tossed up, seems like the slider, defended back to him
full and straight, doesn't turn, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
quick legbreak first up, into the pads, worked to leg for one

Gayle looks to take on long-on off a spinner. Nearly goes over him, but this is a low-percentage shot. This is a slider, short and wide outside off, and instead of cutting it, he is looking to loft him over long-off. Not enough pace to work with. Caught at long-off
full and straight, driven back to Coulter-Nile. Just the over MI needed
wide length ball, can't get power into this. Just the single to deep cover
on a length, angling in, worked to deep midwicket for another single
Rahul looking to give himself room, totally done in by the sower short ball, gets a bottom edge to point
short of a length, into the body, tucked away for one
slower ball, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket for one
wrong'un, punched to point, Rahul wants the quick single, but Gayle sends him back
slow sweep into the big side of the ground. Not often do you see Gayle sweep. And he has placed this straight of deep square leg
full outside off, Gayle looks for the six over long-off, but the outside edge flies over cover for two more
swept, uses his pace, places this square of short fine. Comes back for two
no wrong'un first up. The quick legbreak again. Defended
quick legbreak, on a length, goes back to punch this to deep cover
slower ball again, but this is short, and it beats his pull

and this is why he was trying to stay out of Gayle's reach. he bowls straight, overpitches slightly, and Gayle lofts this over long-on. Not the cleanest of Gayle strikes, but this ground is not big enough
wide on the crease, full, angling in, drilled to the left of long-on, and Boult puts in the dive to save two runs. Oh sorry, they run just the one. So three runs saved
wide on the crease, full, angling in, drilled to the left of long-on, and Boult puts in the dive to save two runs
length ball, angling in, driven hard, on the up, for a single to long-on
wide outside off, trying to stay out of his reach. Too wide
slower-ball offcutter, middle and leg, grips. Defended back to him
full, straight and slow, clipped to deep midwicket for one
that is unlucky for Jordan, but Pollard will take it. Goes wide on the crease, bowls a big bouncer, Pollard pulls, gets a top edge, over the wicketkeeper
Jordan goes wide and full again, and this time Pollard nails his attempted hit over long-on. Such clean crisp hitting
