wide full, might be a wide if he doesn't play it, but Pollard drags it to long-on. Takes the second, the throw has overtaken him as he turns around, but the ball is losing pace, and Pollard is gaining it. Easily makes the second
nearly a yorker, outside off, Coulter-Nile does enough to bring Pollard back on strike
he is going leg side every ball. Drags this length ball smack back at his batting partner. NCN ducks, saves himself, then runs the single
that is massive. Jordan bowls the bouncer outside off, hoping to make him cut to the big part of the field, but Pollard moves across to pull this clean out of the ground
short ball with short fine in the circle. The same mistake as Arshdeep. Trying not to be predictable, trying not to give way the ball with the field set, but it goes over short fine for four
yorker, dipping on him, 144ks, just outside off. So unlucky not to hit the off stump. It just moves away an inch after pitching
slower short ball, makes him hit into the big side of the ground, and Coulter-Nile doesn't get all of it, but he has managed to place it in front of deep backward square leg
slower ball, on a length, and it beats the slog as it stays low

bouncer, COulter-Nile swings hard at the pull, and the top edge travels a million miles in the air before falling in  no man's land on the leg side. All fielders there are on the fence except short fine, but this has gone in front of square
yorker, middle and leg, but the inside edge goes past short fine leg for two
full, just outside off, can't get under this, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs
long_text: this is crunched away. Looks for the wide yorker again, misses it, and Coulter-Nuile not only drives it hard but also beats deep cover to his left

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs
long_text: that is just rotten luck. A sharp bouncer, which hits the bat instead of bat making any move towards hitting it. In fact NCN is preserving his self and looking to sway away. The top edge, though, flies over short fine
gets the wide yorker right this time. Steered to third man for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Pollard, SIX runs
long_text: goes for the wide yorker, trying to make him hit to the bigger boundary on the off side, but Pollard shuffles across, takes this on the full and goes over wide mid-on, the shortest boundary in play. Another yorker missed. Young man must be intimidated

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Pollard, SIX runs
long_text: and this is an intimidating start. Bowls full, on-pace, outside off. Has missed the yorker and bowled a half-volley. Pollard drills it over long-off for a six
strays down with a length ball, bunted into the big side of the ground, comes back for two, handing the strike over to POllard for the start of the next over
on a length, outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, wide outside off, punched to deep cover for one

the slowness of the pitch showing. This is a length ball, into the pads, something de Kock loves to pick-up over the leg side. But this has come off the bottom of the bat, and he caught at deep square
walks at Jordan, who bowls it short of a length, and he opens the face to pick up a single
nearly a yorker, de Kock can't get under it. Single to long-on
short of a length, outside off, Pollard looks to run this down to third man but is beaten
bouncer, outside off, a disinterested leave from Pollard
full and straight, clipped off the toes for a single to deep midwicket
hard length. Shami bowls the only thing that works against Hardik Pandya
bouncer, pulled away crisply, but gets just a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, hit hard to long-on for one
full, outside leg, drilled to deep midwicket
fifty for de Kock, fourth in last five outings. Driven to long-off as he pitches this up

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: wrong'un, outside off, punched to cover

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: lovely clean swing. Doesn't matter which way you are turning if you bowl a plum half-volley. He goes over long-on for a flat six

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Wrong'un, around off, and he manages to cut this up and over cover. Not enough room to be doing that, but he still manages to do so

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, on off, driven hard and back to Ashwin

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: this is why we love Pandya. It doesn't matter if it is the first ball. If it has to go, it has to go. Bishnoi bowls a little too full, and Pandya launches him over wide long-off. The head stays down and doesn't look at where the ball is going
full, outside leg, Pandya tries the sweep, but this comes off the toe end for a smart catch for Hooda at deep square leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: is this a legbreak?. De Kock is looking to make room and cut, but is cramped, and just survives thanks to his pad
powerful sweep but there is a deep midwicket in place to keep this down to one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Krunal, no run
long_text: on a length, wrong'un, he punches this, but straight to point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: too full, just outside leg, driven down to long-on
wrong'un, on a length, punched to cover, who is tight, saving the single
full, middle and leg, pushed to leg
Rahul blindsighted by the batsman moving around in the crease. De Kock switches his stance, Ashwin goes wide outside off, but Rahul fails to go with the turn, which is further away. Four byes
tries the big drive down the ground, and he is playing for the wrong'un. Still gets an outside edge for a single to short third man
short, too short, and pitches this outside leg too. Pulled away over midwicket
full, slow, dipping, driven back to him
looks for the reverse-hit, gives up his cards early, and Bishno pitches this well outside what would have been his leg stump. Just the single to what would have been his long-off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Krunal, no run
long_text: another wrong'un, and Pandya seems to have picked it as he goes towards wide long-off, but is beaten

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: on a length, skidding on, wrong'un again, dabbed out, just to the left of cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run
long_text: looks for the reverse sweep on the googly, but only gets a glove to short third man

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run
long_text: wrong'un, on a length, around off, defended from the crease
on a length, going with the angle, pushed into the off side
short of a length again, hardly any turn, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

short_text: Hooda to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: too short, and doesn't matter if you are an offspinner or a legspinner if you bowl that length to de Kock. He sits back, swivels, and pulls this over square leg
Pandya skips down the track, Hooda slips in a quicker delivery, hits the pad, but is going down leg
short of a length, just outside off, Pandya plays the late-cut, but Ashwin makes a diving save at point
on a length, angling in, no turn, worked to leg
too much width with this wrong'un, and Pandya plays it smartly, delaying the cut shot, deliberately going to the right of point, not giving deep cover any chance
and another googly. Short of a length, gives him some width, but just the single to deep cover

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: wrong'un again, short of a length, outside off, mis-hit back to Ashwin
tossed up this time, driven with an open face to sweeper-cover
edged wide of Gayle at slip. Another wrong'un, quite quick, Pandya looks to cut again, gets a healthy edge too wide of Gayle
starts with a wrong'un. On a length, Pandya looks to cut, but is beaten by the turn away

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: nicely bowled, tossed up, still quick, at 95ks. Defended with an open face
full, into the pads, uppishly driven to long-on for one
short of a length, no room, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, angling in, defended to leg

lovely shot, but not so sure about Jordan's effort in the deep. Maxwell tosses it up again, and he drives it over extra cover. Jordan, running from long-off, is within diving distance but chooses not to
slower through the air, 93ks, middle and off, defended back to him

short_text: Jordan to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, outside off, hit too hard to mid-off to be coming through for one

short_text: Jordan to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, outside off, crunched, but straight to extra cover, who is off the circle to prevent the single
bouncer, into his body, mis-hit past Jordan for one
lovely shot. This is high-quality hitting. Seriously. It is short of a length, around the waist, and he has still managed to drive this on the up and over extra for a six no less. Incredible shot
short of a length, no room again, pushed towards short straight extra cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: round-arm, on a length, around off, de Kock is done in by the lack of turn. Gets an inside edge onto the pad

slower through the air, no turn, Pandya defends, the ball bounces in the vicinity of the toe, and then through to Rahul. Maxwell appeals for the catch, claiming it has hit the toe on the full. This is not even close to the toe. Bat to pad to ground to Rahul. Carry on
slower through the air, no turn, Pandya defends, the ball bounces near his toe, and then bounces off the toe. Maxwell appeals for the catch
quick length ball, no room, defended to cover
full, outside off, driven down to long-off for one
Midhun: "Bit misfield runs are in bowlers quota too..even without it being his mistake "

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, no run
long_text: better delivery. On a length, on off, holding its line. Defended with an open face

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Slightly shorter than the last ball, slightly wider, and de Kock swings his arms through it. On the up, along the ground, through extra cover

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, no run
long_text: stays on a length, not much room, driven on the up, but straight to backward point

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man

one more wicket for Arsh. Short, wide, Kishan tries to cut this square, but the extra bounce from his height means it gets a little big on him, and he fails to control it. The top edge settles with deep third man
no turn this time, fired into the pads, and Kishan takes the single this time
turn, sharp turn. Looks like an easy single to leg, but then it turns to take the leading edge to point
short of a length, speared in, and because it sits up, it gives Kishan time to hit it down the ground and wide of mid-on
stays full, just short of the slot, and is pushed for one to long-off
full and outside off again, driven to long-off again
full, outside off, driven down the ground

four overthrows from Pooran. Short of a length, outside off, played towards point for an easy single. Pooran, though, still has a go at the stumps and the man backing up is square and deep on the leg side. This throw ends up towards midwicket, and his dive is not enough to keep this in
short ball, gets big on him, he doesn't get all of the pull but manages to keep it down. Just the single to midwicket
on a length, wicket to wicket, inside edge onto the pad

caught on the rebound. Yadav whips away a full straight ball, but doesn't get enough power or elevation in it. The bat face closes early. M Ashwin is off the 30-yard circle so it keeps quickly at him. It hits the hands and pops up for an easy rebound
length ball, angling in, Yadav shuffles a little and defends this to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, guides it to slip on the bounce

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Yadav, 1 leg bye
long_text: right across it and plays all around. Big lbw shout, but this is a length ball that has not swung. So it is unlikely that this has pitched within the stumps and is going on to hit. And because this is hitting, it is pretty certain this has been pitched outside leg

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Rohit Sharma, OUT
long_text: timbahhh. Arshdeep gets Rohit Sharma. Looks like a legcutter to me, but it isn't. He has bowled seam-up and on-pace. Short of a length, not too much room, and Sharma looks to run this down. Too close to his body, and he plays on

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, no room, dabs down on it, gets a single towards short third man

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: that is feeding de Kock's strengths. On a length, down the leg side, on-pace, and he plays his piack-up shot from inside the crease

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, no room, defended back to him

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, 1 wide
long_text: slightly harsh call. Short ball, into the arm pit, de Kock gets inside the line and misses. Called a wide down the leg side

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, defended solidly back to Arshdeep

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: lovely seam movement. On a length, just outside off, and then jags back in to trap Sharma on the crease. Just gets an inside edge

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, bottom edge on the attempted cut

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: strays down the pads. There is some seam movement from a pretty tight line. Sharma nicely glances it fine of fine leg. Arshdeep Singh puts in a dive but can't keep it in
full and straight, swinging down, clipped away off the toe

short_text: Shami to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, angling across, gets the bottom edge on the cut

short_text: Shami to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: short, wide, angling in, but de Kock stays back to use the pace and late-cut it past point

short_text: Maxwell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: quick length ball across him, pushed to point, and they don't run on the misfield

short_text: Maxwell to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: nearly run out. Pushed to the adjacent pitch on the leg side, Maxwell dashes across, de Kock is well short, but he misses with the direct hit

short_text: Maxwell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: gets some room with a length ball outside off, and he places it between cover-point and extra cover for a four
quick length ball, into the pads, defended

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, outside off, driven to extra cover, sent back as Sharma charges off
on a length, middle and leg, punched away to deep midwicket

we'll have a super Over! KKR just manage to hang on. Good length ball at middle stump, looks to flick that and cops it on the back leg. Only a single in the off side. But they don't even attempt a second. On the flip side, KKR didn't appeal for lbw.
overpitched on middle stump, mistimed slog to where mid-on would have been. Their halfways-in fielder from mid-off runs across but can't stop Warner from retaining the strike
walks into the off side and swats this past square leg. Good length ball, slow and friendly on leg stump. an easy put away. It was 124kph
swatted past the non-striker. Good length, loopy outside off. Waits on it and flat-bats it aerially between non-striker and umpire
whipped to the long leg boundary. Full and into the pads, waits on it and just gets enough on the thick inside edge to get this between the fiedlers
whipped straight to deep midwicket. Low full toss floated outside off, he gets low and drags this out to the fielder who takes a catch very close to the padding. They check it and he's alright
whew very very wide outside off. Almost a slingy action. Russell ran in very gingerly there, almost as if he was checking if he can bowl. And what's more, the siren's gone off. He's overstepped

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Abdul Samad, OUT
long_text: a relay catch at deep midwicket! Oh this is a leg stump full toss and Samad doesn't get a clean swing out at it. The soft signal is out. He reached out a touch and just flicked this in the end. Lockie covered the ground to his left, caught it, and then put in a backhand flick to long-on. They're checking it upstairs. His right boot, on the balancing step, comes very very close to the boundary padding. He is confident about it. And this should remain out given there's no way to conclusively say the foot touched the padding. There's hardly a ripple there. And yes, it does stay out.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Abdul Samad, 2 runs
long_text: yorker outside off, shuffles and looks to slog into the leg side. Thick inside edge onto his boot and then it trickles out to long-on. Warner hares back for the second
slower short ball, wide outside off. Reaches out and can only chop this to sweeper cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Warner, FOUR runs
long_text: lifted over mid-off. A full toss outside off, gets deep in the crease and carves this. Didn't hit that too well but mid-off was in

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Abdul Samad, 1 run
long_text: full and just outside off, looks to pump that straight but it comes off the toe-end and long-off is quick running in at it

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: poor start from Mavi. Point is in. He goes short and he goes wide. A slower ball that is. But enough time to adjust and scythe this over point. Sweeper can't get that to his left
low yorker at middle stump, mistimed another attempted slog, it trickles to long-on's left
high full toss, about thigh height. A slower ball at 119kph. Mistimed slog to deep midwicket's left

dropped at backward point. Russell lunging to his left. Slower ball again it appears, short of a length outside off. Chops at it with an open face. It's wide to Russell's left and he can't grab on after putting in the dive. On his feet again

short_text: Ferguson to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: beats the inside edge. A slower yorker this time, just dips inwards as he sets up outside off. Wants to drive through cover
yorker just outside off, half crouch as he feels for this and opens the wrists late. Only a chip to sweeper's right in the end

short_text: Ferguson to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: beaten. A full slower ball wide outside off, steps the back leg deep into the crease and swings across the line, but that's gone from under him
short of a length and at leg stump. Goes deep in the crease and punches this to long-on's left with soft hands
short of a length and wide outside off, stand stall and spanks this on the rise. Straight to deep extra cover

short_text: Varun to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: full outside off, steps out and meets the pitch of this before drilling it firmly to long-off's left. And it's too fast for Mavi

short_text: Varun to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to backward point
good length and wide outside off, backs away and pummels this on the up but can't beat extra cover

good work at deep square. Tripathi. Full ball on the pads, whipped between deep square and deep midwicket. Tripathi falls into that ball and pushes with his right hand to get that out to deep midwicket

short_text: Cummins to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump. Checks the push back at the bowler

short_text: Cummins to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: smoked over square leg! Sweeet connection. What timing this is. Short and rising in the corridor. Hardly any feet movement but the weight is into the ball as he brings out quick hands and sends this off the middle of the bat with the pull

short_text: Cummins to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: good length and in at the stumps, pushed to midwicket's left
short and up at middle stump, pulled off the front foot to deep square's left

taken at backward point! Short of a length outside off, Shankar wants to pull over midwicket off the front foot, but that's onto him too fast. Comes off the leading edge and Gill takes a few steps to his left and hangs on. A wicket after five matches for Cummins
good length and in at off stump, defended into the off side
good length and turning into leg stump, deep in the crease to clip to deep midwicket's right
full at leg stump, driven to long-on

just clears short third. Full and dipping outside off. Tries the switch-ramp and gets a lot of elevation. Chakravarthy doesn't manage to get under that after running backwards and takes a tumble after stretching out for that
good length on leg stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket's right
full googly at leg stump. Allows that on and expertly clips through the backward square region, which is far enough from midwicket to pinch a second

Russell is hobbling after swooping dowhose old hamstring issues. Left leg. Good length and just outisde off, waits on that and pats it to long-on's right. Calls for the second and Russell is steaming in at this. Does well too and manages to grab it one-handed but immediately hobbles
good length, flat and wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length and climbing across middle. Off the floor to try and pull behind square but cops that on the thigh
chips it wide of mid-off. Full slower ball just outside off, nicely behind the line of that and a clean loft over his partner at the other end
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep square
nearly played on. Good length and just outside off, was looking to nudge that pitch side and played it almost too softly in the end
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off from the crease
short and up at the hips at 145kph. Looks to swat that behind square, can't get bat, but it pings off the thigh and past DK
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket with the turn
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven with the turn to long-off's right
short and turning away. Very slow. Subdued cut to extra cover
good length and turning away outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
loopy length ball outside off, jabbed into the covers with soft hands
good length and just outside off, pushed into the off side off the toe-end
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length outside off, hangs leg side of it and steers to third man from the crease
148kph yorker and see ya! What a delivery. Wide of the crease, aimed for the base of off stump and through from under Pandey's attempted jab at that. He had the room and all but that was unplayable
leg stump yorker pins Warner on the shin but that pitched outside leg. Deflects to backward point
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off
wrong'un lobbed right up at off stump, uppish drive to long-off
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
full on middle stump, mistimed drive to Kuldeep's left
tossed up at off stump, drives with the turn to long-off's right
good length and turning in from outside off, gets forward and jabs this to extra cover's right

a missed stumping opportunity. A difficult one because that seems to have hit Warner and changed path. Good length ball outside off, he runs down at it and is beaten in pace. It hits the flap of the front pad as he misses and that takes it past DK's left shoudler
good length and pushed through quicker outside off. Looks to scythe behind point and is beaten
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off
short of a length outside off, mistimed chop to sweeper cover
good length and wide outside off, reaches out and steers this drive to sweeper's right
taken at straight long-off! Good length and lobbed up just outside off. He reaches out and looks to drill this on the rise. Russell is very straight at long-off and barely has to move
good length and just outside off, chopped to short third man
short and going across middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease

tonks off stump with a slower ball! Lockie is dragging KKR back into this with every over. It's a legcutter release but the ball slides in from a good length. Garg was backing into the leg side after being tucked at his body. Wanted to open some room and chop behind square but that was both too full and at a completely changed pace. Superb from the bowler
good length and in at middle stump. Poked to midwicket with the angle
full and wide outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off
good length and angled into middle stump, pushed to midwicket's right off the inside half
short of a good length and spinning back in sharply to the corridor to cramp him on the cut. It rolls out into the off side
dropped short outside off, backs away to wait and chop this past backward point
full outside off, nicely forward to drive to long-on
good length and just outside off, mistimed pull out to long-on
good length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length outside off, leans in for the drive to sweeper cover
full and into middle stump, punched to long-on with the angle
short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut
full and just outside off, driven to mid-off off the toe-end
good length and just outside off. Looks to get his weight into the front foot to drive through cover. Thick edge to third man's left
short and just outside off, cut to backward point

taken at third man. Short and wide outside off. Looks for the upper cut and has managed to find the man perfectly in the deep. The shot was on, the placement not quite. He hobbles off having done a good job for them

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Bairstow, FOUR runs
long_text: nicely placed. Point and third man in the circle, he goes short of a length outside off. Bairstow walks down at that and chops it late to bisect the two fielders
full and wide outside off, gets down on a knee to try and crunch this through the covers but he gets it off the toe-end. A slower ball too

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: slower short ball wide outside off, mistimed cut to short third

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: yorker length at middle stump, jammed to mid-on's left
short and wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: steps into the off side and ramps this over short fine. Good length ball at 142kph outside off. Half a stride to get in line and watches that closely onto the middle of the bat

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, angled into the body. Punched to cover's left off the back foot
oh poor bowling from Cummins. Bairstow has weathered the storm and survived Cummins' opening spells. The reward is a short ball down leg side and he uses the angle to pull to the long leg boundary
short and wide outside off, looks to slap through the covers and is beaten
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square with the angle
good length and down leg side, shuffles and can't manage to tickle this past short fine. That took the pad on the way to DK
sweet! Full and onto middle stump. Stays still and tucks this wide of mid-on with the angle with no attempt to keep it down. All deliberate, all class
oh sweet timing again. Full and outside off, can't lean into this drive to mid-off's left but he does enough to get two
slaughtered! Whew. No finesse from Bairstow. He gets the front leg well out of the way, lines up this short ball and sends it between deep square and deep midwicket with some force
full and into the pads, stays upright and flicks this aerially and to short fine's left
short of a length at middle stump, swipes it straight to short fine with the angle
short of a length and just outside off, pulled firmly to deep square
good length and just outside off, drops it into the off side with soft hands and doesn't even shape to take off for a run
good length outside off, leaps off the floor and awkwardly lands on one foot, but in the meantime he's also got the smoothest of back foot punches through the covers
short of a length and ripping in outside off, beaten on the slash
full and outside off, reaches out and has a swish at this well in front of the body. Floats out to deep midwicket off the inside half
good length at middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep square
full outside off, gets down and fetches that with a vigorous sweep to the square leg boundary. Nailed it
good length on middle stump, shuffles and whips it with the angle to short fine's left
into the pads and pushed into the leg side with the angle

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide outside off, waits on it and cuts it past backward point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: full and just outside off, backs into the leg side and drills this wide of mid-off. Sweet timing on it
good length outside off, swiped to deep square's left with the angle
good length and jut outside off, punched towards mid-off off the back foot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, looks to cut and gets an under-edge to the keeper

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, cut on the bounce to backward point
good length and into him. Uses the angle to clip this to deep square's left
lovely bouncer. Climbing up at the throat and he does well to keep his eyes on this and sway into the leg side to let that go
good length and in at off stump, pushes it down the pitch from the crease. Tentative again
good length and slanted in at middle stump. Tentative nudge into the leg side
good length and into the corridor, defended down the pitch
good length and wide outside off, looks to chop and is beaten
taken at long-off. Good length ball outside off, hammed flat on the up and straight into Pandey's lap as he runs in from the boundary
yorker at middle stump, squeezed down to long-on with the angle
lofted with the angle over square leg. Three yorkers missed, and this is one better from Mogan's perspective, because it's angled right into his pads. Waits on it and swishes from under that
overpitched on middle stump, mistimed slog off the inside half. Long-on runs to his left and parries it in with two hands as it bounces up to his left. Pushes it into deep midwicket's path

full outside off, makes room and drills this over the bowler. Pandey sprints to his left, gets low and flicks this past long-on who was converging. They run an extra run as a result, but his foot was also on the boundary padding as he  was letting the ball go. So that will be four probably. Looks like he had a fingertip on that as his knee made contact with the padding
high full toss at middle stump, miscued slog to long-off's left. Off the high part of the inside half

mistimed slog clears long-on. Full slower ball wide outside off. He was deep in the crease again to set up behind this outside off. Was into the swing a little early because of the pace, but he went through with it and it landed quite a way behind long-on
full and into leg stump, looks to whip that behind square and misses out. Crashes into the pad and deflects into the off side. Natarajan missed the yorker on this, he gets away
yorker at middle stump, forced to long-on's right off the toe-end
digs the slower ball in at a length, angled across off stump. Looks to lace it through the covers but that pings off the inside half and ends up long-on
good length, cutter, wide outside off. Steps into the off side for the sweep again but is beaten this time
full and wide outside off, gets the back leg into the off side to give himself extra swinging room and drills this past Morgan. Long-off is well beaten to his right
yorker outside off, jammed to extra cover's left
walks into the off side and sweeps over square leg. Anticipated the full ball and was waiting, low and outside off. It was a full toss in the end and he just cleared the boundary there
wide yorker outside off, shuffles into line and is forced to jab this towards deep backward point
yorker length at middle stump, steps out and jams it down to long-on
short of a length outside off, steps out and looks for the pull but is cramped. It ends up a harmless chip well in front of long-on and they pinch a second
walks into the off side and Sandeep follows him. Full and dipping away outside off. Lofted towards long-off
too short and too wide. Might have also been a slower ball. Karthik waits on that on the back foot and hammers it past extra cover
yorker at middle stump, driven to long-on
outside edge again but runs this time. Full and just outside off, clears the front leg and tries to use the angle to go midwicket this time
low full toss at off stump. Looks for the drive through cover, gets an outside edge that's brilliantly snapped by YJB to his left. On the bounce and was high to his left
full and into leg stump, pushed down to long-on with soft hands
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover
good length outside off, opens the face and runs this to point's right
good length and just outside off, pushed to extra cover
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full and into off stump. Very early into the drive and has to check it. Ends up well short of long-off
good length and onto the pads, whipped to long leg off the back foot
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to backward point

he's found deep midwicket! Oh it was there to be clubbed. A length ball gripping and sitting up, just outside off. So much swinging room. But he swings it - and nails it - about stomach height and straight to the man in the deep
good length and just outside off, walks into that and pushes into the covers
short and just outside off, stabbed straight to short third man
low full toss on leg stump, punched to deep midwicket
slower ball, short of a length and raps him on the back thigh as he goes through with the pull shot. That pitched outside off and kept low
lofted to long-off's left. Full and just outside off, hangs leg side of it and nails the connection on this straight drive. On the bounce and into the boundary
low full toss at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket and the siren goes off because he's overstepped

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: good length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease for the glance but cops that on the thigh

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
another inside edge onto boot as he looks to bludgeon this over midwicket. Another googly. Full and just outside off
good length and just outside off, watchfully pushed through point off the front foot
googly lobbed up at middle stump, looks for the slog sweep, thick inside edge to deep backward square

short_text: Rashid Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: inside edge as he miscues the slog. It's a full and flat googly at off stump, gets it onto his pad
good length outside off, pushed into the covers with soft hands
drilled to the extra cover boundary. Overpitched and wide outside off, gets a nice forward stride and brings down the axe on this
good length and just outside off, walks into that and pats it to point
yorker floated out wide outside off, looks to chop it behind point and is beaten
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot

taken at midwicket. It's Garg again, and he had a long long way to run to take this. Good length ball just outside off, looked to slog that on the rise, got it off the inside part of the toe-end of the bat. Garg ran in from the boundary to his right and was still sprinting as he stretched out to his right  and took this near the circle
good length and googly outside off. Gets deep in the crease and flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: fully googly on leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks for the flick

taken at long-off. Garg sprinting and lunging to his left. Good length and pushed through at off stump. Looks to go inside-out and can't open the wrists well enough. It's flat and about waist height as Garg tracks it closely and takes it under his eyes
full outside off, swept to deep square

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, SIX runs
long_text: drilled over the bowler. Rashid overpitches again, this time at middle stump, and he's swung cleanly through that one as well

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: beaten on the reverse sweep. Good length and going across the corridor
diving stop at backward point. Short of a length outside off, makes room and cuts firmly but KW stretches out the left hand and stops that from finding the boundary
full outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
full toss outside off, driven straight back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, looks to reach out for the drive and loses balance. Bat turns and this is down the pitch off the inside half
short ball gets him in the body as he steps out and is through the pull shot early. That almost dipped into his body. Deflected to Bairstow's left
good length and just outside off, mistimed drive through the covers off the front foot
good length and sliding onto the pad as he gets down for the sweep. Big lbw appeal from Rashid, but that pitched outside leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: swept to the square leg boundary. Gets low early and turns this full ball into a full toss on middle stump before the sweep

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: crunched over the bowler. This is overpitched outside off and he keeps the front leg away to allow a clean swing through the line
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
good length outside off, sliced on the rise to sweeper's left
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length and into middle stump, walks into that and flicks to deep square's right
full and just outside off, driven along the ground to long-off
short of a length and just outside off, cuts off the under-edge as this keeps coming into him with the angle
nicely placed. Walks out at the good length ball outside off, and goes inside-out to loft this over extra cover
good length and just outside off, defended to point off the front foot
short and at an off stump line. Walks down but is forced to duck
full on middle stump, gets low and checks his sweep, along the floor to long leg's right
thick edge retrieved by the back pedaling short third man. Pushed out at this as it went across him from a length

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
googly, good length and into leg stump. Whipped to midwicket's right off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: short of a length and skidding on outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover's right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: good length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on's right

thick outside edge squeezes through from under Sandeep at short third man. Good length outside off, looks to drive on the rise and this edge loops on Sandeep who is stuck halfway between diving forward for the catch and going sideways to get his body behind to save the runs. By the end, he's not even down in time
good length and into the pads, flicked to short fine leg
good length and just outside off, gets forward and stabs it down the pitch
beaten on the pull. Short ball sticks in the pitch and loops through to the keeper as Gill pulls over it outside off
short of a length and just outside off, rises on top of the bounce and guides it straight to backward point

swipes across the line and loses his stumps. Good length ball headed for the top of off stump. He isn't behind the line as he wants the room to slog into the leg side. A bit slow on it in the end and that knocks off stump
good length and just outside off, pushed to point's right with soft hands
short at the hips, and an elegant short-arm pick-up to deep square's left. Stays very still and waits for this to get right under his head as he pulls off the front foot
short and climbing away from middle stump. Looks for the flick, gets a leading edge that off the thumb and handle to short third man
good length at middle stump, hurriedly defended down the pitch
beaten as he swishes inside the line of this good length ball. That was going across him with the angle outside off
slower short ball outside off, backs into the leg side and has a lot of swinging room for this cut. But he finds Pandey at cover point and rues the missed opportunity
full slower ball on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
good length and a slower ball outside off. Mistimed pull to mid-on's right
pierces the covers. Expertly done. Short and climbing up at his body. He backs a long way into the leg side and punches this between cover and point off the back foot
gets the pull away this time. A bit off the low part of the bat, but nicely in position this time for the front foot pull over midwicket
deflected to third man as he looks for the pull off the front foot. Short of a length just outside off, late on that and it's off the leading edge and fine
short and up at the hips. Allows it on and swivels to drag this to vacant long leg with a short-arm pull
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off's right
good length at a leg stump line, backs into the leg side and punches to mid-on's left
short and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
chipped over the bowler. Full and at off stump. Solid base as he offers the full face and lofts this
good length on middle stump, punched against the angle to mid-on's right
good length and in at leg stump, clipped to midwicket's left
good length on leg stump, flicked aerially through square leg
good length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket off the back foot
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep square with the angle
good length and slanted in at middle stump, backs into the leg side but can't get the drive past extra cover
full and wide outside off, driven straight to extra cover
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
good length just outside off, punched past the bowler's outstretched right hand. Mid-off's through to the striker's end nearly takes out the bowler who is still on the floor
good length outside off, chopped to third man off the back foot

Rashid drops it at deep square. A simple catch. Or so it seemed until he looked rushed. Full and into the pads, flicked aerially and flat. It's waist height, but Rashid slides on his knees and goes reverse cup, under this. Looks like he misjudged that or reacted late. Bursts through his hands
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to short extra cover
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs this to third man
good length and just outside off, steps out and punches to mid-off
good length and into the pads, clipped through square leg off the back foot
good length at middle, flicked to midwicket

nicely placed. Strange position for point though. They're usually very square at this level, but this point fielder is more in cover's direction. Full ball outside off, leans in and opens the face to guide this to third man's right
full inswinger onto the pads, flicked to midwicket's right and only a half stop there after a dive
inswinger at a length from outside off, walks into that and punches to mid-on

short_text: Jadeja to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: Jadeja tries to bowl like Kadhav but it doesn't matter. It is right in Patel's slot, and he lofts it well over long-on for a clean six. What a cameo from Axar. Stepping out of Jadeja's shadows. At least in the IPL
placed into a hole on the leg side, and they come back for the second. Scores level

short_text: Jadeja to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: Patel shows he is not a one-trick pony. Jadeja goes wide outside off, and he shows the more classical inside-out lofted drive for six. Cooler as

short_text: Jadeja to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: Patel takes Jadeja on. They are similar players. You could even argue Patel would have had a longer India career if not for Jadeja in the limited-overs formats. This is flat, just short of a length, and he has used his long limbs to slog it over deep midwicket. Cool as
oh this is in the slogging zone, Dhawan tries the sweep, but gets a bottom edge for a single to deep square leg
stays wide of his reach but bowls too wide. Not happy with the call

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: nearly holes out. Hit hard to long-off on the first bounce. The dugout stands up to applaud a maiden T20 century for Dhawan but he is not celebrating. He knows he has a job to do in the last over

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhoni is the only one appealing, and he is given. Dhawan reviews immediately. Dhawan again shuffles across to pick the square-leg gap, but Curran bowls full and wide, and squeezes it under his bat. Bat hits the ground, the ball is nowhere near the bat, no appeal from the bowler, but another umpire finds it hard to deny a Dhoni appeal. Well done, DRS

short_text: Sam Curran to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: pinpoint wide yorker, squeezed out for a single

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: full and wide, driven hard, to the fielder in the deep. Curran bowling to his field

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 wide
long_text: short of a length, looks to stay out of Dhawan's hitting zone, but goes too wide. Called for it

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: yorker outside off, Dhawan caught on leg stump, gets a bottom edge. Nearly played on
low full toss, into the body, less room to swing his arms through it, and he holes out to wide long-on. If Pant gets fit, this might be the last we see of Carey this IPL

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: he manufactures a four. Shuffles across, down on a knee, sweeps him like a spinner. Over square leg. How well has he picked his spots tonight?
short of a length, outside off, seems like a slower ball, punched down to long-off for one
wide full toss, and Dhawan has missed out. Driven straight to deep cover
low full toss outside off, hit off the toe end, straight of long-on. Jadhav puts in a dive to keep them down to two
slower ball, on a length, Carey early into the shot, ends up dragging this towards deep midwicket but it doesn't reach there on the full
Carey backs away early, Thakur follows him, hits him on the pad. They want Carey on strike all the time

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: yorker, just outside off, dug out back to him. Good comeback but DC have got what they wanted from this over

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: cramps him up with a high full toss. Dhawan looks at the leg umpire but he is told this isn't too high

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: Curran goes one better and serves up a leg-side half-volley. Dhawan plays a sensational short-arm drive. No follow-through. Just the punch. Over long-on he goes

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: length ball, 137ks, into the pads. Not what you bowl to someone on 81 off 46. Hit wide of long-on for four. Make it 85 off 47 now
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to leg for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Carey, no run
long_text: Carey, under pressure, looks for the ramp, is beaten by a length ball
short of a length, pushed to the left of Jadeja at point. A little yes-no creates a run-out chance but the consequent overthrow gets them a single
driven down to long-off for one
Thakur keeps coming at Stoinis. Goes even shorter this time. Stoinis is shuffling across to look to work this square on the leg side. Gets a massive top edge for a catch at midwicket
not the cleanest of his sixes, but this will do. Short of a length, Stoinis pulls this off the front foot, sends this really high, but it has just enough muscle behind it to carry over long-on
dropped again. Fourth life for Dhawan. Rayudu goes straight to the towel. Is this dew at work? Full ball, on off, hit hard towards extra cover, and it just hits his hand and spills out
on a length, just outside off, 135ks, pushed wide of cover for one
down the wicket, Sharma fires this it into the pads seam-up at 105ks, he clips this square of short fine leg, but Curran makes a diving save at the boundary to keep them to two

short_text: Karn to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: backs away, takes this on the half-volley, and drills it between deep midwicket and long-on. Dismissive batting
short of a length, wide, Stoinis will feel he has missed out as he has found the fielder at point
tries the big sweep, the full ball skids through to take the bottom edge to short fine leg
full, clipped off the toes, Jadeja misfields at deep midwicket to allow them the second
short of a length, pretty straight, punched down to long-on for one
Dhawan shuffles across to pick on the leg side, Bravo drags his line wide, and he changes his shot to go over cover. Not a clean hit, but just enough to clear the extra cover

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: wide yorker, on-pace, 132ks, beats him even as he steps out of the crease. Late on this one
loopy slower ball again, driven square on the off side
full, on-pace, just outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: well Dhawan reminds me of the spinner jibes Bravo keeps getting. He moves across early, picks the slower ball, and sweeps him like an offspinner. Over square leg
length ball, angling in, 133ks, hit to deep midwicket for one
quicker, short of a length, dabs on it for a single
no beating in the flight here. Half-volley, around off, and he unfurls his wrists to get power into this cover drive over extra cover. Superb batting

Stoinis keeps doing what DC keep doing. This is T20. This is Sharjah. Don't worry too much. Keep hitting. He was beaten three balls ago, but he lofts this over long-off. Beaten in the flight, but still goes through with the shot
short of a length, into the pads, and this is good bowling to his field. Just the single to deep square leg
short of a length, hit hard down the ground to long-on
slow, dipping legbreak, Stoinis looks for a hit over long-off, and is beaten comprehensively
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
on a length, straight, punched to straight short midwicket
slower ball, full outside off, drilled hard to long-off

Iyer looks to take Barvo down as he bowls length and gives him pace to work with. Iyer backs himself to hit sixes down the ground, but the slowness of the pitch means he is early into it and the bat face closes a touch. Caught at long-on
short of a length, outside off, punched in front of sweeper cover, and this time they take Thakur on and come back for an easy two
slips down with an on-pace delivery, and Iyer gets more than a tickle on this. Fine leg stands no chance
slower offcutter, no room, Iyer opens the face, gets a single

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: superb yorker, swinging in, dipping, Dhawan just about gets some bat on it, and Iyer calls him through for one even though the ball hasn't gone far

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Dhawan is in some form. Dances down the wicket, turns this length ball into a half-volley, and drives it inside-out, all along the ground, past extra cover
full and wide, driven to deep cover for one

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: length ball, angling in, pushed into the leg side for one

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: a nothing loosener. Short of a length, no sting, no bite, no pace. He smashes him down the ground, and while both long-off and long-on are back, they have been bisected

dropped by Dhoni or has it not carried?. Full and wide by Bravo. Front-of-the-hand slower ball, Dhawan looks to drive, his bat hits the ground, but the ball hits the edge, and it carries low to Dhoni's left, who is just late on it. The glove just comes down late. No other way of saying it
on-pace, on a length, angling in, uppishly hit to deep square
slower ball, on a length, around off, pushed to short straight midwicket
full, outside off, driven down to long-off for one. Another fifty for Dhawan
short of a length, straight, punched down to long-on for one
full and wide, driven to deep cover for one
starts off with a big wide outside off, though

tries the big hit down the ground, but Sharma has bowled this slow and smart, getting both drift and dip. Beats him, hits him on the pad in front, but this pitched outside leg. Iyer lucky to get away with this. Had he got bat on this, there was a good chance of holing out
full and straight, defended to the straight short midwicket
on a length, middle and leg, worked behind square on the leg side

short_text: Karn to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot, picks the wrong'un, goes back, makes room, cuts this from in front of off, and picks the gap at deep cover

short_text: Karn to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: rocket down the ground. Long-off doesn't have far to to go to his left, but he stands no chance. Dhawan skips down the wicket, gets to the pitch of it, and just drills it over his head
on a length, into the pads, stays back to sort of pull this to long leg for one
short of a length, off-pace again, pushed wide of extra cover for another single. Just the singles off this over
slower ball, short of a length, Dhawan is down the wicket to punch this to extra cover
short of a length, into the body, worked away to long leg
full, just outside off, driven hard to long-off for one
full outswinger, driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, straight, tucked away off the hip
just a boring old single down the ground to end the over

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length, he goes back, and nails this pull for a flat four just in front of deep square leg

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: it is almost like Dhawan is teasing them and testing the creaky joints on the field. This time he tosses up a catch to Watson's right at short third. And it is like everything is happening at normal pace, but Watson dives in slow motion. Another life

dropped at deep square. Chahar has ages to settle under this, but he has misjudged it and has to put in a big dive in the end. Dhawan gets down for a sweep, but the extra bounce takes his too edge. Chahar does the rest
full, into the pads, driven to long-on
length ball, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
slower-ball, full toss outside off, pushed wide of cover for one

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: cracking shot. Not sure this is where he exactly intended to go when he skipped down the wicket, but the length ball is wide, and he drives it square through point
slower short ball, Iyer is off his toes to fend it into the covers for one
full, outside off, driven hard, but straight to cover
lovely shot. On a length, on off, and Iyer shows DC batsmen keep coming at you. Keeps his head down, and swings through its line to clear long-on
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
seam movement as Iyer plays for the outswinger. Hit high on the pad, right in front, but not given out because of the height. Dhoni agrees
length ball, angling in, pushed to leg
direct hit at Dhawan's end this time. Short of a length, no room, dabbed towards point, and they rush through for one. Jadeja gets the throw right, but Dhawan is well in

nearly played on, nearly run out. And now he has hurt himself. He looks down for the count. Short of a length, outside off, he looks to punch it, drags it on, and his foot comes in the way. The ball rolls to slip, Dhawan runs, Iyer responds but he can't get any power into the run because he has hurt himself. Watson misses with the direct hit
full, at off, defended back towards him

Chahar has one more. Rahane's horror IPL continues. He shows the right intent, makes room, hits hard, but straight to Curran at point. Smart catch because it is hit hard, but it has come straight at him
on a length, outswinger, pushed wide of extra cover for a single
cuts this in the air, one the bounce to deep point
on a length, outside off, slight shape away, driven to deep cover. Wide throw from Bravo but Jadhav at midwicket is late to go and back it up. He does so belatedly and just in time
Mumbaikar to Mumbaikar. Rahane seems like he knows Thakur inside out. Waits for a short ball first ball, and pulls him over wide mid-on
shuffles across, gets too close to this shortish ball outside off. Punches it square, past point, for one

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: starts off with a gentle shoritsh ball, and he is lucky it stays low to beat his pull
slower short ball, wide outside off, and he pulls it to deep square for one

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: smart batting. Short of a length, outside off, sits in the surface, but Dhawan does enough with his upper-cut to clear short third man
short of a length, whipped wide of long leg, Rahane goes for the second, but a more accurate throw would have got him. Curran's throw is wide, allowing Rahane to get in
short of a length, outside off, placed in front of backward point for one
on a length, on top off, pushed wide of cover-point for one
on a length, straight, worked away to long leg

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, no room, pushed to the left of Curran, who keeps them in their crease

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Dhawan has found his form of late. Down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, but holds his shape and extends his arms through it to chip it back over his head

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full, swinging away, times it nicely, but straight to cover

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short, no bite in it, Dhawan sits back pull it through square leg

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, defended back to Curran

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: and there is some swing for him, away from Dhawan, who lets it go through to the keeper
inswinger, draws an inside edge onto the pad. The second maiden in Sharjah this year. This one has a big cherry at the top in the form of Shaw's wicket
another lovely outswinger. Rahane defends this to cover
outswinger now, slightly full, around off, defended back to him
wide on the crease, inswinger this time, headed towards top of off. Defended off the front foot

Chahar has got him five times out of six. That is an ordinary shot. Outswinger just outside off, and he is looking to flick this to leg. The leading edge settles with Chahar. A second straight duck for Shaw
length-ball outswinger, outside off, punched to cover
full and wide, drilled to deep cover, and this does my head in no end. Why wouldn't you keep running till you are run out off the last ball? Put that fielder under pressure at least
sharp bouncer, top edge, but falls well short of deep midwicket, and they come back for an easy two
and now he shows what happens when Jadeja connects them. On a length, in the slot, on the pads, Jadeja times this perfectly over long-on
misses the yorker, Jadeja gets a low full toss at 142ks. He has not absolutely nailed this, but so small is this ground that even the toe end clears long-on
yorker outside off, well inside the wide line, and no amount of hard stares at the umpire will get you a wide call here
slower ball, 122ks, dipping low full toss, slogged out to deep midwicket
high full toss, angling in, just below the waist, but well above the fence. Jadeja goes deep into the crease, and deposits it over wide long-on
yorker as Rayudu dances down again. Gets the inside edge onto the pad. The ball is on the pitch but they take the single despite a direct kick from Rabada
bouncer, sharp one, 148ks. The quicker bounce a la Andy Roberts. Beats him neck and crop on the hook
nonchalant. This is a short ball outside off at 144ks. Rayudu aborts his early designs of trying to ramp this, and plays the pull over deep square
full and straight, can't get under it. Single to long-on
down the wicket, Rabada yorks him again. Off the inside edge onto the pad, and a single to cover
harsh call. Rayudu has shuffled across, Rabada bowls a yorker that starts in front of the stumps and swings down leg. Just misses the leg stump
full and straight, and he misses the run-out of Rayudu. Rayudu charges back for the second, but Rahane's throw from long-off is slightly slow. Deshpande can't gather it
slower ball gone wrong. Too wide outside off

Jadeja looks to make room, Deshpande looks to follow him, and he strays too far down leg. Jadeja is clever, stands his ground, and plays the pick-up over square leg into the street where a young man makes away with the ball
yorker, just outside off, dug out to point for one
makes room to punch this short-of-a-length ball to long-off for one
full and straight, runs off the inside half to square leg for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single to deep square leg
ordinary ball to end the over. Slides down the leg side with this length ball, and Rayudu glances it fine of short fine leg
short of a length again, punched down the ground for one
short of a length, no room, fended off the back foot

Dhoni takes Nortje on, and edges through. Seems like a slower ball, at 134ks (believe that), and Dhoni is early into the swing. He has skipped down the wicket, gets a meaty edge, and it just about carries through to the keeper
yorker gone wrong, low full toss, into the toes, played to deep midwicket for one
lovely lovely shot. The best of Rayudu. Wide length ball, slower one at 128ks, and he stays beside the line and goes inside-out over cover. Sweet connection
full toss, about knee-high, swinging away a touch, Rayudu gets a soft outside edge to short third man for one
that is out of the crews. Jumps at Stoinis again, turns this into a length ball, and goes over long-on with a clean swing of the bat
full, just outside off, 141ks, hit hard but straight to mid-off
short of a length, 131s, Rayudu jumps at him and is early into the shot. Gets a bottom edge for a single
on a length, on-pace, just outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
quick length ball, 138ks, just outside off. Dhoni caught in no man's land with no feet movement. Throws his hands at the ball, and is beaten
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
can't get much off the free hit, as he is hit on the inside half of the bat on the slog
why is this a no-ball? This is a perfect bouncer, in front of his face, and Rayudu looks at square leg. This is called no-ball. Has to be a line call. Or was this the second bouncer of the over?

Dhawan dropped the easy one, but takes the difficult one. Du Plessis charges at him, Rabada follows him, it goes off the inside half of the bottom of the bat, and Dhawan dives forward at long-on to take the catch. He then does the thigh five, and also jumps on Rabada, who is now the fastest to 50 IPL wickets

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slower bouncer - it reads 140ks on the gun. Perhaps it just sits in the surface and comes off slowly. Beats his attempt to ramp it. Beats him with the slowness of the pace

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length now, 142ks, and it goes under the bat as du Plessis slogs. Over the wicket it goes

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: du Plessis slogs at a length ball first ball, and gets a healthy inside edge to the left of Carey for four
reverse-sweeps another carrom ball, from in front of the stumps, can't get it as square as he wants it to go, but just about clears cover-point
a wide carrom ball again, mis-hits the slog, but gets two just because of the mis-hit
wide on the crease, wide carrom ball, and Rayudu is beaten on the cut. Carey doesn't collect it. Has he dropped him? Not sure if there is an edge
big sweep. Not much turn on this length-ball carrom ball and he sweeps this just over deep square for six
carrom ball again, and he beats him in the flight too. Gets time to turn. Pushed towards cover-point
another carrom ball, starts outside leg, turns towards the stumps, worked into the leg side
chipped over extra cover as Patel goes wide. Gets a couple for this

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: on a length, around off, pushed towards long-off this time
they are peppering Dhawan here. Another pull straight to Dhawan but along the ground now

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: Dhawan has dropped du Plessis. The third ball hit to him this over. Du Plessis down the wicket, not to its pitch, hits it in front of long-on, but Dhawan spills it as his knees hit the ground
down the wicket, hits this powerfully, straight of long-on, but Dhawan makes a diving save to his left

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, hurries him into the pull, but it lands short of long-on. Hits him high on the bat
down the wicket, Nortje spears in a full and fast delivery at 146ks to cramp him up. He gets an inside edge into the pads
on a length, around off, 148ks, defended to cover
top of middle with a 139ks length ball. On-pace, on-seam. Watson is looking to give himself room and swing, but does so down the wrong line

yorker, swinging in late, appeal for lbw, but he seems to have got an inside edge on the pad. Du Plessis is celebrating his fifty, but Iyer has called for a review. At any rate this is going down leg so it is a waste of review for sure. The third umpire sees a spike when the ball is next to the bat so the not-out stays, and du Plessis gets to his fifty. He doesn't celebrate it twice, though

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, opens the face, but can't beat the man at point, who is in tight to save the single
length ball, at 145ks, middle and leg, hits him high on the bat. Single to long-on

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slower again, into the pitch, punched to extra cover
slower ball, short of a length, punched in front of deep cover, and Stoinis makes a diving save to his right

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: ramp to a low full toss, for a moment it seems he has picked the wrong man, the mountain called Nortje, at short fine, but it clears him by inches
slower ball, too full, drilled hard to wide long-on for one
into the pitch now, short of a length, slower too, steered to third man

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: seam-up, in the slot, gentle pace, mid-off is up, and du Plessis accepts this with gratitude, hitting it for a flat six over long-off
one carrom ball too many or is it that this just too short? Watson stands there, waits for it, and smacks it back over Ashwin's head for four. No nicety here. Just brute power
top-edges a sweep over Careys' head. Comes back for what looks like a regulation two but he has to get the skates on in the end

that is slightly unfortunate for Ashwin. He seems to have got the better of Watson with a wide carrom ball, but Watson throws the trunk in his hand at it, and even off the toe end it flies past extra cover
middle and leg, on a length, worked into the leg side for one

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: looks like another carrom ball but this time du Plesssis has got under it with the sweep, and has also placed it square of deep midwicket

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: carrom ball, middle and off, ends up just outside off, punched back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, and again no power in a pull shot. Single to deep midwicket this time
slightly short, he goes back to pull, but doesn't get all of it. Single to wide long-on

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, drives it to wide long-off for one
slow in the air, on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: lap sweep, using Patel's high pace, getting inside the line and guiding this fine of short fine. The run rate goes past six

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: on a length, slow off the surface, pushed wide of Patel for a tight single
is this the legbreak? Or might just be the old-fashioned carrom ball. Short of a length, outside off, just the single down the ground

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: wide on the crease, and another carrom ball, defeating his sweep, but hits him outside the line
another carrom ball, this time on a length. Middle and leg, and holding its line. Pushed to long-on
goes wide on the crease, bowls wide, and is cut away to his deep fielder for one

short_text: Ashwin to du Plessis, no run
long_text: another carrom ball, du Plessis looks to work to leg and gets a leading edge to cover
starts with a carrom ball. Just short of a length, and Watson mis-hits this pull to long-on for one
quick length ball outside off, punched down to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Watson, no run
long_text: makes room, Patel follows it with a slider, he bottom-edges this to the right of Patel and sends du Plessis back

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: on a length, on off, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, no run
long_text: arm ball? Du Plessis is looking to make room but is cramped up by this length ball
on a length, stump to stump, Watson goes back to work this to deep midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: quick length ball, punched to deep cover for one
nice touch. Short of a length, gives him slight width, and Watson gets off his toes to ride the bounce and guide this between point and short third man. Still the worst Powerplay in Sharjah this year

collision between du Plessis and Rabada. Both are caught ball-watching. Du Plessis is looking for a quick single to mid-on, Rabada is getting read to collect the throw. Du Plessis runs right into Rabada, but it is du Plessis who is winded. And at the other end, Watson is looking back to see what is happening, and is nearly run out as the throw is at his end. The throw misses, though

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: on-ace short ball, and du Plessis is ready with his front leg out of the way. He sends a rocket pull into the deep midwicket fence

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, no run
long_text: lovely slower ball. Legcutter at 122ks, bouncing extra from short of a lenght as du Plessis looks to make room to pull. The top edge falls wide of Rabada
slower ball, short of a length, nudged to the adjacent pitch and they steal a single despite a direct hit from Rabada
on a length, wicket to wicket, defended back to him. Rabada yet to be scored off tonight

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: threads the gap. Slower ball, 128ks, on a length, du Plessis gives himself a bit of room, and hits this to the left of extra cover. DC are excited for a moment because this has been hit in the air and at a catchable height but he has placed it in the gap

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full and straight, 145ks, hit too well to mid-on to be risking a single

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: picks his spot, backs away, gets under a short-of-a-length ball and clears midwicket with ease

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slower ball, 120ks, outside off, on a length, du Plessis bottom edges when looking to go over cover

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, no run
long_text: down the wicket, Nortje pulls the length back, and he hits this straight to mid-off on the bounce

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: du Plessis does what Buttler did with some success against Nortje. Bowled up at 141ks, and he gets under it and ramps him over short fine leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Watson, no run
long_text: quicker, into the pads, pushed to midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: down the wicket, Patel slows down the delivery, pulls the length back, and all du Plessis can do is get a single to cover

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, no run
long_text: arm ball, cramps him up as du Plessis looks to cut

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slightly slower, slightly higher, driven to extra cover
on a length, outside off, stays on the crease to drive this to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, punched down the ground for one
short ball, 129ks, Watson doesn't mind waist-high half bungers. Goes over midwicket for four
slower ball, on a length, cuts back in, whipped to midwicket
imperious. On a length, outside off, and Watson plonks his front foot half-way down, and punches this on the up. Lovely off drive. Between the bowler and mid-off
short of a length, into the body, pushed wide of midwicket

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length, 135ks, just outside off, defended with an open face

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, defended
wide down the leg side
and we have a maiden now. Yorker at 142ks. On off. Dug out back to him. The first maiden in Sharjah this IPL
slower ball, on a length, 124ks, on top of off. Defended
short of a length, no room outside off, defended with an open face
driven on the up, and while this is bowled at 144ks, it hasn't quite come on. Bounces in front of short cover
short of a length, slow off the pitch, hits the bottom edge as he looks to work this into the off side
short of a length, pretty straight, defended
short of a length, and du Plessis breaks the maiden with a punch in front of point

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, 137ks, pushed to square leg

short_text: Deshpande to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length, around off, gets it high. Defended to point

Deshpande bowls ahead of Rabada, and in three balls he has got Curran out. Sharp short ball, at him, Curran pulls, gets a top edge to third man, where Nortje is back-pedalling, takes it head high, keeps an eye on the rope, releases the ball before stepping over, and then comes back to take the catch

short_text: Deshpande to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: skids down the wicket second ball, but Deshpande holds his own and fallows him as he backs away. Hits him on the thigh pad

short_text: Deshpande to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, left alone
lifted over deep midwicket! Casual. Full and into leg stump, hangs deep in the crease and and brings out a beautiful swing on this lofted flick
full  and at middle stump, mistimed drive to long-on's left and Gurkeerat has hared the first run down while screaming "two two two"
miscued hook but that will get AB on strike. Short and climbing at the helmet. A feeble fend in the end, but well in front of square leg
lofted to midwicket's right. Low full toss outside off, shuffles into line and scoops that. Maybe looking to go squarer coz square leg is in but he gets two
yorker outside off, driven along the floor to sweeper's left
connects on one. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. Waits on it and chops it to sweeper's right
slower bouncer from around the wicket, loops over Gurkeerat who can't get bat on that because it's a wide
yorker outside off, jammed out to sweeper cover
swiped over square leg! Too predictable now. Another slower ball dug in at a middle stump line. Waits on it again and nails the pull, to deep square's left
drilled over wide long-on! This is a poor length. Full slower ball at middle, gets the front leg out and clubs that slog to the top tier

waits on that and clobbers it over midwicket. Good length, slower ball at middle. Iwas always going to be that, wasn't it? And AB nails the connection this time. Deep in the crease and clears the big side of the ground by some distance
yorker wide outside off, shuffles and shapes for the scoop, but is forced to push into the covers with a straight bat

backward point gets a hand on that at backward point and saves two. Would have been a heck of a catch if he got this one-handed. Full ball outside off, sliced to try and beat point but Unadkat was leaping up with his left hand

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gurkeerat, no run
long_text: slides through under the bat. Yorker in the corridor, gets down and looking to sweep that over square. Not in line and ultimately not close to making connection as that skids past off stump
low full toss at middle stump, punched to long-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: sliced over point! Yorker at off stump, gets deep in the crease and he looks to jam this through the leg side. It pings off the back of his closed face and that's four
low full toss just outside off, drilled down to long-on

survives a miscue into the off side and then possibly a run-out as well. Unadkat outfoxes AB with a cutter at middle stump, rising away from him. He looks to slog, slices into the vacant region to extra cover's right. Unadkat runs over there and throws at the striker's end where AB has gorunded the bat nicely. Extra cover was back on the line in that instance
sliced over sweeper cover. Full and wide outside off, hangs leg side and low of that and then opens the face and lifts it over the off side
full and wide outside off, driven along the ground to extra cover's left
full ball pushed wide outside off. Reaches out with no feet movement, tries to poke into the off side. It's back dow the pitch off the toe-end
beaten again. Unadkat turning it away from over the wicket. This is good length outside off, he stepped out and went across the line
slower short ball across the corridor, beaten on the cut
full on off stump, driven to extra-cover
short on off stump, only gets up to hip height, and AB will punish those all day. Opens up at the hips and swats it over the forward square leg boundary
short, angling into the front shoulder, swivels but can't get too much bat on this hook. Lobs down to long leg, on the bounce
yorker length at middle stump, jammed down to long-on
full and into the pads, flicked to deep square's right
low full toss on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and in at the stumps, clipped to long-on's right
finally manages to find the gap between point and short third, but Tyagi gives chase and pulls that back in. Short of a length ball outside off and chopped square
good length at off stump, deep in the crease to punch to long-on
good length and down leg side, can't get the sweep away
googly, short of a length and up at middle. Dragged to long-on off the back foot
short of a length and into the body. Forced out to deep square
full at off stump, driven down to long-off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Gurkeerat, no run
long_text: full toss outside off, mstimed punch to extra cover
yorker at leg stump stump, jammed to square leg with a closed face. Might have been a half-chance with the run out at the non-striker's end if there a was a direct hit

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to AB, no run
long_text: misses out on a full toss. Outside off, wanted to beat Jofra at short third to the right but finds him again
