short_text: Kartik Tyagi to AB, no run
long_text: nearly a run-out at the non-strikers end. Gurkeerat would have been out without facing a ball. Good length ball outside off, sliced straight to Jofra at short third. Gurkeerat called and wanted the run while AB was ball-watching. Jofra took a long look and aimed, but couldn't hit the stumps
bouncer goes down leg side, left alone

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to AB, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, cut on the bounce to backward point

has Tewatia done enough at deep midwicket? Looks like he has. Kohli is walking back. Full ball angled into Kohli from wide of the crease. he uses the angle and brings out the trademark whip off his his shin. It's flat and fast to Tewatia's right. He takes the catch inches from the line. And is about to fall over. But he lobs it back up with his left hand, then gains his balance again and comes back to take it. Third umpire confirms that was all clean. Brilliant footwork so close to the line. That was traveling quickly to his right too

dropped slow and short outside off, forces him to try and clear the ground with a pull. Not enough power on that and it's an easy take for Stokes. This isn't too different from the ball Kohli hit for six, except that it's climbing away from a tiring batsman
full and just outside off, pushed straight to extra cover
good length and into the pads, steps out and flicks to midwicket
full and down leg side, beaten on the sweep

slapped over long-on! Good length ball, dipping and very slow at middle stump. He steps out and is not to the pitch of the ball so this has taken some incredible power to launch on the up. Had to make all the power
googly, good length and turning away outside off. Looks to slog that and cue-ends it to long-off
good length at off, steps out and goes inside-out. A chip to long-off's right where Stokes is the man again

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Padikkal, no run
long_text: yorker just outside off, backs away and looks to slice behind point. Can't get it off the pitch
length at off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
short of a length and just outside off. Looks for the pull, gets an under-edge into the pitch
short and down leg side, left alone
full ball at off stump, steps out and meets it on the full. Drives to Stokes' left at long-off
at a length and into the body, whipped to deep midwicket's right
good length outside off, steps out and punches to sweeper's right
length and into leg stump. Clipped to deep backward square's left
good length and fired down leg. Kohli arches to let that go
short of a length and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
slower and short of a length at leg stump. Steps out and is forced to punch to long-on
good length and sliding on low as he steps out. Uses the angle to pat it to midwicket
googly short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward poiint whose wayward throw gives them a run at midwicket. The batsmen weren't even looking for a run. Unadkat the fielder
short outside off, cut to backward point's right. He leaps one-handed and gets a finger on it

gets deep in the crease and pulls this over deep midwicket. Googly, short and turning into him. Had to make room by getting the front leg into the leg side and then the swivel helps him find the stands
good length and coming into the body again, reaches out and flicks to deep midwicket's right
short of a length and a googly on middle. He gets on the back foot for the cut and gets an inside edge through short fine. Didn't pick that
googly, short and at middle stump. Pulled to deep square's right
good length and just outside off, steps out and punches to long-off on the up
good length, googly and going away outside off. Flicked through midwicket off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
just short of deep square running in. Looks to sweep this off stump ball and gets a top edge
short and wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, a googly, left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, mistimed drive to long-off's right

backs into the leg side, Tewatia bowls a front-of-the-hand quicker one. It's a full toss and he looks to slog that. Can only get it out to deep midwicket with a couple of bounces. The umpire says no-ball and then overturns it? Not sure if that was a no-ball call or if he was holding his arm out to tell the bowler the batsman isn't ready. Might be the latter given the lack of protests around. Or they checked and he got confirmation that is wasn't above waist height because he was touching his earpiece. Nothing clear at the moment, other than the fact it's not a no-ball
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut down to long-off. Tewatia's overstepped.
tossed up outside off, gets down for the slog sweep and misses again
good length and sliding on outside off, looks for the sweep and is beaten on the under-edge
slower ball, dug in at a length and rising past Kohli's bat as he steps out and looks to muscle this through the covers

nearly lobs that to short third man. Slower short ball outside off, shapes to pull, loses his shape, then follows with his hands and has a weak jab at that. Tyagi picks up on the bounce at short third and throws to give away a run at long-on via the non-striker's end
full slower ball outside off, driven to long-off
short and outside off, rolls the wrists as he cuts to sweeper cover
past the edge. Good length and keeps coming in with the angle until it pitches and straightens in the corridor. Angled bat on that
slower ball, dug in short of a length at middle stump. Walks down at it and drags the pull to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, pushed to point
full and loopy at leg stump, leans in and pushes to midwicket's right
miscued loft. Full outside off, steps out and slices to sweeper's left
googly, short and into leg stump. Whipped to deep square
googly from wide of the crease, at a good length and in at off stump. Pushed to point off the front foot
full and just outside off, punched out to sweeper cover
good length and across him on off stump, uses the angle to jab this to sweeper's left
full and just outside off, check-drive into the covers
picked up wide of mid-on. Good length and across him, steps out and shovels this wide of the fielder
good length and just outside off, poked into the off side with the angle
good length and tight at off stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
good length and just outside off. Kohli runs down at it and almost forces himself into opening the face and getting this square. As it turns out, third man is in. Two runs to Jofra's right
good length and just outside off, poked to extra cover's left with soft hands
full and just outside off, driven towards mid-off off the toe-end. Has to put in a big dive at the other end as the throw comes in. And it would have saved him if Smith had got the direct hit

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: short and just outside off, waits on it and uses the angle to stab this to short third man's left

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: short and up at the under-arm, hurries him a touch but he's swiveled quickly and managed to squeeze this between keeper and short fine leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Padikkal, no run
long_text: good length and slanted away, but comes back in off the pitch as he looks to chop this behind point. Beaten on the under-edge
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers with soft hands
full and down leg side, gets good bat on the lap sweep but short fine lunges to the left and gets a hand on it
good length and sliding into the stumps. Clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length on leg stump, whipped to deep square

taken in the covers. Good bowling from Gopal. Hangs the length ball wide outside off. It's got some overspin on it. Finch is down on a knee trying to slog sweep that, but he's gotten too far away with his leg-side stride and ends up slicing it high. Uthappa takes it at mid-off
sounds like a dropped catch. Short and just outside off, backs away to cut, but that's impossible to catch. Thick outside edge that takes Samson's left bicep and deflects to short third
googly, short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward point
chipped over the long-off boundary. Good length and just outside off, half a stride and he's behind the line of it.Offers the full face and simply lifts it on the rise
beaten on the outside edge. Short of a length and this one moves away from the seam and past the attempted punch
short and down leg side, left alone
cuts through him. Short of a length and jumping back in from outside off as he swishes down the wrong line

smoked over square leg! That is some connection. Short of a length at off stump, not a lot of time to move his feet there, but the bat swing across the line is sweet on this pull shot. Rapid hands. It's into the second tier too, 100 metres according to the broadcaster
good length and just outside off, hangs the bat out and gets an inside edge down to fine leg
good length and into the pads, whipped to deep midwicket's left
googly at a length on leg stump. Steps out and can only get pad on the attempted flick, single at short fine
good length and just outside off, defended down the pitch off the front foot
good length on leg stump, dabbed to short fine off the back foot
good length at off stump, onto the back foot to punch to extra cover
good length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and pushes with soft hands through square leg. The bigger side, that
good length and into the hips, hopping again as he flicks to deep square's right
good length and down leg side, can't get bat on it
good length and in at off stump, watchfully patted into the covers
past the outside edge. Has him hopping with a short of a length ball angled into him that jags away off the seam
short of a length across the corridor, hangs back and guides this to third man with the angle
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
yorker and just outside off, jams the bat down on it and is beaten

appeal for lbw is given out and Jofra reviews right away. Full dipping ball at middle stump, rapped him right in front as he looked to go across that. Inside edge? No, says Ultra Edge. That's smashing leg stump, he was struck right on the toe. That'll remain out and Morris has a fourth
low full toss outside off, looks for another heave into the leg side, it's mistimed and bounces out towards long-off
full and wide outside off, can't get bat on that
good length and wide outside off, swings across the line and is beaten
full and into the body, shoveled to deep midwicket

taken at sweeper cover by Shahbaz. He's a very good fielder, and he's pulled off some nice skill to hang on at the boundary. Full ball outside off, shuffles and goes inside-out. He takes some strides to his right, marginally over-runs it but keeps his bearings and then dives to his right and backwards to hold on. they checked to see if he'd landed ball-first on the turf, but there don't seem to be enough close-up angles of that
full slower ball wide outside off, mistimed drive rolls back to the bowler
past short fine. Another full toss outside off, down on one knee and swept wide of the fielder
low full toss outside off, drilled to long-on's right, along the ground
full and wide outside off, gets down for the ramp but he cops this on his back knee which was exposed. Past the inside edge and he's down from the impact, can't take the run
full slower ball outside off, gets down on one knee and slices this to sweeper's right. Kohli swats it into the ground after running t his right
whipped over midwicket! Low full toss outside off, jumps into line of it and then uses quick wrists for a short-arm whip to use the pace and send it 85 metres
full slower ball outside off, almost yorker length. Squeezed to deep midwicket off the thick inside edge
slow good length ball turning away wide outside  off, reaches out and sweeps down to long-on

short_text: Chahal to Smith, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: reverse whip past point! They had extra cover back. He waits on this full one on middle and swivels the other way and whips it while still upright. And it's another front foot no-ball from Chahal!
beaten on the reverse sweep. Good length ball turning down leg side and he's through it too quickly. AB doesn't gather cleanly
full ball tossed up at leg stump, slogs it straight to deep midwicket who takes a clean catch and sends the throw back in quickly

short_text: Chahal to Smith, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: full at off stump, steps out to the pitch of this and launches it over his partner to beat long-on. And that brings up his fifty. He's also rewarded with a free hit as the siren has gone off. Chahal has overstepped
good length and tossed up outside off, steps out and mistimes the slog, to deep midwicket
full and wide outside off, swept to deep midwicket's left

swept over point. Full ball outside off, he jumps into a left-hander's stance but the grip is much the same. What matters though is the connection is perfect to send this legbreak to the point boundary
full slower ball wide outside off, stabbed to extra cover's left off the back foot
full and just outside off, there for the drive but he's gone too eagerly at it. It trickles out to mid-off
short at the body, pulled off the front foot to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on's right
good length and angled into the body. Opens the face and runs it to short third man. His direct hit deflects into long-on's direction and they get a second
short and at the stumps. Squeezed out to deep midwicket
full and into leg stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket's left
full slower ball outside off, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket
expertly done. Short and into the body. Stays a touch leg side of that and gets this fine of short third man with an angled bat

taken at mid-off. Morris was brought back for the wicket, and he's got the biggest one. Good length and rising just outside off, was looking to slap this over the infield on the up but ended up slicing it
short and down leg side, can't get bat on it
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
oh he's nailed the connection on that! Full ball angled into off stump and he keeps the front leg side and swipes this over midwicket. Some sound off the bat there, right off the middle
full slower ball at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full slower ball outside off, driven to extra cover
oh this is just poor bowling. Point and third man are in. And he goes bouncer outside off again. Smith leaps off the ground and chops this over short third
oh well placed. Slower ball dropped short and wide outside off, waits on it and deliberately cuts this over point
length ball outside off, half a stride across as he clips this into midwicket
full slower ball, wide outside off. Mistimed drive to long-off
good length at middle stump, tapped to long-on off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, punched to long-on on the up
short of a length and at off stump, defended down the pitch
full and into the pads, flicked straight to midwicket
length outside off, punched to sweeper's right
short and just outside off, allows it on and deflects to third man
full and just outside off, leans in and pushes uppishly towards long-off
good length and turning in. Nudged through vacant midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
short and just outside off, looks for the pull, gets it onto the pads off the inside edge
good length and just outside off, deep in the crease and glanced to deep midwicket
full dipping legbreak wide outside off, reaches a long way out and flicks uppishly to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, deep in the crease and whips to deep midwicket
beaten by the googly. Two googlies to him that he hasn't picked today. This is rising from a length outside off and he was looking to punch through cover
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, pushed to point with the turn
dipping full ball outside off, gets low and paddles to deep backward square's right
good length and turning away wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right
good length and into leg stump, clipped to long-on with the angle
good length and into middle. Gets forward and jabs to the bowler's right with the angle
full at leg stump, flicked to long-on's right

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Buttler, SIX runs
long_text: drilled over straight long-off. Good length ball at off stump, pushed through flat. Steps out and meets it on the pitch and then a clean lofted drive
full at middle stump, steps out and squeezes this past extra cover's left hand after yorking himself
good length outside off, steps out and drives to long-off
loopy length ball wide outside off, turning away from the tramline and left alone
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length, slowed right down outside off. Dips on him too. Waits for it to turn and then jabs to point's left. They hesitate with the running but the fiedler hasn't managed to pick it up
tossed up at off stump, gets down and miscues the reverse sweep. Along the ground to sweeper's left
good length on leg stump, hard hands on the push down the wicket
googly at a good length, into leg stump. Glanced through square leg

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Buttler, no run
long_text: just short of midwicket. Full and drifted into leg stump, flicked uppishly

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Buttler, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: driven along the ground to beat sweeper to the right. Full ball and pushed through quick outside off, nicely onto the front foot to get it past extra cover

short_text: Shahbaz Ahmed to Buttler, no run
long_text: full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up and angled into the pads. Gets forward and tickles it to deep backward square's right
full and just outside off, driven to long-off
leaves the googly alone. Didn't look a convincing leave! Good length ball spinning in from outside off

taken at long-off. Bring out the same banners, it's Samson gone softly again. Somehow, even after a good start, Rajasthan have managed to be three down with lots of overs to spare. This is poor batting from Samson. It's a good length dipping ball wide outside off. He's stuck halfway between slapping this over extra cover and driving it for a single to long-off. Has only managed to loft it to the fielder after reaching out wide for it

taken at deep midwicket. Tossed up full and slow outside off, makes him reach out with the slog sweep and gets gets under it a bit too much. It's high and not very far. Job done, though, you'd say for Uthappa. And job well done
full outside off, driven to long-off's right
good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers
welcomed with a loooong hit over midwicket! Tossed up at leg stump, gets the front leg into the leg side and slogs cleanly to send it to the second tier
short and angled in towards off stump. Arches back to try and jab this to third man, beaten
short and just outside off, late cut to third man
full toss at the thigh, flicked out to deep square
whack. Short and not rising up quickly enough outside off. Hangs back and connects right off the middle with this pull, lofted into the vacant deep midwicket region
slapped past extra cover! Short of a good length outside off, steps out and nails this flat-batted hit, all along the floor
full and into the pads, beaten on the flick
slow dipping full toss on middle, reaches out and flicks to deep square
good length and into the pads, flicked out to deep midwicket

taken down leg side. Looks like a slower bouncer down leg side. Looks for the pull and is through it too soon. Seems like he only got a glove on that in the end and AB moved nicely to his right to take it
yorker at the legs, forces him to jam it down the pitch
short of a length wide outside off, firmly cut to sweeper's left. A check for run out at the non-striker's end as Finch puts in a throw close to the stumps, but Uthappa was back safely
good length outside off, mistimed punch to mid-off
short and wide outside off, left alone

just out of reach for Kohli running backwards. Short ball just outside off, backs away to make room and looks to pull over mid-on. Kohli sprints and stretches backwards but can't get a hand on this as it plonks into the turf
good length on leg stump, shuffles into the leg side and flicks to midwicket
short and just outside off, sliced to third man
good length outside off, mistimed slog to mid-on's left
lifted over midwicket. Good length and rising up at off stump. Hangs back in the crease and pulls this off the inside part of the bat
good length on middle stump, punched uppishly to mid-on

lofted over the long-on boundary! Good length and pushed across the corridor. Stays still in the crease after the trigger movement and launches this against the angle and on the up, with the full face offered
slower ball, short of a good length and across off stump. Shuffles deep in the crease and then gets the weight onto the front foot to pull this over mid-on
good length and down leg side again, steps out and is beaten on the flick
good length and down leg side, can't get bat on it
low full toss just outside off, looks to jam that into the off side and gets an inside edge onto pad
slower short ball outside off, backs away and cuts straight to backward point
slower ball at a length on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
thick edge past short third man. Slower ball at a good length outside off, steps out and has a big heave at that. Not in control of it
finds the square leg boundary again. Walks into the off side, uses the pace and the turn on this delivery outside off and lofts it
good length on middle stump, steps out and pushes towards long-on. Can't beat the bowler to his right
swept again and this time aerially. Good length at leg stump, down early and goes with the spin and over square leg
good length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
swiped past backward square. Holds his stance this time and waits on this length ball into the pads. Gets low and finds the vacant boundary at long leg
opens up the off side and drives sweetly. Full ball at off and middle. Walks into the leg side to make room and punches firmly to mid-off's left
good length and pushed wide outside off, steps out and down leg side. He's made too much room and not given himself a chance to attempt a shot
full inswinger down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
good length outside off, stride across off stump as he drops this into the midwicket region
full and just outside off, closes the face and taps to mid-on's left
beats him. Good length and moves away off the the pitch outside off as he pushes out at this
full and at middle stump. Walks down at it and yorks himself. Squeezes to mid-on's left
short and pushed across him. Walks down and slaps it on the rise to cover
good length and just outside off, pushed to midwicket's left
good length outside off, punched off the front foot to long-off
good length and into the pads, uses the angle to flick to midwicket
good length and just outside off, pushed back down the pitch on the front foot
good length and slanted in at middle stump, deep in the crease and taps to midwicket
good length at off stump, punched with the turn to long-on
nearly a yorker, calmly pushed to long-off to end this early
he over-compensates, goes too short, and gives him width too. Cut over point for four. Deliberately up and over
low full toss, driven down to long-on
Pandya is looking for the golf swing as Green pitches this up. Gets a thick inside edge for one
short and wide, just too slow, so he doesn't get the timing. Takes a the single on the cut
bouncer to end the over, and Pandya ducks it
this is buffet bowling for Pandya. On a length, into the pads, the short boundary on the leg side. He flicks it with his head down, and clears the square-leg fence easily
lovely straight hitting. Cummins goes full, 140ks, and he gets under it and lofts him back over his head
bouncer, at him. Pandya ducks it
and Pandya stamps his hitting class. Cummins bowls just short of a length with mid-on up, and he drives at it with his head down. Doesn't bother to look up either as he has cleared mid-on with ease
slower ball, full toss outside leg, glanced away for one to fine leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pandya, no run
long_text: shuffles across, Mavi doesn't give him the length to hit. Defended off the back foot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: slower short ball, pulled down to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: de Kock is looking for an early night here. Short ball, only about rib-high, and he swivels with it to pull it up and over and just behind square

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: imperious. Short of a length, on-pace, angles outside off, and he steers it between point and short third man for four

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower-ball yorker, dipping on him, 102ks. Knuckle ball it looks like. Kept out by de Kock, who acknowledges it is a good ball

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: full and straight, mis-hit towards deep midwicket for an easy two
short of a length, on off, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, outside off, knocked into the off side for one
quick length ball outside off, left alone
he has swept this onto his own wicket. Varun bowls a full and wide carrom ball, Yadav tries the big sweep, and gets a meaty bottom edge onto the off stump
another wrong'un, starts too far outside leg, and de Kock works it away for a single

short_text: Varun to de Kock, no run
long_text: wrong'un, from just outside leg, and takes the leading edge to point. Bounces short

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: Yadav plonks his back foot across to set up a base to go over the bowler's head, but ends up going over the keeper's head with an outside edge. Just short of that driving length, but the bowler is unlucky here

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: slower ball, wide length ball, crunched to deep cover for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, no run
long_text: shows him the ramp early, Mavi bowls the short ball, slower I think, at 126ks. De Kock continues with the ramp, but is beaten
looks to work this length ball to leg, but gets a leading edge over cover for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, holds its line, beats the edge as he looks to run this down

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: nearly a yorker, at his heel, clipped away for one
short of a length, sits up, punched wide of long-on for two
deftly played wide of that slip. A quick length-ball legcutter, and he opens the face late. Russell has to give chase, and he sticks the boot out
short of a length, another single to deep midwicket
short of a length, around off, punched to deep midwicket for two
legcutter, outside off, on a length, pushed towards long-on for one
on a length, middle and off, worked to deep midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, no run
long_text: another length ball pushed straight to mid-on

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, hits him high on the bat. Pushed to mid-on

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, no run
long_text: shuffles across to play this length ball to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, OUT
long_text: finally a wicket for KKR. Mavi comes back after that disdainful four. This is full, just outside off, Sharma plays for the angle, but it actually pitches and seams away to take the outside edge

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: calculated hitting. Skips down the wicket, takes this on a length, and goes inside-out to the shorter boundary. One-bounce four to deep cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: wide length ball, hits him high on the bat. Hit straight to point

short_text: Varun to de Kock, no run
long_text: tossed up, just outside off, defended
on a length, slow, wicket to wicket, bunted into the leg side for one

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: quick legcutter, Sharma looks to drive on the up, but is beaten

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: after two good balls, he serves Sharma a short ball, and he pulls him clean over midwicket. It is the short boundary too

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: tries the slog sweep but is done in by the wrong'un this time. Lucky to survive this one

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: lovely legcutter outside off, beats him on the drive
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man for one
back to yorkers, and draws another dot. Actually make it a single to cover

short_text: Russell to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: bouncer, and it disappears over the short boundary. Pulls this emphatically, and there is no deep square in place anyway. That is fifty for him. He looks in ominous form

short_text: Russell to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: de Kock on fire. Two yorkers later, Russell gives him a length ball - actually slightly fuller than length - and he clears the front leg to smack him back over his head

short_text: Russell to de Kock, no run
long_text: nearly a yorker, well outside off, de Kock catches up with it, but only manages to send it back to Russell

short_text: Russell to de Kock, no run
long_text: yorker outside off, de Kock can't reach it

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: legcutter, Sharma looks to play on the up, but can't beat the man at cover

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slower through the air, full, just outside off, defended with an open face
offbreak, just outside off, pushed to the right of cover for one
on a length, around off, pushed down the ground to long-on
legcutter, short of a length, punched wide of long-off for an easy couple

short_text: Varun to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: flighted outside off, driven hard, but straight to point

short_text: Prasidh to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: beautiful batting. Gets width outside off this time so he drives hard on it, and it bounces over the straight extra cover for four. Mid-off has no chance

short_text: Prasidh to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: de Kock is toying with them. Short of a length, straight, and he rocks back to pull him for a flat six over midwicket. Picking on the short boundary
uppish drive but bounces well short of mid-off

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fullish, straight, clipped to short midwicket
slightly fuller, de Kock respects it and opens the face for a single

short_text: Prasidh to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: de Kock dictating terms here. Not a bad ball, short of a length, straight, but he picks the length early, swivels back and slogs this almost through square leg and along the ground

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: yorker, middle and leg, dot
de Kock looks to pull, Russell has bowled short at 137ks, gets it high, and de Kock gets just the single to deep square
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed wide of mid-on for one

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, just outside off, punched down to mid-off

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, opens the face, but can't get it past cover-point
short of a length, straight, bunted to leg for one

short_text: Green to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, defended back to him
low full toss, just the single to deep midwicket

short_text: Green to de Kock, no run
long_text: beaten on the sweep this time, but this is headed down leg

short_text: Green to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: always a difficult catch. De Kock gets a massive top edge on the sweep, Varun runs back from short fine, but he has to catch it over his head running back, and they are always tricky. He gets there but can't hold on

short_text: Green to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, the swing back in cramps him up on the cut

short_text: Green to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: full toss, crunched past the bowler for four more. Long-on has no chance of cutting this

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: looks to drive on the up but this gets a little big and hits the splice of his bat. Fielded at cover-point

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, hits the bat high as Sharma defends

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, Rohit is squared up a touch and ends up defending this back to Cummins
full, just outside off, dug out to mid-off for one

short_text: Cummins to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: even better. Totally disdainful. Length ball, outside off, but de Kock shows no regard. He slogs this over midwicket for four more

short_text: Cummins to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: cracked away. Just short of a length, but de Kock shows no respect. Clears the front leg, hits on the up, and clears wide mid-on easily
looks for the ramp, but Krishna goes wide at it and concedes just the single to square leg

short_text: Prasidh to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: he is not getting it right. Short, angling away to give him the width, and he is cut in front of backward point for four
short of a length, around off, worked to leg for one

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: in the air, catchable high, but pierces the gap between point and cover-point. Wide length ball, swinging away, but he throws his bat at it

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: they are feeding his pull again? After bowling a lovely outswinger, Krishna goes short, and he is not quick enough to bother Sharma, who goes over square leg. Yorks the boundary

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: lovely outswinger first up. Dipping, on a length, just outside off, moving away late. Just doesn't get the edge

short_text: Cummins to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, 136ks, around off, pushed to point

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: straying into the pads again, lucky to get away with just the one leg-bye

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, defended

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: nicely played. On a length, just around middle, but Rohit does really well to get inside the line and glances him fine of short fine leg

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fuller, just outside off, holding its line. Defended

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, 4 leg byes
long_text: short of a length, tight line, but it nips back in going too far down leg for four leg-byes
quick, into the pads, nudged fine of short fine

short_text: Green to de Kock, no run
long_text: fuller, middle and leg, defended to midwicket

short_text: Green to de Kock, no run
long_text: again that slight swing , back into the left-hand bat. Defended to leg
again that slight swing away from the right-hand batsman. On a length. Worked to leg for one

short_text: Green to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fuller this time, and Sharma is forced to defend

short_text: Green to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: starts with an arm ball, which leaves the batsman after pitching, but Rohit late-cuts it between point and cover-point
excellent finish from Morgan. Coulter-Nile gives him length at 134ks, and Morgan says thank you very much, good sir. Lofts him straight back over his head and into the sight screen
misses the yorker by inches, and Morgan shovels this straight of long-on for two

nails the wide yorker after showing him the wide yorker. He digs it out towards the 30-yard circle, and comes back for two. He is gone for all money, but the throw is wayward. So no new batsman to bowl to
oh the perfect ball Morgan needs when looking to break free after playing second fiddle. On a length, in his arc, and he has lofted him over long-on for six
slower ball again, but this time shorter and straighter, Cummins bottom-edges the pull for one
crunched away. Slower length ball, outside off, he stays beside the line and punches this on the up. Neither long-off nor deep cover has a chance of cutting this off. Fifty for Cummins
full and wide, dug out to deep cover
full, angling in, pushed down the ground for one
another full toss, but this time he can't time the shot well. Just the single to deep midwicket
on-pace full toss, seems like a yorker gone wrong. Cummins shuffles across it, and shovels it square of deep midwicket for four
that de Kock drop is hurting them now. Cummins picks the slower ball early, and slogs it over the short boundary for a six over midwicket
full and straight, dug out for one

how has de Kock managed to drop this one?. BUmrah has done the job he is asked to do. A wide length-ball slower ball produces the skier that could bring MI the wicket that takes the heat off Coulter-Nile's over. But de Kock has let it slip through his big gloves
quick high full toss at 143ks, and Cummins is asking for a no-ball. I think this is just before the waist. De Kock does well to collect it as it bounces well in front of him
yorker, 145ks, middle and off, dug out for a single to extra cover
on-pace bouncer, Cummins keeps the pull down, gets a single
slower ball, full, hit hard to long-off for one
low full toss, Morgan makes room and drives it back at Bumrah, who sticks his left foot out and the deflection towards midwicket allows them a second
pinpoint yorker, on leg stump, dipping on him. Cummins can inly dig it out back to Boult
slower bouncer, Cummins has shuffled across and leaves it alone. Good height. Won't be called a wide
that is a reply. Gets stuck into this short-of-a-length delivery. Bowled on-pace, and he goes back to pull this through deep midwicket
Cummins lucky to survive this one. He shuffles across early, Boult goes behind him with a yorker, but it misses the leg stump by inches
slower one this time, but it allows Morgan time to go deep into the crease and cut, but Kishan saves three runs with his dive at point
on a length, on-pace, and Morgan accepts the rare boundary opportunity. Opens the face and goes over point for four
you'd think you have had four slower balls and now Bumrah will bowl with pace on, but guess what, he won't. Cummins early into the pull. Excellent over
slower bouncer, offcutter, beats Cummins's attempt at the ramp
another slower ball, 124ks, but Cummins times it well and makes long-off work to his right to keep this in
looks to pull, makes a decent connection, but can't beat midwicket
slower ball again, but this time at 125ks, on a length, outside off, he has to check his shot. Just the single to mid-off
massive slower ball, 108ks, dipping full toss, outside off. Does him in completely
full, nearly a yorker, just outside off, dug out for a dot
short of a length, no pace or room to work with. Just the single to deep cover
lovely shot. Pandya bowls length outside off, and he chips him inside-out, gets a couple wide of long-off
slightly back of a length, uses soft hands to place this wide of midwicket and comes back for two
on a length, middle and leg, pushed straight to short midwicket
quick length ball, punched to wide long-on
wrong'un, seems to have picked it, and defended this with an open face
legbreak, on a length, Cummins goes back, opens the face, and places this square of deep cover for two
quick legbreak, hits his pad, but is headed down leg. Leg-bye accrues
full, into the pads, played against the turn, gets a single past midwicket
wide legbreak, he goes after it, and the mis-hit clears extra cover easily
short of a length, around off, punched down to long-on
excellent batting. The impetus that they need. Short of a length, just outside off, and he loves the drop in pace. Doesn't matter the length, he goes inside-out, and clears mid-off easily

Cummins is loving the bowling of Australia team-mate. He is ready for the short ball, which is not as sharp as Bumrah bowling one, and pulls it into the rope in front of deep square. Small six but six nonetheless
short of a length, 137ks, on top of off, defended
makes room and drives with an open face, gets a single to deep third man
runs this behind square for one
whoa that is a shot and a half. Length ball, 134ks, outside off, opens up the front leg slightly, and drives it on the up and between mid-off and extra cover
quick legbreak, around off, and then holds its line to cramp him up on the punch. Another dot
short of a length, sits in the surface, pushed down to long-on for one
full, slow, just outside off, driven to long-off
wrong'un, starts just outside off, then goes wider. Morgan only toe-ends it to cover
overpitched again, driven down to long-off this time
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
short of a length, pushed past Bumrah's right hand for a sharp single
bouncer again, loopy one, down the leg side, called wide
on a length, shaping in, defended back to him

just like that, another bowling change and plan has been executed perfectly. Russell has been backing away to open up the off side, but Bumrah now gives him a sharp bouncer. He has nowhere to go, and looks to duck out of the way. The ball, though, follows his bat and lobs up for an easy catch. Just too good from Bumrah
Russell backs away again, but this is slightly fuller and slightly straighter, so attacking his stumps more. Russell defends respecfully

the quicker they come, the quicker they go. This is an incredible shot. Nothing wrong with what Bumrah has delivered. Short of a length, angling in, on top of off, but Russell has made room and crunched this through point
short of a length, 142ks, nips back in, hits him on the thigh pad
legbreak, middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket for one
picks the googly this time, gets inside the line early, is waiting for the turn, and then laps it fine for four. Nobody behind square on the leg side
fuller, but short of driving length, slow in the air, pushed with an open face
looks to lap him around the corner, but has clearly not picked the wrong'un and is hit on the pad
length ball, outside off, stays back to push this back to him
overpitches, Morgan likes it, drives it with an open face. The man at extra cover gets a hand to it
short of a length, around off, pushed to the straight extra cover

Pandya overpitches slightly, gets into Russell's zone, and he slog-sweep this over midwicket. Efficient batting so far. Respect to good balls, but no respect to the scoreboard if he slips into Russell's arc
stays away from Russell's swinging arc. Just short of that length. Defended back
looks for the lap, Pandya takes his line wide, Morgan gets bat on it, but can't place it fine of the deep fielder behind square
on a length, no room, pushed back to Pandya
into the pads, on a length, worked away for one
wrong'un or a slider? Whatever it is, it beats Morgan outside off as it keeps going on with the angle
Chahar bowls a teasing legbreak, but just too full, and is driven to extra cover

back-to-back. Kathik has played on a spinner again. And once again it is a wide legbreak. Last game it was Chahal, this game it is Chahar. One leggie learning from the other? Slow and wide, Karthik looks to lap it regardless, and only ends up showing the ball the way to his own wicket

Gill takes a risk after playing 22 balls for 21 runs, and holes out. Chahar is not giving him the swinging length, but the strike-rate pressure on Gill shows as he goes for this regardless. Looks to hit a six over long-on, but because he is not close to the pitch of the ball, he gets no power in this. Pollard takes an easy catch at long-on
a touch too straight, placed wide of deep square, and they come back for two
short of a length, around off, punched away straight to extra cover
lovely placement. He has got a short ball, and he has not looked to pull this for a six. He just rocks back and pulls this in front of deep square and square of deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
Karthik backs away again, and Pandya follows him again. Off the pad this rolls to short third man
looks to make room, the wily Pandya follows him, cramps him up, and draws another dot
down the leg side, but it seems to have hit the pad on the way through
length ball, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
wide on the crease, stays short of a length, defended back to him
short of a length again, around off, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, around off, hits the splice of the bat as he defends

good comeback from Coulter-Nile. The short-ball plan gets Rana again. Almost as if you can add an extra "i" to his name. He did play this one like the more illustrious Raina does. Looks to get inside the line of this bounce to try to help it along to fine leg but all he manages to do is, glove it through to de Kock
makes room to cut this, but NCN has a deep cover in place to keep them to one
listened to you, dear reader. To be fair, NCN has provided him a plum half-volley, and he has just put it over mid-on for four
already signs the ball is topping. Rana looks to work this to leg but ends up getting a soft leading edge back to the bowler
worked wide of mid-on this time
the shot of a man batting on 11 off 14 inside a Powerplay. Skips down the track with nowhere to go as Pandya pulls the length back. Bounces just short of mid-on
uppishly hit wide of Pandya for a single down to long-on
length ball angled across him, left alone
slight turn, full, middle and off, pushed to long-off for one
low full toss on the toes. What else can a new batsman ask for? Seems like a yorker gone wrong, but Rana is not complaining. Clipped away through midwicket
quick length ball, 139ks, slight swing away. Left alone
missed run-out. Another risky single to mid-on, Gill is gone despite the dive, but Kishan's throw misses
angling in too far, clipped away towards deep midwicket for two
slightly fuller, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
length ball, outside off, hits the bat high as he defends

short, wide again, and Tripathi fails to keep the cut down. However, this has come right out of the screws, but it can't go past Surya Kumar Yadav at point. Smart catch, high to his left. Even Boult is impressed
short, well outside off, but Tripathi pulls this away wide of mid-on. Keeps it down. Makes sure he doesn't go to deep cover, which will get him just the single
short of a length, outside off, and that man at deep cover doesn't have to move an inch
short of a length, rib-high, short-arm pull. Gets a single to long leg
short of a length, outside leg, headed towards middle. Tucked away to square leg
Tripathi gets the width he wants, and swings at this. The ball, though, pitches and seams away to beat his drive
short of a length, straight, pushed back to him
slightly fuller, straighter, pushed towards mid-on for a risky single. This time Kishan misfields, allowing them to make it easily
on a length, headed for top of off, draws the respect it deserves
one more wide down the leg side. NCN not happy with himself
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover
full and straight, pushed wide of mid-on, and Bumrah's dive there is sloppy. Not sure if he has got a bad bounce. Gone for four
another wide down the leg side
looking for more swing, but ends up sliding it down leg
starts with an outswinger, 135ks, on a length, just outside off. Left alone
short of a length, just outside off, uses soft hands to take a single left of cover
some seam movement from just back of a length. Leaves him. Defended back to him
on a length, swinging back in towards off, punched to mid-off
excellent bouncer, 133ks, rising sharply, just outside off. Left alone. De Kock makes a one-handed take overhead. Called wide
full and straight, looking for swing, Gill looks to play to mid-on, gets a leading edge to mid-off
swing there. Tripathi plays late because of it, and Rohit Sharma misfields at short midwicket to let him get off strike
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face

just clears long-on! Just past long-on's outstretched right hand. Chahal tosses it up slow like he has all over, but this one is fuller. So Pooran steps out and meets it as a full toss. It comes off the toe-end and Morris is stretching to his right at long-on but it's past him

run-out! Gayle is walking off! Oh KXIP, how, time and again, do you make it so complex for yourselves? This is lovely bowling from Chahal, offering no pace on it and landing it short of a length outside off. Rahul punches it to cover and takes off instinctively. Gayle is not the man to complete that single at this point in his career. It's a clean pick up, it's a one-bounce throw, and it's a new batsman on strike for the last ball
just short of catching point! Slow, short of a length and turning away outside off. Cut on the bounce to the fielder lunging forward

lovely work from Padikka; at deep midwicket. This one is tossed up wide too and Gayle reaches and lofts the sweep. Padikkal has an awkward bounce to his right after running across and he does supernly to pat it in on the half-volley with one hand
loopy legbreak foxes Gayle. Whew that spun in a long way, tossed up wide and at a length and he left that alone
good length and turning into leg stump, pulled on the bounce to midwicket
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
yorker outside off, jammed into the off side
full outside off, driven to extra cover
full and into the pads, can't get bat on the attempted flick
full slower ball outisde off, hangs back and lofts this to long-on's left
slower short ball, very wide outside off. Left alone
yorker outside off, beaten on the attempted chop
full slower ball, dipping outside off. Jammed into the covers
good length and just outside off, chopped to backward point
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
yorker honing in at middle stump, jammed back down the pitch
good length outside off, mistimed slog along the ground to deep midwicket
full and down leg side, left alone
slower short ball at middle stump, beaten on the pull as he's through it too soon
full and curving away outside off. Beaten on the cover drive

short of a length and turning away outside off, waits on it and punches to long-off to bring up his fifty. Holds a pose for the cameras, points to the sticker on the bat that says The Boss. And then points to the name on the back of the shirt
short and down leg side, cops the pull on his thigh
good length and gripping outside off. Waits on it and hammers to long-on's right
lifted over long-on again. Some Chinnaswamy flashbacks? Short of a length arm ball hurries him on the back foot. It's a short-arm pull and it's far enough behind that fielder
good length, tossed up wide outside off and turning away. Left alone
pulled wayyyy over long-on. Short and up at middle stump, hangs back in the crease and gets a clean swinging arc at this. Muscles it off the back foot
low full toss squeezed out to deep backward square with a slog
full and just outside off, driven to sweeper cover
helps it over the roof. Short ball up at hip height, on middle stump. Head right on top of that from KL Rahul as he pulls from under it and sends it a long way
yorker at off stump, forced to jam that down to long-off
launched over extra cover! Goes with the angle this time and nails the connection. Good length and angled away from the corridor, front leg out, reaches out, slapped on the rise
good length and just outside off, he swings against the angle across him and manages to get it over the bowler. Mid-off is in and long-on can't get it
short of a length and wide outside off. Deliberately pushed away with the angle, beaten on the swish
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
beaten on the slog again. Short of a length and across the corridor, looks to cart that in midwicket's direction on the rise
good length at middle stump, defended to extra cover
slower short ball into leg stump, backs away and cuts to point's right
just short of long-on. Good length at middle stump, looks to slug that wide of long-on but it came off the toe-end
beaten. Good length ball sliding across the corridor. Front leg into the leg side and a big slog at that
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
good length and in at middle stump, allows it on and pushes into the leg side to bring up another fifty this season
full and into the pads, pushed straight to midwicket and he steals a run
overpitched just outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover

that is plumb if there's no bat on it. Oddly enough though, it's Gayle who asks Rahul if there was bat on it. And then he reviews. How would the non-striker know? But the review might be a good one anyway there's a spike on Ultra Edge as ball goes past bat. It was a yorker that pinned him on the back toe in front of middle. He survives
good length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper's left

walks into the leg side and swipes him over deep square. Took some steps early and made Washington think. It's a full ball at middle stump, nice angle towards the leg side too and Gayle goes down on a knee and lofts this
short at middle, shoveled out to deep backward square
good length and slanted in at middle. Punched to long-on
gets one full and uses it. Sundar errs in length for the first time tonight and this is slugged over his head. Just short of a driving length and Gayle uses his reach and goes straight
short at leg stump, pulled to deep backward square
good length outside off, dragged off the low part to long-on
and again! Sower ball this time, at a good length outside off and once again he clears the front leg and swings across the line. This one is straighter, more wide long-on than midwicket
out of the stadium! Good length and just outside off. Angled into him. He gets the front leg in the leg side and slogs across the line for a sweet connection. Over the roof at midwicket
full and wide outside off, lunges at that and throws the bat out. Loses his footing and nearly falls over. Inside edge into the square leg region
good length and into the pads. Swiped on the bounce to fine leg
good length ball jumps up in the corridor as he shapes for the cut. Forced to poke it into the covers
full and just outside off, front leg into the leg side and a mistimed slog down to long-on
good length and into middle stump, pushed to long-on with the angle
short of a length at leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, pushed through cover off the front foot
full and into middle stump, defended down the pitch
beaten on the inside edge. Short of a length and sliding into the corridor. He was cutting for the one that turns
good length on middle, deep in the crease and nudges to midwicket's right
short and just outside off, defended to backward point
good length and just outside off, opens the face and drops this to backward point's left
good length onto leg stump, looks for the glance and cops this on the pad
good length and just outside off, defended to backward point
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a good length at the thigh, can't get the glance away
good length and holding in the pitch outside off. Upright drive, thick edge to short third man's left
dropped short and down leg side. Firmly pulled, but on the bounce to deep square
short and quick at leg stump. Shuffles and looks to ramp it fine, but can't get bat on it
good length outside off, one-handed slice through the covers on the front foot
good length and at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short and into leg stump. Swiped to deep backward square's right

loses his shape this time! And gets a wave goodbye from the bowler, who wins the battle. Lovely bowling. Tosses another one up, gets it to dip at leg stump, and Mayank goes across the line. He's cramped himself for such a shot because the front leg is not out of the way. Hits the top of middle

drilled over the bowler. Lovely shape on that. It's been all balance from him tonight. This is tossed up at middle stump, gets a stride out to meet it on the pitch and holds his position to lift this straight
full on off stump, driven out to sweeper cover
googly, good length and into leg stump. Nudged to deep midwicket's right off the back foot
good length and dipping on off stump. Leans in and pushes to point's right with the turn
good length and down the pitch, beaten on the attempted glance. and AB is beaten too. Short third and short fine both sprint back for this. The former drags it back in
good length and slowed down at middle stump. Looks for the flick as that turns away but can only get it back down the pitch
short and just outside off, on the front foot and under this as he looks to pull. Top edge falls short of fine leg
sliced over point. Good length and just outside off. Got his front leg into the leg  side and opens the face at it. Not sure if he wanted it there, looked like was an attempt to go over extra cover
short ball up at off stump, too eager to get the pull away and gets the cue-end on this into the off side. Disappointed with himself, midwicket was in
full and just outside off, flowing drive straight to extra cover where Kohli fumbles
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
good length and into leg stump, gets down on a knee and whips this over midwicket. Long-on and deep square converge on that and combine
full toss at leg stump, patted out to mid-on
lofted over wide long-on! Agarwal waits on the slower ball and lofts it into the leg side. Held his balance. It's a dipping wristspinner at middle stump and he got his weight into it
full slower ball down leg side. Looks to sweep that and is down on a knee, but that's off the thigh guard and AB slides to his left to stop
good length slower ball at middle stump, clips this to midwicket's right
full slower ball on off stump, check-punch off the front foot to mid-off
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover on the rise
lovely batting. More pristine striking from Mayank. This is full and just outside off, half a stride out and the perfect connection with the full face offered to get this over Saini
short and just outside off, mistimed cut into the pitch. Another direct hit at the non-striker's end

direct hit at the non-striker's end as Mayank stretches. Good length and just outside off, a crisp punch on the rise to Udana's left at mid-off. He picks up cleanly and swivels to hit the stumps but the bat is grounded
short of a length and in at middle stump. Opens up his stance to try and drop this into the off side for a single, but he's timed it too well
good length and at off stump. Punched into the covers, everyone is back on the circle there

a casual swipe over midwicket. Good length and just outside off, but with the angle into him. Half a stride out and a still head as he goes across the line. Looks like it lands full on the boundary padding

and again. Lovely batting, this. Full ball tossed up outside off, stride out to meet that one on the pitch and goes inside-out again with the turn. Wide of long-off once more, and over the line after a bounce
dropped short at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and brings out the short-arm pull to deep midwicket's right
short and just outside off, under-edge on the cut to point

oh that is graceful. Good length and dipping on him outside off, also turning away. But he's waited on that with half a stride and gone with the turn, on the up and to long-off's right. All hands, that
full and into the pads, gets forward and flicks to square leg's left
full and into the pad. Looks to flick and walks into that, pad first. That slid on off the pitch
slower short ball at off stump. Backs away, makes room and looks to clear the off side infield. Gets an inside edge to short fine's right
lifted to deep square leg's right. Short and up at the chest. Nicely in position for the pull this time and into the ad board
short ahd down leg side, 143kph and past his attempted hook
good length and into the body. Nudges it towards mid-on where Siraj is too eager on the throw and misfields
full slower ball at middle stump. Checks himself as he looks to flick. Trickles to midwicket's right
good length and into the pads, uses the angle and flicks to deep square's left
good length and down leg side, misses out on the flick
short and just outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, punched to extra cover on the rise
short of a good length and just outside off. Punched forcefully off the back foot but can't get it past backward point to his right
short of a good length and just outside off, looks for the cut, gets an inside edge towards the keeper
good length and onto the pads. Stays tall and uses the angle to shovel that fine
good length and into the stumps, tucked off the front foot to midwicket
beaten on the outside edge. Goes wide of the crease and gets this to straighten past the outside edge as he's rooted to the back foot
good length and into leg stump, pushed to midwicket
short and wide outside off, has a slash and is beaten
good length and shaping away, wide outside off, slashed down to third man
full inswinger at leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
good length and some shape away outside off. Pushed into the covers off the under-edge
lifted over deep square! Full toss angled into leg stump, allows that on and helps it over that fielder. Off the low part of the inside half, but it's good enough

launched over long-off! This is poor bowling from Shami, the plans are all over the place. This is a good length ball, a slower one, just outside off. Morris walks into the leg side and drills this flat
low full toss outside off, sliced to extra cover's left and past his dive
oh that sounded so sweet! Whew! A bouner up at the throat and following him down leg side. He has nailed this pull. Flies over deep midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked on the bounce to deep square
scooped over short fine. Savvy batting from Morris. It's a yorker at middle stump, he drops his right shoulder and steps into the off side to make room and nails the connection
full outside off, mistimed slog to long-on
full and wide outside off as Morris is walking way down into the leg side. Was too far down to get a bat on this
caressed over the point boundary. Slower short ball, wide outside off. Waits on that and opens the face at the right moment to loft this
full and into leg stump, mistimed slog down to long-on
short of a length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
short of a length and following him down leg side. He pushes it aerially towards extra cover
short ball just outside off, clears the front leg and looks to pull. Thick inside edge to deep square

Rahul lunges to his right to take this and Kohli's gone. Slower bouncer down leg side. He looks for the hook into the turf. Is through it early and that pings off the glove and to Rahul's right. Taken comfortably and Shami has AB and Kohli in the same over. Looked like a knuckle ball
full at off stump, steps out and punches to long-off

taken at extra cover. Full and just outside off. Wants to loft this over mid-off. Ends up getting that off the toe-end with the bat turning in his hands. And it's an easy take for the backpedaling Hooda
beaten on the pull. Slower ball, short of a good length and wide outside off. Slides through from under the shot
good length outside off, mistimed slog to long-on's right
good length at off stump, watchfully nudged to extra cover's left
inside edge as he looks for the slog sweep. Googly tossed up wide outside off, and he's through the shot too soon
googly, short of a length and turning into leg stump. Punched to long-on
short of a good length, just outside off. Punched firmly back at the bowler off the back foot
good length and loopy at off stump. Spins away as Kohli looks to drive that. Into the covers off the thick edge
full and tossed up wide outside off. Mistimed drive out to sweeper as he reaches out

taken by Rahul in the short fine leg region. Jordan has his first wicket of the season. Bouncer up at his left shoulder. Swipes from under it and takes his eyes off the ball. Ends up slicing it. Rahul with a short sprint to the right to take that. Jordan punches the air and breathes a sigh of relief. It's been a difficult tournament for him until tonight
full and into the pads, looks for the whip behind square again and cops that on the pad
legcutter, good length and down leg side. Beaten on the whip
short of a length at middle, mistimed pull to long-on
slower yorker at leg stump, flicked into his toes and a single pitch side on the off side
short of a good length and wide outside off, throws the bat at it and ends up slicing it again. To sweeper's right
just short of mid-off. Good length ball outside off, looks to slap it over mid-off but that's sliced. Maxwell grabs it on the half volley and nearly runs Kohli out. Direct hit and that was out
full and dipping at middle stump. Mistimed drive to deep midwicket's right
short of a good length, sliding onto the corridor. Mistimed chop into the covers
good length outside off, jabbed to backward point
good length and down leg side, can't gather that cleanly, the keeper

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Dubey, SIX runs
long_text: muscled over deep midwicket! Presumably this is what the left-hander was sent out to do, take on the leggie. It's another googly. Good length and at middle stump. A clean slog sweep, and effortless to get that 76 metres in midwicket's direction

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Dubey, SIX runs
long_text: that's out of the stadium. Googly, short and at middle stump. Jumps onto the back foot and pulls it over long-on
good length and in at leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
full and honing in at leg stump. Steps out and yorks himself. Forced to jab that into the covers
short of a length outside off, gets the front leg away and chops this to sweeper
good length and in at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short and just outside off, punched to point's right
good length and cramping him at leg stump. Pushed to long-on off the back foot
short and down leg side, can't get bat on the glance
good length otuside off, steps out and punches to sweeper

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Dubey, no run
long_text: beaten by a googly. Wants a wide for that. Good length and outside off, grips and spins away from his cut
good length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Kohli, no run
long_text: lovely work at extra cover from Agarwal. Lunges low to his left to look for the catch off this aerial drive, but it's short of him. But recovers immediately and has Kohli scrambling back
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Dubey, no run
long_text: good length and pushed across off stump. Patted to midwicket off the back foot
good length and sliding into leg stump. Clipped to deep square off the back foot
good length on leg stump, steps out and drives to long-on
good length and in at middle stump, whipped to deep square off the toe-end
good length and into leg stump, allows it on and jabs it to deep backward square's leg
full on leg stump, looks for the flick and cops it on the pad
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
full and into leg stump, gets forward and flicks to long-on
googly, short of a length and away from middle, clipped through midwicket off the back foot
beaten by a googly he hasn't picked. Good length outside off, ripping away and past his attempted poke
googly, full outside off, driven to long-on's left

taken at long-on. That's the end of the Washington experiment. A googly, landed at leg stump on a good length. He was looking for the slog sweep, a no-look slog sweep. Ended up slicing it high and Jordan took that safely with a few strides to his left
full outside off, driven a bit too well to long-off's left this time to steal a second
full outside off, big stride out to drive to long-off's left
good length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on's right
good length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler with the turn
short and fired down leg side. Sundar loses his footing trying to reach this but it works. Swished fine using only his right hand
good length on off, punched to long-on off the back foot
full and into leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
good length and across off stump. Punched to sweeper's right off the front foot
full and into off stump, driven down to long-on
googly, short of a length and turning away from middle. Closes the face and glances to deep square's left
good length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
full and wide outside off, loses his shape on the expansive drive, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper's right
good length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, driven to long-off
drops short of Maxwell. Good length on off stump, chips the back foot punch down the pitch as that grips
short of a length at off stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full and into leg stump, leans in and flicks to long-on's left. Kohli is back for the second with ease
googly, short of a length and turning away outside off. Cut to sweeper's right
good length and tight at middle stump, defended off the back foot
googly, short of a length and outside off. Cut to backward point

bowls him with another beauty. Finch caught on the back foot again as Ashwin lands this quick legbreak on middle stump. This time the bat's facing long-on and the ball's past the outside edge to knock off stump
dropped. Good length and turning away from the corridor. Looks for the cut and gets a thick edge that brushes Rahul's gloves. Gayle is too wide at slip to get a hand on it
short and outside off, cut to sweeper's left

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, no run
long_text: short of a length and angled into middle stump. Backs away and cuts to point
good length and coming on with the angle at leg stump. Gets forward and flicks to short fine's left
tossed up full and wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped short and into leg stump. Allows it on and pulls into the ground, and to square leg's right with the angle

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, 1 leg bye
long_text: full and into leg stump, steps out and can't get bat on it. Slides onto his pad
good length and in at middle stump, punched to mid-on's right

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Kohli, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump, nicely forward to tap this to extra cover's right
slower ball at a length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket's right with soft hands

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: good length on leg stump, allows that on and flicks to deep square's right. Hooda slides to his right and gets in a tangle after getting behind it. As he looks to get up, one leg is in contact with the padding as the other gets the ball bouncing onto the ankle

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: punched past extra cover. Good length and just outside off. Gets the weight onto the front foot and check-punches it to Pooran's right
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper's left
full slower ball just outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot

straight to short extra. Another punch at a ball that stops on him. This one is good length and outside off. He checks the attempted drive and can't do enough to stop this floating straight out at Pooran
good length at middle stump, punches with hard hands and it ends up a chip to mid-off's left
pick-up shot to deep square's right. Overpitched on leg stump, a deliberate aerial flick. It's not too far to the fielder's right, just a few metres, but it was away from him quickly
short-arm pull to the square leg's right. Walks into this short ball and has to be quick with his hands. as it cramps him at the chest
short and up at the ribs.A bit too quick onto him as he swivels for the pull. Gets it out to deep square
good length and in at middle stump, walks down the track and flicks to deep square
good length and across middle stump. Closes the face to pat this to mid-on
yorker at the toes, flicked out to deep square
full and down leg side, can't get the flick away

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: lifted over short fine. Good length and climbing into leg stump. Stays tall and flicks from under it
good length and into the pads, allows it on and flicks to deep square's right
good length and just outside off, pushes it into the covers with soft hands to steal a run from Pooran who fumbles

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Finch, no run
Arshdeep Singh to Finch, no run
long_text: thick outside edge. A slower ball to start. Full and just outside off. Reaches out at it with hard hands. Once bounce and into a tumbling Gayle's hands
good length and into leg stump, hurriedly nudged off the inside edge to square leg's right

chipped straight. Still walking down, is Finch, possibly to cut out the inswingers. This one is just short of a good length and climbing in from outside off. He offers the full face and gets the over his partner off the inside half
short ball and ends up down leg side. Finch walks down at him again and is forced to leave this
good length and just outside off, jumps into line and flicks to midwicket's right

through him and past the keeper. Short of a good length, jagging back sharply off the seam. Finch walked down at it and was well beaten on the inside edge. But that kept dipping away and away from Rahul's left-handed reach
good length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
swiped over the long leg boundary. Good length ball at leg stump, gets low on it and clears the infield. On this ground, you only clear the infield at a decent height to get six
good length outside leg stump, steps out and looks for the flick. Cops it on the pad
good length and onto the pads. Flicked to square leg's right
tossed up full and wide outside off, some turn away. Pushed into the covers on the front foot
good length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, clipped through vacant midwicket
slower short ball, and Deshpande has his second wicket with an attempted ramp going nowhere
full and wide, swings hard, and edges it over short third man for four
there won't we a tie. Full ball, Tewatia looks to hit this to leg, and skies vertically. Deshpande is ambling towards the catch and runs into Gopal. Misses on a wicket but he has sealed the game
low full toss, nearly a yorker. Dug out. Can't do much better
yorker, dug out, back to Tewatia

this is awful cricket from Shreyas Gopal. Deshpande bowls slow, and he bowls wide, and Tewatia goes after it. This is a mis-hit but it is travelling, and Rahane catches it running back but he knows he is not going to be able to stay in so he throws it back in. Tewatia is absolutely filthy with Gopal for not running back
slower ball, full and wide, Tewatia stands his ground and takes the wide
short ball, pulled wide of long-on, but he turns down the second. He wants strike for the last over
yorker to Gopal. Just the single to mid-off

Rabada has delivered what Dhawan asked for. This is nearly a yorker. Quick one. And even though it is not a yorker, there is still not enough room to get under. All he manages to do is scoop it out to point
Archer gets the length ball to swing at, but Rabada is quick, at 148ks, and it bounces over his big swing
slower short ball, wide outside off, 123ks, and it squeezes under his big pull to leg
makes room, Rabada goes for the off stumps. Tewatia gets bat to this low full toss for a single to long-off
low full toss, signs off with another 151.6ks delivery, pushed wide of mid-off but not wide enough to get more than one
slower offcutter outside off, Tewatia looks for the sweep and is beaten
he gets length, but it gets big on him as he swings. The mis-hit brings him one to long-on
lovely bowling. A yorker at the base of middle and leg stump at 149.7ks. After trying the ramp, Uthappa charges at Nortje, and he spears in this massive yorker. This is just too good for Uthappa

Nortje goes for a length ball, Tewatia swipes across it, gets a massive top edge towards third man. Rabada is kept fine there but he can't get to it. And for the second time tonight, he recovers well after having been done in by the spin
he tries the ramp like Buttler did earlier, but Nortje bowls the slower offcutter at 128ks. They take the bye as the ball bounces in front of Carey and he can't make a clean connection
slower short ball, Tewatis picks it, he pulls it in front of square, but he finds the man at midwicket. He hits his bat with his glove because he knows he has missed out here

that will ease some nerves. Cheeky, and perfectly executed. Rabada continues with the plan of bowling short and at the body of his former DC team-mate. This time he arches his back and ramps him over the wicketkeeper's head
sets himself up for the pull again, but this is the slower short ball. Gets an inside edge into his body. Just the single
quicker short ball, a touch late into it, but manages to clear midwicket in the circle
short ball, Uthappa looks to pull, but this is a slower legcutter at 127ks, and the leading edge lobs wide of him. Rabada dives full length but can't get to it
short, chest-high, no room, he dabs it down for a single to point
quicker, flatter, this time he has placed it wide of point for a single
really slow this time, stump to stump, defended with an open face. Uthappa refuses the single
quick length ball outside off, he plays with an open face to point
flat, quick, short of a length, defended back to him
really slow, but not full enough. Tewatia defends
carrom ball, he sees it off the pitch and opens the face to get a single to deep point
slower ball, wide, on a length, slogged to deep midwicket for one
short again, quick too, pulled down this time. Happy with the single
on a length, 140ks, angling in, uppishly driven for a single to long-on
driven in front of deep cover

Nortje has dropped it. What a chance this is. This is actually a good ball to bowl to Tewatia because he likes to help it along with the pull. So you have the fine leg back and bowl into his underarm. Tewatia offers the catch, but Nortje can't hold on. Quite a regulation catch
wide length ball, times the drive well, gets a single to deep cover
wide down the leg side as he goes wide on the crease and angles it too far
slower again, worked to leg for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, FOUR runs
long_text: Uthappa takes the big risk. The reverse-sweep after four dots and a run-out. This is a quick length ball, and he can use the pace to clear short third man

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, no run
long_text: slow through the air, just outside off, defended back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, no run
long_text: quick, on a length, outside off, pushed to cover-point. They don't run off the msifield
