Parag is run out. Really slow in the air, Uthappa looks to work this to leg, but because there is on pace to work with, he doesn't get the ball wide enough of Patel. Uthappa charges down the wicket, and then sends Parag back. He has nowhere to go. He can only wish Patel misses, but he takes his time, steadies his aim, and goes for the base of the middle stump

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, no run
long_text: quick length ball, 95ks, pushed to cover
on a length, 151.4ks, just outside off. Defended solidly
full, on off, pushed down to long-on for one
pace is your friend, pace is your enemy. Especially when defending small totals. Quick bouncer, Uthappa late into it, gets a top edge, but it sails comfortably over fine leg
full, tailing in, 149.4ks, dug out to short midwicket
even Rahane can't do anything about this one. Short and wide from Nortje, and he has cut it away in front of point
short of a length, wide, punched square, and Rahane dives at point to save at least one, possibly even four runs
leading edge, uppish, but wide of the diving Patel
length ball, outside off, punched to long-off for one
massive wicket. Axar Patel hits back. Lovely arm ball, quick, 97ks, Samson looks to make room but the ball slides on hit the middle stump. Samson is left anguished as he walks back
full, outside off, pushed slightly wide of cover, and Samson puts in a dive to make it

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, no run
long_text: on a length, slight turn from just outside off, played straight to cover-point
flat, into the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
and he walks down the wicket to this free hit and gets an inside edge past short fine leg for four
no-ball so a free hit next ball. I did mention before the start of the match that he has a reputation for bowling no-balls in Ranji Trophy
run down to third man for one

appeal for obstructing the field. The third umpire wants to know if Uthappa has "seen the throw and changed his direction". This is pushed down the ground, Deshpnade gets a hand to it, which is why Samson sends him back. Uthappa runs between the throw from mid-on and the wicket, but he has not changed his direction to come in the way of the ball. But he has changed his direction beforehand to come in the way of where the direct hit will travel. Cheeky, and not-out
bouncer first up, 141ks, but it is too high and is called a wide
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one

Deshpande holds his own against a batsman intent on dominating. Stokes jumps out of the crease, and he bowls a slower one at 121ks. He is way early into the shot, and ends up holing out to long-on. Deshpande is over the moon
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man
shuffles across to punch this wide offbreak, but straight to short extra cover
really slow in the air, 81ks, clipped off the toes for one
the second less-than-100% hit to deep midwicket this over. Again first bounce to the fielder. This is pulled away
quick arm ball, Stokes is cramped on the punch, but he does well to keep this out
offbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
slog-sweep to the left of deep midwicket, Rabada is running full pelt, and then the ball spins to his right. Rabada does to brake and stick his right hand to field

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: like the London buses, sixes arriving in a bunch for Axar Patel. By pumping him down the ground last over, Samson has now shortened his length and rocks deep into his crease to pull this over midwicket for another massive six
driven to deep cover for one
flat, on a length, into the pads, punched down to long-on
full, outside off, driven to deep cover for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Stokes, FOUR runs
long_text: quick length ball, but Stokes still plays the reverse ramp, and gets enough timing on it to clear short third man
quick, flat, Samson is expecting it. Rocks back to pull it to deep midwicket
carrom ball? Bowled at 91ks, looks like slipping down leg, turns back towards the stumps, takes an inside edge for a single to short fine leg
drifting into the pads, worked to deep square for one
Samson shuffles across early, Ashwin slips in a quick ball down leg. He gets the bat down in time. Single to short fine
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
misses the line, short of a length, well down leg, and he goes on a knee to help him over short fine for four
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, bottom edge on the attempted cut
quick, into the pads, worked to leg for one
goes back to punch this flat delivery to extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: nothing watchful about this. The first six off Axar Patel this IPL. What a lovely clean strike. Samson skips down the wicket, also makes a little room, and swings him clean over his head for a huge six

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: turn for Patel. On a length, just outside off, and Samson plays him back watchfully
on a length, wicket to wicket, worked to deep midwicket for one
big wind-up, wide length ball, hit wide of mid-off for one
short ball, this time the quicker one, and Stokes doesn't time the pull well. Straight to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, no room, but still punched to deep cover for one

slower ball, 126ks, short, on the pads, and Stokes pulls this disdainfully in front of square. The deep fielder doesn't have far to go to his right, but this is timed so well it keeps getting away from him
short of a length, outside off, mis-hits the punch outside off

Has Iyer dislocated his shoulder? No he hasn't, but he is in pain. Lovely on-the-up drive to this quick short-of-a-length ball, and Iyer makes a dive to his left at mid-off to save three runs. But he has landed awkwardly, and is in pain and is going off the field
full and straight, 153ks, get out of here. Consistent 150-plus bowling for two overs. Punched well but straight to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, 147ks, dropped to the left of cover for one
slower ball at 133ks (quicker than many quicks' on-pace ball), on a length, outside leg, off the leading edge to mid-off
Another 150-pkus delivery, Stokes shows he is good enough to time it after making room. But straight to point
full, on off, punched to mid-off. This is at 154ks

lovely bowling. Lovely cricket in these four overs. Hitting, innovation, pace and now guile. Ashwin slows this down by at least 10-12ks, and he bowls it scrambled-seam. Smith is playing for the offbreak, which it looks like, but goes straight on because of the imperfect (if you will) seam position. Leading edge results in an easy catch
short of a length, quicker, Smith backs away and is hit on the inside edge
flatter offbreak, tucked to square leg
leading edge as Ashwin bowls a slow offbreak on the pads. Gets a single
really slow offbreak, placed between midwicket and square leg
full, middle and leg, pushed wide of midwicket

bowled'im. Nortje has his own back. This is all fast and furious at 155.4ks. Nortje sticks to his (speed) guns, and keeps attacking the stumps with fast bowling. This time Buttler tries the more orthodox shot down the ground, and is beaten by the seam movement to lose his middle stump. Don't hear a pundit criticising him for playing orthodox shot when the unorthodox ones were bringing him the results. That is how they sound when they criticise innovation
and he has done it again. Backs away, then shuffles across, this is bowled at 156ks, but he takes it from outside off and ramps him fine of short fine
welcome to the Buttler clinic on T20 batting. After a six first ball, he shuffles all over the crease before getting inside the line of a full ball and ramps him up and over short fine
backs away, Nortje is quick, 152.1ks, and Stokes is hitting point when looking to go over cover. Just the single
full and straight, 152.3ks. late inswing defeats his shot. Just the leg-bye
oh what a welcome. Length ball, 148ks, no room, but he has casually and dreamily lofted him over long-on. What an exhibition these two guys are putting on
straight length ball, pushed to mid-on for one
goes full, outside off, pushed straight of mid-off for one
lovely batting. The sound off that bat. Uff. Walks at it, gives himself some room, and punches him through extra cover. This is not a bad ball really. Short of a length, not too wide
tightens the line this time, and Stokes defends in front of off
oh lovely. As good as the Dhawan punch earlier in the night. Short of a length, outside off, and he drives it on the up, past extra cover
and nearly a wicket first ball. Length ball, into the pads, 140ks, Buttler early into closing the face, but the leading edge clears Deshpande
on a length, angling in, pushed in front of square leg for one
as dreamy as Buttler's voice. Wide half-volley, and he leans into it, and push-drives it through cover. This is Rabada at 150ks
Rahane misses the run-out. Too full, dug out straight to Rahane at short cover, and he is gone for all money. Rahane has missed
again, middle and leg, angling towards off, quite quick. Defended again
corrects the line. On a length, quick, on off, defended
lovely nonchalant shot first up. Rabada bowls the rare loosener. On a length, but outside leg, and there is no deep square leg in place. Clipped away for four
big slower ball, at 99.9ks, wide outside off, and Patel is nowhere near it. Toe-ends this for a catch to short third man

short_text: Unadkat to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: on-pace to Patel, a low full toss outside off. Axar can't hit this for a six, but he manages to place this wide of long-off and times it well enough

slower ball. Smart bowling. Bowl on pace to the Indian batsman, who has faced a lot of you. Go slow to the Australian, who has hardly faced you in the past? Wide length ball, offcutter, mis-hit to long-off
full toss, on-pace, hits the high part of the bat. Just the single to long-on
full, wide and on-pace it seems. Not the cleanest of connections but gets this into the gap between long-off and deep cover
slower ball, short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover, the bigger part of the ground
short ball, a little ball of fire, quick and wide, getting big on him. Stoinis looks for the hook but goes only as far as deep midwicket
angling in, full and fast, just the leg-bye
full and straight, just short of being a yorker, whipped to leg, but straight to deep midwicket
he tries that but can't get this high full toss past point. It is a knee-high full toss
low full toss, can't get under it, just the single to long-off
high full toss, no power in the shot. Just the single to mid-off
lovely yorker outside leg, right at his heel. Just the single. No boundary in the 18th over. Excellent effort
deep in the crease, moving across, but Tyagi stays accurate with the yorker. Just the single to long-on
yorker, just outside off, placed wide of deep midwicket for two

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Stoinis, no run
long_text: Stoinis moves away early, looking to hit over, and Iyer slips a full and wide one to earn a dot
full and straight again, pushed to long-on for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Carey, no run
long_text: full, straight, pushed to cover. No run

what a comeback from Archer. He is shorter, quicker and straighter, hitting him on the arm. They take a leg-bye but I am not sure he tried to play a shot here. The umpire should have been more vigilant. He was neither playing a shot nor taking evasive action. Sort of let the ball hit him
lovely shot. Picks the short boundary and goes for it. Archer is quick and short and into the body, but Carey makes room and cuts this chest-high bouncer over point for a flat six
yorker, 147ks, outside off, dug out towards long-off for one
full, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
quicker full ball, 145ks, high full toss, punched past point. Ruled to be not high enough to be called a no-ball
slower ball, 131ks (you read it right), hit back to Archer

he might have missed out on the lbw earlier, but gets his man now. Wide on the crease, wide length ball, Iyer looks for another six down the ground, but the extra bounce means he holes out to long-off
yorker, middle and leg, he opens the front leg, digs it out for a single to fine leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Stoinis, no run
long_text: short ball, 138ks, at him, Stoinis looks for the ramp and is beaten. The third man is up, which is why Stoinis lets out a grunt on missing out on a boundary

it sounds like timber, but it is not. Iyer is moving around the crease to play with his length, but Tyagi bowls the perfect yorker on the middle stump. Iyer gets the bottom edge to survive this one. Oh hello, this has hit the toe first. So a plumb lbw not appealed for

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: short of a length, angling in, pushed straight to midwicket
wide on the crease, length ball, hit hard but gets just the single to long-on

has Stokes taken the most incredible catch?. Has he got rid of the ball in time, though? Iyer has mistimed this slog, Stokes settles himself under it at deep midwicket, but it is a little too big for him. He has to be airborne beyond the boundary to catch this, so he has very little time to get rid of it before his foot comes down. Replays show the ball is in his hand as he flicks it back in. That is a six, but a great effort in the field to even give himself a chance to catch this. Fifty for Iyer now
offcutter short ball, pulled wide of long-on, and they come back for two. Not one on-pace delivery this over
Iyer has started picking the slower ball already. He delays the shot, keeps his head down, and slogs this length ball over wide long-on
slower ball again, punched down to long-off for one. Unadkat needs to watch out that he doesn't become too predictable like Nagarkoti did the other night
slower ball, on a length, angling in, pushed to deep midwicket for one
on a length, angling in towards top of off, pushed into the covers
short of a length, into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
legbreak, on a length, starts from outside leg, punched to long-on for one
on a length, outside leg, he makes room and punches this down to long-off
big wide down the leg side as this comes out of the hand late
incredible power. The high grip and the late unfurling of the wrists and he hits this shortish ball over midwicket and wide of long-on
flatter, into the pads, punched to extra cover after making room
full, slow, middle and leg. Stoinis thinks of the big one, but reins himself in and defends this back

Iyer tries the big reverse sweep, Tewatia stays outside off, and it seems he has got a bottom edge on it. Tewatia seems to be suggesting this is leg-byes, but the replays show he has gloved it between the keeper's legs for two
full and wide, within Iyer's reach and he chips it over extra cover for four
lovely bowling. Defensive line wide outside off, but not much turn and it stays inside the wide line as he leaves it alone
fuller, legbreak, wide, cut away to point
wide length ball, some turn, punched straight to extra cover
punched uppishly to long-on. On two bounces
length-ball legbreak, punched down to long-on for one
length ball, around leg, worked against the turn to leg for one

and Dhawan perishes trying to force the pace. Looks for the reverse sweep, Iyer stays wide outside off, and the slowness and extra bouncer means he gets a top edge for an easy catch at short third man
slider, short, wide, angling away, and called a wide
on a length, around leg, pushed to midwicket for one
short of a length, pulled hard, wide of long-on, hit a little too well to think of a second

short_text: Gopal to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: he is hitting everything beautifully today. Right out of the middle of the bat as slog-sweeps this length ball over midwicket. Special innings. Showing why he worth persisting with
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-on for one. Fifty for Dhawan
short of a length, straight, punched down to long-on for one
flat, into the pads, worked to short fine leg for one

short_text: Tewatia to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: inside-out chip, just a touch too full, and he goes over extra cover. All touch

short_text: Tewatia to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: wrong'un, around off, pushed to short cover again

short_text: Tewatia to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, pushed to short cover
wide low full toss, driven with an open face, but a diving save at point denies them runs
another incredible shot. A good tight short ball, but Iyer ramps it even as he is ducking for a couple
short of a length, pulled away to deep midwicket
Dhawan is nearly run out but the overthrow allows them a single. Hit straight to short midwicket, Dhawan is sent back, but Tewatia misses with the throw
incredible shot. It id a free hit all right, but it is quite a good one. Short at him, Iyer is in no position to attack it but slaps it back over his head for four. Not even off the middle of the bat

short_text: Stokes to S Dhawan, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: beamer, seems like a slower ball gone wrong, pulled away to long leg for one
short of a length, straight, tucked away off a length
slow through the air, Iyer pushes in front of his body, gets a single
length-ball legbreak, played square on the leg side for one
quick legbreak, Dhawan places it wide of long-on with soft hands. Comes back for two
on a length, just outside off, Iyer pushes at it, is hit on the inner half of the bat
wrong'un, on a length, outside off, cut away to deep cover for one
pushed wide of Gopal for a single to long-off

short_text: Tewatia to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slow-sweep to a flat legbreak, can't get under it, hits it flat and low to the left of deep midwicket. Samson takes the risk, charges at it and dives. Doesn't make it. Concedes four. Slight misjudgement, but you can't fault him here. He saw a chance to take a wicket and committed to it. Not a moment of hesitation
pushed wide of midwicket, but not wide enough to think of a second
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to point for one
on a length, into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket for one
short of a length, wide outside off, pulled down to long-on for one
on a length, around off, punched down to long-off for one
tossed up wide, slow in the air, driven to deep cover for one
wrong'un, swept away to long leg for one
length ball, legbreak, Iyer goes back to cut it to deep cover
short of a length, Iyer has enough time to punch this, but can't beat extra cover
quick, flat legbreak, worked to deep midwicket for one
starts with a wrong'un, punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: down the wicket, beaten this time by a slower ball that squeezes under his bat

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, short of a length, well outside leg, and Dhawan loves this line, helping this along past short fine leg with a delayed pull
short of a length, quick, hits the inner half of the bat. Single to leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, 3 runs
long_text: shuffles across to look to hit this to leg. Doesn't get the right length so he pushes this towards midwicket. A misfield allows him runs

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Dhawan is hitting the ball harder than he has all IPL. He is looking in excellent touch. This is not a bad ball, but Dhawan punches it on the up, past cover, with immaculate timing
short of a length, around off, worked into the covers for one
wide on the crease, big angle down the leg side. Wide
slower ball, full and straight, worked to leg for one
Iyer shuffles across early, then makes room, gets a length ball and lofts it over mid-on. Not the cleanest of connections but enough on it to clear mid-on
big slower ball, 116ks, Dhawan slogs and is caught at mid-off. Just the one off the free hit
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of point for one

short_text: Stokes to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: cracking shot. Dhawan is in some mood today. Stokes pitches short, and wide, and Dhawan is on the front foot and cuts in well in front of point

short_text: Stokes to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, driven on the up, but hit too hard to be taking a single to mid-off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: Stokes makes a full-length diving save at point. This is cut hard, but Stokes is alert and acrobatic

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: bouncer from wide on the crease, 138ks, Iyer ducks it

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: on a length, around off, punched to deep cover. That is his deep fielder. Shouldn't be bouncing him as he did last ball

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: flat pull for a six. Short ball at 138ks, rib-high, and Dhawan loves it. Helps it along over short fine leg. Also the line is too leg-side
on a length, angling in, 141ks, punched to mid-on for one

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, pushed to short cover
short of a length, 147ks, tucked off the hip for one
on a length, outside off, holds its line, defended with an open face
bouncer, outside off, 148ks, and he is wided on height
short of a length, outside off, and he is hit on the splice too. The bottom hand comes off as he pushes. This is bowled at 151ks
and Rahane goes. Playing with fore when you look to slog Archer at this pace. Heavy length, quick, and gets big on him. Goes off the splice of the bat to mid-on
short of a length, 149ks, not much room. Rahane looks to steer it, but is beaten by both pace and bounce of this
length ball, outside off, 145ks, hits the bat high again as Rahane defends

short_text: Unadkat to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: that is cracking. He likes Unadkat's pace. Sets back, moves across, gets inside the line and short-arm pulls this over midwicket
moves across the line to work this wide of mid-on for two

short_text: Unadkat to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, shaping in towards off, punched back to him

short_text: Unadkat to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: there is definite seam movement around. Dhawan jumps out of the crease, Unadkat drags the length back, it jags away and beats him
on a length, straight, pushed towards mid-on for one
wide length ball, Rahane tries a big drive at it, ans is beaten by the angle. Perhaps slight seam too

short_text: Archer to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, slight seam, beats him as he looks to open the face
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man
full, swinging in, pushed to mid-on
pace like fiyah. And a poor wide call. Short of a length, 148ks, around off, nips back in, Rahane does well to save himself from being hit. Goes under the armpit. Called wide
seam again. Archer looking unplayable. Or at least unhittable. Seams from just short of a length, and hits him high on the pad
wide down the leg side. Seems to be jagging around
seam again, and extra bounce. Hits the handle of the bat. Bowled at 147ks, on a length

bowled'im, first up, what a beauty. Lovely seam position, just short of a length, outside off. Shaw pushes at it, and the ball hits the seam and jags back in to take the inside edge onto the middle stump
full and dipping away from him outside off, has a big swing and can't connect
full slower ball on off stump, backs away and drives on the bounce to mid-off
yorks him as he walks down leg side. Beaten

slower ball at a good length on leg stump. Looks for the slog and skies it up pitch side. Bravo yells mine and settles under that to take the catch and close any realistic mathematical chances for SRH
followed down leg side with a yorker again, and cops that on the boot. Can't get it away
yorker down leg side, and he can't get bat on the attempted slog as he walks into the leg side

taken at long-on. Low full toss outside off, looks to play the helicopter shot but once again he's not behind the line of this for that shot. Holes out. Oh but he's also got so deep in the crease that his back leg has pushed off stump back.

short_text: Thakur to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: full and wide outside off, can't get the attempted drive away
full and just outside off, backs away and chops it straight to point. Watson is close in and picks up but doesn't throw
full toss outside off, wants to ramp it over square leg who is in the circle. But he hasn't got behind that

short_text: Thakur to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: full yorker floating away from him outside off. Reiffel shaped to call it a wide, hands half out. Then the bowler protested and, so did Dhoni. And suddenly he rethinks it. Replays show it had curved past the line
full ball floats away again, and this time it's past the tramline. Left alone
scythed to sweeper's right. Full toss wide outside off, floated away a touch and he hung back and had a whip at this

lofted over extra cover! Dhoni is furious with his bowler. He's put the sweeper square and Karn's lobbed this full ball up outside off. Nadeem reaches out with a stride and nails the lofted drive into the vacant boundary. "Nahiiiii," you could hear. No. And then a big chat with him as he walks to his fielding position.
just short of deep backward point. Good length and gripping and turning outside off. Backs into the leg side and looks to go over extra cover. Ends up getting too far from it and slices

short_text: Karn to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: reverse sweep over backward point. Good length ball dug into off stump, rising slowly, but he gets under this and nails the execution

short_text: Karn to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: long-on tips it over the line. Steps out at this ball and turns it into a full toss. Ends up slicing the attempted slog a touch. Thakur runs to his left and lunges up. Can't catch that
taken at long-on. The plan's come off. Williamson reaching out for the slog sweep as Karn tosses it up slow and at a length outside off. Can't manage to get the power on that to clear the boundary
lofted over square leg. That was the gap in the leg, and he hits it there. Good length ball at middle, shuffles and lofts the pull
full slower ball outside off, jammed to extra cover

finds the vacant midwicket boundary to bring up fifty. There's a rwason he's considered one of the best in the world. The plan from Bravo is clear with the wide yorkers. He walks into the off side to open up the leg side. He gets a low full toss and he chips it
taken at deep backward point. Full and wide, that's the plan, and that's what the field is set for. Shankar reaches out and slices it straight to Jadeja
full outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover's left. Missed out on that. Chawla did well to throw himself at that, face first. A boundary for sure if that got past him
overpitched outside off, lofted drive to long-off's right. Bit eager to get this one away
sweeps him over wide long-on! That is sweetly hit, wow. Good length and dipping in from outside off. He's down on one knee and uses his reach to send this 90 metres
good length and sliding on into the corridor. Gets forward and manages to eat Chawla's laboured dive to the right with this push
short outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short outside off, steered to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
googly, short of a length outside off. Tucks it to deep midwicket's right but hit a bit too well for the second
short of a good length at middle. Shuffles and tucks it to deep midwicket's right
googly, good length and outside off. Allows it on and dabs to short third
good length on off stump, punched to deep extra cover's right. Curran is rapid there and stops them going back for a second
tossed up at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off

picks out deep midwicket! A clean lofted sweep from Garg, hit powerfully enough that he might have got a four a couple of metres to Jadeja's right. But he's got this from off stump and straight into the hands
good length at leg stump, gets back in the crease and expertly pats this into vacant midwicket. Soft hands calibrated for a second run
tossed up and wide outside off again, left alone again
tossed up full and very wide outside off. Left alone
short at middle, hurried pull towards long--on
good length and turning away from middle. Gets an inside edge on the attempted sweep that trickles into the leg side
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper's right
tickled fine. Short of a good length, slanted into leg stump. He had shuffled so had enough room to jab at this and get is past Dhoni's dive
slower ball at a length outside off, leans in and flicks to midwicket's left
oh neatly done. So subtle. Good length  and just outside off. Watches that right under his eye as he gets on the front foot and opens the face late to chop to backward point boundary
good length and into leg stump. Looks to flick and cops that on the thigh
good length at middle stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
full outside off, leans in for the drive to deep extra cover
tossed up at off stump, shapes to sweep, adjusts to hurriedly drive to point
tossed up at middle stump, nicely to the pitch as he drives to long-on
full toss on off stump, punched to long-off's left
good length and big turn away outside off. It's also very wide
tossed up at off, driven to long-off along the floor
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square's left
oh gorgeous. Full and just outside off, leans in to reach the pitch and goes inside-out to chip this over extra cover. "Nahhhhh," says Dhoni, presumably about Jadeja's length
slapped over extra cover. Short and gripping outside off. Waits on it, opens up the body and deliberately lifts it over the fielder
good length, gripping and turning away from off. Punched to long-on
length at middle, punched to long-off with the turn
short outside off, whipped to deep midwicket's left
good length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
dropped short at leg stump, nails the connection on the pull, but not the placement. Finds deep backward square
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
good length and just outside off, pushed down the pitch on the rise
full and into leg stump, flicked to short fine
good length on middle stump, some turn away. Watchfully pushed to extra cover's left
full outside off, leans in and drives to long-off
good length and into leg stump, patted past his partner off the front foot

hits middle stump! Classic stuff from Jadeja. Cramps him, ties him, induces the false shot. Good length and tight on the stumps again. Bairstow looks to whip into the leg side and is beaten on the inside edge
good length and sliding into middle. Can't get the punch past extra cover
good length and into middle stump, onto the back foot and mistimes the attempted punch into the off side
good length and middle stump, punched to deep midwicket
good length, gripping and turning outside off. Dropped into the off side off the front foot
full and just outside off, mistimed drive to long-on off the toe end
good length ball floats away in the corridor. Punched down to long-on
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
slower short ball outside off, short-arm whip to deep midwicket's left
good length outside off, steered down to third man off the front foot
short of a length at off. Whipped to midwicket's right
good length on middle, punched to long-on
appeal for lbw turned down. Not reviewed. Was looking to play the reverse sweep. Good length and gripping. Might have hit his chest too so it was on its way up. Perhaps also hitting just outside off
good length and in at off stump. Allows that on and opens the face late to jab this to sweeper's left
tossed up on middle, drives with the turn to long-off
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length on middle stump, punched to extra cover's right
beaten on the pull again. Short and wide outside off, too far away for it
short outside off, pulled firmly to long-on's right
beaten. Slower short ball outside off, steps out and swipes over that
good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover on the up
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right and a slightly wide Jadeja throw means KW is safe
good length and into the corridor. Uses the angle to push this into vacant midwicket

short_text: Sam Curran to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length and into the stumps. Defended off the back foot

short_text: Sam Curran to Williamson, FOUR runs
long_text: steered over backward point and has Warner smiling in the dugout. Slower short ball angled into him. Arches into the leg side to make room and jabs at it late. Third man was in
slower ball at a length, angled into the body. Nudged to midwicket's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Williamson, no run
long_text: lbw appeal turned down. Slower ball at a length on leg stump. Looks for the flick and cops that in front of leg. Curran is around the wicket, remember. That's likely sliding down. Dhoni has a chat this time. No review. That was going down and might have too high as well

short_text: Sam Curran to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length and slanted into the corridor. Chopped to backward point

short_text: Sam Curran to Williamson, no run
long_text: slower ball, good length on off stump. Defended off the back foot
good length and coming into the corridor. Dabbed into the off side with soft hands off the front foot
beaten on the inside edge. Cuts back in, that one. Good length ball that lands on the seam. He's looking to drive through cover on the rise
slower short ball wide outside off, pulled to deep square's left
good length on middle stump, punched to mid-on's left
good length outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
short and just outside off, springs onto the back foot and gets nicely adjacent to this as he punches through cover

Bravo gets Pandey! Pandey gets Pandey first actually, with this call. Good length ball, sweetly punched on the rise to extra cover. An instinctive call for the run? There usually isn't a fielder that straight at cover in the powerplays. Inexplicable otherwise because it's traveling at a good speed to Bravo who picks up cleanly and gets in superb position to take down the stumps at the non-striker's end. He had run to his right too so he had all three stumps to aim at. A regular single to mid-off's left on most days

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed between cover point and short cover. They packed the infield but he finds a way. Short of a good length outside off, weight onto the front foot and slapped on the rise

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length outside off, defended into the covers

inside edge onto pad and Curran takes it! Full and into middle stump. Looks to swipe it behind point and gets it straight onto his front pad which was out in the leg side. Pings back up for Curran who has a short sprint to his left and an easy catch. That's the first time this season that Warner's fallen in the powerplay

short_text: Sam Curran to Warner, no run
long_text: short of a good length and jumps up at him. Watchfully dropped into the off side off the back foot
good length outside off, punched off the front foot to sweeper's left
slower short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length outside off, walks down at it and punches to mid-off
beaten on the inside edge. Good length ball cutting back in off the seam. Looks to punch that through cover
slower short ball outside off, left alone

miscued pull plops into the outfield past midwicket. Piyush Chawla has been midwicket to midwicket and he's being followed. Just has to retrieve this one though, it doesn't run away. Short ball at middle and got big on him
good length on leg stump, hangs back this time and clips to midwicket's right

dominant batting. Fourth ball off Chahar and the fourth time he's walked down at him. And this time he uses his wrists and whips this length ball from wide outside off in front of deep backward square
good length on middle stump, nudged to midwicket's right from the crease

short_text: Sam Curran to Bairstow, FOUR runs
long_text: sweet sound off this. Good length and pushed across him. Reaches out with an angled bat and pats it firmly on the rise to beat extra cover to his left
good length and cramped at leg stump. Pushed to midwicket's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Warner, no run
long_text: good length and at the stumps. Defended down the pitch

short_text: Sam Curran to Warner, no run
long_text: oh good shout for lbw. Turned down by the umpire, is Curran, and then by his captain who simply turns around. Good length at middle and leg. Looks for the flick and is pinned in front of leg stump. Was there an edge on that? Replays awaited. Yes there was

short_text: Sam Curran to Warner, no run
long_text: full and into the pads, flicked to midwicket
short of a length on the pads, clipped into the leg side off the back foot
good length outside off, walking down into this punch to sweeper point
good length and just outside off, walks down at him and taps into the covers
good length and down leg side, walks at it and can't get the flick going
short and wide outside off, a more confident shot this time. A cut to sweeper point
climbs past the edge. Short of a length outside off, checks his cut again and this one jumps up
just short of backward point. Good length inswinger wide outside off. Checks his poke at this and ends up lobbing it in front of that fielder
full outside off, slogs across that and hits this into his partner's feet it appears. And that deflects towards long-off
drilled to long-off's left. Overpitched ball outside off, gets down on a knee and clubs it firmly. A dive from the fielder will not allow him to get a hand on that
just over deep midwicket. Full toss at middle stump, slogged off the inside half of the bat but there's enough for it to clear the line
slower ball, good length and at middle stump. Looks for the slog, cops it in the mid-riff
full slower ball outside off, lofted to long-on's right. Warner slides as he stops this on the half-volley to his right. What an athlete, whew

loses his stumps first ball. Overpitched ball angled away from leg stump stump. He's looking to launch it over long-on and is beaten on the outside edge. That was there for the hit and Khaleel's sheepish smile suggests he knows that. Just looked for the wrong part of the field, Bravo
taken at extra cover. Low full toss across the corridor. Gets low and wants to chip that over extra cover. It comes off the toe and hangs harmlessly for Williamson

see ya! Vintage. Full and marginally short of yorker length at middle stump. Gets the front leg out of the way, hangs back on his back leg and whips it with those quick hands. 102 metres. Way, way over long-on
dipping yorker at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left off the toe-end
wide yorker outside off, looks to drive through cover and gets it off the under-edge into the turf
full slower ball on middle, reaches out and flicks to short fine
short and just outside off, opens the face and gets another late cut between backward point and third man
yorker down leg side, can't get the flick away
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on's right

oh nearly pulls off a blinder. Landed on his hip in the process and he's down trying to gather his breath. It was a good ball that Dhoni didn't pick at all, a legcutter. Good length and at middle. He was looking to punch to long-on and got a leading edge. Sandeep flew to his left and hung for a moment as he got his left hand on it. Just couldn't hold on
slower ball, good length and across him. Can't beat point with the late cut this time
caressed behind point. Short and wide and across him. Opens the face and bisects backward point and short third
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off
good length on leg stump, whipped to fine leg's left off the back foot
good length and wide outside off. Has a swish at that with static feet and is beaten
full toss wide outside off, allows that to go across him and slaps it to sweeper's right
full toss at middle stump, it's a miscued pull off the high part of the bat. Backward square leg was a little too fine to get to that to his left
good length and just outside off, dabs to third man's left off the back foot

another full toss taken at long-off. Slightly more complex, this take, but Pandey keeps his balance. Full toss wide outside off, spanked off the front foot and this dips to Pandey's left. Has a hurried sprint and then keeps his bearings after catching that
good length and cutting in from middle stump as he looks to punch through cover with the angle. Thick edge towards square leg
slower ball, good length and just outside off. Nudged to extra cover's left off the back foot
short and pushed across off stump. Leaves that alone hoping for the wide call on height. Not given
full and just outside off, mistimed drive to long-off
good length at middle stump, deep in the crease and punches to long-on
straight to long-off. Friendly full toss wide outside off, about knee height. He hammers it to Warner's left and he crouches and takes that reverse cup
yorker length and wide outside off Goes too far down leg side to make room and is beaten on the attempted slice
good length on leg stump, nudged into the vacant leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: smoked over deep midwicket! Full ball just outside off, gets low with the bat coming down from a third man direction. Then connects with perfect timing and nails the slog sweep

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, chopped to short third

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length at off, looks to glance, only manages to get it into the pitch
good length at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: straight over his head! Full and quick just outside off, half a step out and clean swing through the line. Rashid doesn't even bother to look
yorker length outside off, sliced off the toe-end to sweeper cover
slower short ball at leg stump, shuffles and tries to guide that fine. Cops it on the body and is disgusted with himself. Short fine was in
slashed over point. Full toss pushed across him and he lays back and has a swish under this
yorker at off stump, punched to long-off's right
full and just outside off, steps out and drives to extra cover
just clears point. Full ball pushed across the corridor, steps out for the drive and opens the face to try and reach it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, backs away to cut and gets a thick outside edge to short third

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: good length outside off, looks to flick and hits it straight onto the pad
good length outside off, swept firmly to deep midwicket's right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: beaten. Googly release, legbreak off the pitch. Outside off, plays for the one that comes in
good length and into the pads, flicked to deep square

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: smoked over wide long-on with a slog sweep! Googly at a good length on off and middle. Quickly down on one knee and a clean swing in a straight-ish direction. He was bowled trying to hit a similar ball square in the last match. Nails this one

lofted over the bowler. Good hit and once again, without reaching the pitch of the ball. This has only to do with the room and quick hands. Good length ball outside off beats him in flight but he's down leg side with enough swinging room. Angled bat swipe to launch it over the bowler

Pandey takes it low at long-on and says he doesn't know if that's carried. Umpires send it up with the soft signal not out. Short of a good length and hurries him on middle. He pulls  in Pandey's direction and it's dying on him. He takes a few strides and in and grabs that. Third umpire says it's clear to him that the ball has hit the ground. It was a matter of one or two fingers that could have realistically been under the ball because he was diving towards the ground with his hands pointed downwards
good length and steps out to that. It's almost yorked him at leg stump. Jammed down to long-on
good length and slid into the corridor. Backs into the leg side to make room and punches to sweeper cover
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper off the back foot
good length at the stumps, gets low and sweeps firmly to deep midwicket's right
full on middle stump, jammed down to long-on
full and just outside off, drilled firmly to Rashid's left. He's stuck his hand out and that has flicked his left ring finger it appears. And he's in pain
good length and into the stumps, flicked to deep square's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length and spun away outside off, defended off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length and spun into the stumps, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover's left on the front foot
good length and into leg stump. Whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and into middle stump. Mistimed pull to long-on's right
short and into the mid-riff as he looks to play the pull
good length and into leg stump. Looks to punch to long-on. Bowler cleans up to his right
short of a length and wide outside off. Steps out and isn't close to the pitch of this. Manages to slash this to sweeper's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
googly and in at leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, aerial flick down to long-on
good length outside off, reaches out and flicks to long-on's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length and spins away outside off. Hurriedly poked into the off side off the back foot
good length outside off, steps out and slaps it on the rise to sweeper's right
good length arm ball at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and just outside off. Driven with the turn to long-off
good length and holding in the pitch outside off. Check-punch to sweeper cover
short and just outside off, quickly onto the back foot to punch this past extra cover

sounds like a dropped catch and then overthrows. Short of good length ball sliding into the corridor. Late cut and a thick edge on it. Bairstow doesn't hold on and then he isn't alert to the throw from short fine. This trickles down to long-off
yorker at middle stump, squeezed onto his toe
short of a good length outside off, mistimed chop to backward point

the trademark Watto pick-up. Full ball on the pads, a slower ball that doesn't quite grip. He has half a stride into the leg side and brings out that big flourish on the follow through as he lifts this over the backward square boundary
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off on the up
short of a good length, just outside off, chopped to third man
good length and just outside off, tapped to mid-off on the back foot
sliced over extra cover. Good length outside off, steps out and makes room but can't quite reach the pitch of it. Goes through with the shot anyway and clears the infield with ease
full on off stump, steps out and drives inside-out to find extra cover
good length and slight turn away in the corridor. Punches off the back foot and gets a thick outside edge to point
good length and angled into the stumps. Whipped aerially down to long-on
good length and on with the arm at middle stump. Tapped back for the bowler
short and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
lofted drive over the bowler. His go-to release shot that he kept missing as the bowlers bounced him last match. Good length ball this time and he runs down at it and pumps it
good length and swung in from outside off, defended into the off side

knocked him over with a beauty. Curran had no clue against Sandeep tonight. Sandeep goes around the wicket, hits a good length with an angle into leg stump, but gets it to hold its line a touch. Curran nudges in front of the body for the angle and ends up playing inside that. It hits middle stump. But a job well done from CSK's new opener. Addendum: on second viewing, it looks like Curran just played the wrong line and it didn't straighten all that much. Also it hit leg stump
good length on middle stump, flicked off the low part of the bat. To deep square's left
good length and swung into off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
good length and swung into off stump, defended off the back foot

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: whack! No doubt about how well he's connected this. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. So much room. And he flat-blats it straight over the bowler
good length and swung into the pads as he looks to play the glance
good length and into leg stump, a slower ball, flicked to midwicket

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: short in the corridor and pulled again. Once again it doesn't look fully controlled, off the high part of the bat. He was cramped but did well to get the swing away. And there was more elevation in this. It's over the long-on boundary

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: short and climbing in the corridor, cramps him and he pulls again. Once again not off the middle, but this better hit than the previous one and is well over and wide of mid-on

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: gets one past mid-on. short and rising in the corridor. Looks to pull and gets this off the inside part of the bat too, but he's swung at it powerfully. Gets it to the fielder's right
big lbw appeal is turned down and they won't review. That looked close, but possibly sliding down. Full and into the pads, falls over as he looks to flick
good length and across him in the corridor. Closes the face and drags this towards mid-on whose throw at the striker's end is too wide for Bairstow. Watson was struggling to get in

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and shaped away from off stump. Looks to poke into the off side with soft hands but extra cover onto it quickly

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and swung away from off stump. Driven on the rise to mid-off
short of a good length and swung into the corridor. Cut to third man

got him! Faf waits ten minutes to have the strike and goes first ball. Looks like he expected that to come on much quicker. He's on the back foot and it's an inswinger from a good length outside off. He's on the way to middling this, to be fair, but because of his early timing he decides to check the shot. As a result, the bat hangs inside the line at the last moment and this flies off the outside edge
dragged wide of mid-on. Good length and just outside off. Has a swipe across the line and gets it off the inside half of the bat

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length and cramping him at middle and off. Forced to defend to backward point

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of length and into middle stump, punched to midwicket's left off the back foot

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended into the covers

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed over point. They had a fielder back there last over, but not now. And he bowls short and wide. Curran chops at it without any intent to keep it down

short_text: Ahmed to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a good length and rising in the corridor. Mistimed punch off the back foot
short and wide outside off, steps out at that but it is too far away
short of a good length and swung away, punched on the rise to sweeper

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: lovely delivery. Good length and hooping away after starting on leg stump. Curran offers the full face to defend and this is past the outside edge

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: beaten on the cut. Short of a good length and swung away outside off
good length and swung away from outside leg stump. Allows that on and clips to deep square's right

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and curve away from middle stump. Defended into the covers

short_text: Sandeep to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: good length and swung away from middle stump, defended to point off the thick outside edge
full, on off, dug out for a single
slower legcutter, well outside off, pushed to point
slower ball, short of a length, punched to point
on-pace yorker, on off, dug out well
slower legcutter again, half-volley, driven to long-on for one
slower legcutter, full and straight, hits the pad, but not given lbw. Might be sliding down
timber. Nagarkoti looks for the big swing to an on-pace full ball, but it tails back in to take the inside edge onto the wicket
slower ball, on a length, outside off, pushed into the off side for one
yorker, down the leg side, runs off the inside edge for one
full, just outside off, pushed to extra cover for one
slower ball, looks like a high full toss, but it dips on him, and gives him a single off the bottom edge
yorker, middle and leg, can't do much with that

Kohli dives to his left at short midwicket, but collects this on the half-volley. Or so it seemed originally. The umpires have gone upstairs, and their soft signal is out. It is not quite a half-volley, but the ball has touched the ground before Kohli completes the catch. That explains Kohli's unenthusiastic reaction. Not sure why the umpires went with a soft signal of out
short of a length, outside off, punched past point
short ball, quite quick, but a wide down the leg side
low full toss, nearly a yorker, dug out to short midwicket
low full toss, clipped off the toes
short of a length, on top off, pushed wide of point
short of a length, quick, at him. Defended

sensational catch by Morris. Tripathi gets no power in this pull, and Morris charges in from long-on. This has hardly gone past the 30-yard circle, but Morris makes the ground and dives to actually make it look relatively easy
bouncer, a quick one, and it beats his attempt to ramp it
slogs to leg, gets no power, takes a single to deep midwicket. No he turns down the single
slower ball, wide outside off, driven over the top for a four to extra cover
looks for the big hit down the wicket, is hit high on the bat by a length ball
quick, angling in, headed down, hits him on the pad as he slogs
and how he teases a lower-order batsman. Real slow legbreak. Just short of a length, the ball sits in the surface, and the leading edge falls just short of Chahal
wide legbreak, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off
slow dipping legbreak, beats his sweep, concedes a leg-bye
wide legbreak, drilled to the left of deep cover for two
drift and dip, Tripathi way too early into the big sweep. Hit on the pad
slower one, dips on him big-time, still a full toss. Gets a single to deep square leg
and now the catches are sticking too. Slower ball, Cummins looks to go over long-off, but toe-ends it for a sitter to Padikkal
slower ball, outside off, hit hard, but straight to long-off
goes for the yorker, bowls a low full toss, dug out to long-on
full, on off, on-pace, driven to extra cover
slower ball, slogged away to deep midwicket for one
slower legcutter, pulled down to long leg for one

Udana gets his own back. Game over. RCB are relieved although this didn't even get to threatening proportions, but they have been at the wrong end of this before. Udana goes full and wide, away from the wheelhouse, and all Russell manages is a catch to extra cover
yorker outside off, Russell can't access this
Udana is losing it here. Full toss outside off. Russell crashes this wide of long-on for four more
Padikkal's special effort at wide long-on can't keep this in. Full and fast and wide, Russell mis-hits the slog, Padikkal gets to it, but can't drop it back in before touching the rope
slower ball, but a touch too full, and he slogs this wide of long-on for four
short of a length, slow, outside off, and Russell turns down the single
looks for the ramp as Morris bowls short and at him. Beats him
yorker now, dug out for one
dropped by Padikkal. Morris tries the slower ball, full, outside off, and Russell mis-hits it flat for a lo catch at long-off, but Padikkal can't hold on
yorker, middle and leg, dug out for one
slower ball, short of a length, punched to point. No run
short of a length, this time he goes back to pull him to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, straight, defended to short midwicket
quick ball outside off, it doesn't turn, and runs off the outside edge for a couple
Russell slogs, Sundar doesn't give him the length, Russell gets a single to long leg off the inside edge
offbreak, on a length, outside off, drops this to point for one
make it three wickets. Sundar bowls short of a length, Morgan tries to make pace and go inside-out, but all he manages is a top edge to short third man
legbreak, middle and leg, Russell shows him the respect and defends
full and slow, legbreak, on the pads, swept away for one
flat, quick, into the pads, Russell gets a leg-bye
played on. Chahal teases him with a wide slow legbreak. Karthik is caught in two minds, eventually tries a late cover-drive, and the ball doesn't turn, and the inside edge crashes into the stumps
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-on
slider outside off, beats him on the cut
slower through the air, on the pads, worked away to leg for one
first boundary since the fifth over. Lovely cover-drive past the short extra cover. Clears his front leg to give him some room, and gets a full-enough length to be able to drive it powerfully
quick length ball, into the pads, worked away for one

Gill has run himself out. He has put himself under so much pressure he is trying to steal non-existent singles. Morgan down the wicket, Sundar drags the length back, the ball turns, goes off the outside half of the bat to cover-point, who is in tight. Gill runs through, and has no chance of making it
quick, on a length, headed for off, pushed back to Sundar
backs away to make room, but Sundar gives him none. Hit hard to long-off for one
slow, full, teasing him, and the ball dips alarmingly to beat his sweep
stays back to push a length ball back to Chahal
flat, quick, on off, pushed down to long-on
flat legbreak, turned to leg for one

appeal for catch at the wicket, not given, and they review it. Morgan tries the reverse sweep first ball, the ball turns and bounces, and lobs off the forearm. No glove on the way. Now we will check for the lbw. It is hitting him in line but bouncing over

droped by Finch. Those big buckets have let this through. Gill comes down the pitch, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, and chips more that hits. Finch moves to his left at long-on, his natural side, but can't hold on
and the slog-sweep gets him. He tries for the big six, and Sundar fires a quick length ball in. He is beaten, and his middle stumps is knocked back
down the wicket, mis-hits the slog, goes off the inside half of the bat for one
short of a length, quick, some turn, punched to deep point for one
goes back, Sundar fires this in, worked to leg for one
shapes up for the slog, Sundar keeps the length away from it. He aborts, and pushes this down the ground for one
length ball, offbreak, worked to leg for one
on a length, middle and leg, stays away from the slog-sweep. Another dot. Two overs without a boundary
slider again, cut away hard, and Siraj makes a diving save at point. Might have saved four there
slider, on a length, outside off, beats him on the outside edge
full, legbreak, driven inside-out to long-off
wrong'un, full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
slow, full, outside leg, some turn, pushed to long-on for one
Rana looks for the big slog-sweep off the last ball of the Powerplay, but this pitch is slow and he gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, fired in, looks to hit this down the ground but ends up dragging it to square leg
down the wicket, he shortess the length, fires this in, concedes just the single to deep midwicket
slower in the air, down the leg side, they get one as he misses. Not called a wide
offbreak that doesn't turn, and they steal a single off the outside half of the bat. Saini is the fielder at cover, and they have picked on him
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one

cheeky. Siraj follows him with a short ball as he backs away, and he takes this from outside leg, and ramps this over short third. Actually this is not a ramp because he is not hitting this from down to up. He has has just cut this over short third. Flat six
nice shot. Stands his ground, gets this short ball, and elegantly pulls him over midwicket. No violence here
full and straight, pushed wide of mid-on for one
slightly fuller, tucked to leg again, but can't beat forward square leg this time
lovely shot first ball. Shot of a man in form. Short of a length, at the hips, he gets inside the line and tucks this away through square leg. Long leg has no chance
full ball at 135ks, Gill should ideally be timing this over mid-off, but this goes off the toe end to mid-off

unconvincing innings from Banton comes to an end. Tripathi must be wondering why he was dropped down the order. No risks taken. And he is bowled off the inside edge to a really quick delivery. At 148ks, short of a length, nipping in slightly, and Banton is done in
stays back of a length, gives him no room, hit to mid-off for a quick single
short of a length, outside off, hit straight to backward point here
short of a length, no room, the best he can do is, drop this at his toes and run
misses out on a plum leg-side half-volley and finds long leg on the bounce
slower short ball, at his body, Gill makes room and cuts this in front of point and in the air
short of a length, outside off, dabbed for one. Lovely first over from Siraj
short of a length, pushed to midwicket, and they don't take the overthrow off Banton's body
and now the quick bouncer at 143ks. Beats him hands down for pace as he hooks
lovely delivery. Slower one, 121ks. It is the offcutter, Banton plays for that inward movement, but it holds its line and beats his outside edge
short of a length, no room, runs off the outer half of the bat to cover-point
wide full ball, driven in front of cover-point, but the dive there gets a touch on and saves two runs. Kohli is the fielder
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched wide of mid-off for one
full and wide down the leg side at 142ks
short ball, into the ribs, 135ks, pulled down to square leg
hit back hard at Saini, he sticks his right hand at it, but the parry doesn't carry to mid-on. A little harsh to call this a drop
short of a length, no room, 146ks, he opens the face, but point is tight to deny him the single
shuffles across to get close to a wide length ball, mis-hits it back to Saini
nice little cover drive on the up, but can't beat cover. Gets a single off the defelction
wide length ball, outswinger, 143ks, and some zip there. Betas him, but is called wide
slower ball, full, on the toes, dipping, so it is perhaps better to just clip it for one and not look for the big hit
Morris lucky to get away with this one. On a length, down leg, but Gill has fhund short fine leg
short of a length, on off, punched to cover-point
easy pick-up. Class shot. He gets inside the line to a length ball, and just picks it up nonchalantly over square leg
short of a length, at him, defended to leg
good start for Morris. On a length, around off, Banton falls over, gets a thick edge to third man for one
yorker, outside off, dug out to long-on, and they take just the single. Beats me why. Why won't you keep running till you are run out?
yorker, middle and leg, just the single, and he has got de Villiers off strike finally
short of a length, slower, punched straight of long-off, and they came back for two for AB to retain the strike
slower legcutter on the free hit, de Villiers grunts as he can't quite reach it. Still manages to place it square of deep cover, and sprints back for two

short_text: Russell to AB, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: of all th shots he has hit today, this is the most incredible. Russell has nailed a yorker outside off, but he has gone deep and across, and has managed to squeeze it over point for a perfectly timed shot. No-ball too
low full toss, nearly a yorker outside off, and de Villiers mis-hits it back to Russell
on-pace length ball. Why do you bother? De Villiers just stands deep and swings this clean over wide long-off
slower ball, low full toss, and he mis-hits it wide of long-on. Comes back for two, though. AB on strike next ball
quick short ball, 137ks, rib-high, off the bottom edge on the pull. AB off strike
decent yorker outside off, dig out for one
first boundary for Kohli. Off an outside edge. Krishna bowls a wide length ball, out of his reach as he is standing his ground. Edge goes fine of short third. Kohli shouts YES, and punches the air
on-pace short ball, 139ks, upper-cut in front of square. Another couple
slower ball, Kohli early into the slog, still doesn't get his first boundary. Placed wide of long-on for two, though
good bouncer, 137ks, across him, de Villiers looks to ramp it. Beaten. Not just a dot but de Villiers off strike for Krishna at the start of the next over
nails the yorker outside off, but he has still timed it beautifully and placed it to the left of deep cover for two
Kohli does well to hand it straight back to de Villiers as this yorker is good outside off and he digs it out to leg
slower short ball, outside off, left alone, wide. And Karthik concedes a bye as it bounces in front of him
goes for the wide yorker, but gives him the low full toss. Mis-hit but over extra cover and between long-off and deep cover

this is clean clean monstrous hitting. Russell gives him a length ball, and he makes room and unleashes a pure golf swing to send him back over his head. Not sure which part of Sharjah this ball has landed in. Fifty for AB
misses the yorker. Gives him the low full toss. De Villiers stands in the crease on a solid base, and hits this wide of long-on
full and straight, hit wide of long-on, and no fancy cute sharp twos. Give the strike to AB. Kohli thinks so too
misses the yorker. De Villiers backs away and gets under the low full toss, and even places it wide of long-on. Another flat six
de Villiers tries to put Cummins off by shuffling across, and then tries the ramp, but Cummins stays full and wide. Eventually de Villiers tries to go over the off side but is beaten
good bouncer, 138ks, quick, at off, and de Villiers looks to upper-cut. Beaten
de Villiers playing havoc with best-laid plans here. Slower ball, short of a length, and he holds his charge to pull this flat to deep midwicket
on-pace length ball, outside off, and angling in, and he makes room and lofts him over long-off for six more
slower ball, wide down leg, and Karthik fails to collect this half-volley to his left. Another bye on top of it
looks for the quick yorker, 137ks, into the pads, but the length is slightly short of being a yorker. AB swings hard at it, and it runs off the inside half of the bat and past short fine leg
on-pace full toss, 143ks, de Villiers is done in for pace. Mis-hits this to extra cover
de Villiers is waiting for these now. This is another slow offcutter, at 115ks, and he goes deep into the crease to slog this half-volley out of the ground. Into the roof and then into the street
de Villiers waits for another slower ball, bowled at 116ks, and he goes deep into the crease to loft this length ball over wide long-on. Those wrists and timing
slower ball, 112ks, big wind-up, expecting a slower ball, but this is even slower and beats his swing. Hits him on the pad but is headed down leg
short of a length, 123ks, de Villiers stays back and punches this wide of long-off for two
wide length ball, cut away, past point, but not enough timing to beat deep cover
flat, quick offbreak, punched to long-off for one
flighted, just short of being a half-volley, just outside off, steered away, but again can't place it. All signs of a slow pitch
on a length, legcutter, punched to extra cover. Can't place it
on a length, pretty straight, punched to deep midwicket for one
yorker outside off, under his bat. Valuable dot
the change-up, the quick ball, 144ks, and Kohli is outsmarted as he is still charging at him. Hit on the toe. Nagarkoti is bowling an excellent spell here
Kohli charges at him again, Nagarkoti remains slow, and he punches this wide of long-on. Russell answers some questions regarding his fitness with a big dive, saving two runs
leading edge. Kohli looks to work this slower ball to leg, and the leading edge sails over the bowler's head. Enough time to come back for two
short of a length, slower ball, outside off, 119ks, punched to deep cover
slower offuctter again, dragged into the leg side for a single to deep midwicket
slower ball, short of a length, worked to leg for one
driven hard to long-on for one

just de Villiers things. You think this should be four the moment it leaves his bat, but he has hit this straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end. But he has hit it so hard, that the ricochet beats mid-off and goes all the way to the fence for four
slower ball, on a length, wide outside off, 121ks, gets a bottom edge on the drive
whips at the first length ball he faces. The ball hits the inside half of his bat, and rolls to short midwicket
Krishna comes back with a perfect yorker. Bowled with a scrambled seam, 137ks, Finch is backing away, and the ball tails in a little and squeezes under his bat to knock back the middle stump
and so it does. Finch backs away first ball, and punches a short-of-a-length delivery between mid-off and extra cover
another slower ball, 115ks, and this one grips and turns. Just the one leg-bye
down the wicket again, Nagarkoti keeps bowling slow, at 119ks now, and is driven to long-off for one
down the wicket, Nagarkoti pulls the length back and also runs his fingers on this. Short of a length, at 120ks, and it slides under his slog-pull
slower wide length ball, Finch looks to go inside-out but ends up dragging this into his own pad
short of a length, tucked away off the hip, and they take the quick single
Kohli charges at Nagarkoti, who shortens the length and draws an inside edge into his pad
short of a length, straight, soft hands, bunted into the leg side, and they come back for two. Finch is really slow, but the rocket throw is on a half-volley and Rana doesn't collect it
tossed up high, rellly slow, Finch hits hard, and this is misfielded at extra cover by Morgan to allow them two runs
on a length, straight, worked to leg for one
offbreak, and Kohli plays for the legcutter. Beaten on the inside edge. Kohli lets out a grunt for letting that happen
legcutter, on a length, outside off, Kohli uses soft hands to place it into the off side and comes back for two
Finch backs away, Varun stays short of a length, just outside off, and he cuts this to deep cover
slower ball, short, wide, Finch doesn't get an timing on the cut. Takes a single
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
slower ball, short of a length, at off, and he runs this behind square on the off side
on a length, angling in, worked to the right of Banton this time, and he does well to attack the ball and keep them down to one
bouncer, Banton is wrongfooted at deep midwicket as this spins straight instead of square. He puts in the dive, though, to keep them down to one
driven down to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven hard with his wrist unfurling on it, but Morgan makes a dive at cover and keeps them down to one. Seems he has saved at least one run here
into the pads, quicker, hits the pad on the sweep. Just the leg-bye
legcutter, slow in the air, on a length, defended in front of off
quick short ball, Finch looks to pull this from outside off. Beaten on the bottom edge
appeal for lbw as Finch doesn't pick this offbreak bowled with a legcutter action. Seems to be headed down. They don't review the not-out call
short of a length, legcutter, waits for it, runs it down to short third man
on a length, outside off, pushed to mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, holds its line. Defended
bouncer first up, and it is too high. Called wide
Russell says I will do it all myself. The stumps are splayed all over the place. Cross seam, full, straight. Padikkal makes room, swings and misses
slower ball, short of a length, punched to wide long-off for one
Russell follows Finch with a yorker but slips it down leg
short of a length, just outside off, runs this down to third man

and another chance goes begging. Russell has done Padikkal in with a slower ball, and two fielders converge towards the skier at long-off. And for a moment, both of them leave it to each other. Krishna makes a belated attempt to catch it. Doesn't even get a finger on it. Should have been a wicket. Is six
tossed up, pretty straight, clipped away off the toe
Finch plays this flat delivery past short fine for one

another misfield. Varun ha bowled a good ball, short of a length, making him play to his field at deep midwicket, but Gill messes up a regulation take. And the ball slides towards the boundary, Gill dives but his elbow is touching the rope with the ball still in his hand. Or so it appears from the replay
short of a length, straight, Finch goes back and inside the line, and helps this past short fine leg for two
Finch's front leg is opened up. He has bad intentions here, but Varun keeps the length short of his slot. Finch pushes this wide of long-n for two
short of a length, around off, whipped to deep midwicket for one

and the catching troubles continue for this IPL. An over ruined. Short ball, down the leg side, hit straight to short fine leg but Nagarkoti lets it slip through his fingers. What should have been a wicket becomes the only boundary for the over
into the helmet now. What an over this is turning out to be. Lovely quick bouncer, Finch looks to pull this behind square but is late on it and hit on the glove and onto the helmet
lovely slower ball. Short of a length, Finch goes for the pull but is way early into it. This is bowled at 118ks
short ball, into the ribs, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, into the body, Finch plays the flick-pull to deep backward square for one
short of a length, 137ks, Finch gets a bottom edge as he tries to cut
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of point for a single
short, quick, into the chest, pulled away to long leg for one
backs away again, but Cummins bowls a smart short slower ball at 128ks. Just runs the fingers on it. Extra bounce beats his attempt at the cut
length ball, outside off, driven on the up, straight to short extra cover
short of a length, Finch walks down and works this to long leg. Nagarkoti keeps them down to one with a big sprint to his right
quick length ball, beats him for pace, hits the pad, but can't stop the leg-bye
short of a length, straighter this time, pushed to leg for one
short of a length, into the hip, and for some reason he doesn't have long leg that kept these shots in last over. This time Padikkal is allowed a free hit past short fine for four
after three good balls in his own half, Kirshna pitches one up on the pads, and Padikkal says thank you very much. Whips it over midwicket
short of a length again as Finch walks at him. Punched to extra cover for one
goes down the wicket again, Kirshna bowls short, into the armpit, and he pulls it fine, but not fine of short fine leg
and he slips in a bouncer too as Finch walks at him. This is at 134ks, and Finch tries a duck-pull and is beaten. Called one for the over
another bouncer to ends the over, this one at 140ks. Padikkal ducks it again
really full, just outside off, driven with an open face, but can't beat the man at point in the circle
responds with a bouncer at 141ks. Padikkal ducks it
and he repeats the dose. Cummins's pace doesn't matter here. Backs away again, and this time he goes squarer, over point
these batsmen know they need runs here so they are not fooling around. Makes room, gets a length ball, and he goes inside-out over cover for four
length ball, angling in towards top of off. Defended
a third straight single for Padikkal to long leg
short of a length, outside off, punched wide of cover for one
Finch is in some mood. The first time Krishna goes into Finch's half, he lofts him over wide long-on and into the street
tucked away off the hip as Krishna stays short of a length
another walk down the wicket from Finch. He works this short-of-a-length delivery to long leg
short of a length, at the pads, tucked away to long leg
Finch keeps walking at him. Cummins bowls short of a length, and he tucks this away, in front of deep square, for a couple
quick bouncer, 142ks, Finch has walked enough at him. Cummins go upstairs, and makes him get out of harm's way
length ball, angling in, worked away to deep square for one
he is not letting Cummins beat him on the inside edge. Pushes this length ball to mid-off for one
and Finch is covering that straight line really well. Walks a little at Cummins, and meets this straight length ball in front of the pad and clips him over midwicket
looks for the lbw ball that everyone bowls to Finch. But he is moving into the ball here and pushes this to mid-on
short ball, he calmly pulls this over square leg and fine of deep square for four
short of a length, wide, punched wide of mid-off for one

Shaw exposed in the field again. This run is not on as Pandya dabs this towards point who is in tight. Imagine if Shaw picks this up and runs Pollard out, you have a new batsman on strike. But he doesn't pick this up clean
there is nothing golden about this. It is a plum little half-volley slower ball outside leg with fine leg in the circle. Pandya gathers four
he gets nothing. Quick length ball, Pollard is looking to play this down the ground, but gets an inside edge into the pad. No room here
smart batting from Pandya, stays beside the line of a length ball and places this wide of cover for one
short of a length, hurries him again, and this time he gets the single to leg
short of a length, quick, 141ks, Pollard playsa an uncharacteristic slog, is beaten on the bottom edge of the bat

plum length ball, Pollard looks for the big hit, misses, is hit on the pad. They appeal for lbw, not given as it is headed down leg, but DC still review it because, well, we don't like early finishes in the IPL. Missing another set
short of a length, outside off, nicely steered to third man for one
slower length ball to end the over. Pollard is happy with a dot
quick length ball, pushed wide of mid-on for one
sharp short ball, at him, and he does well to drop his wrists and stays away from its line

another brace for Rabada. But is this too late? Kishan tries to end this right here right now, looking to upper-cut him, but Rabada gets big on him, making him loft this towards deep cover where Axar takes a smart low catch diving forward
