he has picked not only the short boundary but also the shortest man on the field. Plays the pick-up shot to a short-of-a-length ball on the hip, and Shaw leaps at deep square and gets only finger tips to it
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
short of a length, hit straight to mid-off, decides to take the quick single and makes it in what seems like 10 strides
full toss wide down the leg side. Pollard thinks he has missed out on a boundary
pulls this one from well outside off. He has picked the field again. No deep midwicket in place so he pulls this chest-high short ball in front of square
short of a length, at him, another dot as Pollard plays this back to him
bouncer, in front of his face, outside off. Left alone
cross-seam, short of a length, tucked off the hip for one
yorker, dug out well to long-on

some shot. To get this much power off the back foot when hitting in front of square. Stoinis bowls short of a length, just outside off, and he crunches it in front of cover to find the gap at deep extra cover
on a length, outside off, pushed down the ground for a single to long-on
slower ball, short of a length, pushed down the ground, only one pitch away from Stoinis, but he misfields to allow them a single
full, outside off, pushed to deep cover

oh hello. It was a death wish all right but on Hardik's behalf. Rolls his fingers on a length ball outside off, Pandya swings hard for a six down the ground, but it takes the outside edge through to Carey. It is possible Pandya played for the offcutter but this one didn't quite grip
good start. On a length, just outside off. Defended

Rabada has his own back but is it too late? Yadav gets too ambitious. Shuffles across to try and take on the long-on, but Rabada's length is not full enough for that. The skier is taken at mid-off. He is gone but he has left them only a run a ball to get. That is better than batting deep and turning it into 13 an over
short of a length, around off, steered to third man for one
pushed just wide of point for one
4, 2, 6 off Rabada. You better believe it. A dynamite innings. He picks on the short boundary. Gets inside the line, Rabada bowls into the hip, but he uses his wrists to whip this over long leg
he is taking Rabada on, making room and lofting him over mid-off. Not the cleanest of strikes but enough on it to clear mid-on
legcutter slower ball, short of a length, wide, and he unfurls his wrists on the cut. Gets a thick edge, but it goes fine of third man for four
he brings out a ladder and reaches this wide short slower ball, and manages to cut it perfectly in the gap between short third and point. He will need some chalk after this
slower ball, short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
low full toss outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
Kishan announces himself here. Not allowing Stoinis bowl a cheap over. Lofts a length ball over long-on. Sweet connection, short boundary
wide length ball, pushed to mid-off for one
punched on the up, gets a single to mid-off
lovely chip over extra cover for another couple. Yadav looking in absolute control against spin
slow, on a length, and he punches this down to long-on
arm ball, short of a length, punched to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: and Yadav rubs it in by giving Shaw no chance here. He sweeps this one even harder and in front of square. Shaw has no chance here

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: fuller, slower, swept hard, and Shaw misfields at deep square leg. That's minus-three for him in the field

short_text: Axar Patel to Yadav, no run
long_text: flat, on a length, punched to extra cover
top edge on the sweep, but it falls well short of deep square leg
topsinner, on a length, straight, punched to wide long-on
offbreak, on a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, no turn, worked to deep midwicket for one
offbreak, pitched up, driven to long-on for one
lovely shot. Ashwin bowls the carrom ball, but it gives Yadav some width, and he punches this over extra cover for four
short of a length, into the hip, and hits the hip. Another dot
nothing slow about this. Bouncer at 140ks, and he is hooking as he is ducking. Beaten
short of a length, slower ball, and I hear a flick as it passes his hip. But it is called wide
steered wide of point this time for a single
on a length, straight, pushed back to him
wrong end from Iyer. Yadav drops this towards point, and refuses to respond to Kishan's call. Iyer hits the stumps direct but at the striker's end. That gives Kishan time to get back
gets inside the line, and is beaten on the leg side. Good umpiring to not call it a wide even though he has missed the leg stump
looks to cramp him up with his angle but ends up sliding down the leg side
carrom ball, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one

Ashwin has got de Kock again. Lovely bowling again. The dip works even in T20. De Kock looks for the big sweep, but Ashwin gets the ball to drop out of his reach, and then his bounce does the rest to take the top edge for deep square leg to take. In a way that dropped catch last ball has netted the bigger fish. So catches don't always win matches. Time to go easy with that cliche
dropped by himself. Carrom ball, sits in the curface, hit off the toe end, back to him, he goes for the overhead catch and this just hits the fingertips and parries off
on a length, pretty straight, worked to leg for one
offbreak, back of a length, punched down to long-on for one
Yadav moves across early, Ashwin slows this down and goes straight, but he nails the sweep for a couple square of deep square leg
slower ball, low full toss, hit to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip

short_text: Patel to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: and he is picking his field now. Slower length ball, de Kocks gets inside the line and shovels this over short fine. De Kock brings up his fifty. Nobody has batted this fluently today

short_text: Patel to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: bouncer, quick, and de Kock loves the pace. Uses it to help it past short fine leg for four
slower offcutter, another forehand topspin from Yadav into the leg side. Just the single this time
looks to ramp an on-pace length ball over short fine. Gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, angling in, punched to deep midwicket for one
soft outside edge for a single straight of short third man
this has topspun after pitching in the deep. Another whip to a length ball offbreak, it seems like deep midwicket has it covered to his left but the ball pitches and speeds off for four
full outside off, driven hard to deep cover

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: slow offbreak, on off, defended back to him
on a length, around off, whipped to long-on for one
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
on a length, on off, crunched to deep point for one
slower ball, offcutter, pushed down to long-on for one
length ball, angling in, he gets inside the line and clips this through square leg and finds the gap perfectly
slower offcutter now, 118ks, pushed to long-on for one

short_text: Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: on-pace first up, on a length, 136ks, angled across him, beats him on the drive
short of a length, tucked off the hip

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: top edge on the hook but not a smart ball with the fine leg up. De Kock knows this bouncer is too high to control but he also knows there is no one back to catch this. He gets six off the top edge

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, outside off, driven to extra cover

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: that's a shot and a half. This is a length ball pitched just outside leg, and de Kock picks it early to use his pace and play the pick-up over long leg

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and off, pushed back to him

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: quick length ball, middle and leg, punched to mid-on

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, OUT
long_text: what an uncharacteristic shot from Rohit. He doesn't take risks this early, and de Kock is going well at the other end. So it is a surprise he slogs at this. Axar's pace is slow so he ends up dragging this to deep midwicket. He suggests he is trying to hit it straighter, but he is gone now

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, sliding in with the arm. Defended back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: full, on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: quick length ball, angled into the pads, and he clears mid-on with this loft easily

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: reverse sweep, but Axar has slowed this down so he doesn't get much timing on it. Goes past point for two

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: driven hard to the right of Axar, who gets a hand to this, but this isn't really a chance
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: a touch too full, a touch too straight, and de Kock sweeps this past square leg for four

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: tries to go back and late-cut this length ball, but gets a bottom edge

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: first boundary of the innings, and he makes it a big one. De Kock sees the ball is not turning so goes with the angle and lofts this length ball over mid-on

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: quick, on a length, just outside off, sliding in, pushed to cover
offbreak, which doesn't turn. Punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: quicker, short of a length, looking to protect the over. De Kock punches this to extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: slow through the air, de Kock makes room to punch this straight of deep midwicket for two

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: quicker, flatter, 100ks, worked to leg for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: Sharma tries the big drive over mid-on, but Axar slows it down, and he gets a big inside edge into the pad

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: on a length, turning into the pads, pushed to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: slow, on a length, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to mid-on for one

short_text: Nortje to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short ball, gets big on him, but Rohit manages to keep the pull down
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for one

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
short of a length, no room, pushed towards point for one and they take the second off the direct-hit overthrow

short_text: Nortje to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, just outside off, off the inside half of the bat to mid-on

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, no room, defended from the crease
quick bouncer, down the leg side
uppish drive as he goes hard at a back-of-a-length ball. Gets a single wide of mid-off

short_text: Rabada to de Kock, no run
long_text: wide length ball, driven hard, but straight to short extra cover
full, outside off, driven straight of mid-off, but the dive keeps them down to one

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, slight swing, hits the inside half of his bat

short_text: Rabada to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: has he started with a slower ball? Full, on the pads, pushed to midwicket
high full toss outside off, Carey hits along the ground for just a couple, square of deep point
full toss, angling in, tucking hum up, hit straight of long-on for two
misses out. Full toss, on the pad. Just a touch too quick. Mis-hit to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: that will make Dhawan breathe slightly easier. Bumrah gives him the rare length ball, and Dhawan goes deep into the crease to loft him over midwicket
slower ball, really full, hit hard, straight of long-off. Gets a couple
full toss, angling in, cramps him up as he backs away. Just the single to long-off

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: pinpoint yorker to end the over. No room either. So he can't manoeuvre a single either

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: finally a boundary for Dhawan. Boult misses the yorker by inches, bowling a half-volley on the toes, and Dhawan manages to beat deep square leg with this
cramps him up with a shortish ball. Cut to deep point. This is excellent bowling
nearly a yorker, just outside off, driven to long-off for one
makes room to go into the short side, doesn't nail it, deep point keeps the ball in
slower short ball, makes him hit to the big side, just the single to deep midwicket
slower ball, on a length, driven hard but gets only a single to long-off

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhawan backs away early, Bumrah slips in one full and wide. No chance to get close to it
full, almost a yorker, on off, dug out to deep cover for one
full and fast, clipped off the toes, easy two into the leg side
lovely dipping slower ball full toss, Carey gets a bottom edge to it, but they sneak in a two to long-on
Dhawan looks for the ramp over short fine, Bumrah bowls the slower one and also wide of off. He can't place it wide of the man. Just the single
short of a length, around off, punched wide of deep midwicket for two
punched hard to extra cover for one
tries the reverse sweep, gets a massive to edge, which clears the strong point field inside the circle

Stoinis runs on the misfield, and has been run out. Tries the big loft down the ground, goes off the inside half of the bat to long-on. Suryakumar Yadav gets a bad bounce and a wobble, Stoinis thinks that is enough for the second, but the thing is, the ball still rests with him and doesn't go too far. Which is probably why Dhawan doesn't come. And rightly so because Stoinis has taken just four steps, and still can't make it back in time
stays back to punch this shortish delivery to deep cover for one
short, wide, cut away powerfully, but Rohit saves three runs with a dive at cover-point
Stoinis backs away early, Boult slips a full wide one, Stoinis gets no power into the drive. Takes the single to deep cover
slower short ball, angling in, but angling too far down leg
what a player Stoinis is proving out to be for DC. This time he beats mid-off to his left. Boult misses the yorker length, Stoinis makes room and drives this between extra cover and mid-off
picks his field. The mid-off is up so Stoinis is making room early and targetting that part of the field. Gets a short-of-a-length delivery, but he still powers it straight of mid-off for four
bouncer, 133ks, over his left shoulder. Stoinis leaves this alone
short of a length, on-pace, tucked off the hip for one to short fine leg. That brings up Dhawan's fifty

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length, on-pace, and Dhawan punches this past point. The sweeper, Chahar, is off the fence so he has to be perfect with his angles if he has to cut it off. He is not
slower ball, short of a length, wide outside off. Called too
seems like the carrom ball, on a length, pretty accurate, hit back to Pandya
lap sweep first up, and places this fine of fine leg
short of a length, quick, and Iyer finds deep midwicket who is a few yards off the fence. Seems slightly early into it. Off the toe end it goes
only Pandya is appealing for the lbw here. Dhawan looks for the reverse lap here, and gets a bit of bat on this. Only a bit. So it is just the single
mis-hit as Iyer slogs a length ball, but it doesn't carry to long-on
full, wide and fast, trying to stay out of Iyer's reach, but Iyer reaches it all right and drives this over point
down the wicket, yorks himself up, digs this out hard and Chahar lets it slip through his hands for a single
short and straight this time, pulled to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, wide. Dhawan misses out. Finds the man at extra cover. Six feet either side, and this would be four
on a length, middle and off, legbreak, driven to long-off for one
shorter, flatter, pulled for one off the bottom half of the bat

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: first boundary off Chahar. He loks for a slow wrong'un, but pitches up a half-volley. So it doesn't matter which way it is turning. Dhawan has drilled this straight of long-off
short of a length, accurate, punched to straight extra cover. Three overs without a boundary now
low full toss, but jammed in really low, goes off the toe end to short finee for one
on a length, into the pads, worked to leg
full toss outside off, driven into the cover
length ball, into the pads, clipped to leg
length ball, stops at him, and nearly a return catch. Falls short
soft hands again as Bumrah gives him neither the length to hit nor the room to swing. Another single to point
short of a length, pitched outside leg, tucked off the hip
short of a length, just outside off, soft hands for a single to point
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
and nearly a wicket first ball. Seems lightly off pace, short of a length, and he makes room to cut, and it goes in the air and wide of point
wrong'un, Dhawan goes back to punch this to deep cover
on a length, no room, Iyer plays with soft hands and places this in front of point
punched down to long-off for one
flighted slow legbreak, driven to long-off for one
tossed up outside off, pushed with an open face. Gets a thick edge to short third
on a length, on off, pushed with an open face for one
slower ball, short of a length, tucked off the hip, and they take two as this ball doesn't cross the 30-yard circle at backward square leg. Using the big side of the field for couples
delightful. Pattinson bowls a quick accurate bouncer, Iyer arches back and ramps this late and fine of third man for four
short ball, middle and leg, pulled to deep square leg for one
short of a length, around off, pushes this towards point with soft hands and comes through for one
bouncer, 133ks, down the leg side
on a length, closer to off, pushed to cover
but Iyer keeps attacking Pattinson. Not a horrible ball. Wide length ball, but this gives him the pace to time it with a square-drive. Places this to the left of point, and right of third man
wrong'un, too short, and Dhawan goes back to pull this wide of deep midwicket for two
short of a length, single to deep cover again
looks to make room, Chahar stays on a length and straight. Dhawan pushes this past point for one
another cut, another single. Bowling to his field
manages to cut this time to deep point for one

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, sits in the surface, Dhawan early into the cut, ends up hitting this back to Chahar
short of a length, outside off, slight more power in this dab so they will get just the one
slower ball outside off, Dhawan pushes this to the 30-yard circle at point, and calls two early, and makes it too. That is the big side of the ground
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed down to long-on
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

short_text: Pollard to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball again, shortish, widish, and Dhawan makes room to cut. Chahar at point is wrong-footed, and they get four
slower ball, full, outside off, pushed to long-on for one

short_text: Krunal to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower through the air so Dhawan tries the paddle sweep but is still early into it. Hit on the back of the bat
soft hands, pushed for a single to cover
they convert zero into two. Iyer gets a bottom edge on the cut, and charges through for a quick single. Hardik Pandya from cover lets rip a wild throw, and they take the second
slightly round-arm, on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
low full toss, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
length ball, outside off, punched down to long-off

short_text: Pattinson to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, runs this square on the off side
slower ball, down the leg side, Iyer wants four and not the wide. However, the change of pace means he doesn't get all of this. Just the single to square leg
not a bad ball this time, but Iyer shows great touch. Push-drives a wide length ball on the up, past the diving fielder at cover
length ball down the leg side, with fine leg up. Easy four. Pattinson having an off night here
down the wicket, drives a short-of-a-length ball to deep cover

short_text: Pattinson to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length, just outside off, but Dhawan opens the bat face really late to guide this between the keeper and short third man
hits the pad again but this one is sliding down leg
Pandya shortens the length this time, and he pushes this towards cover for one

short_text: Krunal to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: crunched away. Lovely sound. Out of the screws. Clears the front leg, and plays the big slog sweep over midwicket
full, middle and leg, nudged to square leg for what looks like a risky single but Kishan fumbles to make it a comfortable one

lovely arm ball from Krunal. Given lbw, and Rahane refuses to review after Dhawan suggests this might perhaps be a touch high. Short of a length, angling in, Rahane looks to punch this to midwicket and misses completely. Hit in front of middle but high on the pad. Replays confirm the height was good
plays the big sweep shot first up. Gets a single to deep square leg
moves across, gets inside the line, clips this full toss into the leg side

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: excellent fielding by Ishan Kishan at cover-point. Dhawan thinks he has broken the shackles when he skips out of the crease, and punches this short ball square on the off side, but Kishan saves four runs with a dive on the edge of the circle

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: shimmies down, Bumrah shortens the length, he tries the slog-pull, and misses

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full toss, Dhawan hits this straight to mid-off. Just a touch too quick, gets hurried into this

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slightly short of a length, same line, heading towards off. Pushed with an open face

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, punched to mid-off
length ball outside off, pushed to cover-point
no slip there. After two tight-line deliveries, Boult goes full outside off, and Rahane gets a genuine edge on the drive. The slip would have gobbled this up, but MI have taken it out
length ball, pitches middle and off, swings back in, defended to mid-on
quick bouncer, just outside off, pulled down to short midwicket
full, hits the pad, appeals for lbw as Rahane falls over, but this is pitched outside leg
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single to long leg
short of a length, just outside off, played with an open face to cover-point
another wide down the leg side. Proving to be a long over
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
away swing, but Rahane gets a stride in, covers the movement, and drives this on the up. This time to the right of point
full and wide down the leg side
short of a length, slight seam back in, cramping him up. Pushed to midwicket
full and straight, but Rahane can't beat square leg with his clip
wide length ball, positive movement into the ball, drives this on the up, past the man diving at point
runs this length ball down to third man for one
full, outside off, driven square for two
swinging in towards off, Rahane lunges forward and defends

he has chipped one to short cover. On a length, Shaw looks to push to cover, but the ball doesn't quite come on to the bat, and he ends up offering a catch to short cover. Plays in front of his body, and the bat face slices open in his hands. Big wicket. Early signs that the pitch might be slow
on a length, on off, angles away, Shaw pushes with soft hands, gets an outside edge and that goes between slip and short third man
full, slight shape back in towards off, defended
pumps it over the cover boundary and breaks into dance! It's a full toss outside off, he hangs leg side of it and hammers it inside-out. The win is sealed
short of a good length just outside off, pulled off the front foot to long-on's left
good length, slower ball at off stump. Closes the face and picks this up to deep midwicket's left. Shankar had no real chance of stopping the second, and he fumbled it anyway running to his left.
low full toss outside off, hard hands again as he looks to drive through the off side. Inside edge down to long-on

dragged to long-off's right. Slower ball at a good length outside off, wants to lace that through the covers but is too eager. It's cue-ended over the bowler's head though and that gives them a second
low full toss outside off, goes a little too hard with the attempted drive and ends up slicing with one hand off the bat to sweeper cover
low full toss outside off, into the leg side again and slices to sweeper cover

and now he lifts one over fine leg! This is genius batting from Tewatia. He is playing SRH right now, just opening up whichever side of the field that he wants. It's going to be full from Natarajan, so there is an option to walk into the off side as well and that's what he goes with this time. Picks up this low full toss from middle and gets it a long way over that fielder in the deep
gets it past mid-off! Low full toss at leg stump, backs a long way into the leg side and opens the face. Gets this off the low part of his bat but it bounces past Warner's dive to the right
low full toss at off stump, clears the front leg and drives to long-off's left
low full toss on middle stump, walks into the leg side and manages to only slice this towards sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tewatia, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops that on the pad. It's fine of short fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tewatia, no run
long_text: the luck's on his side as he survives both a catch behind and a stumping. Short of a length googly outside off, looks for the cut and runs straight away. Gets an outside edge that deflects off Bairstow's leg and onto the stumps. But the zing bails don't fall off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tewatia, FOUR runs
long_text: now he goes over extra cover! He made them move sweeper cover to deep backward point and now he puts this full ball outside off right where that fielder might have stopped it. Just uses the angle. Remember how he struggled to get this exact angle away against Bishnoi in that famous match?  He's found a way

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tewatia, FOUR runs
long_text: and again! Stunning attack from Tewatia. No playing Rashid out. This is a googly, good length and at middle stump. Switches again and lifts it past backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tewatia, FOUR runs
long_text: whips it to the backward point boundary! He's switched his grip, and made full connection with this middle stump full toss to lift it over backward point
good length and ripping away from off stump. Guides it to short third's left off the outside edge
short at middle stump, shuffles and tucks this through vacant square leg

dinks it over the keeper! Superb execution. Parag has 14 off his last three balls and they're up to 17 this over. This is full ball at middle stump, he gets down into the off side, drops the shoulders and almost looks like he's yorked himelf. But somehow he manages to meet this on the half volley and steer it over YJB
beats sweeper to the right. Slower short ball wide outside off, waits on it and chops it over extra cover. Rashid sprints to the right but his slide is not enough
inside on the full toss and it's onto his pads. He's feeling sorry for himself for missing out even as Parag calls him through and sneaks a run pitch side
overpitched outside off, drilled firmly past the non-striker and they steal a second to Warner's left at long-off

more sweet-sounding pulls! Dropped halfway down at middle stump, this knuckle ball. And just outside off. It's easier not to put this away. Tewatia onto the front foot and bludgeons this over wide long-on

oh that is massive! Slower short ball sitting up at middle stump and he pummels this pull shot off the front foot. It echos across the ground and slams into the flex banners in the first tier. 97 metres
slower ball just outside off, pushed through the covers with an open face
slower ball just outside off, closes the face and gets a leading edge through the covers

dropped by deep midwicket. Well, technically it's not a drop if you don't even get a hand on it. Garg completely misses this after making the ground, to get under it. Slower short ball climbing up at middle stump, through the pull early and sliced. He just overruns this and can't get a hand with the reverse cup
slammed past the bowler who couldn't get a hand on this catch attempt. Slower short ball outside off, flat-batted to long-off's left
slower short ball, wide outside off, mistimed drive straight to extra cover
yorker at leg stump, 135kph, jammed to long-on's left
full and just outside off, driven to long-off

run-out appeal on the non-striker's end as Natarajan dives for this in his follow through. He thinks he's got his little finger on this, on the left hand. At the moment of impact, Parag is about a foot outside the crease. Has he made it back before ball hits stumps? He was already reaching backwards as this straight drive off a full toss came back at the bowler.Doesn't matter because the third umpire can't conclusively say that touched Natarajan's finger. Good chance Parag was back in too. Yes he was
low full toss just outside off, punched to long-off off the toe-end
full and tailing into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
leading edge over the bowler. Full slower ball at leg stump, closes the face too early but this is safely down to long-on
full slower ball outside off, leans in and flicks to deep square
slower length ball just outside off. Mistimed drive on the up, back to the bowler who lets an easy one slip and concedes the single at mid-off
good length at leg stump, clipped to long-on's right
good length outside off, nice flowing drive on the rise to long-off's left
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket off the front foot
short of a good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to long-off
length and just outside off, cut to short third man
good length and down leg side, beaten on the glance
good length and down leg side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
just short of the bowler. Full and into off again. Aerial drive again as he checks this. Shankar dives forward in the follow through but it's died on him early
full outside off, driven aerially towards mid-off
good length and onto the pads, flicked through square leg
thin edge taken well! Full outside off, a legbreak that he tries to drive through cover. Not close enough to it in the end and Bairstow does well with that. He's over the moon and so is Rashid

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: good length and turning away from off stump, squares him and makes him defend off the back foot
good length on middle stump, driven to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, 3 leg byes
long_text: googly at a good length, down leg side, edge on the attempted flick. It's past the keeper and then Khaleel puts in a valiant sprint and reaches out to drag that in with his left arm. He's diving onto his right hip, but going at this leading with his left hand. He drags it in as his head is about to smash into the boundary padding, and then, somehow, manages to nutmeg himeself and keep that in as his left leg is lifted! Brilliant effort. He was running back from short fine and short third was around to pick up his flick
good length outside off, patted to sweeper's right off the back foot and takes on Shankar's arm to just make it in for the second

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, clipped to midwicket off the back foot. That was turning in to him
full on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to backward point's left
full on middle stump, driven to long-on's right
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and in at middle stump. Flicked to midwicket
good length and just outside off, shuffles and taps to long-on with soft hands

short_text: Rashid Khan to Parag, no run
long_text: another review sent up for lbw, this time by the bowling team. Googly hits him in front of leg as he gets forward to defend this. Surely that's sliding down yes it is. Missing leg. Warner needed a lot of convincing and took it right at the end. That's their review gone and the teams are level now on that front
googly, good length and in at leg stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
full on leg stump, nicely punched off the front foot to long-on's left
slider at middle stump, quickly pulled to deep backward square's left
good length googly at middle, leans in and clips to midwicket's right

trapped on the back foot and he reviews the lbw decision. Good length ball, seems like a conventional legbreak. But no, replays show that pitched on middle before sliding onwards to leg stump, where Uthappa is caught on the pad trying to play the glance as this keeps a touch low. It's three reds on DRS and he's gone straight after the break.
short and wide outside off, hangs back and chops that past point. Sweeper with no chance again
full at middle stump, driven aerially past the bowler, down to long-on
good length on leg stump, shuffles and clips to deep midwicket's right with soft hands
good length just outside off, shuffles and punches to long-on
good length outside off, driven sweetly on the up to sweeper's right
full slower ball on leg stump, leans in and clips to deep midwicket's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Samson, no run
long_text: appeal for lbw again but this might be striking outside off and there's an inside edge on it. Good length outside off, a googly and he was looking to block on the front foot
tossed up outside off, drives neatly to sweeper's right
good length and just outside off, onto the back foot and flicks to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, nudged to long-on
googly at a length on middle, leans in and taps it to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Uthappa, no run
long_text: lbw appeal turned down. Possible bat on that as Uthappa looks to whip a googly through midwicket. Spun in sharply and caught him in front of leg
good length on off stump, slides on. Punched to long-on off the back foot
dropped short and down leg side, pulled to short fine
full on off stump, driven to long-off
wow, stunning. Short of a length at leg stump, walks into the leg side and shows all three stumps before punching this aerially to extra cover's left. Sweeper has no chance
loose and put away. Short and into the pads. Swivels and places this pull to long leg's left
full and into leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
beaten and a maiden. Offcutter, good length and just outside off. Tentative drive at that as it cuts away from him
full and at middle stump, nicely-timed drive, straight to mid-on
slower ball, good length and ripping away from off stump. Nudged into the covers
short at middle stump, shuffles and whips to midwicket's right. Rashid's dive means no single
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off's right
short at leg stump, watchfully glanced to short fine
top edge over the keeper. Is this the day he finds some luck? So far so good. He was outdone by this slower ball. Dug in short outside off and he wanted to pull. Had to check the shot in the end
full and just outside off, check-drive out to extra cover
launched over short fine. Poor bowling but that is sweetly put away. Fine leg is in and he goes short and down leg side. Uthappa just helps it with a pull, nails the timing
slower ball, short and very wide outside off. Left alone
short and rapidly across the corridor, 140.9kph. Sways away to let that go

appeal for catch behind and given! Rajasthan are three down in the powerplay yet again.Good length and pushed across middle stump. He looks to close the face on that and turn it into the leg side. Gets an inside edge onto thigh and it dies on Bairstow, who does well to scoop it up
length outside off, punched towards mid-off

looks like they have Smith at the non-striker's end. Yup, by a long long way. It's a slower short ball pulled to deep square and they've come back for a second that Smith can't make even with a big, desperate dive. Natarajan picks the one-bounce throw and lobs it onto the stumps. Smith doesn't wait for the third umpire's decision.Smith was hesitant. It was Buttler's call. Paradoxically, it was Smith who ran the first one hard and got there before Buttler got to the other end. Just a slight pause as Buttler hared back for the second - and he looked like he would have completed it. But Shankar, running to his left, put in the perfect throw
over the line in a second! Wow. Short at the hips and it's a short-arm pull that is timed so perfectly that it's gone about waist height before dipping over the backward square boundary
smoked. Short ball is a bit too short. Doesn't get steep, sits up instead and Buttler nails that pull well in front of square
yorker at middle stump, squeezed towards mid-off
slower length ball on middle stump, punched to long-on
full slower ball outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off
slower length ball outside off, punched sweetly off the back foot to find sweeper cover
slower length ball outside off, shuffles and clips through square leg
full outside off, leans in and slices to sweeper
good length and swung in at off stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
good length and just outside off, shoveled with the angle to backward point's left and Pandey tumbles to stop the run
good length on middle stump and neatly tucked through midwicket. Shuffles onto the back foot and uses the pace to work this to deep square's left
full outside off, 140.5kph, drives firmly to extra cover
short and just outside off, 137kph, punched into the covers

played on! There's more evidence of a slow pitch. It's a short ball climbing away outside off. He shuffles and wants to pull through midwicket but it's off the inside edge and onto leg stump. Khaleel is overjoyed, and who wouldn't be with this wicket? Yet another opening combo fails for RR, four times in a row now
short at middle stump, punched to midwicket's right
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off's left
short of a length and across him outside off, whips to mid-on's left
short of a length and swung away outside off. Mistimed cut to cover
whack. First runs for Stokes in IPL 2020. And it is a trademark punch past the bowlers. Steps out at this outswinger to cut out the angle and pumps it on the rise between Sandeep and mid-on
beaten. Good length and skidding low outside off, swung away. Beaten on the chop
good length outswinger from off stump, walks down the pitch and defends down the pitch

full slower ball wide outside off, reaches out and lofts to long-off's left. Jofra picks up on the bounce and then sends a vicious throw to the striker's end on the bounce. Garg has no chance of making it

waits on that and lofts it nicely over short fine. Slower short ball. Shapes for the hook and then waits a long time on it to deliberately lift that in that direction. Wasn't looking to hit that hard, and didn't need to
slower short ball just outside off. Steps out and tries to make room for the cut. Gets an inside edge to short fine
good length slower ball wide outside off, neaten on the attempted reverse sweep

overthrows at midwicket again. Slower ball, short of a good length outside off. Punched on the bounce to Stokes who wants to get KW at the non-striker's. Would have too if he'd gotten a direct hit, but instead Smith has to clean up at deep midwicket and his return throw slips and there's a brief thought about a third run at mid-on before Unadkat sprints after it
good length slower ball pushed wide outside off. Sliced towards sweeper cover
swept over deep midwicket! Slower ball at a good length outside, just hangs on a touch to wait on it and then gets the perfect timing on it. That is difficult on this pitch. Sweet hit
quality. Williamson gets two sixes to close off Archer's spell. This one is classic KW. Short at the hips and he swivels perfectly to get in position and helps this over long leg
low full toss on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square's left
short and cramping him at the waist. Pulls from under it and it's well short of deep square
just evades extra cover. Stokes diving backwards and to his left. It's a high-ish full toss outside off and he slices that
bowled him with a legcutter. Full and smashes leg stump and deflects to short third. Garg takes off for the run but is sent back. He was looking slog that
high full toss above the waist. Mistimed pull towards fine leg

casually lofts a Jofra slower ball, one-handed, to long-on's left. This, of course, is what Williamson is known for - the walk into the leg side and desperate swishing to try and reach the ball. 94 metres!
slower ball, short and cutting away from the corridor. Looks to turn it into the leg side but can't get it off the pitch
slower ball, short and outside off. Cut to sweeper cover

holes out to long-on. It was coming. This is extremely savvy from Unadkat. It's near impossible to hit slower short balls into the leg side today. He gets this to sit up at chest height and has him slicing. A simple catch well inside the boundary from long-on
slower short ball at leg stump. Another laboured pull, this time to deep midwicket's left on that big boundary
digs it in, short and turning away outside off. Steps out and hoicks off the inside edge to get this to deep midwicket's right
slower ball, short of a good length outside off. He shapes for the ramp but is forced to adjust and push this to short third

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: short outside off, and a bit too high as he looks to pull from under this
short and up at middle stump, aerial pull to deep midwicket's right
brings up fifty from 40 balls. It's a full toss onto his pads and he can't get the swish away to Archer's left at fine leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: nicely placed. Delivered looking for the blockhole on the the leg side but Pandey takes a step down and makes this a hittable full stop. Deliberately checks his flick to place it between deep square and deep midwicket
low full toss on off stump, shuffles and flicks to long-on
and there's his famed yorker first up. Nails it at a leg stump line. Pandey awkwardly gets both legs into the leg side and does okay to squeeze this behind square
full and wide outside off, extends the arms and drives to long-off's left
good length and angled into him. Steps out and clips through square leg
oh this is smoked. Pushed through a bit quicker and that helps as Pandey runs down to the pitch of this length ball and smokes it 94 metres, into the second tier over long-on
short and wide outside off, cut to cover
short outside off, steps out and flicks it right onto his boot

Tyagi comes in and this clears him at deep midwicket. Short ball really dug in. Pandey steps out and puts his entire upper body into this pull shot, back leg lifted and all. Tyagi is already in from the rope on the big side, but he takes a few more steps in and that costs him
short and in the corridor. Leaps to try and get on top of that. It's at 148kph. His attempted glide to third man can't beat Buttler to his right
bouncer rising sharply in the corridor, left alone

splits middle and leg! Superb. Didn't get him early on but gets him anyway. Around the wicket, full and and fast and angled in at leg stump. Warner walks into the leg side and makes room to drive through cover. Misses it entirely

yorker at middle stump, 145.5kph. Squeezed to extra cover's left. Samson swoops down at it and makes Warner scramble at the non-striker's end. Might have just made it even if there was a direct hit. Earns an overthrow at midwicket for his efforts
full and curves into the corridor at 145kph. Warner beaten on the inside edge as he looks to loft in long-on's direction
good length legcutter at middle, driven to long-on
good length and pushed through outside off with the front of his hand. Slapped on the rise between bowler and stumps. Long-off does well to tumble to his left and stop. Parag the fielder
full and front-of-the hand outside off. Warner steps into the off side and is beaten on the sweep
front of the hand short ball outside off, punched to deep extra cover
just clears long-on. Good length at off stump, steps out to get to the pitch and then a laboured drag with a closed face. There's enough on it
short and spinning away outside off. Under-edge as he goes too hard on the cut
short and dug into the pitch, wide outside off. Makes him reach out and club that on the bounce to long-off
slower short ball outside off. Looks for the pull, ends up slicing to long-on's left. He pulls out to collect it on the bounce and gets one or two shouts from the field. Shreyas Gopal
slower short ball from over the wicket, pulled to deep midwicket
low full toss at middle stump, mistimed slog to deep midwicket
nice connection on this slog, but it's on the bounce to deep midwicket. Good length and a cutter outside off. That's about the best you'll get with a slog on this pitch against a slower ball
slower ball, dug in short of a good length. Dragged with a front foot pull to deep midwicket
good length and into the corridor. Forward stride as he pushes to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off

drops short of short fine leg. Tewatia goes around the wicket and bowls full at leg stump. It's there for the conventional slog but Warner was looking for the switch hit. Leading edge is well short of the fielder
full on off stump, driven to long-off
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
good length and sliding in at middle stump. Defended to extra cover
good length and sliding into leg stump. Driven to midwicket's left
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandey, no run
long_text: short and up at middle stump. Backs into the leg side to try and open up the off. But that's so slow onto him that he can only forehand that to mid-off
short and down leg side, gets up and hooks that towards fine leg
short at middle stump, pulled between deep square and fine leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Warner, SIX runs
long_text: spanked over mid-off. Short ball takes an eternity to lift up outside off. He waits on that crunches it. Mid-off is in the circle. He had to use his own power for that, got nothing off the surface
good length and wide outside off, clears the front leg and looks to slap through cover on the up. Gets an under-edge into the turf and it's a good stop to the right from Buttler, diving to his right
short and wide outside off, allows that to come on and cuts late to place this to sweeper's right
good length and in at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and pushed across him outside off, Dragged aerially to deep midwicket's right
good length and sliding into middle stump, punched to long-on with the angle
short and wide outside off, going away from him. No power on this pull to long-on
good length and turning away outside off. Punched to long-on with a closed face
swatted over wide mid-off! Short ball hits up nicely and it's put away firmly with a flat bat
short and down leg side, left alone
short at off stump, pulled off the front foot deep square's left
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to mid-off
good length and in at leg stump. Clipped to deep square's right
googly, short outside off. Onto the back foot to punch to long-off's right
googly, short and turning into off stump. Punched to sweeper's right
front of the hand again, good length at leg stump. Punched to long-on's left
slogged over wide long-on. Nice pace on this front-of-the-hand quicker one that's full at leg stump. Front leg out of the way and boom
converntional legbreak, short of a good length and turning away from off. Onto the back foot to punch to sweeper
good length, front of the hand legcutter? Just outside off and pushed to extra cover
checks the shot again. A googly sits in the pitch outside off and he pushes it aerially, but safely, back to the bowler
swiped past short third. Set up for the switch hit and this was short enough that he could wait outside off and get it fine of that fielder off the back foot
full and slanted into off stump, opens the face and drives that down to long-off
good length and in at middle, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
lofts that straight. One of his go-to shots when spinners attack his stumps and he's good at it. Right to the pitch, a clean swing to send that 89 metres
good length and slanted into leg stump. Defended to midwicket
good length and down leg side, left alone
well bowled. Outfoxed Warner there who was set to loft that straight. Had to check it and pat this good length ball back to the bowler
offcutter at a good length on middle. Walks into that as he flicks to midwicket
good length and angled into him. Might have been an offcutter too. Pushed into vacant midwicket
half-stop at mid-on. Good length ball across him, whips it to Jofra's left, against the angle
short and across off stump. Steps out and runs into the line of this one. Cramped and pokes into midwicket
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Warner, no run
long_text: short and across him outside off, flat-batted drive on the up, straight to mid-off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Warner, no run
long_text: bouncer at a leg stump line, left alone

lovely catch to the left at deep square. Tyagi gets this one higher and Bairstow is done by the pull shot! It's up at the throat this time, angled in from outside off. He's pulling off the front foot again gets it high on the bat. Samson tracks it nicely to the left before diving to hold on with a soft landing

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Bairstow, SIX runs
long_text: whipped over square leg now. Don't feed Bairstow there! Tyagi likes bowling wide of the crease and the first three balls have been a perfect release for Bairstow. This one is the best of them all, because it's close to his body. He's on the front foot for the short-arm pull
short of a length and wide outside off again, 137.5kph. Swipes it behind the deep square fielder off the inside half
wide of the crease, short of a good length and wide outside off. Flat-batted slash at that ends up to deep square's left off the thick inside edge
googly and cramped again at middle stump. Mistimed back foot punch trickles into the covers
good length and turning into middle. Whipped to long-on off the back foot
good bowling. Bairstow was on a middle and off stump guard with leg stump visible. Looking to open up the leg side. He bowls a googly at cutting length and cramps him anyway. He can only find point
good length and skidding through outside off. Punched to mid-off's right
checks the lofted sweep but it's good enough. Googly at middle stump, going away from a good length. Just drags it over midwicket
good length and just outside off. Steps out and has a swing through the line but he isn't to the pitch of this. It's dragged to long-on's left
a misfield at midwicket means no maiden for Archer. Slower length ball harmlessly pushed to the midwicket fielder off the front foot. Tewatia runs past it
good length and in at middle stump, watchfully nudged to midwicket. 150.1kph that one
forced to evade that. 145kph bouncer lifting up at his face. Was halfway into a hook before that rose up and he got out of the way
short and 148kph, climbing up outside off. Watchful punch to cover point
short of a length outside off, 142.7kph, hurried punch into the covers
good length and just outside off, patted into the covers off the back foot
full and angled in from the front of the hand. Gets the front leg across and drives to long-on
googly, short of a length and in at off stump. Miscued punch to extra cover
good length outside off, watchfully swept towards backward square because that stopped on him
tossed up full on middle stump, slugged along the floor to long-on's left
good length outside off, jabs to point off the front foot
googly, short of a good length outside off. Onto the back foot and punches to cover point
mean bouncer has him ducking. 145kph and angled at the helmet. Under that quickly and then seeks a wide from the square leg umpire. It is not forthcoming
short at leg stump, allows it to come on and nudges to deep square off the back foot
good length and just outside off, pushes towards mid-off with soft hands
good length and climbing up at his thigh. Tucked into the midwicket region
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
misses a full toss. Just outside off and he simply misses the drive. Oh correction, Ultra Edge says there was a nick on it but it bounced before going through to the keeper
yorker and just outside off, jammed down to long-on
full slower ball wide outside off, shuffles and skews the attempted slog into the off side
good length and across off stump, shuffles and looks for the slog. Beaten
full and wide outside off, beaten on the attempted drive
full and at the stumps, shuffles and drives to long-on's right
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
taken at deep midwicket. Full toss on leg stump, a hurried flick and hardly a step needed to be taken, it's straight into that fielder's grasp
short and at the hips. Springs onto the back foot and pulls this past square leg

takes it this time! A full toss outside off, Bravo looking to loft that over long-off but the bat turns and he miscues that. Padikkal with a similar sprint in and this time he's got his hands in position to grab it at waist height

dropped. At long-off by Padikkal, running in. Short and wide outside off, Bravo gets too far leg side and has a swish from under it. Padikkal makes the ground bit loses balance right at the end and cops that on the thigh
yorker at middle stump, shuffles and just manages to squeeze this into the midwicket region
yorker wide outside off, chopped to deep backward point
full and dipping in to the corridor. Mistimed drive in long-on's direction
slower good length ball at middle stump, mistimed slog to deep midwicket
full and just outside off, stands tall and whips this off the back foot to long-off's left. All hands, that shot

knocks middle stump and points to his captain at long-on. It's a loopy, slow full toss on off stump. He's in the off side looking for the paddle sweep. Paddles it onto middle stump. A laboured innings that never looked like taking off. Rayudu's struggle ends
full and wide outside off, steps out but that keeps dipping away from him. Reaches out and chips that over extra cover
full slower ball, wide outside off. Sliced to sweeper's left
low full toss outside off, swept to deep square
full and at off stump, makes room and drives straight to extra cover
good length at middle stump, backs away and mistimes the loft to extra cover's right
short and wide outside off, cut to backward point

there's a sound on it and bowler and keeper are convinced. They convince Kohli to review the catch behind appeal. It's a short ball at middle. Curran is backing into the off side for the ramp and there's a sound as ball passes glove and sails over the stumps. Early visions of the replay show this is a good review .And Ultra Edge confirms there's an edge on that.
full and in at off stump, plants the front leg across and whips it straight to short fine

taken at long-off! Calculative and consistent. Chahal's had a bad night tonight but with his last ball he's got Dhoni hitting exactly where he wants. This is tossed up full and wide outside off. Dhoni has to reach out a long way. He does and he gets a hammer down on the ball. But from his position, nearly split across the crease, he can't get elevation. It's right into the hands
good length, loopy at 78kph on a leg stump line. Looks for the slog sweep, but that turns away and gets him on the body
full on leg stump, flicked aerially to deep midwicket
clears long-on with ease. Chahal lobs this right in Dhoni's hitting arc at leg stump. He shuffles his feet and gets entangled somewhat, but has managed to keep his balance and drill this flat
good length at middle, steps out and drives aerially to long-on's left. Kohli swoops in and picks up on the bounce
good length and sliding on at off stump. Punched to deep extra cover
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
yorker at leg stump, jammed down to long-on
short and rising outside off, steps out and has a waft. Beaten
beaten. And perhaps a harsh wide ball. Slower short ball, just around the tramline. Rayudu has made too much room for the cut
carted away. Full ball outside off, steps into line and slogs and ugly slog well in front of square. Midwicket was in the circle

oh that's a meek end. Low full toss on off stump, mistimed punch to mid-off's left and he takes off for a run he's no even determined to finish. Sort of gives up and hopes at the end while Morris picks up and hits the stumps direct at the non-striker's
short and jags in off the seam outside off to beat his attempted late cut
short and in at the stumps, backs away and punches to sweeper
full and down leg side. Was played by the batsman's early shuffle into the leg side
full outside off, jumps into the off side to get in line and whip this to long-on's right
short and just outside off, steps out and slices a pull feebly down to long-on
whipped to the long leg boundary. Full and in at off stump, walks into the off side and uses the angle to find that boundary. Expertly done
run-out missed and overthrows at deep midwicket. Good length ball just outside off, punched to extra cover. Rayudu wants the run and is too slow to turn. Finch misses at the non-striker's end
oh another gorgeous shot from Jagadeesan. Short and climbing into him. Not a lot of pace on that and he eats into it. A controlled pull, placed to deep midwicket's right with the perfect balance
at the stumps and punched down to long-on
good length and spinning away, wide outside off. Too far for the sweep. Too far anyway, thinks umpire

gets the reverse sweep over short third man. Lovely execution. Actually, on second look, that's a switch hit because he's switched to a left-hander's grip. This is good length and tossed wide. He reaches out and lifts it
good length at off stump, steps out and mistimes a slog to deep miwicket
nicely bowled. Lands this wide after he sees Rayudu shape to advance down the pitch. He retreats in the end and lets it go
full, slow and wide outside off. Gets out a stride and looks to drive hard. Ends up slicing to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, gets down and sweeps firmly to deep square's left
full and at off stump, 144kph. No stride as he looks to drive. It's off the toe-end to extra cover's left
full toss outside off, sliced to sweeper's left
good length and in the corridor, slanted in. Mistimed on-drive is picked up by midwicket to his left
short and tucking him up at off stump. 143kph. Shuffles and can't get this glance square of midwicket
short and down leg side, looks for the glance and is beaten
slower short ball outside off, inside edge onto thigh as he looks for the pull
just clears mid-off. Good length ball Offers the full face and drives on the up. It's off the low part of the bat but it's enough
good length at middle stump, whipped into the vacant square leg region
short and slow, wide outside off. Mistimed cut into the covers
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on
good length and just outside off, poked into the covers
drilled straight. He's got class, that's for sure. Good length ball outside off, steps out to meet that at the pitch and nails the connection. It's flat and to long-off's right. Elegant
good length at middle stump, on the back foot and taps this into the leg side
and again. Short outside off, steps out and swishes under it to be beaten
beaten on the cut again. Happened a couple of times today. Short and outside off and he's swishing from under it
short and up at the ribs. Subdued pull to deep square
full slower ball outside off, attempted drive is off the thick inside edge to deep square's left
good length and angled in at middle stump. Gets an early stride in and is cramped. Forced to nudge this to midwicket
good length and in at middle stump, defended into the leg side
lands short of third man. Short ball at middle stump. He steps out and runs into its path. A forced ramp in the end but Chahal can't get close
short at the throat, a good looking hook into the turf, straight to fine leg
length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
ramped over the keeper. Nicely done. Short and rising in the corridor. Not express pace that. He arches into the leg side and watches that lift off the face of his bat
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
good length outside off, driven on the up to long-off
short outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
good length at leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
good length at middle stump, paddled straight to short fine
short at leg stump, swiped to deep square
good length outside off, onto the back foot to stab this into the covers
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
tossed up slow, at 77kph, on off stump. Leans in for the drive with the turn but that holds its line and hits the top part of his bat
good length and at off stump. Onto the back foot to whip to deep square
full outside off, gets to the pitch and flicks to long-on
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, leans in and taps it to point's right
short and just outside off, cut to backward point
short at middle stump, glanced to square leg's left off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot

out goes middle stump! Washington sprints into the leg side and takes a leap in celebration. Good length at off stump, spinning in towards him. In Watson's defence, this is there for the sweep that he's attempted. But he's not got low enough for it. From the position he's in, he's probably better going with the slog sweep from under the ball. What he ends up doing is swiping above it and he's disappointed
lifted to the long leg boundary. Good length, down leg side, some pace on it - Watson down on one knee to sweep behind square
good length and pushed through at 100kph, at middle stump. Hurried on the attempted punch into the covers
good length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full and just outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
beaten on the cut. 143kph. Short and wide outside off, steps out and has made too much room. Swishing under that in the end
past the outside edge. 142kph, rising up from a length. Rayudu defends for the angle into him and is caught inside the line
good length and just outside off, punched crisply on the front foot, straight at the bowler
short and just outside off, chopped to third man's right
full and into leg stump at 147kph. Looks to flick and cops that on the pad, outside the line of leg stump

taken at deep square! Two miscues and then he nails one, but that is the bigger side and I think he was looking to go straigther. Flat good length ball at middle stump, he wants to pick that up but ends up getting under it a tad too much and it turns into a sweep of sorts by the end. Not a slog sweep though, and it's taken a few yards inside the boundary
good length at middle stump, looks to reach out again for the lofted drive and gets a thick inside edge towards deep square
lands safely to long-on's right. Good length ball, reaches out and closes the face on this on off stump. Was looking to whip over midwicket and gets only elevation on it
good length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
close call on the lbw. Good length and pushed through too quick for Watson to get hold of the sweep. Caught him at leg stump though, so possibly going down
good length at off stump, punched back at the bowler who can't hold on cleanly to his right
swiped over square leg. Square leg and fine leg were both brought in for Watson this ball. It's a slower ball at a good length, middle stump line. He goes forward and lifts this with an upright sweep
short of a length and just outside off, cut straight to sweeper point
dropped marginally shot, pulled firmly out to deep square
good length and tight at middle stump. Forces him to defend on the front foot
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off off the inside half
good length and honing in at off stump. Watchfully defended into the covers
good length and in at the stumps, 141.9kph. Driven on the rise to mid-off
good length outside off, leans in nicely for this drive on the rise but Washington puts in a tumbling stop to his left at mid-off
short and wide outside off, left alone. That was too high

short_text: Saini to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, looks to drive through the line and is beaten

short_text: Saini to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full and in at middle stump, defended down the pitch

short_text: Saini to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
short and curving away outside off, gets the late cut straight to backward point
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut on the bounce to backward point
picked up over square leg. Morris with the inswinger this time at the stumps and Watson is waiting on it. Tiny stride to keep some room before he goes aerial with the flick
past the outside edge. Angled into the corridor and then straightening off the pitch as he brings down an angled bat to feel for this
beaten by an outswinger. Full and wide outside off, static feet as he has a swish at it
yorker outside off, jammed to extra cover
contentious wide. Good length ball outside off, starts outside the tramline but dips in late. Kohli lets it go and he gets the run
shovelled to deep midwicket's right. Might feel he missed out there. It's a full toss wide outside off, he shuffles into line and deliberately closes the face on this. Square leg and fine leg were in
full and wide outside off, walks into that shot and drills firmly to long-off's left

full and just outside off, allows that on and slices to deep backward point's left. Curran swoops down on that and puts in the throw. Kohli hares back and slides right through the middle of the pitch to make his ground

dropped in the follow through but that is hit too hard for him to have a realistic chance. Full ball outside off, in the line again is Kohli and drills it to Bravo's left, at face height. Bursts through to long-off's right

scooped it to vacant fine leg! Not a shot he ever plays. This is full and wide outside off, and he knows it's going to be there because there's no one behind square on the leg side. Gets in line, falls over but manages to get it there
full and wide outside off, can't manage to get bat on that and looks disappointed that's not been balled wide
yorker just outside off, jammed back down the pitch

just past Watson's grasp as he runs back from extra cover. Ovepitched ball ripe for the lofted drive, outside off. He's gone too hard and ends up slicing it high. Watson's not close to getting a hand on that
yorker just outside off, jammed down to long-off
leaping up to stop that. Jagadeesan nearly pulls off a blinder at backward point. This is a full wide ball that he looks to slice over him at point. Stretches and jumps to get the right hand on this

dropped at deep square but that was a no-ball on height. Full toss at the ribs. Miscues the pull. Jadeja goes reverse cup to his right and puts it down which means a second and Kohli will be back on strike for the free hit
pumped straight! Slower good length ball outside off, he steps out, meets it on the rise and puts one of the cleanest hits of the night. It's flat and to long-on's left
full and wide outside off, steps out and has to reach out again. Gets it down to deep backward point

short_text: Sam Curran to Kohli, SIX runs
long_text: expertly picked over square leg! Incredible shot, this, a stroke of genius. It's a full ball angling away from middle stump but he's stepped down and into the off side to line this up at his feet. From there, the wrists do the work. A quick flick and that just clears the vacant boundary there
full and wide outside off, gets the stride into the leg side and has a one-handed swish at this. The angle's taken it away from him
low full toss wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Kohli, SIX runs
long_text: slugged over long-on. Poor length from Curran. Just short of a driving length and with a lot of room outside off. Plants the front leg down and drags it on the up with his quick wrists
full and very wide outside off, left alone
full and just outside off, jammed down to long-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Dubey, SIX runs
long_text: Jagadeesan drops it at long-off. And tips it over the boundary too. Overpitched ball is there for the pummel straight and that's what Dube goes for. Ends up slicing it off the low part of the bat, the outside part. Jagadeesan has a margin of about a a foot or two behind him but ends up reaching behind and to his right at the end. That momentum makes the ball bounce out of his hand and towards the hoarding
whack. Fifty for Kohli. Short and into the hips, gets the weight onto the back foot and pulls with the angle to the long leg boundary
full and just outside off, wants to crunch that wide of mid-off but it's off the toe-end to the fielder
short at the ribs, rotates the upper body as he puts his weight into this pull shot to deep square's left
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, steps out and flicks to long-on's right
misfield by Faf at long-on. And an apology. Good length ball pushed gently towards him and he's slow getting down on that as he attacks it
hammered! Whew. That was hit hard. Good length and pushed through flatter outside off. Stood there and sent it back, head height to have both bowler and umpire evading as he bisected them
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, clipped into the midwicket region
attempted googly is down leg side, left alone
good length on middle stump, flicked back at the bowler with the turn
good length and just outside off, patted straight to extra cover
good length and sliding on at middle, mistimed pull to long-on

short_text: Sam Curran to Dubey, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
good length just outside off, punched on the rise to long-off
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
easily taken to his left by Dhoni. Short and wide outside off, looks to lace this behind square on the off side, absolutely chucks the hands at it. Can manage only a thick edge
length at middle stump, punched to long-on

short_text: Sam Curran to Kohli, SIX runs
long_text: a leading edge in line with the stumps and over the keeper. Short at leg stump, steps out and looks to pull from his hips. Face closed very early but he's got more than he would have if he'd got that off the middle
full on off stump, driven to long-off
short of a length just outside off, mistimed cut to sweeper's left as this skids on
short and on the pads, flicked to deep backward square
short and wide outside off, punched straight to extra cover
good length and turning away outside off, jabbed into the covers
appeal for lbw and then catch. Good length and sliding into the pad as he looks to flick. Going down leg and there was no bat so Dhoni's catch isn't all Jadeja thinks it is
full on off stump, jammed down to long-on
good length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
launched over long-on. Full and faster outside off this time. Good pace for a ball pitching just outside off if you're looking to slog. It's what he does and it's controlled
full on middle stump, driven to long-on's left
full at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off's right
full on middle stump, swept to deep midwicket
good length and into leg stump, tapped to midwicket's left
good length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
short and wide outside off, cut into the point region
appeal for lbw as he looks for the reverse sweep. Jadeja is around the wicket and turns this in from outside off. Caught in front of the stumps, but was that glove first? Looks like it
good length outside off, pushed into the off side on the front foot
good length outside off, pushed into the covers
good length and just outside off, mistimed punch into the covers

there's a sound and there's a wicket! AB de Villiers for a duck. Cross-seam delivery at a good length and in the corridor. He looks to drive from inside the line of that and gets a thin edge through to Dhoni. Thakur's penchant for getting the big players is alive - Russell in the last match, AB tonight
short and in the corridor, drops the arms to let that go. It dips on Dhoni
short of a length at leg stump, clipped to midwicket

taken at mid-off. Good length and in the corridor. Padikkal looks to drive through the line to try and clear mid-off, but that sticks in the pitch and he's through it early. Bottom hand comes off as well and it's easily taken by Faf. Padikkal didn't come to terms with this pitch tonight
just short of third man. Short and wide outside off, wants to slap that over the off side infield but it gets a bit wide for him and he's forced to open the face
good length at off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
full outside off, steps out and jams it down to long-off
clears long-on comfortably. Good length ball at middle stump, steps out and meets it right at the pitch and sends it cleanly over the fiedler. 94 metres
short and turning into the corridor, cut straight to extra cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off
good length and turning in from middle. Steps out and punches to long-on
short and wide across him, pulls firmly but not too far to long-on's left
full on middle stump, shuffles and drives to long-on's right
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length outside off, steps out and chopped to sweeper's left
full and wide outside off, lifted to long-off's right with extended arms
beaten. Short and across off stump, doesn't get up as he looks to pull
full on middle stump, flicked down to long-on
good length and turning in from off and defended down the pitch again
good length and turning in from outside off, watchfully pushed back down the pitch. Looked like he had to check a punch there
full and tossed up at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length on middle, some turn away. Punched to long-on
good length outside off, opens the face and runs it straight to backward point
short and wide outside off, cuts to third man's left. It's Watson down there and you can hear Kohli yell "push!" as they take off. Padikkal does and it's a comfortable second
full on off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
oh crunched. A floaty half-volley outside off and he digs into this. It's a slower ball. Nice and low with the stride and past extra cover, to his left
full and down leg side, left alone
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover
good length and just outside off, steps out and punches to long-on
short of a length and tucked at the mid-riff as he looks to flick this
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
short of a length outside off, steered into the off side with an open face
good length outside off, steps out and punches firmly between bowler and mid-off
good length and at leg stump, looks for the flick and cops it on the pad. Appeal for lbw turned down. That pitched outside leg
short of a length and just outside off, chopped to short third man
backs away and chops it past point. Good length and just outside off, used the angle to just slice that
good length and just outside off, defended into the off side with soft hands
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off, punched into the covers
good length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short and just outside off, shuffles and jabs it into the covers
good length on middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep backward square
bouncer dug in too short, left alone
full and just outside off, driven straight to mid-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: good length slower ball wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, punched firmly to mid-off
good length and just outside off, jabbed to point's right with soft hands
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length and down leg side, can't get the flick away
full on off stump, walks into the off side and jabs this off his toes to backward square's right

knocks out middle stump! Finch was utterly out of sorts tonight and it shows with this wicket. Woeful swish at this inswinger. It's a good length ball that hits the top of middle. Finch's feet were leg side, his bat swing outside off. Not pretty viewing at all for him
good length and just outside off, punched off the back foot to extra cover
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
short and across him, cut with an angled bat to third man
connects on one. Short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper point

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: gently tucked away. Good length ball slanted into the pads, just waited on that and used the pace to get it wide of mid-on
good length and down leg side, beaten on the attempted flick

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: beaten. Jumps past the outside edge. Short of a good length just outside off and seams away rapidly as he has a chop at this
short and just outside off, defended off the back foot
short and at the hips, tucked straight to deep square this time
good length and slanted into the thigh, flicked out to deep square

short_text: Sam Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: full outswinger at off stump, pushes with hard hands and gets this aerially towards extra cover
beaten. Short of a good length, swung away outside off. Keeps a touch low and is past the cut again
beaten again. Another outswinger, this one fuller outside off, and this time Finch is caught deep in the crease and pushing at it with static feet
beaten again and this time with swing the other way. A tad short, this outswinger, but it's past his cut
good length and swung into the corridor, looks to punch off the back foot and is beaten
