good length and just outside off, allows that in and opens the face to steer to third man
good length and some late shape in. Left alone
full and wide outside off, angled away from him. Left alone

oh KKR win this by the barest of margins. Narine goes for the safe quick ball, wide outside off. Maxwell gets a play on the short boundary, but his body has fallen away so he doesn't get all of this. It goes high in the air over cover, and lands inches short of the boundary. Umpire Gaffaney's eye is sharp. He rules it four on the field. The replays confirm it. He has yorked the cover boundary
he goes for a six into the big side of the ground. Clever bowling from Narine. KKR are favourites now. He has holed out. Gets too much under this front-of-the-hand delivery. Taken at deep midwicket

oh really slow offbreak again. Maxwell slogs again. Beaten again. This is some brave bowling. APpeal for lbw, not given out. They review it. This is turning down the leg side for mine. Yes it is missing. They get a leg-bye
Maxwell keeps KXIP in it. He switches his stance, to play almost a pull shot over extra cover. This is some shot. Targets the short boundary
brave bowling. Really slow in the air, an offbreak, middle and leg, beats the Maxwell slog. Valuable dot
quick length ball, Maxwell makes room and swings, this goes off the toe end. The mis-hit means they have time to come back for two

bowled'im. This is what happens when you leave yourself too much to do. Suddenly 74 off 58 doesn't look like a great effort after all. Full toss outside off, Rahul looks for the boundary into the leg side, and gets a big inside edge onto his wicket
full and wide, hit straight to deep point, and Nagarkoti allows them a second. KKR won't be happy with that

sharp offcutter bouncer. Singh is cramped as he looks to back away. Ends up trying to play an upper-cut but gets no power behind it because it has got big on him. Rana runs back from point to take the catch
short of a length, quick, no room, steered to third man for one
yorker, outside off, third man is fine enough to keep this cue-end in check
full and straight. Big swing, not much power, but this goes straight of long-on for two runs
offbreak, into the pads, he works it around the corner for one. Perfect result for KKR. Youngster back on strike

short_text: Narine to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
long_text: short of a length, wide, and Singh sees freedom. He hits hard, but straight to extra cover

short_text: Narine to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
long_text: carrom ball. Singh stays back and defends this length ball. Accurate again

short_text: Narine to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
long_text: offbreak, dipping, slow, headed for off. Defended to leg
oh Pooran. What is he doing here? Makes room early, Narine slows it down, bowl an offbreak, he swings across the line, his head falls away, he misses the ball, Narine hits the top of middle stump
carrom ball, short of a length, punched to deep cover for one
flighted outside off, soft hands, places it wide of cover
offbreak, from outside leg, opens the face, gets a single to short third man
short of a length, wicket to wicket, defended back to him
Pooran mis-hits this, but the idea is right. He is going wide of long-off into the short boundary. It falls wide enough of the man, and also rolls along for four
offbreak, middle and off, pushed to short cover
driven to deep cover for one
Pooran is killing this game right here right now. Nagarkoti tries the short ball, and Pooran drops this over the short boundary on the leg side
lovely shot. That is out of the screws. Short of a length, outside off, and he drives this on the up, between mid-off and extra cover for four
slower ball, full and wide, steered to deep point for one
full and straight, uses soft hands to place it wide of long-on for two
ordinary bowling. Strong leg-side field, and he goes wide. The length is good, into the surface, but the width means he can cut it away for four
wide length ball, driven on the up, straight of deep cover. Easy two
stays short of a length, pitches outside leg, headed towards off. Defended to short cover, who is tight on the single
short ball, no room, and he is cramped up as he looks to run this to third man again
wide length ball, driven on the up, gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, wicket to wicket, runs this down to third man for one
Agarwal perishes trying to pick on the short boundary. Goes across to try to play the pick-up shot and lofts this length ball straight down the throat of deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, he stays beside the line and pushes this past extra cover for two
short of a length, outside off, punched in front of deep cover for two
quicker, into the pads, gets a single to long leg
full and straight, driven to long-off for one
some dip on this offbreak, and Agarwal mis-hits this to long-on for one
shortish offbreak, pulled to short fine leg for one
length-ball offbreak, worked into the leg side for one
on a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-off for one. They are targetting Russell in the field
sharp short ball, draws a limp pull, but there is no one inside the circle on the leg side to take the catch
short ball, hurries him into the pull, but he manages to keep it short of deep midwicket. That is fifty for Agarwal too. He has been the life force of this innings
full and straight, hit down to long-on for one
lovely shot. That is the touch of Rahul. Wide length ball, and he pushes this with soft hands, wide of mid-off, and Russell is ginger in the chase. That is fifty for Rahul
an ordinary start. Length ball, into the pads, nicely clipped away to deep square for four
lovely shot. Agarwal is single-handedly keeping KXIP ahead of the game. Makes room again, finally gets a length ball just outside off, and drives it over extra cover for four
nearly a yorker, outside off, dug out to deep point for one
Agarwal keeps backing away, Varun keeps cramping him up. Hit down to long-off for one
flighted outside off, nearly a yorker, squeezes under his drive
short of a length, legcutter, cut away for one
backs away, scythes a shortish ball to deep cover for one
full toss, gets away with it. Rahul is not looking to hit them so he ends up playing to midwicket
full, just outside off, dug out to deep cover for one

Agarwal places the pull wide of deep square leg. Nagarkoti bowls the short ball with a fielder back for it, but he pulls this in front of square. This over is breaking the shackles the spinners briefly imposed
lovely shot. Cross-seam, length ball, outside off, he drives on the up, and past extra cover. All along the ground
wide length ball, driven to deep point for one
full and wide, and he gets away with it as Rahul drives this straight to point
plays this in front of the front pad and manages to place this square on the leg side for a couple
tight offbreak, into the pads, just the one leg-bye to short fine
slows this down as Agarwal backs away. He cuts this to deep point
on a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
offbreak, on a length, into the pads, placed between deep square and deep midwicket
short of a length, offbreak, punched past short midwicket, and they come back for two
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
quick legcutter, on a length, outside off, Rahul stays back, looking for one to cover, gets an inside edge onto the boot
offbreak, Rahul stays back to defend this to cover
wrong'un, on a length, outside off, driven on the up, for a single to deep point
single to short midwicket. They make it despite the direct hit
legcutter, full, outside off, placed in front of deep cover for two
offbreak, middle and leg, turning down, helped around the corner for one
stays back to push a flat offbreak to short midwicket
carrom ball, Agarwal stays beside the line and pushes this in front of point for one
looks to back away and hit. Narine cramps him up with a short ball, but he swings hard at it, and the outside edge goes straight of short third man
offbreak, short, and Rahul goes back to pull it for one
offbreak first up, on a length, straight, pushed to leg for one
short of a length, legcutter, punched down to long-on for another single
quick offbreak, Rahul goes back, gets an inside edge for a single to short fine leg
on a length, pretty straight, puts this in a hole on the leg side and comes back for two
another legcutter, short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
legcutter, on a length, just outside off, pushed in front of point for one
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
full, outside off, driven wide of mid-off for another single
short of a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to mid-on for one
uppish pull but straight of that short midwicket. Rahul finding some of his touch. Gingerly but getting there
short of a length, outside off, punched wide of mid-off for one
Rahul is being given a gift after gift here. Pushes to mid-off and runs, Krishna is attacking the ball to try to run him out, but he lets it through for two extra runs
on a length, headed to top of off, pushed in front of point for one
on a length, angling in, pushed past midwicket for a couple
sharp bouncer, 145ks, but a touch too far down leg. Rahul uses the pace and swivels to pull this fine of short fine leg
slower ball, a tentative push from Rahul, and he edges this onto his pad
angles a length ball a touch too far down leg. Clipped away for one
on a length, angling in, Rahul drops this at his toes and rushes through for one
on a length, pretty straight, defended back to him
Agarwal continues to take Kishna on. This is the most effective of the lot. He makes room early, gets under a length ball, and lofts him over cover-point for six
short of a length, at off, defended with an open face
some acrobatics from Rahul. Agarwal plays the uppish on-drive to a length ball, and Rahul has to jump and get out of the way. He lets it go between his legs. Straight of mid-on it goes
short of a length, just outside off, played with an open face to cover-point
lovely little chip shot. On a length, Agarwal knows he is not close to it, but goes with the chip and gets just enough on it to clear mid-on
on a length, hit off the lower half of the bat to mid-off
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on for one
sharp bouncer, at his badge, Agarwal is ducking and hooking at the same time. Beaten
short of a length, nips back in, played with soft hands for one
slower ball, really full, 124ks, dug out towards deep point for two
short of a length, opens the face, gets a single past point
short of a length, 143ks, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, this one skids through. Agarwal defends in front of the stumps
short of a length, into the surface, 139ks, Agarwal early into trying to work this to leg. Hit on the thigh pad
short of a length, just outside off, dropped towards point for one
on a length, outside off, push-driven to short extra cover

dropped by Russell. He does the hard work here, but then drops it and seems to have done hismelf some damage. Prasidh bowl on a length, the ball stops and Rahul gets under it, skying it over mid-off. Russell makes good ground, gets side-on, but the ball slips out. And he has hurt himself trying to save the boundary. That too in vain. He tumbles into the electronic boundary boards there
full and straight, nearly a yorker, dug out by Rahul
stays on a length, a touch too straight, punched to mid-on for one
on a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
full and straight, 140ks, Rahul could have looked to play this square but is cautious, and pushes this to midwicket
on a length, angling in, worked away for a single to deep square leg
wide length ball, soft hands, gets a single to point
on a length, holds its line, headed for top of off. Defended

short, quick, into the body, Karthik hits this straight to deep square, and for a change someone takes the second off the last ball even though it is not on. Karthik is run out, but this is a sight for sore eyes. A batsman risking his average for one extra run that might come handy later
full and wide. Just short of being a yorker, but Karthik can't get under it. Beaten
offcutter short ball, turns down the leg side for a wide
misses the yorker. Cummins hits the low full toss straight to extra cover. Jordan lucky to get away with that
angles this into the pads with a quick length ball, Karthik looks to hit behind square, is beaten for pace, gets a leg-bye
slower short ball with third man up, and Karthik upper-cuts it over that man. The innings keeps getting better
short of a length, punched hard to mid-off for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
long_text: lovely bowling to end the over. Full and wide again, protecting the short boundary. Karthik looks to drive to cover but is beaten. Excellent last over. Excellent spell overall

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
long_text: Karthik shuffles across to try to target the short leg-side boundary, but Arshdeep goes wide and squeezes this under his bat
slower ball, on a length, played into the leg side. Gets just the single to deep midwicket
full, nearly a yorker, dug out towards long-off. Not much power in the shot, which allows Karthik to come back for the second
full toss, wide outside off, and this time Cummins stands his ground. Another wide
Cummins shuffles across, Arshdeep goes wide, but lands this off the cut strip. Called wide

Arshdeep has got the big wicket of Russell. That might be worth 10 runs. He stays away from the swinging arc. Bowls full and wide, and the angle takes it further away. All Russell manages is an outside edge to the keeper

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Russell, FOUR runs
long_text: wide yorker, but Russell gets enough bat on it to place it between the keeper and third man. Not that he is looking to place. He is just trying to get some bat on it. And it flies off the edge
brute of a bouncer Russell's head is falling away as he fends. Off the handle it goes. Karthik calls him through for a single

looks for the slog, Shami cramps him up, Gill is asked to run a second as this is the fifth ball of the over. He is slow to turn around, slow to run the second, and is caught short. But Gill has done his job here on a difficult pitch. And has been selfless in the end. Now over to Russell and Karthik
slower ball, on a length, he slogs acrass it, and takes a bye as Prabhsimran fumbles the take on the half-volley

manipulates the bowling now. Makes room early, gets a full ball on the leg stump, and opens the face to place it between point and cover-point. Short boundary too. Fifty too. We've been expecting you, Mr Karthik
low full toss, into the pads, making him hit into the big part of the ground, but the length is wrong, and he has placed it through deep square leg for four more
full and straight, Karthik looks to play the reverse ramp, he takes a single to short third man. And takes the second off the overthrow

wide length ball, Gill puts his wicket on the line to try to bring Karthik back on strike for the start of the next over. He takes the second on the throw, coming in from deep cover. It is a long throw, coming in from the big part of the ground. And Gill puts in a big dive to make it
wide length ball, and Karthik shuffles across to work this into the leg side. Jordan does well by denying him access to a clean swing
Jordan might tell you this has gone off the edge, but he still bowled a wide half-volley, which meant Karthik swung hard at it. The outside edge flew straight of short third man
big six. Slot ball from Jordan. Wide outside off, and he has missed the yorker. Karthik accepts the half-volley with glee, and sends it over long-off
it doesn't matter if he has to go the bigger part of the ground. He gets under a wide length ball, and crashes it over extra cover for four
full and wide, dug out for one to extra cover

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, short of a length, and Karthik gets inside the line to pull it between long leg and deep midwicket. Karthik showing his utility in this innings

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
long_text: bowls wide outside off, Karthik shuffles across, and it is not called wide even though it lands almost off the cut strip

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, full outside off, and Karthik picks on the short fence with a hit over wide cover. Wide half-volley really. And mid-off is up

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
long_text: full and wide, appeal for a catch at the wicket, but the bat has hit the ground to create that noise

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: short, on-pace, and he goes back to pull this between long leg and deep square leg. Into the big boundary
slower-ball bouncer, he helps it along with the pull, places it fine of fine leg and comes back for two
on a length, on the pads, helped around the corner for one
legbreak, too short, hit hard to long-off for one
legbreak, on a length, soft hands to go wide and short of long-off so that he can come back for an easy second

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: wrong'un, too short, too straight, and pulled into the small side of the ground. That brings up Gill's fifty

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Gill, no run
long_text: short of a length, not too wide, can't place the cut past point
driven down to long-off, just wide of him, as he bowls length
carrom ball, dragged short, Karthik stands his griund and muscles it down the ground. Just enough in it to clear long-on for an important six

another ball sitting in the surface. Karthik is looking to go over extra but ends up hitting this back over his head. Maxwell is wide at long-on, and runs across to his left to make a one-handed save to deny them two runs
wrong'un, short of a length, punched to deep cover for one
another carrom ball, driven wide of-long-off for two
tries the big slog, and it works. Looks to go over long-on, but the carrom ball turns away to take a healthy edge straight of short third man
offbreak, on the pads, clipped away for a single
short of a length, pulled straight of long-on, and they scamper back for two
full, outside off, chipped down to long-off for one
legbreak, short of a length, punched in front of deep cover for a two into the bigger side of the ground

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Karthik, no run
long_text: wrong'un, Karthik looks for the cut, but is cramped by it. Bottom edge goes to point
short, straight, pulled to wide long-on
flat, on a length, outside off, pushed into the covers
short of a length, wide, looks for the late cut, but can't beat the man at point
has he picked the googly and tried to slog-sweep him? Doesn't matter. He has found short midwicket
another offbreak to handcuff him, played straight to cover-point
offbreak to cramp him up, played defensively
short of a length, outside off, and he picks on the short boundary, punching this in front of deep cover. The dive is a little belated at the boundary
full, quick, pushed to extra cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Karthik, no run
long_text: full, just outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, straight, pulled to long leg for one

Morgan perishes. He is looking to go over the short off-side boundary, and he has picked the wrong'un to do so, but the ball sits in the surface and he is early into the shot, ending up dragging this to long-on for an easy catch
legbreak, short, outside off, cut to deep point
wrong'un, short, pulled but not clean. Gets a single
short of a length, outside off, cut away
offbreak, punched down to long-on for one
gets this to turn away and use the angle to push it further away. Cut away for one
short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep cover
quick length ball, into the pads, pushed into the leg side for one
Morgan picks the short boundary and slog-sweeps Mujeeb over midwicket. Smart batting. A master No. 4 at work. Not sure why bowl the carrom ball and turn it into the shorter side?
short of a length, wide, looks like a legbreak, cut away to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover. Good way to protect a good over. Bowl short of a length, and don't give them room
quick slider, into the pads, tickled away fine of fine leg for two
gets bat on this reverse sweep, but can't beat short third man

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Morgan, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, seems like a wrong'un, and beats him on the defensive push

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Morgan, no run
long_text: slider outside off, short of a length, cut away, but straight to point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Morgan, no run
long_text: and expecting a googly, Morgan goes for a revere sweep first up. Beaten

slower ball, on a length, on the pads, worked past short fine leg. The dive from the fielder, and the consequent touch, possibly deflects the ball away from the line of the deep backward square running in. They take the second
short of a length, into the body, tucked off the hip for one
short of a length, angling in, worked into the leg side for a single
short of a length, angling into off, he opens the face late, and places this fine of third man
down the wicket, but Jordan holds his own and shortens the length and cramps him up to draw a dot
push-drives this length ball on the up, places this wide of mid-off, gets a couple into the big boundary
worked into the unmanned 30-yard circle on the leg side for a single
reverse sweep, nails it, over point, gets four to the short off-side biundary
looks for the lap sweep as he sees a wristspun delivery, but this is a googly and he has lapped this into his own helmet. It lands safe
wide down the leg side, plus two byes
offbreak, short of a length, worked around the corner for one
short of a length, outside off, this time he has punched him to the left of deep cover for two more
short of a length, turns away, punched wide of deep cover for two. Into the bigger side of the ground
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
yorker, right on the crease, dug out to cover for one
on a length, 139ks, just outside off, he makes room and pushes this to cover-point
too short this time, and it doesn't get high. About midriff-high, and he pulls it into the short boundary for four. A thousand IPL runs for Morgan
short of a length, cramping him up with the angle, hitting him high on the pad
short of a length, into the armpit, fended to leg
misses out. A leg-side length ball, and he can easily clip it away for four, but is hit on the pad as he moves too far across
too straight this time. The length remains the same, but it is just a touch down leg, and the boundary is short on that side. Helps it away for four
another dot as Jordan stays short of a length. Pushed back to him
short of a length, no room, Gill doesn't like this. Hit straight to cover-point. Needs to learn how to work singles off these deliveries if he can't hit boundaries off short-of-a-length deliveries
driven on the up as Jordan stays back of a length. Dot to mid-off
short of a length, straight, punched towards mid-off

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Morgan, no run
long_text: cramps him up with a length ball, defended to leg

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Morgan, no run
long_text: uppish to mid-on as Morgan defends a length ball that stops at him
short of a length, straight, pulled to deep square leg

both batsmen at the same end. Disastrous start for KKR. Gill plays this straight to short fine, and should be responding to the non-striker's call. I don't care if there is a single or not, you have to trust your partner if he is a specialist batsman and is running to the danger end. Gill preserves himself. Shami's throw from short fine comes at the wrong end, but Pooran collects it at cover and strolls to the non-striker's to run Rana out
short of a length, at he stumps, played uppishly past midwicket for one

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Rana, no run
long_text: and the plan for Rana seems to be to not pitch anything in his half. He ducks this short ball

Prabhdeep is wrong-footed. Brute of a bouncer, at his face, Rana fends awkwardly, and the ball flies off the back of the bat to where the keeper would have been. But Prabhdeep was following the angle of the bouncer, and had moved down the leg side
short of a length, chest-high, and he pushes inside its line

timber. Shami bowls seam-up, targetting the stumps, and gets appreciable seam movement from a length outside off, and knocks back the middle stump and send the leg stump flying. True to his role, Tripathi is trying to clear the infield, and not defend or nudge
and finally gets a short ball that is not shoulder high, and breaks the shackles with a pull into the smaller part of the ground. He has half-volleyed the boundary skirting at deep square leg
sharp bouncer. At him, no room, 135ks. Tripathi is ducking and hooking at the same time. Beaten
short of a length, 137ks, gets dome width, looks to cut, but it gets big on him, and he gets a bottom edge for a single

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: maiden over. Ends with a length ball within the stumps, and draws a defensive push from Tripathi. Excellent start from Arshdeep

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: appeal for a catch at the wicket. Bouncer, over his left shoulder, Tripathi hooks and is beaten. This wicketkeeper is quite excitable, and appeals for anything

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: beaten outside off. Pitched up, wide, going with the angle. Tripathi tries the big drive, and is nowhere near it

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: leading edge, nearly caught at cover. This one swings back a touch. Tripathi looks to work this to leg, but it doesn't swing as much as he expects it to. The leading edge doesn't carry to the diving Pooran at short cover

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: doesn't carry to the keeper. Short and wide, he cuts at it, the ball doesn't quite come on, takes the bottom edge, and falls short of the diving keeper, Prabhsimran

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run
long_text: some seam movement there? On a length, shaping up to swing from outside off, and then pitching and leaving him, beating the defensive push
short of a length, 141ks, wide outside off, third leave of the over. This one nips back in after crossing the stumps
short of a length, wide outside off, 140ks, left alone
again short of a length, and this nips too far down leg. Gill nicely nudges it wide of short fine leg into the short boundary
short of a length, into the pads, tucked in front of long leg for two
wide length ball, left alone. It holds its line
on a length, swift, into the pads, goes for a leg-bye
looks to ramp a slower short ball but sends it only as far as a limping Pant can go to catch. Is it a cramp or is it a strain? Rabada has three
slower short ball, Tyagi pulls this down, gets a single
quick, on a length, into the body, worked to leg
another brace for Rabada. It is just crazy how often he has been getting these. Slower offcutter first up, Tewatia early into the slog, plays this on
slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out for a single to keep the strike for the last over

Rabada drops. This short ball gets big on Tewatia, who pulls this more high than long. Rabada moves to his right at long leg, gets to it, but can't hold on. He is a few yards in so he has to leap. Had he been on the fence, this would be an easy catch
low full toss, driven to deep point, but he turns down the single again
bouncer, 144ks, too high as he has dug this in too short
backs away, Nortje follows him, and he pulls but straight to long leg. Turns down the single
slower ball, big wide down the leg side
wide on the crease, short of a length, on off, another defensive push
short of a length, no room, defended

short_text: Patel to Kartik Tyagi, no run
long_text: bouncer, well outside off, and Tyagi wants to have nothing to do with it
slower short ball, no power in the pull, gets a single to deep midwicket
Tewatia has some belated fun. Gets an on-pace length ball on off, and uses the angle and the pace to hit him over cover-point for six
slower ball, full, worked to midwicket for one

Hetmyer you beautiful beautiful fielder. His second stunning diving catch in the deep. Gopal makes room to loft this length ball inside out. Hetmyer dives to his left and also in front to take this clean. The soft signal is out. The hard signal has to be out as he has his fingers under it. The third umpire is convinced after watching many replays
short of a length, around off, punched square and they are still diving around. Saves three runs
short, outside leg, and he pulls this straight to fine leg for one
backs away to hit this to deep point for one
short, into the hip, handcuffs him, pulled to long leg
short of a length, middle and off, nipping away, runs away off the outside edge for a four fine of third man
full toss, on the pads, and he has somehow managed to put this over wide long-on. Not the cleanest of connections
quick length ball, driven straight to extra cover
full toss, hit straight to long-off for a single

slower short ball, pulled away to the left of deep midwicket but Axar Patel puts in a diving save to save two runs. This is a great effort. The control on the ball is amazing. As his dive approaches the rope, he lets go off the ball
on-pace short ball, Tewatia looks for the midwicket pull, is beaten outside off
full and straight, pushed to long-on for one
slides down the leg side for a wide

slower offcutter, mis-hit between extra cover and long-off. Rabada puts in a full-length dive to try to catch it but I don't like seeing fast bowlers dive like this. Not worth the injury risk when the reward is a wicket when the game is already over
and he bowls one first up. Short of a length, outside off, pulled back to him
short of a length, at him, ramped away to third man for one
Archer fights the good fight but Rabada is too good for him. Gets too much under this length ball as he tries another swing for a six. Skies it for a catch in the long-off region
short of a length, no room, and the best he can do is run this down to third man for one
full toss with mid-off up, and Tewatia goes over the man for four

short_text: Rabada to Archer, (no ball) 1 leg bye
long_text: Archer looks for that golf-swing six as Rabada bowls length. Beaten and hit on the back leg. This is a no-ball
wide length ball, punched away, but can't beat that deep square third man
length ball, into the body. Archer hurried into the shot, hits to long leg on the bounce
fired into the pads, pushed towards long-on

Rabada makes a routine catch look difficult but takes it sensationally with a dive. Tye has no option but to go after Axar as he pitches short, but he manages to hit this just to the right of deep midwicket. Rabada is late to move behind the ball, but then puts the dive in
quick length ball, outside off, pushed with soft hands for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Tewatia, no run
long_text: slower through the air, hit straight to extra cover. Another dot

short_text: Axar Patel to Tewatia, no run
long_text: short of a length, quick, outside off, punched back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to Tewatia, no run
long_text: arm ball, outside off, swings away, hit on the toe end
slower short ball again, 118ks, and Tye is beaten on the pull again
slower offcutter, full, outside leg
lovely hit. Too late? Stoinis bowls on-pace, 131ks, full, in the slot, and he is drilled flat over long-off
slight swing away as he pitches up. Pushed to cover. And Rahane fielding again. They have used him cleverly as a 12th man. Invariably he is on the field
slower short ball, but drop in pace, Tye connects with fresh air on the pull
short of a length, hit hard, Stojnis fields to his left in the follow-through. Both the batsmen think there is an easy single on, and in the end have to rush back to their respective creases

and this is how anchor jobs hurt teams. He has wasted more than a quarter of the innings for less than a run a ball and now he is out when trying to hit. Full offcutter, outside leg, beats his swing, hits his pad, and then the off stump
full, middle and leg, worked to leg for a single
hangs this one in the air, gets some dip on this, defended back to him
swept away. Possibly only the second boundary off Ashwin tonight. Along the ground and between deep square and deep midwicket
drifting into the pads, worked to leg
and too easy for Ashwin. Nice drift, dip, and then some turn. Lomror looks to work to leg, and the leading edge is swallowed at short cover
just wide of Ashwin. Quick offbreak, leading edge, to the right of Ashwin, just out of reach. No need to dive now
full, on the toes, clipped away to deep midwicket
full and straight, played to mid-off with soft hands. They get a single
short, straight, pulled to deep midwicket for one

Stoinis. Turning everything he touches to gold. This is what happens when you show no intent against others and then are obligated to hit the change bowler for 25 runs. Samson swings at a length ball, and it sort of swings a touch and goes off the toe end. Million miles in the air. Caught at long-on
another length ball, 127ks, but Jaiswal has shuffled too far across and can't get any power into this. Just a single to long-on
and Jaiswal decides it is time. Goes over the cow corner as Mujumdar suggested. Stoinis bowls an on-pace legnth ball. And he clears the front leg to send him out of the ground

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: again he stays away from the slot. No room either. Samson wants a single to short fine, but Jaiswal sends him back. A direct hit would have had Samson here
arm ball, short of a length, he doesn't let Jaiswal get under it. Punched down to long-on for one
clever batting. Shuffles across, gets under a length ball, laps it for three

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, punched to point
sweeps this from well outside off, in the air, and it bounces short of deep midwicket
slow, on a length, on off, pushed past cover-point for one
short of a length, quick, 150ks, and he goes back to run this down to third man
short of a length, tucked away off the hip to long leg
quick short-of-a-length ball here. beats him for pace. An inside edge gets them a single
short of a length, slower ball, 125ks, runs this to point. Another dot
lbw appeal as this nips back in, but it has hit him outside the line. The umpire thinks so too. And DC think so too as they don't review this

Hetmyer. What a lovely catch. Nortje comes back, pitches one up, Smith whips this to leg, and Hetmyer dives forward from deep square midwicket to take this clean. They go to the third umpire with the soft signal saying he is out. The replays confirm it
another slower short ball, rib-high, pulled to deep square for one
slower bouncer, Smith looks for the hook, aborts it. Then looks for the ramp, and aborts that too. Too little pace on it to try either
slower offcutter at 123ks again, no room to him, pushed towards short midwicket for one
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, at him, tucked away into a hole on the leg side for two. That is good placement on this ground
short of a length, at off, worked to deep midwicket for one
quick offbreak, just outdside off, pushed to the right of Ashwin, and he is not going to dive for these after having dislocated his shoulder once previously. They get the single
wide on the crease, under-cuts the ball, Smith pushes this length ball into the leg side for one
quick length-ball offbreak, he dabs down on it for a single
looks like an attempted legbreak, short, outside off, pulled off the toe end
carrom ball. A touch too short, and he has pulled this from well outside off for a four through midwicket
lovely bowling. Smith shapes up for the slog, but the dip on this means this is nowhere near his swinging arc. Smith does well to abort the slog and just defend
carrom ball. Starts too far outside leg. Wide
short of a length, on-pace, 136ks, Jaiswal beaten on the punch. This is hurting RR, and Jaiswal needs to find a way here
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched to cover-point
short of a length, wide outside off, punched away, and they get a single thanks to a Stoinis misfield at extra cover
short ball, slower at 123ks, outside leg, and all Jaiswal needs is a bit of bat to clear short fine leg. However, he is early into the shot and gets a single off the glove
Jaiswal's first aerial hit as Harshal gives him an on-pace short ball. And this pace in the 130s works better for Jaiswal than Rabada and Nortje. Pulled away for a six
starts with a slower offcutter at 128ks. Short of a length, runs off the outside edge to reach the keeper on the half-volley
Smith backs away to punch a length ball to cover. No room, no time for him to manipulate the field. Another excellent over from Ashwin inside the Powerplay
drifting in, full, worked to leg for one
flighted offbreak outside off, driven hard and square, but straight to point. The pressure has to be building up
carrom ball. Flat, on a length, outside off. He looks to cut, and is beaten on the inside edge
offbreak that doesn't turn, on a length, outside off, worked to leg for one
length-ball offbreak, outside off, pushed towards long-off for one
this is some cricket. Rabada bowling quick and at him, and Smith looking to find runs. This is a bouncer, right at this body, Smith gets down on a knee and gets a top edge to clear short fine leg
oh he has just cleared the man at long leg. This is an interesting hit. Smith stays in the crease and whips one from middle and off, and ends up dragging behind square. Just clears the man
on a length, stump to stump, pushed to mid-on. That is what Rabada is looking to do
another wide down the leg side. Seems like a plan to cramp Smith up or look for lbw
slower ball, short of a length, this time he has time to run this down to third man. Just seems hurried by quick bowling here
on a length, outside off, driven on the up but straight to extra cover. Jaiswal getting stuck here like Tewatia did the other night
short of a length, around off, runs off the outer half of the bat for one
wide down the leg side
quick offbreak, on a length, outside off, hit straight to cover
accurate, no room, defended to leg
offbreak, tight line, pushed down to long-on for one

not the Mankad, but the more prosaic catch at square leg. Lovely bowling I must say. Buttler is looking for the big hit over long-on/midwicket region, but he gets the ball to dip on him, and ends up hitting to square leg, where Dhawan takes a diving catch even as the ball swerves away from him. Out comes the thigh-five, and a big leap from Ashwin
Buttler doesn't back up. Drifting length ball, bunted into the leg side for one
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, 143ks, good carry too, and beats Jaiswal as he looks to open the face on this
quick bouncer, just 134ks on the radar, but this is quick. And on middle and leg. He ducks it
short of a length, no room, pushed with an open face to point
short of a length, around off, Jaiswal tries to run this down and is beaten. Not short enough for that shot
short of a length, wicket to wicket, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, angling in, tucked away between square leg and midwicket
lovely effort at mid-off. This a mis-hit off a length ball and is dying in front of mid-off, but Stoinis puts in a dive and still reaches it only on a half-volley
short ball, 145ks, but it sits up, and Buttler has enough time to pull this through square leg. Along the ground
strays too far down leg, and Buttler tickles this full ball along for four
on a length, 145ks, on off, holds the line to hit the outside half of his bat
short of a length, no room, but he has dabbed it wide of slip for one
short ball, just outside off, good carry. Jaiswal sways inside its line

short of a length, quick, 142ks, he looks to use his pace and steer him. Beaten. They don't even try to run the bye. This is poor. The last ball of the first innings should always feature a run-out if it is not hit for a boundary or any other dismissal
short of a length, at him, punched to backward point for one
slower ball, on a length, 126ks, on leg, and Harshal doesn't get room to swing on this slog. Caught at deep midwicket
quick and full again, hit down to long-on for one
full and wide and quick. Nearly a yorker. Beaten
yorker/low full toss, middle and leg, dug out for a single to extra cover
gets the wicket. More importantly no run off it. Wide length ball, angling further way. Sure to be called a wide, but Axar manages to get the cue on it for a catch to Buttler

short_text: Tye to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: short, on-pace, wide outside off, and he has pulled this to deep midwicket. All the hard work done for DC going down the drain because of this over

short_text: Tye to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: and this is in the slot, and Axar goes deep into the crease to smack him for a six back over his head

short_text: Tye to Axar Patel, (no ball) 4 byes
long_text: slips out. Horribly wrong. Just what DC needed, just what RR didn't. High full toss, and it reaches Buttler on a half-volley. He can't get his pads properly behind it. Four byes too
low full toss, can't get under it, hit to long-off on the bounce
short of a length, 131ks, wide outside off, pulled off the cue end to long-on
goes for the wide yorker, and despite Axar's shuffle across, it has been called wide. Because it has gone too wide, almost off the cut strip

short_text: Tye to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: plum on-pace half-volley at 133ks. Axar rockets this back over the non-striker's head for four
full, on off, Harshal makes room and goes deep in the crease to go over extra cover for four
sharp bouncer, quick, and following him. Harshal has to act fast to avoid getting hit

another run-out missed. A slot ball hit straight to mid-off, and sets off for a single. Smith's throw is not accurate so Archer tries to collect it in front and deflect it onto the wicket. He is hit at the finger tip of the left hand
length ball, angling in, wide down the leg side
yorker, outside off, dug out to pint, and if Jaiswal hits the non-striker's end, Harshal is gone. He misses
slower ball, 127ks, on a length, on off, pushed past the ring on the off side and they charge back for a second
full toss, just outside off, pushed to point

huge wicket. This could mean a difference of 20 runs. Tyagi bowls seam-up, quick, in the slot and just outside off. Hetmyer is looking at that wide long-on six, but the bat face turns in his hands as he connects. A smart overhead catch by Tewatia at long-on

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX runs
long_text: slower ball, on leg, in the slot, and Hetmyer clears the front leg to slog him for another six. Hetmyer hurting RR

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX runs
long_text: just clears long-off. That unnecessary overthrow hurts Tyagi. Full toss outside off, and he goes flat over long-off. And despite fielding on such a small ground, Archer is not right on the fence. That is a second fielder who has let Tyagi down this over
wide full toss. Yorker gone wrong, but hit straight to point. No single available but a direct-hit overthrow will bring Hetmyer back on strike

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Patel, no run
long_text: full and wide, drilled to mid-off. Just hit too well to get Hetmyer back on strike

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, 1 leg bye
long_text: slot ball, but outside leg, and Hetmyer misses with the slog. Just the leg-bye

wide yorker to close the over out after one poor slot ball earlier in the over. Just the single. Good comeback. It is so important to make sure you don't go for 20-plus even if you get takes down early in the over
slower-ball yorker, on leg, dug out for one to deep midwicket
wide length ball, runs this down to third man for one
wide on-pace length ball, and he goes inside-out with a drive over extra cover for a regal six
bouncer, at off, and he flat-bats it straight of long-on. Couldn't have planned it but it falls safe
wide length ball, 134ks, angles away and beats him

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, 1 leg bye
long_text: full and quick, outside leg, hits him on the pad, concedes a leg-bye

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, no run
long_text: goes for the wide yorker, change-up from 114ks to 137ks, beats him outside off

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX runs
long_text: another slower short ball looking to tuck him up, but in the process he goes too far down leg, and Hetmyer gets inside the line and helps it along for a small six over long leg
short of a length, at off, steered to third man
wide length ball, driven on the up, straight of deep cover, comes back for two
slower ball, 117ks, short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
full and straight, blocked back to him
and now he bowls a slow loopy legbreak, takes the thick outside edge and rolls past short third man
on a length, wicket to wicket, defended back to him

and that is the icing on the cake that Tewatia's spell has been. I suppose Ponting will acknowledge Tewatia now. "You have to fight for what you are owed." He has got the danger man out. Short of a length, wide, legbreak so it turns away too. Stoinis nowhere near it but still cuts. The top edge settles with cover-point
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep point

beaten in the flight as Stoinis jumps out of the crease. Big appeal for lbw but he is too far down the wicket. Another slider, and seems to have hit him inside the line. Not sure how far down Stoinis is, though, vis-a-vis DRS. They don't go upstairs anyway
slower-ball yorker, 120ks, pretty straight, dug out wide of short fine leg for one
full and wide, 131ks, driven off the toe end in front of deep cover
on a length, angling in, 138ks, hits his leading edge and goes for a single to extra cover
on-pace short ball, 133ks, at his body, Hetmyer gets inside the line and pulls this for a flat six over square leg
slower short ball, runs this down to third man for one
wide length ball, 136ks, but just inside the line. Left alone by Stoinis
another boundary-less over from Tewatia. What an effort Tewatia is putting in against the team that didn't retain him. Again that in-between length, and no room. Just the single to long-on
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, legbreak, turns away, which means he punches down to long-off for one
on a length, outside off, cut away past the diving fielder at point, but gets just a single to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to extra cover. Another dot
on a length, outside off, steered to short third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Stoinis, no run
long_text: closes out a lovely over with a perfect inswinger that cannot be driven or pulled. And it is aimed at top of off. Defended back to him
slower bouncer, and Hetmyer is very early into the hook. The front edge, though, doesn't travel as far as square leg
short of a length, around off, pushed towards mid-on
sharp bouncer, 137ks, at him, higher than the shoulder, hits the glove, but there is no leg gully
shanked away as he looks to pull, but it falls well short of deep midwicket
short of a length, at him. tucked away off the hip for one to deep midwicket
quick legbreak, pushes him back, runs off the leading edge to short cover
short of a length, around off, punched to deep cover
low full toss, on off, driven to long-off for one
Sixer Stoinis keps hitting them out of the field. Tewatia makes the mistake of pitching one up, and he goes over long-off for another big six

one more run-out. Pant just puts his head down and runs with Stoinis not even moving. This is poor running from Pant. Stoinis pushes this straight to short midwicket and takes a couple of instinctive steps down the wicket. Only to realise Pant is there looking into his eyes. All you can say is, this is Stoinis's call, and Pant should have waited for it
as expected, he bowls short and wide, with no turn, and Pant cuts to deep point again
slider, short, outside off, cut to deep cover
on a length, straight, pushed to long-on for one
Gopal saves one this time. Short of a length, just outside off, punched down the ground but not past Gopal who dives to his left
two dots and a six. A touch too full with the wide legbreak, and he goes inside-out despite a deep extra cover in place. Just extending his arms into the shot
on a length, outside off, pushed to short cover
on a length, straight, pushed towards mid-on but Jaiswal makes a superb save from short midwicket
slider, on a length, into the pads, pushed down to long-on
he looks to stay away from his reach, and ends up bowling a wide
quick legbreak, on a length, Stoinis caught on the back foot. The leading edge goes to cover
flighted legbreak, too full to get any elevation. Hit straight to midwicket
nearly chopped on. Leggies bowling wide sliders to Pant has been a common sight this IPL. He goes hard at it, gets a bottom edge but he is lucky this doesn't ricochet onto the wicket
slider wide outside off, left alone
legbreak, on a length, can't drive, can't pull. Pushed to deep cover for one
and another pull, but this is not that short so he mis-hits it to deep square for one
not that short, but Stoinis nonchalantly goes back and uses his high grip to pull this over midwicket for a small flats ix

Stoinis in golden touch. And great attitude. You have to put away bad balls here no matter how many wickets you have lost. This is a long hop, and he goes back to pull it over midwicket. Just misses a car outside the ground
short and wide, cut away hard to deep cover
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
wrong'un first up, on a length, punched to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of extra cover for one

that is a run-out. Iyer dives desperately to make it back, but gets up and keeps walking. This is a slower ball by Tye, short of a length, outside off, he pushes this towards cover and sets off. That is a poorly judged single because he has not waited for the ball to beat short cover. Jaiswal makes a diving save. Iyer is sent back. And Jaiswal hits the striker's end directly
full toss outside off, played with an open face, gets a single to third man
bouncer, 136ks, too high. Called wide
Iyer shuffles across and flicks a full straight ball to leg
short of a length, gentle pace of 124ks, and I don;t even think this is a slower ball. Punched away through covers
on a length, outside off, on-pace, pushed to cover
quick sharp bouncer, on top of his front shoulder, Pant ducks inside its line
short of a length, 139ks, rising towards his chest. Fended with the bottom hand off the handle
on a length, around off, 150ks. Defended with an open face
short of a length, around off, pushed towards cover for a single

Archer gets Shaw. He does it all himself. Shaw is looking for the pull again, but this one is not as short as he expects it to be. Consequently a massive top edge takes fight for moon and comes down towards midwicket. Archer runs towards it, asks Shreyas Gopal to get out of the way, and takes the catch
bouncer, head high, at him, and Shaw hooks in the air. There is a deep backward square in place, but he has managed to get it in just in front of square

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: short of a length, chest high, just outside off. Defended
another bouncer, gives him the width, Iyer throws his bat it, and is beaten. Called wide

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: bouncer, outside off, left alone by Iyer

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, FOUR runs
long_text: unfortunate. Tyagi stays with the plan of bowling wide from wide on the crease. Iyer throws his bat at it, and the ball moves away to take the thick outside edge over short third man
wide on the crease again, bowls a wide outswinger, driven off the to end past cover

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: lovely delivery. Wide on the crease, pitches short of a length, and then pitches and moves against the angle. Handy delivery even in a Test. Beats him

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Iyer, no run
long_text: wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, punched to midwicket. Can't find the gap
slightly fuller than the short-of-a-length he has been bowling, and Shaw lofts him on the up, back over his head, for a dismissive six

yet another drop. Kartik Tyagi over-runs this one. Lovely bouncer, shoulder high, just outside off, draws the big top edge to a fine fine leg. Tyagi runs to his right, but he has misjudged it and gone past where the ball is dropping
short of a length, just outside off, punched wide of mid-off for one
cross-seam bouncer, at his body, but Iyer pulls him over midwicket. The free hit has given him the freedom

short_text: Aaron to Iyer, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: Iyer has been handcuffed by the length last two balls, but here he moves away to create room and cuts this shortish ball past point. What's more? This is a no-ball too
short of a length again, nips back in, cramps him up. He wants a single to cover-point but is sent back. Rightly too
short of a length, stays low, just outside off, kept out
another bouncer, 138ks, Shaw sways out of its line and belatedly tries to ramp it too. Beaten
legcutter, 120ks, short of a length, just around off, pushed towards mid-on for one
bouncer first up, 138ks, just outside off, and Iyer stays inside its line

Archer's first wicket in a Powerplay this year. It has taken him 51 balls. And this is not such a great ball. A length ball on the pads, and Dhawan likes the look of it. Looks to clear the ring on the leg side, but doesn't get the elevation he wants and also finds short midwicket to perfection
short of a length, at him, dropped at his feet for a single
and again, Archer is hit for a four first ball. Not a bad ball really. On a length, 138ks, not much room, but Shaw stays inside its line and drives it on the up through the covers

short_text: Aaron to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Aaron fails to close a good over. Bowls a slower ball half-volley at 117ks. Dhawan loves it, and plays the pick-up over the leg side
short, 135ks, gets a little big on him, hits him on the glove as he hooks. Falls safe. A single to long leg
short of a length, outside off, steered to square third man for one

short_text: Aaron to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: back of a length, 139ks, on the pads, hits him high on the pad
Shaw shows his cards. Sees one on a length, and goes through the line. The mis-hit clears mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, decent pace of 136ks, defended to point

taken at is that short mid-off? Appears so. Full at the stumps, Arshdeep has a crack at the drive, and finds Warner there who takes the catch and pumps his fists. The fist-pump of a captain who's finished the match with two fifth-bowler overs left

short_text: Natarajan to Arshdeep Singh, no run
long_text: yorker in at middle, jammed down the pitch

short_text: Natarajan to Arshdeep Singh, no run
long_text: yorker at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
nails it! Another sweet yorker from Natarajan. Straight for the base of middle stump and Cottrell swishes around it
yorker at leg stump, backs into the leg side and pushes towards point
full slower ball on middle stump, defended on the front foot
short at the hips, pulled to long leg

short_text: Sandeep to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: struck in the grille. Short ball gets too big for him as he looks to hook that. Bowler checks on him, umpire checks on him, and he's on his feet and ready to go

short_text: Sandeep to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR runs
long_text: launches it over the bowler. Good length outside off, nicely forward and punched with conviction. Mid-off is in and long-on can't get to that

short_text: Sandeep to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: slower length ball outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot

short_text: Sandeep to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: full on off stump, defended off the back foot
pinned right in front. Googly rips back in, Shami is shaping for the cut and is caught in front of middle stump. No reviews to spare either, he thought that was going down

taken at backward point. One of the best innings this season ends softly, almost tragically, because it has been played around a shambolic chase from KXIP. Pooran looking to farm the strike and play out Rashid, wants to chop this short ball into the covers after a couple of dot balls. Thick edge and a long, laboured walk back from Pooran. Would you blame him if he felt let down?

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pooran, no run
long_text: googly, full on middle stump, gets forward and drives to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pooran, no run
long_text: googly at a length, punched to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pooran, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, punched into the covers

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pooran, no run
long_text: beaten. Good length legbreak, just outside off, and he looks to defend for the angle

short_text: Ahmed to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: yorker at off stump, defended into the leg side

big appeal for catch behind. Turned down. SRH don't review, but the umpires now send it upstairs with a soft signal not out. Yorker wide outside off, he looks to jab at that and there's a sound as it goes through to the keeper. Third umpire Barde said this review is for bump ball so the on-field umpire reckons there's bat on it. Which might well mean Mujeeb will go here, because that doesn't look close to being a bump ball, and it could be conclusive based on the replays. They haven't checked for the actual edge, no Ultra Edge used, so just to reiterate - the umpire thought that was edged. It's given out. But Mujeeb reviews that decision! Now we'll have Ultra Edge. Another can of worms here though - because Mujeeb was walking towards the dressing room as he turned back and made the signal for a review. Did he get adviced by the dugout? We don't know yet. What we do know - there is a spike as ball goes past bat. So the umpire's original decision, overturned by the umpire himself, is reviewed by the batsman, who is in fact, out. At the end of it all, KXIP are a review short. Welcome to cricket.
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
brilliant work. Yorker tailed into the corridor, waits on that and opens the face perfectly to get this fine of third man

just short of deep square and past him in the end as he lunges forward for the catch. Slower short ball, nice swiping length, and swipe he does. Hits Samad's body on the half-volley and is past the boundary
short and wide outside off, cut to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, no run
long_text: beaten. Good length and skidding on, wide outside off. Goes for the slog sweep and it's past him
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length on middle stump, tucked to long leg

through him! You can be watchful against Rashid, but that doesn't mean assured success. Good length, googly, rips sharply in as Mandeep is caught half on tCaught he front foot and half on the back, trying to read him off the pitch. You can't do that. It's past his frenzied late cut and into middle stump
short of a good length on middle stump, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
short and sliding on outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off, slices it aerially to sweeper cover's right
low full toss on off stump, driven to long-off
good length outside off, chopped into the covers

a mix-up but Pooran safe in the end. Good length ball, pushed to midwicket's left. Where it is Garg again. Mandeep went halfway down but Pooran probably saved a little because he was ball-watching. Apologies from Mandeep
short and wide outside off, left alone
slower short ball outside off, chopped to backward point
short of a length just outside off, punched into the covers

oh they've got him at the non-striker's end, surely! Yes. Priyam Garg has sent Maxwell back. Superb, superb work. It's a good ball to start off, Natarajan nails the away-swinging yorker at middle stump. Maxwell jabs it in extra cover's direction. Garg with a clean pick up, a quick pivot to open his body up and hit the single stump on the bounce
full and curved in at middle stump, punched to long-off along the floor
low full toss on leg stump, allows that on and tickles it past short fine
full toss, thigh height. Mistimed pull to deep midwicket's right
full and wide outside off, can't reach out to that
low full toss on off stump, driven to long-off

dropped. Natarajan can't react quickly to his left in the follow-through. It's an offcutter, good length at middle stump. Maxwell punches through the line too soon. That wasn't difficult by any means, a half-chance at worst, but decent height. Was caught off guard
good length outside off, defended into the covers

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: beaten. Good length and turning away outside off, looks to punch that through the covers
short of a length and skidded across him. Mistimed pull to deep midwicket
good length and pushed through at middle stump. Flicked to short fine's left off the back foot
good length and ripping into middle stump. Onto the back foot and he hurriedly punches to long-off
short of a length at middle, pulled down to long-on

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, no run
long_text: good length and cramping him at middle stump. Pushed into the covers off the back foot

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: and past deep midwicket this time! Front-of-the-hand quicker one, dropped short at middle stump. He pulls him off the front foot, flat and to the fielder's right

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: 17-ball fifty! Fastest this season. Samad has nowhere to look right now, this is some assault. Good lenth ball and pushed through wide outside off, extends the arms and slaps it on the rise over long-off. Special knock, this

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: smoked over long-on! He won't let the allrounders off! Good length on middle stump, steps out and meet it at the pitch to absolutely pummel that

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, FOUR runs
long_text: big dive to the right at long-off but Garg can't stop that. Good length, flat and pushed across him. Slapped firmly to the wide long-off boundary. Garg has a flap with his right hand but only manages to push it into the padding

short_text: Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: smoked over long-off. Full and wide outside off, just swings through the line and that's rapidly over the boundary

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: good length legbreak at off stump, defended to backward point off the outside edge

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, nudged to midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: googly turning in from a length, at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
outside edge as he looks to pull a short ball going away from him. Short third man cleans up to his right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pooran, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, chopped straight to short third
good length and turning away outside off. Maxwell is squared a touch as he drops this into the covers with soft hands
short of a length just outside off, cramped on the late cut and gets a thick outside edge fine of short third
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
taken at deep backward square! Good length, tossed up slow at middle stump. Rahul looks for the sweep and gets a top edge that is quite easily pouched by Williamson
good length and down leg side. Gets a glove to short fine as he looks to sweep
and again. Fuller, flatter, similar line outside off. And a similar shot, but this one is further back over long-on
lifted to long-on's right. Wide of the crease, full and tossed into the arc outside off. Pooran waits on that and hits this pretty straight
low full toss punched straight to mid-on. He was dancing around a bit thinking of the scoop, but might have outfoxed himself by the end of the dance
low full toss on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
good length at middle stump, mistimed punch into the leg side

incredible. There's a reason so many people fawn over this guy's abilities. This is good length ball at middle and he's barely moved. Static and languidly picking this up over long leg. You don't do this if you don't pick length really quickly
good length on leg stump, looks to ramp that fine, cops it on the thigh guard
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full and into the corridor, defended solidly on the front foot
yorker length on leg stump, jammed to deep square's right
good length on off, defended off the back foot

oh yeah, sweet. Classy from Pooran. This is full outside off, bowling to the field, nothing wrong with it. Pooran gets a big stride out to meet that and times the cover drive perfectly. All balance, that

oh he's crunched that straight to cover! Whew, he hit that so well! It's a short ball outside off and he's cut that with some bat speed, but it's straight into Garg's lap. A metre either side and I don't think he'd have got a hand on that

short_text: Ahmed to Prabhsimran Singh, FOUR runs
long_text: drilled past mid-off. Full and just outside off, good stride out and smoked it past mid-off's right hand
short at leg stump, short-arm pull to short fine
good length on off stump, defended to point off the back foot

short_text: Natarajan to Prabhsimran Singh, FOUR runs
long_text: full on leg stump, stands tall and whips that to mid-on's right
good length and pushed across the corridor. Looks to force a punch off the front foot. It's to mid-off's left off the toe-end
good length and just outside off, opens the face to turn this to backward point's left

short_text: Natarajan to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
long_text: good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket against the angle
good length outside off, punched through the covers on the up
good length on leg stump, clipped to deep square
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a good length and swung in at off stump. Pushed into the covers

short_text: Sandeep to Prabhsimran Singh, no run
long_text: short outside off, under-edge on the cut into point
good length and in at the stumps, knocked towards mid-on

another run out appeal. At the striker's end this time. Bairstow tumbles over the stumps to gather this and whip the bails off. Simran might have just made it. He has. Length ball on middle, clipped to midwicket's right and a throw that didn't have too much venom. Needed a direct hit and needed it a little faster. Although there's a chance that might have been a direct hit without YJB's intervention
full slower ball outside off, jabs at that with hard hands, ends up slicing it through the covers
good length just outside off, thick outside edge to short third as he defends inside the line

mix-up and Agarwal is caught quite a way up the pitch. Been sold down the river by his old friend. Full inswinger just outside off, neatly punched wide of mid-off. Warner gives chase, puts in a slide and is back up quickly. Rahul sprints down for the second and then says no. Agarwal responds to his call and takes off too, but he's left with no chance as a result. Throw comes in one bounce and Khaleel is back to gather it
good length at the pads, allows that on and clips into vacant midwicket
short and across the corridor, beaten on the cut. That slid through under his shot
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Chopped to backward point

oh sweet. Just gets the weight into the ball here outside off. It's good length outside off, never really uses a big stride but the timing and the weight into it means his cover drives always pack power. This one does and it's to extra cover's left
good length inswinger at leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
good length and just outside off, chopped into the off side
full indipper outside off, half a stride down to loft this straight over the bowler. Bat shuffles in his hands a little. This plonks in the turf as md-on and mid-off run backwards
short and just outside off, cut off the inside half to backward point
full outside off, driven firmly to sweeper's right
taken at deep midwicket. Low full toss angled into leg stump from around the wicket. Looks to time that, an aerial flick. But he's taken well inside the boundary
yorker at off stump, jammed into the off side
lofted over the long-off boundary. Full slower ball outside off. He wanted to go over mid-off again and was just a touch too early. But he'd done it well enough for this to land over the line
nicely put away. The calm head of Williamson. Low full toss outside off, holds his shape and opens the face as he lofts this over mid-off
full and just outside off, mistimed slog to deep midwicket
yorker at middle and leg. Jammed to mid-off

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide outside off, pulled neatly and dragged wide of long-on. Sweet connection on that

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek, no run
long_text: nutmegged. Full and tailing in late at leg stump. He looks to whip that behind square but misses as it dips on him

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek, SIX runs
long_text: just clears the line. Whew, that was a check-shot but it had enough after going over the bowler. Full and curving into middle stump. Went straight and managed to time it perfectly
full slower ball on middle stump, jabbed to extra cover
Pooran takes one to his right and screams. At long-on this time. Full and wobbly from around the wicket, at middle stump. Looks to drill this wide of long-on but can't get enough power on that
short outside off, cut to sweeper's left

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, OUT
long_text: short and into leg stump. It's there for the pull but it looks like he's hurried there because he can only manage to loft this up with the angle, no real power on that and not even entirely a pull. A half-ramp. Catching practice at deep square

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, 2 runs
long_text: good length at middle, steps out and is not to the pitch, but adjusts and chips to long-on's right
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, 1 run
long_text: good length slider at middle stump, clipped into the leg side

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped at long-off! Good length ball just outside off, steps down to meet at the pitch and connect firmly on this lofted hit, but he hasn't managed any elevation. It's flat and to Pooran's left at head height and he only manages to tip this to his left and into the boundary

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, 1 run
long_text: full slower ball at off stump, flicked off the inside edge to short fine

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: good length, slower ball at middle stump. Watchfully flicked to midwicket
full outside off, steps out and chips this wide of mid-off

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump, punched back down the pitch

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, defended into the covers

taken in the follow through! Clearly they meant to take all wickets at once with that big drought set-up. This is a cutter from around the wicket, good length and gripping at an off stump line. He wants to turn that into the leg side with the angle but that stops on him and it's a feeble push back at the bowler

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: googly at a good length, in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven to long-off on the front foot

there's an lbw appeal and a run-out appeal. The run-out's been sent upstairs. At the striker's end. But it seems they've also referred for the lbw. So we'll be looking at that first. It was a slider at leg stump, Bairstow was struck on the back leg trying to whip into the leg side. That back leg is definitely in front of leg stump, but there were a couple of sounds Ultra Edge shows no bat and that is hitting leg stump. The decision will be overturned. Good review and what an over this is. Four dot balls and the two set batsmen gone. Bairstow falls short of a well-deserved hundred

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, no run
long_text: chopped to backward point. Another slider, coming into the corridor. He was hurried on that

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, no run
long_text: short and skidding on just outside off, chopped straight to point

taken at long-on. Bishnoi with a quicker one across the corridor, good length delivery. Pretty much his go-to against left-handers this season. Warner miscues the slog sweep and it's a nice friendly take for Maxwell
good length and angled into middle stump. Mistimed drive rolls back at the bowler
full and just outside off, driven along the ground to sweeper cover
full and into the pads, beaten on the flick
overpitched outside off, mistimed slog to deep midwicket
good length and in at off stump, leans into that and punches toe extra cover's left
low full toss on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
good length and another googly outside off, gets forward and turns it into the leg side
googly, good length and at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
swiped to deep midwicket's left this time. Good length and pushed through fast at middle stump. Clears the front leg, weight on the back leg, and places this perfectly to the fielder's left
nonchalant swipe over the bowler. Full and wide outside off, reaches out with extended arms and holds his shape as he watches this fly
full and into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket to bring up his fifty. Ninth in a row against KXIP
short at off stump, drags this pull between deep midwicket and long-on
yorker at off stump from around the wicket. Opens the face and chops this to backward point
oh well bowled. Yorker following him down leg side. Squeezed down to fine leg, just about
hammered straight. Backs into the leg side, meets this off-stump full toss with the middle of the bat. Mid-off is in the circle
full and at the stumps, mistimed slog to long-on's right
beaten as he gets down for the ramp. Anticipating a full one at the stumps there. But this is short of a good length and sailing past his right shoulder as he gets down
low full toss, mistimed drive straight to mid-off
three runs saved at backward point. High full toss outside off, he looks to steer that between backward point and short third man. Can't beat the dive
low full toss at leg stump, driven to long-on's left
full and in at middle stump, clears the front leg for the slog, but can only get this to long-on along the ground

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Warner, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: dipping yorker outside off, jammed to extra cover off the front foot. Oh no the siren's gone off. He's overstepped.
low full toss tailing in at leg stump. Tries to make room to drive through the off side, gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
dropped short and down leg side, beaten on the pull. Keeper fumbles lunging to his left

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, no run
long_text: nutmegs him. Nicley done. Yorker just outside leg and past his attempted flick
full inswinging yorker at leg stump, jammed into the covers
low full toss on middle stump, clipped expertly between deep midwicket and long-on

oh that sounds dangerous! Good things there's no one in the stands. He's changed his bat about three times in the last five minutes, but those arms are doing all the work right now. This is full and pushed wide outside off from around the wicket and he's down on his knee quickly to swing through this and send it into the second tier, in long-on's direction
swatted over midwicket. Short at middle stump, back in the crease and an easy swipe across the line of that. 90 metres

slapped wide of long-off. Good length, wide and sliding away. Sits up at a good pace and he clubs it off the front foot. Mandeep does brilliantly to sprint across and get a hand to that, but it slips through
late cut to short fine.Warner shapes for the switch-hit but has to adjust as Maxwell pushes this down leg side
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover with the angle
low full toss outside off, swiped past his partner and to long-on's left to complete the fifth 100+ stand between these two

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, no run
long_text: short and in at the front shoulder. Mistimed pull, off the under-edge to short fine
low full toss outside off, mistimed swat to deep midwicket's left
that's his third fifty of the season. Good length outside off, lofted on the up and to long-on's left
short and down leg side as Bairstow runs down the pitch at him

short_text: Arshdeep Singh to Bairstow, no run
long_text: low full toss wide outside off, shapes away from late in the path and he gets this drive to extra off the toe-end
full and just outside off, clears the front leg and clatters this to sweeper cover
low full toss at the boots, flicked to deep midwicket
pumped straight. Attempted googly it seems. But there's no grip, it slides off of a length on off stump. Warner has the front leg in the leg side and a bat swing to die for
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven along the ground to long-off
full on middle, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
short and sliding into middle stump, mistimed pull to deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX runs
long_text: over square leg. They've put pressure right away on the youngster. Drops it short at middle stump, he's deep in the crease and pulls without any fuss

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, FOUR runs
long_text: full and wide outside off, another googly. Bairstow down on one knee and drives cleanly to clear extra cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX runs
long_text: drilled over long-on. Lands nicely in his swinging arc, just outside off, and he has nailed the connection on this lofted drive
thick edge as he looks to drive a googly. Full and dipping outside off, lands to short third's left
full outside off, steps out and yorks himself. Squeezes it to deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, no run
long_text: full and angled into off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, tapped to extra cover's left
good length and sliding on with the arm. Warner looks to punch through the covers for the one that turns. It slides into midwicket off the inside half
good length on middle, steps out and chips to long-off's right
full on middle, steps out and whips to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, flicked expertly to deep midwicket's right with soft hands
full on off stump, driven along the ground to long-off

good length and sliding rapidly into off stump. Punched to cover. Third umpire being called for a run-out appeal at the non-striker's end. Warner made a big dive and was in as Mujeeb patted the one-bounce throw onto the stumps
short and just outside off, punched to extra cover
full outside off, driven to extra cover's right. Maxwell with a slide to his right to stop this time
full outside off, steps out and meets it on the full. Punches to mid-off
short of a length and just outside off, mistimed cut into the covers
