good length and just outside off, quickly onto the back foot and punches it between cover and extra. Maxwell ends up stepping on the ball as he tries to backheel it at the boundary. Has a fall too, but he's smiling sheepishly about that surprisingly lazy effort for someone like him
yorker at middle stump, hammed down the pitch
full and in at middle stump. Mistimed push to midwicket off the inside half
slashed over backward point. Short and into the corridor, makes some extra room to swing from under that and he manages to do it
mistimed but past mid-on. Short one gets big on him and his pull shot is bouncing to the right of mid-on, and once again Rahul's dive there won't help

dropped at mid-off. Tough, dipping chance low to the right for Rahul. Looks like he manages to get only one hand on it. Bairstow jumps down the track again, but it's a short delivery and he drives on the up off a high part of the bat. Rahul leaps to the tight and gets a hand on it, but wasn't close to holding on
short of a length just outside off, walks down at him and gets out a short-arm pull. Can't beat midwicket to the right
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
clears short fine. Short ball into the hips, uses the angle to swipe it just past the fiedler's jump
full and just outside off, crunched into the covers
spanked wide of mid-off. Good length and across him again, but just outside off. Half a stride forward and punched on the up, into the turf and timed well enough
slashed over cover. Good length and wide outside off, chucks his hands at that with the intention to go over the infield. That ball it's pace and angle, allows him to execute perfectly
good length and in at middle, pushed into the off side with soft hands
full and down leg side, beaten on the flick
good length and just outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
short of a good length, tucking him up at middle. Dropped into the covers with soft hands
nails it this time. Short and at off again, but this time Warner's compressed his knees a little more to adjust for the lower bounce. Slaps it viciously, wide of mid-on
beaten on the inside edge. Short and angled in at off stump. He looks to swipe with the angle and a flat bat
short and just outside off, shuffles and tucks this to mid-on's right
short of a length and cramped him at middle stump. Mistimed punch to mid-off
good length and floated in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full and into middle stump, driven to long-on
full and into the pads, clipped to deep backward square
low full toss outside off again, but the attempted drive is mistimed towards mid-off this time
low full toss just outside off, holds his shape and taps this wide of extra cover
good length and slanted into off stump. Blocked into the off side

steered past slip. Good length ball outside off, in the corridor, and straightening a touch. He nudges this from inside the line. Whether he was looking for four our not, he finds the third man region with a boundary
straight this time and just short of the boundary. Another good length delivery with some marginal movement away. Half a stride this time and a deliberate attempt to loft this straight and aerially
beaten. Short of a good length and swung away outside off. He looks to go with the front foot pull but that moves away too much
short ball is too short. Even for the keeper. Leaps up with his right hand and can't get to that, Prabsimran
good length and just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
short of a good length, curve away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
good length and wide outswinger outside off, punched into the covers firmly
and Jadeja in typical CSK style ends the last over with three straight boundaries, driving this low full toss past extra cover. Long after the game is over as a contest
another bouncer, hooked away with eyes off. Manages to get a four to deep square leg. NRR boost for CSK. CSK and NRR, tell me of a better love story
lovely shot from Jadeja to upper-cut this short ball over point for a six. As with many of the CSK guns this year, he has fired too late
yorker outside off, dug out for one
quick sharp bouncer at 140ks, nearly into the helmet. Another dot
yorker now, on off, slight swing away too. Pushed to cover

fires this one into the pads at 109ks. Jadeja is beaten on the slog. Narine shows why everyone was clamouring for him to bowl. Opened up the game with Watson's wicket, and has left CSK no chance to win
into the pitch again, but it just sits up for too long. Wide outside off, Jadeja has to reach out for it, and thick edge flies over short third man and point for four
looks to slog a full ball, but manages just a single to deep square leg
quick, wide, short of a length, Jadhav looks to cut, but is hit on the inside half of the bat
looks like the carrom ball, but is too short, and Jadhav just sits back and pulls this wide of long-on for four
sees Jadeja coming, slips one wide outside off, and Jadeja does well to get some bat on it and save himself from a stumping
Jadeja clears the front leg to slog, but Russell gives him nothing. Heavy ball, at his armpit again. No power in the shot. Just the single to long-on
short of a length, at him, dropped to leg for one
another short ball, this might be one for the over as it sails over Jadhav's pull
there is some gas in this short ball. Cross-seam, just outside off, and flies over Jadhav's pull
again that heavy ball. Short of a length, into the armpit, and Jadeja fends at it with eyes off the ball. Gets a single to long leg
can he ever? Can he ever? Back of a length, no room, Curran wants to go over mid-off, but ends up hitting him straight to extra cover
goes back to look to use his pace, but places this straight to short third man
nice dipping offbreak, on a length, turning in from around off. Another block
full, slow, outside off, defended to cover

and hello, the youngster has taken Dhoni down. He sticks to his guns. Flights up a length-ball legcutter. Dhoni opens up the front leg to slog-sweep him, but the ball doesn't turn away. Just goes on with the angle to knock back the middle stump
short, wide and that is the freedom Dhoni needs. He might be getting on a little, but this is some brute force. Cut in front of point for four
offbreak, on a length, pushed to extra cover for one
on a length, carrom ball, punched to deep square leg for one

short_text: Narine to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: is this the over that breaks the game open? Lovely shot. Narine a touch too full, and Curran drives him over extra cover. This is excellent

short_text: Narine to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: Curran provides CSK and Dhoni some relief. What a player he is proving to be. Down the wicket against Narine - a rare sight - and gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts him over long-off
oh he tries the big slog. That is very unDhoni-like. The offbreak dips alarmingly, and then takes the thick inside edge into his front pad
offbreak, short of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
straight offbreak, turning down leg, Dhoni happy with a leg-bye
full and slow, drilled down to long-on for one
quick length ball, Dhoni rocks back to use his pace, and cuts this. Except that he has cut it in front of point. He beats him to the other side, and gets four. This time, he gets two
electric save from Tripathi at deep backwards square leg. Dhoni has pulled this powerfully behind square, but Tripathi puts in a full-length dive to keep this in
seems like the carrom ball. Dhoni goes back to cut, but can't beat point
length ball, offbreak, goes back to punch this down the ground

short_text: Varun to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: offbreak, runs off the leading edge to point
short cover again, another dot. Dhoni yet to hit a boundary off Narine ever
short of a length, no room, Dhoni pushes this to short cover
offbreak, on a length, draws him forward, pushed to long-off for one
similar delivery, and this time he places this past short midwicket. And no Watson means they convert this into a couple

short_text: Narine to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length, pitched outside leg, punched to short midwicket

He has given him. Seems going down leg to me. They go upstairs. Beaten in flight completely. He is trying to pull a ball this is just short of a length, and also skids through. It pitches on off, doesn't turn much, and is this is a carrom ball? It is a front-of-the-hand ball for sure. So it sort of holds its line against the angle, and that means it is clipping leg. Huge wicket. Make that nine dismissals for around 90 runs for Narine v Watson
on a length, straight, worked to deep midwicket. That is fifty for Watson
full, just outside off, driven back at him, and he does well to field in his follow-through
short of a length, stump tp stump, and played back to Nagarkoti
interesting. Dhoni plays a big shot so early into the innings. No feet, and he gets a think outside edge to a length ball. Single to third man
short of a length, Dhoni across and early into the pull. Hit on the box

wow the bowling change works. What do I know about cricket? Rayudu has found long-on with pinpoint precision. Short of a length, not much remarkable about the delivery except that Rayudu decided to pull in the air. Long-on says thank you very much
drags this short, and Rayudu is quick to rock back and pull it to deep square for on
offbreak, on a length, around off, punched down to long-on for one
carrom ball, short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep point
nice offbreak, dipping, just outside off, hit back to him
down the wicket, flat offbreak, hit past midwicket, and Russell makes a diving save at the fence
offbreak, sits up, nearly hit back for a return catch. Falls short
short of a length, on off, pushed to point
bouncer, too high according to the square leg umpire. Called wide
full and wide, hit wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, around off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, Rayudu gets inside the line to nudge this to leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
on a length, on off, slight movement back in. Defended
and this time Watson makes room to clear the ring on the off side. And that is the sparsely populated side of the field. Smart batting again. Just chipping it over the infield
down the wicket, yorks himself a little, gets a single to leg
nearly a yorker, dug out for a single to long-on
one more that falls short. Mavi at deep midwicket runs to his right but doesn't take one step forward, and this Watson pull yorks him. Another misjudgement in the deep
short of a length, quite straight, Rayudu gets inside the line to bunt this pull for a single
length ball, pushed to mid-off for a quick single
pulled away to deep backward square for one more
slower through the air, Rayudu goes back to push this length ball into the covers for one
short, Watson hurried into the pull, gets a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, straight, punched to deep midwicket
the big heave-ho, gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket for one
smart batting. Down on a knee early, gets across, and laps this from outside off, fine of fine leg, who is square
pulled away to deep square for one
leading edge, flies wide of Rana at point. On a length, Rayudu shuffles across again, it holds its line, and the leading edge doesn't go to hand
on a length, he shuffles across to get behind the line, and pushes it back to Nagarkoti
down the wicket, stays inside the line, and goes inside-out to what he has turned into a length ball. Lovely shot
full, on off, driven, but the extra cover is in tight to keep this to a dot
on a length, outside off, dabs on it for a single to third man
back of a length, Rayudu goes deep into the crease, and rubs salt into the wounds by pulling this for four through deep midwicket

nearly picks out the deep fielder. KKR will be questioning if Tripathi shouldn't have attacked this. Watson pulls hard and flat, straight towards Tripathi at deep square, who doesn't step in and watches it land on a half-volley. I count it as a misjudgement and a drop
offbreak, goes back to push this to leg for one
a touch too short, pulled away, but straight to deep square leg
stays short of a length, punched to extra cover
carrom ball first up. Short of a length, punched down to long-on
short of a length, outside off, dropped at his feet virtually. A single taken easily
short of a length again, cut away to third man for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run
long_text: short of a length, straight, pushed to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: Watson taking full toll of the youngster here. Don't go by that wicket last over, Mavi has been pretty ordinary this spell. Nice little short ball for Watson to pull over square leg for six

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: Watson back away, Mavi tries to follow him with a shortish ball, but that plays into the batsman's hand if your fine leg is up. Watson is adept enoogh to place this wide of that fielder
short of a length, straight, tucked off the hip for one
shout for lbw. Swings back in off a length, seems to have hit him in front, but it is bouncing over
sort ball, cramps him up, but he pulls it square of deep square
full and straight, pushed to mid-on for one
lucky runs. Short of a lenngth, just outside off, holds its line, takes the outside edge, and Rayudu's soft hands make sure it doesn't fly. Wide of slip it goes
bouncer, down the leg side, and called wide
full and straight, mis-hit to mid-on, where Narine misfields to allow them a single
nearly run out. On a length, on off, played with an open face to point. Rayudu sends him back, and it is his call. Nagarkoti misses with the throw
short of a length, at him, pulled to deep square for one
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, OUT
long_text: big big wicket. Mavi persisted with despite match-ups calling for Narine. And I don't think Mavi has done anything differently here. This is just one of those T20 things. You bowl the same delivery, and the batsmen plays vastly different shots. Mavi stays short of a length, widish, and du Plessis gives him too much room this time, and edges through to Karthik
on a length, straight, dropped to cover for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: smart shot. Short of a length, slight width, with third man up. And Watson uses all his pace to guide him past that short third man

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run
long_text: length ball, stump to stump, Watson is watchful

short_text: Cummins to du Plessis, no run
long_text: quicker, short of a length, hits him on the thigh pad with movement back in

short_text: Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: draws the short ball with the lovely push to a length ball last ball. And he is seeing this beautifully. Picks the length early, sets up for the pull, and smacks it through midwicket
lovely shot. This is a decent inswinger, honing in on top of off. Du Plessis stays inside its line, and pushes with an open face, placing it wide of extra cover for two
swinging in again, but down leg, so they get a leg-bye
on a length again, swinging back in, no room, defended
perfect length. On off, aiming at the top of off. Defended

short_text: Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: masterly batting by du Plessis. Moving around the crease to hit a young bowler off his plans. Shuffles across, then makes room, and whips a straight short-of-a-length ball through square leg for four

short_text: Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: shuffles across and deep, gets under a shortish ball, and goes over wide mid-off. Not absolutely cleanly struck but gets enough to clear the infield
short of a length again, single to deep midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: stays short of a length, just around off, punched wide of mid-off for one again
short of a length, outside off, Watson goes back to run this down to third man for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, punched wide of mid-off for one
lovely drive. Just a touch too full, and Watson likes to get a stride in. Drives this through extra cover for four
short of a length, gets big on him, he drops it down to point for a single

short_text: Cummins to du Plessis, no run
long_text: lovely delivery. Pitches on a length, on off, nips back in, hits him on the pad, but the umpire rules it is doing too much. And rightly so
this is the outswinger, around off, on a length, off the thick edge it runs to third man
full, slight shape in, hits the inside half of the bat on the drive
short of a length, on off, good carry as it is left alone

low full toss, hits into the leg side, and they will risk the second. And magically, Dhoni has out that big glove back on by the time he reaches the wicket to collect the throw. And collect the throw he does to run him out

and that glove off nearly brings a drop. Mavi gets a big edge to a wide slower ball, the edge flies to Dhoni's right, who sticks out the ungloved hand, and the ball lobs off away towards short third man. Dhoni runs off, puts a dive in, and takes the rebound
low full toss, can't get under it, hit straight to long-off for one
on-pace length ball, Cummins slogs, gets two off the inside half of the bat
slower ball now, and Nagarkoti mis-times this to mid-off for a catch. At least that bring Cummins to the strike
sharp bouncer. You know young kid will be under pressure after one early dot. Now it is two as he slips a quick bouncer in and beats him. Oh this is too high. Called a wide
he backs away, then shuffles across, looking for the ramp, but is beaten by an on-pace length ball. The idea is not bad, but the execution is
wide, short of a length, Karthik tries to go for the upper-cut, but the lack of pace means he can't time it well. Caught at square third man by Thakur, but not on the first attempt

short_text: Sam Curran to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped by Jadeja. How rare is that event? Karthik shuffles wide again, and sweeps this flat towards deep midwicket. High to the right of Jadeja it goes, who gets both hands to it, but it slips out and rolls on for four

short_text: Sam Curran to Karthik, no run
long_text: full and wide, really wide, but not called as Karthik has shuffled across early
full and wide, with the third man back and also a short third man in. This one goes to the man in the deep. For a single
lovely drive on the up, looks to beat extra cover, but Bravo puts in a dive and gets a hand on it. They still get two
looks to shuffle and ramp, but Curran bowls the slower one and concedes just the one leg-bye
Cummins providing this innings the final twist? Gets under a short-of-a-length ball, and effortlessly swings it over wide long-on for six. Excellent timing

slower ball. Not sure it is a knuckle ball or not, but it beats Cummins outside off. Thakur appeals for a catch at the wicket, Dhoni doesn't support him. Also not a slower ball. Just bowled cross-seam, and it sits in the surface
out of the screws. Short ball, not too high, and Cummins pull this over midwicket for four
wide down the leg side
bouncer, on off, pulled to deep square leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, runs off the outside edge for a single to third man
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
wide full toss, and another fumble by Jagadeesan at extra cover. No run, though

catch or a bump ball?. It is a near yorker steered straight to short third man. We go to the third man. The soft signal is out. It bounces short of the bat, and goes off the toe end for a clean catch to short third man. A fair effort by Tripathi, who did his usual Powerplay slogging before selflessly hitting out post PP. Not his fault that Morgan and Russell got out at the other end
hit hard on the up and straight to extra cover, but a misfield there gives them two runs
short and wide, and Tripathi upper-cuts it away over point. Wide of square third man too
short of a length, on-pace, into the body, worked off the hip for one
short of a length, no room, slight cut back in, hits him high on the pad
short ball, hurries him up, pulled down to long leg for one
short of a length, outside off, opens the face for a single to third man
wide length ball, pushed with an open face to deep cover
on a length again, on off, pushed wide of long-on for two

huge wicket. Russell clears the front leg to slog to leg, but Thakur has been superb. Unerring with his length. Short of a length, cross-seam, lands on the seam, bounces, and takes the top edge through to Dhoni
on a length, cross-seam, hurries Russell up a touch. Hit to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to extra cover
short of a length, not much room, punched down to long-off for one
this is just poor bowling. A gentle length ball well down the leg side with the fine leg up. Tripathi laps it up with a sweep over short fine leg
on a length, straight, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover for one
oh he gets a gift from the returning Chahar. Well down the leg side with fine leg up, and he helps it over short fine. That will find him breathing space

and there is a wicket at the wrong end. It is Tripathi who should be getting out from KKR's point of view. Instead it is Morgan gone off a really good sharp bouncer. It is angled into the body and over his right shoulder and takes the glove on the way through to Dhoni
slower short ball, Tripathi is swinging hard but he is finding neither the fence nor the fielders. That is a good result for CSK. Just the single to long-on

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, no run
long_text: quicker ball, hits him on the thigh pad as Tripathi attempts another big hit into the leg side

slower ball, outside leg, Tripathi looks to sweep this behind square but the slowness means he ends up hitting it in front of square. Still gets two as Chahar loses the ball in the air and doesn't attack it
on a length, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
another run-out missed. Curran cramps him up, Tripathi plays this to Curran's right and runs off. Curran misses with Tripathi miles out of the crease
nice legbreak, middle and leg, turning back in to crap him up. Hits his pad

stays away from the Tripathi slog by shortening the length. Bottom edge for one to covershailesh: "In middle over, 20 runs in 10 balls don't make much sense. I would rather have a proper batsman, who can hit in the end and will cover-up. Losing wickets surely slow down things and we shouldn't underestimate the power of set batsman."
makes room to dab this length ball to point for one
wide length ball, driven hard, but the deep cover is straight to keep this kind of a drive down to one
sees him look to come down, slips a wide quick legbreak to beat him. Tripathi does well to keep his back foot in the crease
slider, middle and off, runs off the outer half of the bat for one
and he shows why. On a length, no room. Defended back to him
slight shimmy again, Thakur cramps him up again, another leg-bye
on a length, pitched outside leg, shapes in a touch, hits him on the pad and goes fine of third man for two
bouncer, at him, Morgan, who is shimmying down, has to avoid it
on a length, just a touch straighter, pushed to cover this time
oh is he in good touch or what? Just laces a cover-drive first ball square of extra cover and straight of deep cover. Just a lovely little push to a length ball

Jadeja and du Plessis combine for a superb catch. Narine continues with his job of slogging these middle overs. He seems to have placed this between long-on and deep midwicket, but Jadeja makes the ground to his right and makes the dive to catch it. He doesn't quite need to do it, but he relays the catch to du Plessis because the boundary skirting is not too far from him
slow wide legbreak, slogged across the line, but gets a bottom edge for one to long-on
Triphti turns down the second. This has been placed wide of deep square, but he doesn't go for the second
on a length, outside off, pushed straight of extra cover for one
full, into the pads, worked into the leg side for what looks like a couple but Narine slips while turning around

Tripathi will not hold back, which is how he should play instead of setting himself up for a personal landmark. He knows he is not close enough to this full ball so chips this right back over his head for a single
on a length, into the pads, placed between deep midwicket and deep square for two
and now he plays with the field. Full, nearly a yorker, outside off, squeezed between short third and point
Narine showing he can hit with the field spread too. And that too to a slower ball. Offcutter, outside off, on a length, and he goes over long-off. Nailed beautifully
bouncer, on-pace, 130ks, down the leg side, called wide
slower ball, full, driven hard to long-on for one
short wide, and Tripathi keeps chugging along. Upper-cuts this over the ring. Brings up his fifty. Back where he belongs
low full toss, angling in, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, just outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
full, just too close to him to try an aerial hit. Driven to long-on for one
on a length, on the pads, nudged to short fine leg for one
Tripathi keeps going. Flat slog sweep to deep midwicket for one
quick legbreak, no turn, kept out by Tripathi
big slog-sweep, but it hangs in the air for a catch at long-on. Just not full enough even though Rana is going with the turn. Just not close enough to the pitch of the ball to nail this
short of a length, punched straight of midwicket for one
on a length, straight, off the leading edge it goes to mid-off for one
slower off cutter, wide, on a length, driven on the up, to the left of the sweeper cover for two
short of a length, around off, no room, pushed to point
full, on the pads, clipped into a gap on the on side
short of a length, straight, pushed to midwicket
on a length, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
half-volley, on off, driven hard past extra cover for two
Tripathi continues slogging. That is so good to see. And good intentions bring good results. He has slogged this full all the way over the leaping Curran at long-on
full, on off, driven to long-on for another single
short of a length, into the pads, punched down to long-on
legbreak, on a length, straight, pushed down the ground
and he repeats it, but Rana uses soft hands to drop it towards short third for one
short of a length, into the body, short-arm jab to deep square leg for one
short offcutter, spinning down the leg side. He is lucky Tripathi has got no bat on it as the fine leg is up
and Tripathi goes the distance now. Knuckle ball, picked early, taken on the half-volley that it is, and lofted over wide long-off
short of a length, no room, punched to cover
this one moves in, worked away to short fine leg for one
looks like a legcutter. At 130ks. On a length, opens him up a little with away movement. Defended back to him
bouncer, 140ks, around off, and Rana sways out of its line
short of a length, straight, defended off the back foot
full and wide, with third man up, and Rana throws his bat at it, getting a thick edge over the man for four runs
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease

Thakur gets Gill a third time in three innings. Looks to slog at a length ball while he has been picking the singles so well till now. Perhaps just saw a length ball and went after it, which is fair enough. Thakur has bowled it cross-seam, and it seems to have hit the smooth leather and skidded on, taking the bottom edge
slower ball, wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, and he has hit this too well to be taking a single to mid-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, FOUR runs
long_text: Tripathi is loving this promotion. The fields are up, and he is swinging selflessly at the ball. Clears mid-off this time

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, no run
long_text: misses out on a full toss outside off. Ends up swinging inside its line
on a length, around off, cutting away, pushed in front of point for another single
short of a length, on off, pushed in front of point for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, FOUR runs
long_text: pitched outside leg, fine leg is up, and all he needs is some bat on it. He gets inside the line, and guides it to the fence
offcutter, on a length, around off, dropped into the covers for one
short ball, angling into him, with short fine leg up, and Tripathi knows he doesn't need to nail the hook. He just helps it along over the fielder's head

and Tripathi now slogs. That is what made him a good opener for RPS. Selfless slogging. Gets enough on this length ball to clear the infield. Thakur gives it chase and puts in a big dive but the third umpire rules he is in touch with the ball when his knee makes contact with the rope
on a length, wicket to wicket, pushed to mid-on for one
short at gentle pace, and pulled away over midwicket for four

Jadeja misses again. This time at the non-striker's. Again he gets a good bounce, and again Tripathi is short. He has started off the back foot, and has had to run around Chahar, but he is lucky again. Jadeja doesn't usually miss two out of two
inswinger, strays to leg, clipped away for one

Jadeja misses. He is tight at point, gets a good bounce, and the batsmen have absent-mindedly set off for a single. In the end, Tripathi is left to put in a dive, which is not enough if Jadeja hits. On this rare occasion, Jadeja misses

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 leg bye
long_text: inswinger, down the leg side, concedes a leg-bye

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, no run
long_text: stays on a length, swings back in, defended back to him

short_text: Sam Curran to Tripathi, no run
long_text: some seam away from around leg, after pitching on a length. Squares him up a touch
on a length, outside off, pushed to mid-off for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Gill, no run
long_text: Curran is very lucky here. Bowls a plum half-volley, Gill plays a lovely straight drive, but just too straight and into the wicket at the non-striker's end. The ricochet goes straight to mid-off
wide inswinger, shapes back in a touch to end up within the wide line. Left alone
down the wicket, Chahar bowls an inswinger, he pushes this to mid-off and charges off for a single that he makes easily despite the direct hit
outswinger, on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, swinging away, steered to square third man
half-volley outside off, driven hard, but straight to cover
starts down the leg side again, and this time Tripathi tickles it away for four. A welcome drink for Tripathi at the top of the order
big wide down the leg side. He goes slightly round arm with this
taken at extra cover. Short of a length, just outside off, looks to slash that into the off side and it comes off the high part of the bat and floats up for Rohit who leaps and holds on easily
straight to Pollard at long-on. Low full toss at the stumps, mistimes the slog, Pollard takes it without having to move. Best figures of the season for a bowler. It's also his first four-for in T20s
swatted wide of long-on again! Short ball at off, drags it with a pull right off the middle
bouncer at off stump, takes his eyes off that and swats it to deep midwicket's right
low full toss on leg stump, stands tall and whips that to long-on's right
full toss headed for the top of off. Backs away and looks to punch that through the off side. Outside edge stopped on the half-volley by QDK, to his right
full at off stump, drives firmly to long-off
full on leg stump, looks for the flick, gets a leading edge towards sweeper cover
good length outside off, sliced to sweeper's left
full on off stump, patted out to mid-off on the front foot
full on off stump, squeezed down to long-off
just over deep midwicket. Slower short ball and a nice swinging height for Jofra on the pull
yorker outside off, beaten on the slash
yorker at leg stump, stabbed out to mid-on

taken behind. That rose up at Gopal, and then it rose up at QDK too. Some fire in that delivery. Short of a length, just outside off. Looks to stab it down to third man and gets the outside edge. QDK is let's say woken up by that one, to his right
yorker at off stump, pushed to sweeper cover
short and just outside off, runs it to third man's right
nails another yorker and that's deflected onto the stumps off his back leg. Got the front leg out of the way and tried to whip it leg side, but that was too good for him
yorker at middle stump, squeezed out to midwicket
swatted to long-off's right, first ball. Slower ball, short and wide outside off, Back leg well into the off side as he lines this up and brings a hammer at it. Flat and one bounce over the line
slower ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
taken for deep midwicket. Slower short ball just outside off, can't clear the ground with his attempted lofted pull. Midiwcket jogs to the left to take that
short and into the hips, pulled to deep square's right

short_text: Pollard to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: slower short ball, he's beaten on the pull and can't believe that's not a wide

short_text: Pollard to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: full and wide outside off, sliced over point. Was looking to go straighter than that but it's enough
oh smoothly lofted over mid-off. Overpitched and wide outside off, just goes with the angle, uses the pace, and connects perfectly on this drive
short and just outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover
bouncer gets too big for him to get that upper cut away

sensational Pollard! Seems to give us one of these every year. Full and in at leg stump, lines it up and wants to club that over long-on. Makes decent connection, but little elevation on that. Well, too little when it's Pollard anyway. A couple of strides to his left,  and then he jumps up and reaches for that with his right palm. The ball clatters into his forearm, it appears, and threatens to drop to the ground. But after all that he's done up to that point, he's still alive to it and recovers to get his hands in position and hold on low to his left. A special catch to end a special innings. Grins sheepishly at his dugout behind him
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

short_text: Pattinson to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: short of a good length outside off, gets down for the ramp, improvises for the reverse-ramp and misses completely. QDK leaps to his right to stop that
good length outside off, mistimed slog down to long-on
slower ball, short of a good length and into off stump. Punched to long-off
inside edge onto pad. In the slot, just outside off. Was through that slog a little early
dragged to deep square's left. Slower short ball at middle stump, waits again and pulls aerially to find the boundary
clears long-on. Slower ball, dipping at a good length outside off. Buttler waits and watches and then thwack. To long-on's left
good length and into the pads, flicked to deep square's left
short and into the hips, mistimed pull to long-on's right
low full toss outside off, driven to long-off's left
low full toss fired wide outside off as he walks into the leg side. Beaten as he can't reach that
good length at off, steps out and punches to long-off
fires the yorker in at leg stump, jammed down to long-on

is this on? Buttler is, for sure. Short of a good length, angled into him as he walks into the leg side, and he uses the angle to swipe yet another one over the leg side. 87 metres in the direction of midwicket
full outside off, dragged down to long-on with a swipe

sends it over long-on! That's fifty. Singlehandedly keeping them alive tonight. Chahar goes diagonal run-up again and loses his bearings. Drops this wayyyyy too short outside off and it's a clean swing with the pull
full on middle, mistimed slog off the inside half to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, laced on the up to sweeper
length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover

would have been a brilliant stumping but Curran survives. Short ball down leg side as he spots Chahar jumping down the pitch. QDK does brilliantly to pluck this down leg side and then try and flick it onto the stumps, but he misses

short_text: Chahar to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length and pushed through at leg stump. Tapped back down the pitch
full and in at middle, driven to extra cover
slapped over the extra cover boundary. It's short and it's low and wide outside off. But there's a lot of time. He puts the front leg out and slaps it with the turn
good length outside off, steps out and drives to long-off's left
good length and staying low at leg stump. Flicked to deep square's left
good length and wide outside off, slashed on the up to sweeper's left
short and into the hips, flicked to deep square off the back foot
short and just outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot
good length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side with soft hands

short_text: Chahar to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: just short of extra cover. Good length ball tossed up outside off, slapped on the rise and taken on the half volley
full on middle stump, drilled along the ground to deep midwicket
see ya. Dropped short, outside off, sitting right up and he pummels this over midwicket with a pull

incredible catch running backwards from extra cover! Looks like Anukul Roy, a sub. Full ball outside off, looks to heave leg side, gets a leading edge that's headed towards landing just past where mid-off might've been. He sprints backwards and to his left and pull out a full-length dive to hold on to that. Brilliant

a plea for lbw from Pattinson! That pitched outside leg, surely? He's over the wicket. Lomror shuffles and catches this in front of middle as he looks for the glance. Rohit not convinced on the review
good length and into the pads, tickled down to fine leg
slower length ball at leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
good length and in at middle stump, backs away and punches to extra cover
short at off stump, swiped to deep square's left along the ground
short and up at the helmet. Fends it awkwardly down to fine leg
good length on middle stump, pushes for the angle but that's off the inside edge to deep square
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
short of a good length, skidding onto the pad as he looks to glance
beaten in flight but manages to cover this with the body and jab to extra cover. Good length ball sliding away outside off
full at middle stump, drags the reverse sweep straight to backward point
full outside off, reverse sweep to backward point's left. Kishan with a dive there but not a clean stop
full and into the pads, flicked to deep square
beaten. Good length and just outside off. Drives on the up and from inside the line of that
good length and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
shot! Nice balance on that from Lomror. Short and just outside off, got his head right on top of the bounce and elegantly punched through the covers
short and wide across off stump, opens the face and gets it through to third man. Backward point got a bad bounce
short of a good length outside off, tucked to deep square's right off the back foot
slower short ball at leg stump, tickles it very fine. Fine leg is very fine. A Buttler specific fine leg
beats short third to the right. Good length and just outside off, waits on that, opens the face at the perfect moment and splits the two fielders behind square on the off side
short and just outside off, mistimed pull past the non-striker
beaten. Good length and skidding past the outside edge as he opens the face too soon
good length and just outside off, punched to point off the back foot
short and in at off stump, punched back down the pitch
beaten. Short of a good length angled in, straightens off the pitch and beat the back foot punch
overpitched on leg stump, waits on that and times it beautifully to mid-on's right. Lovely hands
how'd that miss off stump! Oh boy. That was a yorker angled and was continuing to move in with that angle. Buttler was looking to carve through the covers
good length and in at the corridor, pushed to mid-on with the angle
good length and in at off stump, punched on the rise to mid-off
short and just outside off, defended off the back foot

taken at mid-on. Oh boy, it's a familiar script for Rajasthan. Short ball, up at the ribs and angled across off stump. He's cramped on the pull, gets in a poor position for it and slices it up for mid-on. It's long been a way to get Sanju out and it  works on the night
full outside off, driven to mid-off
lifts over the stumps. Good length on middle stump, walks into the off side to try and ramp that
good length and just outside off. Defeneded from the crease
shot. Short and wide outside off him, 140kph. There are three fielders in the covers and he's slapped it between two of them

appeal for catch behind as Bumrah cuts through him. Mumbai don't review the not-out decisions. Short of a good length and cramping him at the thigh. It's gone through to the keeper off the thigh guard
short of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers

taken low to the left by the keeper. Smith's inexplicable powerplay batting decisions continue. It's astounding how he's thrown it away the last three matches. This is a good length ball outside off, slanted into him. He's had a big big swipe across the line without moving his feet and the inside edge is taken. A wild swipe and he nearly fell into the off side at the end of that
good length and rising up at middle stump. He's off his feet trying to flick this, cops it on the thigh
good length and just outside off, punched to mid-off's right
good length and angled into the corridor, shuffles and flicks straight to square leg
good length and just outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
full inswinger at off stump, driven to mid-off
whipped away! Outrageous. Short ball outside off, drops his weight into the off side and uses his wrists to get this behind square
good length and swung in at off stump, punched back at the bowler off the back foot
not a successful return for Jaiswal. It's short of a good length, it's curving away from him outside off. He hangs leg side of it and has a swish at it. A thin edge taken comfortably
good length on middle stump, shuffles and tucks this to midwicket from the crease
low full toss on middle stump, mistimed drive to long-on's right and Hardik slips at the other end so they can't come back for the second
mistimed and dragged over long-on. That's another friendly full toss from Rajpoot. Thigh height at off stump, he slices the attempted slow but that's enough
slower full ball dipping outside off, swiped into midwicket region off the low part of the bat
ramped over short fine again. Low full toss outside off, skips into the line and it's easy work for him from there
in the slot and wide outside off, but he doesn't get close to that as his feet are rooted. Mistimed off the inside half to long-on

yorker outside off, mistimed drive to long-off and that allows them the second. SKY comes back and puts in a dive too, in case the doctors are still looking at his coordination. The siren has gone off, by the way. He has overstepped
low full toss outside off, looks to drill through the covers but it trickles into the leg side off the toe-end
short of a good length outside off, walks into the line again and swipes to fine leg's left

oh wow! Wow. Unreal. The cojones on this guy. Walks into a bouncer head first, but is still looking for the boundary behind the wicket next ball. He squats as a full ball lands just outside off, and then opens the face to lift this over well, the first slip region. And it goes all the way

now SKY is hit on the helmet and looks out of sorts. It was a slower bouncer outside off and he walked into it. That hit him on the badge. And it rung immediately. He's on his feet. But seemed disoriented immediately. It was a knuckle ball and from Jofra, even that can do damage. But it looks like he's passed whatever test they were giving him. A nod to the doctors and the helmet is back on
full outside off, opens the face and sliced to sweeper cover
beaten. Slower ball at a good length, wide outside off, has a swish at that
full and low at the stumps, drilled to long-on's left

oh well done getting out of the way. That. Was. Scary. Absolutely terrifying  - a beamer from Jofra headed straight for Hardik's head. He just manages to get under that. It was 152kph. It's got everyone, including Buttler. Snuck under him. Holds up his hands in apology

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: and now he lifts it over short fine! Savvy batting, this. Expected a shorter length and was fed with a slower short ball outside off, much like the one he got from Jofra, last ball of the last over. Dropped his right shoulder and ramped this

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, SIX runs
long_text: whew, clean! Nice anticipation of the yorker and even better execution of the sweep. Low full outside off, he's down, nearly both knees on the floor and lifts it over square leg who was in the circle

dropped. Curran foxes Hardik with a slower short ball outside off. He slices the attempted pull and it hangs up in the short midwicket area. Somehow Curran ends up getting too far ahead of this and is reaching backwards and to his right
yorker nailed at middle stump, can't do more than jam this to deep midwicket

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, FOUR runs
long_text: just manages to beat sweeper to his right. Low full toss outside off, stands upright, opens the face and gets it over extra cover
low full toss just outside off, shuffled and drills to deep midwicket
and that's a reply and a half! SKY is elated with that. It's a knuckle ball, short and outside off. He backs into the leg side, stays more upright this time and manages to swipe that over short fine
quickly past his attempted ramp. That ball has a chuckle at SKY as he's down on one knee. It was short and sailed over him, outside off
yorker just outside off, exposes the stumps to try and carve that. Can only get it to backward point on the bounce. A 151.9kph yorker that one
short and cramping him up at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a good length and quick in the corridor. Hurriedly punched back to the bowler

past mid-off. It's hard to tell if that was a miscued shot or just one he was looking to connect on, whichever direction. Slower ball, short of a good length outside off, it's a half-cut, half-punch off the back foot and it's between bowler and fielder
slower short ball outside off, subdued pull out to deep midwicket's right
slower short ball outside off, pulled to long-on

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, no run
long_text: half a run-out chance at the non-striker's. Good length outside off, punched to extra cover's left. Hardik sent back and might have made it even if Smith's throw was collected
full on middle stump, drilled to long-on
slower short ball at middle, pulled to deep square

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: past the keeper first and then short third. God that must be annoying as a fielding team but it is expertly done and he has a fifty. He's kept his scoring rate up even as wickets fall around. Allows this legcutter to come on in the corridor and stabs it late
yorker outside off, gets low and guides this to third man's left
good length outside off, neatly punched to sweeper's right
misfield at extra cover. Good length outside off, punched sweetly off the middle and it's slipped through from under the fielder
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Pandya, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump, 138kph. Punched back to the bowler on the rise
bouncer, wide outside off. Too short and sailing over his head
slower short ball, wide outside off. Backs away and chops to sweeper cover

taken at midwicket. You can almost see this coming when Krunal is up against elite pace. Short and at his ribs and he gets in poor positions, and that's what's happened. Pinned right back, trying to pivot on his back toe, with the front leg in the air. Can't get a horizontal bat at this, just ends up shoveling awkwardly to the fielder on the circle
beaten on the drive this time. A slower ball, good length and outside off. Was looking to go aerial and through the line, over mid-off. It was a knuckle ball
past the hook. Short and steep and fast at middle stump, he's not close to making connection
another short legcutter as SKY backs into the leg side to use his pace for the slash. Late cut down to third man
legcutter, short and at middle stump. Backs away to try and open up the point region. Checks his cut to the fielder
good length at middle stump, deep in the crease to tap this into the leg side
googly, short and wide outside off. Under-edge on the attempted cut
full outside off, big stride out to flick to deep midwicket's right
short and across him outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
good length at middle, steps out and drills to long-on
leading edge down to long-off as he looks to whip this googly from outside off, off the back foot
launched over the bowler's head. Good length delivery angled into his swinging arc and he's quicky down on a knee to lift this
googly, full on leg stump, well forward to drive to long-on
googly, short and wide outside off. Beaten on the cut
googly, good length and into leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket
crashed to sweeper's right. Front-of-the-hand overpitched ball, wide outside off. Goes inside-out
spanked past extra cover! Short and just outside off, goes the other way this time - deep in the crease - and hits it aerially and to sweeper's right
sweetly placed. Good length and a legbreak outside off. He gets well outside the line of that and sweeps so perfectly, all along the floor with a big stride. There's no one at long leg
short of a length, sliding into the corridor. Chopped to backward point
appeal for lbw turned as he's struck in front of leg. That was spinning in and might taken an inside edge too as he looked to defend
good length and sliding onto leg stump. Punched to midwicket off the back foot
low full toss on leg stump, punched along the floor to long-on
googly, short of a good length and just outside off. Opens the face and gets it to short third
short of a good length, just outside off. Sliding across off stump. Chopped to backward point
full on leg stump, looks to sweep, deflected to long leg off the pad
falls short of the bowler. Good length and dipping outside off. Pokes with hard hands
good length and just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length, tossed right up at off. Watchfully defended on the front foot

taken at extra cover! Oh boy, Ishan Kishan. For all the other goodness he gives you, he has a bit of misadventure too. That's what this is. Gopal back to the regulation legbreak again, tossed right up outside off. Kishan wants to pump him over the leg side first up but loses shape, slices it up for Samson to take to his right

lofted straight to long-on. Looks like a regulation legbreak, flighted and dipping. Didn't bowl one of these in his last over. Rewarded immediately in this one. Rohit steps out and doesn't make the pitch of this. Wants to lift it straight but he's having to reach out and it's taken well within the boundary

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: thick edge past the keeper. Short outside off, 141kph, has the room for the slash and that's what he does. More third man runs

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, no run
long_text: three dots in a row. Once again, SKY backing too far into the leg side. This is short and wide and he gets an under-edge to Buttler on the cut

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length offcutter, wide outside off. Makes too much room and can only get this square drive as far as backward point

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, no run
long_text: yorker and just outside off. Jammed into the pitch

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: oh lovely. Short and in the corridor, stays firmly planted this time and allows it right under his eye before nudging it through the cordon region. The other side of third man this time

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide outside off, dances leg side of it and then jabs at it. Almost got a little to far from that, but managed to get the chop in, with bottom hand coming off. Wide of third man

short_text: Gopal to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly, full and outside off. Leans in and pushes it back to the bowler

short_text: Gopal to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly, short and into off stump. Cut straight to backward point

short_text: Gopal to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: launched over deep midwicket. Dropped short, a googly, but outside off. Sits up nicely and the lofted pull rarely fails off this particular bat
good length and into the pads, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
front-of-the-hand again, and this time an offcutter. Tapped down the pitch
lofted over extra cover. Peak SKY. Full and front-of-the hand this, like a legcutter. Gives it a nice skid onto SKY who lifts it inside-out
short and wide outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper cover
short and down leg side, beaten on the attempted glance

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, opens the face and guides to third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide
long_text: good bouncer, but a bit too high says leg umpire. That was directed right at the head
short and just outside off, pulls above it and is beaten. It lands short of Buttler and deflects towards fine leg

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, cut firmly to backward point on the bounce. Fumbles it but recovers quickly enough to stop the single

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short and wide outside off, sliced to third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
long_text: mistimed pull over midwicket. Short and getting big once again off the pitch. About 137kph. Rohit drags it from outside off

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, flicked into the leg side
good length and down leg side as he looks to flick that

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: oh nicely adjusted. Full and into leg stump. Looks like he was into that a bit early, but he continued to offer the full face and then used his wrists to place that perfectly to short midwicket's left

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, driven off the inside half of the bat to short midwicket

short_text: Tom Curran to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: appeal for lbw turned down. Good length ball hitting his in front of middle and leg as he shuffles for the flick. Probably missing leg stump with the angle

short_text: Tom Curran to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: leading edge as he looks to flick this from middle stump. Third time I'm seeing that this evening, second time from Rohit. Closed the face too soon
good length and in the corridor. Opens the face and runs it to third man
short of a good length, just outside off at 135.7kph. Opens the face to steer this to third man

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to de Kock, OUT
long_text: a wicket on debut! Short ball gets too steep for QDK. It's at middle stump and angled across him. He's backing into the leg side trying to hook this, but slices it up for Buttler to take to his right

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: diving stop by Rajpoot to his left at short third. 141kph, good length and in the corridor. Rohit leans back for the late cut

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: picked up over square leg. A full toss at middle stump. Looks like that slipped out. Rohit has the front leg in the air as he hurriedly puts this away. 141kph

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: wide of the crease, just short of a good length and angled into Rohit at 135kph. Looks to punch through the covers, gets an inside edge to short fine

short_text: Kartik Tyagi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: good length and just outside off at 133kph, nicely forward to defend into the covers
short of a length at the hips, whipped with the angle to fine leg

short_text: Archer to de Kock, no run
long_text: yorker and jut outside off, beaten on the attempted chop

short_text: Archer to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: dragged over square leg! This is all hand and eye. Woof. Good length at middle stump, stands his ground and swings across the line to use the pace

short_text: Archer to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: past Rajpoot's dive at fine leg. 150.4kph, short of a good length and down leg side. QDK has a slash at it and it's dipping rapidly on Rajpoot to his left. He puts in a dive but can't get a hand on it. Jofra thinks that was easier than it looked

short_text: Archer to de Kock, no run
long_text: cops that on the body as it lifts past the outside edge on his attempted glance. 145kph that, good length and on a middle stump line
full and just outside off, driven to cover's right and a fumble from him. Looks like Curran got an awkward bounce

short_text: Rajpoot to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and tucking him up in the corridor. Mistimed punch into the covers

short_text: Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: gently lifts it over short fine. Full slower ball just outside off, and QDK is moving almost slow-mo. Nicely into the off side, eyes on it the whole time and a little scoop for the four
good length at the stumps, tucked to deep square leg off the back foot

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed to sweeper's left. Not saving that, third man or not. Short outside off, waits on it again and cuts late

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: lofted over the long-off boundary. He's taking to Rajpoot's pace here. Full and just outside off, no movement. Sliding nicely on for him to go through the line after offering the full face

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, well forward to defend into the covers
good length and turning into leg stump. Clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
under-edge into the off side as this front-of-the-hand quicker one stays low and goes across him. He was looking to cut

short_text: Gopal to de Kock, no run
long_text: full googly outside off, back down the pitch off the lead edge as he closes the face on it
good length and sliding in at the corridor. Punched to long-off's left off the back foot

short_text: Gopal to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, turning away from him as he cuts straight to cover point
full on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: carved between point and short third. More and more teams are now putting a sweeper out and having third man inside. Short of a good length from Rajpoot and quite wide outside off. Rohit allows that on and picks up some easy runs

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and wide awayswinger. Slashes at that and is beaten

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length outswinger from off stump. Closes the face on that as he defends into the covers off the leading edge
full and in at the pads, tucked through vacant square leg

short_text: Rajpoot to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, chopped to backward point
full and swung down leg side, beaten on the flick

short_text: Rajpoot to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: past mid-off. Full and floaty, just outside off. Leans into that with almost no feet, but he's right on top of it to pat it past his partner
short ball, into his body, the inside edge gets them a single
slower short ball outside off, and Pant gets his body behind this take as it reaches him on a half-volley
wide down the leg side, and Pant can't make a clean collection as it falls short and wide of him
makes room, swings hard, gets a thick edge to third man
quicker ball, cramps him up. Dot
Saini getting his own back. He dishes out beamers and bouncers, but is courageous enough to take it when it is thrown at him. Now he gets under a slower ball and lofts it over mid-off
slower short ball, cut square of third man for two
full and straight, Siraj is off the cut strip trying to make room. He hits the base of the middle stump
short ball, follows him as he backs away. Draws a dot
low full toss, on off, and he does well to make room and squeeze this past point for four
on a length, quick, outside off, runs off the outer half of the bat for a single
full toss outside off, yorker gone wrong. Hit to mid-off
backs away to hit this to deep cover for one
looks for the five-for with a full straight ball, but Saini defends it well
short of a length, Saini has no plans of getting behind the line, and Rabada follows him. Beats him
low full toss, nearly a yorker, kept out
slower ball to Udana, not to Saini. And he gets a top edge as he backs away. Taken at extra cover
bouncer. Tewatia's, Rashid's, Stoinis's, everyone's revenge will be taken by your Rabada. Mean bouncer, he throws up his hands to protect his face

straight quick length ball. Bude swings in Abu Dhabi, Rabada hits the wicket in Dubai. This is becoming a huge NRR blip for RCB. Oh hang on. We are checking if DC had four inside the circle. Ashwin might be the culprit here. Did he charge in enough to be inside the circle when the ball is delivered? Ashwin is fielding at midwicket. Just outside the circle with Rabada three steps from bowling. Now we get a new angle, and Ashwin is on the line when Rabada releases the ball. So this shouldn't be a no-ball. fair delivery. Dube stays out
bouncer, quick, 146ks, and Udana can't lay bat on ball
quick yorker, 143ks, at his toes, just the one leg-bye
slower bouncer, beats him. Nortje doing just what is required
yorker, on off, dug out for one
thick outside edge on the slog. Single to third man
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off for one
slower bouncer, and that produces the wicket. Rabada has his share of two again. Easy as. Cramps him up too with it, and he gets no power into the pull. Caught at midwicket
short of a length, at him, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, angling in, jams against his bat as he looks to make room. Single into the off side
length ball, outside off, mid-off is up, and he makes room to go over that man
slower short ball this time, and this time he is beaten on the upper cut
short, quick, at him, he makes room and plays an impressive upper-cut despite there not being any room. That will help RCB's NRR
drift into the pads, Dube plays this to short straight midwicket
Dube takes on the short boundary on the leg side and goes against the turn. He gets enough in it to clear wide long-on
quick straight ball, he makes room to get a single
more turn, and a thick outside edge that stays down
pulls the length back a little, dropped into the covers
sharp offbreak, from middle and off, and he is beaten by the turn
quick length ball, angling in, worked to leg for one
slower bouncer, at his head, and he manages to get away with a single. In no control at all
quick short ball, follows him, but he manages to run this down to third man

that is the game. Kohli has left himself too much to do. Now he is obliged to slog at the best bowler. Gets a bottom edge, which carries to the keeper. He will have to review how he misread the pitch and went pace, pace, pace. Then he was pretty much forced to show no intent against spin because of the grip on the surface and the three wickets lost inside the Powerplay
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
shuffles inside the line of a length, ball, gets a single to deep square leg
wide down the leg side. Looking to stay stump to stump and slipping down
short ball, might be on-pace, but it is wide, and Kohli gets no power into the pull. Just the single
mid-off has gone back and Sundar gets a single there
lovely shot first ball. Sundar, what a player. Offcutter, on a length, and he plays the drive on the up with an open face, placing it between mid-off and extra cover
another slower short ball, pulled to short fine for one
shorter this time, pulled fine of deep square leg for a couple
Kohli wakes up. he is not waiting as long as Dhoni does. He jumps out of the crease to treat Harshal's slower balls like an offspinner, and lofts it handsomely over wide long-on
slower offcutter, but down the leg side

and Ali is forced to take on the big side of the boundary for some impetus. He has no choice with Kohli setting himself up Dhoni style for the back end. Axar cramps him up with a low full toss. Perhaps a yorker but Ali has turned this into a fullie by jumping out of the crase. Hits it only as far as deep midwicket

full and straight, driven to long-on for another one. No intent to take the spinners on. By a captain who didn't bowl his spinners out. Didn't ask his big fast bowler to bowl cutters when he was bowling beamers
tries the big hit into the big side of the field, the leg side. Mis-hits it for a single
length, into the pads, single to deep midwicket
smart bowling. Sees him step out, tries to slide this wide, and Moeen gets the toe end to save himself from a stumping
flat, into the pads, no pressure. Single to long-on
down the wicket, but Harshal pulls the length back and bowls the slower offcutter to allow them just the single
low full toss, again no attempt to hit a boundary. Places this into the leg side for a couple
appeal for both lbw and bat-pad it seems. Offcutter, beats Kohli, hits him high on the pad and lobs back to the bowler. Not out on both counts as this is headed down and there is no edge
full toss, on the pads, gets just the two as he is not looking to hit sixes just yet
slower offcutter again, hits Ali on the thigh pad as he looks to pull. Just one leg-bye
down the wicket, Harshal bowls the slower one, pushed to deep midwicket for one
unlike Ashwin, Axar closes out the over without trying anything fancy. Quick length ball outside off, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: flatter, outside off, cut straight to point

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: slow, full, straght, defended back. Kohli's strike rate under 100 now

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: even slower, 85ks, some turn from leg to off. Defended

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: slow through the air, full and straight, short straight midwicket denies them the single
Ali goes deep to pull this length ball over midwicket for one
full, on the pads, swept away fine for a couple
little pause in his stride, bowls a wide down the leg side. Seems like the carrom ball but doesn't turn enough
flatter, into the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
full outside off, driven to long-off for another single
nice offbreak. Slower through the air, gets turn, runs off the outside half of the bat for one
offbreak, hit down to long-on for one
carrom ball? Draws a leading edge from Kohli. Not full enough for his push down the ground
tossed up wide, driven to long-off for one
slower through the air, Kohli runs it down fine of short third and takes on Ashwin's slowness in the field to come back for two
down the wicket, Axar shortens the length, concedes just the single
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one. Bowling to his field

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: slows this down, and the midwicket is straight and short to deny Kohli that single. Field placement on point

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: back of a length, into the pads, beats his punch, hits him on the pad
some turn, and it stops at him too. Pushed to straight cover. It is gripping. Kohli's use of his spinners becomes more and more questionable
swept away, and even though there is a deep midwicket in place, he has rolled his wrists to place this square of the man
slower through the air, drifting in, skids through, angles in, hits the pad
flat, length ball, angling in, pushed to cover
offbreak, slightly round-arm, pushed to long-on for one
drifting in, full, runs off the inside half of the bat. Pant's reaction suggests Ali has no idea about this
bouncer, 147ks, just outside off. Kohli wants to have nothing to do with it

finally someone takes a catch. A huge "come on" is belted out by someone. Short of a length, quick, nearing 150ks, and de Villiers is hurried into the pull. The top edge goes higher than the ring-of-fire lights, but Dhawan settles under it and takes it. And then comes out the thigh-five
oh helicopter off the back foot. Goes deep to a quick short-of-a-length ball, and whips it over mid-odff. What wrists. Incredible

missed run-out. Kohli is gone for all money as de Villiers has hit this too sweetly to mid-on. Kohli does the done thing: run if you see your striker running. AB, though, stops after a couple of steps. Rabada misses with the throw
full and fast, driven hard but straight to mid-on
on a length, into the pads, and he finds short fine leg
hit hard in the air at catching height for mid-off, but the mid-off is too wide for this shot. Four to de Villiers
short of a length, wide outside off, runs this down to third man for one
down the leg side, and he gets away with it. Single to short fine leg
wide length ball, pushed just to the left of cover for one
on a length, on off, defended back to him
but if you bowl plum half-volleys on the pads, Kohli won't need the single to get off strike. Clipped away for an easy boundary that takes him to 9000 T20 runs

lovely lovely bowling. He knows there is turn on offer so he is bowling slower and flighting them. It dips to create the gap between where the ball pitches and Finch's reach. And then it turns to take the outside edge for Pant to catch
flatter, quicker, fuller, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: lovely bowling. Beating Kohli on the forward-defensive. Creates the gap by getting dip on this ball, and then it rips past his outside edge

short_text: Axar Patel to Finch, 1 leg bye
long_text: angling in, no room for Finch. Another leg-bye
flatter, angling in, worked to leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: loosener. Just a floated half-volley. Not much action on it. Kohli loves it. Beats extra cover with his drive

down the wicket, Padikkal shows lack of experience. Ashwin makes him play the shot he doesn't want to play. Slows down the ball, goes a touch wider, makes him drag it to leg where deep midwicket is waiting. Padikkal wants to hit long-on, but he has let a master offspinner make him play the shot he wants him to play
dipping offbreak, slow, worked to leg for one
punched down the ground
turn with the new ball. Beaten
manages to place this wide of deep square for one
flat, quick offbreak, pushed to leg for a dot
finally the inswinger to Finch. And it is quick too. Beats him but is headed down leg. One leg-bye
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
driven back hard, Nortje gets a hand to it

and this time Dhawan's being deep has given him a chance. Finch has a big swing at a length ball outside off, and he gets a healthy edge. Dhawan goes up for the catch but it still manages to burst through. Casinos open for Finch tonight?
short of a length, closer to the stumps, punched to extra cover
short and wide again, and it is called wide
oh a loosener. Everybody bowls straight at Finch. Nortje goes short of a length and wide. Finch says thank you very much

edged and short of slip. This is excellent Test-match bowling to Finch. Full, just outside off, seams away, takes the edge, but Dhawan is too deep at slip. I can understand that: you stand deep because in T20 batsman are swinging hard and edges carry further
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
yorker on the pads, dug out for one
full, fast, pushed to mid-on
another drop. A sitter. Length ball, on off, Finch defends, and the bat face turns and it lobs back for an easy catch to Rabada. But he spills it
wide down the leg side, looking for that lbw ball against Finch
and that is some tone. Hits him high on the bat with a quick length ball. Padikkal takes the bottom hand off to keep this down. Get a single to cover

good full wide ball, hit to deep cover. Not many batsmen take the suicidal second off the last ball for some reason, but these guys are not bothered about their averages. Hetmyer charges off for the second, which looks like will be his wicket, but Kohli's throw is wide, and he completes the second. I would have liked them to go for the third too. Keep running till you are run out
yorker, just outside off, dug out to long-on for one
full and wide, driven to deep cover. Just the one
oh he gets the straight full toss that he can drop over the short leg-side boundary for a six. If this is not an attempted bluff, this is pretty poor from Udana. Has to go wide yorkers
Stoinis shuffles across to look for a ramp. Udana beats him with a low full toss. They get a leg-bye
wide and full, Hetmyer hits this to long-off for one
and Stoinis picks the leg side to bring up his fifty. Gets well across to this wide length ball, and sort of shovels this over square leg for four
fuller now, driven to long-on for one
left alone. Hetmyer knows this short ball is too high. He wants a wide call.The umpires disagree
on-pace bouncer, beats Hetmyer on the pull. There is one man appealing for a catch at the wicket. That is Kohli at the boundary. They don't review it, though

timber. Pant looks for the big hit over the leg side as Saini pitches short. He is deep in the crease and gives this his all. Siraj, though, has bowled a slower ball, and Pant only gets a bottom edge onto the stumps
short, well down the leg side, Pant looks to pull it over short fine, but is beaten. Wide this time
slower shortish ball, he turns his stance to reverse-ramp it over short third, but he is beaten when doing so

short_text: Siraj to Pant, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: another beamer. Head high. And most incredibly, Pant gets out of the way, and ramps it for a six over long leg
and he does well to finish off. Full and wide, doesn't allow him a free hit to the short boundary. Driven hard but only a single to deep cover
lovely yorker, just outside off, dug out to extra cover for one
shuffling across to try to access the short leg-side boundary but Udana does well by staying wide with the yorker. Concedes just the leg-bye
lovely shot. Slower ball, short of a length, not easy to get power behind it, but he lofts this over extra cover for four
wide yorker, dug out to extra cover for one
too wide, trying to stay out of his reach
wide full toss with short third man in the circle. Playing with fire. But he gets just the single to deep point
another full toss, hit hard into the pitch, and it bounces over Saini for a single to long-on
excellent batting. He knows the field so well. Short of a length, at the hip, and he turns this around the corner with soft hands. Just placing it past short fine leg to use Saini's pace
Pant sort of makes up for that refused second. He picks the slower ball, stays deep in the crease, and lofts this back over Saini's head for a small six. Finally over a 100 SR

low full toss, wide outside off to try to make him hit to the big part of the field. drilled wide of long-on. Pant refuses to run the second. That is poor from Pant. Stoinis is filthy with him and is stranded mid-pitch, but Kohli attacks the throw and fails to collect it clean. Missed the run-out there
shuffles across to get under a 149ks length ball, and swipes it to the short boundary into the leg side for four more
another high full toss. He has placed this to deep midwicket, but it remains to be seen if this will be called too. Not called a no-ball. Dips just below the waist
short, into the body, short fine leg is up, but he can't get it that fine. Gets just the single to deep backward square leg
slower ball, played with soft hands, into the bigger part of the field, takes a couple
mis-hit to long-on, but it falls short
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, but straight to extra cover
single to deep cover this time
slower ball. It is too full and too wide, and Stoinis has enough time to recover. Stays deep into the crease, and absolutely rockets this past extra cover. No one is laying a finger on that one

dropped. Yet another one goes down in Dubai. Low full toss. Stoinis goes deep into the crease but doesn't get enough power into this. It lobs towards wide long-on. Chahal runs to his left from deep midwicket, and it slips through his hands
wide ball on the free hit. Misses the yorker by a few inches, and he goes over point for four more. That is a way of getting your own back after having jammed by a beamer

high dangerous chest-high full toss at 143ks. No slower ball. No signs of dew. Stoinis is hit on the glove but there is no hurt or injury. Sunil Gavaskar is thinking the same. "No way can you tell me that that slipped," he says on air. I stand to be corrected but I haven't seen an apology from Saini either
doesn't get all of this but he is going straight and it is straight enough of long-on. Saini gives him the length. No pace taken off it. Stoinis will keep coming at you if you do that
short boundary on the leg side. Saini bowls short of a length, Stoinis stays deep in the crease to swing his arms through it, and goes over midwicket for a small flat six
lovely yorker. On off. Dug out
quick length ball, outside leg, beats him, goes for a leb-bye
uff that is some power. Ali finally comes back to Stoinis with a straight ball, and he clears his front leg and swings those tree trunks at it. Back over Ali's head this goes for four
another wide doing the same
tosses this one wide as Stoinis backs away. Goes too wide
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
fuller, quick, punched down to long-on for one
Stoinis takes on the long boundary as Ali pitches short, but he has those Popeye biceps behind it. Goes over deep midwicket with ease
flat, quick offbreak, Stoinis is cramped as he backs away. Hit back to Ali
full, straight, soft hands to work it to leg for one
lovely bowling. Pant shimmies down, Chahal bowls a legbreak at just 73ks. it dips and it turns. Pant has to show respect. Takes a single to leg
down the wicket, not to its pitch, but pushes this wide of Chahal for a single to long-off
wrong'un, full, outside leg, worked away to deep square for one
the length is pulled back, and Kohli is tight at short midwicket to prevent the single
slog sweep into the long boundary. Capitals forced to take on a low-percentage option, but he has placed this in front of deep midwicket
chipped back, shouts of catch it, but it slips through his fingers. No real power in the shot either. Chahal has to leap high, but this counts as a drop
denies him the slogging length, Stoinis waits for it to turn and works this to short fine for one
whips a full ball wide of long-on for a couple
tossed up outside off, pushed to deep cover for one

Paddikal takes a superb catch at deep midwicket. Another team change works. Ali gets some dip on this, which means Iyer's attempt at hitting a six has more height than length on it.
