Paddikal, a tall man, sets himself up at the midwicket fence, takes the catch, lobs the ball back up as he falls over, steps out, comes back in, completes the catch. Calm as
full, into the pads, worked away to leg for one
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
really slow in the air, really full pitched outside leg, swept fine, but can't beat short fine leg
full, middle and leg, punched to midwicket
wide leg-break but Iyer drags it back and chips him back over his head. Kohli at long-on is quick to come around to deny them the second
slow in the air, just outside off, pushed to long-off for one
length-ball legbreak, punched off the back foot to deep cover
short of a length, no power into the cut, no run
full and straight, placed between deep square and deep midwicket, comes back for two
short of a length, chest high again, worked to leg for a single

Dhawan perishes looking for the big hit. Gets a length ball, sees he can hit a six, but is slightly early into the shot. The bat face closes a little, and he doesn't get enough power into it. Caught at long-on
slower ball, outside off, he goes over mid-off, but doesn't nail this one. Gets two, though
short of a length, chest high, dropped to leg with soft hands
Dhawan down the wicket, hits this straight, mid-off is up, but Udana gets his foot in the way. Saves three runs
a lot of movement across and back away, but Siraj nails the perfect yorker. Dug out. What a change this is proving out to be to get Siraj into this game
short of a length, into the hip, worked to leg for one

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: sharp. Siraj has got wheels tonight. Dhawan skips down the track, and Siraj tells him nosireebob, not against me. Dhawan has to get out of the way of this bouncer
short of a length, stump to stump, worked to leg for one
short of a length, on off, angling in, punched to midwicket. Iyer wants a single off the midwicket, but Dhawan sends him back
punched on the up, timed superbly, and Kohli has to make a diving save at mid-off
quick, on a length, no room, punched to long-on
length-ball offbreak, worked to short fine for one
stays short of a length, into the body, worked into the leg side for one

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, on off, punched straight to cover

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower through the air, stump to stump, pushed back

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, he opens the face but can't beat point
back to bowling short, Iyer sways out of its line even though it doesn't rise as high as the earlier one. The periscope is up by the way
Iyer won't mind that sighter. Gentle length ball on the pads. He plays the pick-up over square leg. Shaw must be wondering why he didn't get this

Kohli's shouts of "come on" echo in the empty stadium. Shaw has gloves Siraj through to AB. Good short ball. Quick, high, and into the body. Shaw goes for the attacking option, but it surprises him with the pace, and kisses the glove/top part of the bat on the way through
on a length, outside off, driven with an open face, gets a single to deep point

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: maybe this is why Dhawan didn't want that single. Disimisses this shortish delivery through midwicket for four. Lovely pull

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: big mix-up. Dhawan drops this shortish ball at his toes, and doesn't look up at Shaw, who has come to within a hand-shaking distance. Shaw scampers back and makes it
on a length, into the pads, helped along for a single to short fine leg
slower in the air, Shaw goes for the sweep again. Doesn't nail it, which is just as well. Falls short of deep square leg
gets down for a sweep, gets inside the line, Sundar fires it in, but Shaw doesn't hold back. Gets a top edge but straight over AB's head. The first boundary off Sundar tonight
short of a length, and pulled past that square leg for two more
sweep to a quick length ball, clears the infield and places it fine of deep square leg
just stops a touch on him, and AB shouts "catch it". It falls short of Sundar, though
Dhawan skips down the wicket, and chips this in front of deep square leg for two

short_text: Chahal to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: and now comes out the Dhawan sweep. Full, on the pads, he clears out the front leg to make room for his arms to swing. Places this fine of deep square leg
on a length, can't drive, can't slog. Pushed wide of Chahal for a risky single, but his pick-up is not clean. We will never know if Shaw was struggling here

overcompensates now and bowls a plum half-volley. Shaw is going against the turn after clearing his front leg, but this is a new ball and he has gone only to long-on and not midwicket. New balls please
poor ball. Short, wide, and cut away in front of square. The kind of ball you might throw down to a batsman short on form and confidence just to make him feel better
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as Chahal pulls the length back, but Dhawan manages to push him down to long-on for one
speared into the pads to protect another over. Just the single into the leg side
on a length, pretty straight, punched down to long-on for one
nails the sweep, drags it from outside off, but can't beat backward square leg
full, no turn, into the pads, nudged away into the leg side
fuller, and worked into the leg side for one
turn. DC won't mind this. Turn and bounce actually. From short of a length, into the ribs, hits his glove, then his chest, and falls away from AB
pulled away as Saini gets a little big on him. It excites RCB but the ball falls well short of deep square leg
on a length, straight, punched hard to mid-on. No chance to get a single as he has hit this hard
nobody is coming in the way of this hit. Shaw makes room, and gets under a full quick ball and lofts it over extra cover for a six. This is some exciting start from DC

crunched away. On a length, on the up. If I were short cover, I would be getting out of the way. Right now, though, Kohli is the man, and he fields it without fuss. Must have stung his hand. But he doesn't show
on a length, pitched outside leg, angling towards middle, punched away through midwicket

short_text: Saini to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Just short of a half-volley, but gives him room to open his arm. Dhawan stays inside the line and drives it between cover-point and cover
quicker, into the pads, protecting a good over. Dhawan gets a single to long-on

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhawan makes room early, Sundar watches the feet closely, and he flights this well outside off to beat him
full, on the leg stump, driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked to deep square for one

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower through the air, Dhawan looks for the big sweep, early into the shot, beaten, but the ball is headed down leg

short_text: Sundar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: quick, on a length, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
lovely flick-pull. Short of a length, hip-high, and he unfurls his wrists to impart power into this and hit it through square leg
slower ball, 102ks, but a leg-side half-volley, and Shaw clips it uppishly through midwicket for four
some seam movement?. On a length, on off, beats his push-drive with away movement. It does go off the seam a little
a touch too short, and Shaw is a short man so he has more time to pull this. He goes square of forward square leg, and along the ground
short of a length, into the body, tucked away towards long leg
length ball on the pads, gets away with just one leg-bye

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: and that'll do it! What middle order problems? Low full toss outside off, Faf leans in and punches that to the extra cover boundary to seal a ten-wicket win

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: oh come on Faf. One handed slice over extra cover. Full outside off, front leg in the leg side, bottom hand off the bat and that sails away
slower short ball at off stump, pulled to deep midwicket's left
full outside off, sliced to sweeper's left. A miscue as he looks to muscle this
full and wide outside off, looks to drive through the covers, gets a thick edge to third man's right

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: scythed past short third man. Yorker outside off, executed to perfection. But Faf opens the face late and gets it fine of that fielder

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: full toss wide outside off, slices it over point with ease
full and wide outside off, jammed out to sweeper's left
low full toss on middle, driven off the toe-end to long-on

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: yorker length just outside off, jammed into the covers

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: steamed past extra cover. Tossed up outside off, allows that to land and there's no nuance about this drive. Into the boundary rapidly

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short outside off, cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: googly, good length and in at off stump. Punched back to the bowler
short at middle, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: short outside off, cut to extra cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: beaten. Good length, outside off and spinning past the attempted drive through the covers
yorker length on middle, jammed out to long-on

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: pummeled over long-on and the equation is under run-a-ball now. Good length and sliding on outside off, down on one knee and drilled on the rise
short and wide outside off, beaten on the cut. Pooran appeals for catch behind and is met with a wide call

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover's left

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: short outside off but skidding in with the angle. Uses that to pull firmly to long-on's right

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 2 runs
long_text: short and wide outside off, carved between short third and backward point
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
full slower ball, wide outside off. Left alone
short at middle, mistimed pull to long-on
short and way down leg side
pumped straight over the bowler. Short and at middle stump. Walks down into the leg side and hits this on the rise, almost a straight pull
bouncer at middle stump. Beaten on the pull
bouncer at the front shoulder, top edge on the hook, falls short of the fielder
full and in at middle stump, driven down to long-on

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short and turning away outside off, beaten on the cut
short at middle stump, pulls aerially, on the bounce to long-on

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, no run
long_text: full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short and just outside off, pulled to long-on's right

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 2 runs
long_text: jumps out and lofts this to sweeper's right. Good length outside off, steps out for the drive

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, grips and stops. He pushes with hard hands into the covers

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: good length on leg stump, swept to short fine

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: beaten on the cut. Short and climbing into the corridor as he looks to slash that late. Extended appeal for catch by the bowler. He is on his own

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: good length outside off, punched to long-off
short of deep midwicket. Good length outside off, lofted sweep dips on the man out there
good length and very wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: blazed past extra cover. Overpitched and wide outside off, drives firmly along the turf to that fielder's right

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full and just outside off, lofted drive to long-off
fifty for Faf. Their best batsman this season keeps on going. Full and wide outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man's right

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and sliding onto middle stump. Defended into the pitch off the back foot. It bounces past the stumps
yorker at leg stump, jammed down to long-on
crunched wide of mid-off and a Watson fifty at long last for CSK. They've waited long for this. And he's in it tonight. Full and wide outside off, trademark Watson stride out as he creams this drive
nowhere to hide for Jordan. Short and at the hips. Watson gets tall, allows it to come on and clips it to short fine's left
overpitched on leg stump, driven aerially to long-on
nails the yorker at off stump. Squeezed to square leg's right and hundred stand comes up for CSK
short outside off, chopped to third man's right
short of a length at off stump, backs away and gets a leading edge to extra cover's left

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover
short at leg stump, nudged to deep square's right off the hips

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, chopped into the covers off the front foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: swept far, far over deep midwicket! What a connection on that, might be the biggest this season. 101 metres. Full and flat outside off, quickly down on one knee and a vicious sweep

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full on off stump, driven along the floor to sweeper cover
good length and wide outside off, sliced to sweeper's left
tossed up full and very wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: short ball stays low at middle and would have had him plumb, but he pulls at this and gets an under-edge past short fine

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper along the ground

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full on leg stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: beautiful. The perfect inside-out drive. Full on middle, jumps down to meet it at the pitch, opens the body just enough to make room, gets his angles perfect and gets it wide of long-off
short at middle stump, pulled on the bounce to long-on

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: terrible misfield. Shami at short fine. Full and down leg side, forceful sweep straight at the fielder. He lets it through, between his legs

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: smartly done. Good length ball coming in at middle. He steps across to expose the stumps and ramps this fine. Cottrell is too square at deep backward square to get to that

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: good length and into the pads. Whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full on middle stump, gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: shot! Counterpunch. But that's a short ball. Faf is waiting on the front foot and swats it between deep square and deep midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: lbw apeeal turned down. Cops this slider on the pad as he's deep in the cresae for the glance. Going down

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: beaten. Good length and turning away marginally outside off as Faf looks to drive. Got that to dip on the batsman

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length outside off, jabbed to backward point off the back foot
good length and sliding on in the corridor, hurriedly tapped into the covers

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: hammered past Watson! Slower short ball rising slowly at a middle stump line. He backs into the leg side and flat-bat its past his partner's ankles

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: down to third man where there isn't anyone. Short and wide outside off, has a slash, thick outside edge between short third and backward point

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: swatted away. Short and wide outside off, shuffles into line and drags the pull wide of mid-on
evades Sarfraz's dive after running back from extra cover. Slower short ball wide outside off, ends up slicing this after stepping out and making room

short_text: Jordan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: scooped after a long wait, fine of short fine leg. Slower ball at a good length outside off, drops down on a knee into the side and waits and waits before executing this
short and just outside off, cut to deep point
slower ball at a length just outside off, uppish drive off the back foot, down to long-off
beaten on the pull. Might have been a slower one that gripped and rose more than Watson expected outside off
short and into the mid-riff, deflected fine with a pull shot

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, no run
long_text: mistimed drive to midwicket. Overpitched outside off, shuffles into line but gets too much bottom hand as he looks to drive this
good length and on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left

short_text: Shami to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: oh neatly clipped away. Good length slower ball at middle, he a walked deep into the crease and across and had to wait. But did it to perfection as he picked this up over square leg
short and down leg side, steps across and is beaten on the pull

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full on off, driven to long-off

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: massive lbw appeal as he's struck in front of middle but there might have been an inside edge. He was looking to sweep from off stump. Replays will be interesting it hits his back thigh, which might have been outside the line of off stump. Pooran signalled bat, Rahul signals outside off they might both be right
short at middle stump, deep in the crease to clip this to deep midwicket

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: lofted straight again. Long-off is out. He gets forward to this full ball and hits it a little leg side of him

short_text: Harpreet Brar to Watson, no run
long_text: good length ball sliding onto the pads as he goes deep in the crease. Struck outside leg stump trying to glance

short_text: Harpreet Brar to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: full on middle stump, steps out and drives to mid-on
short outside off, cut straight to backward point
drilled over his partner. Classy. Good length outside off, stride down the pitch and swinging room on the drive allows him to loft it
full slower ball at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
safely over square leg. Short ball at middle, gets a lot of elevation on the pull
short and wide outside off, thick edge to third man as he cuts
full and wide outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off's left
short of a length, just outside off. Cramping him on the cut, which is on the bounce to backward point
short and just outside off, punched to mid-off's left
good length at middle stump, nudged to mid-on's right off the back foot
short and in the corridor, dabbed down the third man, 141.9kph
oh, poor. Full and swung down leg side. Pooran can't even get a hand on that with the dive
beaten on the cut. Short and just outside off, past the bat quickly as he looks to cut
oh unplayable. That might the perfect ball. Good length, bolt upright seam, very late swerve away as it lands at a length in the corridor. Narrowly past the outside edge as Watson looks to defend

short_text: Cottrell to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot

just clears mid-off! Almost one too many. Full ball just outside off, pushes onto the front foot to try and loft again, this time in the off side. The handle turns in his hand and it's over Rahul's right shoulder before landing safely
lofted over mid-on! Full inswinging ball at middle stump and he uses the angle to close the face and clear the infield. Nice trademark forward stride on that too
short and into the hips with the swing. Stands tall and turns it fine with a glance
good length and swung in sharply at middle stump, solidly defended on the front foot
full and swung into the corridor. Jammed into the pitch off the inside half
low full toss outside off, has a slog and it's miscued. Trickles to long-on's right
thigh high full toss outside off, backs into the off side and has a swing. Straight to deep midwicket. Square leg was in and he's cross with himself
beaten on the reverse-ramp. Low full toss outside off, drops into the leg side and tries to jab this on its way
good length slower ball wide outside off, walks into that trying to slap it through cover. Thick outside edge to Dhoni's right and Maxwell calls him through
full and very wide outside off, can't reach that
jabs it square of third man this time! Full and wide outside off, shuffles around and jams this down to where a conventional third man might have been
ramped over short third. It's a low full toss on leg stump and he does what everyone does  manipulates the wrists to drag it past his right shoulder and lift it on the off side

full on leg stump, driven firmly to deep midwicket's left and once again they manage to sneak a second on Jadeja's throw although it may have been a lot closer if the bails had come off one way or another. Khanw as diving

forehand slap over wide mid-off. Slower short ball across him and wide outside off. His front leg is past the tramline on the leg side! He's that far in the leg side, but manages to reach out at this and connects nicely
yorker at off stump, shuffles and can only clip this to deep midwicket's left. Sarfraz takes on Jadeja's arm and comes back for the second
slower short ball, wide outside off. Subdued cut, on the bounce to backward point
yorker length at leg stump, can't get this off the pitch
full loopy slower ball outside off, driven to extra cover's left. Through that fielder's dive
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Cut neatly to sweeper's left
full and wide outside off, makes too much room and is beaten on the chop
full outside off, patted down to long-off
outside edge fall short of short third man! Another slower ball, good length and just outside off. Looks to drive on the rise

taken by Dhoni to his right! Thakur will be on a hat-trick. Full slower ball outside off, wants to jam it behind square on the off side and gets a thick outside edge and that floats off his bat to the keeper's right

very very high again  but not far enough. This is a good catch from Jadeja at deep midwicket. That was a juicy ball in the slot at leg stump, right there for the big slog. Big slog is what he does, but he might have fallen over into the off side a touch because he gets under it more than he desires. That must have wobbled but Jadeja waits and waits and then rolls into the turf in relief after taking it
yorker just outside off, jammed down to long-off off the front foot
short and across him, mistimed chop ends up at long-off
low full toss on middle stump, weight onto his back leg for a strong base and nice clean slog over wide long-on
just past leg stump! Pooran walking into the off side a long way, showing the leg stump. This yorker is narrowly past it
low full toss wide outside off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover
yorker outside off, jammed into vacant cover. Point is back on the fence so they steal a second
slower short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep backward square's right

no power on this one, but they two to long-on's left. Curran outraged with Jadhav who he feels should have attacked that better to his left. Slower short ball, miscued pull. Jadhav is looking for affirmation to his left from deep midwicket and from long-off to his right

short_text: Sam Curran to Pooran, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, climbs over his attempted hook

short_text: Sam Curran to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: ooooof, that is second tier! That is massive. Massive! Goes wide of the crease, drops it short at middle stump, he's leaning back as he pulls and he's tonked it high and far over midwicket. 97 metres is the official count
slower short ball just outside off, cut to deep backward point
slower short ball just outside off, shuffles and pulls to deep square
overpitched on leg stump, driven to long-on's right
good length on leg stump, flicked straight to short fine
past short third man! Short and into the body this time. Walks into the leg side to make room and gets the late cut where he wanted
whack. To sweeper's right this time. This is poor length from Thakur. Short and wide outside off, and he gets the weight into his half stride and slaughters it
drilled over long-off for the fifty. Sweeet hit. It's a cross-seam, good length ball, friendly driving length just outside off. And he gets deep in the crease and crunches it
low full toss on leg stump, driven along the floor to extra cover
over deep midwicket. Oh he's come out in good hitting form alright. This is dropped slightly short of a good length, sits up at off stump and he swings cleanly under it with a pull

oh you beauty. Good length, pushed fast and wide across him from around the wicket. That's a decent option from Jadeja, because Pooran has shuffled and seemingly wants to go leg side. Instead he gets laced on the up, over extra cover. That flew off the middle
short of a good length on leg, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
good length outside off, walks across off stump and clubs this. Straight to deep midwicket
good length at off, defended down the pitch on the front foot
good length and just outside off, leans in and pushes to extra cover with soft hands
short and just outside off, cut to third man's right
good legth and just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man with the angle
good length on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
thick outside edge and beats third man to his left. Good length just outside off, walks into that and looks to drive on the up. Loses his shape, retains some luck
short and slower ball, wide outside off. Beaten on the cut

straight to extra cover.  Full and wide outside off, he's down on one knee and strikes this cleanly. But placed right into Rayudu's lap. He's at the edge of the circle and it dips at a nice height. Mandeep's cameo is done, was hitting them sweetly
full on leg stump, nicely forward and flicked into the leg side
full and just outside off, driven with the turn to long-off's left
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
short and just outside off, punched between deep midwicket and long-on and a fumble out there
full on middle, leans in and drives to long-on
clears deep midwicket. Dropped short, lofted pull. The fielder is in from the circle but that is not an aberration anymore, we've seen all teams do it on these big grounds. That allows Mandeep six
good length at middle, onto the back foot to punch to long-on
full outside off, driven to extra cover's right. A dive but only parried to long-off
swung far over midwicket. That is a delicious sounding slog sweep. Full googly just outside off and he picked that so quickly and was down immediately
misfield by Faf. Full on off, once again he miscues the inside-out shot to long-off's left and Faf lets that past and they get a second
short outside off, mistimed cut towards backward point who fumbles as there's a slight mix up between the batsmen
short and in at middle stump, punched to long-on
short and just outside off, carved to sweeper off the back foot
good length at the stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
beaten on the cut. That rips past the outside edge
short at the stumps, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
good length outside off, wants to go inside-out over extra, miscues and gets it to long-off's left
short and just outside off, cut to backward point
googly, short and in at middle. Expertly tucked to deep midwicket's left off the back foot
good length and sliding on at off stump, punched to long-off from deep in the crease
short and just outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot

taken at deep midwicket. Short and sliding onto middle stump. He's hurried on the pull and was perhaps looking to sit that squarer, because this just looks like catching practice in the end. Chawla strikes immediately
short outside off, subdued pull down to long-on. This one sticks in the pitch and turns too
short outside off, cut to sweeper
length at the stumps, tapped into the leg side with the angle
short and just outside off, cut to short third

can't get to that at long-off after a big dive to the left. Faf du Plessis sprints to his left and puts a big dive in but it's short of him. Pulls in short of the boundary and sweeper cleans up behind him. Agarwal was looking to drive over extra cover but that ball stuck in the pitch and he got more elevation than strength on this
short and just outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
overpitched on leg stump, driven along the floor to long-on
eases it past point. Errs there, the bowler. Short and wide and at regular pace. He's nicely onto the back foot to put this away
loopy yorker, slower ball at middle. Looks to drive and gets it off the toe-end
good length at middle, punched back to the bowler
good length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
attempted slower ball, full and down leg side again. Left alone
short and down leg side, left alone
good length slower ball on middle stump, allows it on and tucks it to square leg
good length outside off, walks into that and punches to sweeper on the up
full and just outside off, 137.4kph. Sweetly timed straight drive back at the bowler, who gets a hand on it
short and wide outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper point
good length at leg stump, punched to mid-on
short of a length and just outside off, backs away and chops to extra cover's left
short of a good length and just outside off. Half a stride out and pulled over midwicket
short and into the corridor, can't thread the late cut between short third and backward point

full slower ball on leg stump. Looks for the flick and cops it on the front pad. Lbw appeal turned down but both bowler and keeper were interested right till the end. Decided against the review. That was sliding down
good length and slanted in at off stump. Defended to point's right
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's right and a tumbling stop there
clubbed to the extra cover boundary. Good length ball in the corridor and he walks into the leg side to make room and get this right off the middle, aerially before it runs into the cover boundary
good length and just outside off. Defended into the pitch off the front foot

short_text: Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: oh lovely wristwork. Full and pushed across the corridor. Leans in and very deliberately opens the face to slice this past backward point
full outside off, driven into vacant cover

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: thick outside edge between short third and backward point. Good length ball, a cutter and wide outside off, has a hack at that
full and across him, looks to caress through the covers on the front foot, gets an inside edge through square leg
good length and just outside off, pushed into the point region with soft hands

full and just outside off, a sweet flowing cover drive but CSK have that area covered with the slip out. A fielder in between mid-off and extra cover, very straight and in especially for these two batsmen who love hitting there
short of a length and just outside off, opens the face and finds backward point
short at middle stump, gets big on him as he looks to punch through midwicket. Inside edge onto thigh and into the off side
short and wide outside off, under-edge on the attempted late cut
short and wide outside off, waits on that and times the cut perfectly. You could see him watch it all the way on and slash it square to beat the sweeper fielder comfortably
short and into the hips. Stays tall at that and clips it fine. Chawla runs across from long leg and puts in a dive to stop one-handed to his right
good length and just outside off, mistimed punch towards mid-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Agarwal, no run
long_text: full, wide, and slanted across the corridor. Beaten on the attempted drive
full inswinger, 132kph, just outside off. Looks to lean into this and drive through cover but it goes to mid-off off the inside half

short_text: Sam Curran to Rahul, no run
long_text: good length and swung in at middle stump, hurriedly defended down the pitch

short_text: Sam Curran to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed on the rise. Full and wide outside off. Walks down at it and closes the face on this drive to get it well to sweeper point's right
ood length and shaping into off stump. Gets low and opens the face to run this between backward point and short third. Jadeja dives to the left to keep it to one
full and wide outside off, some shape in. Reaches out and drives firmly to sweeper's right. Long, long boundary
good length, inswinger into the corridor, jabbed to extra cover's left
good length, swung away outside off and he uses that to stab this to deep point
short and just outside off, opens the face and punches to backward poiint
good length and outswinger again. Just outside off. Solidly defended on the front foot
big inswinger but watchfully defended with a straight bat. Goes wide of the crease and hits a good length
short of a good length outside off, some shape away from him. Gets tall and opens the face to run this to deep point's left. Just about steals a second run against a good throw from the deep

short_text: Pollard to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: slower ball, nearly a yorker, dug out to extra cover

short_text: Pollard to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: quick and full, between Rashid's legs as his right foot shuffles to off

short_text: Pollard to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: wide on the crease, slower ball, beats his slog

short_text: Pollard to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: short of a length, pulled to deep midwicket. No single again. Even Sandeep is happy letting Rashid have this net

short_text: Pollard to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: on-pace, full, really full, hit down to long-on. Refuses the single
slower legcutter, short of a length, outside off, hit in front of deep point for two
fast low full toss at the base of the leg stump. Sandeep makes room and saves his toes, and then jams the bat down on it
looks for a ramp, leaves his stumps exposed, and he hits the middle stump with a seam-up low full toss
Rashid Khan shuffles across and deep into the crease to place this full ball square of deep midwicket for two
yorker, outside leg, beats him comprehensively but runs away for leg-byes
Bumrah gets his own back. Another slower ball, on a length, Samad looks to go over long-on, but gets a massive edge for extra cover to take a skier

short_text: Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: slower short ball, 129ks, sits up to be hit, and he gets inside the line to pull this for a six over deep square
looks for the ramp to a wide ball, beaten
full, on off, off the inside edge for a single for short fine

short_text: Boult to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: slower bouncer, middle and leg, angling away, beats his hook
full, on off, hit wide of long-on for one
yorker outside off, well inside the tram line. Left alone
low full toss, into the pads, hit wide of long-on for two

short_text: Bumrah to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: misfielded by Pattinson at deep point. He goes hard at a wide ball, hits it over point, and Pattinson is done in by the ball quickening up after bouncing

short_text: Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: that is massive. After wide yorkers, Bumrah goes on-pace length, and he goes deep in his crease to hit back over long-off
another wide yorker but this time it is too wide

short_text: Bumrah to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: wide yorker this time. No run as the dig-out goes nowhere
full wide ball. Samad reaches out and hits this square where the diving fielder gets a hand on it and saves two
full, nearly a yorker, hit to deep midwicket for one
slower bouncer, angling across, beats him as he looks to ramp it
on-pace length ball, Sharma tries the big slog, gets a single off the inside edge
short of a length, stays low, pulled away to deep square leg for one

that might be the game. Slower short wide ball legcutter. If Warner doesn't play it, this will be called. But he goes after it, and gets thick outside edge that lobs to the right of short third man where Kishan takes a superb diving catch
puts this into a hole on the leg side to come back for an easy two
looks for the reverse ramp but is beaten by a Pattinson slower ball on a length outside off
yorker, just outside off, dug out to mid-off for one
full and wide, away from Warner but manages to kiss that wide line. Not called a wide
yorker, wide outside off, gets a single to deep cover
down the wicket, takes this on the full, hits to the left of deep midwicket, but doesn't have the timing. Gets only two
this time it is a wide outside off
fires in a wide down the leg side after seeing Warner shuffle to cover his wide line outside off
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, gets a thick inside edge for a single to long leg
wide again, but short of a length, and pulled to wide long-on for one
full, wide yorker. Called a wide

smart catch by Chahar at deep square leg. Just an example of how small the ground is. This is a terrible mis-hit to a full toss, but the top edge carries to the boundary. Chahar takes his overhead and to his left, and he is a couple of yards off the fence so he can go down and roll safely. The third umpire confirms that

Pollard. What fielding. This is hit mighty had back over his head, but the tall man sticks out his big right mitt, and while he can't catch it, he deflects it to long-on. And mind you, he tried to close his hand to catch it. Just a touch too quick for that
low full toss, he makes room and drives it to deep cover
slower ball, short of a length, but because he doesn't have the pace, he can't find the gap between point and short third man
slower short ball, punched down to long-on for one
wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, pushed just wide of long-on, and Warner pushes Garg for the second. Puts in a big dive to make it
slower short ball, pulled between deep square and deep midwicket. Gets two
slower bouncer again, and he makes room to hit him over extra cover for four
full toss, on the pads, shovelled to deep square leg
short of a length, slower, and it falls short of deep midwicket
on a length, on off, pushed to long-off for one

this might be the first time Boult has bowled to his NZ captain Williamson in competitive cricket, and he has got him out. Slower bouncer, just sits in front of Williamson's face, and he has picked it late and wants to withdraw from his ramp but is late to do so. It runs off the face of the bat for a catch to de Kock. Just no pace on it to take it away from the keeper
low full toss as he looks for the yorker. Toe-ended to deep midwicket for one
yorker, hit back towards Bumrah who sticks his foot to nearly kick it past mid-off. But Boult does well there. Anyway, the single brings up Warner's fifty
slower ball, outside off, on a length, pushed to deep cover
high full toss, Warner lets out a grunt as this hits him high on the bat. Single to deep midwicket. Not called a no-ball. Just below the waist so a good call from the umpire
looks for a yorker, but the line is down the leg side. Wided
slower ball, legcutter, on a length, at the stumps, pushed to long-on for one
full, on off, hit straight to mid-off for just the single
big back lift, and then checks the shot because of a slower ball. Hit straight to mid-off
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, straight, pushed down to long-on for one
full, flat, angled in, worked to leg for one
full, looking to jam it against the bottom of his bat, but errs by a few inches. Warner lofts him back over his head for a four
and he bowls the Jadhav-like super round-arm delivery again. This is short and sits up. Warner stands his ground, waits for it, and lofts this over long-on for an easy six
short, wide, Warner reaches out to hit this wide of long-off where a Pollard dive keeps them to two
short of a length, outside off, played with an open face to point

that is a nothing shot out of nowhere. Length ball outside off, on-pace, and he decides to go in the air but there is no anger behind the shot. When you go in the air, when long-off is back, pack a punch in the hit. He has chipped it straight to the man
short of a length, into the hip, can only tuck it away for one
slower ball, full, on the pads, driven to deep midwicket for one
wide down the leg side. Pandey could have looked to hit for a six too, but he takes the wide
short of a length again, but this time he cramps Warner up. Only a single to deep midwicket
lovely shot. Short of a length, pretty straight, but the angle gives him just that little bit of width to guide this between short third and point. Replay of how he welcomed Bumrah to the crease
pulled down to wide long-on for one
wide short delivery, and would have been a wide had Warner not reached out and toe-ended it for a dot
wrong'un, shortens the length too, Warner bunts this into a hole on the leg side and comes back for two
and Warner joins the party. Chahar over-pitches again, and he has cleared the front leg to slog him over long-on. SRH are not out of this
full again, but wide, and Pandey has to reach for it. Ends up chipping to deep cover for one
and overpitches first up. Pandey doesn't care this is just his first delivery, and clears his front leg to send him to the top of the grandstand behind wide long-on
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
on a length, Warner tries to slog, gets a bottom edge and starts running. The ball just about misses the leg stump or he would have been bowled while he was 10 yards down the pitch
on-pace short ball, pulled to deep midwicket for one
another slower ball that is a wide down the leg side
slower ball again, wide down the leg side
H Padnya has dropped a sitter. Blinded by the sun. Slower short ball, Pandey plays the upper-cut, straight to deep point, and Pandya doesn't have too far to run. But he loses the ball in the sun
slower ball, short of a length, hit hard, on the bounce to deep cover
on a length, straight, pushed down to long-on for one
full and wide, Warner beaten on the drive, and he is not happy that this hasn't been called a wide
goes low, and bowls a round-arm delivery. This is like a quicker, left-arm Kedar Jadhav. worked to leg for one
high back lift, but Pandya yorks Pandey
slower to Pandey, tight line, pushed to his left, but Krunal makes the save
low full toss, denies him that aerial hitting he is looking for. Just the single to long-off
full, on off, pushed to long-off for one
full, angling in, pushed straight of midwicket for one
whoa that is crisp. Just a push to a length ball, but it is timed so superbly it teases mid-on all the way to the boundary. Nothing more than a defensive push
slower ball, full, just outside off, runs off the outside half of the bat for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover-point this time
gets the width this time. Short of a length, angling wide, and he has punched this between cover-point and extra cover
and Warner likes the extra pace. Short of a length, angling towards top of off, and he opens the face to place it between short third and point
slower ball again, short of a length, angling in towards off, hit back to Boult
slower short ball, and Pandey has the time to manoeuvre this short ball and hit in front of deep square leg for four
short of a length, angling in from wide on the crease. Pulled down to mid-on
Pandey hits a four second ball. Slower offcutter, but too full and he drags it from wide outside off, and goes through mid-on
on a length, wide, he stays leg side of it, and plays it to cover

huge wicket. Bairstow is the one hitting big ones here, and he is gone. Slower short ball, Bairstow is deceived and ends up dragging this short ball to deep square leg instead of the vacant midwicket region. H Pandya takes a low catch
frustration from Warner but the top edge falls safe. Long-on runs to his left, deep square runs to his right, midwicket runs back, but none of the three can make it to the ball
on a length, just outside off, runs this to short third for one more
tucks him up with another short ball. Warner makes room to play this to extra cover for one
down the wicket, drawing a short ball from Pattinson, hit high on the pad
offcutter, tight line, Warner looks to open the face and run, but gets a bottom edge onto his pad
Warner still struggling for his timing. SHort ball, and he looks to go over midwicket, getting the toe end back to the bowler
nearly a yorker outside off, dug out to mid-off
Bairstow is in the mood here. Just a slight error in length, dropping it a touch short, and Bairstow goes back to pull it over midwicket
quicker, into the pads, runs off for two leg-byes
slow through the air, and still 95ks, on a length, no room. Defended
short of a length, turning in, pulled to deep midwicket
full, fast and wide, and is called for it
Warner is ready for a slog, but he has bowled a near yorker. Hit to mid-off
looks for the big slog to a length ball but ends up hitting it along the ground to deep midwicket
slower ball, on the pads, and the slowness of the pace means the glance can't beat short fine leg
down the leg side, Bairstow misses out, but still gets four leg-byes. Oh hang on, he might have got a bit of an inside edge too
down the wicket, Pattinson shortens the length, but Bairstow pulls him in the air through midwicket. Finds the gap between mid-on and midwicket
sliding into the pads, helped along the way, fine leg is up, but Boult makes a diving save to keep them down to two
on a length, no room, played back to him
on a length, stump to stump, Warner pushes this back to Boult
slight shimmy, Boult yorks him, they pinch a single straight of mid-off
slower offcutter, on a length, Bairstow looks to cut it and is beaten
with a tight field on the leg side to allow him to target the pads, Boult bowls full and wide. And Bairstow says thank you very much, and lofts this over wide mid-off
this one swings back, clipped to short midwicket where Rohit puts in a diving save
on a length, outside off, no swing, pushed wide of mid-off for one
what a finish from Krunal Pandya. Six. Four. Four. Six. Kaul bowls length again, and he goes deep in the crease and sends it flying over long-on for another six
Krunal playing a little gem here. Low full toss again, he stays leg side of it, and drives it to the right of extra cover for four more
back to attempting a yorker, ends up bowling a low full toss, and Pandya clears the front leg to hit it straight of long-on
why bowl length after yorkers have been working? Krunal gets under this slower ball and lofts him over long-on for an easy six
base of leg stump. This is great stuff by SRH at death. Pandya goes deep into the crease to try to turn a yorker into a half-volley but Kaul sticks to his guns and squeezes this under his bat
low low full toss. Good enough execution. Just the single to deep midwicket
oh the perfect yorker to Pandya who is looking to go deep into the crease to manufacture a length. Natarajan nails it. Dug out back to him. Another lovely over from Natarajan
looks for the wide yorker again, but bowls full enough to deny him an aerial hit. Drilled to long-on for one
wide yorker, can't do better than hit it straight to deep cover for one
oh just short of a wide yorker, and Pandya gets under it to drive it over point. If you are bowling wide yorkers, you need a deep point or a square third man
nails the yorker this time, dug out to long-on for one
goes for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a full toss, and he smashes this for a flat six over long-off

Hits him on the toe with a yorker. Seems like a slower yorker. Big appeal for lbw. Not given. SRH go upstairs. Runs the fingers on it to create the pace deception, which is why Pandya is early into the shot. But this has pitched just outside leg to save Pandya. Well done by the umpire because it is easy to get carried away when a batsman is hit on the toe bang in front of the stumps
short ball, just outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
knee high full toss now, and draws a bit of a mis-hit still. However, at Sharjah, this is strong enough. Rashid leaps at deep square leg and sticks his hand out, but this clears him
another low full toss, but he ends up hitting it on the first bounce to deep square leg
another low full toss, but lower than the last one, and he can't get under it. Single to long-on
yorker gone wrong. Low full toss, on the stumps, and easily flicked away for a six over midwicket
lovely wide yorker, just inside that blue wide line, and it squeezes past his bat. Lovely comeback from Natarajan after that first-ball six
full and straight, Pollard can't get under it. Only a single
near yorker, outside off, driven to extra cover for one
full toss outside off, hit straight to extra cover off the toe end
misses the yorker, is drilled to long-off for one
well this is why. Natarajan comes back, thinks he has bowled a good short ball, and dismissively Pandya pulls it over midwicket for a six

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: lovely slow legbreak. Pollard is not taking any risks either. Just the two off the last Rashid over. They want to be in the middle for other overs so no risks against him

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: another wrong'un, wide outside off, defended off the front foot
googly, but it starts too straight, and is a wide down the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: quick, flat, straight, defended to leg
finds the single now to bring Pollard on strike. Soft hands, into the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: flat, quick legbreak, pushed back to him. Pandya doesn't want to take risks against Rashid, but he needs to get a a single at least

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot

sensational catch but he has taken out Kishan. Might not be the smartest thing to do with Pollard to follow. Jokes aside, though, this is an amazing catch. Slower ball from Sharma, and he hits it flat and straight of long-on, but Pandey puts in a full length dive to catch it even as it is dying on him
hit powerfully down to long-on for one
wide on the crease, Pandya shuffles wide too, Sharma bowls wide, Pandya drives to the left of Pandey at long-off, and misfields to add to his drop earlier in the innings

difficult chance but dropped. Warner at long-on leaps full length, but it doesn't stick. Harsh to call it a drop. Pandya looks to go downtown, mis-hits it towards long-on, but he has got enough for Sharjah
slower offcutter, pitches outside leg, turns towards off, worked to leg for one
on a length, outside off, punched down to long-on
full, outside off, a misfield by the diving extra cover allows him a single

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: beaten. Legbreak, tossed up outside off, Pandya pushes in defence, beaten by the turn
tossed up wide outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: wrong'un, short of a length, the turn takes it away from his reach, and he ends up playing it back to him

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, SIX runs
long_text: Kishan goes after Rashid. Gets just the right length for the slog-sweep, and he goes with it, sending him over midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, OUT
long_text: and it will stay at Faf's 72* for now. Googly from Rashid, de Kock looks to pull this for a six that would take him to 73 but it gets big on him and gets a thick top edge towards midwicket. Rashid runs to the circle, gets under it, and catches a swirler
slower offcutter, 114ks, pitches on off and cuts away to beat his slog
soft hands, dabbed towards the keeper and off they go for a single

short_text: Kaul to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: length ball, gentle medium pace, on the pads, and de Kock lofts this for another flat six. Meat and drink for him

short_text: Kaul to de Kock, no run
long_text: yorker, on off, dug out back to him

short_text: Kaul to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: makes it look easy. Shuffles across, gets inside the line of a short-of-a-length ball, and then ramps it fine of long leg
mis-hits the slog off the free hit, gets just the couple to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside leg, hit hard to long leg for one. This is a no-ball
cramps him up, goes for a single to long-on
slower, wider, and Kishan finally gets one out of the crews, hitting him over long-on. Just a touch too full from Williamson
down the wicket again, Williamson goes shorter, draws a bottom edge for one

short_text: Williamson to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: finally a boundary in 16 balls. Down the wicket, reaches it pitch, and hits him flat back over his head. Brings up his fifty too
flatter, angled in, punched to long-on for one
Kishan looks for the slog sweep, but Williamson is slow and just out of his reach. The mis-hit fetches them two wide of long-on
flatter, quicker, punched to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: wrong'un, middle and leg, de Kock looks to work to leg, gets a soft leading edge for a single to mid-off
flatter, middle and leg, worked into the leg side for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: googly, short, cut away, but straight to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: gets some dip, Kishan has to stretch, ends up pushing this back down the wicket, and Rashid makes a diving save

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: full, middle and leg, pushed to deep midwicket for one
wide outside off, drilled to wide long-on for one
full, really full, can't get under it. Hit hard, but along the ground. Gets a single to deep square
down the wicket, not to its pitch, worked into the leg side for a single
looks for the slog sweep, Williamson keeps the length short of the slot. Concedes just the single to deep midwicket
on a length, just outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
bottom edge first ball. Nicely flighted outside off. He looks to push, plays for the turn, and the ball skids through. Safe

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: flat, on a length, worked to leg for one

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: pulled away between wide long-on and midwicket. Pandey runs to his left and is a slide away  from stopping the boundary. However, he is slow to go down and MI get four

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: on a length, goes back to work this to leg

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: wrong'un, dropped into the leg side for one. And a deflection from the direct hit at the stumps brings them another run

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: straight six. Clears the front le, gets down on a knee, and lofts this back over his head
full, middle and leg, drilled down to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, no run
long_text: nearly bowled. Tries the reverse sweep, is hot on the forearm, and it rolls towards the stumps. He tries to kick it away but misses. The ball misses the stumps too
short of a length, pulled away for a single to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, straight, and Kishan sweeps this between long leg and deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, on the pads, pulled to deep square leg
on a length, wicket to wicket, punched down to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: flat, legbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: pushed away for a single

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: dropped. Difficult chance but by Pandey's standards, this is definitely a drop. This is a short ball pulled straight to Pandey at long-on. He has to leap a little for this overhead catch, but ends up parrying it over. Seems he was not sure of how far behind the boundary rope is
Kishan looks to work this wrong'un to leg, but ends up getting a leading edge that falls short of long-off

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: full, on off, hit wide of long-on, but Pandey is quick and keeps them to one

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: full, on the pads, worked towards fine leg with soft hands, and comes back for two

short_text: Abdul Samad to de Kock, no run
long_text: slider first ball, beats him on the cut, drawing a shout from Bairstow
full and straight, pushed to mid-on

how lucky is Kaul? Leg-side filth at 128ks, seems like a floaty slower ball, and the fine leg is up. Yadav seems to have decided to hit this for a six, but plays a little early, and gets a thick edge to short fine leg
wide length ball, 126ks, and he doesn't need second invitations to go over extra cover. This is in his slot
full, outside off, squeezed in front of extra cover for one
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched down the ground, Kaul gets a hand on it, which actually slows the ball down and allows them the time to take a single
full toss on the pads with fine leg up. Once again Kaul is lucky Yadav is not looking for a six. Just the four
on a length, angling across, hits the inside half of the bat on the drive
another ramp attempted, this time by Surya, and he is beaten. It just misses the leg stump. Well done by the umpire to not call this a wide

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, 1 leg bye
long_text: looks for the ramp, Natarajan bowls short of a length, outside off, and de Kock gets a leg-bye off the forearm

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: full, straight, he clears the front leg looking for a big hit, but is hit on the inside half of the bat

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, no room, punched to point

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: full, middle and leg, and he clears the front leg to bludgeon this through mid-on for four
shouts of catch it as this stops on him, but the leading edge is wide of the diving Sharma
short of a length, wide outside off, punched to deep cover
pulls the length back a touch, pushed down to long-on for one
full, on the pads, 129ks, he is lucky that Yadav has decided to hit just four and not deposit this into the road around the ground
this one seems to have swung away a little. Pushed towards mid-off
on a length, outside off, holds its line, dropped into the offside for one
looks like the slower ball. On a length, outside off, hit back to Kaul
slight shimmy to take this on the half-volley and drive it between the bowler and mid-on
lovely shot. Kaul goes short of a length to deny him the drive, but he is on his toes to punch this on the up, between mid-off and extra cover
extension of arms through the line of this length ball with an open face to beat cover. Looks eays in the PP in Sharjah
swinging into the pads, but he has a deep square leg in place
gets some swing, but it starts outside leg and goes further down

short_text: Kaul to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: length ball outside leg with fine leg up. Clipped away for an easy four
on a length, middle and leg, angling across, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, 138ks, Surya plays with soft hands, but the ball doesn't go anywhere. Can't take a single
shuffles across to cash in on the short fine leg but ends up hitting this length ball straight to the man
short of a length, pushed towards mid-on with soft hands for a single

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, punched to point

short_text: Natarajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: on a length, around off, slight nip off the surface, hits him on the pad
inswinger now, on a length, headed towards middle and off. Punched down aerially to mid-on

appeal for a catch at the wicket, not given, and SRH review. Short and wide, pitched just outside the wide line, and Rohit has somehow managed to catch up with the cue end of his bat. A good review from SRH. The decision will have to change, and Rohit will have to walk back

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: and Rohit has had enough sighters. Snadeep bowls short at a gentle pace, and Rohit stands tall to pull this over midwicket. Six number 1

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, wide outside off, slight swing back in, patted away to cover again

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slightly short of a length, swings in a touch, pushed to cover

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: beaten first ball. On a length outside off, holds its line while Rohit plays for the inswing

short_text: Stoinis to Shivam Mavi, 1 leg bye
long_text: low full toss into the pad, they get a leg-bye. That is the win for DC

short_text: Stoinis to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: another yorker, beats him, but also missed the leg stump
another slower yorker, taken on the full for a dive to wide long-on
short ball, pulled down to deep backward square leg for one
that's the game then. Dipping slower yorker at 126ks, and it squeezes under Tripathi's swing to dislodge the off stump
wide low full toss, Tripathi is on a knee and drives with an open face over point. Missing quite a few yorkers, and it is understandable with the dew around
back of a length, outside off, punched to long-on, and Tripathi refuses the single
short of a length, outside off, a misfield at point allows them to come back for the second
full toss, again cramps him up, concedes just the single to deep midwicket
and Nortje has delivered the big wicket. Morgan gets the pulling length, but this sort of hanfcuffs him with its straight line. Caught at long leg. DC will breathe for now
heavy length, Tripathi throws his bat it. Gets a single to deep point
full toss, around off, mis-timed for a single down to long-off
that over has gone for 23. Yorker gone wrong again. Almost a half-volley, and with mid-off in the circle, he has hit it through mid-off for four more

given out caught at the wicket, and Tripathi has reviewed it. Bouncer, at his helmet, Tripathi looks for the hook, and it has missed his bat and just kissed the helmet on the way. So Tripathi has successfully overturned this one
finally gets the yorker right, dug out to long-off for one

yorker gone wrong, and Rabada has been hit for three successive shots. This is like Cottrell to Tewatia. Three balls in, and Morgan has taken the 18 required off the over. This is a plum full toss, and he has pumped it over deep square leg
oh this is mayhem. Doesn't matter who you are. If you are bowling in the last four, you have no rights. Slower ball, short of a length, outside leg, picked up over square leg for another six
that is a massive top edge. What an almighty swing to a bouncer, and the top edge flies fine and sails into the roof
this over keeps KKR alive. A third six to end it off with. Another wide low full toss, Tripathi gets on a knee and lofts this over extra cover
low full toss, hit in the air, but on the bounce to mid-off
and he goes wide yorker with the third man up. Tripathi sees a qide full ball, and throws his bat at it. The outside edge sails over short third man
full toss, slower ball, and Tripathi slogs this over wide long-on. This over bringing the asking rate back down towards 18
picks the slower ball early, clears the front leg, and slogs this over midwicket
full ball, on the tram line, driven to deep cover
sees Morgan shuffles across, goes wider, but ends up going too wide
full toss, leg stump, swiped to deep midwicket for one more
sharp bouncer, 140ks, following him, pulled to long leg
short ball, pulled into the ground for a single

through the hands of Rahane at deep midwicket. Down the wicket, cramped on the full toss, but still goes ahead with it. Rahane is at the edge of the boundary, he leaps up, but gets only a fleeting touch on the ball
yorker gone wrong. Morgan makes room and sends this low full toss over extra cover
yorker, middle and leg, dug out to extra cover for one
another slower full toss, this one dips enough to not be a no-ball again. Morgan gets just a bottom edge through to the keeper
slower ball, high full toss, taken at point, but this is bound to a no-ball as it looks like a high full toss. Replays confirm this is a no-ball
slow again, full, on off, driven to deep point for one
slower full ball outside off, driven to cover-point
slower bouncer, beats his hook, but he has been wided on the height. Harsh call
short of a length, makes room, gets a bottom edge on the cut. Takes a single
slower ball again, full, around off, worked to deep midwicket for one
slower offcutter, short of a length, gets extra bounce and goes for a single off the high part of the bat
down the wicket again, this time upper-cuts a short ball to deep point for one
backs away, Nortje follows him with a length ball, worked to leg for two
first ball he faces, Morgan shimmies a touch and pulls a short ball for a flat six over square leg
Tripathi might finally get to bat after all. Cummins can't get away with two edges. Short of a length, 141ks, Cummins looks to go over cover, but gets a thick edge for a low catch at third man
shorter this time, at him, and Cummins drops his wrists under it
oh unlucky. Short of a length, around off, gets good carry, and the outside edge goes wide of the keeper for four
looks for the slower yorker for the lbw, at 119ks, ends up bowling a low full toss, and Cummins keeps it out

two in two with a diving catch from Dhawan at mid-off. Harshal digs this in, but bowls the change-up, the quick delivery at 133ks. Karthik is late into the pull, and gets a top edge to the right of mid-off, but Dhawan dives full length to take the catch

what a comeback from Harshal Patel. Shortens the length here with this slower ball. Rana looks to go over midwicket this time, but gets a massive top edge for substitute fielder Axar Patel to take the catch at deep midwicket
one slower ball too many. Rana is now lining him up for slower ones. This is pitched on a length, and he lofts him over long-on
lovely stop by Nortje at the long-off fence. Slower offcutter, Rana lofts him down the ground, but Nortje runs to his left and sticks his left hand out to keep the ball in play
slower offcutter. Short of a length, around off, drops this towards point and runs
short of a length, wicket to wicket, punched to leg for one
runs this down to short third man to bring up his fifty
slower offcutter, gives him the width and Rana accepts it, cutting him square of sweeper cover
misses out. Short of a length, pitched outside leg, short fine leg is up. But he finds the fielder
on a length, on off, pushed to cover
slower ball, middle and leg, worked into the leg side, there is a mix-up between the runners as they look for two but Rabada doesn't make a clean pick-up running in from deep midwicket
slower ball, full, on the pads, clipped away between deep midwicket and deep backward square
short of a length, wide, punched to cover
change-up delivery, a quick ball, 134ks. Hits him on the glove with a short ball
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
straight, played away off the pads for a single to deep square leg
another slower ball, middle and off, pushed to cover
another slower ball. A big wide down leg. dealing in slower deliveries
sharp quick ball, 137ks, makes him fend and hits him high on the bat
Rabada has done the job. Brought back to get Russell out, Rabada delivers. Fast short ball, Russell back away and swings, gets a big top edge and Nortje runs in from third man to claim it
the Russellmania is taking off. Rabada misses the yorker, ends up bowling a half-volley, and he goes straight back over his head
now the quick short one to follow him as he backs away. Draws a dot
short ball, slower one, 125ks, Russell waits for it, sets up his base, and smashes this down the ground and straight of long-on
goes for the yorker, ends up bowling a quick full toss. Defended back to him
Mishra stays away from Russell's swinging arc. Short ball, wide, and hit hard down to long-on
slider, short wide outside off, punched down to long-off for one
and h takes six off that free hit. Mishra bowls a full legbreak, Rana gets right behind it and crashes it back over his head
big wind-up, but Mishra is slow and gets the ball to dip. Punched to deep cover for one. But this is a no-ball
legbreak, middle and leg, pushed to leg for one
short of a length, stays low, hit hard to long-on for one

Gill is not only out to a skier he refuses to cross. This is ordinary bating. Digging a hole with slow strike before trying the slow sweep against the turn off Mishra. The big top edge goes straight up for a mile and settles with Pant
and he fails to edd the over well. Provides him width on this length ball without a deep point. Is cut away precisely there
fired down the leg side for a wide
legbreak, short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
carrom ball? Short of a length, turning the other way, runs away off the thick outside edge. Clears point
on a length, outside off, cut straight to cover-point where substitute fielder Rahane misfields
slow offbreak, short of driving length, punched to deep cover
slow, offbreak, Rana goes back to cut it for a single to deep cover
ends with a slider that goes to point for a single
slower, fuller, dug out back to him
slider, short of a length. Rana cuts but he doesn't have the pace to work with. Hits this to point
dropped. Slider from Mishra, Rana gets a leading edge as he looks to the leg side. Mishra has to dive to his right, but this is not that difficult a catch. Spills it
down the wicket, Mishra goes wide, making him drag it to long-on for one
leading edge first up. Slow legbreak, starts from leg, and lands in front of point after hitting his edge
low full toss, on the pads, worked away for one to deep square
full and fast, and he concedes a single to the man he just pushed back: deep square leg
another offcutter, this time he starts on a length and outside leg. Beats his push
slower ball again, nearly a yorker, and goes for four. Is this done deliberately? He is looking to open the face, but the ball has run off the edge of the bat, between the keeper and short third
another slower ball, Rana slogs at it, gets a thick edge, and it flies over short third. That's why they ask you to swing hard if you are swinging
on a length, outside off, punched to mid-off for one
slower ball first up, wide down the leg side
offcutter to draw a dot to end the over. Just short of a length, and beats his push in front of off
short ball, at off, draws a bottom edge on the pull for a single to mid-on
steered to deep point for one
down the wicket, Stoinis tucks him up with a shortish delivery. Concedes a single to midwicket
short, at 134ks, and Gill delays the pull slightly to place this square of the deep square leg. He doesn't have far to go to his right, but can't stop this
on a length, no room, he runs it down to deep point for one
short of a length, quick, hits him high on the bat. Played to cover-point
runs his fingers on it? Pace is 134ks. Yes this is a legcutter, which stays low and squeezes under his bat outside off
top edge on the pull but he has placed this in front of square so there is no boundary rider. He gets a small six for this
short of a length, quick, hits the thigh pad, concedes a leg-bye
pulls the length ball a little, is punched to mid-off for one
Gill lines Nortje up. Shuffles across to get behind the line of this length ball and goes over mid-off. Even though he gets more height than distance, it is good enough to clear mid-off
pause plus round arm. Rana just waits for it, and pings this ball back over long-on for another six
another pause in his delivery stride. Bowls middle and leg, makes him play to his deep fielder, midwicket
fuller, slower, on the pads, worked to leg for one
pauses in his delivery stride, bowls flat, outside off, cut to cover-point
what a welcome back. Doesn't bother with any sighters. Slog-sweeps this length ball from around off. Clean connection
length-ball offbreak, worked to leg for one
on a length, around off, defended from the crease
nearly a run-out. Gill runs after hitting to mid-off, and he is casual in trying to make it. Iyer has nearly caught him off guard but misses the stumps. He is gone if Iyer hits
a length ball on the pads, clipped to the vast open spaces in the leg side for, you'd better believe, a three at Sharjah
on a length, straight, wicket to wicket, defended back to him
there he goes. Not the attack to try Narine against. The good thing is, he hasn't wasted too many balls. Clears the front leg and slogs, Nortje hits the top of leg stump
sharp bouncer, aimed at the helmet, but it keeps flying as it goes past him. Goes for four byes
back to pace, played with an open face for a single to point
and just as I say this attack is too quick and big for Narine, Rabada bowls a 119ks slower ball, which Narine punches through point
this is not the attack to try Narine against. Sharp heavy short ball, beats him as he fends without getting close to the line of the ball
stays short of a length, Gill gets inside its line, takes a single to leg
short of a length, again, cramps him up with the angle. Pushed to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
yorker, dug out to long-off for just the single. I am surprised they don't go for the extra run
this is excellent bowling. Beats him with an on-pace short ball. Appeals for a catch at the wicket. Not given. They review, looking for a bottom edge here. Nothing on the UltraEdge
slower ball, short of a length, beats his pull
Hetmyer has mis-hit this slower ball for a six that lands short of the dugout. Opens up his front leg and lofts it down the ground
Hetmyer looks for a six first up, and is beaten by a quick bouncer
slower ball, wide down leg, but Stoinis thinks he can clear short midwicket and take four. However, he ends up toe-ending this for a catch at short fine leg
legcutter goes too full, and Iyer gets inside the line for another head-down six off another spinner. Sweet as
stays short of a length, doesn't allow him a free hit down the ground. Hit to long-off for one
slow through the air, gets some dip, beats him in the air. Gets hit on the inside half on the slog
flat, short of a length, outside off, and he stands tall to hit it over extra cover for a flat six
really slow offbreak, and Karthik can't collect it down the leg side as it beats Iyer's swing. Or did he get a bottom edge?
short of a length, flat, outside off, pulled between long-on and deep midwicket for four
looks to ramp a bouncer even while ducking. Makes no connection

oh he tries the helicopter and it crash-lands in the lap of long-on. Russell cramps him up with a full ball on the pads. Pant has to draw any power from that whip of the wrists. He doesn't succeed. Long-on takes the catch
full toss, and he has mis-hit it. And still it is placed between wide long-on and deep midwicket
short ball, hurrier him into the pull, but he also gets inside the line to be able to use the pace and place it square on the leg side for four
Pant is only getting started here. Russell makes the mistake of bowling length. Pant is not holding himself back. Sends this to the roof behind wide long-on
and he draws a mis-hit immediately. Not a yorker, but not quite a half-volley. So he can't get under it properly. Takes a single to deep cover
full toss, just outside off, played to deep midwicket for one
Cummins has mid-off up and Iyer backs away to drive a full delivery between mid-off and extra cover
oh nearly a yorker, but Iyer gets inside its line and manages to play it towards short fine where an awkward bounce draws four runs from Narine
full, outside off, drilled hard to the left of deep cover, but they get just the single
this time the yorker lands. Just the single to leg
yorker gone wrong. Iyer likes the consequent low full toss. He hits this metres above the midwicket boundary

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: there is a deep midwicket in place but Pant has drilled this full ball between long-on and that man. No chance for either fielder

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: that is a Pant special. Slower bouncer, outside off, and he somehow smashes this over extra cover where there is no fielder
dug out to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, FOUR runs
long_text: misfielded at the fence to undo a good delivery. Mavi stays full enough - even though not quite the yorker - to deny him a free hit. Iyer sends it to long-on, where Cummins lets the bowler down. That's Iyer's fastest fifty in IPL
fuller, doesn't allow him elevation. Hit to long-off for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: Bang. Pant has warmed up. A nothing length-ball loosener outside off, and he has smashed it straight of mid-off
the straight yorker executer now. Dug out for just the single
low full toss but he has angled it too far wide outside off
wide full toss, called wide. Borderline on height too, but he gets away with that one
yorker, h can't get under it. Takes a single to long-on
absolutely smashes away as he gets width on a length ball, but he has hit this straight to extra cover. An unnecessary throw from Morgan gives them the single
played down the ground for a single
short of a length, no room, punched straight of deep midwicket for two
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, with an open face. Gets a single to deep point
lovely shot. Cummins gets a touch too full, and he drives it over extra cover for four more
full and wide, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, pretty straight, cross seam, played to deep square leg for one
short of a length, wicket to wicket, punched down the ground for one
full and straight, clipped between square leg and deep midwicket for two more
on a length, mis-hit towards long leg, and he scampers back for two. Gets a dive in for good measure
nearly run out first ball. Short of a length, no room, the bottom hand comes off as he pushes to point. He is short by miles but the throw doesn't hit at the non-striker's end
backs away to open the face on this short-of-a-length delivery for a single
Nagarkoti finally gets some reward too. Short of a length, follows Shaw as he makes room, and this one flies over the toe end of the bat. Goes a mile in the air but can't clear long-on
short of a length, no room, worked to leg for one
back of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
