soft little pick-up shot, and six more. Full toss, middle and leg, and Shaw goes over midwicket with this
this time he gives Iyer width with the flatter delivery, and he rocks back to cut it between short third and point
flatter, quicker, shorter. Cramps him up
head-down six. Gets the big stride in, not right to its pitch, but close enough to swing through the line and go over long-on
slips this in wide and flat, draws a bottom edge on the cut as Shaw has backed away early
no justice in Sharjah. Plays for the offbreak, gets an outside edge to this legcutter, and it flies fine of short third man
looks like an offbreak, goes away after pitching, Dropped in front of point for one
gets away with a similar delivery, this time it is flicked for a single to deep backward square
just a soft little pick-up shot, and he gets six for it. He shuffles across to clip this leg-side length ball over deep square
yorker gone wrong. Low full toss, hit to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, 118ks, on a length, outside off, and Shaw delays his slog to send it over long-on and bring up his fifty
on a length, straight, whipped to deep midwicket
lovely yorker to start off with, 141ks, following him, jamming his bat outside leg
short of a length, outside off, punched into the leg side
full, driven hard, gets a thick inside edge for one
stays short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep point
offbreak, short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
Iyer finally gets spin, and he unleashes. Not quite to the pitch of the ball, which is why he ends up dragging it to midwicket, but gets a good enough connection
on a length, on off, punched down to long-on
bouncer to end the over. Iyer does nothing to it. Two overs without a boundary for Russell. This is excellent
another near-yorker. A low full toss hit to mid-off for a tight single, and Shaw is hit on the foot by the throw and is down on his haunches. A direct hit would have got Shaw here
full, slightly short of being a yorker, but Shaw can't beat mid-off here
short of a length, gets big on him, dropped into the leg side for one
full, slight swing, hits the outer half of the bat for a single to extra cover
gets some swing, which means he can't get all of this low full toss. Hit straight to extra cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, outside off, driven on the up, hard and between the bowler and mid-off
on a length, but no room this time. Pushed with soft hands, and they take a single to cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, SIX runs
long_text: lovely shot. First boundary after the fifth over. Makes room to loft this length ball inside-out over extra cover
on a length, outside off, played on the up, gets a single to mid-off
short of a length, Shaw gets inside the line and helps it along to long leg for one
short of a length, angling in, worked to deep square leg for one
yorker. Dub out back to him. Excellent over. No boundary
shuffles across, then backs away. Russells stays short and straight. He ramps him to third man for one
on a length, just outside off, punched to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed straight to cover and they scamper through for one
legcutter. Great ball to get a dot here. Short of a length, just outside off, holds its line, beats his defensive shot
short, on off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
legcutter again, short of a length, not much room, cut away in front of square for one

legcutter grip but a topsinner, and Dhawan is done in. Brave bowling. Tosses this up, but gets some drop in it, and the extra bounce gets a big top edge on the sweep. The ball swirls and swirls and Morgan does well to hold on to it at square leg

short_text: Varun to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, skids through to beat his pull
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, plays this to deep midwicket for one
tossed up wide, Shaw tries the big sweep, but is beaten
short of a length, seems like the legbreak, cut away between cover and cover-point
again the big wind-up, and again he stays out of the swinging arc. Punched down to long-on for one
appeal for lbw as Narine beats him on the slog with the offbreak, but this is headed down leg. Nice dip on it
carrom ball, short of a length, outside off, placed in front of point for one

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: more of a slog-sweep this time, and the result is the same. Clean as. Why would you want to be a bowler? This is a perfect length for an offbreak, but this is Sharjah

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: big sweep. Dhawan early to plonk the foot down, get down on a knee, and sweep this length-ball offbreak in the air and out of the ground
big wind up against this offbreak, but it dips and drops short of the slot. So he works it to leg for one

short_text: Varun to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full, but slow and dipping, slight turn away from him. Defended back to the bowler

short_text: Varun to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely inside-out shot. Not a big drive, just a jab at it. He has finally got one full, and he goes over extra cover
carrom ball, short of a length, pulled down to long-on for one
short ball, pulled to midwicket where a fumble by Morgan allows them the single

short_text: Varun to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: nice offbreak, slight drift and dip, and then holds its line
on a length, seems like an offbreak. Shaw goes back to punch this to deep cover for one
short of a length, just outside off, soft hands are back, and they take a single to cover
goes for a proper short ball, at 148ks, but this rises to as high as his ribs. Pulled away with disdain. The first six of many tonight
Slightly shorter than the usual short of a length, and that allows Shaw, a short man, the time to pull this over midwicket
short of a length, angling in, Dhawan uses soft hands to dab it for a single into the off side
short, quick, chest-high, pulled down into the ground for a single
down the wicket, makes room, Cummins follows him, he still manages a good swing, but can't beat midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: cramps him up on this shortish delivery, Dhawan gets a bottom edge as he looks for the late cut

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: down the wicket to try to upset his length, but Mavi stays short of a length, and draws extra bounce to beat him
on a length, soft hands again, placed slightly to the left of cover-point. Another single
short of a length, wide, steered square of deep point for a couple

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: back to short of a length, Dhawan takes a single with an open face

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slightly too short as he goes short of a length, allowing Dhawan a cut as opposed to the punch, and he opens the face to send this over that fly slip
short of a length, angling in, soft hands from Dhawan, another single pinched
back to short of a length, played with soft hands, takes a single to point
there you are. The first time Cummins pitches up, and Shaw extends his arms into the shot anf lofts him over mid-on
short of a length, at off, runs off the outer half of the bat to fly slip/ short third man
short of a length, slight room, punched away to square third man for one
short of a length, into the body, tucked away off the hip to deep square leg

short_text: Tom Curran to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: punched wide of mid-on and into the boundary. Full toss on leg stump, strong base, quick wrists
full and in at middle stump, backs away and drives to long-on
slower short ball at middle, backs into the leg side for a laboured pull to deep midwicket
slower ball, good length and at off stump. Punched to extra cover's left. Smith collects one-handed, throws at the non-striker's end and the man backing up fumbles it
slower ball, good length on off stump. Pushed pitch side with the angle

falls short of long-off. Slower short ball outside off, looks to jab it to the extra cover boundary. Miscues and lobs it up for the diving fielder. Gopal does well to not let that pass him, but the half-volley is parried to his left and Kohli uses that to sneak a third
good length and in at middle stump, turned towards square leg with soft hands

short_text: Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: oh wow. Lovely placement. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. Fetches it with perfect  timing to get the pace and beat fine leg to his left

short_text: Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: slashed over short third. Slower ball, short and very wide. No attempt to be aesthetic there. Kohli chucks the hands with the intent to get it over the fielder. It is over him off the thick outside edge
slower ball, good length and outside off. Shuffles and drops it into the leg side with soft hands
carved over extra with little control. Full slower ball outside off, doesn't time the attempted loft
full at middle, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket

short_text: Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: punched past the bowler! Full ball at off stump, steps out to create some pace off the surface and then check-drives it firmly past the bowler's ankles
googly, good length and in at middle stump. Deep in the crease to tuck this to long-on's right with soft hands
short of a good length outside off, opens the face and dabs to short third's left
googly, short of a good length outside off. Punched to long-on off the back foot
just over midwicket. Short ball outside off and he was shaping to pull, but that gripped and turned away from him. He had to drag it
full legbreak outside off, slashes a drive out to sweeper
googly, good length and in at off stump. Opens the face and dabs it to point
full toss at off stump, tapped back down the pitch

knocks off stump out with a 145kph ball. Padikkal walking into the leg side again expecting a short one, but this is full. Archer too smart for him, but it's the end of yet another impressive innings from the 20-year-old

beaten and so is Buttler. Archer has his hands on his hips. Full slower ball wide outside off, 121.6kph. Looks to whip that over midwicket. Buttler can't collect cleanly on the bounce and they sneak a run
short ball in the corridor. Gets steep and he lets that go
good length and just outside off, mistimed slog to long-on

past third man to his left. Short and at middle stump. Not doing too well with the pull against Archer, so this time he jumps into the leg side to open the off side instead. Smart batting. Slashes it over backward point
short and wide, dragged clumsily down to long-on with the pull
full toss on middle stump, punches it down to long-on and brings up his fifty. Got the time to play himself in today and he's used it after an indifferent start to the season
sweeeeet. Pristine. Full and quicker at middle stump. Jumps down and is right by the pitch of it. Clean straight swing
full on off stump, driven on the bounce to extra cover
dropped. Tough return catch for Tewatia, that was drilled to his left, just above head height. Full ball outside off. Long-off gets across to it, to his right
short and wide outside off. Looks to muscle it through the off side, gets a thick inside edge to long-on

just short of midwicket. Struggling to get the pull away against Archer's pace. He  plays that shot compulsively and will be tested more and more with every passing game. This time he slices it a few yards in front of Samson
short and rising too quickly at middle stump. Backs away to pull but that's ended up at mid-off
bouncer at leg stump, 137.2kph, ducks under it
short of good length outside off, another mistimed pull. This time because it's a short ball. Mid-on covers to his right
short outside off, mistimed pull to midwicket off the inside half
good length and just outside off, mistimed drive on the rise to mid-off's right
good length, coming in from outside off. Hurriedly defended on the front foot
full googly down leg side, gets low for the paddle sweep and misses. Buttler can't gather cleanly
short of a good length at middle, mistimed pull to long-on
good length offbreak this time, at middle stump. Pushed into midwicket
whipped over extra cover. Full and just outside off. Parag doesn't bowl legbreaks as much as legcutters, so there won't be much grip on his deliveries. Kohli goes inside-out over extra cover

steps out and slaps it on the up. Peak Kohli. Short of a good length and wide outside off. Kohli will enjoy Parag's bowling, because he skids it on. And this skids on and sits up and he gets it on the rise to the wide long-off boundary
good length and sliding in from outside off, chopped to short third man
slower short ball just outside off, backs away and cuts straight to backward point
slower good length ball at middle, flicked to deep midwicket
slower short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep square

third fifty of the season. Slower ball, dug short and turning into the corridor. Allows that one, arches into the leg side to make room and dabs it past the keeper. The timid boy who hung out with 16-year-old Prayas Barman at the airports when RCB traveled between venues last year, is now a guaranteed pick in that top order
short at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket's left
good length and across the corridor. Looks to drive on the up, thick inside edge to deep square
googly, short of a good length outside off. Tapped to extra cover
good length and quickly onto the legs. Punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper's right
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on's left

bat-pad situation and an lbw shout. Good length ball slides back in off the pitch at middle and Kohli is a little tangled trying to play a late cut. Tewatia seems convinced that's pad-first. Smith and Buttler, slip and keeper, don't. Ultra Edge shows glove first
short and skidding on at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's right
dropped very short and wide outside off. Can't beat extra cover with the cut
tossed up full and a legbreak. Reaches out and drives to long-off with the turn
googly on leg stump, deep in the crease to flick to long leg
full and quicker on off stump, front-of-the-hand. Neat little flowing drive to long-off's right. Tewatia with another dive and tumble to save runs
full googly outside off, gets forward and flicks to long-on
googly, short and at leg stump. Whipped top deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
yorker length at off stump, jammed back down the pitch
full on off stump, pushed to extra cover's right off the front foot
good length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
whippy pull to deep square. Dropped short at middle stump, quickly on the back foot and gets it to deep square's right
full and just outside off, squeezed out to sweeper cover

short_text: Tom Curran to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: misfield at extra cover. Very poor work. Full ball outside off, steps out and drives firmly. Great timing on it. But it's straight at the fielder, Lomror, who just doesn't get down on it with the barrier
dropped short, a slower ball outside off. Pulls it over midwicket. Tewatia runs a long way to his left from deep square and puts in a dive to flick this back in

short_text: Tom Curran to Kohli, no run
long_text: length and at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to sweeper cover
good length and just outside off, steps out and drives to mid-off's left
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
beaten. Loopy googly tossed up very wide outside off. Reaches out and is beaten on the under edge as he has a whip at that
short and wide and cut to sweeper's left again
good length and sliding in at middle. Onto the back foot to punch to long-on
good length and into the pads. Nudged to fine leg's right
good length and sliding in at leg stump. Flicked to midwicket's left
short and wide outside off, hammered to sweeper cover off the back foot
just short of long-on running in. Slower ball at a good length, just outside off. Wants to loft it over midwicket, presumably. Archer can't reach it

short_text: Tom Curran to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: way too short from Curran. And this one is wide too. It's also a slower ball. He waits on it and punches aerially to the extra cover boundary

short_text: Tom Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: forced to leave that. Short slower ball going across the corridor. Had shaped for the pull but that just didn't arrive. Decided to drop the bat and let it go

short_text: Tom Curran to Padikkal, FOUR runs
long_text: slower short ball up at the hips. Waits on it and shovels it past short fine

short_text: Tom Curran to Padikkal, no run
long_text: full slower ball on off stump, forced to defend into the covers
slices the attempted pull and dribbles away safely after landing behind the bowler. Short and going across him, was late on the pull
googly, short of good length just outside off. Punched towards long-on off the back foot
short at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to backward point who fumbles. They take the run as he looks to retrieve it
easy peasy. That'll feel nice. Googly gets stuck in his hand a little and is very very short and almost looping down on Kohli as it goes down leg. Helps it along to the backward square boundary
good length and coming into him as he shuffles and defends down the pitch
googly, short of a good length outside off. Opens the face and chops to short third's right
good length outside off, 146.3kph, shuffles and taps it on the rise into the covers
good length and wide outside off at 143.9kph. Lets it go and they smile at each other as Jofra follows through
good length and just outside off, shuffles and tries to flick, cops it on the thigh guard. 143.2kph
good length at middle stump, defended into the covers with soft hands
misfield at short fine. Gopal not sharp enough to field low to his left. Short at the hips, stands tall and nudges it. Through from under him
good length and angled away from middle stump. Deep in the crease as he defends off the outside part of the bat
googly, full and outside off. Reaches out and clips to midwicket
good length, sliding across the corridor. Punched to long-on off the back foot
googly, short of a good length and wide outside off. Shuffles and whips into midwicket

caught in front of the stumps trying to sweep. Turned down. Smith reviews. He was looking to paddle this from middle stump, was caught on the thigh. An incoming ball on first glance. Might not be such a bad shout. His front leg is well across the body and into the off side nothing on Ultra Edge till ball hits pad. That is hitting middle and leg. Impact is on off stump. A googly from a good length and he's taken the early wicket. Good bowling and also a good decision to keep staring his captain down with puppy eyes and get that review

oh he's done this every match, just jump down the leg side. Invariably the first ball against a legspinner, Finch has gone way down leg side, drawn a short ball into him and swatted it past backward square. And he does it again
good length, googly at leg stump. On the back foot to tap to long-on
good length on middle stump, taps it to mid-on
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
slower ball at a good length, just outside off. Opens the face and runs it fine of third man

short of a good length and just outside off. That is a decent length on most days, but today there is more time on such balls as we saw all of the first innings. Front foot pull, nailed over midwicket
good length at off stump, defended from deep in the crease
young and free-flowing This is an overpitched ball slanted into his pad and he just picks it up, and times it to send a long back over square leg
slower shor ball gives Finch some extra time, and he arches into the leg side to slap this over the covers
beaten on the pull. Short and climbing outside off, pulls from inside the line of that
good shout for lbw I thought. Maybe going over. He pins him deep in the crease, trying to flick a middle stump ball and cops it on the front pad in front of the stumps. The high part of the pad
short and just outside off, defended on the back foot
short ball climbing up at middle stump, gets the front leg in the air trying to pull but is cramped and caught on the body
short and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands

cops that on the helmet. Good length all at 140,7kph outside off. Sinks into it and tries to ramp, only to miss completely. He's on his feet and disappointed at himself for not getting some runs off of that ball
slower short ball at leg stump, mistimed pull to deep square's left
beaten. It was there for the slog, length-wise. But was quickly past him outside off as he looked for the wrist flick again

swats it to the deep square boundary with some help from the fielder who was putting in a valiant effort to his right. Walks into another high full toss outside off, and just has a flick at it. Gurkeerat jumps to his right, one-handed and can't hang on. That was very close to being above the waist, I thought
sends it flying over square leg A good length ball in the corridor, shuffles into the corridor and is right behind it. Uses the pace to loft it high and about 83 metres behind

oh that's hit him straight on the throat it looks like. I hope not. Looks like just under the throat, collarbone region. A beamer as he walks into the off side for the ramp. He's on his feet now. Whew, that looked scary. A ball in the mid-140s.
low full toss at off stump, mistimed drive off the outer half to mid-off's right
full outside off, carted down to long-off's right

wow what is happening here. Slower yorker gets Archer on the toe. He's resting on his at and looking into the floor as his partner wants the run. He's run all the way next to Archer before turning. The bowler has responded late, turns around and tries to long it in the direction of Kohli who's running in from extra cover. But he can't hang on and the opportunity for the run out is gone
full and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
nails this one. Slower ball, short of a good length. Short enough  for him to line it up and club it flat over the fielder
past his swing. Full toss pushed wide outside off, backs into the off side for the slog and can't connect on it
back-of-the-hand length ball just outside off, can only slice it to long-off as it rises off the pitch and gets sweep
squeezed past short fine. Full toss on the pad, free swing, thick inside edge to short fine's right
short of deep square. Bouncer at the front shoulder, swipes hurriedly from under that
oh smart stop frm AB. Full toss ball outside off, looks to slap through the covers, gets a thick edge that AB plucks on the bounce with a dive to his left
short at middle stump, looks to pull but is completely late on it. Lobbed over the bowler's head off the sticker part of the bat
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square's left
nonchalant short-arm whip over square leg! Full on off stump, about 143kph. He shuffles and gets deep in the crease and stays very still. Then swishes his arms, flat and over the fielder
full outside off, driven along the floor to long-off
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

taken at long-off. Smart, smart bowling from Chahal. Knows Lomror's strength is that arc for the leg-side hit, so slides this close to the tramline and full outside off. He looks for the sweep but the angle, the width, the pace - everything is against him. Sliced up
full on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep square
full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to deep midwicket
oh such a good hitter. The third instance of Lomror absolutely nailing one off the middle. Another full ball at middle stump, and he creates the swinging room for a slog sweep
yorker outside off, jams it into the covers with soft hands
taken at long-on. Udana's taken the pace off that again and that means Parag can't get the power on this pull shot. Not on this pitch. Short and sitting up for the pull but taken well inside
full and just outside off, gets the front leg out and drills it to mid-off
offcutter, short of a length and just outside off. Tapped to long-on with soft hands but quick work from the man down there prevents that
short slower ball down leg side, lets that go
full slower ball on leg stump, clips with soft hands into the vacant midwicket region
good length outside off, opens the face to drive to sweeper's left
pumps this firmly! Whew. What bat-speed. But Devdutt cleans up to his left. He got to the pitch of this length ball outside off and drills it past his partner
ooooooooh that is far! Some hit. Full on off stump, steps out and makes the pitch of this and nails the slog. Far far away in the direction of wide long-on
beaten on the slog sweep. Good length and pushed across him, a googly. Too wide and past his swinging arc
tossed up full and wide outside off, mistimed loft to long-off's right
full and down leg side, beaten on the sweep
good length outside off, opens the face and chops to short third
good length at middle, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, punched to long-off with the turn
good length at middle stump, makes room and chops to backward point
short at leg stump, on the back foot to whip to deep backward square
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length on off stump, gets forward and opens the face and runs it to point's left
full on off stump, driven to long-off
good length and outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third
drilled past the bowler. Nicely timed. Full and at middle stump, gets the front leg out of the and goes straight, a bit aerial, but between stumps and non-striker
low full toss on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
short on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
good length in the corridor, turning away. Looks to flick and gets a leading edge towards short third
good length cutter outside off, shuffles and flicks to mid-on
short at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length offcutter wide outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
just short of sweeper cover Full and wide outside off, doesn't slide onto the bat as he looks to loft it over extra cover. Ends up slicing it
googly, good length and outside off. Blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, onto the back foot and punches to long-off
good length on off stump, gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover on the front foot

holes out to long-off and a forlorn Uthappa walks back. It's just not coming off for him. Good length ball, loopy and tossed up wide outside off. He wants to loft that over long-off but it's a half-hearted attempt. Checks it and taken well inside
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
slower ball, good length outside off. Mistimed chop into the covers
good length at leg stump, backs away and is hurried. Drops it into the covers
good length and across the corridor, backs away and has a swipe. It works out. Not fully off the middle, bat turns in the hand, but it's past mid-off's dive to the left
good length at off stump, backs into the leg side and defends into the covers
full outside off, backs into the leg side and drives along the floor to sweeper cover
good length and spun away wide outside off, beaten on the cut
good length on leg stump, swept to deep square's right
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
googly, short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
clubs this way over midwicket! Full on middle stump, pushed through at middle stump and he clears the front foot and has a lovely swing at this. 84 metres
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
good length outside off, driven to sweeper cover's left
good length at middle stump, whipped to midwicket with the angle
good length on leg stump, flicks to deep square off the front foot
good length and leg stump, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket
good length and leg stump, defended to extra cover on the front foot
lofted to long-on's left. Full on middle stump, gets to the pitch and it's a subdued slog. On the bounce and beats long-on's left
googly, full and wide outside off, chopped out to sweeper cover
low full toss wide outside off, mistimed slog to long-on's right
full on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
low full toss on off stump, gets down and paddles it to fine leg's right
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length at leg stump, shuffles and taps to deep midwicket off the back foot
just chipped over backward square. Good length outside off, top edge as he doesn't go through with that shot
good length outside off, gets low for the sweep wide outside off, cops it on the pad
good length and outside off, gets forward and pats it down the pitch
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's right
good length at off stump, gets forward and whips to deep midwicket
good length at the stumps, tucked into the leg side off the back foot
just past mid-on. Good length and outside off, looks to drag it across. Drops short of mid-on and he can only parry it to deep midwicket
full on off stump, front leg into the leg side and driven to mid-off
good length on middle stump, watchfully defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, well forward and defends down the pitch

has he got him? The sounds from around the infield indicate he has! Umpire sends it upstairs. Chahal diving low to the right in his follow through after beating Samson in flight. Soft signal is out. This is not too straightforward it is essentially the thumb, index and middle finger of Chahal's right hand that catch the ball. As he goes down, there is a chance the ball could be sticking out the webbing as he goes down. But there is no conclusive evdience says the third umpire. So that will remain out. It was a full ball on off stump, he wanted to drive through the covers and it pinged off the inside half. Massive, massive wicket and once again Rajasthan's middle order have a job to do
past the edge. A wicket maiden. Good length and outside off, with some climb. Looks to feel for that on the front foot and is done for pace
short of a good length and slanted into the corridor. Shuffles and is cramped. Defended towards midwicket
good length and nipping back in from outside off, 143kph. Shuffles and gets in line. Defended off the inside half
good length outside off, tentative forward push. Off the inside half and rolls towards the keeper
good length outside off, shuffles and defends to midwicket off the front foot

taken at first slip! But is that a bump ball? Soft signal is out. It was a yorker length ball outside off that Buttler was looking to drive, so there's a lot of jamming action happening which can complicate such calls. But that is off the outside edge and aerial before Buttler's inside edge hits the turf, so it is clean. Saini delivers immediately. Low catch to the right at first slip
beaten. Full and pushed across him, driving with the angle but the bat is inside the line this time

just picks off where he left. Whew. You get pure aesthetic value at the very least from this guy. This is today's exhibit. Full ball just outside off, half a stride out, all of the bat face offered and gently caressed wide of mid-off

chopped on! Short and wide outside off. Smith throws his hands at that with the weight seemingly on his front leg. Might have required a later cut, because this grips a touch and he's through the shot very early
back-of-the-hand slower ball, good length at middle stump. Flicks to deep square
pulled to the midwicket boundary this time. Good length at middle stump, sitting up once more and pulled into the turf off the front foot

wow, made that looks ridiculously simple. A slower ball, good length and sitting up at middle stump. 100kph. He was already on the front foot, so it takes even more effort to make up the strength for this whip over midwicket. He does it without fuss, just swipes across the line
good length and across middle stump. Brings out the reverse sweep but can't get too much bat on that. Trickles to backward point off the high part
good length at leg stump, flicked to square leg off the front foot
good length and turning into middle stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a good length, at middle and leg. Punched to long-on off the back foot
oh nicely done. Good length on leg stump, takes a step into the leg side but then comes back in line with the stumps and casually taps this on the head, swept past short fine
good length at middle, flicked to square leg
clipped past short fine. Good length and at his regular speed. Smith shuffles to open up the leg side - as he does - and this one is to that fielder's left
leading edge down the pitch. Second slower ball from Udana this over. That one was 99kph. Good length and at leg stump, he was looking to flick that
beats the inside edge. 128kph, short of a good length and coming back into the corridor. Smith was pushing on the back foot for the one angled across him
slower ball, good length and just outside off. Jumps into the line again but has to adjust. Dropped into the off side with hands
tickled past short fine. He's walking about already. Good length and angled across him from an off stump line. Jumps into the line and puts it away
outside edge doesn't carry to wide slip. Good length ball to start off, at an off stump line. Defends with soft hands, a tad inside the line

short_text: Abdul Samad to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: good length outside off, steps out and crunches it over the bowler's head
along the floor to long-on. Full on middle stump, attempted slog down to the fielder there with no danger

short_text: Abdul Samad to Sam Curran, 1 run
long_text: full and flat outside off, steps out and swings for it. It's off the thick inside edge to deep midwicket's right
front of the hand. Good length and outside off. He slices it, an attempted pull, and it's only a single at long-on

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: drills it straight through the bowler. Tossed up at off stump, helicoptered back at the bowler, who can barely react as this whistles between him and the stumps
tossed up at off stump, steps out but he can barely have a swing at this. It trickles to long-on's left and he comes back for the second

oh this is a disastrous start for SRH! It's not terrible bowling, to be honest. Slips a length ball down leg side as Dhoni steps out at him. Bairstow loses his footing as he looks to go for that down leg side and he misses it. And it dribbles past all the fielders
good length, slower ball on off stump. Mistimed slog dragged to long-on
slapped over the midwicket boundary! Slower short ball sitting nicely up for him and he has slaughtered that off the front foot! It's down to 29 off 7. Warner is disgusted with that last ball
slower short ball cutting across middle. Miscued pull lobbed into vacant midwicket
mistimed slog in front of long-on. Another cutter, at a good length and he can't get the slog away. Sliced over the bowler

oh that is a terrible misfield at deep midwicket. Samad, who might now have to carry that into the last over as a bowler! Slower length ball had been dragged to Samad's left. It was not menacing by any means, he just let it through after making the ground
yorker to start. And a good one at leg stump. No swinging room for Curran, who can only get it off the toe-end to deep midwicket
low full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to deep backward square

short_text: Natarajan to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: hooks his first ball into the first tier! WOW. Some talent to be able to hit that first up. Short ball in the corridor. He shuffles and walks straight into the line.That is quite a heave. 86 metres!

picks Samad out at deep backward square! Oh he watched that so closely into his hands. Short ball at middle stump, on the front foot to pull. Samad doesn't have to move a lot. Makes a strong base, brings out the reverse cup and holds on. Camera cuts to Muralitharan in the dugout mouthing "good catch" as he looks sheepishly at the people around him
swiped over the square leg boundary! For his fifty. Attempted yorker is a friendly full toss on the pads and he helps it over the boundary with the angle. His first ever T20 fifty
nails the yorker but they have two. In at leg stump, he managed to squeeze it between long-on and deep midwicket

dropped and helped along to the long-off boundary. Manish Pandey the man running back from mid-off. It was a yorker at middle, he was looking to slog that. Ended up slicing it. Pandey went back and to his right and lunged. Only managed to push it backwards in the end, wasn't easy

just about stopped at short third. Good length and just outside off, late cut between backward point and short third. Khaleel dives to his left and manages to stop with his body but he's grimacing and he's stayed on the floor, holding what looks like his right knee. Did he slip and end up seating that knee on the ball?
beats him. Slower ball, good and just outside off. Gets the front leg into the leg side and tries to chop towards third man
legcutter at a good length, cramping him as he backs into the leg side. He dabs it through square leg with soft hands and steals a second
three in three! This is overpitched and down leg side. Stays tall and allows it on, tickles it fine
past short fine. Short and at the hips from Bhuvi and that is pressure straight away on him. Boundaries off the first two balls. Easily swiped away
inside edge past Bairstow. Short and cramped him at the mid-riff. Looks for the pull and gets lucky

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, leans in and watchfully taps it back to the bowler

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, defended off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: can't stop this. Short and at leg stump, pulled firmly to Natarajan's left again, and this time he's not close to it

dropped short at middle stump, pulled firmly to deep backward square's left. Natarajan is scambling and sprinting and huffing to his left. And he has some fortune as this slams into his leg as he runs for it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, 1 leg bye
long_text: pinned him deep in the crease and the lbw appeal is turned down. Warner reluctantly reviews. Good length, middle and leg it appeared to pitch. Turning into Jadeja who is struck in front of leg stump trying to flick. Ball tracking has the pitching outside leg. The review is lost.
thick inside edge along the ground to deep square. Rashid tempts him, googly, full and slow outside off. Can't get the shot away

just short of short third man! Overspin because of the flight, Dhoni looking to cut as it gets steep on him. Thick edge loops in front of Natarajan who dives to his right and manages to parry it forwards

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, no run
long_text: good length outside off, sliding on again and once again he's looked to hit it too hard. Mistimed punch to extra cover

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, no run
long_text: inside edge onto his boot. Good length ball slides on straight outside off, looks to wallop this over midwicket, cops it on his back boot
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper

short_text: Abdul Samad to Jadeja, SIX runs
long_text: dragged over long-on. Full and outside off. Steps out and gets a little cramped, but manages to get the swing away. It's flat and to long-on's right

short_text: Abdul Samad to Jadeja, no run
long_text: beaten. Googly, slow and short and wide. Lifts over his cut
full and slanted in at middle and leg. Front foot into the leg side as he hammers this along the ground to long-on
yes he is, but gets an inside edge on the slog. Full slower ball, and perhaps that's what's done him. Through the attempted slog early, only a single off the boot in the off side
low full toss at middle, mistimed drive to long-on
good length, slower ball down leg side. Left alone
good length outside off, allows it to come on and slices it square off the front foot. To sweeper's right
clipped to the backward square boundary. Attempted yorker is a bit too full. A full toss at the leg in fact. Turns it away with the angle
nearly chops on. Short and just outside off, looks for the cut and it skids onto the under-edge
offcutter, back of a length and just outside off. Punched to extra cover
beaten on the hook. Short ball rising up at middle stump. Gets inside the line to pull it off but that's past him
short and just outside off, pulled firmly, lovely sound, but along the floor to deep square
short and just outside off, steps out and makes too much room. Beaten on the cut
short and just outside off, cut to third man's right
short and just outside off, cut to third man
good length and in at off stump, punched to extra cover's right
googly, short of a length and in at off stump. Punched to sweeper cover
full and quick at leg stump, flicked to deep backward square

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: bowled from well behind the crease. Slows is right down. Good length and in at off stump, punched to extra cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: googly, back of a length outside off, cut to point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: appeal for catch down leg side. Turned down. Good length ball pitching just outside leg and Jadeja can't get the flick away. Brushed the front pad

lovely work at sweeper by Garg. Good lengths slider outside off, half a squat and slapped past extra cover. It's sprinting away from Garg who has sprinted a long way himself before putting a big slide in
short and just outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover
good length outside off, miscued slog this time. Down to long-on
short of length and wide outside off, miscued back foot punch to long-off's right

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: smoked past his left hand! Samad almost taking evasive action. Tossed up full outside off, stride down and bludgeoned at hip height. Just as well he didn't get a hand on that. Long-off can't get near it
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: good length at off, big lunge forward to defend to extra cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: good length and turning away from leg stump. Dhoni wants to flick but that's back down the pitch off the leading edge
googly, back of a good length and going away outside off. Punched to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, quickly forward to defend down the pitch

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: slider, good length and at the stumps. Backs away and hurriedly pushes into the covers

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run
long_text: good length and a googly across off stump. Backs away and pushes into the covers

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, backs away for the cut but that skids on and catches the under-edge

short_text: Abdul Samad to Dhoni, no run
long_text: dropped short outside off, cut firmly to extra cover's left but Warner's all over that
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper

short_text: Abdul Samad to Jadeja, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, defended off the back foot

he's got a wicket at extra cover! Sharp catch from Warner. Good length ball, lobbed up slowly and wide outside off. Not a lot of turn, but there's dip and overspin and Jadhav is not on top of this attempted drive. It's to Warner's left at face height and he shows good reactions
short of a good length at off stump, onto the back foot and pulls to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, deep in the crease and watchfully defended

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: good length at middle, pushed to midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: inside edge as it's a googly on a good length outside off this time. This time, there is gap between bat and pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: rapidly past the outside edge! Genius bowling. This is the exact line and length - and even the release - from which he bowled that googly to Dhoni earlier. Jadha covers for that and loses the outside edge battle
good length, googly and in at middle. Onto the back foot to punch to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: inside edge onto pad. Googly, at a length outside off. Big gap as he has a stab at this away from the body
good length at middle stump, onto the back foot and turns it into midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked through square leg off the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot with the turn
good length at middle stump, onto the back foot and punched to long-on
good length, slow and at middle. 78kph. Steps out and flicks to midwicket
good length at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket

the bails are off at the striker's end, Faf appears to be short.Oh boy this is going to be controversial, I can already tell. Bairstow is sprinting towards the stumps as midwicket's throw comes in on the bounce. He uses his momentum to push it on the half volley towards the stumps. The ball hits the stumps, BUT, so does Bairstow. Seemingly at the same time. But that is the side angle. From front on, the umpire is convinced it's the ball that hits the stumps when Faf is short. So that is out. It was a full ball flicked to midwicket's right, his throw was halfway between looking for the direct hit and lobbing it to the keeper - just ended up a feeble lob. But it has worked and it is the man who had just gotten going. He was struggling to make that run, possibly a result of the knock he took last over

short_text: Natarajan to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length at leg stump, looks to flick, cops in on the pad

short_text: Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: adjusts, improvises, and finds the same spot again. Short ball this time, and slower, and wider. Faf is down the pitch again and this time he has to reach out more and then uses the horizontal bat to drag it over the umpire again

short_text: Natarajan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: oh lovely! Good length at middle stump, pushed across him again. But Faf negates the angle entirely by running down at him and then lifting this cleanly on the up, straight and over the umpire
good length on middle stump, flicked to square leg's right

knocks the top of off! Rayudu playing down the wrong line. Need to watch this closely, because he's very far away from this. Surprisingly far away. Slow-mos show it was just a good length ball, nice upright seam, aimed to go across him. No  movement on that, but for some reason Rayudu is down leg, bringing the bat down angled towards midwicket and playing outside leg stump

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: misses the full toss at his leg and might have copped that on his right knee. Just above it, yes. That'll sting. Lost his shape trying to slog that inswinger
swings past leg stump as Faf sets up for another ramp This is an attempted yorker, but it's just a little too far down leg

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: neatly ramped fine. Again, the length is predictable. Also helps this is a slower ball, short of a good length outside off. He's set up, he waits, and he executes well

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: just short of third man this time and oncethe body again, good work from the fielder to get the body behind it. Slower ball at a length outside off, thick outside edge on the slash

just short of Rashid who has done exceptionally not to let this bounce past him. Short ball, half-hearted pull pings off the top edge. Rashid sprints to his right, then slides on his hips and uses both his hands to swat this in front of himself on the half-volley

waits in the crease this time and pulls over midwicket off the high part of the bat. Garg gives chase and dives to pull it back in. Deep square ran a long way to his left to accompany him and was there to throw it back in

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: punched past mid-off. Khaleel is , more often than not, going to bowl a short, hard length. Faf steps out in anticipation of that and uses the angled bat to hammer this on the up to the fielder's left
low full toss at leg stump, leans in and clips it well in front of the deep square fielder

short_text: Natarajan to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
long_text: big appeal for lbw and the bowler's possibly more interested than usual because Faf had set up on an off stump line attempting this flick. But this has pitched outside leg
short of third man. Short and steep delivery at middle stump. He steps out and has a hoick from under it. Was looking to go over mid-on, ended up slicing it
full at middle stump, 136kph, shuffles and drives to mid-on
short at middle and leg, steps out and looks to swipe to fine leg but cops that on the thigh guard
good length and tight at the body. Defended into the off side
short and moving away from him outside off, cuts off the thick outside edge to third man
short and wide outside off, cut to cover
good length and nipping away outside off, shuffles and uses the pace to guide that to third man

chops it on! Not a moment this innings when Watson was in control. This is the widest of the deliveries Bhuvneshwar's bowled to him. But it is still an incoming ball. He's in a half squat trying to cut it. Inside edge and that's all tonight from Watson
inside edge onto back leg. Another inswinger aimed for the top of off stump. Wants to slash behind point on the front foot
short of a good length, aimed for the top of off. Tapped into the covers

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short and into the mid-riff as he looks to pull this incoming ball
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
good length and swung in at off stump. Hurriedly dropped into the off side with soft hands
short and just outside off. Walks into the line and shovels it out to deep square

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, clipped to midwicket with the swing

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full and tailing in at middle stump. Drives from in front of his pad, off the inside half to mid-on

short_text: Ahmed to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and swung in at leg stump, 136.9kph, flicked to square leg
narrowly saved from being bowled by the inside edge. Looks to drive on the up with a massive bat-pad gap against this inswinger
big lbw appeal as Watson is trapped on the front foot looking to defend. Might have been going down leg, this inswinger. They don't think of the review. He was struck in front of middle and leg
short of a good length and swung into his hips. On his toes to clip this to fine leg

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: big inswinger but Faf is up to it. Good length and headed for the top of off. Not too much feet from Faf but defends solidly

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and curving away outside off. Punched to extra cover off the back foot

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length ad wide outside off, left alone
through to Dhoni, possibly rolling off the outside edge. Another knuckle ball it appears. Full and wide and couldn't connect on the drive
lovely yorker again. Just not giving him anything. Wide outside off, chopped to deep point

poor fielding. Yorker outside off, another big swing at it, it trickles into the covers. Bravo at extra cover, who is closest to it, has not moved for it at all. Rayudu has to come across all the way from backward point and they pinch a second
miscued loft to long-off's left. Slower full toss wide outside off, a knuckle ball. Shuffled, got on a knee and swung hard for it. But that seems to be making him lose balance

short_text: Thakur to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: yorker outside off, difficult to get that way. A big swing of the bat, lovely bat speed and all, but it can only go as far as extra cover
sliced into the backward point region. Slower ball wide outside off, got too far under that

can't clear extra cover. Good length ball, wide outside off. Slapped on the up and Bravo holds on with a reverse cup. But the third umpire has spotted Thakur overstepping. Garg's night is not done yet

low full toss on off stump, walks across his stumps and flicks to deep midwicket's right to bring up his fifty. Points the bat sharply at the dugout and then frustratedly whacks his front pad. It's a day of confusing emotional reactions from SRH batsmen! It's managed to get chuckles out of Laxman and Warner
full and wide outside off, too far away from him. Looks like an attempted helicoper shot. Ends up a drive at extra cover
yorker outside off, has a big slog at that. It's off the inside half of the bat to deep midwicket's right. The poor timing allows a second on the big side
full and just outside off, driven along the floor to extra cover
full outside off, sliced to deep backward point's left and takes on his arm to complete two
whipped over backward square. The line is going to be off stump given there are two square fielders in the circle on the leg side. Garg anticipates that, gets on one knee and slaps from underneath

caught behind. Well, it's one out of three for CSK in the over. It ends Sharma's innings - the one that injected pace into the middle overs for them. It's a slower short ball, he looks for the pull, gets an edge behind and Chahar is beaming ironically as he finally gets one
slower short ball outside off, chopped to backward point's left

gets it fine. Slower short ball has beaten him for lack of pace, but he's used his wrists to adjust and make sure his attempted pull isn't in front of square. Might not have been precisely looking to get it over short fine, but for his efforts, he is rewarded with the ball floating over Watson there
full and at the stumps and he clips this to to deep square's right
slower short ball down leg side, beaten on the pull

dropped at sweeper cover this time! Good length outside off, opens the face, wants to go over extra cover. Ends up slicing it high. Thakur is already under it as he starts. Gets it in his grasp too but it pops out

Jadeja drops it at deep midwicket. Sharma seems to be beaten by the length of that leg-side boundary but he survives. Slower short ball outside off, hoicks it Jadeja's left. He makes his ground, to his left, and seems to have taken his eyes off it late. Trickles into the boundary behind him

short_text: Sam Curran to Garg, no run
long_text: beaten but there was a chance to get more runs. Overpitched outside off again and he couldn't get bat on the chop this time

short_text: Sam Curran to Garg, FOUR runs
long_text: expertly done. Slower cutter at a length, outside off. Allows it to slide on and opens the face to get this between backward point and short third

short_text: Sam Curran to Garg, SIX runs
long_text: whipped over the deep midwicket boundary! Overpitched ball at middle stump, and once again he's just deep in the crease and waiting for the full one. Gets low and flicks quickly at this and gets it to the fielder's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Garg, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: full toss above the waist and sliced past point.  Wide outside off and he adjusts nicely to carve this

short_text: Sam Curran to Garg, FOUR runs
long_text: well placed. This is low-risk, high reward. Full ball at off stump, he stays low and watches it on, right under his eyes. And then opens the face late to beat backward point to the right

another overthrow at long-on. Offcuttter outside off, sliced to backward point. Thakur has a throw for the non-striker's stumps. Long-on on would have backed that up, to be fair. Curran got a hand on it though, a half-stop, and that's what gives them the extra run
good length, offcutter just outside off. Gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket's left

gorgeous. That is a good looking pull. Short ball outside off, a nice swivel of the upper body as he uses the pace and drags this to the backward square boundary with a short swing. Brilliant connection
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover

short outside off, opens the face to slice to third man.  Draws the throw to the non-striker's end where it might have been close if Thakur was behind the stumps. He has to try and relay it instead as Sharma dives. The result is an extra run at long-on
full on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length outside off, shuffles and drives to long-on
good length and very wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover
oh clean. Overpitched outside off and he's got good batspeed under this lofted drive. Flat and to mid-off's left with disdain
full slower ball outside off, leans in and flicks to long-on
full ball at leg stump, steps out and slices to sweeper's right
slower bouncer, down leg side. Beaten on the attempted hook
full slower ball at leg stump, flicked to long leg
slower ball, full toss on leg stump at 105kph. Waits on it and flicks to midwicket
good length offbreak at off stump, defended to point
short and just outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
short of a good length just outside off, punched to long-on
pumped over midwcket! Jadeja punished again for dropping it short. Sitting up outside off and this is a lovely connection on the front-foot pull
reverse-swat to the point boundary. Short of a good length outside off, sitting up nicely and he nails the connection on it
appeal for lbw turned down as he steps out at this length ball and has a slog. Cops it high on the front leg
good length just outside off, whipped to deep midwicket
googly, good length at middle. Defended on the front foot
googly, good length on off stump. Defended off the back foot
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper
googly, full on off stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, driven to extra cover. Who has a shy at the non-striker's and would have caught Garg well outside the crease. Where was he going?! Curran with the throw
googly full and down leg side, takes it on with a sweep and gets it past short fine
good length at off, punched to long-on
good length at off, tapped down the pitch
good length at off, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
good length at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
good length on the stumps, pushed off the front foot
good length at off, pushed through cover

they've got Kane next ball! This is a gift. This is a sight - an angry Williamson. No way to tell why from here, but what we can argue pretty confidently is that there wasn't a run to Rayudu's right here at midwicket. Did Garg call for it and then change his mind? Can't think of another reason for this anger. It was a good length ball flicked to mdiwicket's right. Williamson was halfway down, and went back. The throw was wide but there was so much time that Dhoni could flick it onto the stumps and still catch Williamson a few yards short

are we even surprised anymore with this guy? Faf du Plessis with yet another perfectly timed jump at the boundary to help his team out. Good length ball at middle stump, steps out and looks to drag this over long-on. Faf waits, jumps, lands and then is on the verge of losing his balance. So, once again, he lobs it up inside play and comes back for it. Calm as ever
good length on middle stump, brings out the conventional sweep this time. Flat and to deep midwicket's left
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
a switched late-cut. Short of a length at leg stump. Flips around and changes his grip to right-handed, but there's no room with this googly. A late cut to short fine
good length and sliding on at middle stump, backs away and punches to extra cover
half an appeal for lbw as he nails a yorker at off stump. Kane got the front leg across as he jammed this into the off side. Might have been and then toe
good length and just outside off, driven on the rise to backward point
full slower ball at middle stump, whipped down to long-on
short at middle stump, flicked to long leg
good bouncer. Just under his left eye and he gets the head into the off side to let that go
full toss and a dipping slower ball outside off. Driven to sweeper cover
dropped short on middle stump, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
good length outside off, punched to sweeper with the turn
good length at leg stump, watchfully pushed into the midwicket region
google, short and across the corridor. Backs away and cuts to cover
past short third man. You just know Warner's going to reverse sweep as early as possible. First ball on this occasion. Fetches it from middle stump and it's quickly past Watson
short of a good length and gripping outside off. Turns away too but there's enough time to tuck this into vacant midwicket
thick edge down to third man. There was a gully, but this is wide of him. Good length ball moving away off the seam as he drives away from the body
good length just outside off, leans in for the forward defence but then wants to open the face and run it towards third man. Gently rolls out to backward point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
briefly in the air but that's past Watson's lunge to the left at extra cover. And it is a lovelry, flowing drive. Full ball outside off, got his weight into that
full and just outside off, nicely forward to drive to extra cover

drives it straight to mid-off! Good length and a lot of room outside off. Sets up to drill this on the rise. Was probably looking to go wider, towards the extra cover direction. But it's come off the inside half and a simple catch for Curran
good length and just outside off, pushed towards mid-off on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and down leg side, beaten on the flick
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a good length outside off, slashed to sweeper cover on the up
full at leg stump, driven down to long-on
good length and slanted in at middle stump. Backs away and pokes into the covers
overpitched at middle stump, steps the front foot into the leg side and looks to punch this past mid-on. Doesn't get it off the middle. The fielder dives to his left and parries it behind mid-off
full on the pads, tucked to midwicket's left off the front foot
punched past Pandey's face at the other end. Full and just outside off, sets up nicely, full face of the bat, and no intent to keep it down
full at off stump, driven off the front foot to mid-off
good length at leg stump, shoveled to deep square's right off the back foot
full and just outside off, mistimed drive down the pitch
bouncer just past his front shoulder. He was camping on the front foot and this hook is an afterthought, the ball's well past him
full and coming in at middle, punched to mid-on
good length on off stump, punched to mid-off on the rise
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's right and Thakur has Warner scrambling. Can't get the direct hit at the striker's end
swished over mid-on. Dropped a touch short outside off, he moves his weight onto the back leg and chips this over the fielder with a short-arm pull
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
short of a good length on off stump, pulled along the floor to deep square
good length and just outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull

short_text: Sam Curran to Warner, no run
long_text: inside edge as he falls over driving to drive this full ball from off stump. Was looking to go mid-on, caught that on the pad
good length at the hips, whipped to deep square

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: drills it over the bowler. Pandey with a taste for the straight drives today. Third one. This is a full slower ball just outside off and the front leg is away once again to allow swinging room. Bat turns in the hand a little but, again, all he needed to do was clear the infield
good length and swung away in the corridor, chopped to backward point's left
short and just outside off, pulled to midwicket off the inside half
good length and cramping him at middle stump line. Wants to push into the off side but he's forced to defend down the pitch
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
good length and in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, dropped into the covers. An overthrow the result of a shy at the non-striker's stumps. They weren't looking for a run

oh good shape on this, both batsman and bowler. Full outswinger just outside off. He's got the head right above the line of the ball, check-driving from under his eyes. No flourish, because it's a swinging ball. Offers the full face and it's between bowler and mid-off
good length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, no run
long_text: full slower ball outside off, jabs it into the off side. Was beaten by lack of pace on the drive

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: lofted over mid-off. Full inswinger in the corridor, not much of a stride, which is a decent way to create room against incoming balls. Not neatly out of the middle but he just needed to get that over Chawla

short_text: Sam Curran to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
good length and swung away in the corridor, opens the face and pushes into the off side
chops into the turf as Chahar brings another one in off a good length. He was looking to cut but there was no room
another big inswinger and Pandey had no idea how to deal with that, because he can barely get the bat down too. Luckily for him it's started middle and gone further down
outside edge past slip and into the boundary. Full and swinging away in the corridor. Looks to drive through cover first up but survives

bowled him comprehensively! Bairstow completely outsmarted. Full inswinger starting from just outside off, upright seam brings it back in viciously and the batsman is not prepared for it. The bat swing is outside off, for the initial line, and he can't even get it close to the ball which thuds the front pad before splitting the stumps
full and swinging away in the corridor. Mistimed drive with half a stride, can't get it past extra cover
good length and shaped away from off stump. Drops it into the off side with soft hands
good length and curving into the corridor. Stays leg side of that and opens the face to run this into vacant point
Sahmi keeps this last yorker out to end this game
yorker, just outside off, squeezes under the bat and misses the off stump
looks for the ramp over short fine this time as Bumrah pitches it up. Off the inside half of the bat it goes, past short fine
smartly played. Bumrah bowls the short ball to cramp him up. However, this is the slower ball, giving him the time to adjust, and he ramps it over short third
full and straight, hit to extra cover
no fast bowlers' pact here. Short, into the ribs, hits the handle of the bat
oh just clears the long-off. Gets too far under this hit, sends it miles into the air, but gets enough distance on it to clear Pollard at long-off. Consolation six
wide slower ball, Gowtham throws his bat at it, gets a thick edge over short third for four
yorker, just outside leg, dug out for one, but the fielding from Boult is sensational. He gets to the ball quick, and flicks an underarm throw acrobatically
another one bites the dust. Full, straight, Bishnoi makes room, gets a thick outside edge, Yadav takes a simple catch at point
quicker, fuller, just outside off, hit to long-off for one
slower length ball, just outside off, beats his slog

short_text: Pattinson to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: quick, full, just outside off, beats him as he looks to go inside-out

short_text: Pattinson to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: quick bouncer, following him, Bishnoi sways out of the line
slower shortish ball, hit down to long-on for one
makes room, Pattinson stays full and straight, the mis-hit carries to a full-length diving Yadav at point but this is a really really difficult chance

short_text: Pattinson to Ravi Bishnoi, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, Surya Yadav makes another diving save at point

yorker, given lbw, but he reviews it. It seems he might have hit it, but this has swung as it goes past the bat, and hits him on the toe in front of the stumps. Plumb as. Was that reverse? It went really late
full ball, just outside off, drilled wide of sweeper cover for two
on a length, angling in, cramps him up. Hit back to Boult
looks for the ramp, sees the short ball, keeps his stance and looks to pull. Is done in by the slower delivery, and is hit on the helmet
yorker outside off, dug out for a single to extra cover
yorker outside off, dug out for one
shot of the night even though the game is dead. Sarfaraz plays the reverse pull to hit this length ball over short third after switching his stance

full toss, on off, gets big on him, for a catch at point. They will check the height of the full toss, though. Has dipped just enough in the nick of time. So it is a fair delivery, and another wicket goes down
Bumrah has that fine leg fine as we mentioned earlier in the over. Bumrah knows the ramp is in play if he spears them in from wide on the crease. Except that it gets Sarfaraz only one run
wide on the crease again, punched with an open face, and Surya Yadav goes flying at point to save four runs
swipes a wide length ball across the line to deep midwicket for one
angling in from wide on the crease, hits the pad, and accordingly for that angle, his fine leg is fine to prevent the boundary off the tickle
wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, hits him high on the bat
worked into a hole on the leg side for a couple
angular run this time, and he keeps bowling the slow legbreaks. Maxwell plays the desperate slog, but this ball is not full enough for the shot. Deep midwicket takes the catch
straight run this time, and he bowls a really slow legbreak, beating the Maxwell switch hit for the pace
he makes that angular run he does at death these days, and bowls a straight legbreak. Worked around the corner for one
looks to pull, gets a bottom edge to deep square leg
quick legbreak, outside off, defended back to him because of the turn
yorker planned, yorker executed. Just the single off. Good way to close out an excellent over
bouncer, Neesham goes back to pull it down. Gets a single
full and straight, flicked away in the air, gets two to deep midwicket
that has gone like an offcutter. This is not a slower ball. Clocked at 135ks. Short of a length, outside leg, then squares him up with the away movement and beats him
on-pace this time. Seam-up, full, just outside off, and there has been some movement available today if you land it on the seam. This one deviates enough to take the edge. That is a huge wicket
gets away with one. Seems like an offcutter from Pattinson. Pooran sees one in the slot, looking to go voer long-off. The thick outside edge lands short of sweeper cover
excellent comeback over. Bowls a low wide full toss, it straight to cover-point. Pandya has done his job
lovely wide yorker. On top of that blue tram line. Maxwell leaves it alone. Not called a wide
again bowls that length to deny him an aerial hit. Right at his heel. Dug out for a single to deep midwicket. Hardik Pandya does well to deny them the second
on a length, no pace to work with, pushed towards long-off for one
on off, really full, doesn't let him get under it. Dug out for one. Good bowling
oh he goes for the surprise full straight ball. Driven wide of long-on for two
yorker, on the pads, dug out for one. So despite that boundary, just the seven off
angling in, he shuffles across to work this to leg for one
on a length, outside off, crunches sweetly, but straight to extra cover
short of a length, pitches outside leg, angles towards off, runs this down to third man
lovely shot. Doesn't matter if you are Bumrah. If you bowl short at not high pace, Pooran is going to hurt you. Pulls this over midwicket for a four
on a length, no room, pushed back towards him
looks for the sweep, Chahar does well to slow it down and beat him in the air, but he gets a bottom edge on the sweep, which fetches him three runs
short and wide again, cut away past the diving man at point
Pooran is on fire here. Picks the length early to rock back and pull this shortish delivery over wide long-on for six more
shuffles across to slog this to deep midwicket
again the slow wide legbreak just like Chahal bowls to Maxwell. He tries to skip down the track, but gets an outside edge over slip

big appeal for lbw as he beats him on the sweep. Not given, but MI review. If it is the legbreak, has it straightened enough? No it is the wrong'un. Is it full enough to be pitching within the stumps and hitting them too? I suspect this is pitched outside leg. And it is pitched well outside leg. Good decision by the on-field umpire: he picked the googly and decided it had to be pitching outside if it was hitting the stumps
short of a length, some width, punched to deep point for one
short of a length, straight, pushed down towards long-on
short of a length, wicket to wicket, played with soft hands for a single towards point
same length but gives him the width to throw his arms at. Goes flying over point
seam movement?. On a length, middle and leg, lands on seam, moves away, beats him
short of a length, quick, draws an inside edge for one
flatter, into the pads, worked to leg for one
Chahar is bowling like Chahal to Maxwell: slow wide legbreaks. He beats him again
lovely slow legbreak again, and beats Maxwell again. This isn't a wide either
short of a length, outside off, no turn, cut away for one
short of a length, just outside off, punched to long-off for one
really slow, wide legbreak. Maxwell is beaten, but it is called wide
top of leg stump. Rahul is looking for the lap sweep, but the Chahar legbreak doesn't turn as he expects it to. That means he misses it, and the leg stump is left exposed. Chahar takes it
on a length, no room, worked to leg for one
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover
moves across early, Pandya fires one in, looking for the yorker, Pooran gets an outside edge and the pace on the ball does the job of beating short third
and now he gets one in the slot. On a length, just outside off, turning in, and he has slog-swept this to Dubai, it would appear. Lands on the grass banks
moves across this time, Pandya goes wider, and has been called for it
wide length ball as Pooran stands his ground this time. Called wide this time
flatter, quicker, fuller, straighter. Pushed back to him
stays away from his reach but gets inside the tram line. Beats him on the cut
wide length ball, too wide
wrong'un, goes back to cut this to deep point for one
nice legbreak, dipping, on a length, just outside of,f turning back in, beating him but turning too far down for the lbw
short of a length, stays low, pulled to wide long-on for one
looks for the paddle sweep, doesn't get the full length, but goes ahead with it and takes a single
some turn from short of a length, worked to leg
on a length, straight, pushed back to him
full, straight, driven to long-on
on a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

bowled'im. This plan of left-arm spin in the Powerplay has worked. He has given them nothing so far. Nair looking to manufacture a late cut, but Pandya stays on a length and draws the bottom edge into the stumps
quick, into the pads, worked to short fine leg
short of a length, off the bottom edge, single to point
down the wicket with no intent to hit a six. Pushes this back to him
wide length ball, pushed to point

BOOM BOOM. You could just see that business had picked up this over. This is lovely bowling. After troubling him last two balls, he bowls a full ball just outside off with a Shami-like seam position. And he draws seam movement to rush through the gate
short of a length, no room, played to point
short of a length, holds its line, hits him high on the pad
full, into the pads, worked away to long leg
beats him for pace first up, hits the pad, but is headed down leg
on a length, straight, punched down the ground
full toss, hit to mid-on for a quick single
short of a length, straight, punched to deep midwicket
slow, on a length, slight turn, inside edge onto the pad
flat, into the body, pulled to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to the extra cover placed straight
opens the face for a single
short of a length, outside off, this time he manages to place this well square of deep point. Also the fielder had moved in front of square a little
wide length ball, driven to deep point for one
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, straight to extra cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
lovely timing. On a length, angling away, just a push, gets a couple in front of deep point
on a length, angling in, uses soft hands to play it in front of deep square for a couple
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, down the leg side, wide
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off
on a length, angling in, worked to square leg
tucked away off the hip, square of long leg
Agarwal in scintillating form. Makes room to cut this perfctly okay delivery - short of a length, at the stumps - over cover for four

that's a better bouncer. Right at his badge, and quicker too, draws the mis-hit, but Krunal Pandya has misjudged the catch at long leg. Can't even get a hand to it. Charges in and the runs to his left
runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, on the pads, clipped away in front of long leg
on a length, slight swing, defended back to him
short ball, 136ks, good height, but Agarwal is in excellent form and has smacked this clean over forward square leg for four
some swing first up, but down the leg side and clipped away for one

that is four sixes in the over. Kings XI have been demolished here. Gowtham is a man running up to accept his punishment. Bowls in the slot again, and Pollard gives him the punishment. Another straight six
and one more. This is like stealing candy. Length-ball, in the slot, in front of the stumps, and he has just extended his arms for a six over long-on
he looks to go wide of Pollard's reach, but how do you get too wide for Pollard. The long arms catch up with the ball and smash this for a straight flat six over long-off
oh holy molly, he has missed out on this one. Sets up strong base, gets a full toss, but the bat swings a touch too early, and he gets a leading edge to long-on
now Gowtham looks to cramp Pandya up by following him, but ends up bowling in his slot. Over wide long-on for another big six
he gets away with the first one: a yorker outside off
yorker gone wrong. Full toss on the pads, and flicked away nonchalantly for four through square leg. Nineteen off that over
slower bouncer. Sits up. Hooked square of deep midwicket for four more. Mumbai have turned this around
