oh that is really unfortunate. Full and fast, just outside off, slight movement away draws the outside edge, but that goes for four to third man
slower ball outside off, out of his reach, but called wide
back to yorker, smashed to long-on for one
short and wide, extra bounce, some movement away, but when you throw the bat as hard as Pandya foes, the edge is likely to clear the field. over short third this goes
yorker, straight, dug out for a single
Pollard makes room, he follows him, ends up with a high foll toss that is hit to deep midwicket for one
goes for the yorker, ends up with a low full toss, drilled to long-on for one

oh that is some hitting. Another good ball. Wide and short of a length, and off pace, but he has hit it down the ground with such power that long-off can't get around even though he has only a little distance to move

Neesham has not bowled one bad ball so far but has been taken for 12 off three balls. Pandya is moving across to set up a strong base to hit. He goes wide and short of a length, but he punches him over extra cover for four
slower legcutter this time, hit over the infield on the off side for two

this is excellent hitting. Pandya is some T20 batsman. He has just come in. This is a very good legcutter, back of a length, no room. Pandya is cramped, but somehow he funds enough power with his matchstick arms to go over long-on. Into the wind, mind

lovely yorker. Seems plumb but Pollard has reviewed it immediately. Must have hit it then. And he is right. He has got an inside edge onto his toe. Otherwise, he has gone for all money after having shuffled right in front of his stumps
draws another mis-hit. With a wide length ball this time. Slices off the outer half of his bat for a couple in front of deep cover
slower ball gone wrong. Wide down the leg side
short of a length, wide, concedes a single to deep cover
and this time he is tight on the stumps with a short-of-a-length delivery. Concedes just the single
short of a length, wide, 139ks, slight movement away, punched straight to point

relay catch first up. Shami has bowled a dangerous ball first up. Seam-up, on-pace, in the slot, but Sharma gets more air than lemgth on it. Maxwell runs to his right from long-off, is very close to the rope when he fumbles the catch, bit still holds on, recovers well and lobs it back in before going over. Neesham, the man at long-on, has done well to come backing up for the relay catch
full, into the pads, slogged to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: oh he is picking his spots, which you can do against Neesham's pace. He knows the deep cover has just come in to give him a long-off so he makes room and lofts this full ball over cover. Another yorker gone wrong, it seems

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: he goes into the pitch but bowls seam-up and one pace. Sharma loves these 130ks short balls. Pulled over square leg for six more

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: another yorker gone wrong. Low full toss, and he drives it between mid-off and extra cover. He bowled so well when bowling cutters into the pitch, but yorkers are not working. Because he us missing them

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: Sharma shows him the shuffle across, and Neesham attempts his first yorker of the innings. It goes wrong, and he ramps him fine of long leg for four. That is fifty for Sharma too
slower short ball, at him, helped to long leg for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slower, tossed up, pushed to short cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: short part of the field, and Sharma has picked his spot well. Shouts of catch it as he pulls one that is not short enough, but he has got enough on it to clear deep midwicket
again flat and short. Cut away to deep point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pollard, no run
long_text: short of a length, wicket to wicket, punched to short midwicket
he goes shorter, Pollard punches this in front of deep cover, and comes back for two

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pollard, SIX runs
long_text: oh the legspin slayer is here. Decent legbreak, on a length, outside off, and he has just lobbed it back over his head for a big six. That reach turns a good length ball into a half-volley
flat, smeared into the pads, punched past the diving short midwicket
down the wicket, not close to the pitch of the ball, pushed to long-on
stays short of the driving length again. Pushed down to long-on for one
on a length, around off, pushed to short midwicket
on a length, flat, pushed to long-on for one

Kishan has no choice but to slog-sweep the moment he sees a ball thrown up. However, the length is too full, which doesn't allow him the elevation. And he ends up drilling this straight to deep midwicket
on a length, on off, run down to point for one
short of a length, following him as he backs away, on-pace, and beats him on the bottom edge
nearly produces the wicket. Sees him back away, slips in a wide slower ball, draws the slice, but it falls between cover-point and the boundary rider

short_text: Cottrell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: looks to pull a ball that is not short enough, and it skids on to hit his pad. The pressure has to be building up

short_text: Cottrell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: length-ball offcutter, pushed to mid-off. No single. Off the toe end
short of a length, he throws his bat at it, gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, 130ks, punched to deep cover for another single. Another excellent over from Neesham
slower legcutter, 110ks, kicks at him. Rohit throws his head back and runs this to third man for one
looks for the short legcutter, but ends up slipping it down leg
short of a length, 131ks, outside off, punched to deep point

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: beaten on the inside edge. Leg-bye

another catch goes down. This short ball goes big on Kishan as he looks to pull. Ends up top-edging towards midwicket. Bishnoi runs in, makes all the ground, gets under the ball, but can't hold on to it
length ball, into the pads, played along the ground to long leg
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, but ends up putting it in a hole on the leg side for a couple

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: looks like the googly, Sharma stays back to punch it to wide long-on
punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan, no run
long_text: goes wider with the googly, draws the toe end of the bat, and fields well off his own bowling

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan, SIX runs
long_text: Kishan is waiting for this wrong'un, and this is in his arc too. He slogs it over the big boundary at cow corner. Will you believe it? This is the first six of the night

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: flighted legbreak, pushed straight of extra cover for one
pushed down to long-on to end a cheap over for Gowtham

short_text: Gowtham to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: looks for the back cut, but finds the fielder at point. Ginger in getting back to the crease, and we go to the third umpire. He has made it, but there is something odd about the way he does it. His foot seems jammed so he extends the arm to get in just in time
flatter, shorter, punched to long-on for one
down the wicket, Gowtham pulls back the length, drawing a defensive shot
bunted into the leg side looking for two, but Kishan slips on the turn

missed run-out. Hit to the left of Gowtham and Sharma calls him through. Gowtham is caught in an awkward position where he has to run around so he gets in a feeble backhand flick allowing Kishan to get back

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: tries the legbreak for a change, ends up bowling it short and also giving him width. Sharma rocks back to late-cut it between point and short third
flatter googly, punched down to long-off now for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan, no run
long_text: another googly. Nice, slow and dipping. The point fielder is nice and tight to deny him this single

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan, no run
long_text: wrong'un, starts around middle and off, played with an open face, but straight to the fielder at point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: short of a length again, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, angling away, punched to deep cover
again off the inside half, whipped to deep midwicket for one
another shot that is hit off the inside half of the bat. Every time Kishan has looked to hit pace down the ground, he has been hit on the inside half of the bat
short of a length, pulled to deep forward square leg for one

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slight movement back in from just outside off. Enough to cramp him up. A valuable dot as he plays this straight to cover-point
looks for the pick-up shot off a length on the pads, but is beaten. The ball goes hardly anywhere off the pad, but Sharma calls him through for a single
short of a length, outside off, he runs it down to third man for one
wide length ball, steered to third man for one

short_text: Neesham to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: the first one takes the edge. An on-pace legcutter, short of a length, moves away, squares Sharma up, but the edge is too thick for Rahul to catch
off the inside half of the bat again, and this time he gets a single to mid-on. The throw hits Kishan on the calf
Kishan walks down to create a length, but Neesham sticks to his guns and bowls back of a length. Defended to cover
another slower offcutter, turns away off short of a length and beats him
slower ball first up, full outside off, hit to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
Gowatham has had a testing first over. Bowls flat, outside off, Sharma punches this beautifully, but this time Pooran gets a hand to it with a dive at extra cover. Saves two runs
offbreak, drifting in, no turn, worked to leg
slower, flighted, worked into the leg side for one

short_text: Gowtham to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: he knows what is coming next: a flatter shorter delivery, so he goes back early and cuts this in front of point. All touch

short_text: Gowtham to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Backs away early, and even though Gowtham follows him with an offbreak, he punches with an open face between mid-off and extra cover

short_text: Gowtham to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: flat offbreak outside off. Doesn't turn. Beats him on the outside edge
bouncer, just outside off, he ducks it
full, just outside off, slices this over the infield. No power behind the shot as this runs off the outer half of the bat, but it manages to clear the infield
on a length, slight seam back in, or he possibly ran his fingers on it. Bowled at 135ks, so seems more like seam. Kishan has to defend
on a length, on off, angling away, runs off the face for a single
quick bouncer. Kishan, ducking for cover, manages to pull it and keep it down. Gets a single to long leg
wide down the leg side
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
not sure if this is a googly because it is so full it has no time to turn. Pushed straight of mid-off for a single

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, OUT
long_text: slows this down, bowls full on the pads, he sweeps it fine, calls for a single, and Surya looks like he has been run out. And he is gone. Shami is feeling his shoulder but his throw from short fine leg has done the job, catching Yadav short of his ground with a direct hit. It is Yadav's call, he has had an early start, no stutter. So he has underestimated Shami here

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short slider, Sharma thinks he can hit a six, but this skids through like a flipper would, gets a bottom edge

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fuller, straighter, defended back to Bishnoi
legbreak, outside off, on a length, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: slows this down, full, on off, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide
long_text: wide down the leg side as he fires this one in
full, just outside off, slight movement away, resulting in a check drive to short cover
better than the last one because this is not a half-volley. He stands tall, and plays the push-drive on the up, placing it between mid-off and extra cover again
pitched too full. Looking for swing. Ends up bowling a half-volley outside off. Driven between mid-off and extra cover. All along the ground
this one goes the other way. Might have been seam as this shapes to swing back in, but pitches and keep going with the angle. Hit uppishly to cover-point
full, swinging in, played with soft hands, dropped into the covers for a single
just outside off, not enough swing, pushed wide of mid-off for one

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: lovely seam bowling. Given out lbw but my initial reaction is heading down leg. Rohit reviews. On a length, on off, Rohit drives, and the ball jags back in after pitching. The only questions is, is it doing too much? I think it is. HawkEye thinks it is. Rohit is reinstated

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, straight, holds its line, defended back to him

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: another lovely shot. Just short of a length, he stays back and punches this along the ground past the man diving at cover-point

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: holds its line after pitching just short of a length, Rohit has to defend it

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, seaming in, hits him high on the pad

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: 5000 IPL runs for Rohit Sharma. Wide outswinger, he throws his bat at it, times it well, but it goes in the air between cover-point and cover. Kings XI excited for a moment
a wicket-maiden after that 30-run over. On a length, around off, angles away. Defended to off

special bowling. Thirty runs in his last over. Five balls, no runs and a wicket in this. Lovely seam position angling towards slip, pitches on a length, on middle and leg, drawing a shot across the line, and then swinging late to beat him and hit the timber. The Cottrell salute is alive and well

short_text: Cottrell to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, nicely punched away, but straight to cover-point

short_text: Cottrell to de Kock, no run
long_text: full now, gets swing, bowls really full, 128ks, dug out back to him

short_text: Cottrell to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, pushed with an open face to cover-point

short_text: Cottrell to de Kock, no run
long_text: starts with a length ball outside off, squeezes under his attempt to cut, and dies on its way to Rahul

short_text: Kuldeep to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: finds the extra cover boundary. Nicely placed. Tossed up outside off, steps out to make it to the pitch of that and it's a clean connection on the lofted drive
good length at middle stump, steps out and drives aerially towards long-on
good length at middle stump, inside edge onto the pads as he looks to force it off the back foot
pumps him straight! Doesn't allow this wrong'un to turn. Jumps out to the pitch of it and uses his reach to cart that
beaten on the drive. Wrong'un spinning away from off stump
beaten on the sweep. Good length ball wide outside off and he gave it the full swing

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, SIX runs
long_text: swipes it over deep midwicket for his fifty. Quiet little innings until now from Curran, who came in at 7 today. Waited it till the last couple of overs to start taking on the bowlers and it's, all things considered, a well paced 50

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, SIX runs
long_text: well connected again. Good length and sliding on outside off. Steps out and goes straight. A bit low on the bat but it's gone 89 metres
short outside off, sliced over the bowler off the back foot

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, under-edge on the attempted cut, back down the pitch

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length outside off, slogs along the floor to deep midwicket and refuses the single

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, SIX runs
long_text: over wide long-on and a good looking shot too. Short of a good length. Steps out and that sits up for him with some extra pace to swing at. Swing he does

finds deep midwicket. Dropped short at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and pulls aerially. Nagarkoti with an easy take in the deep but Unadkat thinks that has hit the spider cam cable in the air. Which would make it a dead ball. It's been sent upstairs. There is a ripple from spider cam's angle. A bit more vague from all the other angles. So the umpires tell him to walk. Not conclusive
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, whipped to long-on off the back foot
good length and turning into leg, chopped onto his back leg on the attempted cut
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
full on middle stump, swept off the inside half to deep midwicket
good length at middle, steps out and drills to long-on's left
full and floated outside off, gets low and paddles to long leg's right
good length and wide outside off, driven to sweeper's right
short of a good length outside off, shuffles and pulls to long leg's right
good length outside off, chopped to extra cover's left off the front foot
full at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
wrong'un, full on off stump. Picks that and drives with the turn to sweeper's right
wrong'un, full at middle stump. Looks for the paddle sweep, deflected into the point region off the forearm
good length outside off, turning in sharply as he gets forward to defend. Off the inside edge to midwicket
wrong'un, good  length at middle. Down for the sweep and gets it to long leg's right off the under-edge
full on off stump, driven to long-on
good length and turning in at leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and turning in at off stump. Gets forward and pushes to extra cover's left
short and just outside off, chopped to backward point

oh sensational Nagarkoti! Good length ball wide outside off, looks to launch him straight again but this one grips and holds its line. It's sliced up, between long-off and long-on who are converging. Nagarkoti is the man coming from long-on. The ball's swerving in the direction of long-off. He simply sprints in front of that man and then leaps, almost parallel to the floor, to his left to hold on to that
cuts through his defences with a googly. Pitching on a good length, and he's playing back. Between bat and pad and even the keeper can't hang on
sixah Jofra. Full and wide outside off, step forward and swing through the line to launch this over long-off
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot

appeal for catch behind is turned down and DK reviews. Was looking for the reverse whip against a middle stump ball. Looks like it took his glove, went onto pad and then lobbed up for the keeper who took it high to his right. Replays are more or less confirming that right now. That will be overturned
good length and ripping in from outside off. Steps out and cuts to sweeper cover
short at middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square off the back foot
good length on leg stump, steps out and flicks to midwicket
short of a good length outside off, shuffles and sweeps to long leg

short_text: Varun to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length, googly, wide outside off and spinning. Beaten on the sweep

short_text: Varun to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, slides past the cut
good length outside off, swiped to long-on's right
good length and spinning away outside off. Shuffles and drives to long-off

short and just outside off, punched to extra cover's left. Morgan throws on the bounce after running around it. Bowler takes the bails off at the non-striker's end. Sent upstairs but the bat's well grounded

short_text: Varun to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: dropped short on middle stump, pulled to short midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended to short third off the outside edge
good length outside off, shuffles and looks to sweep. Cops it on the front thigh

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped short outside off, backs away and whips this firmly to sweeper's right. Cummins mistimes the slide and that's through from under him

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length and strangled at leg stump. Flicked hurriedly to square leg

short_text: Narine to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length at middle, gets forward and turns it to midwicket
good length outside off, uses the turn to flick into the leg side
good length on middle stump, turning. Flicked to deep square

knocks middle stump! Good line from Chakravarthy and slowed it down nicely as well. It's a googly. Pitching leg stump, gripping and rising up at middle as Tewatia walks into the leg side to try and make room for a drive through cover. Gets too far away from it and is beaten on the outside edge
good length on middle, steps out and tucks it through midwicket
full offbreak on middle stump, driven to long-on
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper's left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
just short of extra cover. Full ball at off stump, slices feebly in Morgan's direction. He's right back on the circle
good length just outside off, mistimed drive into the covers
short of a good length and wide outside off. 134.7kph. Slapped on the up to sweeper's elft
slower short ball down leg and we know what he does to those! Lines it up and slaps it to fine leg's right, flat and into the hoarding
good length outside off, neatly driven on the up past mid-off. Long-on sprints across to clean that up
short and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man's right
slower ball, a full toss dipping outside off. Gets low and drags this wide of mid-on with a check

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, driven straight to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tom Curran, 1 run
long_text: short and wide outside off, slapped off the back foot to sweeper

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tom Curran, 2 runs
long_text: short outside off, pulled with a swivel to deep square's left

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tom Curran, 2 runs
long_text: good length outside off, sweet sweet timing on this cover drive on the rise. Dribbles to sweeper's right

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: good length outside off, stabbed into the covers off the front foot
full outside off, 143kph, driven along the floor to sweeper cover. Bottom hand comes off as he does it

short_text: Nagarkoti, to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: full and at the stumps of the new batsman. Punched to mid-on

taken low at backward point! Very sharp from Gill, low to his left if he's taken this. Soft signal is out. Short ball outside off is laced off the back foot with an open face. It's quick and low to Gill's left. He keeps his eye on it, lunges low and in front. Appears like he has taken it cleanly too. Clean enough not to be overturned, anyway. That will stay out
good length at off, defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, chopped to third man

finds deep square with precision! The man is in to save the second on a big boundary.This is a short ball, and Uthappa swipes right across his front leg, about chest height before it dips into that fielder's lap

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: good length outside off, opens the face and jabs to backward point
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
good length and angled into the corridor. Pushes on the front foot, thick inside edge to fine leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: good length at off, poked into the covers with soft hands

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Parag, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, defended off the front foot

taken at short third man! This is a captain's gamble paying off. Cummins and Mavi were given the job to just get the top order out it seems, because this is the sixth consecutive over of pace. And it has yielded Buttler's wicket. Nothing too special about the ball itself - good length and wide outside off. Has a slash on the up, half a stride in on it. Thick edge and straight to the man there
good length and just outside off, defended down the pitch
mean bouncer in the corridor. He's late on the hook
just short of backward point. Good length at 146kph on leg stump. Closes the face too early on the flick
good length at middle stump, punched to cover's right. A fumble as he lunges low
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover
follows him down leg and crashes this full ball into his pads as he looks to flick
good length and wide outside off, looks to cart it through the off side after making room. Thick inside edge into the leg side

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: beaten as that gets big on him. Short and outside off, climbing up at 135kph. Got a little inside the line as this wobbled away from his back foot punch

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide outside off, onto the front foot and spanks it through cover. Attempted slower ball? That was at 123kph. Looks like an offcutter

oh that was close for a run-out at the striker's end! Short of a good length just outside off, opens the face and drops it in front of backward point with soft hands and Nagarkoti is rapid as he gets low and has an under-arm flick. Would have got Buttler with a direct hit

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Uthappa, no run
long_text: good length and just outside off, pushed into the covers on the up

dragged to midwicket! Short of a good length, climbing up at a middle stump line. 135kph. He goes across the line for the front-foot pull, but that gets a bit steep by the end. Off the sticker region of the bat and a gentle catch offered
beaten as this bouncer whistles past his right shoulder

ramps him fine! Full and in at leg stump. He was already dropping the shoulder and moving into the off side for the ramp. Possibly just anticipating the angle in that Cummins is providing. But this also happens to be full and down leg side so it all adds up beautifully and the ball slams into the sponsor's hoarding
short of a good length and into the body. Uses the angled to swish towards fine leg
short of a good length, just outside off. Defended to mid-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, 145.7kph, defended to mid-on from the crease
sweet. Good length and outside off. Half a stride and an aesthetic drive on the up to mid-off's left. Russell chases and pulls it in
short of a length, nipping in off the seam. Inside edge onto pad and a single in the covers as he looks to punch on the up

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: beaten on the inside edge as he looks to pull from outside off. Good length skidder angled into the corridor

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, knocked on the up to extra cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: yawn. Good length and angled into the pads. Waits on it and holds his shape to clip this past short fine

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length outside off, 131.1kph, skips into line for the flick but cops it on the pad

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: good length outside off, looks to punch into the covers. Gets a thick inside edge to midwicket

given out caught behind now. Smith looks confused, has a chat with Jos, and then walks off. It's a good length ball in at leg stump. His front foot is well in the leg side and he's had another ungainly hoick at this. Inside edge past leg stump and taken low to the left by DK. Strange sequence of shots from Smith leading up to that dismissal
just clears mid-off. Good length ball at middle, ugly heave from Smith across the line and he only ends up slicing it

edged? No says the umpire. KKR won't review. Short of a good length at middle stump straightening on him as he looks to flick. There was a sound as this was near Smith. Do KKR think it was pad? Was a bit more woody in my opinion
beaten. Shuffles into the off side against this back of a length ball and has a swipe as it climbs over the outside edge
good length and just outside off, defended to midwicket off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked along the floor to deep square
good length and wide outside off, gets down for the sweep, it deflects off his back thigh and rolls away behind the keeper
good length, turning in at middle stump. Tucked towards long-on off the back foot
sweet little swipe over wide long-on. Narine telegraphs this - offbreak at length on an off stump line. Buttler knows where it's going to land and he skips down to meet it there and then shovels it
good length, offbreak at off stump. Well forward before turning this to deep square
good length on middle stump, flicked to square leg
short and down leg side, beaten on the flick
good length and just outside off, punched to backward point off the back foot

short_text: Tom Curran to Morgan, no run
long_text: yorker outside off, drilled back towards the bowler who sits down and holds on his follow through
yorker outside off, jammed down to long-off and Nagarkoti is back for another second
and again. Morgan keeps shuffling and drawing this line from Curran. This one is full and too wide outside off again
wide yorker outside off, just past the tramline as Morgan looks to chop it
slower ball, full and very very wide as Morgan waits for this after settling outside off stump
low full toss outside off, driven firmly to long-off's left. Nagarkoti comes back for the second and survives as Curran hopes Smith's throw hits the stumps direct

short_text: Tom Curran to Morgan, SIX runs
long_text: clears deep midwicket. Short ball across the corridor. Might have been a slower one too. He waited on that and put the weight into his pull very late despite being on his toes. Expertly lifted
low full toss across his off stump. Walks into that and hammers it flat-batted to long-off's left. Smith sprints across and drags it in with his left hand
good length, slower ball at leg stump. Inside edge onto thigh, out towards short fine
full slower ball on leg stump, whipped out to deep square
good length and just outside off, chopped to short third man
good length on middle stump, pushed to long-on
full outside off, lines that up and drills it straight over mid-off. Proper connection on that swing
slower short ball just outside off, chopped on the bounce to short third
yorker outside off, jammed down to long-on

taken at deep backward square by Samson. Got into a tangle running to his right, because Royals insist their deep fielders are in from the rope when Cummins is batting. So he runs to his right at an awkward angle and is actually nearly facing the boundary line as he leaps up and takes it just above his head. As he lands, he hits the back of his head onto the floor. The medical team have a chat with him and he's alright it seems. This was a slower short ball outside off and a bit of a blind hook from Cummins, only managed to slice it
good length and just outside off. Slower ball sitting up. Slapped to long-off's left
low full toss at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off, chopped to sweeper cover

short_text: Tom Curran to Morgan, FOUR runs
long_text: knee high full toss nice and wide outside off. Morgan cuts loose and whacks it to sweeper's left
slower ball, short of a good length on middle. Flicked to deep square

dropped at deep backward point! Again, the plan is executed for the wicket at deep backward point. But this time Curran loses it to his right. Short and across him, and Morgan uses the upper cut. Just uses the pace though, not much of a swat at that. Curran is on the line but apprehensive as he goes for this to his right. It was about chest height
slower short ball outside off, jabbed into the covers
punched to Samson's right at sweeper. He's in from the line a long way, halfway. This is a slower ball and a short one. Nicely on top of that to punch firmly in front of square
146kph bouncer up at the throat. Takes the eyes off and fends it into the square leg region
short and just outside off, opens the face and turns it to third man
short at the body, pulled out to deep square
slower short ball at leg stump, controlled pull out to deep square
good length, slower ball at leg stump. Clipped to deep midwicket
slower ball, good length on off stump. Gets forward and tucks delicately into vacant midwicket to steal two
low full toss on off stump, slapped across the line, on the bounce to deep midwicket
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Steps out and is forced to adjust on the cut. To sweeper's left

short_text: Tom Curran to Morgan, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, defended to point off the front foot
short of a good length, wide outside off. Hapless slog and he's well beaten
slower ball at off stump, punched on the up to long-off
short of a good length in the corridor, opens the face and runs it to third man

was that off the helmet?  Looks like it. Bouncer up at the crest at 127kph. Morgan beaten on the attempted hook. Takes off his helmet at the other end and is all smiles. Was beaten by a lack of pace there
bouncer down leg side, beaten on the pull
short and down leg side, left alone

taken at deep backward point! This is a plan coming off. Rajpoot goes full and wide outside off. Reaching out and throwing his hands at this, but it's sliced off the outside part of the bat. Russell's holding his head. Well, his helmet.He obviously thinks that should have been somewhere over extra cover. But the plan with the fielder out there has worked out for Royals
see ya. That is not a length Rajpoot can afford to bowl at his pace. Short of a good length and he's got the front foot stride to slug this over deep midwicket from outside off
full and very wide outside off, left alone. That cut back in to sail over the wide line
beaten on the attempted ramp. Short and rising at an off stump line. Stays leg side of it and opens the face but it's too quick
good length slower ball, at the stumps. Shuffles and exposes the stumps before poking it past the non-striker
good length on leg stump, nudged to mid-on's left off the back foot
beaten. Short and across the corridor and skidding rapidly underneath the attempted cut
good length at 148kph, defended on the front foot
taken behind! 147.3kph. Good length in the corridor. Karthik deep in the crease looking to defend. It's an angled bat coming down towards midwicket. Manages to brush the outside edge
safely to sweeper's right. Good length and dipping wide outside off. Russell wants to go over extra cover after getting down on a knee. Ends up slicing it high
clears the midwicket boundary with ease again. Full and slid on at leg stump. Never going to survive that as a bowler. Casual whip, not much height on it, and to the deep fielder's left
short and wide outside off, cut straight to extra cover
smoked into the railings. Good length ball, a googly at middle and leg. Front leg into the leg side and a brutal slog sweep over deep midwicket
good length on off stump, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
googly, short and in at off stump. Dragged to deep midwicket's right with a pull
good length and at off stump, 147.8kph. Defended off the back foot
slower ball, short and into the body. Pulled to deep midwicket
beaten. 148.7kph, short and just outside off. Russell hurriedly backing into the leg side and having a swish, out of balance
149.7kph bouncer in the corridor. Russell gets his head into the leg side to let that go
full and just outside off at 149.4kph. Deep in the crease and respectfully defended

takes it himself, pitch side. Good length ball at leg stump. Kicks up a bit of dust off the surface. Gill looks for the leg glance off his thigh but has closed the face too soon. Leading edge hangs up in the air and Archer completes a simple catch
short and turning away outside off, cut to sweeper's left
googly, short of a good length and in at off. Cut to backward point
googly at a length on leg stump, clipped to short fine off the back foot
raps the pads with a googly. Good length and tucking him up on the crease as he attempts the whip behind square
short outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover

misfield by Jofra at long-on. Full and front-of-the-hand quicker one. Just outside off. He's to the pitch of that and crunches it down the ground. Archer extends his left hand but can't muster the balance to come back up with the ball in hand

holes out to long-off! Another page in the Tewatia story. Goes over the wicket now, fuller and flatter. Possibly seam up. Rana miscues the attempted loft-drive into the off side. It's off the low part of the bat
good length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
short and just outside off, cut straight to backward point
beats sweeeper to his right. Short and just outside off, waits on that and chops firmly to evade Samson's big dive
short and sliding away outside off, beaten on the cut

beaten on the reverse shot. Good length and turning into the corridor. Wanted to hoick behind third man but was a bit too quick with getting in position for that. Lost his bearings, flicked his thigh on the way to Buttler. Or was it glove? Yes it was!
over the non-striker. Good length and wide outside off. Steps out and once again, just tremendous use of his reach to drag this towards the leg side even as it threatens to turn away from him
good length outside off, driven back to the bowler
safely into the turf at mid-off. Good length, wide outside off, attempted sweep and it's a top edge that evades Smith running back from extra cover by some distance

oh what a shot. Pure improv. Good length slider in at middle and leg. He's on the front foot for a pull but realises this will stay a tad low. Adjusts the swing, makes it a short-arm one, and bisects deep square and deep midwicket
short and just outside off, cut straight to backward point
short and just outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover
good length just outside off, slides on nicely for the flick to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
looks like another legcutter. Good length and sliding in towards middle stump, swept to deep midwicket
good length and just outside off, dabbed to extra cover's left. Looked like a legcutter
short and just outside off, backs away for the cut as this slides into the corridor. Thick edge runs past short third
sweetly lofted over the extra cover boundary. Parag starts with an overpitched offbreak, wide outside off. Lovely stride forward and completes the batswing with grace
finds the midwicket boundary. Attempted front-of-the-hand quicker one from Shreyas. It's dropped short and sits up nicely for a front-foot pull
good length and wide outside off, pushed through flat. Reaches out and slaps to sweeper's right
just short of deep midwicket. Short and just outside off, a checked pull, in the air briefly
beaten by the googly. Good length and just outside off. Playing for the one spinning in, bat hanging inside the line
leading edge as he looks to flick this full googly from outside off. Curran chases to his right at short third
googly floated up at off stump, drilled firmly back at the bowler and bursts through his hands to trickle to long-off

short_text: Tom Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: slower ball again, short and just outside off. Under-edge on the attempted cut. Rolls to the keeper

short_text: Tom Curran to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: he thrives on room outside off. And after three tight deliveries, Curran feeds him a wide one. It's also a slower ball and much shorter. Slashed to the backward point boundary

short_text: Tom Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, makes him drive towards mid-off again

short_text: Tom Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: good length at off stump, watchfully defended on the front foot

short_text: Tom Curran to Rana, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, sweetly timed drive, straight to mid-off
offcutter, good length and just outside off. Clipped to deep midwicket
good length and down leg side, left alone
short of a good length, just outside off, tapped into the covers

knocks middle and leg stump and lets out a couple of roars. Another good length offcutter, but slightly fuller and slightly straighter than the last one. Narine brings out the slog again but this time he's beaten on the inside edge
past extra cover. Short of a good length and slanting into him this time. Backs away and punches it between extra cover and regular cover

nails it. Unadkat bowls Narine's dream ball. Good length, offcutter not very well concealed, just outside off. Spinning into his arc. He has the front foot in the leg side and the full swing sends it over midwicket
good length at off stump, watchfully patted on the up to mid-off
good length at middle stump, cramped on the punch. It's back down the pitch
appeal for lbw as Narine is caught on the pad yet again, trying to pull a length ball. He was struck outside the line of leg stump
miscued and straight towards extra cover. Good length ball gets a little big on him as he looks to slash through the covers
slower ball, short of a good length at middle. Pulled to deep midwicket
past midwicket. Good length ball just outside off, friendly enough pace for Gill to wait on the front foot and pull well in front of the fielder
good length at leg stump, looks to whip it behind square and is struck on the pad
beats deep midwicket to the left. Good length offcutter at middles stump, clears the front leg and nails the slog along the ground this time. Samson can't stop with a slide
short and way down leg side, left alone
good length on off stump, punched into the covers

high up and dropped at mid-on! Uthappa puts down a sitter. Full slower ball at middle stump, looks for the big slog and gets it off the toe-end. Uthappa is underneath it and barely has to move. Brings out the reverse cup and simply fluffs it. Might have closed the grasp a bit too early
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
offcutter, good length and cramping him on the pads as he looks to play the flick. Cops that on the body
good length on the stumps, backs away and has a heave. Misses
mid-on gets a hand and stops to his left. Uthappa lunging there. Good length at middle stump, looks to go lofted drive again, but this bounces in front of Uthappa
short of a good length and cramping him at the mid-ridd. Miscues another pull into midwicket
wide of the crease and angled in towards off stump. Good length ball. Narine on the back foot to try and pull, gets it off the high part of the bat
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length at middle stump, allows it on and clips past midwicket

lofted over the long-on boundary. Here we go again. Gill and the straight boundary. Full and floated away from him, but he brings an angled bat down and drags it the other way, towards long-on. Half a stride only. It's all about the head position
good length and shape away outside off, left alone
150.8kph, short and wide outside off. Narine backs into the leg side to make room. He's made too much room. Beaten on the cut
149kph and making him hop as this curves away from a middle stump line. It was banged in short too and he was a long way from making connection
short and lifting up at the hips, some curve in. Uses the angle to nudge it to fine leg
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length and just outside off. Seam angled in but no movement. Pushed into the covers off the front foot
Rabada ends with a six but he needed 21 to take this into a Super Over
slower offcutter again, and he manages to hit this over cover
slower ball, on a length, beats him with the offcutter
timber. Patel sees one on a length, and slogs across its line, only managing an inside edge onto the stumps
back to the yorker, dug out to long-off for one
dropped. Khaleel starts with length. Rabada lofts this to long-off where Pandey spills it
yorker again, and that is another excellent over. Just the single
bouncer, to the tall man, so it is not going to be a wide. And it goes above his hook
yorker again, middle and leg, dug out to long-on for one
wide down the leg side. Bhuvi predicts Axar might back away so tries to bowl that line to cramp him up. Axar stays his ground
yorker again, played back at him, misfielded by Bhuvneshwar, allows him the single
full toss, at the stumps, lofted with an open face, between long-off and extra cover. Gets four for it
misses the yorker by inches, driven to long-off for one

another lovely yorker, given lbw but I think he will get it reviewed and overturned because of the angle. He is beaten after shuffling across, but this is bowled over the wicket and has hit him in front of off. Has to be missing. But it is not. The replay shows it to be swinging back in. That is surprising, but I am not going to question the technology here. I got it wrong unlike Natarajan who has been nailing his yorkers
gets the yorker wrong, but it is a straight full toss that cramps him up. The mis-hit doesn't carry to square leg boundary rider, and they come back for two
and he nails another yorker. Just the single to long-off
yorker again. Can't do much more than dig it out for one. Natarajan has been excellent with the yorker. Is there no dew tonight?
full and straight, bunted into the leg side for a couple
yorker, middle and leg, played to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: legbreak, short of a length, straight, punched to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Stoinis, 1 leg bye
long_text: wrong'un, starts within the stumps, goes for one leg-bye

oh Pant tries the impossible shot. Rashid has slowed this down and bowled full on middle and leg. He wants to go behind square with the sweep, but he doesn't have pace to work with. Ends up sweeping this to deep square leg
flat, into the pads, punched to leg
in his sweeping arc, he hits to deep square leg for another single
wrong'un, Stoinis seems to have picked it because he doesn't wind up despite this being in the slot. Punched to long-off for one
powerful strike. On a length, just outside off. Pant tries nothing fancy here. Just a full-blooded extra cover drive. Over the man in the ring
tries the reverse ramp to a length ball outside off. Beaten
gets inside the line here, trying to go over short fine, but is hit on the pad as he is early into the shot
short of a length, wide outside off, and punched crisply through point for four. This man is in some form
driven to wide long-off for one

wicket for Bhuvi on his comeback. He continues with the strategy of keeping it wide of Hetmyer's reach. Slower offcutter too. He still goes after this length ball, lofting it towards wide long-off. Pandey runs to his right to complete the catch despite a wobble
yorker outside off, goes off the inside edge to short fine, but Hetmyer turns down the single
yorker, outside off, dug out to deep cover for one
lovely power. Slower short ball, goes wide to deny him a clean connection, but Hetmyer throws all his might at it, and plays a lovely shot with the open face. over point it goes for six more
full toss, into the pads, and he loves it. Yorker gone wrong, but the line is better off wider. Lofted over midwicket. DC are in this
low full toss, dug out to mid-off

short slower ball, wide again, Hetmyer does well to get bat on it, but doesn't get any power. Somehow it sails over extra cover, and Warner from long-off has to run to his right to keep it down to two
wide length ball, goes over the tram line. Trying to stay away from his reach. Called for it
lovely yorker, on leg, Hetmyer is not getting this anywhere. Dug out for just the single
another yorker, outside off, driven this time, but straight to deep point
bouncer, but wide down the leg side
another yorker executed nicely. Dug out to long-on for one more
yorker, on off, dug out wide of long-on, but Hetmyer refuses the second

full toss down the leg side, lucky to get away with just the four. Off the inside edge and past the diving Bairstow. That could have been his third straight six. Called leg-byes. He possibly missed it altogether
full, straight, nearly a yorker, dug out back over the bowler's head
like the London buses, you get one after the other. Lovely flat six over wide long-off. They will need much more of this
Pant's first six of this IPL. He slog-sweeps him over the longer boundary. Clean connection
dropped. Short of a length, hit hard, hit back at him, but he spills it
flat, on a length, punched down to long-on for another single
Pant walks down the wicket, Sharma slips one down leg. He does well to get bat on it and avoid a stumping
stays on that length short of the driving one. Pushed to mid-on for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: big swing, but gets an inside edge back to Rashid

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: Pant gets himself out of the line to sweep. Beaten, hit on the pad
full, on off, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, OUT
long_text: wrong'un outside off, and Dhawan tries the slog sweep only to be beaten. Bairstow appeals both for catch and stumping. Given not out, and they review it. So I assume the appeal is now for the catch. And it has hit the toe end of the bat. Great review. Dhawan has to go
full, on the pads, worked to deep square for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: swept away in the air but well short of deep midwicket
tries the big slog sweep, but Abhishek keeps it slow and out of his reach. Another edge to short third for a single
shorter, Pant goes right back to pull it to deep square for one
down the wicket, Abhishek still keeps the ball away from his reach. Pushed down to long-on for one
gets a top edge on the reverse sweep and it clears short third man. Khaleel chases well and keeps them down to two
excellent bowling, slow, and in-between length. Pushed towards long-on with soft hands, and Abhishek gives chase to keep it down to one
leading edge as he looks to push this to long-on. Straight cover does the fielding
flighted outside off, pushed to long-off for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, goes back to pull, can't get it wide enough of long-on to b able to come back for two

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, no room, defended back to him

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full, outside leg, perhaps tried a googly, and Dhawan has drilled this sweep to square leg for four

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: and once again, this is more down leg, but Dhawan is hit on the pad again

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: lovely legbreak, turns back in from off, cramps him up. Another dot
wide on the crease, into the pitch, punched down to long-on for one
pushed down to long-on
slower, 89ks, on a length, on off, pushed to leg
on a length, straight, worked to leg
on a length, outside off, drilled to long-off
backs away, Abhishek doesn't follow him, so he comes back and plays a nothing chip to long-off. Lucky to not hit it well

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: flighted, slower at 93ks, defended back to him

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: quick legbreak, around off, skiddy, defended back to him

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: wrong'un, outside leg, on a length, defended to him

short_text: Rashid Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: quick lebgreak, short of a length, worked to leg for one
slower through the air, and Iyer has thrown it away. He goes for a loft with an open face, and there is a fielder in place for that shot. Catching practice there

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: quick legbreak first up, 97ks, beats him as he defends
again the front-of-the-hand delivery. Short of a length, but surprises Iyer with no spin. He recovers well to pull him to deep midwicket
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, gets a single to deep cover
wide down the leg side, and also beats Bairstow. Tried the front-of-the-hand quick ball
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as Abhishek bowls wide, but he gets an inside edge for a single
short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg
full, outside off, pushed to long-on for one
full, outside off, driven uppishly to long-off
on a length, wicket to wicket, opens the face, takes the single
full toss, hit back at Natarajan's toe, takes a single off the defelction
yorker outside off, steered to short third man for one
on a length, outside off, played with an open face to cover

lovely shot. Knows the mid-off is wide, and can loft this towards the straight mid-off even though there might not be much timing because of the slow pitch. And in the end, he ends up getting some timing too
short of a length, not much room, punched to cover-point
does the double movement again: shuffle across, then back away. Cuts the slower ball in front of square and into the gap between cover-point and extra cover. Easy three there
nicely played. Gets inside the line of a length ball, and glances it fine of short fine leg
shuffles across, then backs away, Khaleel bowls the slower, and he hits it straight to mid-off
slower ball, on a length, outside off, dhawan shuffles and works this to leg for one

short_text: Ahmed to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat cover this time

short_text: Ahmed to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length, no room, hit uppishly, exciting SRH, but in the gap between cover-point and cover
full, middle and leg, dug out to midwicket
on a length, on the up, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, hits hard to deep point for one

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, Dhawan down the pitch, swings to mid-on to shouts of catch it, but he has cleared the man

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: hit straight to mid-off this time

short_text: Natarajan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full, outside off, driven hard, but can't find the gap at cover
is that the knuckle ball? No it is seam-up, but the ball sits in the surface, and the leading edge lobs wide of the diving Bhuvi
short of a length, around off, opens the face, gets a single

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower ball, full, around off, driven hard, but can't beat mid-off

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: oh misses out. Short, wide, cut away hard, but finds the man at point

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. And that is sign that the pitch might have quickened up a little. Chips down the wicket, and even though he is not to the pitch of the ball, he chips this back over his head. Gets good timing on it

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, pitches outside leg, ends at leg. No room. Defended
fuller, straighter, slower at 129ks, defended back to him
seam? On a length, 140ks, on off, and beats his attempt to drive. Yes there is some seam movement there
short of a length, angling in, cramping him up, pushed to midwicket for one
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, wide of mid-off
on a length, outside off, punched to cover

Natarajan at third man charges in but decides not to go for the catch. Dhawan upper-cuts it outside off, and the shouts are for the catch, but Natarajan decides he won't be able to make it and saves the boundary
Iyer nearly runs himself out. Hits this to point and charges down the wicket. It is Dhawan's call, and he is right to stand his ground. Iyer gets back in time

don't need slip for this. SRH have their early wicket. Short of a length, lovely outswinger seam, ball lands on it and kicks away, taking the outside edge as Shaw looks to punch it. Bairstow takes the catch. His first wicket this IPL
outdoes him with the slower ball but the mis-hit flies straight of mid-on. Shaw well early into it. Didn't pick it at all
short of a length, outside off, punched to short cover
wide, short of a length, left alone. Just inside the tram line
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off
slower short ball, helped into the leg side for a couple but one of them is called short. Sharma is the culprit

short_text: Rabada to Abdul Samad, 1 leg bye
long_text: short of a length, into the body and into the pitch, concedes only a leg-bye as Samad backs away
full, 143ks, cross-seam, no room, Williamson looks to whip it to leg, but the slowness of the pitch means  he can send it only as far as the boundary rider at midwicket
quick, short of a length, runs off the inside half of the bat to the left of Pant. Reaches him on a halfvolley and deflects to fine leg

short_text: Rabada to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: smarter than Nortje. Slower ball outside off, and he beats his swing
short ball, quick skiddy one, at 137ks, the inside edge into the ribs. They take the single

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, SIX runs
long_text: massive. Nortje seems to have underestimated the young man. No change of pace this over. Samad gets under this 145k length ball, and lofts him way over wide long-on

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, FOUR runs
long_text: he swings hard at a short ball outside off, gets a top edge, and it clears short third man with ease

short_text: Nortje to Abdul Samad, no run
long_text: oh misses out. On-pace length ball. Right in the slot. He swings across its line, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, Williamson goes inside the line to pull, but can't beat deep square leg
Samad has struck the first ball he faces clean but straight to long-on for one
yorker to start off. Gets Williamson off strike
short of a length, no room, opens the face, gets a single to short third man
and Bairstow's scratchy innings ends. Cross-seam, on pace, full, Bairstow goes back to try to get under the ball, but manages to only sky it to mid-off
slower offcutter, beats his slog, and bounces just over the leg stump
has Bairstow run the only quick man out?. Drills a full ball front of deep cover, calls him for the third and then sends him back. Williamson makes it back, though
slower bouncer, beats him on the pull. Bairstow still looking for his bearings
follows Bairstow with a yorker, who digs it out, and the inside edge actually helps him as he has enough time to come back for two. That is his fifty. Has to be one of his slowest
another slower short ball, pulled to deep square leg for a single
slower short ball, can't time the pull, gets just the single
picks his spot beautifully. Mid-on is up, and he lofts this length ball over the man. Nearly 200 strike rate here

Dhawan has been lobbed. This is the work of that running early on as the fielders are off the fence, but in the last four overs you expect them to go back to the fence. Williamson has cleared Dhawan at deep square, but the ball still falls inside the fence
full toss, and he has just helped it along for a single. No back lift. Could have attempted to hit a six here
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, straight to short extra
pulled away to deep midwicket this time for one
wow that is some flourish. Nortje has done well here with a legcutter short of a length and wide of his reach, but Williamson has helioptered it along the ground between mid-off and extra cover
lovely shot. He has picked his spot. He knows Nortje is not going to bowl full with the mid-off up. He shuffles across to try to hit it to leg, and ends up pulling it between fine leg and deep square
short ball, pulled hard, but straight to deep square leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
full and straight, hit to midwicket. His first dot

bowls full and straight, Williamson hits wide of long-on, who is in off the fence. Stoinis makes a diving save and flicks back a throw even as he falls. Hard enough for the ball to reach inside the circle. There is non one around to collect it so they take three
Williamson goes over that mid-off, but this is a slower ball, and he hasn't got all of it. Just the couple
low full toss, 140ks, with mid-off up, he is lucky to get away with just a single. Bairstow doesn't try to go over that man
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
short, quick, into the body, 139, mis-hits the pull towards long leg
on a length, straight, pushed to long-on for one
dipping full ball, driven to long-off for one more
looks for the sweep as Mishra bowls the slider. It runs off the glove to short fine leg
wrong'un. He picks it off the pitch and punches is down to long-on for one
lovely shot. All wrists. Wide legbreak, and he plays this like a hockey flick, using his wrists to chip it over extra cover
full, can't get under it, hit hard to long-off
pushes this straight of straight extra cover for a single

short_text: Axar Patel to Bairstow, no run
long_text: fired in, middle and leg, no pace, and Patel makes an excellent diving save to his right to deny them a single
short of a length, punched wide of the diving Shaw at extra cover. He gets there but the ball slips under his hand
flat, short of a length, no room, pushed wide of extra cover
flat, into the pads, worked to leg for one
quicker, outside off, dropped into the covers for one
on a length outside off, 92ks, driven to deep cover
slow, really slow, full, driven to long-on for one
slider, outside off, punched to long-off
full, on off, drilled back to him
wrong'un, he picks it off the pitch, and plays it back to him

slog-sweep against the turn on such a big boundary against Mishra's slow pace? That is a death wish, I am sorry to tell you, Mr Pandey. Mishra also gets some dip on it, and the top edge ends with Rabada at deep midwicket
nearly a yorker, middle and off, dug out past the diving Mishra to his right
single down the ground

short_text: Axar Patel to Bairstow, FOUR runs
long_text: this is a good example of the benefit of having taken those quick twos. Dhawan at long-on is some way inside the boundary, and Bairstow has managed to pull this wide of him. It is not a had hit bit because the fielder is in, he has managed to beat him
slower than usual, still 91ks, pushed into the off side
on a length, some turn from around off, punched wide of long-on
wide down the leg side. Seems like an arm ball
flighted outside off, driven to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Pandey, no run
long_text: flat, on a length, on off, punched to short cover
nice shot. Rocks back to cut a flat length ball between point and short third man. Manufactures his own length there
nice dip, on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
really full, hit down the ground, to the right of Mishra

big appeal for a catch at the wicket, not given, and they go upstairs right away. And it has come off the glove. Warner looks for another reverse sweep but this time the ball is not as full as the one that he pulled off two balls ago. Also it doesn't turn and kisses the glove on the way through to Pant. There is a bit of a murmur at the same time on the UltraEdge. So Warner has to go
slider, beats him on the slog outside off as he plays for the turn

tossed up outside off, but Warner switches his stance to make it his leg side. He gets a nit of a bottom edge but he has managed to place it fine of short fine leg. This is the reverse sweep and not the switch hit
full toss, borderline on the no-ball, punched to deep point. It is ruled just below the waist
on a length, another slower ball, 126ks, on off, he opens the face of the bat for a single
short of a length, slower, no room, Warner leaves this in the crease and Bairstow still calls him through for a single
too many slower balls this over. Warner is waiting for them, and clears the front leg to send this full ball back over Ishant's head. It is a wallop
another slower ball, full outside off, driven to long-off
another slower offcutter bowled wide down the leg side
too straight with the fine leg up. Clipped square of that short fine for two
wide down the leg side as the offcutter goes wrong
slower offcutter, 121ks, leading edge from Warner, but it lands short of short cover
Bairstow makes room to go back over his head but doesn't get enough timing behind it
on a length, quick, angling in, and they hustle through for another second by hitting slightly wide of long-on with soft hands
on a length, no room, he opens the face to hit to deep point for one
full outside off, hit hard to long-off so they get just the one
on a length, on off, and they pinch a third straight couple. Soft hands here. They know it is not easy to hit boundaries here
wrong'un, starts outside leg, and Warner uses soft hands again to pinch a two in the leg side
slider, middle and leg, pushed with soft hands to long-on and they come back for two
shimmies down, Mishra slows it down, shortens the length, draws a defensive shot after beating him in the flight
lovely shot. Bairstow getting his bearings now. Mishra tosses up a legbreak but pitches it right in his slot. He slogs it over wide mid-on
paddle sweep from right in front of the stumps. Mishra's slow pace means this won't go for four
single down to long-off as this length ball turns back into Warner and he goes back to punch it against the turn
slower ball, middle and leg, dropped into the leg side for one
these are fortunate runs. Quick length ball, skids through under his shot. Oh it gets a bottom edge onto the thigh pad, and it beats short third man
and now he seems to have got a hang of the pace of the pitch. Slower ball, just a touch too full, Warner clears the front leg, delays his shot, and goes over extra cover
quick, on a length, 143ks, looks for the pick-up. Bairstow looks to play the pick-up shot to leg, but gets an inside edge onto the pad
hit straight to deep point

this pitch is surely slower than the ones we have seen. Bairstow escapes. Looks for a slog over mid-on, but the ball is slow and he is early into the shot. Iyer has to run in and dive, and can't make the catch

we have a review for an lbw after they gave him not out on the field. Short of a length but Bairstow fancies the pull and is hit in front on the back pad. Height is the only thing saving him here, and the replay shows the ball clipping the top of the middle stump. So the on-field decision stays even though DC retain their review
hits a full ball to extra cover and just about makes a risky single. Was gone if Iyer had hit
again he mis-times. Skips down this time, but doesn't get all of it. Just the single to midwicket
another inside edge onto the pad. Clear signs the ball is not coming on. Another accurate slower ball
short of a length, no room, pushed wide of mid-on for one
tries to hit a length ball on the up, but straight to mid-on
early signs of the ball not coming on? Bairstow has swung hard through the line of a length ball, but has hit it straight to mid-on. Doesn't go as fast as full-blooded swings from Bairstow's bat do
bouncer, wicket to wicket, Bairstow ducks under it
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for another single
short of a length, seams in from just outside off, the inside edge hits his pad. Lucky to not play on
short, 134ks, cramping him up, pulled down to deep square leg
on a length, just outside off, angling in, punched to extra cover
on a length, hardly any room, gets a single into the off side
wide length ball, but he has deep point in place just for this
another slower ball, seems like the legcutter, stump to stump, on a length. Defended
slower ball, on a length, on the pads, worked to leg
on a length, no room, punched hard to mid-off
slower ball, back of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
full toss on the thigh, 142ks, for the best part of its journey it seems like it will be a no-ball, but it dips and hits him on the thigh pad. Or has it missed the padding?
quick delivery, 144ks, Bairstow is hit on the inner half of the bat as he looks to drive away from the body
on pace, on length, middle and off, angling across, driven square, to the right of cover-point. They steal the single
slower ball, Warner delays his shot, but can't find the gap. Hits this length ball straight to cover
shovels a full ball over mid-on. Not the most elegant of shots, but he has managed to get enough behind it to clear mid-on
full and straight, hit to mid-on
driven on the up, wide of mid-off, for a single
wide length ball, punched on the up, square of third man. Shaw has to put in a dive to prevent the boundary
full, shaping in, just a push past mid-on for a couple
slight swing away, on a length, around off, runs off the thick outside edge for a single to square third man
short of a length, starts around leg, shapes away to off, punched between point and cover-point
some seam first up as Warner shimmies down the track and leaves it alone outside off

it's a tie! A super over! Unreal. Slower short ball and that is well, completely predictable. Sits up at off stump. Pollard deep in the crease and clobbers this between deep square and deep midwicket. One bounce and over the rope

taken at deep midwicket! Oh boy! A matter of yards from victory, a matter of yards from an IPL hundred. Slower length ball outside off, gets down on a knee and brings out the slog sweep. Flat and right into the lap of the fielder at the line. Have they crossed over? That is all that matters right now
nails it and he's up to 99! Kishan has connected one and dragged this wide of long-on so casually! An overpitched ball from Udana, sliding nicely on as he swipes across the line

tipped over the boundary at long-on! Looks like it's Gurkeerat. Low full toss outside off, slogs at it and gets it off the low part of the bat. Gurkeerat leaps to his left and it's got his fingertips. Tough chance. Kishan still hasn't nailed one off the middle. Now is the time
slower short ball and he pulls straight to deep square. This is Udana's USP at the death. Really digs the cutters in. Pollard can't get it away

they might have Kishan at the non-striker's end. Udana really gpotaway with this ball. Overpitched on middle, square leg was in, but Kishan finds him with the slog. Runs through and dives at the other end and he's made it
slower ball, dug in short at leg stump. Miscued pull out to deep square leg

clears Kohli at long-off! Another mis-hit turns into six for Mumbai. This is a knee height full toss wide outside off. He wants to hit over the leg side but the angle is against him. It ends up a slice, and that is enough after keeping Kohli interested for a moment
straight long-off saves them three. That is a position people have for Pollard. This is a low full toss outside off and he sends it whistling past the bowler
good enough. 143kph, full and at off stump. Kishan is too late on the slog. Perhaps his hands slipped off too. He calls for new gloves immediately
outside edge but gathered on the bounce by Chahal at third man. Short and wide from Saini, missed out on the big cut and third man is fine
full slower ball just outside off, mistimed slog along the floor to deep midwicket
short and down leg side. Kishan has a whip at it and is beaten but he gets a run

forehand slap flat and over the bowler! 20-ball fifty, get outta here you beast! Talk about clutch player. He is doing EVERYTHING he is paid to do. Dropped short at a middle stump line, backs into the leg side and flat-bats this over Chahal like he's facing tennis serves from the Under-14s
short of a length outside off, punched to long-off's left off the back foot

carts him over deep midwicket! He does stick with the loopy stuff. But Kishan has figured that out now. Kohli asking Chahal why he isn't making him into the off side. Good length at off, gets low and slogs it. Just about clears the fielder
good length and pushed flat down leg side. No room this time. Whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full and following him down leg side. Miscued slog bounces out to deep midwicket's right
drilled over long-off! Good length ball, legbreak at off stump. Backs into the leg side, has the reach and the room to absolutely nail this. 81 metres

dropped at backward point! Chahal running backwards barely gets a finger on that. And they're back for the third which means Pollard keeps strike. Zampa slows it down, goes good length legbreak outside off. Pollard looks for the slog again and the leading edge floats over Chahal's head and his lunge to the right won't get him to it

miscued! But still a long long way! Wow, what power! Googly, flat and at a good length wide outside off again. Drags it off the inside half of the bat and then what? It's still in the upper tiers at midwicket
tossed up full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover's right. Easy second for them
oh this is gone far! Dropped short and just outside off, gets back in the crease and effortlessly deposits this pull into the upper tiers at midwicket
Negi drops it at deep extra! His night has turned! Full ball wide outside off, slices it. He goes reverse cup as this is about head height. And he tips it behind
doesn't move. Googly, tossed up wide outside off. Reaches out and drills it past Zampa's face. Long-off's has no chance
short outside off, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
overpitched outside off, clubbed down to long-on
yorker outside off, chopped to point's right. Dube puts in a dive there and manages to parry it towards third man who was running the other way trying to cover him. They take the extra run
can't get the scoop away. Slower ball at a good length, wide outside off. Dances into the off side and looks to force it fine. Cops it on the body
off the toe-end and that probably costs two runs. Low full toss at off stump, lofts it over the bowler. Mid-off was in. But long-on cleans up
smart. Kishan is in his element and playing the bowlers now. This is a full ball pushed across his corridor and he squats and opens the face to slice this to the third man boundary

dropped short of long-off and sneaks through from under him. Short of a good length and wide outside off - a ball bowled expecting the batsman to step out. Pollard merely stays in the crease and uses this reach to flay this. Padikkal dives forward and to his left but there's too much to do as it dips on him
good length and more at middle stump this time. Still not giving him pace. Steps out and punches to long-on
pulls over square leg. He waits in the crease this time and Chahal's slow loopy leg side bowling serves well from there. Deep in the crease for the pull

just clears short fine and deep square rushes to his left to put in a slide. Bit lazy from Dube at short fine, who sort of just watched it go without starting a sprint back. Udana does well to pull it back with a backhand flick. It was an attempted sweep
oh lovely bowling. Good length, tossed up slowly down leg side where Kishan has jumped. Forced to push it back down
he backs into the leg side and Chahal slides it at a length just inside the wide line. Can only get it down to long-off off the toe-end

swung over midwicket! That is fifty for Kishan on his comeback. Not been completely at his best, but he's in there with a gauge on the conditions. This is full outside off and now he knows that's going to be the line. Steps across and nails the slog
short and at leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket's right
good length and fired down leg side. Didn't look to me like Pollard got anything on that, but there's no wide call so there must have been pad
full and wide outside off again. Shuffles and drills to long-off
yorker length and wide outside off. Pushing it away and away from Kishan's favoured sweep shot. World-class from Zampa. He chops at this one and is beaten
good length and sliding onto leg stump. Flicked to deep square
good length at off stump, shuffles and flicks straight to square leg
nicely done. Floaty slower ball lands in the blockhole. Can't get the drive away. Trickles out to long-off
offcutter, floated at a full length outside off. Driven straight to extra cover
good length and just outside off, cut away from him. Patted to backward point
oh gets away with that. Slower ball dropped short at the hips. Pulled straight to short fine
slower short ball again, too wide outside off again
slower ball, short and very wide. Left alone
back-of-the-hand cutter to start off, good length outside off. Swept firmly to long-on
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square
full and wide outside off, pummeled off the front foot to long-off's left. Padikkal sprints across and taps it back in for long-on who was converging. Full stretch
low full toss at leg stump, whipped out to deep midwicket
full googly outside off, swept along the turf to long-on

it's high but not far enough! Zampa gets the big one. Good length on leg stump, the trademark leg-side slog from Hardik, with hardly a stride. He's not close to the pitch of that one and ends up scooping high. Taken at the line by Negi
googly, full outside off. Lofted drive to long-off's left
pristine drive, but straight to mid-off. Good length ball outside off
short and wide outside off, cut aerially to sweeper's right
slower short ball outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover
short and down leg side, too quick for him to connect on the pull
oh that is massive. Whew! Good length ball at middle stump, a step back into the crease and a proper connection on a proper slog. Way way over midwicket
short of a good length, cramps him at middle stump. Can only tap this back towards the bowler
pumped over his head first ball. Sweet hit. The pace on the ball helps. Full ball just outside off, half stride and good swing
good length at middle stump, shuffles and shovels into the vacant midwicket region
good length outside off, a late cut straight to short third man
good length and in the corridor. Uses the angle to whip to long-on's left
good length at off, shuffles and punches to long-on
check-drive back down the pitch. Good length ball outside off, grips and rises a touch as he shapes to flick
good length and into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
tempting and teasing. This is so much fun to watch. 79kph and dipping on a good length. Steps out and drives to long-on
good length and flat onto the pads. Flicked to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, steps out and is beaten in flight. Luckily for him this is the stock legbreak turning into him. Punches to long-on
good length and just outside off, flatter this time at 82kph. Punched to long-off
and just as I say that, he goes 73.5kph with this good length ball. Tempting Kishan to go aerial and clear the big leg side. He sweeps safely out to deep midwicket
full on off stump, gets forward and drives with the turn to long-off's left
googly, short of a good length on leg stump. Pushed out to long-on off the back foot
see ya! Bit of a helicopter shot this. Full toss pushed through at leg stump. Doesn't even swing at that really, it's just a flick. And yet it's gone 94 metres, in the midwicket region
good length, spinning into leg stump at 94kph. Flicked to deep midwicket off the front foot
