googly tossed up outside off, driven firmly to long-off
full and wide outside off, looks for the sweep and gets it off the thick inside edge to deep midwicket's left
good length slider on leg stump, hurriedly pushed into the vacant midwicket region
good length and pushed through at middle stump, driven down to long-on
mistimed slog as he tosses one up at middle stumps. Steps out and miscues it to long-on's left

taken at deep midwicket! This is such smart bowling from Chahal. Always seems to know exactly what to do when he's in RCB colours. Lobs this one up at 74kph, looping at a good length on leg stump. Tempts QDK into the slog sweep but with long boundaries and almost nothing in the air, that is a hard shot to play. Not to mention the overspin. Taken well inside the boundary
good length and turning into the pads. 71.8kph. Slowwww. Dabbed to deep square's right off the back foot
tossed right up at 79.8kph again, middle stump line. Driven to long-on
tossed up at middle stump, thumped down to long-on off the front foot
short and into leg stump. Mistimed pull out to deep square

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length and sliding right onto his pad, down leg side. Was looking to whip into the leg side
full on off stump, driven firmly off the front foot to long-off
good length, cramped at the stumps. Tapped to long-off off the back foot

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: inside edge again. Good length and sliding onto the stumps. QDK looking to make room for the punch into the off side
good length and just outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands, off the front foot
good length and just outside off, nicely forward to defend to mid-off's left
yorker at leg stump, jammed out to midwicket. 143.9kph
full on leg stump, flicked straight to mid-on
good length at leg stump line. 143.9kph, cops that on the thigh as he looks to flick
pulled over fine leg. He's good at this shot. Short and just above the hip and he's under it quickly and this is quickly over the rope off the bat. Ball's lost somewhere in the stands
full and just outside off, 140.5kph. Driven firmly to mid-on

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: nearly gets middle stump. Good length ball slides in as he backs away to try and cut. Inside edge to short fine

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: short and just outside off, cut to short third off the under-edge
good length and cramping him at a middle stump line. Hurriedly nudged to mid-on off the back foot
good length at middle, defended off the front foot
length and at the stumps, defended off the back foot
good length and sliding onto the pad, tapped to midwicket
full slower ball outside off, driven along the floor to sweeper

short_text: Udana to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower ball, short of a good length in the corridor. Beaten on the cut
good length and just outside off, runs it down to third man
whistles past point. Confident comeback into the IPL for Kishan. Too short and too wide from Udana this one

taken to his right by AB! 130kph, good length ball just outside off. Lands on the seam and gets big on him. Once again an angled bat from SKY and he can't control this attempted back foot tap into the off side. Thick edge taken easily and that must be the first non-Malinga Sri Lankan IPL wicket in ages
good length and raps him on the pad as he looks to chop this into the off side
good length outside off, big stride out as he drives this between cover and extra cover

short_text: Sundar to de Kock, no run
long_text: good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch

taken at deep midwicket! That hard length just behind good length again, and at a middle and off line. Not too much room for the pull but Rohit gets a decent connection on it anyway. Expect this is all height. The fielder takes it a comfortable distance inside the boundary

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: just short of a good length, cramping him outside off. Punched to extra cover

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length, at an off stump line. Tapped back towards the bowler off the back foot

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and spun into the pad. Flicked to midwicket off the back foot

short_text: Udana to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: just over cover! Full curving outswinger outside off. QDK doesn't lean into this drive. Slices at it and it's just past the fielder's lunge
good length and into the pads, 128kph, flicked to deep square

short_text: Udana to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and wide outside off, 131.2kph, looks to drive through the covers but through it early. Back down the pitch off the under-edge

short_text: Udana to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: lifted over fine leg. Short and gently up at a leg stump line. Just uses the angle and picks it up over short fine
short of a good length, 124.7kph, just outside off. On his toes to punch this to third man's left
good length and very wide outside off, left alone. Bit of movement away
good length and curved in at off stump. Flicked to deep square

pumped over his head for 200! Slower short ball again and how many times have seen already in this edition, the batsmen expecting those lengths? Dube does it again and he holds a strong base to slap this straight
slower short ball in the corridor. Shapes to pull but that dies on him and he has to arch back and guide this to short third
slow and short outside off, pulled off the toe-end to deep midwicket
whipped over square leg! These are poor lengths from Mumbai Indians over the last ten minutes. Good length and into the pads. Enough pace for Dube to wait and simply flick his wrists for the angle
down on his knee and crunched over wide long-off! Full slower ball with a lot of room outside off. Waits on the slower one as he drops to his left knee, and clubs from under it
slower short ball outside off, has a huge swing at that and is beaten. You could hear the swish of the air as he went after that

whooped into the second tier! What a connection. And yet another fifty for AB! Dropped short at a middle stump line. AB sets up with the front leg compressed and heaves from under this. It goes so high and about 90 metres back in the square leg direction. Bang off the middle of the bat
slower short ball at the body, mistimed pull down to long-on
clever. Slightly baffling tactics here. Third man is in and he goes short and across off stump. Dube just hangs back, uses the angle, and opens the face to bisect keeper and short third
short and into the pads. Hits the pull straight to short fine. Disappointed with himself for missing out

carved over his head. Bumrah misses on the yorker again. It's a low full toss just outside off. AB is crouching in wait and when it shows up in his arc, just swishes from inside the line. That was all about timing and placement
short and into the pitch at leg stump. Awkwardly pushed into midwicket off the back foot

drags it wayyyyyyyyy over fine leg! Too predictable from Boult. Yet another slower short ball. AB waits deep in the crease this time and is almost waiting for the hoick over square. It all works out perfectly and a good over ends with a six after all
slower short ball outside off again, can't find power on the pull shot. Pollard swoops on it to his left at long-on and keeps them to one
struck on the helmet. Slower short ball, loses his timing as he looks to play the hook. Pinged on the side of the head. On his feet and running
low full toss on the pads, flicked straight to short fine
slower short ball at leg stump, checks the pull, taps it down to short fine

can't clear Pollard. Slower short ball outside off, sits up for the pull and he pulls to try and clear the wide long-on boundary. Pollard skips and strides to his left, keeps the eyes on the ball and stretches up to take it

oh beautiful! That is a golf swing. Overpitched on off stump from Bumrah and that is asking for trouble. Such a gorgeous, balanced swing to hit it over the bowler. Competely still apart from the bat swing. Just gorgeous
backs into the leg side and cops this good length ball on his back knee. That'll sting. They'll sneak the leg bye
good length and raps him on the legs as he stays deep in the crease and looks for the glance. Deflected into the off side
whack! Over the wide long-on boundary with a back foot shot. Difficult, but not for this man. Slower ball dropped short, just outside off. Sits up and this is flat and over the boundary
short and wide outside off. Slashes and is beaten on the upper cut
drilled over extra cover. Waited, deep in the crease. It was full and wide and he just needed half a stride to get the weight forward and use the room to find that boundary
good length and a slower ball outside off, punched on the up to long-off's left
slower short ball at off stump, controlled pull to deep square's left
full and onto the pads, waits on that and sweeps it to the vacant long leg boundary
good length outside off, pushed into the off side with soft hands
chopped to the point boundary for his second fifty of the season. Short ball outside off, waits on it, makes room and makes sure to get it well behind square
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the front foot
good length on middle stump, deep in the crease to punch this to long-off
checks his sweep as Krunal slows it down. Good length ball at middle, was down for it too early. Awkwardly pats it into the leg side

finds the extra cover boundary with a loft. Anticipates Pandya's quick, full ball across him from around. He's adapted. And he's kept the front leg away to make room and opened the wrists to find the spot he wants
good length on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
whipped nonchalantly to the midwicket boundary. Good length and skidding into his legs. Stays deep in the crease and this flies off the bat as he punches it to long-on's right
full and drifted in at off stump, gets forward and slices it to sweeper's left
slower good length ball outside off, looks to chop behind point and gets an inside edge to the keeper
drags it over the long-on boundary this time! Full and in the corridor. He stays leg side of it with the front leg out of the way, but he has a good reach. And a good swing. Dominant batting
slaps it over mid-off! Slower length balls outside off, waits on it this time and nails the connection. First boundary since 8.4
nicely bowled. Slower short ball outside off, shapes to pull and is through it very early to be beaten
good length and just outside off, flowing drive on the rise to sweeper's right
short at leg stump, whipped to fine leg
googly, good length at middle stump. Watchfully pushed into the covers with an open face
good length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
dropped short outside off, steered to sweeper's left
beaten outside off. Good length and slows it right down outside off. Half-hearted push on the front foot from AB

chips it straight to extra cover. Good length and just outside off. Only half a stride from Kohli and a feeble push away from is body as this turns and stays a little steep. Loose shot at best, looked completely out of sorts against Chahar today. Easy take for Rohit
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
short and just outside off, punched straight to backward point off the back foot
good length and just outside off, shuffles and defends down the pitch
low full toss on leg stump, hurriedly flicked to midwicket's right. A dive from Rohit there but he only parries it away
good length and in at middle stump, uses the angle to turn it to fine leg
inside edge onto boot as he looks to push this through the covers. Good length and just outside off and he was on the front foot
offcutter, short at middle stump. On is toes and closes the face to tuck this to deep square
good length outside off, defended into the off side
squared him up and the leading edge falls short of extra cover. Once again, looks like Kohli expected this length ball to slide into him. Holds its line as he closes the face
length outside off, defended uppishly to extra cover
lbw appeal as he looks for the reverse sweep and fluffs it. Caught on the back leg. A good length ball turning into the corridor
thick outside edge to third man. Kohli was looking to pick this good length ball off the pitch. He was back for the one that comes in
googly, tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
oh hello Kedar Krunal Malinga. Goes low and very very side arm. Good length and skidding onto the pads. Flicked out to deep square
good length and wide outside off, left alone
nails the yorker length outside off and Padikkal lets it go. Was caught off guard there
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
low full toss at middle stump, driven to deep midwicket
cops it on the back leg. Good length ball at middle stump, loses shape on the attempted slog sweep
lobbed straight to long-off. Full slower ball wide outside off. He's sitting on the back foot trying to go over extra cover. But the pace throws that off and it's taken well inside the rope
falls short of fine leg. The short ball plan nearly works out. Up at his grille and he loses shape - and his bottom hand - as he leaps and has a flap at it
dropped short and down leg side, swivels to free up some room and drags this pull very fine
bouncer at a middle stump line. Ducks to let that go
short of a good length outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length at leg stump, whipped to fine leg off the back foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
googly, short and very wide outside off. Left alone
short outside off with a diagonal run up. Backs away and slaps it to long-off
good length at off stump, patted back down the pitch
finds the backward square boundary yet again and that is fifty for Finch. Finally gets into gear for RCB. This was dropped short and he was down on one knee to whip it past short fine
good length and into the corridor. Chopped to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
beaten. Quicker full ball outside off and Padikkal was caught on the back foot trying to have a slash at this
good length at leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
lofted to the extra cover boundary. Full and at off stump, clears the front leg and gets a clean swing inside-out
good length outside off, chopped to extra cover
beaten. Arm  ball in the corridor, was looking for the cut
full on off stump, driven along the floor to long-off
short and into the body. Looks to tuck into the leg side with soft hands for the single. Bumrah gets to it quickly
good length and down leg side, left alone
good length and in at off stump. Nails the timing on this drive on the rise, on the bounce to extra cover
slower ball, good length and at middle stump. Smothers it and drops this pitch side into the off side with soft hands
sweet connection on the pull. Short ball up at the ribs. Took his eye off that but went though with the pull. No reason to try and keep it on the ground because square leg was in
past the keeper off the thigh guard. Short ball getting big on him and he looked to fend that fine
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
now Chahar with his go-to mind-game. Goes from between the umpire and the stumps. Good length and at off stump. Well forward to block, is Finch
now through the covers! Dropped short once more, at a middle stump line. Finch winning the mind games. Backs away and lashes at it with a flat bat

gets in his head again and drags this over short fine this time. Backs into the leg side and then returns to his stance. Chahar bowls short at leg stump again. Finch gets low and turns it over the infield
follows him down leg but drops it short. Finch opens up the body and pulls it over the square leg fielder
good length and a legbreak, at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right
good length and sliding on at middle, onto the back foot and flicks to deep midwicket
good length and just outside off, 141kph, defended onto the pads off the inside edge
just clears mid-off who sprints backwards and whips the ball in as he tumbles over the boundary. Chahar is the man. Short ball just outside off and climbing up. He lofts it with an angled bat
full slower ball at off stump, jammed out to extra cover
good length slower ball on the pads, looks to flick but that deflects to the keeper off his leg
pulls in front of square. Short ball at middle stump, backs into the leg side and pulls cleanly this time. Also aerially, but well to the fielder's left
just clears mid-on. Short and wide, looks to cut him over the infield but is through it too soon. Bat turns in the hands
short outside off, cut to sweeper point
short and just outside off, lashed to sweeper point's right
sweeeet. Full ball at the stumps, keeps the front leg well out of the way, offers the full face and lofts this straight over the bowler. He's been waiting for that length all tournament
dropped at short midwicket. Big dive to the left from Rohit. Managed to get two hands on it too but couldn't keep it in the grasp as he went to floor. Short ball was pulled firmly and low to his left
beaten. Steps out again to have a whack. This short ball climbs across him
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and turns it down to third man

just short of the incoming deep square fielder. Short of a good length in the corridor, hurried onto him as he shaped to pull. He got too far underneath it to keep his shape and just lobbed it up. Krunal ran in a long way before putting in the dive to his left
outside edge over slip. Offcutter, just short of a good length. Finch had made the decision to step out and he did, and thew the bat at this
short of a good length, up at the hips on an off stump line, can't do more than defend that into the covers
good length and honing in for off stump. Tentative push out from the crease
a groan and down he goes! A short of a good length ball jumping in viciously from outside off. Hangs the bat out and gets an inside that deflects the ball straight into the box
short of a good length on leg stump, whipped out to deep square
good length and floated in, driven on the rise to mid-off

appeal for lbw but there might have been an inside edge on that and he might have been outside off when he was struck. Good length ball hooping in from outside off and he got locked on the front foot. Ah in fact that was rising over the stumps
short and at the hips. Onto his toes to nudge this to short fine's right
full and in at middle stump, flicked straight to short fine
neatly done. Full and at leg stump. Was looking to shape it away. That helped Padikkal as he waited on it and closed the face to send this through square leg
just evades the diving cover fielder! Full outswinger outside off, drives with hard hands and a tad early

short_text: Ashwin to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: and Curran uses all the experience. Makes room, goes with the turn, clears cover. Four. It is all over. The highest IPL run chase is up, and despite an innings that made you want to call the guy back. What a story this game is. Don't tell me to not get carried away
oh he sweeps. Ashwin slips in the googly after showing him the gap square on the leg side. Had to take the risk. Parag bit the bait. Bowled neck and crop
full, dipping, dug out

oh man, the greatest 40 minutes of commentary have come to an end. Tewatia has found deep midwicket with the pull, but he has made sure they win the match. Fifty-three off 31 after everybody wanted him thrown into the Gulf. Take a bloody bow, sir. You are a beautiful beautiful player. Storytellers kill for guys like you

oh he has reached fifty. Minutes ago, they were all asking for a compassion dismissal for him. This, right here, is the importance of keeping on fighting. Keep kicking. Short ball, outside off, and he has upper-cut it for a six. Well played, RT
goes for the yorker, dug out for a single to deep point

golf swing. This is a great day at the cricket. Nine off nine now. Amid this euphoria, this is pretty abysmal death bowling, I am sorry. Length ball, in the slot, on pace, and Archer ain't no Uthappa to be chipping it sweetly
which is just as well because Archer has hit the first ball for six. Short ball, on pace, and Archer loves him some on-pace short bowling. Over wicket for six

what a weak shot from Uthappa. Can you believe he has holed out to long-off at Sharjah to a ball right in his slot? This is just a chip. Need to be going harder at them. That is a poor shot. This ball is right in the sweet slot

wow Rahul bloody Tewatia. This is a story for the ages, son. What redemption. Now Uthappa has to give him strike. He has smacked a wide length ball over midwicket for another six. Now only 21 required in two overs
goes for the fifth. Slower length ball wide outside off, and he goes across the lines. Beaten

well, Rahul, what a player. You are a champion. You have fought through the worst of times. Give yourself something to celebrate. Gees across, shuffles early gets a wide low full toss, and sweeps it over midwicket for another flat six
make it three times. Sing your redemption songs. Cottrell pitches up, and he goes over wide long-off. Strike rate of 135 now. Game is on

whoa whoa whoa cricket you beauty. You keep fighting, the tide can turn. He gets a short of a length ball, stands his ground and swings to leg. Not off the absolute middle of the bat but enough to clear the short square boundary and onto the road
it is a small six but it is a six nonetheless. Hang in there, Rahul. Keep swinging. Cottrell follows him with a bouncer, but he manages to get inside the line to pull him flat over long leg
mid-off is up and Uthappa goes over the man to get four more as Shami pitches on a length
gets inside the line of a full toss, flicks it fine, Ashwin makes a dive at fine leg, and gets a bad bounce to allow the boundary
bouncer, toe-ended to extra cover. Still not getting caught
slogged across the line, no timing, gets just the couple
full and straight, looks for a couple with soft hands, but deep midwicket is alert to it

oh heartbreaking. Samson has perished. Shami is having a great IPL. Bouncer, not a slower ball, so Samson's idea is good to go for the ramp. But he gets extra bounce, and hits the glove before hitting the bat. And then the toe end of the bat, and then Rahul takes the catch
drilled down the ground for a single to long-off. A good result if it is not a six. At least he has the strike
his batting is communicating to KXIP all right. Maxwell gets into the slot again, and he smashes it over midwicket for six more. That's 20 for the over
Maxwell goes back of a length, worked behind square for a couple
and now Samson has refused the single. That will make it more awful for Tewatia, but I think he wants to take the toll of Maxwell
make it two. Maxwell is in the slot. There is life in this chase yet. Another effortless swing. Hardly any anger. All timing. On top of the grandstand behind deep midwicket
cool cat Samson. Lovely effortless six. Flat length ball, and he goes over extra with nonchalance

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: oh why the reverse just after hitting one down the ground? Beaten again

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, SIX runs
long_text: relief. Sweet relief. But he needs more to feel better. Jumps at him, goes down the ground, and gets a straight six

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: looks for the slog, gets an outside edge, and doesn't even get the single because short third is charging in

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: picks the googly, wants to go over long-off, but is not good enough to make a connection
flat, into the pads, whipped to deep square for one
and the poor guy is trying everything. Reverse hit goes to extra cover for one
the worst result. he has hit one in air, but there is no power behind it, and long-off is straight enough to keep them to one

oh a leading edge on a full toss. Not sure why he didn't try to smack this. Anyway it falls short of the charging deep cover. He takes just the single despite the misfield. Seems to have switched off a little
slower ball, really full, drilled to long-on for one
oh the walls seem to be closing in. He tries the sweep off Neesham ans is hit on the pad. Doesn't get out, doesn't get off strike
on-pace, and Samson won't be happy that he has taken just the single to deep point
let's not be distracted from a Samson masterclass. Wide length ball, he waits for it, and he has driven it over extra cover for a smooth six

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: tries the slog weep this time, and is beaten wide outside off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: picks the googly again, looks to go over long-off, but is beaten again
another googly but this is too wide outside off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Tewatia, no run
long_text: googly first up, and there will be more. He has picked the googly but is beaten by the extra bounce
tossed up wide, stays away from his hitting zone, Samson hits wide of long-off, but Agarwal makes an excellent save after a fumble. Keeps them down to one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: tossed up wide outside off, beats his reverse sweep. Samson under pressure to manufacture shots now
driven on the up, straight of extra cover, gets two to wide long-off
Tewatia laves his crease, Maxwell shortens his length. Another dot. Two overs without a boundary. Maxwell bowling a great spell
down on his knees to ramp him, gets bat on it, but there isn't enough pace on the ball to get him more than one

dropped at wide long-off. That Tewatia promotion nearly brings about the Samson wicket as he plays a frustrated shot to a shortish ball that cramps him. Bishnoi, diving to his left at long-off, drops him
another sweep but Maxwell is not giving him a length to hit hard. Just the single to deep square
spears it into the pads, and is happy to concede a leg-bye
length ball, into the pads, swept to deep backward square for one
full toss, and he has shanked it to deep midwicket for one. Seems like Tewatia's batting prowess has been overestimated by RR here
slower short ball, hit in the air towards deep midwicket. Heart-in-mouth stuff. Doesn't carry to the fielder
did he go on-pace there? At any rate, he has bowled too full, and Samson has drilled him through extra cover for four. First boundary in 10 balls
slower ball, low full toss, hit straight to long-on for one
slower ball, really full, hit hard to the straight extra cover
and now he yorks Samson. Just the single
mis-hit down to long-on for one as Maxwell doesn't let him get under it. First over without a boundary this innings
tries the reverse hit, and there is a sound as the ball passes his bat. Rahul can't catch it, but you can't expect the keeper to take catches when someone is attempting a full-blooded reverse
looks to open the face, doesn't get any room. Another dot
spears this into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
low full toss, driven wide of the flying Maxwell for a single
nicely tossed up, middle and leg, defended back to him

Smith picked his spots in that previous Neesham over, but it is not so easy when the field is spread out. Neesham keeps bowling wide legcutters to him. He looks to go over the off side but he has to manufacture all the pace. He can't. Caught at deep cover
short of a length, slower ball, pushed to deep midwicket for one
oh man, this bouncer is so slow it has come back down after reaching twice Smith;s height, all that before crossing the wicket. So he has no choice but to pull it. Brings up the fifty
back to slower legcutters, pulled down to long-on for one
seems like Neesham's first on-pace delivery, and Samson loves it. Unleashes a square-drive on the up, through point and square of deep cover
slower legcutter, dropped at his toes for a single
back of a length, middle and leg, bunted into the leg side to look for two but Ashwin gives a great chase and keeps them down to one
short, the ball sits in the surface so Samson has to adjust. He does that and drops it into the covers for one
okay Pooran can't stop this one. Ashwin gets into the slot. You can't do that to Pooran on this track. He lofts him over long-off for a huge six

sensational fielding. Pooran. That needs to go to ESPN Plays of the Day. Samson has pulled this short-of-a-length delivery that is not there for the pull. Samson skies it but the boundaries are not big enough. Pooran dives full length over the rope, catches it, knows he is over the rope, and finds the time to actually flick it back while in air. All of this without flicking the rope when he jumps, and releasing the ball before he hits ground
chipped back over his head but long-on is very straight
flat, short of a length, hit in the air to deep cover for one

looks to finish the over with a flat defensive delivery, but Smith gets an outside edge for what seems like a four, but Cottrell puts in a huge dive after giving it chase from short thrid man to keep them down to two

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, no run
long_text: just short of that slot. Smith pushes it back to him. Can he flight it into that spot again and again? He might get a wicket
wrong'un, short of a length, whipped to deep square for one
back to back of a length, punched to extra cover for one

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Smith, SIX runs
long_text: and Smith shows he is up for it if the leggie pitches it up in his slot. Especially when the leggie doesn't turn his legbreak. Slogged over wide long-on for six more
Bishnoi is not flighting anything any time soon. Flat outside off, punched to deep cover for one
another slower ball, wide, and allows Smith to throw his hands at it. He might not have got it off the middle, but has enough bat on it to send it over short third man
down the wicket to punch this slower shortish ball between cover-point and extra cover. This is the legcutter, but there is no purchase for Neesham
slower again, back of a length, hacked into the ground, gets a couple square of deep midwicket
looks for the ramp, gives away the sign too early, and Neesham bowls really wide to hit his pad

another slower ball, but smartly played by Smith. He doesn't look to hit a six. Just opens the face and chips him from in front of the stumps and over cover-point. This is a good ball that has been placed for four
Smith lines him up for a slog first ball, but he seems to have bowled a slower ball that has been hit to mid-on

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: back of a length, stays away from the Samson loft down the ground. Draws a dot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: backs away to see if he can put Bishnoi off his length. And he pulls even though this is not very short. The mis-hit has enough in it to carry over the leaping midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: quicker, flatter, Samson looks to pull but this is not short enough. Hit on the pad but headed down leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: and just as I said it, he bowls in the slot. And he doesn't turn the legbreak either. So Samson lines him up and lofts him back over his head for his 100th IPL six

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: on a length, quick, punched to cover. Not one ball in the slot so far
wide down the leg side as he looks to cramp him up

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
long_text: quick legbreak, Rare. He doesn't bowl it that often. Defended back to him
nonchalance. That tells you how good this pitch is. Seems like a lazy flick in the air to a length, but it carries over midwicket. That gets him three
Smith is looking to ramp this, the ball turns out to be short, he still goes on with the shot, and ends up cue-ending to deep square leg for one
slower, short of a length, he looks to shuffle to ff to help this past short fine again, but is hit on the pad
full toss, on the pads, and Smith won't refuse a gift twice in a row. If Shami is going to bowl straight, he needs to send fine leg back
slower ball, short, on the stumps, and Smith knows he can send this over short fine for four, but he misses out
crisp sound of the bat. Don't worry about that. Slogs it from outside off, over midwicket. Can't be bowling on-pace length to him in this mood
short of a length, not much room, punched to point from where Pooran lets rip a throw at the non-striker's end. Awfully close to Smith's head, who has to take evasive action
shuffles across to line up a length ball, and even though it turns out to be a slower one, he hits through the line and goes back over his head
slower ball, does him in, beats him outside off as he looks to push at it
phew. Samson seems like that innings the other day hasn't yet ended. The first legal delivery he faces, and he belts a back-of-a-length ball over long-on for a six. From well outside off
starts with a wide length ball, and this seams to have gone away off the seam. Called wide
the Cottrell salute comes out. This is a nice shot to a length ball on off, across the line but that is fair game. He has timed it well, but Sarfaraz takes a sharp low catch square leg
wide length ball, Buttler makes a good connection, but can't get beat short extra cover
this is definitely a slog as Shami pitches on a length again, but he is beaten on the inside edge
shot Smithy. He is playing a different innings to the kinds we are accustomed to seeing. He shuffles across and lofts this full ball back over Shami's head. He is almost slogging them
into the pads, worked to leg for one
walks down the wicket, they go up for a catch as the ball seams away and beats him. Rahul lets out a celebrappeal, but he is ruled not out, and they don't review. Seems it has gone off Buttler's arm
another bouncer gone too high. Called wide
dipping slower yorker, draws an appeal from Shami, but Rahul has collected this well down the leg side so it can't have hit him in front. Just flicks the inside half of the foot
a length ball, into the pads, placed in front of deep square for two
short of a length, wide, slower, he looks to run it past that wide slip but can't beat him
wide length ball, Smith stands tall and punches this on the up. Through extra cover for four more
another wide down the leg side as Cottrell looks to cramp him up
wide down the leg side
both his deep fielders are square on the leg side, and he has pierced them. Short of a length, and he has flicked this fine of deep square leg. In the air, mind, so you need precision on that
oh Smith has wasted this. Wide full ball, but Smith's feet are stuck and he doesn't get close to it, and mis-hits this to mid-on
slightly short of a length, slight swing back, defended to leg
slight shape back in, takes the inside edge for a single to fine leg

the quicker short one, at 142ks, and Pooran gives Archer the taste of the medicine he himself gave Ngidi. Backs away to pull him for a flat six to midwicket to take 18 off this final over. Ideally, though, he shouldn't have been bowling this ball, but the umpire had other ideas
slower bouncer, 127ks, Pooran backs away to pull, but connects only with the dry Sharjah air
and he cramps him up with a quick length ball, and the bottom edge comes back to him
high full toss, and Pooran makes room to crash this over point for four more
Pooran gets all of this. On-pace length ball, and he clears the front leg and lofts him over long-off for another big six
mis-hit down to long-off for a single
oh that is harsh. This is an excellent short ball under the armpit, but Maxwell has shuffled inside its line, and it misses the leg stump by one stump's width and he has called it a wide

Uthappa has dropped a skier. He has been off colour in the field all night. On-pace length ball, right in the slot, Pooran opens up the front leg to leg, but gets a massive top edge. Uthappa has ages to catch this but he misjudges it and ends up diving at extra-cover circle. Doesn't even get a hand to it

short_text: Tom Curran to Pooran, SIX runs
long_text: he gets the yorker wrong as you will do it every now and then, and Pooran smacks this low full toss over wide long-on for a huge six over the grandstand and into the streets of Sharjah
lovely wide yorker to follow it up with, and all Maxwell can do it get a single

short_text: Tom Curran to Maxwell, no run
long_text: another dot as Maxwell tries a reverse ramp but can't catch up with the line of the ball outside off

dropped or saved his face?. Slower shortish ball well outside off, Pooran swipes across it, sending it back at Curran's face, who just puts his hand up to preserve his well-being. Doesn't attempt to catch it, and rightly so
low full toss, cramps him up, Maxwell mis-hits it to wide long-on for one

just reward for Rajppot. He has hardly erred with his wide lines to Rahul. He shuffles wide this time to try to go over point but doesn't get power behind this open-face shot, and is caught at the square third man boundary
yes he does go there, and Rahul tries the reverse ramp. There is no pace on it so he tries to whip him, and gets hit on the back of the bat
he bowls a full toss that cramps him up, and goes just for the single to long-on
back to bowling wide, but Maxwell manages to reach it. It just short of being a yorker, and Maxwell steers it over short third man
Rajpoot blinks. He sees Maxwell to off again, and goes straight this time. Maxwell wants just that because the field is set on the off side. He hits him over the infield on the leg side
and he succeeds here again. A wide slower ball, beats the Maxwell heave
slower short ball, cut away but straight to deep point. Only the single. Another excellent over from RR. Just 13 off the last two overs
slower legcutter, 111ks, short of a length, on off, pushed into the off side for one

short_text: Tom Curran to Rahul, no run
long_text: lovely yorker, 131ks, just outside off, and it kicks off the crease, and Buttler does really well to collect this. Great reaction

follows him as he attempts a yokrer. He ends up bowling a low full toss but he has successfully managed to cramp Agarwal, taking his arms away from him. Agarwal still attempts a six, but ends up holing out to deep midwicket

short_text: Tom Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: in the slot, on-pace, and that is not good enough. Agarwal clears the front leg and hits this straight of the diving long-off
high full toss, on the pads, hit to deep square for one
no boundary in the 16th over with the score 178 for 0. That is excellent bowling, and to his plan. Ends with a wide low full toss for a single to deep cover
short of a length, wide, slow, and he hits him back over his head for a single
wide yorker, lovely bowling, squeezes under his bat
stays wide, hiding the ball from their hits, gives just the single to deep cover
short of a length, wide, away from him, punched straight to extra cover
wide length ball, drilled to deep cover for one
wide on the crease, bowls wide, called wide

Agarwal's first IPL hundred, and he has got there with improvisation. This shortish ball sits in the pitch, but he manages to loft it over extra cover and make it land between deep cover and long-off. Not the best timing as you expect but the placement is perfect. Gets a long hug from Rahul
short of a length, cut away for a single
sharp turn from outside leg, and it stays low too. Rahul keeps it out, but that might interest Bishnoi and Ashwin
short of a length, wide, cut away to deep cover. As well as you can bowl in these circumstances
punched to extra cover for a single
and he draws another mis-hit. He has managed to hurry Rahul into the pull, and there is a deep midwicket in place, but it somehow goes wide of the man diving there
tries the short quick one again, 139ks, but his short fine is up and this is not smart bowling with that field, Agarwal gets inside the line, and helps this over short fine
leading edge but it flies wide of cover for one. This is a slower ball
lovely pull. Short of a length, straight, he gets inside the line, and sends this over square with his front leg in the air
full, quick, pushed to extra cover
slower ball, back of a length, Agarwal backs away to drive this in front of deep cover where Samson makes a diving save and manages to stay in
short of a length, no room, on-pace, gets a single to point
wrong'un, just short of the driving length. Rahul goes back to work this to leg for one more
slider, short of a length, punched to deep midwicket
quicker, seam-up, beats him on the drive outside off

there is no justice on this ground for bowlers. He seems to have beaten Agarwal in flight by bowling wide outside off, but Agarwal doesn't panic. He keeps his shape, and goes inside-out with the loft to clear wide long-off. Off the toe end
short of a length, wide, trying to stay away from him. Called wide
slows it down, bowls a low full toss, mis-iht to long-off for one
Rahul looks for the extra-cover drive but can't beat the man

short_text: Tom Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, 108sk, wide outside off, Agarwal changes his shot and has the time to do so. He crashes this in front of the diving man at point for four more
yorker, dug out to mid-off, takes a single to reach yet another fifty
slower bouncer, he beats the hook, but has been wided

short_text: Tom Curran to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Curran goes for the wide yorker, and misses it by inches. Rahul short-arms this with an open face, over point for four more
slower ball, low full toss, driven to long-off for one
opens the face to get a single to point this time

short_text: Tom Curran to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: and there the game plan changes. Now they will go both ends. Slower legcutter, Rahul waits on it, and pulls this short-of-a-length delivery nonchalantly over midwicket
slowr ball again, 109ks, on a length, middle and leg, pushed into the leg side for an easy two
tries the slower bouncer, but bowls a big wide on height
slower ball, 111ks, cramps him up again, Rahul takes a single to leg this time
he cramps Rahul up again. And he is looking only for singles. And this time Uthappa is sharp at point
digs this one in, Agarwal is looking to pull, but gets a thick edge over point for a single
this will rub it in. Slower offcutter, Agarwal throws his bat at it, and the thick outside edge flies over short third man for four. Agarwal should not have been on strike

he will be upset that they have allowed Rahul the single. That is what he wants to do to get Agarwal on strike, and Unadkat has bowled a good delivery to cramp him. But the man at point, Uthappa, misfields
on a length, on off, Rahul drives with an open face, gets a single off the outer half of the bat
slower short ball again, 109ks, pulled to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Tom Curran to Agarwal, no run
long_text: Parag saves a few with a dive at extra cover as Agarwal punches this shortish delivery

short_text: Tom Curran to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, cuts in, it seems he has done Agarwal in, but he manages to change the shot so well that he punches it to the left of deep square for four more
short of a length, outside off, cut to third man for one
on a length, into the pads, worked away to deep square
Rahul continues the anchor role. Looks for a single but finds the man at cover
short of a length, hurried into the pull, gets a single to long-on

Gopal can't claim moral victory in this one. Chips down the wicket, not exactly to the pitch of the ball but that only allows his room to swing his arms. And he smacks this clean over his head for another six
picks the googly off the pitch, but adjusts in time and puts it in a hole on the leg side for a couple

brave bowling, but Agarwal goes to his fifty with not the cleanest hit of the night. Gopal seems to have beaten him in the flight but even though it goes off the outside half of the bat, it clears long-off easily
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
flighted outside off, Rahul takes a single to deep cover
looks to cut this, but gets a bottom edge in front of point
oh he pulls the length back, and Agarwal is quick to pull him over midwicket for four more
now he has smoked it clean. Stays beside the line of a flighted legbreak, and lofts it back over his head, and hits into the insignia of Sharjah Cricket Ground at the top of the grandstand
quicker, into the pads, and he goes back to pull it. Another mis-hit, but he has managed to place it in front of deep square leg. Another six
starts off with a slow flighted delivery, pushed to deep cover for one
short of a length, punched down to long-on. Excellent first over over Gopal

another mis-hit but he nearly gets a six. Once again he is beaten in the flight, but the shank nearly clears long-on. Parag at the fence jumps to try to catch it and lob it up for a rebound, but doesn't manage to take it clean. However, he makes sure he doesn't concede six and sends the ball back in before he lands beyond the rope
slower through the air, on middle and leg, driven to long-on
draws a mis-hit. He has tossed it up, but the ball is shorter than what Agarwal expects. Still he has mis-hit it so much that it falls well short of long-on
tossed up nicely, Rahul looks to sweep, looks like he will be beaten but he gets a bottom edge at the last moment
on a length, no turn, punched between deep square and deep midwicket for a rare two at this ground
slower legcutter, 129ks, sits in the pitch, moves away a touch, squares him up slightly. Defended back to him
wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, pushed to the adjacent wicket for a single
short of a length, slower ball, 128ks, bounces at him, defended to point
short of a length, not much width, but he manages to send it past the diving fielder at point
looks to run this down but sends it straight to point
spot on this time. Close to the stumps, on a length, no room, defended back to him
good news for Rajpoot: the free hit hasn't gone for six. Bad news: it has gone for four. Short of a length, not wide, but Rahul gets enough power with an open face to clear point

big wide down the leg side, Buttler fails to make a clean connection as it bounces in front of him so they run an extra run. Oh hello, it is a no-ball too. So he has to change his signal: no-ball takes precedence over the wide. So we have a free hit coming up
on a length, just outside off, he has sweeper cover to keep them down to one. KL Rahul gets back the orange cap
into the pads, worked away to leg for one

and now the deft touch. Rajpoot goes wide on the crease, and but he provides Agarwal width with this shortish delivery. He opens the face to send this to the right of the diving Archer at short third man
slower short ball, 122ks, Agarwal makes the necessary adjustment after shaping up for the hook. He delays his shot, and pulls this over wide mid-on
short of a length, stump to stump, worked to leg for one
slower ball to end the over, 125ks, Rahul goes back to drop this at his toes and sneak in a single
short of a length, 138ks, it sits in the surface, Rahul has no room, he hits this straight to cover
finally a dot. Finally Archer gets the line, length and pace right. Not full enough to be driven. Pushed to cover
4, 4, 4. Wide full ball, and this time he throws his bat at it knowing the field restrictions. Over point he goes
Archer bowls on-pace now, but pitches it too full. Rahul is in too good a touch to be sparing these plum half-volleys. He is pinging the cover fence
lovely cover-drive. Archer starts off with a slower ball, at 106ks, and Rahul nonchalantly drives this length ball through cover
short of a length, straight, Agarwal opens the face on it, but can't beat point
on-pace short ball, and Agarwal has already hit the second six of the night. Makes room as Unadkat looks to cramp him up, and then he swivels to pull it square on the leg side
Buttler needs to learn from Dhoni and get his legs behind such balls. Slower bouncer, too high, bounces in front of Buttler and he lets it through
slower offcutter again, 113ks, this time he drops it in front of point for a single
beautiful push-drive through the covers, but the sweeper cover will keep them down to two
slower offcutter, 114ks, Agarwal adjusts and pushes this to sweeper cover for one

not a bad ball but Agarwal is quick to rock back and pull this short-of-a-length ball over midwicket for four. Not the best connection because the length is not there to be pulling, but he takes advantage of the field restrictions
on a length, around off, pushed wide of mid-on for one
beaten. Agarwal looks to open the face late to play this fine, but this short-of-a-length ball hits the seam and holds its line
wide on the crease, short of a length, pushed straight to cover
and that is six no. 1. Agarwal doesn't bother with a sighter from Rajpoot. He backs away and lofts a length ball over mid-off. Not even off the middle of the bat. More of the toe end
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one
wide length ball, Rahul goes back to punch this square, but straight to point
slower offcutter, 114ks, Agarwal looks to run it down for a single, but ends up playing it to point
tucked away off the hip to deep square leg
extra bouncer, Rahul is surprised by it as the ball hits him on the maker's name. Kicks off from just short of a length. He manages to keep it down
slight seam from a length just outside leg, Agarwal squared up a touch, but plays with soft hands for a single
beaten. Seams to have seamed away after pitching on a length, on middle and leg. Agarwal pushes without conviction, and fails to make connection
short of a length, angling towards off, Rahul drops it at his toes and takes a single
finished with a boundary. Low full toss just outside off, stays leg side of it again and thumps it past the bowler's feet
slapped a long way over long-on! Back of a length offcutter comes at a nice swinging height, and swing he does, with feet firmly rooted outside leg stump
punched sweetly but into the stumps at the other end. Good length ball sliding in at the stumps, a disdainful drive through the line, splits the stumps
bouncer down leg side, left alone
full and just outside off. Makes too much room backing into the leg side, mistimed drive to extra cover
full and on the pads. Looks to whip into the leg side, cops it on the front pad
slower length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length outside off, punched down the ground to long-off
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on's right
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of length on middle stump, exposes all his stumps and chops this to deep backward point
good length on middle, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
Sharma out of the ground! Good length ball fired in at off stump, he's down the pitch quickly and uses his reach and long arms to pump it straight over the bowler

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR runs
long_text: bisects deep midwicket and deep square. Full at middle stump, gets low and with the front leg in the leg side. Creates a nice swinging arc and hits this where he wants to. That's the end of Rashid tonight
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
low full toss at middle stump, miscued reverse sweep and a half chance with their running but Natarajan can't collect cleanly at short third
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: short outside off, cut to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: good length outside off, driven to extra cover
enough patting it around. Morgan clears the front leg in wait of the full slow ball outside off and creams it over the cover boundary
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
overpitched on leg stump, drilled out to deep midwicket where there's a fumble
full slower ball outside off, looks to drive off side, it ends up at long-on
slower length ball outside off, punched down to long-on
slower length ball outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
good length at middle, punched to long-on

short_text: M Nabi to Gill, no run
long_text: good length outside off, steps out and punches to midwicket
good length at the stumps, punched to long-on's left
good length and down leg side, beaten on the glance

short_text: M Nabi to Morgan, no run
long_text: good length and down leg side, left alone
good length outside off, punched to long-on off the front foot
low full toss on middle stump, driven down to long-on
good length, just outside off. Punched to extra cover
short and up in the corridor. Hooked to long leg
full toss on leg stump, punched uppishly past the bowler to long-on

brilliantly placed to bring up his fifty. Short of a good length, just outside off. Allows that to slide across him and slices past point off the front foot. Doing a fine job tonight, everything they'd have asked
yorker at leg stump, jammed out to deep midwicket
good length on off, punched on the up to long-off's right
good length at middle, punched to long-on
good length on middle, punched to long-on's left and top game awareness from Morgan to come back for the second
good length and sliding on at leg stump. Looks to punch through cover, gets a thick inside edge out to deep midwicket
short at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: M Nabi to Morgan, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length outside off, steps out and can only manage pad on this. Into the off side and they sneak a run
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
full and down leg side, beaten on the flick
googly, short at leg stump. Onto the back foot to tap into midwicket
good length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: carted to long leg's left. Full ball sliding in at leg stump, gets down and good enough connection on the sweep off the inside half of the bat

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: good length, googly at leg stump. Flicked to midwicket from the crease
good length at off stump, pushed to short third with soft hands
full on middle stump, nicely forward to drive to long-on's right
good length at off stump, driven on the rise to long-off

short_text: M Nabi to Gill, no run
long_text: good length outside off, driven back to the bowler
low full toss at off stump, punched out to long-off
short outside off, punched down to long-off
good length, into the pads. Flicked with the angle to short fine's right
full and onto the pads, flicked to deep square's right
full on middle stump, neatly driven to long-on off the front foot
good length on off stump, tapped to long-off's left off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, FOUR runs
long_text: reverse ramp and well clear of short third man. Expert stuff. Good length ball pushed across him and he uses the angle to lift it over that fielder

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: full on middle stump, driven back at the bowler

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, driven to extra cover
googly, good length and into the pads. Whipped to deep square off the back foot
short and just outside off, chopped to point
just short of deep square! His dangerous affair with the slog sweep continues. Drags this good length ball from outside off, it's flat and dipping on Bhuvi
full on middle stump, driven to long-on

short_text: M Nabi to Gill, no run
long_text: short of a length at middle, punched straight to midwicket off the back foot
good length and sliding into middle stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, driven to long-on
good length at off stump, driven on the rise to long-off
lbw appeal as he looks to sweep again. They won't review. Probably pitched outside leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: bat-pad as he gingerly gets forward to try and defend this good length ball on middle stump

short_text: Rashid Khan to Morgan, no run
long_text: full outside off, swept straight to short fine

big appeal and given! Karthik doesn't pick the googly. And he doesn't take the review .oh hang on, the timer seemed to have gone past zero, but he has a review after all. Wondering if I missed his signal earlier, because this is very odd otherwise. Anyway, he was pushing forward, playing for a corridor line on this length ball. Was caught on the back leg right in front of middle. That takes the top of leg says tracker and well, they'll lose the review that was taken in bizarre circumstances. Certainly the TV timer had burnt out. Is there another timer on the field? Can be the only explanation
good length and quickly through at middle stump. Flicked uppishly to deep midwicket
short at the hips, glanced to fine leg

and now behind square on the off side. Predictable again, Khaleel. Short of a length at middle and off. Backs away once more and rolls his wrists on top of this, cuts into the floor, beats point to the right

slaughtered. He knows exactly where Khaleel is going to bowl this. Short and at middle stump. Some extra juice with the fingers rolled over it too. All it does is give him more time and he slaps it over extra cover
short and just outside off, deflected to backward point off the back foot
short slower ball at the hips. Flicked to square leg's right. DK wants the run and doesn't get a response from Gill. Dives at the other end as the throw misses
short at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, solidly punched back down the pitch
full and wide outside off, beaten on the attempted drive

caught behind! Feet rooted from Rana this time. I suppose one can lose discipline when it's coming off so nicely previously. This is good length, lands on the seam and goes away marginally outside off. No forward stride and that's a drive away from the body. Thin edge and some Test match flashbacks for Saha
easy. Too easy. Full toss on middle stump, offers the full face and bisects non-striker and the stumps. He's probably practiced this with two cones since he was 12. Poor from Natarajan
yorker at the toes, jammed to midwicket's right
good length on leg stump, flicked straight to short fine
short at middle stump, gets tall on that and pulls into the turf to find deep midwicket
good length and slams the pad as he looks for another glance
nice diving stop from Saha. Good length ball into the pads, misses on the glance but it's off his pad. Saha gets his right hand to it
cut wide of third man. Short and wide from Khaleel, Rana goes intentionally aerial. Easy runs

oh beautiful. He's come out with some rhythm tonight. Everything just connecting sweetly. Short and in at middle and leg. Leaps off his feet and turns this off the hips. It blazes out to the square leg boundary
top edge over the slip.Slammed short of a length just outside off, was looking to turn that behind square leg with a hook. No position for it, but perfectly in position to get runs at third man
full slower ball on the pads, flicked to midwicket's left
easy catch for midwicket. No run. Full ball on middle and he'll be disappointed not to get this chip over that infielder

awkward half-pull as this short ball gets big. Definitely an area teams are targeting him. He backs out of this pull from outside off, and it's a bunt towards mid-on. But the siren has gone off, which means Bhuvi has overstepped
good length outside off, pushed into the off side with soft hands
punched between extra cover and mid-off. Timing spot on so far for Rana! Just short of a good length and he's behind the line once more, lovely balance and the full face offered
rises past the outside edge. Good length ball gets steep as he has a push outside off
sumptuous. Good length and across him. A bit of a shuffle of the back leg to get his head on top of that, and then opens the face on the punch to beat point
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

oh how did he do that? Ridiculous ease. This is a good length ball starting outside off and angling away, he has no business clearing long-on. But he does. Steps out, doesn't let that run away from and simply has a flap and gets it off the middle
short at off stump, defended to point off the back foot
short of a length and pushed across the corridor, left alone

sliced and mid-off takes it. Warner himself, and he is ecstatic. Slammed in short of a length at a middle stump line. Looks for the pull but this has stayed a touch low. It's a feeble slice in the end. Warner with a loud call and that is another failure for Narine against bowling that isn't good length or fuller
short of a length and climbing up at his hips. Backs away a touch but is forced to defend off the back foot
good length and some shape away from off stump. Forces him to defend into the covers
good length and into the stumps, steps out and taps to mid-on
flicked aerially and quite deliberately through square leg. Good length ball slanted into him and an easy put away
good length and swung away outside off. Left alone
full inswinger at the stumps, sweetly timed flick, straight to midwicket
graceful to start. Short of a good length outside off, some shape away. Nicely onto the front foot to drive on the rise between cover and extra
beaten. Full tosses the way for Russell until those last four balls. Slammed in, going across the corridor and rapidly past the attempted hook. DK misses the gather

missed run out at the non-striker's end. But another mean short ball across Sharma that he has no answer to. Well beaten on the cut. Karthik lobs it to Russell, who catches, turns and has a big throw at the stumps to miss
sliced but safe in the leg side. Slower short ball, looks for the pull but is through it early
rapid and past his ribs. Short and across the corridor. Looks to use the pace and nudge it to third man, but that's long past him

short_text: Russell to M Nabi, 1 run, OUT
long_text: Saha run out at the striker's end. Full ball outside off, Nabi mistimes the drive, along the floor to long-off. Saha wants the second but is sent back. Puts in a dive but he won't make it. A forgettable innings for him, couldn't get anything away tonight

short_text: Russell to M Nabi, FOUR runs
long_text: expertly done! Low full toss pushed across off stump  but Nabi has jumped into line and with a quick wristy flick, he's sent that to the deep square boundary

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, no run
long_text: oh that looked wide. Another slower ball at a good length, just wide of the marker in my opinion. Saha was reaching a long way out to miss that one
attempted offcutter, good length, but very wide

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, no run
long_text: beaten. This was in the slot. Just outside off, shuffled and was close to the line. But swung from too far outside the line. Beaten on the inside edge

short_text: Shivam Mavi to M Nabi, 1 run
long_text: top edge to short fine's right. Another slower short ball, this one up above the right shoulder. Has a swish but can't control that. Would have had a wide if he didn't connect on it

short_text: Shivam Mavi to M Nabi, no run
long_text: beaten. Slower short ball again and he's through the cut too soon

short_text: Shivam Mavi to M Nabi, FOUR runs
long_text: oh, clobbered. Short of a good length and sitting right up outside off. Awful tennis forehand, wonderful cricket shot. Well in front of sweeper cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to M Nabi, no run
long_text: slower short ball just outside off, beaten on the pull

dropped at deep backward point! Nagarkoti, rated very highly as an outfielder, has lost this completely. It's a full toss on leg stump, he was looking to hit over midwicket. Leading edge floats out to Nagarkoti who comes in and back, then hangs on for a bit and lunges back and to his left again as this evades him and bounce over the boundary
full and very wide outside off, can't get bat after reaching out at that
full and wide outside off, shuffles and drives to sweeper cover

awkwardly bunts a high full toss back to the bowler. Umpires are checking if it was above the waist. Straight into his mid-riff, that. He was hopping and lobbed it straight back up for Russell. It's about thigh high. Pandey will go back. He was shaping to play the ramp. Caught off guard, but it is a legal delivery
full and pushed wide across him, reaches out and just manages to get bat on it. Along the floor to sweeper cover
low full toss outside off, shuffles and slugs along the floor to deep midwicket
looks to scoop but ends up slicing this low full toss to short fine's right off the high part of the bat
beaten. Good length and wide outside off, can't connect on the slash
full outside off, backs into the leg side but is forced to hurry and get a bat on this. Sliced to third man's right
offcutter, short and just outside off. Chopped to sweeper's left to bring up his fifty
just beats mid-off! Unconventional shot - a flat-batted jab with the front leg in the leg side. It's short and rising outside off, and he pushes out at it. Between bowler mid-off
inside edge past the stumps. Slower short ball, wide outside off. Completely miscues the pull
short and just outside off, chopped to backward point

just past deep midwicket! Good length, googly outside off. Steps out and swings through the line with some hope. It's off the inside half of the bat and just lifts over the boundary as the fielder runs to his right
left alone and that is just inside the wide line. Quicker one delivered with the fingers, wide outside off
good length, googly. Into the pads. Flicked to deep square
quicker one, dropped short outside off. Pulled firmly to deep midwicket's left
good length at middle, steps out and hoicks along the floor to deep square
full outside off, looks to crash it through the off side, gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
short of a length and turning away outside off, tucked down to long-on off the back foot
good length at off stump, backs away and mistimes a drive to long-off
good length at middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
appeal for lbw is turned down. Good length at middle stump, looks to sweep the offbreak. Cops it on the back leg, around leg stump
short and just outside off, cut straight to extra cover
short of a good length outside off, punched to deep cover
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
offcutter, full at middle stump. Clipped to deep midwicket's left
clean. Usually is when he middles them. Overpitched outside off, stays leg side of it but with a decent stride in. Uses his wrists to get it wide of mid-off
short and in at middle stump, pulled to midwicket
good length at off stump, 140.4kph, sliced on the up to sweeper's left
good length, into the pads at 140.8kph. Chipped on the rise to long-on's right
good length and into the pads, flicked to deep square's left
short of a good length at leg stump, turned to short fine with an attempted pull
good length and spinning into his pads as he gets forward and looks to flick
short and just outside off, cut straight to backward point
good length on off stump, drags the slog sweep to deep midwicket's right
good length and just outside off, punched to long-off's left
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

against mystery bowlers you need tricks of your own. In this case, Pandey chucks his hands out at a full wide ball, has a chop at it and is completely out of shape, not to mention swishing with only one hand. For his efforts, an under-edge nutmegs DK and he gets four. Sure he worked hard on that in the nets
good length and a speculative jump down the pitch from Saha. Forced to reach out with one hand in the end and turn this towards deep square
full outside off, driven along the floor to long-off
full and up outside off. Big stride outside to flick to long-on
short and wide outside off. Saha backing into the leg side gets himself too far to execute the cut
offcutter, turning in from a good length at off stump. 114.5kph. Dropped pitch side on the off side with soft hands
full at off stump, 136kph, flicked straight to short midwicket
full slower ball, floated and way down leg side
good length and wide outside off, mistimed  drive on the up to mid-off's left. 139.1kph
full and into the pads again, cops that on the pad as he looks to flick. Inside edge on it, it appears

oh sensational from Cummins at deep midwicket! Give him some more money. Full and into the pads. Flicked with brilliant timing. Cummins sprints to his right, slides on his hips and flicks this back in for deep square leg who was running to his left
good length outside off, 141kph. Driven to mid-off's left on the rise
good length outside off, watchfully tapped out to sweeper cover
good length and this time it turns away with a similar release. Wide outside off, chopped off the under-edge into the covers
good length and sliding on outside off, punched to point off the front foot

KKR review the lbw call. Saha also fails to pick the ball that spins inwards. Good length, on the front foot trying to drive at an off stump line. He's caught in front of middle and leg, just above the knee. UltraEdge has nothing on it. Clipping the top of leg so it will be umpire's call
full outside off, pushed back down the pitch off the front foot

got him first ball after the break! What a return for this guy. Once again, it's that wristy release that looks like it'll be a legcutter, but goes straight on. It's flicked off the middle finger, cross-seam. Will not spin inwards. Warner looks to flick, an indication that maybe he was looking for the one that comes in when it's delivered like that. But it gets the top of the bat and floats back to the bowler whose little fairytale now has Warner as a lead character
short of a good length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
quicker one delivered with the front of the hand. 106kph, short and at the legs stump. Whipped aerially towards deep square
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
fuller and flatter and wide outside off this time. Nice adjustment. Pandey steps out again but can only drag along the floor to long-on
clears the wide long-on boundary this time. Lobbed up at a good length, steps right out and completes the swing nicely to send this 84 metres
full on middle stump, clears the front leg and miscues his slog. Trickles low to midwicket's right
good length, just outside off, driven on the up to backward point
offbreak, good length and quick at middle stump. Hurriedly swept to deep square's right. Misfield by Rana
fingerspin this time. Dropped short outside off, pulled firmly out to deep midwicket
goes wristspin again. Short of a length, pitching and cutting into Pandey, who cops that on the thigh
short of a good length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
wristspinner to start. It slides on across Warner, who cuts to sweeper cover
good length outside off, gets forward and flicks it back down the pitch
good length, just outside off. Looks to pull but that slides on straight. Inside edge onto boot for a single in the covers
dropped short at leg stump, sweet punch off the back foot to deep midwicket
good length and turning in at leg stump. Clipped to midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, steps out and drives along the ground to long-off
good length outside off, steps out and drives with the turn to long-off's right
short and in at the hips. Hops off the ground and turns it through square leg
good length and in at middle stump, clipped to midwicket
swats him in front of deep square. Short and up at the ribs. Wrner quickly gets the head out of the way, doesn't bother to keep that down. One bounce and over the line
good length and in at middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
good length and into middle stump, punched to mid-on with the angle
short outside off, cut straight to cover
offcutter at a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length outside off, gets forward and clips into the midwicket region which is now vacant because of his last shot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pandey, SIX runs
long_text: oh sweeeeeet! What a clean strike that is. If any shot comes naturally to Pandey, it's this front foot pull over midwicket. Shuffles to get into Mavi's line outside off and when it rises, he swings cleanly from under that. Nailed off the middle to get off the mark

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, punched into the covers on the rise

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length outside off, forced into the covers off the front foot
good length and onto the pads, tucked through square leg from the crease

bowled him next ball!  Looks like an offcutter. Bairstow swishing all over this. Just an incoming ball hitting the seam, in fact. Bowlers know Bairstow is vulnerable to that ball. And it shows rather pertinently in this instance. Good length ball, pitching in the corridor with a tilt inwards. Bairstow looking to drive on the rise for the line. Off and middle both visible. You don't do that and get away often against this bowler

taken by DK but Bairstow has reviewed immediately. He was looking for the ramp agains this good length ball in the corridor. Got entangled, and it seemed to hit the back leg and lob up for DK in the slips region. Was there bat after pad though? Doesn't look like it. And he's struck outside off. This will remain not out.
past the inside edge again. This time Bairstow looking to go horizontal batted with the cut. Good length ball skids underneath, just outside off
good length and in at middle stump, punched to mid-off

narrowly over off stump. Well it's no mystery what the angle's going to be - into him from wide of the crease. So Warner has set up for the pull shot already, but it doesn't bounce up as much as he expects
slams it in, short of a good length, and angles it into Bairstow. He's looking to back away for the cut and gets an inside edge to short fine's right

hammered to deep midwicket's right! Everything you associate with Warner. Quick feet to go deep in the crease, and quick hands pulling firmly in front of square. First real short ball from Narine today and he is duly punished
good length on the legs, whipped to short fine's left off the back foot
good length at middle stump, punched to long-off's right

drags it over the wide long-on boundary. Not to the pitch of this good length ball at middle stump, but little risk going in that direction as mid-on is in the circle. Too far for deep midwicket to come close
short of a good length, turning in at middle stump. Punched to extra cover's right off the back foot
good length at off stump, punched to long-off with the turn
full and slanted in at middle stump. Watchfully defended
short of a good length, in the corridor. Tapped to cover point's left off the back foot
short of a good length and honing in for his off stump again. No room. Defended down the pitch
deflected towards the slip cordon as he's tucked up at the thigh trying to whip this rising ball through square leg
good length and just outside off. 143.6kph, a bit of wobble in the corridor. But he's nicely forward to stab this to cover's left
good length at off stump, defended off the thick outside edge, to short third man
good length and turning in at middle stump, leans forward and flicks gently to mid-on's right
good length at leg stump shoveled to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, deep in the crease for a hurried punch to long-off's right. Nice confident call to beat the fielder's throw
good length at middle stump, cramped and having to make some pace for himself. Just pats it back down off the front foot
full on off stump, makes room and drives straight to extra cover
full outside off, brings down the hammer on that, crunched to long-off's right off the front foot
that's that. One more for Rabada. Three wickets at the death. Jadeja just gives catching pressure to Mishra at point
shuffles across to work this slower ball into the leg side

short_text: Rabada to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length straight, defended

Dhoni walks off. Doesn't wait to see if this low catch is clean or not. Rabada rolls his fingers on the short ball, Dhoni gets a top edge thanks to the extra bounce, and Pant dives in front to take the catch
slower ball, on leg, makes room to take a single to point
Jadeja makes room, Rabada's length ball gets big on hi, and he mis-hits it over mid-off. Again hit high on the bat
down the wicket to drive this slower ball to deep cover
quick again, hits him on the pad as he looks to slog to leg. Pant collects it on the bounce
sharp bouncer, 138ks, but this time it is a tough too high. Called a wide
down the leg side. That will be a wide
slower ball, short of a length, pulled down to long-on for one
legcutter length ball, he is late into it, and is hit high on the bat
quick short ball, Jadeja is late into it, and gets a single off the top edge. Over five a ball now. Just to keep you informed
low full toss, driven hard to deep cover for one
top edge. Rabada hurrying him with a bouncer, but it lands wide of the sweeper on the leg side
short of a length, around off, pushed down the ground for one
dug in short, smartly played by Jadeja who makes room and guides this between short third and point
short of a length, angling in from round the wicket, bunted into a hole on the leg side for a couple

finally. Faf has edged one straight to a fielder, and the said fielder completes the catch. He is backing away again, and Rabada smartly slips in a wide delivery, and the outside edge settles with Pant
and Faf is outdoing all cats. What will it take for one chance to stick. He backs away to manage just a toe-ended skier, and Hetmyer drops him at mid-off

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: slower ball, on a length, and all Fafa manages is an inside edge to fine leg
low full toss, Dhoni can't get power behind it, but this falls well short of deep midwicket

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: oh he doesn't bowl to his field. Gives him a low full toss outside leg, and he helps it along for four to fine leg

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: length ball, angling across, punched straight to extra cover

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: lovely comeback. Slower bouncer, outside off, Dhoni, well early into the shot

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: low full toss. Dhoni looks in good touch. Drills this back over Avesh's head for four
short, wide, he backs away and hits this point for three
sharp bouncer, quick, 145ks, over his left shoulder, too good. Dhoni late into the hook. And not even too high

that is plumb lbw. The asking rate means he has to do something out of the ordinary, and Nortje is too good. Runs the fingers on a length ball that is headed straight for the stumps. Jadhav is looking to slog it and is beaten comprehensively. No question of a review
full and straight and slower at 125ks, runs off the inside edge for another single. If there is no boundary this over, it might just be it for CSK
yorker, or just a couple of inches off one. Hit down to long-on for one

du Plessis man. He has more lives than a cat. A length ball cramping him up, mis-hit to leg, but doesn't carry to midwicket. And then he is sent back and beats the direct hit by a frame, and even gets an overthrow
yorker, almost one, straight at the stumps. Faf digs it out for one. And he has come back well to end this over

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, no run
