long_text: beaten comprehensively. Bashing a short length, and Faf charges at him and is beaten by the bouncer. The mid-off is up, which brings about this shot. And that length
quick straight, back of a length, hits him on the pad. Another leg-bye
has he edged it or placed it? Quick, short of a length, and he has actually opened the face late and beaten third man to his left. Late touch

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
long_text: really quick, draws a grunt out of du Plessus as this hits him on the body after following him with the angle. Only a leg-bye here

short_text: Rabada to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, cramping him, but du Plessis gets enough bat on this to clear midwicket for four

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: they are in a biosecure bubble or I would tell Faf to walk into a casino soon as this match finishes. Tries the ramp, but Avesh bowls wide, and he tries the revrse ramp, and the thick outside flies towards third man but falls short
length ball, driven to extra cover for one
looks for the yorker on the stumps with Jadhav shuffling across. Ends up slipping down the leg side
slower ball, and he is lucky again. Tries to go big down the ground, and gets a top edge to this length ball, but clears mid-off

short_text: Avesh Khan to Jadhav, FOUR runs
long_text: clears mid-off, and it is a tall man too. Down the wicket, and slaps this down the ground but not with great elevation. Nortje leaps at mid-off, but it just six inches too high

short_text: Avesh Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: short of a length, wide, and he is beaten on the cut by the extra bounce

short_text: Avesh Khan to Jadhav, FOUR runs
long_text: smashing shot. Shuffles across, not a high back lift, and he punches a length ball past midwicket. Great power
more fortune for Faf. Looks for the sweep from outside off, and gets a bottom edge for a couple
quicker slider, hit into the leg side, but gets just a single
slower legbreak, punched down to long-off
down the wicket, Mishra yorks him with a quick one, pushed wide of long-on for two

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: nearly the wicket. Down the wicket, beaten in the flight, and the thick outside edge just evades the man at point
quick, length, outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, wide, cut away for one

short_text: Avesh Khan to Jadhav, no run
long_text: appeal for a catch at the wicket but it has come off the pad

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: now Hetmer drops one. After Kohli and Finch and Shaw. Du Plessis lets out a grunt as this short ball gets big on him as he looks to upper-cut. Hetmyer is sweeping and runs in, and this is straight at his throat but he drops it. Hits his chest

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: makes room to slog this across the line, and manages to place it between deep square and fine leg. Just the fifth boundary of the innings

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: shuffles across to look to go over extra cover, and is beaten by the ball that holds its line
length ball, outside off, punched to deep cover
sharp turn from a length, just outside leg, and all he can manage is a punch down to long-on for a single
goes across to sweep a full ball to deep square leg for one
goes back to pull a length ball, gets a single to deep midwicket
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the it, gets a single to long-on
sharp, dipping, punched to long-off for one
wrong'un, Faf goes back to work this to leg for one
delicate late cut to a fullish ball. Patel hasn't bowl quick so he gets just the two for this

short_text: Axar Patel to Jadhav, no run
long_text: slows this down, full, middle and leg, defended back

short_text: Axar Patel to Jadhav, no run
long_text: tossed up wide, Jadhav, being short, can go back and cut, but he fails to beat short third man

short_text: Axar Patel to Jadhav, no run
long_text: nice dip on this, on a length, on off, pushed to cover

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: length ball, into the pads, worked to leg for one

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, OUT
long_text: do we have a run-out here? Yes we do. Du Plessis refuses the single when it is Gaekwad's call. Bottom edge behind square, and that should be the non-striker's call. Faf takes a couple of steps and sends him back after he has come halfway up the wicket. Pant is quick, gets the glove off, slides, throws, Patel doesn't collect clean but still has time to recover and run him out
sharp turn from outside leg, beats his sweep, hits him on the pad
leading edge as he looks to work this to leg, and Dhawan makes a diving save at point, much to the joy of Pant and Iyer, who seem to lov Dhawan

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, no run
long_text: jumps out of the crease, Mishra bowls the slider, beats him in flight, and an inside edge saves him from getting stumped
falls short again. Again sweeping against the turn, gets another top edge, and this doesn't carry to long leg
slider, cramps him up as he looks to run it past short third. Bottom edge
Faf gets away. The second time he has tried a slog sweep against the turn of a big spinner. The top edge falls short of deep midwicket. Very lucky to get away with it

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: on a length, no room, he backs away to punch this to long-off for one
flat, fired in, worked to deep square

short_text: Axar Patel to Gaikwad, no run
long_text: flighted, straight, driven back to the bowler

short_text: Axar Patel to Gaikwad, no run
long_text: looks to make room to cut but can't beat cover-point

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: looking for the paddle sweep, gets an inside edge into his helmet. Still good for a single
on a length, outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, no run
long_text: looks to slog this to leg, but gets a thick edge to roll it towards point
turn here. Nice turn. Short ball, Gaekwad looks to pull but the turn makes sure he can't hit this where he wants it. Gets a single to deep midwicket
is this the wrong'un? Goes past the inside edge to hit the pad
shuffles across to drive this full ball down to long-off for one

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slow in the air, around off, Faf plays off the back foot, back to Mishra
flighted outside off, pushed slightly wide of cover, and Faf calls him through for one
Vijay's frustrating stay ends. Hard length against a batsman under pressure to hit out almost always works. The bat turns in his hand as he swings hard at it. Lobs it for a catch to midwicket
big bouncer, and it keeps rising after crossing the batsman, and Pant makes a good overhead one-handed collection
Vijay looks for the big hit over mid-off, but is hit on the inside half of the bat
on a length, wicket to wicket, worked to deep square leg for one
short of a length, straight, punched towards deep midwicket for two

short_text: Nortje to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: on a length, into the pads, and he uses all his pace with a deflection wide of square leg for four. He is carrying forward that from from the last game
starts with a tight line, and it swings further down the leg side

short_text: Axar Patel to Vijay, no run
long_text: fired into the pads, the deflection can't beat short fine leg

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: pushed wide of the diving Patel to his left
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one

short_text: Axar Patel to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: on a length, straight, worked wide of mid-on for one

make it one more success for Patel against Watson. The analysts will love it. A sixth wicket of Watson in under 60 balls. Watson is keen to break the hold and is looking for one big hit. He seems this flat and goes back to pull but it skids an and he doesn't get the power or the elevation. Easy catch for deep midwicket. It is acutally not that easy. Hetmyer is taken aback by the power behind the shot but he has done well
Vijay is looking to make room and go over extra cover, but gets an inside edge to square leg for one

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: better delivery, just outside off, Watson looks to drop it and run, but hasn't created any distance between the bowler and the ball

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: Watto checks in. Pure muscle and timing. Breaks the back knee to get under a length ball, and sends this flying over wide mid-on. A thousand CSK runs for Watson
another single to third man, playing length balls with an open face
similar delivery, similar shot, finds the gap this time to get a single to third man

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: on a length, just outside off, opens the face, can't beat point

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: thick inside edge for four. A subdued Watson likes this slightly lower pace and drives, but it runs off the inside half of the bat to beat mid-on
breaks the maiden with a steer down to third man, but this is a testing over that Watson has been fortunate to survive
on a length, around off, holds its line, pushed to cover
this is a legcutter at mid-140s. Too good. Watson looks to steer it after this pitches short of a length, and is beaten comprehensively
dropped. Ordinary cricket this ball. Nortje slips down the leg side, but Watson fails to beat square leg, but Shaw fluffs a sitter after two attempts at it
seam movement. Too good. A length ball jagging back in at 146ks, going between bat and pad, and somehow missing the stumps
full, on off, quick, driven sweetly but straight to mid-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Vijay, FOUR runs
long_text: Vijay makes room and makes good of this over by lofting him over mid-on
again short, Watson rocks back to punch him to deep midwicket for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Watson, no run
long_text: short of a length again, within the stumps, played back to Patel
slower, flighted, middle and leg, worked to leg
again flat and short, punched past square leg for one

short_text: Axar Patel to Watson, no run
long_text: flat, angling in, punched to mid-on
final ball strays into the pads, clipped away for a nice couple to deep square leg
short of a length, rises into the chest, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, late movement away, beats his attempt at a drive
another leave outside off as Rabada gets nice shape away from him after pitching
length ball, outside off, slight shape away, left alone
wide length ball, driven on the toe end to point
across again, an inside edge again, but this just for a single to square leg

lucky runs for Stoinis. Same operation: backing away, then across, Hazlewood bowls a fine yorker wide outside off, and he gets inside edge onto the pad, and then it rolls wide of Dhoni. He could have done better with this
lovely shot first ball from Stoinis. He bluffs him twice. First backs away, then shuffles across, and Hazlewood follows him with a slower ball, and he still gets enough bat to beat short fine leg
wastes a full toss. Surprised by the pace of it, it looks like. Gets just the single to deep midwicket
finally something for him. Hazlewood misses the yorker by inches, and he lofts him back over his head. One bounce into the fence
looks for the reverse ramp and is beaten by the offcutter just outside off. Such good bowling, it is forcing them to play new shots

the frustration has got to Iyer. Lovely over from Curran ends with a reward. Slower offcutter, wide outside off, Iyer just swings for the fences, and gets a thick outside edge. Dhoni dives to his right to take the catch. A highly disappointing innings from Iyer: SR of under 120
nearly a yorker again, he shuffles across to hit this into the leg side for a couple
short, slower, outside off, hit straight to long-off for another single. Excellent over so far
Curran is bowling a great over. After two dots, he bowls wide outside off and full, and has been drilled down to long-off for one. Bowling to his field again

short_text: Sam Curran to Iyer, no run
long_text: hard length, angling in, hits him high on the bat as he looks to hit down the ground. Two good dots

short_text: Sam Curran to Iyer, no run
long_text: smart delivery to follow him as he backs away. It stays down to squeeze under his bat
gets the yorker spot on, well out of his reach, but nowhere close to being a wide. Beats him. Despite two fours, still a good over considering they are just two down
there is Pant. Manufactures a shot. He backs away to make room so he can loft this hard-length ball over cover for four. Lovely shot
looks at the field, realises this is going to be wide, so he shuffles. But Hazlewood is good enough to execute the yorker. Just the single to third man
full toss on the pads, and he misses out. Not a full-blooded swipe but a short-arm one for a single to deep midwicket
lots of power in this cover drive. There is a sweeper in place but the man, Kedar Jadhav, is put under pressure and can't keep this in even though he doesn't have too far to run to his left
and he stays wide outside off to stay awya from Pant's reach. This time he goes too wide
starts with a slower ball outside off, and he is beaten on the big shot that he attempts over cover
sower short ball, wide too, he is out of position, and plays a slap down the wicket and manages to place it between long-on and long-off
looks for the slog but Chahar follows him with a length ball. Dropped into the leg side for another couple
full toss on the pads. Yorker gone wrong. This is the break DC need. He plays a short-arm shot between long leg and deep midwicket
yorker, straight, hit into a hole on the leg side for a couple
short, into the hip, he gets inside the line to pull it to the right of long leg, but because he is off balance playing the shot, he will get just the single
wide length ball, mis-hit to long-off for one
goes wide, goes full, protects the over with a shot straight to his sweeper fielder. That's bowling to your field
yorker, on off, can't do much with it. Gets a single to long-on
wide length ball, cutting away, driven away to long-off for one
short of a length, pitched outside leg, bunted into the leg side for another couple
this is a good yorker, but Pant is good enough to hit this towards fine leg. But he finds short fine leg
whoa that is a freebie. A nice slower ball from Curran, patted back to him, but he throws back and throws wide, giving nobody a chance in the field. Sticky hands, I think
short of a length, straight, bunted into the leg side and they take two to the ball that barely reaches the 30-yard circle
wide ball as he bowls the bouncer too short
slower short ball, runs it to short third man for one
finally breaking free. Gets width on a length ball, and he plays the orthodox classic extra-cover drive to troll those who can't live with his unorthodoxy
wide length ball, hit to extra cover for one
on a length, outside off, looks to hit hard, but shanks it almost, for a single to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover for one
Pant thinking the big slog again, but the length is a touch too short for it. Punched to long-on for one so well done Jadeja
shimmies down the wicket, Jadeja fires this into the pads at 96ks, appeals for lbw but it is headed towards leg
into the pads, single to short fine leg
wider length ball, bunted into the leg side but will get only one
that is Pant. That is why love Pant. He sees there is no fielder at fine leg so he goes across, gets on a knee, and sweeps a length ball right to that long leg for four
and Pant plays from the crease to end this with a single
even quicker, short, he goes back to cut it to deep point
quick, short of driving length, so he plays it back to Chawla
on a length, flat, Iyer plays off the back foot, straight to cover
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as he drags the length back, the lack of spin means he gets an inside edge onto the pad and the ball rolls to Dhoni's right, who collects and stumps Shaw
goes back to punch a length ball to deep midwicket for one
flatter and quicker, looks for the late-cut again, and is beaten
slows it down, within the stumps, short of slogging length, defended back to him
this time he goes one better. Quicker from Jadeja so he can wait for it and late-cut it between point and short third man
short, rally short, he has the time to do whatever but it is also wide outside off. So he cuts this square of deep cover
stays short of that slogging length, outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
looks for the big sweep over suqare leg, but is beaten by the googly outside leg again
flat, quick, appeal for lbw as he is trapped on the crease. This is the googly so it is difficult for it to have pitched on and gone on to hit

he tries the reverse shot and is given out lbw. He is looking to go over the point ring, but he plays it ordinarily. He doesn't sweep it. He is trying to play a reverse shot upright, and it is not easy. Not when Chawla fires in it to trap you plumb

short_text: Chawla to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: skips out of his crease, gets close enough to the pitch of the ball, and lofts this back over Chawla's head
flighted around off, drilled to long-off. Just too close to him to get any elevation
flat, quick, on off, punched to long-off for one

and this is double barrel stuff now. Not just Dhawan but Shaw also getting stuck into Jadeja. Against the spin, not to its pitch, but he sweeps with all his might and hits him for a flat six square on the leg side
fired into the pads, pushed to long-on for one

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: and Dhawan shows he is not all slogs. The field might have moved to protect the leg side but Dhawan loves the off side too. He plays the drive over extra cover this time to put Jadeja under further pressure
on a length, middle and leg, holds its line, pushed into the leg side to bring up his first fifty of this season
gets the length to sweep, but it is still not full enough so he ends up sending it deep square leg for one
Jadeja risks the pull to deny him the slog. Dhawan goes back to punch this short ball wide of deep midwicket for two
looks to drive on the up but mis-hits it back to CHawla
on a length, middle and leg, turned towards off, can't play the big shot so he bunts this towards long-on and comes back for two
terrific batting. Shaw jumps out of the crease, Chawla goes wide on the crease and tries to get him stumped with a wide, but he ends up driving it over extra cover again. Lovely hands
goes back expecting a short ball, but the late-cut finds the man at point
lovely shot. It is a chip over extra cover. Hardly any follow0-through. Just makes room, and takes this really full ball and dunks it over extra cover
flighted around off, seems like a googly, he drops this at his toes and takes the single
nice dip and some turn. In front of middle and off, played back to Jadeja
flatter, shorter, pulled down the ground for one

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: flat slog sweep this time, and he has beaten deep midwicket too. So the spinners hurting CSK second game in a row
on a length, middle and leg, no turn, worked to leg for one
low full toss, driven to long-on for one

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: that last over bought Dhawan a life-line, and now he cashes in on left-arm spin. Right in his slot, and he slogs this over midwicket for six
oh those last two punches pushed the sweeper in front of square, and then he rocks back to late-cut this flat delivery through point for four. Much-needed good over for DC
punched away in front of cover-point again, and this time Chahar makes the ground to keep them down to two

lovely shot. Goes back to punch a length ball in front of cover, and Dhoni will not be happy with Chahar's half-hearted attempt at the boundary. Just feebly sticks his foot out. If looks could kill, Dhoni would be under trial right now
short of a length - the perfect one for spinners - punched down the ground for one
bowl short again, pulled to deep midwicket for another single
short quick ball first up, pulled down to long-on for one
slower bouncer, he aborts the pull and goes for the upper cut. Gets just the single to deep point

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower ball, and pressure builds and builds for Dhawan. He is beaten on the pull, and it somehow bounces over the stumps
yrker. Middle and leg, dug out towards mid-on for a single
down the wicket again, but Chahar shortens the length and cramps him up. Dhawan gets just the single into the covers
not the most convincing of shots but Dhawan is away. He drives with an open face and deliberately in the air. He gets a thick edge fine of deep cover for a couple
wide on the crease, short of a length, wide, punched away, but the diving cover-point keeps them down to one

short_text: Hazlewood to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and leg, headed towards off, played defensively again as he looks for a single that he can't find

short_text: Hazlewood to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: down the wicket, gets no room or length error from Hazlewwod. Has to play defensively

short_text: Hazlewood to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, ends up just outside off, he opens the face, but can't get it past point
short of a length, angling in, punched to leg for one

mis-hit but it has gone past mid-on. Not short enough to pull perhaps or maybe too wide. Yes too wide to be pulling so he ends up lobbing it towards mid-on. But he has got enough meat in it to clear the fielder
hit hard on the up, with an open face, but can't beat the wide mid-off
picks this up from middle and leg, almost a vertical-bat pull, gets a single to deep square leg
flicked away from middle and off, into the leg side,through square leg. Gets a couple
oh misses out. Plum length ball outside leg with fine leg in the circle. Shaw wants six but can't catch up with it. Wide

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: he has had enough of failing to find gaps. Stands tall, picks the slower ball, and lofts it over mid-off. Doesn't matter that this is not a driving length. He goes hard at it, and clears the field

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, no run
long_text: noe the cutter away from him, punched on the up but straight to cover

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, no run
long_text: back to regulation swing, and he has smashed this straight to midwicket

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: the first poor ball from Curran. Starts too straight with short fine in the circle. He has tried a legcutter here. And he has been flicked away past short fine. Although not sure fine leg should be up when you are swinging into the pads

driven hard on the up, Hazlewood gets a left hand to it. On the full, but that was hardly a chance as this was hit hard and he was in his follow-through. Mind you, he took one recently in the England series. Jason Roy, was it?
the first full ball from Hazlewood, swings back into Dhawan, and he gets an inside edge onto the pad but takes the single
short of a length again, he gets the width to throw his bat at it, but Jadeja makes a one-handed diving save at point
short of a length, tucked away off the hip, gets a single to leg

short_text: Hazlewood to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length, on the pads, he looks to pull but is beaten and hit on the thigh pad

short_text: Hazlewood to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: on a length, middle and leg, headed to off, defended, but he won't get the single

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, no run
long_text: bouncer, middle and leg, he ducks it. That is a good over from Curran. Started off well, used swing, and then protected the over with a bouncer last ball

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, no run
long_text: change-up from Curran. After swinging four balls, he has bowled the cutter here. Shaw adjusts well, plays with soft hands, and the edge dies in front of Dhoni

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: down the wicket, Curran shortens the length, he cuts this in front of deep cover, but a one-handed pick-up and throw from M Vijay keeps them down to one

short_text: Sam Curran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: nice swing away from Dhawan, just outside off, left alone

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, 1 leg bye
long_text: swinging back in again, beats the bat this time, but the ball is headed down leg. Gets a leg-bye

short_text: Sam Curran to Shaw, no run
long_text: looking for that lbw with swing back into the pads. Shaw's bat comes down in time
short and wide, he needs a ladder to reach it, but reach it he does and gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, Shaw early into the punch, hits this uppishly to mid-off
fuller, wider, and this time Shaw goes one better with a lovely drive away from the body with an open face. Finds that save gap between cover-point and extra cover
lovely shot. You give him width and shortish length, and he will keep punching you all night long. This one goes in front of cover-point, along the ground, all the way for four
nice swing away but for some reason, Shaw is beaten on the inside edge. On replays he has actually inside-edged it. Nobody appeals. No sign of disappointment or guilt from Shaw either
short of a length, wide, swinging away, but Shaw throws his bat it it. Tries to cut, but ends up hitting it to extra cover
that is plumb. Full and at middle stump. Gets down for the sweep and is completely cramped on it. On the back leg right in front of middle stump
googly, skidding in from a good length outside off. Squeezed to deep square off the thick inside edge
full at off stump, nicely forward to flick this down to long-on
googly, sliding into the corridor. Defended off the back foot
googly, full and very wide outside off. Left alone

takes leg stump. A googly from Ashwin and he shakes his head. That is revenge taken. Perhaps one of his easier ones. Good length ball on off and this one is as rash as the last one was classy. No feet, all hoick
oooh, classy. Nice inside-out loft from Saini. Full ball outside off, down on one knee and pure timing as he goes with the turn

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Steyn, no run
long_text: big appeal for lbw but he was struck outside off. A good length ball angled in and he was struck playing the forward block
good length on off stump, punched to long-off

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Saini, no run
long_text: full on off stump, defended to midwicket's right

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Saini, no run
long_text: inside edge onto pad as he looks to blaze a full ball through the covers

not this time. Another miscue from Sundar's many attempts. This is full and the angle is across him. He looks to go leg side with the loft and can only slice it harmlessly for the fielder at long-on. His longest innings in the IPL comes to an end

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Sundar, SIX runs
long_text: clears long-off! Neat little loft from Sundar, after several attempts to go straight against spin. This is full and outside off, he's got a big stride out and cleared the fielder with ease
short and pushed across him, beats him on the cut
full on middle stump, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushed with the turn to point off the back foot. Run-out appeal as Sundar scrambles back after taking a few steps. He's grounded though
oh dives over it. Pooran with the shocker in the deep. Short of a length ball angled into him, gentle punch off the back foot. Pooran makes the ground to his right and then it just seep through
good length at middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full and in at middle stump, lofted to long-on's right
into leg stump! Good length, coming in with his regular angle, and also spinning in off the pitch. Umesh shaping for the big slog sweep but is through the shot too soon

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length and angled in outside off, mistimed drive on the up to extra cover
back of a length on the stumps, driven down to long-on

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Sundar, no run
long_text: appeal for lbw is turned down. Got down for the sweep against this full ball. Might have pitched outside leg
short and just outside off, punched to long-off's right
pulled back in by long-on. Full ball outside off, gets the slow sweep over the bowler's head off the low part of the. Two fielders converge but long-on puts in the slide and saves two

bowled him! Skidder from Maxwell, a bit low arm, and angled in from wide of the crease around the wicket. Clears the front leg and looks to whip into the leg side. It's hit his back leg and deflected onto the stumps
dropped short and skidding onto his thigh as he gets back to try and pull this
good length and skidding onto middle stump. Steps out and drives to long-on
length on the pads, clipped to deep square off the back foot
short and cramps him as he jumps into the leg side to make room. Cut to sweeper
good length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
full slower ball outside off, driven to mid-off's right
short at off stump, chopped to third man
good length, slower ball outside off. Chopped to point
carted over midwicket! Whew, that looked sweet! Short and just outside off, stands tall and pulls off the front foot. Flat and clears the boundary with ease
length on middle stump, punched to long-on on the up
short and down leg side, left alone
short and wide outside off, looks for the cut and is beaten
short at off stump, defended to point off the back foot
full at middle stump, driven straight and splits the stumps at the other end. Dube was a couple of yards out if Shami had got a hand on that
short of a length on middle stump, pushed through midwicket off the back foot
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short at off stump, dabbed in front of third man with soft hands

just short of third man! Short ball across him. Looks for the ramp. M Ashwin lunges low to his right and isn't getting there. So he adjusts and has a flap at it so that it doesn't bounce over him. Does it brilliantly, then gives chase and puts in a slide as the ball heads towards fine leg. Pulls it back in but his heel's connected with the boundary as he does so
short at off stump, punched to sweeper
length outside off, swishes at it, thick edge down to third man
short of a length in the corridor, tapped to backward point
length at middle stump, mistimed punch towards mid-off
good length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
good length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
full on off stump, driven along the floor to long-off's right
good length and just outside off. Punched into the covers
good length and turning in at off stump. Waits on that and nudges to point
short of a length outside off, punched straight to extra cover

Sarfaraz takes it at sweeper cover! Full and wide outside off, looks to drill this over the off side, but there's no elevation, it's flat and taken some ten yards inside the rope. Ashwin is thrilled, so is Sarfaraz

oh unlucky at sweeper cover. Good length ball outside off, absolutely smoked on the rise past extra cover. Sarfaraz sprints and puts in the dive to his right to get to it. Just manages to get away from him because of the momentum

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Sundar, no run
long_text: full outside off, driven along the floor to extra cover

has he bowled him? Or is it caught behind? Looks good for both. It is bowled. Short of a length, skidding onwards and clipping the top of off as Finch exposes middle and off to try and play the cut. Nice, quick readjustments from the young bowler after that nervous first over
short of a length at leg stump, clipped to short fine's left
tossed up outside off, watches closely before driving out to sweeper cover
good length and skidding on at leg stump. Hurriedly nudged to deep midwicket
slower and shorter outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short at the hips, pushed through square leg with soft hands
googly tossed right up outside off, stays on the back foot and creams it along the floor to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, looks to flick but cops that on the pad
googly not picked. Rips in and past the cut before Finch can get it away
short of good length just outside off, chopped to point's right
full and down leg side, gets low and whips this past short fine leg

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to AB, no run
long_text: good length ball sliding in towards off stump. Hurriedly chopped to cover point

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: full and into the pads. Allows it on and tickles it fine, using Bishnoi's pace. Cottrell gives chase and drags it in, but was in contact with the boundary padding as he did so

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to AB, no run
long_text: good length and sliding in at off stump. Watchfully defended into the covers

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to AB, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, flicked straight to short midwicket

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped short on a leg stump line, gets back and whips forcefully to the deep backward square fence
follows him and overdoes it yet again as Finch jumps into the leg side, past the keeper and short fine has to clean up

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Finch, FOUR runs
long_text: back away and swats it over the bowler. Goes short again and follows him again. But there is room for him to just get this wide of mid-off now
follows him down leg side with a short ball as Finch backs away a long way. A bit too much on it
full slower ball outside off, looks to get low and crunch it wide of mid-off. It comes off the toe end
dropped too short this time. Way, way over the batsman's head
rapped on the bicep. Short ball in the corridor, was looking to pull that. Catches it on the right arm
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
slashed through the covers. Too short from Cottrell. And a bit of width. Weight onto the back foot and quick hands to hit well in front of square
full slower ball, very wide outside off, left alone

oh wow, unreal. Casually launches this over the long-off boundary. It's short of a good length and a slower ball. He's just held a strong base, waited on it, and swung on the up from a fully static position. Incredible
can't get that away. Short and just outside off, punched off the back foot, straight to extra cover
good length and honing in at middle stump. Forced to defend this on the front foot

that could be out caught behind. Finch reviews. Short of a good length ball pinning him back. It went through to the keeper off the back leg. But there were two sounds. Was it bat or did the ball hit the front flap before hitting the thigh? Yes, UltraEdge confirms it was the front knee flap that made the sound. On lbw it is not out. Wickets missing. Good review from Finch after being given out.
drilled over mid-on. Attempted slower ball turns into a friendly full toss. Merely has to clear the infield and does it, no fuss
length on middle stump, flicked from deep in the crease to short midwicket
good length and just outside off, off his feet to try and tap this into the covers. Gets an inside edge onto body
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off from deep in the crease
short and up at the chest. Watchfully defended into the leg side
short and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man

taken at mid-on! RCB falling apart! Short and pushed across him outside off. Looks for the pull and slices it straight up for Bishnoi who sets up and watches and watches and watches before taking it calmly
good length at middle stump, back in the crease and punches it to the bowler
good length, slower ball at off stump. Looks to tap it into the covers but it rolls back down the pitch
rapped in the mid-riff as he looks to pull. Short ball up at off stump as he looks to go behind square
beaten on the pull. Short and in the corridor. Plays on top of the bounce
short of a good length just outside off. Finch walks down at him again, but this time he lets it go
short of a good length, climbing up at his hips. Shuffles and drops it behind square with soft hands

given lbw and he won't review! Trapped right in front of middle. Philippe is used to batting in powerplays, but this experiment has failed. Jumps into the off side and looks to whip a straight, good length ball behind square. Pinned right in front
short and at leg stump. Walks down at it and drags it out to fine leg
big appeal for lbw, it appears. Pins Finch deep in the crease with a good length ball. Raps the top of his knee flap at a leg stump line. Not out
past the outside edge. Full and floated away outside off. Shuffles and looks to drive but is swishing inside the line as this goes straight on
good length and swung in at off stump. Defended down the pitch

taken at mid-on! Out comes the salute! Follows him down leg side and cramps him at the chest with a short ball. Backing away looking for the pull, but this is onto him quickly. Slices it up for the fielder
inside edge past the stumps. Good length and hooping into the corridor as he looks to cut. Rolls out towards square leg
inswinging yorker at middle stump. Keeps the feet out of the way and jams it down into the pitch
full outswinger at off stump, jammed out to mid-off

he bowls the short offbreak and gives up six anyway! He was waiting for it. Back and across on off stump. Right in his swinging arc and he swung it straight over the bowler. The highest score by an Indian in the IPL
pumped over wide long-on! KXIP have 200. Driving length, floated up at leg stump. Front leg out of the way and a clean swing
carved behind point. Full and some width outside off, once again he just stays deep in the crease and opens the face on this
low full toss outside off, looks to go inside-out over extra but can't time this too well. Just a single to sweeper's right
swatted to the backward square fence. Walks down at him, pre-meditated. It's a short ball, but he's not quick enough to bother Nair who swivels a touch and sends this on its way
full and just outside off, lofted over the bowler and between the two deep fielders at the straight boundary

inside edge and it's boundary number four at fine leg on the night. Another Short of a good length ball. Kept a touch low, this one. Rahul was looking for the pull and the inside edge sprinted past the stumps
scythed over extra cover. What a shot. 140kph from Steyn, but driving length outside off. Rahul's waiting deep in the crease and merely opens the face after chopping down at this with an angled bat
second tier! 95 metres. Wow. All a bit predictable from RCB right now. Slower ball slammed in short of a good length. Rahul waits on this one and pummels this pull shot, far far over midwicket
good length and sliding outside off, beaten on the slash

first century of the 2020 season! KL Rahul carves this full ball over short third man to bring up his second IPL hundred. It's not been entirelyfluent, especially as he's tired on a slowing pitch on a big ground, but he'd done the groundwork early on and with some reprieves, he's the man who's there at the end. Keeping the runs ticking for his team and reaping the rewards now. This will mean so much to the man who said he was anxious he might not be able to play cover drives thanks to the lockdown

just clears AB at deep square. Slower ball, good length at leg stump. Waits on it and rolls the wrists. This time it goes square like he wants it to. AB leaps backwards, one-handed after running to his right. Gets a hand on it too, but it was already beyond him

Kohli drops one again! Much more straightforward this time. Full slower ball, looks to drill that over long-off and loses his shape and his timing. Floats up for Kohli who has to run a straight path, gets under it, and then simply cannot hold on
carves between backward point and short third. Fifth offcutter in a row. Short and wide this time. Deliberately chopped behind by Rahul
offcutter, short of a good length outside off. Backs awalefty and slices to sweeper's

ramped past short fine. A step into the leg, then into the off side. Classic Karun Nair. Saini attempts another offcutter, it's a full toss and he jabs at this late and gets the bat in the right position
good length offcutter on leg stump again. Shoveled to deep square off the front foot
offcutter, good length and outside off. Looks to lace it through the covers, chops it into the pitch

Kohli drops him at deep midwicket! Full toss on leg stump, wanted to use the pace to angle that over the square boundary. But it ended up only slightly to Kohli's right at deep midwicket. He couldn't get completely under it, was looking to catch that a bit to his right, away from his eyeline. And he grabbed at it a bit too soon

clears deep midwicket. Just. That was hit hard. Offcutter dug into the surface again, dropped short and sitting up for the pull. Slugs it flat and clears Kohli. It's only into the ad board there, but that is an 87 metre hit.
full and floated wide outside off. Slipped out, that one, left alone
nails the yorker at middle and off, jammed down the long-on's left
dropped short outside off, pulled on the ounce to long-on's right
good length just outside off, tapped into the covers
good length, slower ball at off stump. Walks into the leg side and punches straight to extra cover
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
good length onto the pads. flicked to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, punched on the up to long-on
slapped to extra cover! Oh boy. Offcutter, slammed into the pitch, short and outside off. Steps out and it sits up sweetly for a lashing. and he's lashed it straight to Finch
short ball just outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
good length outside off, gets forward and pats it down the pitch
tossed up full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
swept to the backward square boundary again. Chahal clearly has a plan to keep it at Rahul's legs, but this is the second time he's made use of it. Gets low and gets it well to deep square's right
leading edge trickles safely to extra cover. Length ball dipping at leg stump and he closes the face early on it
tossed up full outside off, gets forward and slices to sweeper's right
good length and sliding into the corridor. Tapped on the up to long-on
good length outside off, pulled to deep midwicket off the toe end
good length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot

dropped at mid-off. Negi flying to his right and can't hang on to a difficult chance. But this is the exact shot that Maxwell fell to last match - trying to drive on the rise and getting through it too early
good length outside off, beaten on the drive

hits it straight to mid-off! Dube's dream IPL 2020 with the ball could become an actual thing here. Gentle good length ball just outside off, steps out and sort of yorks himself - or cramps himself for sure. Can't get the swing through it to go right of or over ABD. Hit its knee height

in control this time as he lofts it over extra cover. His second cover drive against Saini. Taken to his pace, it appears. Good length and outside off. He has to go on the rise, which is ideal if you want to go aerial. Good shape as he executes this
top edge and clear of the keeper. Caught a little on the front foot here as a short one rises up at the helmet. Adjusts quickly and swipes from under it
short at the ribs, dragged to fine leg's left with a pull
good length at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, punched on the up to mid-off's right
shoveled fine past the keeper. This must be Rahul's third boundary at fine leg tonight. Good length ball angled into his pads and he turns it away
dropped short of a good length, 101.6kph in the corridor. Mistimed punch down towards long-on off the back foot
length and slanted in at the stumps. Clears the front leg and goes for the big slog, but, miscues another one to deep midwicket. Sundar is sliding them on rapidly
good length, sliding on outside off. Backs and slces to sweeper cover
short at the stumps, mistimed pull rolls down to long-on's left
good length at the stumps, hurriedly pushed into the covers
good length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot and that is fifty number one for the season for KXIP's new captain
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and just outside off. Dropped to extra cover's left with soft hands
full on off stump, driven down the turf to long-off
good length and turning into the pads. Goes back and turns it past Finch at short fine
full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
short of a good length and turning away, cut straight to backward point
good length at off stump, looks to work it into the off side. It ends up pitch side on the leg off the inside half
tickled fine. Umesh struggling once more through the middle. Good length and onto the pads. Hangs deep and gets enough bat on that
slower ball at a good length, slides under the bat as Rahul looks to drive on the rise

carved over deep extra cover. Overpitched outside off, hangs deep in the crease and stays leg side of that. Front leg hanging in the air as it gets into the leg side too. And then he just opens the face at the perfect moment
no-ball as this slips out of Umesh's hands and sails out towards fine leg. Completely lost that
short at the hips, clipped to deep square's right
crunched past mid-off. Overpitched and a bit of width outside off. Nice pace on that for Pooran to get forward, open his arm and hit through the line
slower ball, short and down leg side. Looks to play the pull and gets an edge that doesn't carry to the keeper
another slider, good length and at off stump. Front leg moves rapidly into the leg side to make room as he chops this to sweeper cover
length and sliding onto leg stump. Punched to long-on from deep in the crease
full on off stump, driven to long-off along the floor
full outside off, a slider this time. Nicely on top of that and flicks to deep midwicket's right
big appeal for lbw is turned down. Another googly. He's looking to sweep him but that's probably pitched outside leg stump. No, replays show it pitched in line! But there might have been an edge
short of a good length, turning in at off stump. Punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length outside off, looks to flick to long-on but can't beat the bowler
short of a good length, sliding into the corridor. Punched to sweeper off the back foot
quick and short of a good length, just outside off. Punched to long-off
good length outside off, jabbed into the off side on the front foot
short outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
through Steyn's legs at short third. Short and just outside off, sliced straight to Steyn who is down with the barrier, but it's a barrier with a massive hole

gets him with the googly! Makes India's Test opener look bang average with yet another perfect googly for the season. Mayank looking to drive through the covers on the up, for a good length ball pitching on off. Massive gap between bat and pad. He had no inkling of this. Loses middle and off. Chahal doesn't normally bowl too many googlies to right handers, but he has nailed them this season so far
slows it down further and this time Rahul drops it pitch side with soft hands. Loopy and drawing him forward outside off. Direct hit at the non-striker's end but Rahul is well safe
slows it down, good length on off. Watchfully tapped into the covers off the front foot
swiped to the backward square boundary. This will be a good match-up. Chahal goes quick and full, but at leg stump. Rahul is down quickly and it's a pristine shot, along the floor
good length and just outside off. Hangs deep in the crease and shapes for the cut, but it doesn't turn too much. Pokes into the covers
dropped short at off stump, punched to sweeper cover
slower ball, good length at 105.kph. Hard hands on the push and a thick inside edge to deep square's right
short of a length in the corridor, opens the face and runs it tp third man
full toss outside off and he just pats that through extra cover like he's in training
good length, poor line. Attempted slower ball. About 40kph slower than regular pace at 106kph. Bounces down leg side
beaten. Bouncer just outside off at 147.9kph. He's already under it and wants to ramp it over third man
good take down leg side. Short ball following Mayank down leg side. A long long way down leg side. He can't get bat on the pull. Philippe is nearly parallel to the floor as he grabs this
146.7kph, full and in at off stump. Late on the attempted drive and he gets an inside edge to short fine
slower ball at a good length, gets forward and inside edge onto pad for the single in the off side
slower ball onto the pads, flicked to deep square
full slower ball, looped up at leg stump. Watchfully jabbed to mid-on
short of a good length, at off stump and providing no room. Defended to backward point off the back foot

just clears midwicket and then teases mid-on who can't win the race. Short of a good length, drags this pull shot a tad. It was another slower ball. The bat turned in his hand, but these are the benefits of being a batsman in the powerplay
another slower ball, full and onto the pads. Flicked to deep square
offcutter at a length on leg stump. Awkward little chip towards deep square after he commits early to the flick
length at off stump, hurried onto him this time and he taps it down the pitch

oh yes! Yes yes yes. That is the KL Rahul everyone dreams of for India. This is full and outside off, and he brings out the perfect cover drive - big stride, weight into the shot, high elbow and a balanced head right on top of the ball. Perfect timing on it
short of a length just outside off, 137.5kph. Allows that to skid on and stays on the back foot before deflecting to third man's right
low full toss, 142.7kph, hurriedly tapped to mid-on's left
beaten by pace on the flick. Full and skidding onto the front pad, just outside the line of leg stump, as he looks to flick. 144.7kph
good length and just outside off, just a little late on the cover drive. That slams into the bat. 144.1kph
full slower ball outside off, drifts away from him in the corridor. Defended to point
good length at leg stump, flicks it straight to short fine. Was running down the pitch too and had to be sent back. Close call as Steyn took aim but couldn't hit the stumps
length on off stump, punched off the front foot and an early call for the single at mid-off
sweet timing this time. Full and onto the pads again, is Umesh, and Mayank leans in to get his weight into the shot. Keeps the face full offered and clips it late to midwicket's left
short of a length outside off, punched on the up to cover

forced over extra cover off the toe-end of the bat.  Walks into and slightly legside of this good length ball to make room. Opens the face but it doesn't come off the middle. Has enough to beat Finch from mid-off

a sound as he's beaten on the hook. Turned down by Chaudhary and not contested by RCB. Short ball rose steeply at his front shoulder. He got inside the line but was off balance and bit too far away from it to connect properly
slower ball, short and wide again. A more forceful cut this time but straight to backward point

chopped away this time and beats Umesh at third man. Similar length again from Steyn, short enough for him to rock back and chop into the turf. Umesh does well to get to the ball but it trickles through after he tumbles and gets a hand on it to his right
threads it through! Top class. Just short of a good length from Steyn and he is back, on his toes, and opens the face late to punch this between cover point and backward point
good length and just outside off. Solidly behind that to defend into the covers
short of a good length with some shape away. Opens the face and steers to third man
oh back down leg side. Nearly the perfect over from Umesh until this length ball slanted into the pad. Stays tall in the crease and tickles it fine
short of a good length and cramping him at the waist. Forced to defend into the off side
short at the hips, off his feet to tuck this down to fine leg
misfield in the covers. Full outswinger and he leans back and check-punches this. Sundar lets it through despite a slide to his right
good length and shaped away from middle. Closes the face and nudges it to mid-on
good length and a nice curve away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
and he ends up with a wicket last ball. Mavi wants to hit a six, Chahar shortens his length and beats him to leave him stranded halfway down the wicket
tossed up wide, driven to deep cover for two
full and straight, pushed down the ground for one
Yadav tries the reverse sweep, and is beaten outside off
short, but no power behind the pull. Gets a single to deep midwicket

short_text: Chahar to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: cut away to point
slower ball, right in the slot, but he doesn't hit him in the air. Takes a single to long-on

short_text: Pattinson to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: wide length ball, hit hard but straight to point

short_text: Pattinson to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: bottom edge as he makes room to try to cut

short_text: Pattinson to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: slower ball, Mavi well early into the shot. Beaten
oh he has hit better balls than this for sixes. This is right in the slot, it is on-pace, and he is thinking six as he swings hard, but gets the toe end of the bat for an easy catch to midwicket
Cummins backs away, Pattinson looks to go wide, but bowls too wide
short of a length, slower, pushed to point for one

wow. Bumrah goes for 27 in one over. All too late of course but still. Bumrah bowls another low full toss. He is looking for a wicket instead of closing it out. Cummins backs away and hits him back over his head
tries to follow him a slower ball but bowls a wide down the leg side
six number three off a Bumrah over. He gets the yorker wrong, and Cummins slogs this over midwicket. Just clears him
goes for the yorker, driven in front of sweeper cover for two

six more for Cummins. He is getting some of his own back here. He is not in control of this one for sure. Bumrah bounces him, and follows him, and he gets a top edge on the hook that sails over long leg
dug in shorter, Cummins backs away again, looks to pull, beaten
lovely shot. Short of a length, into the body, and he backs away to help this along, using his pace to send it over long leg for a six

short_text: Boult to Shivam Mavi, FOUR runs
long_text: Mavi, who bowled well earlier, stands tall to help this short ball along to deep square leg for four
full,nearly a yorker, dug out to mid-off for one
Cummins gets four back. Backs away to a shortish ball and slaps it over mid-off
short ball, over his shoulder, top-edges the hook, easy catch for deep midwicket. Mumbai looking to end this early now
slower ball, around off, fullish, driven to cover
follows him with a full ball, concedes just the single off the inside edge
full, outside off, driven with an open face, gets a single to deep cover
full and straight, defended to midwicket
and Bumrah has one more. Morgan backs away to try to hit over mid-off, but he is too good for him with the slower offcutter and takes the outside edge through to the keeper
wide on the crease, angled across hi, short of a length, hits the bottom edge
on a length, outside off, dropped into the covers for one

he knocks back his leg stump and stands there still, no emotion. It is in the slot, but Russell is done by the pace. His bat comes down late, and this should seal Mumbai's first win in six attempts in UAE
slower short ball again, and Morgan is beaten. Excellent bowling from Mumbai this evening. They have their plans in place, and have executed them perfectly
slower ball, not full enough for his slog, and he ends up drilling it to long-on for one
big wind-up, big swing, to a length ball outside off, and he gets a thick outside edge over the short third man for four
slower short ball, loopily passes by his shoulder, and he decides to not have a go at it
full toss outside off, Russell's first boundary as he drives this past the diving extra cover
full and straight, hit to long-on for one
good sharp bouncer, and Russell wants nothing of it. Ducks under it
goes back to bowling wide outside off. Would have been wide had he not hit this to deep cover for one
Morgan's first six. This time he stands his ground, and gets under a length ball to loft him over midwicket. More height than distance but still gets enough of it
sees him back away, and slips in a wide delivery outside off. Beaten
short, no room, Russell backs away, doesn't get power behind it. Just the single to long-off
in the slot, outside off, but he fails to make a perfect connection. Mid-off fields
another sharp short ball, this time beats his top edge on the pull
it has hit the stumps but the bail has not fallen off. A quick short ball, has got him in the ribs, and then it rolls into the base of the leg stump. Not hard enough to remove the bail
big wind-up as he backs away, Russell follows him, cramps him up, gives away only a single
slower ball, follows him, hits the pads, and goes for two leg-byes
no sighters here. He backs away to hit a length ball back, and Bumrah fields in his follow-through and threatens to throw it back too. All action
slower ball, short of a length, steered to third man for one
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
slower ball outside off, squeezes under Morgan's drive

lovely catch by H Pandya. Pollard's slowness means Rana has to create all the power on this lofted cover drive. Pandya is off the fence and he has to run back to hold on and he has to keep the fence in mind too. He does all that, and makes it look easy. Pollard's first IPL wicket since 2015
moves wide to cover the line, Pollard gives him no pace to work with. Hit to long-on for one
slower ball, right in the slot for Morgan, but he misses out on the straight hit. Just the front leg taking him away from the line of the ball there
short, wide, legcutter, cut away for four, past the man at point
full, outside off, driven to long-off. Breaks the maiden. What an over
tentative push at one pushed through outside off. Beaten
tries the reverse sweep but is beaten
lovely bowling. For a moment I thought he had bowled him. Slow, drifting away, crates the gap between bat and pad, and then turns back to hit him on the pad. Just outside the line
on a length, outside off, legbreak, he goes back to cut it, but straight to point
plumb. Karthik is feeling the pressure, and as soon as he sees one flighted up, he gets down for a slog sweep. It dips nicely to beat him, and goes straight on to hit him dead in front
wide on the crease, short, but Karthik has no pace to work with. So his pull shot fetches them only a single. Great over: six singles and a wide
slower ball again, and Rana has to abort the big shot. Gets a single to deep cover
slower ball again. Not giving him any room. Worked to leg for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
full, outside off, driven down to long-off for one
short of a length, wide, cut away for a single
short of a length, outside leg, called a wide
well bowled, dipping, on a length, no room. Pushed back to him
closer to the stumps, but flat to deny him the slog. Hit down to long-on for one
oh he bowls wide outside off to avoid that slog weep, but Rana is not that one-dimensional. He plays the cover drive to take four on the off side. Effortless batting
pushed through, on a length, punched down to long-off for one
full and wide, and he opens the face with the drive to beat the man at deep cover. Lovely awareness of the field, and execution to go with it
back of a length, slow, Karthik hits this hard to extra cover
bowls this short, and Karthik pulls it for a single to deep square leg
another reverse sweep but this time he finds the short third man
reverse sweep now. Switches early, takes this from outside what would have been his leg stump, and beats who would have been short third man
flat, on a length, punched wide of deep cover for a couple
quicker, flatter bunts this into the leg side
lovely shot. Karthik plays spin well. Gets to the pitch of this flighted delivery, and lofts him inside out over extra cover for four
slower ball again, cut away for a single
on the pads, and worked away for a single
short, wide, Rana looks for the cut, gets a bottom edge
slow again, on a length, on the pads, worked to leg
lucky there. Slower ball, short outside off, Karthik cuts hard, gets a top edge, but it somehow goes wide of short third man
on the pads, worked away into the leg side for one
quicker, flatter, pulled away to deep square for one
swept away nicely but finds the man at short fine. A couple of metres either side, and it is four
quicker, flatter, gets an inside edge, but it misses the stumps
Rana into the act. He has picked the googly, gone down on a knee, and smashed this over long-off for a six. Lovely shot
on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
on a length, on the pads, nudged to short fine for one
full, straight, defended back to him

nice one-handed grab by de Kock. Narine's poor record against Mumbai continues. He makes room to try to pull. Pattinson sticks with the plan: short, at his body. The top edge is flying over de Kock's head, but he leaps with perfect timing and grabs this with the right mitt
short of a length, straight, dropped into the leg side for one
looks for the pull but this one skids through and stays a touch low, beating hi and hitting him on the box
short of a length, wide, and he smashes this with an open face. In front of point it goes for four
and it nearly gets him Narine's wicket. Short, outside leg, cramping him, hitting the sticker on the bat, but there is no man at short square leg to accept this lob
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
good carry from just short of a length outside off. Left alone by Karthik
Narine survives another run-out. Karthik hits this to midwicket, and Narine strolls up the wicket despite calls of NO. Pollard, though, misses with the throw from midwicket
misses the run-out. The short ball to follow him, draws a top edge into the body. Karthik calls him through for a single. Narine is late to start is out by streets if Bumrah hits. Bumrah misses
short of a length, cramping him up, but he manages to punch it powerfully. But straight to cover-point
Bumrah starts off with a quick length ball angling across. Narine's feet don't move, and he is beaten on the drive
sweetly timed. Slightly too full, and he drives on the walk, between mid-off and extra cover. All intent
on a length, outside off, push-driven on the up, but can't beat the man at point. Looks in good touch

Boult goes short now, and Gill has pulled this straight to midwicket. He is deep in the crease to pull this but the mistake he makes is to try to pull it down. From that height it is a long way down. Had he looked for a six, who knows he might have got away with it

Narine breaks free. Doesn't bother about finding the gap. He just hits it so hard, on top of its bounce, into the ground that it bounces over the infield on the off side. Boult makes the mistake of giving him room
fuller, closer to off, respectfully played back to Boult
on a length, outside off. Looks for the big hit down the ground, get an inside edge fine of fine leg for a couple
short, quick, Narine looks to make room and hit it down the ground. Mis-hits it back to Pattinson
slower ball, too full, on the pads, and even though they have a man deep on the leg side, he can only watch this sail over for a six
full, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short again, Narine makes room to hit this back down the ground. Pattinson gets a hand to it, which allows them to take a single off the deflection
nice punch from Narine but can't beat H Pandya at point. Pattinson staying short
weird shot from Narine. He looks to duck a short ball but sees it has not come off the surface and lets it hit him softly
lovely end to the over. Not short, just short of a length, and it pitches on leg and seams away to beat his edge
full, outside off, timed sweetly, but hit straight to mid-off
on a length, outside off, skiddy, hits his bottom edge as he opens the face
on a length, around off, slight seam away, crunched square on the off side, but can't beat point
length ball, just outside off, left alone
full, really full, dug out just outside off
Mavi bluffs him. Bowls the short ball. Pollard pulls it down towards deep midwicket where a misfield lets them come back for two. Still a good last over
diving save at extra cover by Morgan, but the deflection to long-off allows them time to come back for two. Not the perfect yorker, but wide enough to deny Pollard a free swing
wide on the crease, short slower ball, mis-hit into the leg side, Pollard calls for two immediately and makes it. Karthik is not happy with the effort in the deep

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pollard, FOUR runs
long_text: this full toss has gone wrong. Not low, not wide. High and straight with a straight field, allowing him a free hit square on the leg side

and he does that, and Mavi beats Pollard, and Karthik appeals only to see it has been called a wide. He reviews it immediately. The replay shows no edge, but the ball is only just wide of that guide line, and Pollard is standing outside his off stump. so slightly harsh on that wide call

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Krunal, 1 leg bye
long_text: slower ball to Pandya, beats him as he slogs, concedes just the leg-bye
low full toss with the long-off and long-on very straight. Good plan. Just the single to long-off
another sharp quick bouncer, beats his attempt to pull. Russell has bowled an excellent over here. Could be the difference between a win and a loss
doesn't get power in this, just the single to deep cover

on his backside at the striker's end, and lying prone at the non-striker's. What a delivery for Krunal. Sharp bouncer from Russell, hits his glove, and the force of it knocks Pandya down. Only to realise Pollard is pushing him for the quick single. And he has to dive at the non-striker's end to make it

he is hit wicket. Goes deep to counter the yorker and shuffles to the off stump, but loses the whereabouts of his stumps. Russell delivers the yorker, which Pandya wants to steer, but as the bat comes down, it knocks off the off bail
Russell stays wide, Pollard looks to go over wide long-off, but is hit on the inside half of the bat. Single to long-off
full and wide, drilled down to long-off for one
low full toss again, drilled down to long-on for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, OUT
long_text: Sharma has looked exhausted for a while now. Usually you would see such a full toss outside off disappear into the grand stand, but he ends up slogging this to long-on for an easy catch. Not the worst thing to happen for Mumbai
slower short ball, slapped down to long-off for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: full, wide again, hit in front of cover, and they still take just the single. This time Pandya has said no to the second

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide
long_text: This has been called a wide. Sharma has shuffled across, which is why he goes wider, and while it looks really wide, it has gone under Sharma's bat. KKR not happy with the call

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: short ball, mis-hits the pull, but he has managed to place this square of deep midwicket for four. He is early into the shot here

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
long_text: wide full toss, mis-hit down the ground, but places it wide of long-off for a couple

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide
long_text: tries the slower ball, and it lands off the cut strip. The umpires are wondering if this should be a wide or a no-ball. If it lands off the pitch, it is a no-ball, but this is called a wide after discussion between the two umpires

the best of the three pulls. Pandya is showing his worth here. He knows Cummins is going to bowl back of a length and cramp him up so he goes deep in his crease and shuffles to get inside the line of it, and short-arms it over deep midwicket for six this time. Amazing hitting
quicker, sharper short ball, following him too, and Pandya has to get out of its way
and he keeps beating those two men on the leg side. Another short-arm pull off a ball that is not short enough. Again bisects those two men on the leg side, and hits the rope on the half-volley
short of a length, Pandya goes deep into the crease to manufacture the length to pull, and bisects deep backward square and deep midwicket
Sharma backs away far, Cummins tries to follow him but overdoes it for a leg-side wide. Karthik allows a bye too as this bounces in front of him
outside edge as he looks to work a wide length ball to leg, the throw from short third man hits Sharma's right foot. It is a strong throw as well. And he was a goner had Rana's throw hit the wicket
that is how hard lengths work. Sharma tries to play the pull, gets a massive top edge, but it lands safe around the 30-yard circle around square leg
slower ball, down the leg side, wide
another carrom ball, short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover, who is tight on the single. Narine ends beautifully
quicker delivery, 95ks, turns back in sharply, hits him on the pad again
lovely delivery, dipping and turning back in, hitting the pad but headed down leg
carrom ball, full on off, Pandya gets a sighter and defends
short ball, pulled between deep square and deep midwicket, but they don't come back for two. Is Rohit gassed?

carrom ball from Narine, Tiwary is looking to go over long-off, and is early into the shot too, getting a lot of height but no distance on it. Perfect time for Pollard or Pandya to walk in. Tiwary has done his job
again slower, hard length, pitched outside leg, cutting towards middle, worked to leg for one
slower ball again, on a length, on the pads, nudged past short fine for a couple
Sharma sets up for the ramp, Cummins bowls the slower one, which means he can't send it over fine leg. The ball goes much squarer, and gets him just the single
looks to make room, Cummins bowls a slower one short of a length, and he has to adjust and get just the single to point
Tiwary is taking Cummins to the cleaners. The plan is to bowl hard lengths again, and Tiwary is equal to it. Stays back, opens the front leg, and lofts this over mid-on
looks for the hard length with mid-on and mid-off up. Tiwary still manages to drive it back down the ground, and between the two. Not the best timing but enough on it
tossed up outside off, Tiwary sets up for a slog-sweep, gets a bottom edge to leg for one
angled too far across, called wide
quicker, nearly seam-up, 106ks, Sharma winds up again, but is late into it, and gets just the single off the inside edge

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: lovely shot. Sharma has picked his bowler. Skips down the track, right to the pitch of this, and lofts it over long-on for his 200th IPL six
angling across him, turning further away, punched to deep cover
tossed up, full, Sharma winds uo for a big one, but he gets this too full. Sharma can't get under this. Gets just the single to long-on

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: starts off with a loose ball. Defensive. Short here, looking to dart one in. Sharma pulls this up and over midwicket. These are not short boundaries so it takes a clean hit
tries a straight yorker, Tiwary opens up the front leg and squeezes this past square leg for a couple
tries a big shot but only manages a toe end for a single. The wide line means Sharma has to reach for it. Warrier stays with his plan to bowl away from Sharma's reach

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: Sharma moves around in the crease, but Warrier sticks with his area and hits the inside edge of his bat
tries a wide slower ball this, and has been called for it

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slower ball? It does move away from him after angling in. So might have been a slower legcutter. Beats Rohit's loft outside off, and falls in short of Karthik

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: stays wide again, and this time Sharma has a go at it, and lofts him in front of deep cover for four
short and wide outside off. Sharma doesn't have to play at it
quick length ball, driven on the up, wide of mid-off, gets a single
another sweep, and again not in control. Kuldeep keeps the length just short of what is ideal for sweeping, and draws a top edge. A fifty nonetheless for Rohit
angles this across him, wide, punched to deep cover for one
on a length, looks to run this behind square, can only send it to point
nice length, not in the arc, not short, can only work it to leg for one
regulation legbreak, short of a length, punched down to long-off for one

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: acrobatic work from Katthik behind the wicket. Deflection off Sharma's pad as he tries the sweep, and Karthik has covered it well with his body but can't prevent one leg-bye
Narine continues with his comeback. Just the single.Three overs without a boundary now. This is a carrom ball, short of a length, and is punched down to long-on for one

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, 1 run, OUT
long_text: skips down the track, Narine drags the length back, beats him in flight, and he drops this into the leg side. Lovely chase from Narine and a lovely take from Morgan. Narine chases towards deep midwicket, they decide to take him on, the throw comes in quick to the bowler's end, but on a half-volley. Morgan gathers it beautifully, and flicks the bails off behind him. A wicketkeeper would be proud of that work
another carrom ball, hit down the ground for a single
swept away to long leg

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fired into the pads, 92ks, draws a dot. Carrom ball that beats him with the drift more than the turn and hits the pads
nice dip on this, not in the swinging arc, so he pushes it down to long-on

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: nice legbreak, around off, turning back in, on a length, defended back to him
drilled down to long-off for one
premeditates a sweep and wastes a juicy foll toss on the pads. Gets a single to long leg
mis-hits the free hit, getting a top edge on the slog to a low full toss. Gets just the single
that's really quick, 106ks, and he has beaten him on the late cut. Almost a seam-up delivery. But it is a no-ball
sweeps this from just outside off, along the ground to deep square
Surya leaves the crease again, Kuldeep cramps him up, and the mis-hit falls well short of long-on
stays short, away from the swinging arc, punched down to long-on for one. Good comeback from Narine
offbreak. Short of a length. Turns in appreciably. Worked to leg for one
fuller, just outside off, driven to long-on for one
quick shortish ball, wide outside off, his cut finds the man at point
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover. No turn
played away to deep square leg for one
on a length, outside off, goes back to punch this to deep midwicket for one

lovely shot. He has picked the wrong'un. Steps down, gets to its pitch, and has gone inside-out over cover for a six. Nothing more alpha than picking a googly and going with the turn and hitting a six
nice turn back in, slightly quicker too, it runs off the inside half of Sharma's bat for one
drags the length back. Gets some dip. Punched to midwicket for one
flighted high again, driven to long-off again
slow and loopy first up, driven to long-off for one
full and wide, driven in front of sweeper-cover for two

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: there is no mistiming this. A gentle short ball at the stumps, and Sharma has smoked this out of the stadium. Sweet sound of the bat. Th sixes stats of Abu Dhabi already getting a working over

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, wide, looks to punch it away, gets a bottom edge

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: that is the first pull he has mis-hit this evening as Russell follows him and hurries him up a little. And still he has managed to place it in front of long leg for four

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, on off, pushed back to Russell
short of a length, outside off, opens the face late to get a single to third man

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: quicker ball, some turn back, punched away crisply, but can't beat the man at cover
short again, punched to deep midwicket
drags the length back, and Yadav loves it just as much. Stands tall and pulls him over midwicket
slow through the air again, offbreak on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
slows this down, gets some dip on it, Yadav can't hit this so he nudges it to leg for one
a nothing offbreak loosener to start off with but Yadav is in no mood for sighters. Plays the pick-up shot over midwicket, thank you very much

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full ball, some shape, hits the outside half of the bat as he looks to work this to leg

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: that is a small six but still worth 6. Quick to see a short ball but doesn't bother rocking back and pulls it from the crease over midwicket. It lands just beyond the rope

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: Sharma looks to make room, but Cummins follows him, drawing a defensive shot back
short of a length, on off, manages to work this to leg
short of a length, no room, worked to leg for one

short_text: Cummins to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: well he doesn't miss out this time. Short ball on an easy-paced pitch, and he is waiting for it. Pulls this 138ks ball over midwicket for six
and he starts off with a wide down the leg side. Sharma won't be happy he has missed out. This could have been pulled for a six

lovely shot. Wrists and forearms. Short of a length, no room to swing his arms, but he punches it nicely past midwicket. Another West Indian, Narine, gives it a slow chase but this time they stay with two

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Yadav, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, pushed to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 3 runs
long_text: fuller this time, he eases himself into another push-drive past mid-off and Russell gives it a ginger chase. Then pulls out te old back heel to keep this in. Has conceded one extra run

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
long_text: short of a length, outside off, punched beautifully on the up, finds the gap through cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, just outside off, defended to leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs
long_text: full, outside off, just a push wide of mid-off for a couple. Elegantly played
slips through the hands of midwicket. He shuffles across to pick this perfectly decent off-side delivery into the leg side. Narine goes up for it, but doesn't seem to have times his jump perfectly
lovely drive to thread the heavily populated cover field. Between cover and cover-point, along the ground. And he has played it on the up too. Top notch
wide on the crease, angling it into the pads, and Yadav loves it there. Plays a clip square on the leg side to beat long leg
square drive to a wide length ball, but again straight to the man at point
