he has missed a plum full toss Just some late swing to do him in. Just outside off so he is okay
nearly played on. He looks to cut one outside off, but it is perhaps not short enough. He gets a bottom edge for four to fine leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: looks for an open-face push-drive but can't get it past the man at point. A wicket-maiden for Mavi. Great start

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: beaten on the inside edge this time as this wide length ball seams back in and moves dramatically after passing the stumps

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: left alone outside off as he stays away from his driving arc

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on a length, angling in, clipped away straight to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, OUT
long_text: De Kock goes. He tries the big pull shot but the ball is not that short. He has had a big go at this as is evident from high the ball has gone. Nikhil Naik at midwicket has to wait for an eternity for it to come down but catches it comfortably

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length, pitches leg, angles to off, played back to him

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: that extra ball has hurt Warrier. He bowls short and wide, and Sharma loves it, upper-cutting it over cover-point for a six. Warrier screams into his hand towel for having ruined what had been such a good first over
goes wide on the crease to vary things a bit, and ends up bowling a wide down the leg side

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: gets the width to play the cut, but can't beat the man at point

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: short of a length, tight on off again, played with an open face to point

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: another defensive shot from Rohit as he stays tight around off

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: tries the outswinger. Short of a length, outside off, beats him on the defence, but also dies in front of the keeper
on a length, around off, crisply played straight of mid-off for one
slower short ball, cut away to deep cover for one

short_text: Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX runs
long_text: quick bouncer, and Dhoni has a hat-trick of sixes. Pulls this over deep square leg. Equal-highest sixes for an IPL match

short_text: Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX runs
long_text: somebody return the ball please. Slower legcutter, Dhoni on a knee, sweet connection, new balls please somebody

short_text: Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX runs
long_text: and Dhoni finally shows intent. Plays the pick-up to an on-pace length ball, and sends it sailing over midwicket for another six
quick, on a length, outside off, gets a single
pulled to deep midwicket for another single
and he shows he has learnt from his master. A leave to end the 19th over. Dropping his wrists out of the way like proper Test match cricket

du Plessis woke the sleeping giant up. Archer bowls the quick bouncer this time, and it is too quick for him. Top edge onto his body, and lobs up for a simple catch for Samson. One thing du Plessis has done through this innings: announce that he can hit clean when he wants to

short_text: Archer to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: du Plessis is waiting for a fourth slower ball in the over, and Archer serves it up. He opens up the front leg and pulls this over deep midwicket for another six
slower short ball again, pulled to deep square for one
slower legcutter again, hit inside-out to deep cover for one. Archer bowling to his field
slower ball to start off with. Du Plessis manages to loft it wide of deep cover, comes back for two

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: slower short ball again, and there is deep midwicket in place to keep this pull down to one
slower short ball, Dhoni pulls, gets just the single

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: short of a length, off-pace, he goes inside out, but gets just the single to wide long-off

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, no run
long_text: yorker, dug out straight to short fine leg. Good comeback from Curran, following him with the yorker

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: du Plessis is in some kind of zone. This is as good as Samson's hitting. Curran bowls on-pace, and he clears his front leg to send this length ball over long-off for his fifth straight scoring shot that is a six
punched to deep cover for one

short_text: Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: and there it is. With a lovely straight six, he goes to 55 off 29, but even that strike rate is not good enough after his slow start pushed CSK into a corner

short_text: Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: sets himself up for the short slower ball this time, and pulls this sweetly over midwicket for a six
on a length angling in, pushed away for a single
Unadkat stays slow, but shortens the length this time. Du Plessis can manage just a single off the pull

short_text: Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: down the wicket, banking on a slower one, Unadkat serves one up, and he lofts it over wide long-on for a six
hits this on the up but straight to long-off
wide length ball, squeezed out for a single
loopy bouncer, Dhoni leaves it alone, and it is not called a wide. Seemed a wide to me. Well above his head
bottom edge on the pull, and Samson collects it on the bounce
cramps him up with a short ball, a limp pulls manages to just clear midwicket. Miller thinks about diving, but decides it is too far out of his reach

short_text: Archer to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. Short of a length, slow, on off, and he backs away to crunch this between cover and extra cover. Finds that gap perfectly

short_text: Archer to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slower ball, outside off, and du Plessis finds the man at point. Six feet either side, and it might have been four
looks to follow him, and Archer goes too far down leg
front-of-the-hand quick low full toss. Hit to deep cover for one. Tewatia ends with 3 for 37

short_text: Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: finally du Plessis gets the timing. Tewatia hasn't done much wrong, but du Plessis goes deep and makes room to loft a length ball over long-on. Perhaps needs to be a touch shorter?
punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, no room, punched down to long-on

short_text: Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: dropped by Riyan Parag at long-on. Du Plessis still struggling for timing on this small ground. Parag sets himself under it at long-on, and the ball swerves away at the last moment. Du Plessis's first boundary
slider into the pads, worked to leg for one
short of a length, slower ball, punched to midwicket, where a misfield gets CSK a single

short_text: Tom Curran to Dhoni, no run
long_text: slower ball to start off with, Dhoni crunches this hard but straight to extra cover

when it is your evening, it is your night. Now Samson takes an amazing one-handed catch to send Jadhav back. Slower short ball, offcutter, Jadhav throws his bat at it, gets a top edge, and Samson leaps to his right to pluck a one-hander

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: and du Plessis is not getting any power into his hits. Really struggling. Gets a free hit right in the slot but sends it only as far as long-on

short_text: Tom Curran to Jadhav, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: down the wicket, but this slower full toss is so high that it is still called a no-ball

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: wide slower ball, hit hard, straight to long-off

short_text: Tom Curran to du Plessis, 2 runs
long_text: and immediately after that chat with Fleming in the timeout, Faf shows some intent. Drills this down the ground for a couple
another slower ball, cramps Faf up, and he takes another single
another slower legcutter. This is some skill. Pushed into the off side for one
another slower legcutter, but this one has slipped down the leg side
slower short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket for another single
length ball, angling in, worked to leg for one
slower ball, pretty accurate, within the stumps, bunted to leg for one
full and wide, nearly a yorker, dug out for one
drilled down to long-off for one. CSK have had their best over in a while, but it has only stayed abreast with the asking rate. Gopal is done for the night
moves across to pull this length ball to deep square leg for one
Gopal continues to slow it down. Now he has the extra cover back, and Jadhav takes a single
lovely shot. Jadhav gets under a length ball and goes inside-out over cover for four
Gopal slows it down, Jadhav looks to go over cover, ends up slicing it over the infield, but the placement is good as the sweeper is too straight
finally a boundary attempt, and it comes from Jadhav. Drills a rocket past du Plessis at non-striker's end for a straight four
tossed up wide outside off, driven hard, but straight to long-off
down the wicket again, Tewatia digs it in, punched down to long-on

short_text: Tewatia to du Plessis, no run
long_text: down the wicket, beaten in the flight, forced to play just the push to extra cover
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
wide length ball, pushed to point. Even Jadhav not looking for boundaries
full, straight, du Plessis not looking to take risk. So the hat-trick ball is avoided easily. They get a single to long-on
down the wicket but too close to the pitch of the ball, hits it back to Gopal
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
short of a length, straight, punched down to long-on
slightly quicker, outside off, punched to deep cover
soft hands of Jadhav to work this to leg for another single
length ball, du Plessis goes back to work this to leg for one

and Tewatia is on a hat-trick. Another stumping for Samson. Gaikwad skips out first ball, Tewatia bowls wide outside off to beat him easily. Tewatia is elated. Celebrates with fingers in his ear. Not sure if he had been given some lip when he was batting

and Tewatia has done for Curran. Too many risks he is taking, and has jumped of the crease again. Tewatia slows it down further, and goes wider to beat him. Easy stumping for Samson. Curran goes for a six-ball 17, a very Curran score

short_text: Tewatia to Sam Curran, no run
long_text: shorter quicker slider, hit back to Tewatia off the back foot

short_text: Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: twice as nice. Tewatia does better than the last time by taking this slightly out of Curran's reach, but he still gets enough on this straight loft to add six more

short_text: Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: lovely shot. Sweet timing. Down the wicket, right to its pitch, and lofts it clean back over his head. over the roof again. New balls please
du Plessis skips down the wicket to push this into the leg side for another single
full toss, but du Plessis gets just a single to deep midwicket. Asking rate 12.65 now
no turn again, Curran goes back to punch this to leg for one

short_text: Gopal to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: and he smacks a cool boundary first up. Gopal bowls short again, and he goes back to pull this over midwicket

a sleepy little knock from Vijay comes to an end. He has hit in the air for a second time without the conviction of hitting a six. He looks to pull this slightly short ball, but goes only as far as deep square leg
Gopal gets a hand on this drive back at him, but the deflection goes past the stumps for a single

short_text: Gopal to du Plessis, no run
long_text: a better start to this over. he tosses it up outside off, and Faf plays it back to him. Surprised by no turn perhaps
slows this one down, on off, pushed straight to cover. Just four off and a wicket, and the asking rate is back to 12.3
full, straight, driven to long-on for one

timber. Tewatia gets the wicket to ease off some pressure. Watson knows they can't have three singles in a row. He goes back to pull another slider, and this is perhaps not short enough. It squeezes under the bat, hits the pad, and cannons into the leg stump
pushes this through, the slider, no turn, middle and leg, short of a length, pushed to leg for one
full, just outside off, driven to long-off for one

and he nearly has a wicket first ball. Vijay has played a switched-off shot first ball, chipping this towards long-off without any power. It is good he hasn't hit it well: it doesn't carry to the fielder

short_text: Tom Curran to Watson, no run
long_text: slower ball to end the over, and another dot as it is driven straight to cover

short_text: Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely batting. Short of a length, just the amount of width he needs, and he steers this wide of short third man

short_text: Tom Curran to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: Watson repeats the dose. Curran stays short again, this time on off, and Watson likes this short boundaries. Smoked clean over square leg

short_text: Tom Curran to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: Watson helps this over the fence. Curran looks to tuck him up, but goes too fa down leg with this shortish ball, and Watson pulls this over long leg

short_text: Tom Curran to Vijay, 1 leg bye
long_text: short of a length, quick, beats his attempt to play to leg. Goes for a leg-bye

short_text: Tom Curran to Vijay, no run
long_text: lovely slower ball first up. Vijay totally flummoxed and beaten outside off
too short, and Watson sends it over the grandstand. Gopal has found no turn on the ball,and the length has been generally shot. Watson i waiting for this one, and pulls it in the air over square leg
another attempted legbreak that doesn't turn and goes on with the angle. Hit straight to midwicket
pushed through full and straight, driven to long-on for one. Bowled at 113ks
on a length, still no turn. It goes with the angle. Hit to square leg again
short again, no turn, and this time Vijay beats the man at square for four
not sure this is the wrong'un, but this does come back in. Can't beat square leg

quick short ball. Too good for Watson. No room. He has to defend this back to Archer. Just the six runs off the over despite conceding a six off the first ball. The asking rate nearing two a ball already
slower ball now, and pretty accurate. Watson plays it out watchfully
hurried on the pull this time, straight to midwicket
looks to run this down, and sends it straight to the keeper. On the bouncer

pace on this one, and it draws an lbw shout. Not given, sounds like bat, but the two noises are two pads. Watson simply late on this high pace of Archer. Probably headed down leg. Umpire's call says the replay
and he bowls a gentle length ball into the pads. Watson picks the slower ball, and goes over midwicket for a six. They will need many more of these
short of a length, on pace, pushed to cover-point. Good comeback by Unadkat after conceding two fours off the first two balls
Watson slogs this slower ball to deep forward square leg for one
slower bouncer, but too high, and it is called a wide
slower ball again. It is not easy to bowl these with the new ball. Watson pushes this to cover-point
slower ball now, and Vijay has to drop and run. He is not the quick Vijay we knew. He is nearly run out but Tewatia misses with the throw
lovely strike. Clears the front leg, stands tall, and smashes this length ball over mid-off. Has the pace to work with
loose ball. Pitches well outside leg, on a length, and Vijay helps it on its way to fine leg for four
short of a length, into the ribs, played with the bottom hand off the bat, gets a single to long leg
short of a length, just outside off, dropped square of point for a single
slower ball? Yes it is. At 123ks. On a length, on off, Watson has to defend
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man for one
wide and full, slower than the last one, driven square, but can't beat Miller at cover-point
that's quick. He has visibly beaten Vijay for pace and hit his pad. Headed down leg
slower ball, on off, he pushes it to point and takes off for a suicidal run. Sent back, and he gets an overthrow for his efforts
on a length, straight, pushed into the leg side for one
looks to run this down to third man but can't beat the slip
tucked away off the hip again for another single
short of a length, on the hips, tucked away for a single
full and straight, dug out for a single to leg
slow and short and wide again, Archer toe-ends this to long-off for another single. Ngidi comes back well to end with just 30 off this over
slower short ball again, outside off, Curran slaps this down to long-off to give Archer another hit before this innings ends
slow and short, into the ribs, cramps him up, just a single to long leg
slower short ball wide outside off, Archer goes across, is right behind its line, but is early into his swing. Finally a clean dot for Ngidi
make it 27 off two legal deliveries. He beats Archer with a slower ball but it is called wide. So the free hit remains

short_text: Ngidi to Archer, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: Make it four. Range hitting at its best. Archer goes deep into the crease, sets up a strong base, and murders another length ball. This one is straight back over his head. Twenty-five off three legal deliveries. Make it 26 off two legal deliveries as this is another no-ball. Man this game is cruel. Another free hit coming up

short_text: Ngidi to Archer, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: That is three in a row. Holly Molly. Short of a length, and he makes room again to send this flat over cow corner for another six. Plus this is a no-ball. A big no-ball. CSK losing the plot here
bang. Over the roof behind midwicket. Ngidi bowls on-pace short ball. Archer clears the front leg, and smacks this over midwicket, and onto the road somewhere
or as easy as Archer is making it look with this effortless six. Cool as. Ngidi misses his yorker, and he makes room and lofts him back over his head
full, middle and leg, hit to long-on for one

short_text: Sam Curran to Tom Curran, 1 run
long_text: walks down at him, Sam shortens the length, pulled away to square leg for a single

short_text: Sam Curran to Tom Curran, 2 runs
long_text: low full toss, drilled back at him. Sam gets a hand on it. They take Jadeja on for a second and he rips the stumps out with a flat throw from long-on. The replays, though, show Archer has made it in

short_text: Sam Curran to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: oh Tom has this one over Sam. Lovely yorker from Tom, but he gets an outside edge past the diving short third man for four

S Curran has another wicket. Smith has looked out of gas for a wee while now. He looks to whip a length ball to leg but gets no power behind the shot. Caught at deep midwicket. CSK back into this if there is dew later tonight

short_text: Sam Curran to Tom Curran, 1 run
long_text: on a length, on the pads, worked away to long leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed for a single. An excellent 18th over. No boundary off it

short_text: Chahar to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: and they don't have the review so Curran has to walk back but the umpires get together for a chat before sending Curran on his way. This is shambolic umpiring. I am loathe to criticise umpires, but this is really poor. This is a short ball that Curran looks to pull and is beaten. The ball hits the thigh pad of Curran and goes to Dhoni on the half-volley, and he has been given out caught at the wicket. Hang on. The umpires have seen the replay, and are now going to the third umpire. Dhoni doesn;t seem happy with them changing their minds after seeing the replay. Not sure what Dhoni has against it: the umpires are within their rights to change their decision as long as they are consistent and arriving at the right decision. The replays show Curran can go back to bat

short_text: Chahar to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: short of a length, angling in, giving him no room. Hit back to Chahar. Good over so far
this is a slower ball for sure, and he gets a single to deep point with the punch

slower legcutter, short of a length, outside off, beats him, falls in front of Dhoni, and they take a bye off the midfield. Oh replays show this is not a slower ball. It is seam up but just dies upon pitching
shuffle across to work a length ball to long leg for one

another wicket for Curran as Parag looks to run this down to the other side of short third man. This is short of a length, he has run his fingers on it. Parag opens the face and gets only an edge that is falling in front of Dhoni. The ball nearly pops out of his hands but he does well to hold on

short_text: Sam Curran to Parag, FOUR runs
long_text: low wide full toss, and it runs off the outer half of his bat for a four between short third man and point
wide length ball, driven in front of deep cover, comes back for two. That is crisp connection

short_text: Sam Curran to Parag, no run
long_text: round the wicket goes Curran, bowls an offcutter, allows him no room. Pushed back to him

that is out. Tewatia has been swiping across the line too often here. Given out lbw but he has reviewed it. He has missed a plum full toss, and is hit on the toe. The only question is, if it is angling down. it isn't. He has burnt the review
slower ball, on a length, around, cutting away, gets a single to deep cover
slower ball, on a length, and he swipes across it. Beaten
mis-times a pull but get s a couple thanks to that as he places this wide of deep midwicket
lovely clean strike, Ngidi bowls regulation pace and length. Tewatia stands tall and goes over wide mid-off for four
worked into the leg side for one
Smith is on the floor, and the ball is at the fine-leg fence. Smith premeditates to counter Ngidi's wide bowling, and ramps his over short fine. In the process he is on his back on the flor
Tewatia looks to slog him, Ngidi is not full enough, and he gets a single to leg
wrong'un, takes the outside edge, and goes for a single to short third man. Chawla ends a good comeback, but he has still conceded 55 off his four overs
wide on the crease, slider, Smith happy with a single
on a length, Tewatia can't get under it, punched down to long-off
full, around off, driven to long-off for one
pushed wide of cover for a single

Uthappa tries to hit him for another six, chips down the track, but gets too close to the ball and hence can't get the elevation he needs. This is timed well, but straight and low to du Plessis at long-off. Disappointing effort from Uthappa
short and wide, cut away for another single
short of a length, punched away for one

dropped by Curran at wide long-off. Jadeja continues to bowl wide. This is round-arm too. Smith reaches for it, and mis-hits towards Curran, but he is so close to the boundary that he is worried about the rope behind it, and the ball pops out of his hand and for a six
wide outside off, past that guide line, and it is called
Uthappa looks to hit down the ground, is hit on the inside edge and takes a single to deep midwicket
slows this down, punched away square of deep cover, but they are happy with just the one
wide length ball, quick, pushed to deep cover
nice length here, and some turn. Amazing what happens once your tormentor is gone. Only a single to cover
appeal for stumping as he is beaten by a wrong'un but he is safe
looks to go to long-off but can't go past Chawla
pushed down the ground
pushed back to him as Chawla is quick

slower ball again, worked into a hole on the leg side, and has Miller lost his bat while diving to make it to the non-striker's end? Oh he has lost his bat while diving but has Jadhav broken the wicket with his hand before colelcting the ball? Miller is definitely short of the ground, and the third umpire doesn't seem to be considering the possibility of Jadhav having messed up this run-out. He rules it out. Miller gone without facing a ball on RR debut. Good thinking by the fielder in the deep to go to the far end because Miller was surprised by the call for two. And Jadhav's collection was clean as. The earlier replays created an illusion it might not have been
short of a length, cramps him up, punches this back to Ngidi
another slower ball, wide down the leg side

and they finally get rid of Samson. Ngidi keeps hiding the ball from Samson. No pace on, and wide outside off. Samson still thinks of hitting this over cover for six, but he doesn't get the timing. Off the toe end it goes for a catch to deep cover. What a lovely innings from Samson
short of a length, outside off, cut away to third man for one
slower ball again, he has to pull out of his big wind-up. Pushed to point where Jadeja concedes an overthrow for a single
slower ball, short of a length, cutting in, punched to point for one
round-arm delivery, fired in outside off, Samson can't get this one away
flat, wide, outside off, driven to deep cover
this one slips out of his hand and is a wide full toss outside off
flatter and quicker, and pushed to deep midwicket now

oh man this is some hitting. Jadeja got away once, but Samson is waiting for the next one. his is slightly fuller, slightly closer to off, and Samson lofts it over long-off. It is like a range-hitting season
Samson winds up for a big hit, but sees this is wide, and leaves it alone
Jadeja good at bowling that length that is not in his arc but also not short. Concedes only a single
this one has no room on it, and he gets away with a single. If he doesn't bowl another over, Chawla could avoid a fifty tonight. But who will bowl his overs?
and now he is too short, and Smith plays a late cut to beat a slow-motion dive from Watson at short third man
this time he avoids that full length, and Samson punches this to deep cover

Chawla has to be a sucker for punishment. He is not looking to shorten his length, Just keeps up rolling these into his arc, and Boutros Boutros Ghali, Samson loves it in the slot. Another straight six
driven to deep cover
Chawla is continuing to pitch it up, and when you don't get any dip on the ball, you are asking for punishment on smaller grounds. And he has drilled this back over his head for another six
worked into the leg side for a other single
winds up for a big hit, but the lack of turn on this one means it takes the inside edge
well bowled. Full but not full enough for his lofted shots. Gets the inside edge on the drive
gets bat on this one, and takes the single to bring Samson back on strike

huge shout for lbw against Smith, not given, and they won't review it. Plays right across the line of this, but doesn't seem to have straightened enough. Hello, the replay shows it did straighten enough and would have hit the leg stump. Missed out there
darted into the pads, not letting him get under it. He takes a single to leg
Lovely Jubbly. Smith into the act now. Chalwa remains short, wide, flat, and Smith goes over extra cover. This is an exhibition. Twenty-eight off this over. He went for 21 in the whole last match
Chawla drags this short. Whatever you do, don't let him drive. Samson punches this to deep cover for a single. And this is a no-ball too so Smith gets a free hit now
Yo Yo Ma. This is sweet hitting. Chawla is in his slot again, and he clears from front leg to send it sailing back over his head. This is lovely batting
short of a length, Smith is happy with singles now. Give Samson as much strike as you can
shorter, flatter, quicker, and he ounches it to deep cover to bring up his own quickest IPL fifty
the best of the lot. Lovely to watch. Groovy. Chawla goes wide, trying to avoid his arc, but he reaches for it, and goes inside-out over extra cover. Sweet as
Samson is some mood tonight. Chawla starts off full too, and he clears his front leg to send it over long-on. Smooth easy hitting
looks to drive to long-off, but gets hit on the inside half of the bat. A much-needed dot for Jadeja
flat and quick again, pushed wide of cover this time
flatter, quicker, shorter, played to cover
Jadeja shows some heart but not sure it is wise here. He flights it up again, and Samson nonchalantly lofts this over long-off, and it is huge. Hits the top of the grandstand
Samson loves this small boundaries. Keeps his head down and swings through the line of a full ball on the pads. Over wide long-on it goes
low full toss, driven to deep midwicket for one
slower short ball, Smith shapes up for the pull, and then decides to go ahead with it. Except that this is pulled to mid-off (crazy, right?) for one
wide on the crease, and ends up angling this too far down the leg side. Glanced away fine of short fine leg. Not good bowling
backs away as Chahar runs in, then gets back to his original position when Chahar bowls. Chahar bowls length and straight. Pushed wide of mid-on for one
short-arm pull. Chahar bowls a short ball that doesn't have much sting in it. Samson stands tall, and picks it up over square leg
slower ball, short of a length, punched to deep cover for one
wide length ball, pushed wide of mid-off for a single
slower ball, on a length, no room, Samson does well to take a single in the covers
full and wide, driven square, square enough of deep cover to allow them to come back for a second

short_text: Sam Curran to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: another short ball, straight at him, and he nonchalantly pulls it over square leg for six. With short square boundaries here, not sure you want to go short at Curran's pace

short_text: Sam Curran to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: cheeky. Short ball, no room, extra bouncer, and Samson steers it between the keeper and short third man. Doesn't bother with keeping it down

short_text: Sam Curran to Samson, no run
long_text: and Samson moves the other way, backing away to create room. Curran goes wide outside off, and beats his attempt to cut
the shuffle across continues, Curran sticks to his guns, bowling short of the driving length and outside off. Smith takes a single to mid-off
digs this one in short, Samson is ready for the hook, but mis-times it. He is looking square leg, but ends up hitting this over wide mid-on. Has enough behind it to clear the circle, though
short of driving length, pushed square on the off side, but not past Jadeja
on a length, around off, in the slot but Samson is looking to get himself in.Pushes this to leg
keeps it short of that slogging length, and Smith has to look for a single, which he gets in front of point
shaping up for another big hit, but this length ball doesn't quite come on to the bat and he ends up adjusting the shot for a push to leg
what a welcome to Ngidi. Smith shuffles across and whips a gentle length ball over long leg for a six. Easy as
slower bouncer, around off, dabbed down towards point for a single
tries the bouncer, but there is no bounce in the pitch. Easily pulled away over midwicket for four
slower ball, nearly a yorker, Smith plays it back to him
goes full looking for swing, but angles it down leg for a single to long leg

smart bowling. Jaiswal sees this is shortish again, and thinks he has another boundary for the taking, but this is slightly wider and bounces a touch extra. Takes the top endge for an easy catch towards Dhoni, but Chahar is so committed to it that Dhoni lets him take it
the first boundary of the innings. This is only slightly short of a length, and despite being a tall man, Jaiswal manages to go back enough to create his length and pulls it over midwicket

short_text: Sam Curran to Smith, no run
long_text: shuffling across again, and Curran is winning this battle by keeping the ball away from Smith. This short ball has tennis-ball bounce, and sails over his attempted cut. Excellent start for CSK

short_text: Sam Curran to Smith, no run
long_text: Curran slips in the short ball as Smith walks down at him this time. Hits the bottom half of the bat as Smith tries to pull
angling in, on a length, tucked away to long leg
and this is good bowling. Even though Smith shuffles enough to make connection with a wide length ball, the deep cover-point is in place to prevent a boundary

short_text: Sam Curran to Smith, no run
long_text: on a length, outside off, Smith pushes it to point
Smith shuffles wide, Curran goes wider, and is called for it

short_text: Sam Curran to Smith, no run
long_text: starts off with a slow delivery on a length outside off. Pushed to cover-point
misses out on a juicy short wide delivery again as he can't find the gap between point and cover-point. Gaekwad's misfield gives them a single. It could have easily been 12 off this over
missed out on a leg-side half-volley as he finds the man by the side of the square-leg umpire
shuffles across, takes a length ball from off to work it past square leg for a couple
short of a length, outside ff, he goes back to steer it to third man
Jaiswal walks down at Chahar, who bowls the one swinging in to him. Pushed towards mid-off as he is cramped up
after a two-minute delay, we finally have a ball bowled. It starts outside off, and swings further away. Left alone by Jaiswal. Close to being called a wide
taken at long-on! That's the win for RCB. Sandeep with a sweet connection, but Kohli tracks backwards and leaps to grab on to that. Short ball, good pull, but Sunrisers will lose by 10 runs
good length and just outside off, backs away and has a slog. Gets a thick outside edge to third man's left
low full toss at middle stump, laboured thwack to long-on's right
short of a length outside off, opens the face and jabs it to point off the under-edge
slower ball at a length on middle stump, lofts it on the up to long-on's right
slower ball at a good length on middle, slugged off the toe-end to long-on's left
low full toss on off stump, leans in and pats it to extra cover. Direct hit and he would've been out at the non-striker's
full and across off stump, feebly poke at it and is beaten

holes out to long-on. Smart bowling from Dube. Making him fetch that from outside off, because foot movement is out of the question. Slower ball, looping outside off. Comes off the toe-end and that's that for Marsh. Can barely stay on his feet and off he goes with the physio for support
short of a length at off stump, mistimed pull out to long-on. Marsh hobbles through to the other end. There's a misfield at long-on, but he can barely jog at the moment
tonks off stump! Full and honing in at off stump. Nothing adventurous about this shot either, just an attempted drive. But Saini is  rapid. Just too good. He has done his job to perfection
yorker at middle stump, watchfully pushed down to long-on
knocks the middle stump out! Full, straight, too fast for Bhuvi. Top class. Looking to drive that to long-on with a straight bat, not a lot wrong with the attempt. It's just too fast for him
short of a length just outside off, jabbed to point off the back foot
short outside off, whippy cut, straight to third man
another bouncer but this goes all wrong for Saini. Chases him down leg side with another bouncer. It's above the head, it's way down leg side, it's past Philippe's left hand

short_text: Saini to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: bouncer first up. Heading for his helmet. Rashid is quick to duck under that

collision and run out! Rashid Khan is on the floor. It was a cutter, flicked into the leg side. To deep midwicket. They wanted two, they were both ball watching. Sharma had run to the side that would be around the wicket for the right handed bowler to him. Rashid was on the same path at the other end. They were, essentially, headed for each other and in the moment, with the ball-watching, had no idea where the other person was. Sharma was on his feet, and he ran through, so he's the one dismissed.
length on off stump, waits on that and jabs into the covers off the front foot

short_text: Dubey to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: four first up. Easy does it for the main man now for SRH. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. Waits on it, old fashioned square cut between backward point and third man

bat, onto helmet, onto stumps! Length ball outside off, walks into the off side and looks for the ramp. It's off the leading edge, onto his grille, and then it lobs onto off stump. This chase is coming completely apart now
offcutter, short of a length at middle stump. Looks to whip into the leg side, deflected towards short fine off the thigh
length at off stump, tapped down to long-on off the back foot
oh hello! Hello Abhishek Sharma. Jumps down, meets this full ball at the pitch and drills it straight over the bowler. Confident stuff that, superbly executed
full on leg stump, tucked to deep midwicket off the front foot
tossed up at off stump, driven along the floor to long-off

bowled him with an absolute beauty! Wow! Sensational! Googly lobbed right up, just outside off. Shankar looked completely out of sorts, playing for the turn and looking to drive on the off side. Huge, huge gap between bat and pad and middle stump takes a tonk. What a delivery. And what a player he is for RCB, keeping them in it again and again and again

bowled him! Oh boy oh boy oh boy, what was Bairstow thinking there? Look for your Fazeer Mohammed clips because this is fully deserving of an animated "why did he dooo thaaat?" Full floaty ball at leg stump, gets the front leg into the leg side and unleashes the most ungainly heave and misses entirely. Leg stump takes a knock and RCB will suddenly feel energised with the inexperience coming for SRH. Top knock from YJB until that ball
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
past the outside edge. Length ball wide outside off, opens the face and has a swish
third umpire checking for run out at striker's end. He's well in. A full ball flicked to Padikkal's right at deep midwicket, they take his arm on and do it successfully

scythed off the thick inside edge and it trickles to deep square's left and beats him to the boundary. A short ball again, throws his bat at it with a pull and gets no real timing on that. But midwicket is in and there is a gap out there

dropped at deep midwicket. A difficult one though, diving forward at a dipping ball to his left. Padikkal there. Short ball outside off and he laced this with the pull, flat and dipping rapidly at the fielder
yorker length down leg side, can't get the flick away
expertly carved past short third. Yorker length outside off, just hangs deep, slight arch back, and the perfect opening of the face to get it to that fielder's left
full and just outside off. A stylish chip to long-on's left
pristine! Length ball sitting up outside off at the perfect pace, and he gets his weight into it even without a big forward stride. Races to extra cover's left
short ad up at the front shoulder. Inside edge lands pitch side after his attempted hook

beaten and the keeper fumbles too. Short and just outside off, looks to chop but that dips in and is past the inside edge. Keeps on moving to Philippe's left and it looks like it's hit him awkwardly on the fingers. He's getting some help from the physio

brings up a half century with some brute force. Dropped short at an off stump line with square leg in the circle. Poor from Umesh, but majestic short-arm pull from Bairstow. Drops to deep midwicket's right and skids into the ad boards
length on leg stump, tucked into the midwicket region with soft hands

Steyn drops it! Oh boy, that looks utterly ordinary with the catch, but has he managed a run out? Short ball at middle stump, through the pull shot too early. Top edge hands up at fine leg. Steyn has completely lost it running back and to his left. Has the reverse cup ready, and has to follow it awkwardly down with reverse cup. In the end, he can't even get a hand to it. Completely lost that in the sky. Managed to keep it from touching the boundary. Bairstow well in on the run out chance
slower ball, short of a good length outside off. Looks to work it leg side but it's back to the bowler
slower ball, short of a length and wide outside off. Backs away and looks to flat-bat through the off side. Beaten

length at middle stump, steps out and looks to flick. Looks like an inside edge onto pad that deflects to the keeper's right. Or not, according to the umpire. It's gone far enough for him to come back for the second
length outside off, defended to backward point
length at middle stump, walks across his stumps and flicks to fine leg's left. Kohli wanted more urgency from that fielder. Garg gets off the mark with a double
full on middle stump, jammed down to long-on

oh but he gifts one next ball! Full and loopy outside off, looks to loft him over long-off. Gets nowhere near enough connection. Saini takes it some 10-15 yards inside. A tired, lazy shot at best, that one

there's a noise here and an appeal for catch behind. Kohli reviews. Full ball tossed right outside off, spinning towards the wide marker. Pandey looked to slug that over extra cover and it spun past the bat, thinks the umpire. UltraEdge shows a flat line. That's the review lost.
full outside off, reverse sweep straight to short third
full and wide outside off, driven to extra cover

is that a missed stumping? Looks like it. Full and down leg side. Down the track, big swing and nowhere near it. Philippe is rooted in his squat, can't even move to his left as this slides between batsman and leg stump
full on leg stump, thumped down to long-on
just past off stump. Expects this short of a length ball to rise, but it's low and past his pull shot. This exact thing has happened to many batsmen this evening
length outside off, jammed to mid-off's left

dropped at extra cover! Finch with the reverse cup. It's drilled at him. Very very hard. Just bursts through his hands. He was in position and all, hands behind it, but it is just too quick for him. An overpitched ball slaughtered by Bairstow at head height, just to his right
short and into the body. Shapes to pull but is done for pace. Adjusts and guides it to third man instead
full and into the pads. Looks to flick it away, only deflected to midwicket's right off the pad
yorker length at middle stump, jammed down to long-on
short of a length and spinning away, backs away to punch to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
good length, slow and turning at off stump. Steps out and is forced to dead-bat that because he's nowhere near the pitch
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper's left
length at middle stump. Looks to work that for the turn, into the covers, but it skids on and pings to midwicket off the inside edge
length and skidding on at middle stump. Tapped into the leg side off the back foot
full slower ball at middle stump, drilled down to long-on off the front foot
similar areas from both batsman and bowler. But it's an inside edge on the attemped cover drive that gives Jonny the runs at fine leg this time
expertly done. Such a good batsman. Anticipated the line and length and just jumped into the off side and got under it. From there, he nails the ramp and it's quickly over the fine boundary
beaten on the pull. Short of a length in the corridor, swipes above that one
length on middle stump, driven firmly to long-on's left
length and just outside off, opens the face and taps to point's left
length on middle, punched to long-on's right
length outside off, good skill this time in maneuvering that fine. Got down on a knee and ramped it. Long leg cleans up
past the edge again. Dangles it slow and wide outside off. Bairstow forward and half-hearted in that poke
length and slow at leg stump, leans in and chips to long-on
rips it past the edge! Whew, that was gorgeous viewing. Dip, drift, grip and then past Pandey's forward defence
length on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
short of a length at middle, clipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full and just outside off, there for the drive and he nails it but straight to extra cover
length at off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, pulled to midwicket
ohhh yessss! That echoed in Dubai! Floated up into the slot and he wasted no time, plants the front leg out and into the leg side before swinging it 91 metres in the midwicket direction
length and sliding on outside off, slapped on the bounce to extra cover
low full toss outside off, chopped to mid-off's left
length at off stump, dropped pitch side off the back foot
another pick-up into the leg side. Short and climbing in the corridor. Similar to most of the last few deliveries, but a different strategy this time. Hoicks without fuss to the midwicket boundary
length outside off, looks to force that on the up. It trickles to mid-on off the inside half
short of a length and skidding on outside off. Mistimed punch on the up
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off's left on the rise
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
length on off stump, punched to mid-on off the inside of the bat
length on off stump, flicks it onto his own pad off the inside edge. A run sneaked pitch side
length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler on the up
on the pads again! Umesh really struggling for line. This one is yorker length, Pandey is shimmying quickly to meet it on the full and he gets it past short fine
sweetly put away. Throwdown right onto his pads and he uses the pace and offers the full face of the bat to clip this to mid-on's right
short and just outside off, slashes at that. Point gets a hand to it diving to his left
good length and just outside off, looks to force that on the up and against the angle. It's hit the inside of his bat
short of a length just outside off, jumps inside the line and deflects it to third man's left
short of good length outside off, mistimed drive on the up to mid-off
whistles past the inside edge. Slammed in at a good length, just outside off. Bairstow swishes for the original line but the angle beats him
one bounce to third man. He wanted to cut and withdrew, and somehow the outside edge still nearly carried out to that fielder
length on middle, clipped to midwicket's left. Chahal seems to have jarred his knee into the turf. He's walking off but he looks in good spirits, maybe a temporary break
evades mid-on and has enough on it to find the boundary. Full ball at middle, drives uppishly, almost shoveled with the bottom hand because he's not to the pitch. It's between non-striker and mid-on
short and in the corridor. Too late on the pull and it's no work for midwicket
full and into the pads. Whips it off the toes to fine leg's left
length at off stump, defended towards midwicket off the inside half of the bat
lbw appeal turned down. Half an appeal. Short of a length and climbing into his thigh as he looks to glance that
length and at the stumps. Solidly defended on the front foot
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot

he has Warner out backing up! Oh boy, this is huge. Ain't gonne be no spirit of cricket talk tonight for sure. Length ball just outside off, Bairstow absolutley cannons this drive on the up, back at Umesh. Technically, it is a dropped catch. He sticks one hand out and can't hold on, because well, he's only human. But, the hand is important because Warner is meandering and he is caught well out off the deflections

helped over the fine leg boundary! If there ever was a shot to sum up a batsman, it's this half-pull, half-ramp from Bairstow. Quick, short and at his hips. Barely does more than bring his bat from underneath that and lift it with the angle
overpitched and on the toes. This time Bairstow does manage to get bat and he does it with good effect. Flicked to fine leg's left and Steyn's dive is not good enough
length and down leg side again. Looking to get the outswinger going, no luck so far
short of a length and down leg side. Flying take from Philippe down leg side
appeal for lbw turned down. Length ball skids on past his poke from the crease. Past the inside edge but hitting him outside leg stump
length and in the corridor, defended to point from the crease
beaten. Length ball skids on, very very low. Looks to just feel for that as it skids between inside edge and off stump
full outside off, scythes at it from inside the line, on the bounce to backward point
full and wide outside off again, throws his hands at this again, down one knee. Not quite timed. Beats extra cover to the left
crunched. Overpitched and a lot of room outside off. He has nailed that drive to mid-off's right
short of a length and climbing, outside off. Left alone
Bairstow runs at the stumps and finishes the run-out. Beaten on the hook, is Dube. Just wanders half-heartedly for the run. Philippe not interested. Bairstow completes the job
slower ball at a length, wide outside off again. He's outfoxed once more, just manages a flap at that. It rolls out to long-off
beaten. Knuckle ball, it appears. Good length and loopy wide outside off. Lines up for the slog sweep but can't get the timing right

sensational work from Pandey at long-off! What a throw. Slower ball just outside off, mistimed punch to his left at long-off. Pandey swoops down on it, winds up his throwing arm and sends it one bounce to the keeper's end, mere inches from the stumps. Bairstow only has to complete a simple movement. Super, super stuff from Pandey. Beats AB's dive
half century. Every season, it is this man at the end for RCB. Full ball outside off, swatted to long-off's left  on the front foot
pumped straight over the bowler. Full at middle stump, deep in the crease waiting for it and a clean loft to get it over the boundary, one bounce
yorker at the stumps, jammed to deep midwicket
beaten by the yorker. Full and honing in at the corridor, can't get close to connecting on that

whipped over extra this time! And off the back foot. Welcome back, AB. Ridiculous shots. Doing precisely what the bowler wants him to do and still managing sixes. This was short and rising up in the corridor. He leaped up at it and flat-batted it well in front of square

clubbed over extra cover! Sandeep was looking to take away the slog and the scoop with that last ball. Goes with the same ball again, length, slow and wide. This time he waits for it and hits it on the up, way way back. Stunning hit on a slow pitch
beaten. Expertly done. Slower ball, good length and wide outside off. Looks to slog that and is beaten
slower ball smashed into the pitch, short of a length and at the body. Backs away and hammers it only to fine long-off
another yorker and he can only turn it to deep square with a flick
yorker at leg stump, clipped between deep square and fine leg
nicely bowled. Jams that into the surface and rolls the fingers at it. It grips and gets big to cramp Dube, who was backing away. He can only tap it back at the bowler
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
lofts it straight and firmly. Overpitched this time, narrowly missing the yorker. Enough for AB to swing from underneath it, flat and to the straight boundary
nails the yorker. At middle stump and turned out to deep square with a flick
length at off stump, allows that on and opens the face to get it down to third man
full outside off, looks to crunch it through the covers, thick inside edge down to long-on

chipped to the midwicket boundary. Slower ball at a good length, on middle. Looks like midwicket was in and he just looks to get it there. Would have been caught with a fielder in the deep, but this is one bounce over the line and very deliberate
nearly chops on! Short ball slants inwards as AB looks to cut this behind square on the off side. Bounces through to the keeper
short at middle stump, hurriedly tucks it to midwicket's left
full slower ball outside off. Driven off the low part of the bat to long-off
slower ball, full and just outside off. Driven to long-off

taken at deep midwicket. Length ball at middle stump, hangs back and looks to slog that over the midwicket boundary. It's come off the inside half and Rashid settles comfortably underneath that to take the catch. His first real attempt at clearing the boundary today and it doesn't come off. A nice little comeback has happened from Natarajan this evening after his first over
yorker at middle stump, jammed down to long-on
carved wide of sweeper cover. Full and wide outside off, down on one knee, and a gorgeous looking free-flowing aerial drive to that fielder's right
dropped short and at his chest. Pulled firmly, straight to deep midwicket
short of a length at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
length on off stump, nudged into the covers
length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket's left off the back foot and another second run stolen
googly at middle stump, mistimed push down to long-on
length outside off, driven to sweeper's right
full outside off, plonks the front leg across, whips it to deep midwicket's left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
slower ball at middle stump, gets forward and pushes to deep square
length at middle stump, steps out and can't get the flick away. Nudges it back down the pitch
another full slower one on leg stump. Shuffles and flicks to fine leg's right
slower ball, full and just outside off. Driven to point's right off the outside half
length on off stump, steps out and punches to long-off
full on off stump, driven on the rise to long-off
googly, tossed up outside off, whippy off drive to long-off's left
length at leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full outside off, gets forward and clips to long-on
length on off, driven with the turn to long-off
length on middle stump, chipped into the vacant leg side
length at middle stump, whipped to long-on off the back foot
length outside off, driven to long-off
length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket
full at off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length and slow at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the front foot

that is plumb. Or looks plumb anyway. Two in two for SRH. Full and in at middle stump. Finch plants the front leg well across and looks to sweep him. Caught in front of middle stump. Didn't come off at all for Finch tonight. That looked like a carrom ball from Sharma. Certianly the knuckles involved anyway. Seam pointed towards first slip.

bowled him! And a big celebration from Shankar. He has his man. Full and slanted into leg stump. He gets the front leg out of the way and looks to clobber that into the leg side stands. Misses and loses his stumps. No one will fault him for that shot. He's more than done the work tonight. His last few balls were a struggle, but the pace has been set
length on off stump, driven to extra cover on the front foot
short and just outside off, cut straight to point
length at the stumps, clipped to short fine
beaten. Short and cramping him at an off stump line. Backs away for the cut and misses

a full mix up and another drop! Oh SRH are falling apart. Nearly a collision too. Length ball at middle, looks to slog that and ends up hitting it high between deep square and deep midwicket. Looks like Fabian Allen and Abhishek converging. Neither calling. In the end it pops out of Fabian's hand
length at the stumps, on the back foot to punch to sweeper's left
length at off stump, driven to long-off
length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot

Rashid misjudges at deep square and Padikkal has fifty! Oh the Sharma experiment nearly works. He's been asked to slow it down, he does, he draws a laboured sweep shot from outside off. It's in the air. Rashid runs in and overdoes it, has to lunge with his left hand in the end and can't even get a finger on it
length at middle stump, steps out and gently dabs this in front of deep midwicket to open up the second
length at off stump, onto the back foot to tap to long-on's left

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: googly, spinning into middle stump. Blocked on the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX runs
long_text: clears deep square! Full and into the pads. Gets low and sweeps with purpose. Not with great timing, but enough to lift that over the fielder

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR runs
long_text: clears midwicket. Dropped short but a bit more room this time and he latches onto that and turns it over the infielder. First boundary in nearly four overs

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: googly ripping in at leg stump. Finch exposing the stumps to try and cut, but it's rolled back down the pitch

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, no run
long_text: full and just outside off, backs away and looks to slug it through the off side. Thick inside edge onto pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Padikkal, 1 leg bye
long_text: beaten on the reverse sweep. Full ball outside off, he's struck outside off and the lbw appeal is turned down
low full toss on the pads, whipped out to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
carved out to sweeper cover. Full and just outside off, exposes the stumps and opens the wrists
full and just outside off, looks to force that through the covers. Off the inside half to mid-on
beaten. Slower short ball in the corridor, going across him. Pulls from over it
length at leg stump, clipped to deep square
full and at the stumps. Clears the front foot and has a swing at it. Mistimed and off the inside half, down to long-on
length on middle stump, nudged down to long-on
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
just short of long-off. Length ball outside off, got to the pitch and creamed that. Flat and straight at the fielder though
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
legcutter, short of a length outside off. Dabbed into the covers with soft hands
one more yorker. Gets the front leg out of the way and whips firmly to mid-off

another perfect yorker. Nice over from Sandeep so far. Follows him down leg side and makes him slice another one off the inside edge to short fine. There's a direct hit too from there but Padikkal is back in the crease
yorker at leg stump, looks to jam that out, inside edge to short fine
slower short ball at middle stump. Through the pull shot too early. Thick inside edge to deep square's left
slower ball, full and sliding down leg side. Cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
full at middle stump, flicked to backward square leg
good length but poor line, down leg side and past the attempted glance
taken at extra cover. Short outside off, on the back foot again to try and flat-bat that. Scooped feebly into the off side

short_text: Shankar to Finch, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: and pumped way over midwicket! And it is another no ball! Dropped short and he pulls this viciously
beaten. Good length and outside off. Swishes at that and it doesn't quite sit up. The signal's gone off thought! Third umpire has spotted a foot fault no-ball
length and into the pads. Tucked to mid-on's left off the back foot
pummeled over his head. Friendly, floated full ball on off stump. Front leg clear, full face offered, and a brutal batswing
length on middle stump, punched past the bowler off the back foot
length and swung away from middle stump. Squares him up as he defends down the track
yorker length at off stump, gets the front leg out and jams it straight to extra cover
clubbed over midwicket. Length ball at middle stump, half a stride again and a good old fashioned leg-side heave, timed to perfection
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
over extra cover. Sweet, sweet stuff, this. Overpitched ball outside off, half a stride out and just gets his hands through this so smoothly from underneath
whipped to deep square's left! Short and up at his hips. Swivels and just turns it, long hands reaching out, and nails the connection. Fielder in the deep is diving desperately but cannot stop
steps out too soon. Was already down the track and down leg side; and this short ball was shaped away from him. Could barely get a shot away
length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot

good work down at third man from Natarajan. Short and just outside off, gives it a vicious slash and gets a thick edge to the fielder's right. It's quick and low to his right but he pushes it in when he's about to lose balance
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square from the crease
squeezes it past cover. Realllyyyyy had to stretch for that. Slower ball, short and very wide. That took a long time coming and wasn't off the middle, but it had enough to trickle away tantalizingly
beaten. Instinctive shot. This is short of a good length and going across him. Shapes for the pull but no such bounce on this pitch. It skids underneath the bat
slower ball foxes him. It's just outside off, tempting him for the drive on the up. Gets an inside edge that rolls back to the bowler

massive lbw appeal. He was a few yards down the pitch. An inswinger at length, walked at it, across into the off side trying to flick. Might have been struck just outside off no, it was in line with middle and leg. Probably going down
length and wide outside off, reaches out and slashes on the up. Extra cover parries it to mid-off

through the slip region. Slip has gone out after two balls. Sandeep is known to swing it and get the edges, but this is the the game. Full and just outside off. Looks to drive and it's a thick edge. Third man does superbly to his right with the slide
clipped past short fine. Length and staying low - about shin height - on a leg stump line. Waits on it and turns the wrists late
overpitched and swung away from the corridor, a sumptuous, crisp off drive but can't beat mid-off to the right

carts it over midwicket. Right, he's done his homework and decided whom to target, clearly. Down the track first ball, short of a length at middle and angled away from him. But it doesn't matter, he just goes through the line
big inswinger from outside off. Really hoops back in sharply as Finch gets on the front foot. To his credit, doesn't plant it across the stumps. Big inside edge onto pad
full and into the pads. A bat-pad situation as he looks to flick. There's half an appeal
full and swinging away from the corridor. Closes the face on that and taps it to mid-on's left for his first run. Not much of a stride, but he is a tall man
short and pushed across his corridor. Very wide, in fact. Has a slash and is well beaten
full and swung way down leg side. Can't get bat on it
length at off stump, some shape away again. Defended into the covers
good length, swung away and going through to the keeper on the bounce. Just outside the off stump and he let that go
he's hit a full toss straight to square leg! Low full toss at leg stump, flicked firmly and Rabada with the magix reflexes to force a super over

he's found sweeper cover! Can you believe it! All fielders in the circle, only the sweeper back. It's a full toss wide outside off. He swishes at it, just trying to guide it, but he's found Hetmyer! Oh he'll kick himself for this. What an innings it has been, falls just short of taking them over
beaten. Short and wide outside off, looks to play the hook and it's well beaten. But they can afford that now. It's also the bouncer out of the equation for the next two balls

he's tied it! Incredible! Full ball at the stumps, backs away once more and slices it to long-off's left. Mohit with the big dive to get a hand on that, but it gets tangled up in his body as he makes connection with the boundary padding
yorker at middles stump, squeezed down to long-on's right and once again Jordan is back for the second Mayank has to dive as the throw comes in at his end
long long way over the bowler! Full and floated up at the stumps, Mayank lines it up with his leg well into the leg side and crunches it
low full toss outside off, gets down and taps it to extra cover to keep strike for the final over

just clears extra cover. Low full toss at off stump, backs away and looks to open the face. Barely gets it over looks like it's a run short though even though they're back for the second. Addendum: The short run was given for 18.3, but was registered by the commentator after this ball

Iyer drops it at deep midwicket! Short ball into the body, a tired aerial pull. Floated to Iyer's left and he has the reverse cups up and almost no balance as this digs into the turf and lifts over the line
another perfect yorker and he jams it down to long-on. Jordan quickly back for the second. Mayank on the fringes of his fitness right now, huffing and puffing.

over Rabada and into the boundary. Full at middle. Mayank waiting in the leg side again with his front leg. Just misses fractionally and he gets the perfect connection to get this over the bowler. His highest IPL score
perfect yorker. Follows him down leg side, pins his toes as he looks to flick this. Rabada is so so good at this
swing he does, but can't connect. Disappointed too, because this was there in the slot. Good length and just outside off
length at middle stump, punched firmly down to long-on
length at middle, soft-handed poke into the vacant midwicket region. Big boundary there and once again, Jordan is already back for the second before Mayank can call

clears long-off! The rhythm is back for Mayank! Full slower ball, back of the hand, at off stump. He had already shaped to hit that off the front foot, but he had to adjust. Waited and waited and then drilled it flat and straight
short ball just outside off, pulled firmly off the front foot to deep midwicket's left. Loud call for two and Jordan does his part brilliantly
slices it over the backward point boundary to bring up fifty. Good length ball flung wide outside off. On his back knee and deliberately slashes this. To sweeper's left. He's keeping them interested
low full toss at leg stump, driven firmly to long-on
length at middle stump, mistimed slog trickles down to long-on
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
sweetly timed again. Length ball at the stumps, backs into the leg side and carves it to sweeper's right
bouncer, just outside off. Almost waited on the back foot before attempting the hook, but he's beaten
handsome. Short of a length ball at off. He backs into the leg side and chips it on the rise, just over mid-off who is in the circle
short and just outside off, sliced to third man's right
legcutter at a length, just outside off. Left alone
short of a good length at middle, tucks it behind square whee it is a comedy show. Pant slides, fine leg retreats, square leg meanders and it's through all of them

woody sound and that is out. Cross-seam, short and in the corridor. Backs into the leg side and wants to slash this through point. Not a bad idea in principle, but not many can actually pull that off against Rabada at 142kph. Thin edge and off he goes
short in the corridor, gets on top of it and guides to third man

dropped. Midwicket running backwards can't hang on. It's Shaw, with a late lunge towards his right. Miscued pull at a steep short ball at his chest. Floats just behind the 30-yard circle and he can't hang on
good length at the stumps, punched to long-on
length ball just outside off, shuffles and looks to clip through midwicket. Gets a leading edge to extra cover's right
length ball just outside off, looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge to short fine's left
length at off stump, drops it pitch side on the off side and they pinch a risky single from right under Mohit's nose
carted over extra cover! Short ball outside off, leaps up as it gets big on him, then swishes from inside out - like an off-forehand. From his chest, out to the cover boundary

clears long-on! Right, they were always going to target Mohit. This one is a knuckle ball but he picks it. Good length ball sitting up at middle stump and he finally middles on the leg-side swing. Just over the fielder

short_text: Axar Patel to Agarwal, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward point
full outside off, mistimed slog again. To deep midwicket's left this time
length at off stump, pushed into the covers from the crease

short_text: Axar Patel to Agarwal, no run
long_text: length at off stump, looks to flick into the leg side, gets an inside edge onto the pads
lobbed up slow and full at middle stump, attempted slog is off the inside half, down to long-on
length at off stump, whippy hands for this inside-out loft to long-off's left. Rabada nearly over-runs it but adjusts to keep that in, to his right
slower ball at a length on leg stump, clipped down to fine leg
and again. Short of a length and width outside off. Waits leg side of that and opens the face late to send it blazing to the third man boundary
length outside off, driven to extra cover
sweet. Short of a length just outside off, slight arch back, half a forward stride and rapid hands chopping through for the perfectly timed square drive past point
length at the stumps, backs away and looks to punch through the off side. Inside edge onto the body

overthrows at deep midwicket after an easy run in the covers. Length outside off, pushed into the covers. Hetmyer backing up just trundles across and doesn't put in the dive. Long-on is forced to clean up to his right. Iyer and Pant both give him a scolding
short of a length outside off, punched to long-off
short of a length outside off, punched firmly to long-off's right off the back foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Gowtham, no run
long_text: length on off stump, hurriedly pushed back to the bowler

short_text: Axar Patel to Gowtham, no run
long_text: good length outside off, punched to extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Gowtham, no run
long_text: length and sliding in at the stumps. Locks the front leg across and tickles it to midwicket
length at off stump, punched to long-on with the angle, off the back foot
length at middle, mistimed punch to long-on

nails that one! Hasn't nailed many so far, but this pull shot pings off sweetly. Short and up at the hips, quickly in position to send that flat and over the midwicket boundary. He's worked hard on developing that shot off the half-stride. Animated discussion with Gowtham after that - he still believes
length at leg stump, shuffles across and tickles it behind square
length at middle stump, clipped to midwicket's right from the crease
length at off stump, tapped to extra cover
length on leg stump, looks to flick and gets that off the thigh to the keeper

holes out to long-on. Flat length ball outside off, steps out and doesn't make the pitch of that. So he's forced to hit that on the rise. It comes off the inside half of the bat and finds Shaw  about five yards in from the line

short_text: Axar Patel to Khan, no run
long_text: short and in at off stump. Cut straight to backward point
full and in at the stumps. Gets low and across and paddles this. Long leg is quick to his right
full outside off, driven with the turn to long-off
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper's left

short_text: Axar Patel to Agarwal, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, chopped to short third
drilled. Good shot that. Overpitched on off stump, half a stride and full of intent to get that exactly where he wants - to mid-off's left with the full face offered till the last moment
full and driven to long-on
full on leg stump, waits on that and flicks to fine leg
slower ball at a length, just outside off. Rolls his fingers over that one. Chopped to third man again
short of a length just outside off, carved to third man
full at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length and sliding in at the stumps. Looks to force that through the covers, gets a thick inside edge to square leg
lobbed up slowly at a length on off, driven down to long-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Khan, no run
long_text: length outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Khan, no run
long_text: length and in at middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the front foot

short_text: Axar Patel to Khan, no run
long_text: full outside off, driven straight to backward point
full and wide outside off, driven sweetly to sweeper cover
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
edged between slip and keeper! Slip is wide. Full and just outside off, apprehensive push out at it and a thick edge evades the diving Pant comfortably
length outside off, chopped to third man

taken at mid-off! The collapse continues. Look, they left left the wristspinners out with a mind that Rabada would bowl to Maxwell. He comes on right away too and gets him, but Maxwell has played a really poor shot here. It's a length ball wide outside off, he wants to crash that through the off side, but his front leg is not far enough down and his weight is no transferred into it at all. Weak chip to the fielder. Through the shot too soon
leading edge falls short of mid-off. Looked to turn that into the leg side from off stump, closed the face too early
length at off stump, defended to point from the crease
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot. Ashwin looks to dive to his right to stop that and he looks like he's in pain

through him! Ashwin is off and jumping, he is loving this! Looks like the Ashwin floater, that comes in with the angle. Classic offspin bowling. Softened him up with two danglers outside, put the doubt with a similar length and line outside off, only this time it comes back in and cleans him up. Slightly held back in his delivery stride too
length outside off, draws him well forward and makes pat it into the covers
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
length and in at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

taken at short fine! Full ball at middle stump, looks for the sweep first up, gets a top edge that is easily taken by Shaw. Ashwin has a wicket in his first ball for DC - against his former team. Some scripts write themselves
good length and just outside off, waits on that stabs to third man's right off the front foot
length outside off, mistimed punch into the covers and a fumble allows them a run
short of a length just outside off, angled bat on the attempted punch through the covers. Falls weakly into the covers

bowled him! Lovely seam bowling exhibition from Mohit tonight! After taking it away from Rahul all of last over, he jags this one back in. Rahul on the front foot at an off stump line, but brings down an angled bat. It's off the inside edge and crashes into leg. Top stuff from Mohit
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man
length and just outside off, sliced down to third man
length at middle stump, punched straight to mid-on
short of a good length, in at middle stump. Delicately pushed into vacant midwicket
misfield at third man. Length ball seaming away again, casual drive out at that and thick edge. Rabada slides to his left but has over done it. Hits his trailing leg before rolling into the boundary
oh what a ball! Unplayable. Angled in with the length, landing on the seam and moving away at 146kph as Rahul looks to tuck that into the leg side. Climbs past off stump
sliced to the point boundary. Short of a length and honing in at him, but he has quick hands on this occasion and chops from inside the line. With that pace, it is into the padding rapidly
beaten as he looks for the ramp to third man. Slip has gone out this over. That's rapid and getting big at him in the corridor. He arches backwards to try and steer this
short and just outside off. Swivels and checks his pull after shaping too early for it. Rolls out to square leg
short of a length at off, dropped into the off side with soft hands and a loud call for the single
short and up in the corridor. Aerially deflected towards third man with an angled bat
length at the stumps, nudged back down the pitch from the crease
short and rising in the corridor. Nicely on top to turn it towards third man
short of a length at leg stump, hops and turns this down to fine leg
short of a length and down leg side, past the attempted glance
length and just outside off, watchfully tapped into the covers
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
leading edge as he closes the face too soon. Good length ball seaming away again from off stump
clobbered! A throwdown type overpitched ball at middle stump. Don't do that to Rahul in this format. Front leg out of the way and no nuance about this - a big slog over midwicket

beaten. Slides away off the pitch as he looks to punch this through the covers. Good length ball and enough to beat him but hang on! The siren's gone. Which means the TV umpire's spotted Mohit overstep
a check-drive through the covers. Length ball with shape away. Waits on that and plays late, tapped between cover and extra
good length and some shape way in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
length at off stump, defended from the crease into the covers
length at middle and leg, hurries onto him. Defended to square leg off the back foot
length and at the hips, waits on that and nudges it fine. Nice way to resume cricket or not, it's off the pads says the umpire
length at off stump, punched on the up to extra cover's right for a quick single
short of a length at off, tapped to point with an open face
short and wide, a bit too quick for his attempted cut. Beaten
full and wide outside off, scythes from underneath and clears extra cover

run out coming back for a sacrificial second. Thought it was the last ball, but it seems Jordan has overstepped. Short ball outside off, cut to sweeper's left. Comes back and is caught well short. But what an innings it has been. A projected score of 127 at 17 overs when Delhi were 100 for 6 has turned into a 150-plus score
fifty of 20 balls! What. An. Innings. He has deflated this bowler. It's a full toss at off stump, where he's camping. Merely flicks his wrists and sends it over the square leg boundary

crunched over extra cover! What an innings this is turning out to be. Jordan has completely fallen apart in the face of this attack and you can't fault him really. This is imperious. Full and wide outside off, yet again he's walked across. On one knee this time and drilled with purpose
whipped past short fine. Another ball in the slot, regular speed from Jordan. Stoinis in the off side once more, uses the angle and swishes it to the fine leg boundary

edge flies past the keeper. Short outside off, he's shuffles and is cramped on the cut. Just chucks the hands at it in the end and has his reward. Three balls and three different lengths from Jordan so far, none of them have been yorkers
wide, but harsh? He's walking across again as he misses the flick. It's marginally past leg stump

oh lovely! He has sized these KXP slog overs bowlers up. It was going to be their big question mark, and it will remain so even after this innings. Walks across the stumps and handsomely picks this length ball over the squre leg boundary. All smiles after that, he knows what an incredibly shot he's just pulled off
taken at third man and Cottrell finishes his spell with the salute. Slower short ball outside off, backs away and looks to ramp it. Not enough pace and third man takes it running in
slower ball, short of a length at off, cut to sweeper
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Goes back to try and carve it through point again but this rolls through low

between backward point and short third man! Cottrell had him struggling with his last over but Stoinis has completely turned the tables now. Seems to have lost his strategy. This one is a full toss, just outside off. He's deep in the crease to slice it
full and very wide outside off, left alone

chopped over short fine. Slower ball again, short of a length. He's backing into the off side, shaping to pull but has to wait and adjust before using his wrists to chop from underneath and clear the infield
