drilled between mid-off and extra cover. A bit predictable now this slower ball stuff, and Stoinis has sized up his options. One step to get deep in the crease for a strong base, then the front leg out of the way to create room. From thee, he crunches from inside the line
legcutter attempt this time it appears. Just dies after pitching short of a length and Ashwin gets on the back foot and forces it over Jordan. A chip to clear mid-off by the end of it all.
bouncer, wide outside off. Hopeful swing from under that but he can't get bat on it
slower ball at a length, skidding low outside off. Looks to chop at that and is beaten
attempted yorker again, punched firmly on the full to long-on's left
inside edge this time. Nutmegs himself and it whistles past short fine. He went for the yorker, it turned into a full toss. Stoinis had shuffles once more and was whipping towards the leg side

oh that is skillful. Stunning execution from Stoinis. Premeditated the offcutter it appears, because he was quickly into the off side as Jordan released this. It was full and from that base, he simply went with the turn. Picked up cleanly over the midwicket boundary
full outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
beats him with the cutter. Fifth one in a row. This is fuller, inviting the cover drive before spinning away
rolls his fingers over another one in the corridor. Stays on the back foot, deflects it to third man
full slower ball, wide outside off stump. Driven out to sweeper cover
slower ball, short of a length in the corridor. Waits on it and nudges it down to third man

noise on that, and he might be out down leg side. He's walking off as the umpires convene to check if that carried to Rahul. It's a cutter, dropped short and headed for the hips. He looks to tickle it down and it dies on Rahul who gets forward and under that to lap it up. As replays confirm. It came off the glove of Patel inside edge

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Stoinis, no run
long_text: googly, short of a length and cramping him on the back foot punch which rolls back down the pitch feebly

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: short outside off, chopped out to sweeper cover
googly again, length and at leg stump. Shuffles and whips to deep square

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Stoinis, no run
long_text: doesn't pick the googly at all. Tossed right up, looks for the big drive with a massive gap between bat and leg. Inside edge ends up at short fine

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: length, wide outside off and slowed down. Reaches out and chips to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: beaten. Continues with his line across the corridor. Skidding from a length. Axar looks to feel for that and it's past him rapidly
slower ball at a good length, hangs deep and tucks it to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on off, punched to extra cover from the crease
slower ball, coming in with the angle on a good length. Inside edge onto the front pad as he shapes to poke that into the covers
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Through the slog early, can only drag it over midwicket
has him hopping away but at the cost of a free-hit. Second bouncer from Shami. Axar was hurrying to get out of the way as this was headed for his helmet

short_text: Shami to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: length on middle stump, defended on the front foot

taken at mid-off! One time too many from Iyer. But the bigger question - why this time? Shami brought in particularly to get another wicket immediately. It is his last over. Iyer wants to loft this slower length ball over mid-off, but this time the timing isn't there. Simple catch
bouncer, dug in too short outside off. Left alone

got him next ball! A first IPL wicket to remember for Bishnoi. This has been superb from the youngster. He's not only neutralised Rishabh Pant today, he's managed to dismiss him as well. Goes back to his tested line outside off, taking it away from Pant. He attempts a slog sweep and can only edge it onto the stumps. That's the end of that partnership

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: finally gets him away. He's struggled against him so far. This time Bishnoi just a bit too close to the stumps with the length ball. Enough margin for Pant to get on one knee and sweep him over his head to find the long-on boundary

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, can't beat extra cover with the punch
on the bounce to long-on. Length ball, holds in the pitch and turns a touch. He hits on the up anyway, across the line
length at middle, steps out and hurriedly squeezes this to deep square
length at middle stump, tapped off the toe-end to long-on
short of a length across him, opens the face and finds short third man
pumped straight again! Thrown Gowtham's plans right off! He goes fuller this time, and it's right in the arc. Gets the front leg out of the way and nails the connection

clubs it over long-off this time! This is a nice little no-look six thing Iyer has developed here. Second time against Gowtham tonight. Length ball, skidding on nicely. He keeps the head down once again and goes through the line, barely looking up once he's nailed the connection
length and slowed down at middle stump. Gently tucked through midwicket
beaten. Length, gripping and turning away outside off as he gets forward and looks to push through the covers
dug in short of a good length again. He slams them in, such that they lose pace coming at the batsman. Iyer can only tap that to long-on off the back foot
length and drawing him well forward outside off. Driven to long-off
short and just outside off, finds sweeper cover with the cut
length and slid onto the stumps. Clipped to deep midwicket on the front foot
length outside off, whipped to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: length outside off. This one does turn back in and encumbers his attempted reverse sweep. Cops that on the pad

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: outside edge dribbles past short third man and into the boundary. Bishnoi continues to angle it across the corridor. Pant though swings for the the turn, looking to go midwicket. Not in control of that at all
dropped short and slow. Big heave at that, but only a single at sweeper
dropped short and cramps him at off stump. Punched aerially to sweeper's right
beaten. Draws him forward this time. And then glides it past the bat. He's looking to drive through the covers
dropped short outside off, cut aerially past backward point. Agarwal cleans up to his left at sweeper cover
short at leg stump, tickled to short fine's left off the back foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover along the floor
length and skiddy in the corridor outside off. Poked to extra cover's left on the front foot

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Iyer, no run
long_text: 90kph, length at off stump, watchfully defended into the covers. That one straigthened, the first that he's turned so far
short of a length, skidding across from off stump. Hurriedly cut to sweeper cover

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: short and skidded across him once again. Goes away and away as he shapes to cut and he's beaten again

short_text: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, no run
long_text: beaten on the reverse sweep. Length and angling away from off stump again. Big swing and miss
slider, dropped short and pushed wide outside off. Left alone
short at middle, pulled to deep square
short outside off, deflected off the outside edge to short third's left

second tier! This is full-blooded, wow. Length ball pushed through quick at off stump. Keeps the head down like it's golf. And swings cleanly through the line. Not an easy shot on this kind of a pitch, because he wasn't to the pitch of that. Sends it far far over wide long-on
length outside off, knocked to point's right

length and tossed up slower this time. Gets forward and pokes into the vacant leg side. Gowtham chases it down himself and puts in another awkward tumble. It's enough to keep them from coming back for the second
classic Pant! Length at middle and leg. He falls over into the off side as he gets low, opens up  some room and scoops this to the long leg boundary
good length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket from the crease
slower ball at a good length again, waits on it and taps it down to long-on
short and rising up at the chest. Chops at that and Karun Nair leaps to his left at backward point to stop the single
length at middle stump, flicked to mid-on's left
beaten. Rolls his fingers on this short of a length ball. Pant unleashes a vicious cut at that and is well beaten
good length and down leg side, can't connect on the flick
full on middle stump, gets the front leg across and nails the drive. Sarfaraz lunges low at midwicket to keep that to one
length outside off, driven firmly to Maxwell's right at extra cover. He can only get a touch on that. It ends up at long-off
dug in short of a good length and turning away marginally outside off. Just waits on that and shovels it to deep midwicket
length outside off, good stride forward to drive to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, hurried on the cut, it's off the under-edge to point
length on off stump, punched to extra cover
short of a length at middle, punched to mid-on off the back foot
length and at the stumps. No room for a stroke. He hangs back and taps it down the pitch
length on off stump, defended to backward point
length at middle again, gets the front leg across and tucks this to mid-on's left
length at middle stump, keeps a touch low. Defended down the pitch
outside edge down to third man. short of a length just outside off, swishes away from the body at this
length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
length at the stumps, watchfully pushed back to the bowler
length and drifted into the pads. Looks for the flick, cops it on the pad
slapped through point! That whippy bat speed from Pant. Short and going across him, nails the connection, hits it into the turf and bisects cover point and backward point
length and swung down leg side, beaten on the attempted flick

length and just outside off, stands tall and punches through the covers. Gowtham gives chase and looks to put in a slide. But his knee gets planted in the turf and he goes over. Manages to chase it down after recovering and pulls it back in
short of a length at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
length and in at off stump, defended from the crease

taken at short extra cover! Oh boy, the shot selection is just not showing up today. Short of a length and across, once again. Too far away from him for him to be attempting a flick. Does it anyway, closes the face too early. It pings right off the edge and is taken by Agarwal
short of a length across him, swishes at it and is beaten on the outside edge
connects on the pull this time. This is short and up at the hips. Enough swinging room, not too much climb. He's under that and gets it over square leg

taken at mid-on! More reckless cricket from Delhi against good bowling. Dropped short and rising in the corridor. He looks to pull him. Not quite the pitch to do that yet. It's off the toe and spooned to the fielder's right there
short of a length across the corridor, has a stab at it, off the under-edge to third man
slashes and misses. Length ball angled across him and he goes horizontal bat at this
length at off stump, punched to mid-off on the rise
length and swung away in the corridor again, defended away from the body, into the point region
beats the outside edge. Lovely curving outswinger from the corridor. Draws him forward and makes him push with hard hands
length and swung away from off stump, watchfully defended into the covers
beaten. Short of a length and swinging away in the corridor. Plants the front leg down and has a big slog at this. Not near it
low full toss at leg stump, tapped to mid-on

dropped! K Gowtham at square leg. Short ball going across him again. This time he plays the pull. It's off the toe-end. Gowtham running backwards and to his right has to put in a lunge in the end and he can't hang on. It was Maxwell at midwicket who was also close to that one, but not close enough

there's a sound! Catch behind. Rahul won't review, he signals that it might have been Hetmyer's chain.  He might be right. It's nowhere near the bat as he pokes awkwardly at this short ball rising across him

has he dropped him? Doesn't matter, coz he runs him out anyway! KL Rahul makes amends immeidately, but Dhawan is caught napping here. It's a bouncer at his front shoulder. Looks like he gets a glove on that as he looks to hook. Rahul can't gather it high to his right. But it hasn't gone far from him. Dhawan has taken off down the pitch through it all though, with seemingly no call from Shaw at the other end. Rahul picks up, throws it in on the bounce as midwicket gathers at the striker's end and takes the bails off
beaten on the under-edge this time. Length ball swung away, he expects that to bounce a little more than it did. Slams into the sand in front of Rahul and he can't gather cleanly
past the outside edge. Short of a length ball into the pitch at a middle stump line. He looks to play the flick as this shapes away and squares him up completely
short of a length, some shape out. Punched on the rise to point

short_text: Cottrell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: jumps down at this short of a good length ball and cops it on the body. No movement on this, but also no room
length and in at off. Punched to mid-off's left and they pinch the single

full outside off, has a slash at that and gets a thick outside edge. Third man does well to cover the ground and put in a slide, but he can only parry it towards the fine leg boundary. Sarfaraz with the good attempt there
full inswinger again, driven firmly back at the bowler
overpitched and swung in at off stump. Sweetly driven along the floor to mid-off
big full toss first up. Swinging in and about thigh height. Shaw wakes up at that alright! Defended down the pitch

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: swiped through midwicket to end CSK's drought against Mumbai. Short of a length slower ball sitting up at middle stump, pulled firmly off the front foot

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: sliced over point for the tie. Slower ball, length ball, wide ball. Slashes from underneath that
length and into the body, nudged to midwicket

a first ball duck for Dhoni if this catch behind is upheld. Short ball past his front shoulder, he was looking to hook. Taken down leg side and given out straight away. Was there glove? Definitely no bat. No there wasn't. UltraEdge has a flat line. Decision will be overturned. There was a sound, and Dhoni reckons it was a creak in his bat - seems to be saying that to Hardik Pandya
slower short ball outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover's right and Faf du Plessis has a fifty too

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: clears extra cover with ease. That is a poor ball. Slower ball, short and very wide. No concealing that, there was so so much time. He waits on that and cuts it aerially

oh well taken Pattinson. More backpeddling stuff from Mumbai. Curran brings out the ramp, connects on it too, but Pattinson has kept his eyes on it running backwards before smashing the ball into his chest. The perfect T20 cameo from Curran - 18 off 6 is total value - ends with CSK in sight of a win

short_text: Bumrah to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: just clears deep midwicket! Who was running backwards for some reason. Was he in from the line to start with? Yes he was. Ten yards in from the line, so it wasn't misjudgement. This is a slower ball, short of a good length and he swung at it, cleanly. Stuck with and managed to drag it. Would have been taken if the fielder was on the line
low full toss at middle again, slugged out to deep midwicket

short_text: Krunal to Sam Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: slapped over extra cover! Dropped short of a good length outside off. Reaches out, waits on it as it sits up and flat-bats it to the extra cover boundary

short_text: Krunal to Sam Curran, SIX runs
long_text: smokes it over deep midwicket! Another attempted yorker, but this is a full toss. Front leg out of the way, pummels it
yorker at leg stump, backs into the leg side, can only squeeze it with the angle to deep square
yorker length outside off, steps out and carves hurriedly down to long-off

doesn't go well for Jadeja! This is plumb in front. Full and fast, no nuance from Krunal. It's fired in at middle stump like he's giving him throwdowns. Jadeja tries to flick that though and is caught right in front of middle
length and into the body, flicked through square leg
feeds him outside off! A knee high full toss and he merely has to open the face at that. Sprints to the point boundary
lands between extra cover and sweeper. Short ball rising up in the corridor. Backs away and looks to paddle that over the covers. Slices it and three fielders converge, without one getting close
slower short ball at middle stump, check-pull off the front foot. Between deep square and deep midwicket
short of a length at leg stump, off his feet to whip to fine leg
poor start from Pattinson. Full and on the pads, Jadeja just waits on that and turns it fine

holds onto it himself after sprinting backwards! Superbly done from Chahar. It was coming all over. They were stepping down, swinging hard at Chahar who they clearly wanted to cash in on in his last over. This one lands at a good length, outside off. Rayudu ends up slicing it after not making the pitch. It hangs in the mid-off area and he keeps his eyes on it coming from over his shoulder and holds onto it. Confidently done as he ends his spell with Rayudu's wicket. A sensational knock from him
well short of long-on. Length ball, steps out and makes the pitch of it but it comes off the toe-end of the bat.
dropped short, steps out and under-edges the pull to short fine
length at middle, swept on the bounce to deep square

dropped at backward point! Tough one to the right for Krunal. He dives and can't hold on. It's a good length ball on off stump, he brings out the reverse sweep and wants to clear the infield behind square on the off side. Doesn't get the elevation. Krunal got there but can't complete
dropped short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
yorker at the toes, following him down leg side. Manages to tickle it fine - not yet sure if it's off bat or pad. PAttinson sprints and slides to keep it in to his right
attempted slow bouncer, too short and well down leg side

run out call at the striker's end! Sent upstairs. He's run off a misfield, that thing they tell you not to do as a child but he's safe. Full ball flicked to midwicket's left, he doesn't collect leans and they take him on
yorker at the stumps, squeezed pitch side

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: sweet skills! Backs into the leg side and opens up the gap to mid-off's left. It's a length ball that slides on and he punches firmly for the boundary
yorker at the stumps, jammed down to long-on
jumps down at a short ball, catches it on the grille off the bat as he's late on the hook
audacious! Doing whatever he wants right now. This is a full ball speared in at off. Casually walks across and whips this to deep square
slower short ball at middle, shoveled down to fine leg
good length and into the body. Looks to swivel and turn that fine, but it comes off the cue end and ends up at deep square

slapped through extra cover. Whew. Slower ball, good length and outside off. Camps on the back foot and hits through the line. Boult sprints, slides, and gets his body behind it this time to keep it in
beaten. Charges him and is beaten on the under-edge. This was banged in short of a good length, sailing over leg stump
short outside off, pulled firmly to long-on's right
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
googly dropped short, pulled to deep square
length at middle, steps out and clips through square leg
length at the stumps, chipped into the midwicket area
glorious! This is batsman in full control. Steps out, gets to the pitch of this good length ball outside off and then opens his body to send this over wide long-off. Imperious
length at middle stump, steps out and punches to long-on
length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

a fingertip on that from Bumrah and he's lucky because that might have caused damage if he'd gotten more. Rayudu has fifty. Holds this top order together regularly, and he's doing it again. Down the pitch to a short ball as he flat-bats this to the straight boundary
beaten as that gets big on him. Short of a length and straightens as he shuffles and pushes for the angle coming into him
slower ball outside off, sitting up from a good length. Punched to sweeper's left
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man off the back foot
good length outside off, crisp punch out to sweeper cover
length outside off, down the pitch and drives to long-off
short outside off, sliced to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, angles in, flicks to deep square
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left

that is incredibly done. Far and away the best batsman of the match so far. Rayudu has jumped down the track and Krunals drags it short. Still, from that position, he's managed to make room and have enough swinging power to pull it over wide long-on
quicker one as Faf jumps down the pitch. Nearly yorks himself. Has just managed to squeeze it down to long-off
full on middle, swept straight to deep square leg
length at middle, clipped through midwicket

oh dear another misfield, and this is unpardonable from Boult. One of the best outfielders in the world. Full ball carved to deep extra's right. Boult sprints across and it bounces up for him at a comfortable height. Ends up completely missing it. Expect a bit of this in the opening stages of the tournament
misfield at short fine from Bumrah. This is dragged short and down leg. He pulls off the inside edge and Bumrah's just gone over it
length and turning away from middle, gets deep in the crease and flicks to deep midwicket
full and drifted into the pads. Leans in and flicks to deep square
length and angled into the pads, flicked with the angle to deep square
short of a length, low and at the stumps. Sluggish pull down to long-on
length on off, punched down to long-off
short of a length at off, punched to sweeper cover
length and down leg side, left alone
dropped? That almost carried to Chahar at midwicket. A tough one low to his right, but he didn't even get a hand on that. Got forward and flicked hurriedly. Straight through him
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length outside off, steps out and drives to long-off with the turn

short_text: Chahar to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: expertly done. Jumps down the track and doesn't make the pitch of this, but goes from down to up and then inside to out. Opens the face at the perfect time, it's not easy on this pitch, and beats long-off to the left

short_text: Chahar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: length on off stump, defended to extra cover on the front foot
legbreak from a good length at off, gets back and flicks to deep midwicket
length at off stump and sticking in the pitch as Faf goes half-stride and well in front of the body, flicks into vacant midwicket
short of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length and slanted in at middle. Gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket
short outside off, punched to sweeper's left off the back foot
length at the stumps, tapped back with the angle, can't beat the bowler to his right
length and skidding low at the stumps. Looks to whip to deep midwicket, gets an inside edge into the short fine region
length and into the stumps, punched to deep midwicket
lobbed up gently, good length and wide outside off. Reaches out and chops to sweeper cover
looooong way back! Bumrah's no-ball costs him big. Short ball in the corridor, stays back and connects cleanly on the pull shot - way in front of square, over the wide long-on region

short_text: Bumrah to Rayudu, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: whistles over backward point! Effective Powerplay batting. Stays leg side and low at this length ball that is wide outside off. And then slices firmly with no intent to keep it down. It is also a no-ball, as picked up by the TV umpire.
short of a length outside off, walks into the off side and forces that between cover and extra cover. Bit of relay work at the boundary between Chahar and Pollard

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, no run
long_text: bursts through him. Good length and jagging back in strongly. He's trapped in the crease trying to react as that narrowly misses off stump

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length and into his mid-riff. Looks to turn that with the angle but can only get it pitch side via his thigh guard

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, punched off the back foot, straight to backward point

short_text: Bumrah to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, punched into the covers
past the outside edge. Playing on his mind with the movement in and away. This one goes on with the angle. Tentative poke from Rayudu on the front foot and he's too late on it
short of a length with some shape in from outside off. Left alone
short of a length and across off stump. Chopped straight to backward point
past the edge. With a cutter. Gets him forward in the corridor and past the bat
length on off stump, defended towards backward point

wow, sweeeet. I think we have the most aesthetically pleasing shot of the match. Good length ball going across him, gets low, half a flex of the knee to get his weight into that and the perfect cover drive
overpitched on the toes, sweet connection on the flick to deep square's left

short_text: Pattinson to du Plessis, no run
long_text: trapped in the crease trying to flick with the angle. Half an appeal from the bowler who banged this in at a good length. Struck him on the thigh guard
offcutter at a good length, not disguised well enough to trouble Rayudu. Waits on that and guides to third man off the front foot
length and in the corridor. That's skidded on rapidly as he gets forward and defends
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
slapped away! Reflexes look good there for Rayudu. Short and wide and he crunches it in front of square off the back foot

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: sweet timing. Length ball wide outside off. Reaches out and just caresses that to mid-off's left

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: big swing inwards. Has Faf cramped. He was shaping to chop that down to third man
short of a length outside off, uses the angle to stab that to third man
good length, on the pads, and he's caught on the pads trying to flick that
length and a bit of shape in. Gets on the front foot and gets it off the thick outside edge to third man

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short of a length and wide outside off, left aloe

has him this time! But is that going down? It could well be looks very good actually for a batsman's review. He doesn't take it. He's off and Faf has to actually catch him halfway back to try and talk to him about it. A full ball pitching middle, cutting in off the seam. He's beaten on the flick but there was a big deviation. Vijay was completely out of sorts - as he looked on the field too - and I wonder if that has affected his judgement. Replays suggest it was missing. He walked right off.
length and in at the body, hurriedly poked into the leg side

big lbw apeal after he's foxed by the slower ball. They decide against the review. That was superbly done by Pattinson. Vijay trapped in the crease after the last three deliveries. This is a good length ball, tossed up. Vijay absolutely static, reaching well in front of the body to try and lift it over the leg side. It looked very good, but they decide against the review. So so close. Did they think it was lifting over the stumps?
length at off stump, punched firmly from the crease to mid-on
short outside off, another languid swish at that. It's off the inside edge to midwicket
short of a length and down leg side, beaten on the flick
beats the inside edge. Banged short of a good length, jagging in off the seam. Vijay swishing away from the body for the one that goes straight on

massive appeal and he's given lbw. Won't review it. That is dead in front. Full and swinging in sharply from off stump. Watson looking to drive for the initial line. Front leg is in the leg side and this thuds into the back one. Long appeal and then a long wait before Virender Sharma lifts the finger
lifts it over the off-side infield. Classic Watson. Classy Watson. Full and wide outside off, down on his back knee like he does and from there, he just goes over. Sweetly executed
short of a length and shape into the body. Late cut straight to wide slip, on the bounce
length on off, defended into the covers off the back foot
full and curving in from wide outside off. Looks for the booming cover drive but it's off the inside of the bat
length at middle stump, slight wobble but not big movement. Keeps the front pad out of the way and taps to mid-on
overpithced at middle stump, clears the front leg and slogs to long-on's right. Comes back for the second
leading edge just clears extra cover. Full and wide outside off, looks to slog. Head's looking leg side, the runs are on the off
another slower short ball. Hooks and connects this time, but straight to Jadeja at deep midwicket
beaten. Slower short ball in the corridor. Looks for the hook and can't connect
full outside off, gets forward and flicks to deep midwicket
loses his leg stump. Short of good length. Walks into the leg side and swings at that. Completely misses it
yorker outside off, watchfully kept out

holes out to long-on. It's that slam-in length again, just short of a good one. Going across the left hander. He's backing away and doesn't have a strong base for this pull. Just catching practice by the end of it, well within the playing area
short of a length at leg stump, swishes across the line and is beaten. It clears leg stump
dropped short at middle, pulled firmly to deep square's right and Deepak Chahar completely misses that. Covered the ground and got down at it, but was in a hurry to throw it back. Through his legs
length on middle stump, stays deep in the crease and clips into the leg side

caught behind! They've come screaming back, have CSK. The rising awkward ball does it again for Ngidi. This is lifting in the corridor from a short length. Pollard has room, to be fair, and  he tries to hoick it behind square. But it's a bit too quick for him and the edge is a straightforward catch for Dhoni this time

short_text: Sam Curran to Pollard, 1 leg bye
long_text: big appeal for lbw. Turned down. He got across the stumps and looked to clip that from off stump. Struck in front of off. Or was it outside?

short_text: Sam Curran to Pollard, no run
long_text: length outside off, driven back at the bowler who throws it back off balance. It's in the corridor, Pollard leaves it alone

short_text: Sam Curran to Pollard, FOUR runs
long_text: nudged past short fine. Attempted yorker is a full toss on Pollard's pads. Barely has to do anything with that
offcutter at a length on leg stump, forcefully whipped out to deep backward square

short_text: Sam Curran to Pattinson, FOUR runs
long_text: get outta the way, Sam! Gets it full and at middle stump. Pattinson into the leg side, two steps, and drills it past the bowler's head. Mid-off is in the circle
offcutter at off stump, shuffles and uses the angle to flick to deep square
short and across the corridor, beaten on a boisterous attempted pull shot
short outside off, dropped in front of Vijay at midwicket. Soft hands and pinches the run from CSK's sloppiest fielder this evening
short and up at the hips, pulled away to deep midwicket
length and into middle stump, Shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket's right
short of a length just outside off, sliced to third man
taken down leg side! Short ball cramps him at the hips. An awkward glance, off the inside edge. Dhoni stretches to his right and holds on low
googly dropped short outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
short of a length outside off, closes the face too early and gets a leading edge to extra cover
full googly at middle and off. Driven through cover
googly at a length on off stump, hard-handed jab into the leg side
yeah, don't bother. Googly, tossed right up. There's gap between bat and pad, but it doesn't matter when you have Pollard's reach. Lofts it easily to clear the straight boundary
googly outside off, watchfully defended on the front foot
length at leg stump, clipped through midwicket with the turn

Faf you stunner! Wow! What a fielder. This is flat and full, right in Pandya's arc. Which means he's absolutely smoked this, flat and to Faf's right at long-off. He takes strides across, jumps perfectly as it's in danger of whistling past him. Then the magic - the gentlest of landings after all the effort of sprinting and jumping. That landing gives him balance. and he hangs on, and is already in control as he comes down. Lobs it up as a formality anyway, but he had that down. Pure artistry from Faf, and he has changed the course of this game as of now.
length on leg stump, nudged through midwicket off the back foot
length outside off, mistimed punch back down the pitch. Jadeja parries it to long-off
length and sliding onto the pads. Anxiously jabbed through square leg on the front foot

taken at long-on. Faf with the lob back in to take it on the second attempt. You'd pick him to be the man in that situation, wouldn't you? Certainly among the best in the world at this skill. Slog sweep for a length ball outside off, decently connected. Faf leaps up, lands inside safely, lobs it up, takes a quick step out and back into play and hangs on. Impressive knock from Tiwary though, he's set it up nicely
length outside off, punched back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

googly, full outside off. Down for the sweep, struck on the back thigh. They've appealed for lbw and it is turned down. They review. Looked to miss off stump for me, with the turn and ball tracker confirms that. CSK lose the review.
full at leg stump, swept firmly to deep square's left. Vijay covers the ground and then fumbles. They come back for the second
full outside off, throws his hands at it and gets an inside edge past his boot
full on off stump, jumps down and jams it out to long-off
short of a length outside off, shuffles and cramps himself. Tapped to midwicket
short of a length at leg stump, watchfully turned off his hips to deep square's left
drilled past the non-striker! Length outside off, steps down the track and imposes himself on an apprehensive bowler. Beats mid-off to is left
oh sweet. Short of a length at middle, sits up and he pulls flat off the front foot. One bounce and into the midwicket boundary
just past mid-off. He was backing away and reaching out at this length ball going across him. Toe-ended to Curran's right
full outside off, clears the front leg and drills it to mid-off
this one is smoked! No chance for the fielder now. Short of a length, sitting up at middle stump. Gets deep in the crease and carts it off the back foot. Brutal hit
completely misjudged at deep midwicket! A mistimed slog sweep. The fielder runs in, and then back, and it would have only just cleared him by the looks of it - if he was on the line, that is
length and in at leg, clipped straight to midwicket
length and slid into middle, punched to midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, hurriedly punched back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover
taken at long-on! Curran involved again. This looked a decent shot at first. Length ball at middle stump, full face offered as he lofted this. Nice sound and all. But it's taken well inside the line
slower ball dropped very short and down leg side. Beaten on the pull
short and just outside off, pulled to square leg's right
short outside off, looks for the pull as it angles away from him. But that really took a while coming to him. Swatted to long-on's right
offcutter, back of a length and cramps him as he looks for the late cut. Chopped onto the body off the inside edge
length and just outside off, punched to mid-off on the rise
knuckle ball it looks like. Length at off stump, punched on the up to long-off
length ball wide outside off, gets down and swipes vigorously at that. Beaten by the legbreak
length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
googly at a length on middle stump, watchfully defended on the front foot
googly at leg stump, can't turn that away off the pitch
googly at a length outside off, looks to launch another one over extra cover but once again through it early. Down to long-on again
googly tossed right up outside off, drilled straight to Jadeja at extra cover
length and skidding low down leg side. Left alone
length and skidding in from outside off. Doesn't pick it. Wants to drive through the covers, but it's down to long-on off the thick inside half
length ball wide outside off, laboured sweep, dragged out to long-on
short and wide outside off, waits and waits and cuts gratefully to the backward point boundary
short of a length outside off, chopped to short third and a misfield from Lungi allows a second
just clears long-on! Looked a risky shot, but this guy has got big muscles. Length ball on middle, didn't get to the pitch and had to lift that on the up. High on the bat, but just clear
looks for the booming inside-out drive again, but he's through it too soon this time. It trickles down to long-off. A full ball on off
offcutter at a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot

short_text: Sam Curran to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: he's made that boundary for himself. Front leg into the leg side and he waited. The offcutter was at his body, but he managed to slice from inside it and beat Chawla's dive to the right at third man
short and at the body, mistimed pull out to deep square leg

short_text: Sam Curran to Tiwary, no run
long_text: beaten. Full and jagging away off the pitch as he looks to drive through the cover on the front foot. Was probably playing for the cutter into him
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man
offcutter at a length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
full at off, jammed down to long-off
short of a length outside off, chopped to short third
length and in at the stumps, gets forward and chips to long-on

brilliant. This is what SKY is known for. Slow pitch or not, this guy is a specialist against spin. And it's because of those wrists. Full on off, inside out and calmly lifted over extra cover with the turn
full and wide outside off, gets forward and drives to long-off

short_text: Sam Curran to Yadav, no run
long_text: length and in the corridor, punched back at the bowler on the up
length outside off, gets well forward and jabs it into the covers with soft hands

short_text: Sam Curran to Tiwary, no run
long_text: offcutter at a length outside off, pushes with hard hands and it ends up at midwicket off the thick inside edge
length at leg stump, allows that on, nudged to deep square's right

short_text: Sam Curran to Tiwary, no run
long_text: length at off stump, watchfully nudged into the covers

short_text: Sam Curran to de Kock, OUT
long_text: straight to midwicket! Slow does it! Spin at the other end, and an offcutter here from Curran. Welcome to the UAE. Short of a length at middle stump, clears the front leg and slugs this straight to the fielder. It's gone slowly too, perhaps an indication that this pitch won't give you too much pace. He really swung hard at that but it sort of loops on the fielder by the end
googly, short of a length at off stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
googly at a length outside off, driven to extra cover's right

chipped straight to mid-off! Full on off stump, wants to loft that over the fielder. Might have come off too at Wankhede. This pitch a touch slower. And Rohit's bad relationship with legbreak bowling continues. Taken at the edge of the circle and CSK's gamble has paid off

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly at a length outside off, blocked on the front foot
googly, full at off stump. Driven to mid-off

short_text: Chawla to de Kock, no run
long_text: beaten on the reverse sweep. Googly in the corridor. Dhoni gathers that at knee height
vicious swipe from underneath, short ball outside off. Sliced and ends up bobbling to deep point's right

short_text: Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: oh and he's outwitted him after all! Actually steps across this time for the ramp. Lungi has tried to curb that the last few balls. Doesn't this time and he's lost the battle again. Coz this is short of a length, heading right into QDK's body and he gently nudges that to the fine leg boundary
full and very very wide outside off, left alone

short_text: Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: no-nonsense. Short of a length at middle stump, front leg in the leg side and an old fashioned slog across the line, one bounce over the long-on boundary
slower ball, short and very wide as QDK does a small shimmy again. Lets this one go
chopped to deep backward point's right. QDK was shaping for the ramp over short fine, Lungi pushed it wide outside off. He coped. To put it mildly

short_text: Ngidi to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: oh my, that is gorgeous. Just brilliant. Overpitched outside off, plants half a stride down and drills it over the non-striker with no fuss at all
length and into the pads. Half a stride, neatly tucked to long leg's left. Chahar does well to sprint and cover his ground there
length at middle stump, clears the front leg and creams this on the up. Sam Curran flies to his left at mid-off and can only parry it for mid-on to clean up

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, dropped just a shade too short. QDK saps across the line to beat deep square. Sits up nicely for him, he makes room and it's not completely off the middle. But far enough in front of deep square
overpitched and driven firmly to Faf at mid-off, who tumbles. That's stung his right hand, but he's saved three

short_text: Chahar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket

short_text: Chahar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: length at the stumps, mistimed drive on the up to mid-on
length at the stumps, makes room to try and chop but this cramps him. Under-edge into the point region

short_text: Sam Curran to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: length at the stumps, opens up his stance and jabs it with soft hands into the covers

short_text: Sam Curran to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off's left. And we have a second misfield already. Looks like Faf this time

short_text: Sam Curran to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: swats it away. Length and wide outside off. No swing in. Rohit reaches out a long way and connects on that to beat backward point to the right

short_text: Sam Curran to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: short and wide outside off, allows that to come on and chops to deep backward point. Third man was in the circle

short_text: Sam Curran to de Kock, no run
long_text: drilled straight to mid-off. Full at off, gets the front leg out of the way and creams it on the bounce

short_text: Sam Curran to de Kock, no run
long_text: floated full and into the pads, searching for some swing. Goes on straight but QDK can't get the flick away
length and wide outside off, looks to slap that on the rise and mistimes towards mid-off

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, chopped straight to point

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: whipped! Overpitched on the legs and he stands tall and picks the midwicket boundary with no fuss
full and curving into off stump. Driven off the thick inside edge towards mid-on where M Vijay dives over the ball. Cobwebs. QDK back for the second
length at off stump, waits on that and turns it to mid-on's right

short_text: Chahar to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: no delays from Rohit! Outswinger at a length, curving away, but way too slow onto the bat. He waits on it and taps it between cover and point on the rise
